text:
Okay, so from what I am reading, a lot of other people got sort of "conned" into this hotel and I am no exception. We booked a trip through gate1travel.com and when you are booking they give you the options for hotels. The default booking is for Circus Circus, NOT Circus, Circus Manor Motor Lodge. It says three stars and even says this on gate1's travel site: "The rooms are fitted with contemporary decor and furnishings. All rooms are equipped with amenities that will be sure to make your stay pleasant, such as internet access (surcharge), a hair dryer, and a television with cable channels."
We looked up Circus Circus, saw it was nothing special, but alright and went for it...and found out that in fact, we were in the Manor Motor Lodge.
Now, I KNOW that this is gate1's fault and I'll be taking it up with them as well. Also, I want to point out that on my second night, I complained and they put us in a suite for the night, so this is nothing against the overall hotel, but there are still a few things people need to know staying here.
Rooms: They are DUMPS in the manor motor lodge. I asked, when we were checking in, if those rooms had been redone at all and was told that "all the rooms have been updated in SOME way"...well I don't know what way this room had been updated. The carpets were worn and stained. The bedding was the polyester crap from the 80s. The wallpaper was stained and peeling off the walls. The bathroom floor had cracks in the tile and a permanent grunge that could never been cleaned. It looked like a motel room you see in horror movies!
The hallways were constantly loud and smelled of marijuana, with cheap, apple air freshener over top, which was interesting because of the number of small children running around with distinctly trashy families. I even made a joke with a cab driver in Las Vegas, that we were NOT ugly enough to be staying in this hotel. He agreed and said it was the butt of the joke of cabbies on the strip. Good to know.

Hotel: The hotel amenities are geared towards children, but are basically a money grab. There is a small, indoor amusement park that costs something like $8\/30 second ride. There are shops and restaurants, but non are high end. We ate at three places while there and overall they were crappy. I'll give those individual ratings though.

Service: This was very good actually. I had a very pleasant bell hop help us out and all the wait staff and cleaning staff were very nice and the woman whom I complained to was very receptive and polite, so that earns them an extra star.

The thing with the hotel is that even these rooms we were stuck in, fall under 3 stars, even though they, by themselves, would barely qualify as 1 star rooms, because the whole hotel falls under one heading.

SO, lesson to be learned, these rooms are NOT nice rooms. The hotel is considerably crappier than other hotels. It's also quite far from the main strip. BUT it is cheap. If you are (for whatever God-awful reason) bringing children to Vegas, I guess this would fit the bill. Otherwise, if you're just looking for a bed and a cheap one, this also fits the bill. The beds, I will say, had clean sheets and were comfortable. But don't be fooled into thinking you're getting this amazing deal on a three star hotel. You're not. You're getting an average deal, on 1 star accommodations.

Ive always enjoyed comming here even as being an "adult" the entire l hotel has such a great atmosphere to be in. Ive stayed in every tower except for the manor section but other than that i always have a great time specially in the adventuredome not only do i get all day pass i become a child again plus it closes at 12 so if i wanna take a break i go up to my suite and go back whenever i want also the delievery to the rooms is amazing!!! So much in this casino makes me not want to leave plus the free shows . Thank you Circus Circus for always making my stay in vegas great!

I just spent 6 nights at circus circus. Upon checkin I was given a complimentary upgrade. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I've been to this location a handful of times over the years and visit circus Reno on a regular basis. (No longer owned by the same company) Yes circus circus is in need of a total makeover, its showing its age. With that being said you can't beat the room prices, food, comps etc. I've stayed at other casinos in Las Vegas with some of the same problems some of the other reviews said they had. It's Vegas people are there to party it up and have a good time. Circus circus is the best and I definitely will be back!!

According to the front desk, when you book with orbitz they automatically put you in the manor. The manor is in another area not connected to the main hotel\/casino. 

Tips:
$16\/ night resort fee
Manor has parking around each building
Express checkout- just leave your key in the room and close the door (thats what the front desk told us)

Why 2 stars?
-They upgraded us to a double king, but when we got to the room it only had a single.

-We requested a non smoking room, but I think they put us in a smoking room. Our room has an ashtray. Also, I smell weed in the hall.

-For being newly renovated, the furniture is old and the tv is still a tube tv.

What's nice:

-air con works
- you can see your car from your window
-pool is closer

stayed there one night in the main tower room, was upgraded and very nice for the price, I would not recommend the rooms outside the main building, they were not nice at all, however this place seems to be upgrading rooms and is the best attraction and entertainment for children, we always to the adventure dome and kids arcades, keep up the improvements and this will still be a hit on the strip!

We were put up in the skyrise tower, so far so good! I recommend valet parking for sure, bell hop was super quick and the rooms are better than I expected. This Vegas trip is more kid friendly so circus circus suits us well! Plus there's a Starbucks and Krispie kreme What more can a teen ask for?!

It has a great area for kids, plus free circus act shows. If you aren't traveling with kids, then I cannot recommend this casino. It smelled and no one came around with drinks the whole time we were playing craps and blackjack. The place is in serious need of cleaning and renovation.

Oh hells nah!! No more $1 hot dogs and margaritas!! This is a travesty .. 

I've been coming to Circus Circus since the 80's as a young child and I definitely have some fond memories in the midway playing arcade all day and night long while my parents gambled .. but sadly the place is still in a time warp with it's atmosphere and now I prefer the newer luxurious casinos in town ..

So we came in at 3a, long line to check in, but we were upgraded to a mini site for free. Card machine want working so they had security open or door for us (didn't mind since we were only spending one night here) but the check was very friendly and security merry us at our door and was wise cranking commissioner Gordon! Haha, great guy. Nice little suite, comfy bed, nice soft\/firm pillows, regular bathroom, didn't drain to fast but will enough. I do enjoy occasionally gambling here, and after this room, maybe might actually stay here instead of just a one time nap
Its pretty ghetto here. It would be alot better if they would remodel the ENTIRE circus circus to have a newer updated look.

Probably the worst hotel in Vegas, definitely the worst near the strip.  Wallet stolen from room, security is a joke, staff did nothing.  Full of overweight large families that clog small hallways.  Food is mediocre and pool is to full of screaming children to properly enjoy.  Don't stay here.

I have never been so embarrassed and so UPSET at the same damn time! Please, I URGE future people do NOT, once again DO NOT use this establishment! I was bit by God knows how many bed bugs! I stayed in room 2703 and hours later wake up itching and to bite marks along with swollen arm! I was PUNISHED & TORTURED at Circus Circus as if I were a Guantanamo prisoner! I am sending this notice to warn others who are even thinking to cheap out like I did! Don't do it to yourself, bc I obviously PLAYED myself!

I love this hotel it brings back so many memories.Now I am continuing the same tradition bringing my son here.We have stayed at all the different towers except the manor.And I can tell you our favorite its the casino tower. This visit we stayed at the14th floor at a mini suite it was just AMAZING. We love going to the adventuredome and the arcade.The only down side I see of this casino is the parking if you leave and try to come back in the night good luck Finding parking.Maybe i would suggest charging for parking if your not staying there I can see alot of locals taking over the parkings.Again its just a suggestion.

What can I say about this place? The hotel section actually has no smoking signs. The general demographic seems to be people from all over the world. I got a free upgrade to a better room at the same rate. I had a ton of fun at the Adventuredome theme park which has places to smoke just outside a thin glass door. I saved by using their McDonald's open for breakfast-dinner. I don't know what kind of lifestyle you lead, but I was much more comfortable in this atmosphere than if I was at the much more ritzy Paris Hotel & Casino. I never felt like my kids were in danger, and I always wanted to be anywhere but my awesome hotel room so I could be doing any of the number of things to do at this place. I literally just came from Disneyland the day before, and had much more fun between gambling, shopping, rides, and booze. This will always be my 1st choice for Vegas. 5 stars! 

Note: The dart game gives a prize to 12 and under no matter what.

I hate writing bad reviews. I stayed here for a couple days before moving into the dorms at UNLV. Needless to say I was getting a promotion of $26\/night so I shouldn't have expected THAT much, but hear me out.

I came into our room, went to wash my hands in the sink and there was dirt\/dust or whatever in the sink!! It was not clean is the point I am getting at.

Secondly, I found our room EXTREMELY difficult to find. The lady at the check in desk gave us a map telling us where to go but it did not really make sense.

Another very misleading thing is that there are some elevators for the first set of floors and another elevator for the higher set of floors that were not labeled. Myself and many other guests that checked in after me were constantly getting on the wrong elevator.

I find this hotel a little disorganized because the valet\/entrance\/self park is at the back of the hotel, but only taxi's are out front. If anyone can explain that system to me, please do! 

PS. Free wifi but it is incredibly slow...!

When I was younger, I remember the rooms were disgusting. The non-smoking room smells like smoke. This time I did not stay here, but I took my son to the Adventuredome and it was cool. The mini golf course looks the same, this place used to be awesome. 

I really wished the rooms could be better

We stayed at Circus Circus on 8\/21 and it was me and my family  (8 of us in total)  We stood in 2 rooms on the skyrise tower and let me say... for the price, you can't go wrong! Now if you want to nit pick every little thing than go pay 2 or 3 times the amount for a better place, but for the price, we were MORE than satisfied. We even got an early check in with no problem (checked in at 11am) and the room was clean and the beds were comfy.  The pool was surprisingly nice and the atmosphere was fun and relaxed. I would definitely stay here again!!

On Saturday I booked two nights at Circus Circus for Sunday and Monday night with my 9 year old sister and dad. I have to say I didn't read up on reviews before booking the room until I was two hours away so I was really nervous. 

First I checked in and it was sort of a busy line but it was a Sunday so I understood. The clerk that I was checked into his name is Francisco, and he was truly the sweetest guy ever! My sister was with me and he gave her her own keycard and he was just so nice and considerate! 

So we were on the 35th floor of the west tower and the view was just beautiful! I inspected the room like crazy for any bugs or anything in particular and  everything was just as perfect as can be about our room! I was expecting worse of the worse but nope they actually exceeded my expectation! 

Adventuredome was pretty awesome especially for children but boy there were A LOT of kids running around. I don't know whether they were hotel guests, but I'm assuming they were Vegas residents as well. My favorite part about the whole arcade was discovering the arcade upstairs! Now that was an adventure for my sister. 

The only bad thing I would have to say is the buffet. It was awful and especially for the price we paid for the food wasn't close to being worth it. It also seems as though the food had been sitting there for a while. It was just really awful I would never eat there again or advise people to go there either. Also, stay away if you're not bringing kids with you because they are everywhere!

This was my first time at Las Vegas and as an adult who didn't get to do adult things because I was stuck with babysitting I can't wait for the next  time I go to Vegas because then I can actually get drunk and have a good time. 

Thank you circus circus for a pleasant weekend with my family!

I stayed here one time with few friends.. DID NOT ENJOY IT

the location is off the strip. a little bit far from everything. the area looks a little bit ghetto, the room was old\/smells too.

Casino of course is old\/smells too. I pretty much did not stay unless i really wanted to sleep.
Ahhhh, something bit me! Just about says it all, Forrest. Left this place scratchy for days, but this is maybe the best location to gamble while the pre-teens enjoy the indoor amusement park.

Well, first things first. I wish I read the reviews before I booked this place. Probably the worst money I've ever spent on a hotel. Most of the chain motels I've stayed at were a lot nicer and half the price. Booked a room and at check in was told it was in the "manor" which is a complex separate from the hotel, cross a street to get to while carrying all of our luggage. It stinks, our room smoking section wreaked of cigarettes. 
I would have cancelled the reservation when I saw the place but they don't give refunds.

A solid casino & hotel for it being one of the oldest ones on the strip. If you don't have kids with you on the trip, you might want to say further down at one of the newer casino's, but this one definitely gives you some kid-friendly action along with all the other Vegas casino add-ons!

I'm so disgusted!!!  I get here so tired all I wanna do is shower and rest for a bit but no that didn't happen...  I got my stuff ready to shower, turned on the water while I was getting ready to jump in the shower looked down and all I see was my tub being clogged with thick black hair coming out!!!!  I want my refund but they refused to give it back....  And to top it off they made me wait 30+ mins until someone came in to fix it.....  I'm still unhappy about it, it's so discusting....

We booked here with the understanding it had the most for kids to do.  Circus Circus fails in it's attempts to co-ordinate staying at the hotel with such activities.  You don't have to stay here to check out the adventure dome or circus acts. We went at the week of the 20th (May) and it was sparse with people. Our kids had limited interest and were bored quickly. (13yrs)

The accomodations (west tower) were ok nothing special but nothing to complain about. No fridge, but not a make or break item. Bath collected water so you were always ankle deep when showering.

My biggest complaint about this hotel was the lack of enforcement for smokers. There are signs saying strictly prohibited to casino areas, but people smoked everywhere and it was ignored. While most hotels have noticble smoking, the level here was so high I was gasping for air at one point, my wife, myself and one of the kids all were blowing blood out of our noses. and we do not have a medical conditions. I would not book this hotel again the events can be done in a short period of time in one day.  (Note adventure dome is on another floor and was not smokey.

Maybe they had ventilation problems. Eitherway we checked out early and moved hotels.

The Circus Circus Manor Motor Lodge is a good place for families and those just needing a place to crash in Las Vegas. we reserved the room during the Circus Circus half-price sale and the rooms were all of $30. The bed was comfy, the wi-fi worked well and the room was clean and tidy. They are renovating the rooms and that is nice. The major drawback the keeps this from earning a 4 (Very Good) rating, there are no coffee pots in the rooms!!! The Motor Lodge is behind the main building and quite a ways to the strip, wear your walking shoes.
My girlfriend(then) and I stayed here in Vegas. It was cheap, but the room was crappy, 70's looking. Oh well, it's Vegas, so we barely even spent time in our room.

I have been staying at CircusCircus since the 70's as a kid, stopping over with my parents, and then with my own children.  Service was friendly as usual, and the free Circus acts are fun to watch.  The downside is the rooms are not always in good shape, the "Resort Fee" is rising rapidly to an outrageous $15\/night, my last trip included a cold shower, and the two depressing still partially built lots North and South are just not a place you want to be around.

I learned how to gamble here, and I loved it!  Here's why:

1 - You can't beat a $5 buy-in for craps!  I had a blast losing $50, playing with a new $50 to get back up (and I DID!!!)  It was so much fun

2 - You can't beat free drinks and fun people who are serious about having fun

3 - It was a close walk to our hotel, so it was awesome to avoid cabs 

4 - The lights are amazing, and the energy is high!

Kinda dirty, dingy, not great gambling, not great food, a place for kids, but I didn't see the appeal.  They have lots of games and kid-related stuff, but I didn't love Circus Circus.  Plus, the walk from the monorail to here was a half mile in the heat of nothingness.  Forgettable.

Theme is "righting their wrong". 

First impression, it's sub par in comparison to the other hotels I have stayed at. Definitely not the Wynn or Venetian. But it's my first time going to Vegas with a child. Figured this would be the best place. WRONG. When you first walk in the cigarette smell engulfs you. 

When we checked in the manager was kind enough to accommodate us for the dates we were planning to stay. Said that the prior night will be comped. We were very happy until we checked out the room. I first removed the top layer of the bedding. It's a known thing to take that off since i believe they don't wash it every time a guest checks out. Anyways, as I removed it, there were hot Cheetos crumbs on the bed. I called housekeeping to have the linens changed. She sounded annoyed since I added one of the pillows was yellow. Then I checked the other bed (we had 2 queen sized beds) there was hair in the pillow case. That's when I called Guest Service. We were immediately told to go to the front and get our new keys for our new room. 2nd room smelled better. Not smelling like a cigarette like the previous room and everything looked 10x cleaner. Oh did I forget the mention the other phone was disgusting (see photos). 

Biggest wrong was when we came back to the hotel the 1st night. Tried to self park and we were all exhausted so decided to call it a night and just pay to have the car valet. When the valet guy comes this guy tells Tim its $13 for the night. Oh and asked for him to tip him. Ok he was given $15 cash. The next morning Tim was picking up the car from the valet since we had to meet family for Thanksgiving get together  and he was told he never paid. The valet guy pocketed our money. To say we were furious was an understatement. In the end, the manager came and comped the charge. Which really was not comped since we did pay and even gave extra to the guy for tip. This experience is worse than the room being dirty. That employer should be let go. What he did was stealing. 

Like I said they right their wrongs. But come on! Get your ish together right the first time. You are leaving lasting impressions on your guests. We will never stay here again. We should've just stayed elsewhere and just came here for the games at Adventure Dome if the little one really did want to play. In the end we didn't even go to Adventure Dome at all. 

Btw, there's no room service. Also forgot razor and we called to see if they can send someone up and they don't have that service available either. Seriously just pay extra to not have to deal with this kind of BS. Last thing you want to deal with while on vacation.

We had no hot water in the morning. The lady at customer service started accusing me of lying saying they had no complaints of anyone saying hot water not working. I replied that doesn't mean i cant be that unlucky room and if shes accusing me of lying. I paid $300 for this room and got no hot water. And they refused to give us a late check out even if maintenance came (it was 10:15am check out is 11am) unless i paid $55 more for just a extra half hour. Very rude lady for testing my integrity. If i paid $300 i deserve a room with hot water.

She simply could have told me she will send a maintenance guy to check it out instead of accusing me of lying.

I was just there this weekend and had a very disappointed with one of your employees at the Midway at a Bushel Barrel game, I gave her a $10 asked her to give me two balls she was getting ready to give me back my change of $9 and I get near and tell her once more in a nice matter and softly since it's a senior lady, it's two balls (they are $1 each ball per play) and all of sudden she goes crazy on my saying 'get back, get back no touching' in front of a lot of people, it was quite humiliating as some by standers started laughing, and at that moment I told her 'Forget it' grabbed my $10 from the counter and walked away. It is unfair to drive 200+ miles to stay at your hotel, spend money on slots, and arcade games, souvenirs with my family to get this kind of treatment. 

Now the Hotel is decent if you stay in the West or Casino Towers, they are clean, and the room keepers are nice. 

Check in time is chaos! so be prepared! 

Overall our stay was decent, but I doubt we will be staying here on our next visit to Las Vegas, they need to improve their customer service first!

It was ok they sent us to our room there was a naked man in the room  . Back to the front desk for a new room . The new room was nice and the bed is soft . does not have a refrigator or microwave ?????  The pool is across the street you have to walk for ever . The trucks for the hotel unload right beside the  fence and have  to smell and hear semi trucks all day and beep beep beep everytime they back up . It is so loud you can not even talk to each other . They need to put a 12 - 20  foot wall around the whole area and make a garden area around it ,The area would be nice if they  closed a few  service roads and changed there traffic so you can relax and enjoy the pool . The buffet was a one the food tasted like they opened the cans and put it into the pans no home cooking or flavor at all . The desserts were all store pies and cakes and cookies it was really sad . They should just give you the buffet for free with the room . The best things were Krispy Kreme , Auntie Annes, McDonalds .

the pros; 

- check-in staff was very kind and helpful. 
- cheap
the cons;

where to begin?..

-this place is downright FILTHY! our room was disgusting. even in the "remodeled" tower ( west ) 
-too many children running around screaming. 
- Not even really close to anything noteworthy on the strip. 
- No microwave or fridge in the room. That seems like an obvious one. Had to buy a cooler..
- did i mention filthy?

booked way too many nights here.. ditching the hotel soon and staying somewhere else. Honestly a huge disappointment for our first time here in Vegas.

12\/2\/17 My motorcycle was stolen on skyrise level 5 vendor parking. Security had no emotion to my situation. I used to park below adventuredome where other motorcycles parked until I was ticketed and directed to park else where. Just a bad experience, and I hope no one goes through this complete heartbreak. It really took a tool on me, Depression is setting in. 

Mode: ninja 300, Kawasaki 
Year: 2014 
Vin: JAEX8B14EA003923

Some one took the belongings out of their truck and put my motorcycle in their cab and drove off. All that was left was a blue plastic bag and a shelf (of theirs). 

I called the police, and reported it to security. 
I waited for police for 5 hours and no one helped or had a sense of urgency to my situation.

My 24th floor Skyrise Room was perfect. Very clean and comfortable with a beautiful view of some of the strip. I slept very well and had no problems whatsoever. Checkin was quick and easy , the attendant was nice! It was Super packed but I felt I got much more than I paid for (AAA Discounts, etc)  would definetly stay again. NOTE: MAKE SURE YOU READ WHEN YOU BOOK, I GOT THE SAME DEAL A LOT OF PEOPLE GOT BUT THEY CHOSE THE WRONG ROOM TYPE WHEN THEY BOOKED!! Make sure you choose the TOWER ROOMS , Not the Manor! Lol!! SILLY RABBITS.

This is the cheap hotel and I mean cheap in every aspect. First time I stayed and last time. The smell is nasty. The bed covers I would not sit on. The internet connection is hideous. The shower had long hair in it. The plumbing sucks. The only thing that is good is the size of the room which is decent. It is a truly 2 star hotel.
Do not stay here. Spend the extra  $5 per night and stay at Excalibur or luxor. Poor room condition, rude staff, and extremely poor facilities.

Okay, so I'm updating this because Circus Circus e-mailed me a complimentary 2-night stay in their West Tower due to the inconvenience. The new tower is way better than their old Skyline tower, plus they threw in a view of the Strip so that made my stay much more enjoyable. Although the bathtub still needs a little work, the room was much more comfortable and service this time was a lot more streamlined. I am glad that this time around I was able to relax after a few nights on the town! (P.S. I did stay elsewhere for the rest of my vacation though...CC is nicer than it was years ago but I can't really justify staying there again unless I am with kids or need a really cheap room on the Strip and I was able to get a really nice suite at another hotel for a very decent price via an online sale).

I found this place to be: gross; creepy; annoying, and overwhelming.

Gross: everything was just dirty, or looked dirty. The bed? the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in.  Only palatable when drunk. the sheets smelled funny, and the water was lukewarm.

Creepy: there are murals of clowns with well defined junk. Also: the criss angel official store.

Annoying: I don't care that it's circus based, there is no such thing as child friendly vegas.  take your child where they won't see ridiculous and trashy people, and so they won't wake me up.

Overwhelming: so much noise. so much smoke, and sooooo many lights.  I get it, it's Vegas, but all of the casinos down the strip are both quieter and without the seizure inducing running lights, and much more pleasant.

2 Perks: Mexitalia: whole ton of food, for not a lot of money; open 2-8pm.  Also: Krispy Kreme.  Coffee... nom nom nom.

Spend the extra money and go somewhere closer and nicer.  Hell, the other places are probably more "family friendly" too because there aren't as many trashy people around.  Blackjack is cheaper at the Sahara, and the casino is nicer.

Cut and dry: you get what you pay for here. Hard navigation to room (very confusing) as well as the parking deck feeling very low lit and sketchy. ...also you can't get to the elevator to your room in one of the towers without walking through a  low grade casino full of smokers. I wouldn't mind this but I had my children with me, so I didn't like it at all in this case. 

Once we got to our first room, we stumbled upon a great view with the beds made, but trash from the previous guests were left everywhere. It was as if room service made the beds and left, but nothing else. We complained and they knocked the resort fees off and upgraded us to a deluxe room for two nights, which was nice but inconvenient still. Adventuredome was great, but the buffet was highly over priced as it tasted old and stale. Definitely was not worth the money to me. I don't see myself going back however I am not ill with the resort. I only believe they should make a lot of huge investments. Wasn't as kid friendly as I originally thought.

Photo booth at the park - Lying to people stating the package is only $30, charging $31.46 asking why they charge more after they just told me it is $30, Katie (the manager) and Mariah told me the 1.46 is for "tax", but they charge additional tax... She then explain her boss was asking her to lie about it - unbelievable

I feel itchy just thinking about this place. 

I remember when I was a little one my parents brought me and my younger brother here. I thought it was the greatest place I had ever seen, with the little amusement park and the carnival games and circus acts. We had our RV hooked up in the lot. It was the mid 90's. A simpler time.

I've stayed here more than once quite recently when me and my girl were ballin on a budget. Even from the outside it's like... I'm having second thoughts about this. Okay, Just... fork out the extra money and stay somewhere that say, cleans their bedspreads and curtains sometimes, or, vacuums the room occasionally. Circus Circus does not do these things ever.

Even wallking through the casino you get the most disgusting, creepy, dirty feeling. And also the feeling like you are going to be murdered. By clowns. Basically you get the dirty feeling because the place is dirty in all ways, shapes, and forms. It's really a sad place. It's like a carnival tent that someone abandoned and left to rot. And it smells that way. Like shit, mold, stale cigs and despair.

The few times (a few too many) that I've stayed here, the check in line has been long. I actually let a bride and groom at the end of the line cut in front of me when I was next up one time. Hey, Circus Circus has to do with some part of their wedding. It was the least I could do. The people that work the front desk are depressed. And I would be too if someone made me wear that stanky ass purple uniform. Bless their hearts. They also must give you a map and explain to you which way to go and which elevator you need to take to find your room. The layout of the place is horrendous. I've been lost a few times. And, you don't wanna be lost here. Like I said, it's creepy.

On your adventure to find your room, you will be forced through hallways of stands with pushy people trying to sell you a bunch of made in China crap. Like a flea market from hell. Walk quiclky, head down, through this mess. It's the only way you'll make it. 

The ventilation is SO BAD. Honestly I think if you had asthma and stayed here you would die. 

I can't even imagine that people dare to eat here. I give you props for your bravery. They do have a Krispy Kreme, which is actually one plus.

You will have to taxi or drive to get anywhere desirable. The location of this place is really terrible. Plus, you will be embarassed to tell the taxi driver to take you back here. If you wanna go see some tits, Sapphire is pretty close. Not walking distance close, but close enough. 

Really, you could not pay me to stay here. NEVER AGAIN.

As a kid, I'd always love coming down here. There's an arcade and a separate area with indoor roller coaster and rides. 

Recently came back after many years. It  looks slightly depressing. It was quite quiet on a Saturday, but it was during Jan after all. Games are still fun though. Claw machines are relatively cheap.

Not sure about the hotels, but come for the fun and games.

Giving this place one star because less is not possible.. The bathrooms smell like you know what. The casino is full of little kids screaming everywhere. The casino smelled like a cigar shop. And everything just looked old and broken down. I don't recommend this side of Las Vegas at all.. It's actually pretty scary

Wow. What a dump. 

A shadow of it's former self, Circus Circus is now a true circus of ghetto. Dirty carpets, disgusting bathrooms and criminals of every flavor abound. The staff here seem miserable, as well. Circus Circus is the most affordable hotel on the strip for a reason. Even the cab drivers dislike going to this place. The CVS right next door is a haven for loitering homeless, drunks and crackheads. This casino hotel is definitely one to be avoided if you're looking for a clean, safe place to stay with a friendly staff.

In response to the form letter you send to most complaints on Yelp;

Talk is cheap! Keep sending responses like this to your former patrons. Letters do not solve the plethora of issues your business is facing.

Circus circus is a bit beat up, but it is still fun to go to. The dinner buffet is pretty decent, but could use some work. It also gets pretty busy there and the crowds are ridiculous, but it is a fun place for families and anyone who wants to have a fun time! (:

Bed bugs!!! First time here this place is disgusting! Stayed in rom 26730 and woke up with a bed bug by me head (pictured)!! Pool was filthy even had a potato chips bag floating in it.  I will NEVER be back!

I will never step foot in this place again. First of all, you have hobos (I learned they are not part of any act in Circus Circus) slumming outside of this place and there is lack of security. The atmosphere is dark and stuffy. Let me also add that the floors are sticky. GROSS! I was only in Circus Circus for 30 minutes. After playing at a blackjack table, I got up and left when I noticed the stable was sticky as well. 

GROSS PLACE! I think they need to start thinking about condemning this place....

Pros: A deal for families and those traveling on a budget. Its located just of the strip and it is close enough to all attractions. It has a circus area full of carnival attractions and games. It has a decent buffet.

Cons: Our tub faucet leaked all night. We had to close the bathroom door because it was so loud. DO NOT PARTAKE IN THE HOTEL PROMOTIONS IN THE LOBBY. THEY ARE A WASTE OF YOUR TIME. THEY ARE JUST TRYING TO GET MONEY OUT OF YOU. DO NOT GO TO THE POLO TOWERS.

I was in Las Vegas for my cousins wedding. My parents timeshare booked them a room at Circus Circus so the rest of my family decided to stay together. I was hesitant based on the reviews. However, it wasn't that bad. 

Check in is at 3:00pm. I checked in around 2:15pm with no problem. I didn't realize I booked for the Manor Lodge.  I asked how much it would cost to upgrade since my family booked were all staying in the main hotel. The lady who checked me in was incredibly nice and professional and she upgraded me for free. My room was very clean. The bed was comfortable. No bed bugs. There was black electrical tape on the shower head in the bathroom.  There was no noise in the hallway and I felt safe. 

The hotel is very kid friendly. There were kids everywhere. This was not an issue for me. This is a hotel kids would enjoy. 

That being said, this hotel is old Vegas. The owners should really invest into upgrading the entire hotel and making it more modern. They should also put mini refrigerators in the room and give the outside of the hotel a good face lift. 

Overall, experience was good.

Overall happy with the hotel and staff for the money spent. Kids enjoyed the rides. One BIG complaint! When we checked in to the hotel (23rd Feb 2017 between 7.30 pm to 8.00 pm ) before walking to the checking counters, I was stopped by a hotel staff ( man) in the lobby and was asked if I am an Indian. I said No, then asked where we came from, I said New York. I did not like the way this person represented the hotel! But did not want to complain\/ make a big issue at the time as we were tired traveling from Vancouver. 

I would ask hotel management to keep an eye on these inconsiderate staff in the future. 

PK from NY

Lemme just start out by saying we paid $26.00 including tax per night! 

With that said, who can really complain about this being one of the older hotels on the strip? I always say you get what you pay for but in this case I thought we got more then what we paid for. 

The teens loved the games area and the little shops available. The short little shows they perform were great. They were short but had really amazing talent. 

Now on to the room...sigh...I have to admit it was terrible. We walked into the room and was almost knocked over by the stinch. I swore there was something dead or rotting in the room. We searched everywhere to try and locate the cause of the horrible smell and just couldn't find it. My daughter sprayed some perfume and we decided to buy some scented candles or rug deodorizer the next morning. By morning the smell was gone thank goodness. For the next two days we rested well and enjoyed all the hotel had to offer especially for the kids. 

Parents if you go to Vegas with your teens this is a great choice. So many fun things to do here and great shops to shop in. Don't expect a top of the line hotel stay but in terms of a wonderful place to take the kids in Vegas this place takes the cake.

Last time  I visited Vegas I stopped by to check this place out. They actually have a circus act(s) going on in the middle of this giant complex with clowns walking around. One of the clowns I said hello to reminded me of Krusty because he was so surly and nasty and I believe he went off for a smoke break. It was surreal.

I was nervous when I reserved a room at Circus Circus. I read so many reviews. I decided to give it a try. I loved it. i stayed in the WEST TOWER on the 21st floor. The room was clean. I had no complaints. I normally take my lysol and spray the entire room, including the bed and bathroom. My 2 boys (14 & 11)loved it and they are usually picky. There were no kids in the hall running around, in fact I didn't hear any kids yelling during my stay so that was great. If you decide to stay here make sure you stay in the WEST TOWER. When I was checking in, I did hear people complain about their rooms, but they were staying in the skyrise tower and casino tower so i guess those rooms are not as great!!!!
Oh and try to check in around 2:30pm., there isn't as many people. It only take about 15 minutes at the most.

Thank you once again for an excellent stay! I would also like to thank the clerk who helped me check in, she gave me a few carnations since my birthday is coming up. Her name was Pamela, made check in a breeze since we were in a rush to get to our room(Vegas was 37 degrees and we were shivering).

Pros:
Children friendly and offers free Circus Arts every 30 minutes. 

Cons:
Casino ceiling very low. Interiors very old.

I stayed there during CES 2016. The rooms were ok, faucet leaked in the tub non-stop but you couldn't hear it in the bedroom. Place was good to sleep. unfortunately I kept having to walk through the casino to get to an Uber or a Lyft which always ended up parking in a different location, and something there smells horrible.

Don't get me wrong, I've smelled smoke before, and smoke cleaners. This smell, which seems concentrated in a couple of areas, smells like burning cat and oranges mixed with bleach. It's a nasal ice pick.In my adult life I have never had to hold my nose due to smell before.

Now to be fair, other people I was with just said it smelled extremely bad where I was in pain. So maybe I'm the only one it smelled like someone driving an ice pick into my brain, but damn. All I can figure out is it's some sort of citrus-based smoke remover, perhaps it spilled. Maybe something burned. Do not know. I was there a week and would take gulps of air to avoid breathing near the spots.

Hallways on my floor had no visible signs for elevators. Not a big deal but it's walk down a bland hallway, oh, there's an ice maker, approach it and on the right you'll see another area where the elevators are. One of those things that seems to have been designed to purposefully screw with people who are drunk, stoned, or have a feat of being trapped in a never-ending hotel.

The staff that I met were friendly. We left out several hundred dollars worth of swag that remained unmolested, although I do suspect they may have wandered off with a ball of socks I left on the bed.

I should point out I didn't hate it, there was just nothing that really impressed me, and their ATM which I had to use to get on the cash only airport shuttle charged $6 for cash, so meh.

Staff was nice is the only thing nice I can say and only reason I did not give this place a 1 star.  We came from out of state to go see a concert and celebrate a dear friend's 50th bday. They stuck us in the "MANOR". The minor is out dated, jas a funky smell, the plumbing was messed up, out dated TV, the was are really think we could hear the neighbors TV all night and hear every conversation they had clear enough to answer questions. There were also several drinkin young ladies sleeping in the lobby... I do not think they were quests. The soda machine was out of soda. The Manor is not close to the main hotel and casino so if you have trouble walking or are slightly disabled it is a bit of a pain.

All I can say is complete Disappointment!!! After driving 8 hours we were expecting to have a clean comfortable place to stay. Not even close. The stairs in Manor C we're black with grunge and there was urine in the corners. I have no clue how this place stays in business.

I absolutely love coming here my family enjoys it and that makes me very happy yes the hotel is older and there are a ton of kids running around but let's face it when you're coming with your family I'm not paying big bucks to stay at a snobby Casino we love the arcade in the Adventuredome in their free shows or a plus not one but two swimming pools even though they do close a little early compared to other casinos in other places we stayed my kids still enjoy swimming I love Circus Circus and besides the fact that their stuff is being friendly is great again I came this weekend and had free rooms I love to play the table games when the kids are asleep and they are Beyond generous thank you Circus Circus we will definitely be back within the next few weeks

Beautiful hotel. Everything is there. No need to really walk down the strip if you don't wish too. The rides and attractions were a big hit for my toddler. He loved it. The room had an awesome view to the pool and the city. Price was affordable. Will return to this hotel. Very very nice!!

Dingy, dark, and no fridge or minibar in room (Mini Suite). Hallways are dirty and elevators have garbage in them. The breakfast lunch buffet if you are are not a meat lover or refrain from eating pork is the worst buffet i have ever eaten. The quality standards in this hotel are worse than a motel. You are better off in a best western or a double tree. How on earth is this hotel 3 stars is beyond me.

If you are coming to Vegas just to party then this place would be good, As you likely won't be doing more than sleeping off a hangover In your room, But being here on business it was really hard to get good sleep, bed sucked, had a lovely view of the roof\/solid wall, And crap TV!  The staff is just okay we waited in a long line for over 30 minutes just to check in.

I should have checked the reviews before staying in Circus Circus.  We wanted a hotel close to the Convention Center for two days.  All the other hotels close by were fully booked and we thought we hit a good deal when we were able to book a room for a cheaper price.  That was a missed clue.  

Circus Circus is due for an extreme make over.  I do not know how old the hotel is but it looks very old.  Parking was terrible, the garage elevators (only two) were small and very slow.  It was faster taking the stairs. Good thing we didn't have big luggage.  Feel bad for the old people. The path from the garage to the main lobby was nasty.  Garbage and puke in the path (it seems nobody cleans regularly).  The main lobby was too small and dark.  It felt like you were in a bus station.  It was very crowded with people seating in the floor with their luggage.  The carpet was worn out, not enough chairs or sofas for people waiting to check in or for a ride to the airport.  It smelled old too, like a museum,  The only plus I can think of is the staff were really friendly and welcoming.

We stayed in the West Tower and the elevators were like the ones in the garage, small and slow.  They could not handle the traffic.  In the morning it took us more than 20 minutes to get onboard one because they were always full and pitifully slow.  They made slow creaking sounds when moving.  There was also no security to verify if you are hotel guest to the elevator areas.  Anybody can get in the hotel.

The rooms were nothing special, they were old and outdated.  Rooms in Holiday Inn Express are way better.  They do not have a refrigerator (they charge $20 a night to add one) and microwave oven.  They also do not have any HD channels available.

I guess one of the main attractions is the amusement park in the dome.  You do not get perks as a hotel guest.  They will give you a 1 or 3 $ discount in the rides but you almost pay as much as anyone walking in off the street.

I am sorry but I cannot recommend this hotel to anyone.  I would rather pay extra $ for a much better accommodation.  The price you pay (even though it was cheaper than the other hotels in the strip) is not worth it.

This 1 star... is literally for the midway section and thats IT. This is probably my third time taking my kids here who by the way LOVE the midway here. But outside of that this place is a heart attack waiting to happen.

The last two times i was here my only complaint I'd have about this casino\/hotel is the smell they use to fume up the entire facility. The smell here is enough to break someones nose off SERIOUSLY. My nose goes into this rejection mode while i walk through the hotel and casino just to get to the midway. Surprisingly the midway doesnt smell half as bad as the main floor thank god.. otherwise the first time here would have been the last.

The reason this third time here was so bad was the smoke. Im not sure what changed or why it wasnt as filtered out as the last 2 previous times i was here.. but the moment i stepped in.. i really had a hard time breathing..like i was ready to stop breathing any moment. If I felt that way... imagine how my kids felt. I understand vegas isnt a place for kids but i only took them there specifically for the midway and other kid attractions nearby. Given how horrid this experience was.. i probably wont be back here.. ever. The scent of the hotel\/casino was bad enough but i might just die next time i walk through a cloud of heart attack waiting to happen.

I stayed in the manor section C and non-smoking!  I thought my room was pretty decent. It didn't smell but I brought an air freshener with me bc some reviews said rooms stink. 

The manor is outside, which bites because I have to walk a great distance just to get to the casino. ha! I'm lazy.

My bathroom lock was on the opposite side. Thankful that I wasn't bunking with anyone bc that would have been a cruel joke! haha! I always made sure not to the close the door in case I locked myself in! That would have sucked! 

I heard rooms were cheap but the weekend I went... it wasn't cheap.

My family and I love this hotel because it is very kid friendly. If you think that this place is like The Wynn Hotel you are wrong. I don't understand how people can complain about the price if they think it is like a high end hotel. Why not pay a lot more and stay somewhere else and stop crying about this hotel. Just remember one thing and you will not be mad, you get what you pay for. Again this place is very budget friendly. Thank you Circus Circus!!!!!

Fact: Circus Circus was one of the key locations for Sean Connery's 007 film "Diamonds Are Forever."

Fact: The hotel today is even tackier than it was in 1971.

Fact: That creepy feeling you got when you saw Mr. Wint and Mr. Kidd in the film? Yeah. The hotel will give you that creepy feeling, too.


They charge a mandatory "resort fee," which is a bit of a misnomer. This isn't a resort. Imagine instead that the t-shirt vendors and samurai sword dealers of your local flea market teamed up with a carnival, started a permanent location, and decided to add 3x more flashing lights than Britney sees getting out of a limo. To add to the ambiance, they found a way to make the building smell like an orange melmac ashtray that hasn't been cleaned in 30 years.

Cheap. Stinky. Dark. Slightly seedy. That's a pretty good description.

We had a recently renovated room, within the past month, and it was not as tacky as the rest of the hotel. That will not last, though. There was pizza sauce on the wall from the previous tenants that stayed put during my entire week stay. On one of the days, room service did not even check on our room or see if we needed towels.

The furniture in the room, though new, was a peculiar blend. There was a desk and a table, but the only chair was a cloth living room arm chair. I'm not sure how they anticipated someone to use the table or the desk comfortably.

For those of you who have driven up I-95 through the Carolinas, this is the South of the Border of the Vegas Strip. Don't do it. It's cheap, but it's too cheap. Find a decent place off the Strip, or wait for a special rate at a decent hotel through a travel site.

What do you think of the review?
Mr. Wint: Very moving. 
Mr. Kidd: Heartwarming, Mr. Wint. 
Mr. Wint: A glowing tribute, Mr. Kidd.

After reading all the horrendous reviews about this place, I became very paranoid. I entered Circus Circus expecting there to be mold and bugs crawling everywhere in the room. Every day, I would check the sheets for bed bugs with a flash light. Fortunately, there were none to feed my suspicions. Although the room could be nicer, I just use it for sleeping. The TV is a let down, but I am out all day and never have a chance to watch it. The shows here are a MUST. Circus Circus does not emphasize there shows a lot and we did not know there were any at first. Once you find it, you never want to leave. Sad how they are only ~8 minutes per show. There is also an arcade all around the show area and it is really amazing for kids. The shows are at midway which I would never have known if I did not look online. Overall, I expected a lot worse. This place is amazing for kids! But won't stay here next time because it is a little far from the other places on the Strip.

Midway games were really fun to play. Casino is a little bit dirty, but they do offer coin slot machines in addition to a wide variety of the newer video slots. The parking lot was a little crowded and felt really dirty, but overall not too bad for a kid friendly place.
Easy to simply apologize your not out the hassle or the money.... I thought Vegas was all about the "experience

After reading the reviews, I almost cancelled my reservation. I don't think the hotel is as bad as the reviews make it seem. The room was fine, it was basic and there was one flat pillow per person. No extra amenities really, and the place is old and a little dingy. However, it was clean, staff was helpful and friendly, and there was plenty to do. It was overrun with children, which can be great because there is a million things for kids to do. We weren't traveling with kids so at times it was a little annoying. Overall, my stay wasn't bad or great either way. It was inexpensive and basic so it was fine for the two nights. Next time I'm in Vegas I will likely pay more and stay somewhere nicer.

Stayed there when I got married last weekend.Really nice staff thaat was willing to help with everything. Upgraded from a manor room to a skyrise room. Very affordable, room was very clean.  Buffet was almost half the price of the one at Mandalay Bay and I enjoyed it more.  Will definitely stay there again.

Circus Circus is depressing as hell. Kinda surprised that it even outlasted Stardust. 

Access from the Las Vegas Hilton is horrible. I walked by myself from the Hilton to the Circus Circus. Pretty scary experience that I would never do again.

And it's a pretty long walk to the crackin' area of the Strip (the Mirage\/Treasure Island). And to think I thought it was bad enough walking to Fashion Show Mall. 

Since turning 21, I haven't been to the amusement park and the arcade. But at this rate, I'm not sure I can give much credit to them either. 

Needless to say, I'm willing to pay a little more to have closer access to the spots on the Strip that I wanna go to. Plus, if you're 21+, Circus Circus can really cramp your style.

I just spent the weekend at circus circus! I had made a reservtion for the lodge. But as I arrived at 7:30 in the morning I paid 30 dollars for a early check in. and the put me in the sunrise tower. I saw a room in the manor and the casino tower (family in those areas) and to be honest I am so glad I did do the early check in because the lodge is a little run down and dirty with no security out there like the website says. But back to my room. It was clean and big with two queen beds clean linens and a clean towels. The one complaint I have of the actual room was the tv was to small and hardly anychannels on it. I actually had no problems with noise it was really quite for a weekend. It is a old hotel but for someone on a budget its fine I spent 215 for 3 days, early check in and resort fees.

I stayed here when I went to EDC in 2011 and promised myself I would never come back. However, a friend of mine had reserved a room for the weekend and couldn't go so she let me stay in her room for free.

The first time I stayed here, the room smelled literally like s***. We called the front desk and they sent a maid to spray some air freshener around the whole room which didn't work. It was horrible! The bedding was ugly and the room was dark and dreary. The same with the second time. There was a odd smell and parking was weird. 

Just spend a little more and stay at a better hotel.

Being on a budget, I knew what I was paying for when I booked a night here. The check-in went smoothly, and the staff that I have came in contact with was very pleasant. 

The downside I can point out is that the whole hotel building is just confusing to get around. Took a good while trying to find my room after check in. Had to ask the cleaning ladies to try to find my room.

Now I didn't expect much out of the room. They were indeed outdated and didn't have any view outside the window. However the bed was comfy enough and good TV. Bathroom was simple but it wasn't dirty. It was a decent stay. Also gets a star from me for having Krispy Kreme.

Horrible Experience. Stayed in the RV park. First we had to wait 35 minutes in line to check in at the front desk of the hotel. They placed us in the middle of construction parking in the back corner, site 128, and we woke up to a bunch of construction workers pressure washing their vehicles at 630a followed by non-stop back up alarms, bulldozers, and diesel trucks idling outside our door. To top off the stay they shut off the water to the RV park in the morning. When we asked at the front desk about these issues they stated "it's posted in the park, you should have known better" about the water and when they called the now open RV park office and were told they shouldn't have placed us in the construction parking area the front desk staff turned to us and stated "because you checked in after 8pm there is no way we could have known not to use the construction spots, we can't do anything about that." We found this "posting" they referred to, it was a sheet of paper taped to the laundry room door in the RV area. So I suppose had we done laundry in the closed RV park office after arriving at 9pm we would have known we paid for an RV camp with no water. They were the rudest front desk staff who made us even more upset by them implying it was our fault, not theirs, that I had to spend the day wearing dried soap after my shower water was cut off, and my wife had to bathe using baby wipes.

Hey I wouldn't recommend that you have your honeymoon here, but for a last minute room when every casino is booked cuz of queen madonna, the worlds series of poker, and the air show... I'll give it a whirl since I still have fond memories of spending a whole day trying to win stuffed animals and walking 12 miles going around and around considering what to play.  (And i didn't want to stay off the strip)  For nostalgia, memories, or trying to be 12 again, I went upstairs to see if I still had the stuffed animal winning touch.  I was surprised to see that most of the same games were still there!  I concentrated on the Tic-tac-toe since it had the cutest and best price for a first win.  I'm not playing a game where you have to trade 15X to get something decent!  Hint, if you have a room they give you a book of coupons that let you play 2 for 1!  I played a total of 6x or $3.  I won twice!  I guess I still have it.  Hint #2 if your asian and your nice, the gamekeeper might let you lean over the table to float the ball in the right hole.  I got a blue bear and a pink bear that wears a "Property of circus circus hoodie".  Awww how cute!

Regarding the rooms... Like I said it's no honeymoon suite, but my room was clean.  I'm a guy, as long as it's clean, i'm straight.  Strangely the lock on my room was broken and I only  realized it when I was leaving for Madonna.  Luckily I didn't have any valuables.  I called the front desk and they said they would send someone to fix it.  No one came and in the morning I called to bitch again.  I ended up talking to a sup and she sent a housekeeper to verify.  She thought I was one of those freeloading leeches that just bitches to get a free room.  Apparently there are alot of freeloading leeching customers.  The housekeeper opened the door while i was completely nekked trying to put my clothes on.  Apparently she didn't mind and just kept on messing with the door.  Finally I got my boxers on.  She left, the sup called me back and I got a free room.  Comped baby!

Every time I come to Vegas I stay at hotels like the Cosmo, mirage, treasure, planet Hollywood and Caesars palace, but this time my boy friend and I decided to spend less on a hotel and more on fun adventures. I was very hesitant when he booked circus circus, honestly I did not want to stay here. I read all of the review on Yelp and was immediately turned off by the idea of staying here. People made this place sound like "the Cortez" from American horror story. 

We checked in at midnight on Thursday and the girl that helped us was nothing but amazing!!! She was kind, had a great smile and even suggested some places to eat. (Good choice on the Mexican place) 
 We get to our room and it's pretty big and I love it. It's clean and has no smell at all. I guess you get what you pay but people on here over exaggerated, we are staying at the west tower on the 22nd floor. We have a great view of the strip. 

Even the cleaning lady is great, she speaks little English but that was not problem, very kind, we made it easy for her since we are very clean and my ocd obsession with organization kicked in. 

My only problem was that the First floor has this over powering smell, not of cigarettes but something like a strong chemical , maybe for cleaning.
The second problem that I found was that some people working there are not as customer service Friendly, I went to the west deli for breakfast today and they where not welcoming at all and seemed annoyed. 
We are here till Wednesday and can't wait to see what else this hotel has!!!

Tower rooms were decent much to my surprise. Great for a place to rest your sleepy head however the casino is run down and kinda yuck. So in summary... if youre looking for a cheap place to stay for a night because youre in town for a event or something it's a perfect location! However... if youre looking to enjoy the night life or at least have some decent people watching opportunities... go somewhere else.

WE COME HERE ALL THE TIME.   Many people laugh when we say we stay here.  But I have never had a bad experience here. We do not have any kids and are not old farts lol.  We come here to play slots.  And they pay out very well.  We get comp rooms and its great.  Why spend over 100 and stay in  another hotel where your suitcase will be enjoying the room more than you will.  The rooms are clean, just a little out dated and the staff is friendly. The drinks are not watered down and the waitress comes around often. :-)  If you come to play then this is the place for you.

When I was a kid, my extended family and I used to go to Vegas all the time. We'd stay at Circus Circus when I was younger, but as we got older, we stayed at Excalibur. My cousin and I revisited Circus Circus recently. Nostalgia compelled us, now reality repels us. 

It is TO' UP. Seriously BUSTED.

There are corridors of shops that reminded me of being in a swap meet, or maybe even some weird bazaar in a foreign land. It made me feel really uncomfortable. I had good memories of the place, but dude, this is just sad.

To top it off, my cousin used the men's room in the Midway\/arcade. Holy $h*t! There was a SHARPS CONTAINER in there. They must have found one too many rogue syringes in the bathroom and said, "Eff it-- it's gonna happen, so might as well be safe about it." 

But yeah, this place is going downhill and fast. I wouldn't be surprised if this was the next casino to close down... but it's one of the few places that is family-oriented and actually has an arcade for the kids to play while the adults gamble. And their carnival games have decent prizes too.

This place should be next on the list of hotels to knock down.  It's at the far end of the strip and has nothing going for it except the amusement park inside.  That's cool, but the casino is really outdated and depressing, the wait to check in was somewhere near 30-60 minutes, and it just sucks.  Rooms were dated and felt dirty.  We got this room on a budget.  Cab fare from the hotel sucks too.  I wouldn't recommend.  Just go somewhere else.

We had reservations at the Steakhouse but did not stay there so this review is only on the process to get to the restaurant. I would say the meal was good but the process to get there was a nightmare.  The restaurant is the only good thing going for Circus Circus. 

First of all, the parking situation was awful.  The place was packed with tons of families and kids.  We were stuck in a very long line for a quite awhile even to get into the parking garage. They had one entrance blocked off for no apparent reason.  Handicap parking and valet were both full.  And we asked one of the attendants were the handicap parking was and he was very rude to us.

So we finally parked and then had to make our way into Circus Circus.  There are kids and parents everywhere.  The ceiling is low, the place smells awful, gambling sucked.  

I will never, ever go here again.  The steakhouse was not worth all this drama.

The hotel was PACKED with kids I stayed in the west tower the room decor was old fashioned look like something out of the 70s it had a handicap accessible shower my wife and I aren't handicap though... 

The lady in the check in desk asked us how we were doing my wife responded im that we just got married her immediate reaction was "we don't have comps" like wtf no one asked you for one followed by a congratulations  

All in all the staff was Meh the hotel was old I would only recommend if you have kids with you and you want to stay somewhere you can entertain them other than that avoid.

A little overpriced for the room that we received. Granted, it was a Saturday but it was over $200+ for two queen bed room. It was also quite different from the pictures online - 
Make sure you know what you're expecting before booking. To get around within the hotel was also kinda tricky - make sure you have a map and don't get lost in it. 
It is also quite far away from the main Las Vegas area so you'll have to walk quite a bit. There's free\/complimentary parking available - making it convenient. There's also a coaster and rides within the hotel

They don't change or wash the sheets and have an attitude when you bring it up to their attention. Tony at the front desk was very unhelpful. Probably not going to stay here again just spend a couple extra dollars and get a worth it hotel with good customer service

Never AGAIN!  Adventure Dome alone was a sea of unbathed children. I love children, don't get me wrong, but there's something wrong about parents that are holding ridiculous size alcoholic slushies while "watching" their kids here.

There's no rhyme or reason is this claustrophobic muggy place.  

The parking garage is so tight and cramped.  The elevator is always full.  The inside is so far from where I wanted to be in Las Vegas.  We've pleased my niece to ride 2 rides and that was all we can handle.

NEVER AGAIN at the dome.  Never again!

Only stayed here for one day as was flying out at midnight that night but I was pretty glad that I didn't have to actually stay the night.
All hotels in Vegas are pretty confusing with regards to having to walk through the casino and other attractions to get to the actual hotel, but this was the worst of the 3 I stayed at. The whole hotel was dark and dreary and had a very distinct odour. The check in process took over an hour despite the front desk having multiple people sitting there on computers doing nothing. I check in at about 1130 and didn't need to check in as such, just see if my room was available yet, otherwise I would just leave my bag. Despite the fact that there was a room available, I was told that I would have to pay if I wanted to check in early. When I said that I wasn't paying, I was told that they would waive the fee since I was checking out that night. 
The room itself was poorly lit and smelled bad, as did the bed covers. The only good thing was the wifi in the room, although you pay for that with the resort fee. $12 for wifi, some vouchers for the rides and some other things you will almost certainly not use. 
The hotel is widely regarded as a bit of a joke of a casino I learned and really is in a much less appealing area, right up the other end of the strip. I wouldn't have been comfortable walking back there in the dark. Definitely don't recommend. You can do a lot better for not a lot more. The kids might like the amusements, so if you travel with kids, maybe just take them there one day!

Honestly I like circus circus... Because the rates are super cheap and the rooms aren't so bad we really only need a place to sleep and shower and this is just enough. The only cons is there's kids everywhere but whatever, and they could really use some new shower heads. Other than that I never have an issue when I stay here especially during the busy weekends. Also Michelle the front desk agent (the cutie with the short hair and glasses) was just awesome very friendly and personable excellent customer service! She made checking in so quick and easy so thank you.

What a waste of money $200 a night and it felt like I was at a super 8 .. I should have just went to a super 8 ... if you go to Vegas do ya research and get a better deal and better hotel - rooms are ok at best security is also very prevalent

This is a large motel, at best 2.5 stars. The hotel is old and outdated,  the resturant selection is poor. I stayed in a Casino tower King which was apparently renovated  however  it did not seem so. The temperature control is poor, either it was too cold or hot, the ventilation system is outdated.  There are  lot of homeless people wandering around outside the hotel. Don't compare this hotel to the others on the strip, it is in a lower class of its own, think motel quality. Spend a bit more and stay elsewhere,  it will be worth it.

You could not pay me a progressive jackpot to stay here again.

If you want bed bug bites, chlorine filled air, the dirtiest and ugliest cocktail servers, and quite possibly one of the worst themed or thought of hotels ever...well unfortunately this place is for you.

100% positive there is bed bugs as all of us got bit in our room.

I highly recommend dropping acid like Johnny Depp does in "Fear and Loathing" to get you through the weekend if you have to step foot in this place.

Great for kids of all ages.  Free circus shows every few minutes.  Is it me or were the shows dominated by Russian people?  

The games were fun and easy to win too.  Unlike the county fairs its not like you have to drop $10 just to win a small toy either.  Unless you really suck or have horrible luck, you'll be able to win some sort of prize.

rude customer service upstairs not to mention the cheap stuffed toys they give you and they hold on to the big stuffed animals with there dear life as if it was comingout of their paycheck i was playing the dart game and i can clearly see that  got a bulls-eye and the guy just completely denies it. i didn't fight him on it cause i guess his job depended on being a cheating bastard. the games used to be 1$ when i was a  now there 2$ each and they're all scams
Definitely a good spot to bring the family for a good value. Rooms were fairly clean, the service at registration was very friend and welcoming and we received a lot of coupons on savings!!

So my family and I stayed here because there is a three year old in our party and we wanted him to be entertained. This hotel is older but still quite charming. The rooms are clean and the place doesn't smell to bad of smoke like most. There are tons of families and kids so be aware. But the deals are good. The circus acts were pretty cool clowns juggling, acrobats and the likes. Games like at the fair. We didn't go in the adventuredome because he was too little. But we tried their pizza it was not terrible.. Overall it was a good stay. And hey pay the money check in early. It is worth it!!

No one here seems to be trained in the hospitality business. Circus games for the kids will burn a hole through ur wallet. Carpets in room hallway looks like it hasn't be cleaned in 10 years. If you can get room rates for $30\/night then it's worth it. Otherwise, go elsewhere for better clowns. For a place that is supposed to be geared for parents with kids, this place is a bust. Southpoint does a better job.

I would have given this hotel a 2 star rating simply for rooms and such if it weren't for the horrifically rude staff in the sports bar. My bf and I were trying to order breakfast at the bar which we were told is a perfectly acceptable place to do that but immediately the bartender seemed annoyed that we were there. We attempted to order our breakfast over the ridiculously loud music at 9 a.m and my bf was literally hanging over the bar as far as he could to scream his order to the bartender who had to ask him 4 times for his order but it apparently never occurred to him to come a little closer so he could actually hear us. Right after he took our order he left and another bartender came on, when I asked her about my order because I was concerned he didn't hear us properly she was absolutely awful to me and then they of course bring out one breakfast prepared incorrectly when I asked the rude bartender about it she accused us of lying and stormed off to find the jerk who took our order who literally came back and proceeded to argue with us that we ordered one breakfast, because he could not be bothered to take our order properly in the first place, food also sucked we barely touched it and these two staff members were literally bad mouthing us to the other group in the bar. I have never in my life had a staff member anywhere openly argue with me for their careless mistake. However some other staff was very friendly, security guards and cleaning  staff were helpful but my advice to you Circus Circus hire some friendlier less miserable people to work the areas where people are actually spending their money.

it's been almost a month and we now have found bedbugs in our home.... thank you circus circus this is about to be great i am pregnant and am trying to get rid of these nasty ass things before he arrives in a few month i really really thank you for this extra stress. fuck you and your nasty ass run down establishment.... people do not stay here they have bedbugs they will bite they will travel home with you they are a pain in the ass. i cant seem to get rid of them.... please pay the extra money and stay somewhere else.... while we stayed at this piece of shit hotel we had bites everywhere. no joke please go somewhere else this is horrible...

One of the last hotels on the Las Vegas strip that retain nostalgic midway games from my childhood.  They have a variety of these carnival games in both their Adventuredome and their carnival themed midway section, and it's the greatest collection in the Las Vegas area.  They also have free carnival acts - don't expect Cirque du Soleil or anything, but hey, it's free.  The staff are also super nice and gracious and usually will give you the cheap prizes even if you "lose." 

Make sure you change a $50 or a $100 at the Manager's Office in the midway section for free BOGO coupons. 

The other parts of the hotel are mediocre at best, so just make a beeline to the fun parts!

I would give zero stars if I could! First of all I spent 30 minutes finding parking. Then, when I was at the arcade I saw a really cute dog that I wanted. I spent at least thirty dollars on that one game and when the machines breaks down in the middle of the game, she says no refunds. Once, when she went to get something my machine broke down, but she wasn't there to fix it. When she came back I told her my machine broke down and it started doing other weird things afterwards, she said "You should have told me sooner" in a mean way.Then,when I finally won and she asked me what prize I wanted, I said," I want that dog." She said there was no more dogs when I saw so many on display.

I stayed here one time, and was legitimately scared for my life. The surrounding area is very, very scary. The "manor" is basically the lowest grade motel complex that any developed nation would allow to actually stay open. There were at least three signs exhorting the guest to deadbolt the door--think about what that says about the complex. Even if there weren't the signs to scare you into compliance, the run-down nature of the rooms would be 1 star alone. I'd sooner spend the night clutching my bags on a greyhound than return.

Went for vacation early 07\/2014, we stayed in the West tower, the room was great, and the hotel workers was very helpful and nice. Would love to stay at this place again. The Buffet was great, food was hot and delicious unlike Studio B where the food was cold. Would recommend this to families with young children. 
Adventuredome was a blast. If you get coupons from online, or two-for-one buffet- be sure to go to the players club first and cash them in--saves you a few steps.  Can't wait to go back.

Stopped here on way back from Phoenix.  Looking for a budget option for two rooms for us and 3 kids.  Was pleasantly surprised. Rooms were more updated than I thought they would be.  Beds were okay.  Pillows were nice down filled ones.  Showers were a bit small with straight versus arched shower rod.  We were able to get adjoining rooms which was perfect for us, but we had to sacrifice view to 4th floor hvac equipment.  Adventure dome was a good way to kill half a day. We stayed in sky tower.  The clown show was funny, but short and was the only circus act we found. Solid value for the money.

Ofcourse when you get deals your being fucked over ...ale it seem like the rooms are going to be A1 then you get in and it's the absolute opposite . I brought my son here to visit family and why not bring him to circus circus the Manor is the worse place to be placed  it's like bungalows like the boondocks of circus circus... it's the oldest part of the hotel .. the girl at the front desk didn't know what she was talking about and  had me all over the second floor with my son and my bags looking for my room when in reality it was on the 3rd floor ..smh... they took the room I wanted and gave it to someone else even when I continued to call out of the day letting them know I was stuck in traffic but I'm still coming begging them not to give my room away so I end up with 2 queen bed room and the paint is coming off all over the walls or the wall paper shall I say ..  it looks like some one smeared poop all over the room and the free WiFi I guess it doesn't reach this far back of the hotel... last stay here ever 1 experience for my son and last !! I wouldn't recommend a stay in circus circus stay anywhere else and just come for the fun for the kiddos... however I will make the best of this stay.

we went here on a family trip and boy was my uncle piss!! we waited for our room for at least 3 hours cause they said it was already ready, but then the good thing is that we got comped. anyways this is good for a family cuz they have their own amusement park

Staying at Circus Circus's Manor RV park. Went to do laundry and found it had 7 washing machines, 1 was missing and 3 were "Out of Order". If they were slot machines and 4 out of 7 in a row were not working,  I'm sure they would be rushing to service them!

Next time I RV in Vegas, I will stay at SAM'S TOWN RV!

The staff were great, but I wonder about the lack of budget for maintence,not just at the Manor RV but also the non casino amenities!

It's a lot smaller than I remember, but then again the last time I was here was the late 80s! We didn't really do much here as I just wanted to take a stroll down memory lane and check out some of their games they have upstairs. I saw this game where there were three blocks stacked ontop of one another and you had to knock them down with bean bags to win a  little guitar. I won it for my son because I knew he'd love it! Yay!

Worst vegas experience ever stayed 2 nights in Vegas one at TI and one at circus circus (because my daughter wanted to) circus circus you have to walk a mile and take several elevators just to get out of the hotel if you drive an over sized vehicle you have to carry all your luggage forever just to get checked in. At all other stays in Vegas I parked in the oversized vehicle parking caught a free shuttle to check in by the time I got to my room my luggage was already there. And to get out one elevator and through the casino your done. 
Once again horrible.

The hotel overall was good but not exceptionally great. Please book online because it is much cheaper than the at the hotel. Unfortunately, many people checking in food out the hard way. Also, stay in the casino tower they have the better more modernized rooms. Upon entering the casino area was very smokey. Usual for casinos but it needed air handlers to filter the smoke.
