The rooms are reasonably price especially during the week. Prices go up starting Friday thru Sunday so plan accordingly. One great thing is valet parking is free and just remember to tip the drivers. There is self parking I  the nearby parking garage which is very spacious and close. The staff is very friendly and very accomdating. If you want tickets make sure you go early to the ticket counter. I had to go to another hotel in order to buy discounted tickets because they closed early. Overall, the hotel is good but located on the very north part of the strip so you will have to walk alot more. But there is McDonalds and Subway right next door.

We went to their brunch buffet and was disappointed by the food it was horrible. We decided to order pizza to the room because it was advertised in the room materials that they would. We called and were told they don't deliver to the mannor.

Horrible! What a dump, wen there just for our kids and checked out thee next day! Was put into a dirty room with laundry bags, had to be moved and therefore cause us to miss the only real dinner for the night, the arcade is run down, none of the machines work and the ones that do u have to wait for attendants to pay u out

Ein super Hotel, das meine Erwartungen weit bertroffen hat. Nationalitten: berwiegend Deutsche, Hollnder - und natrlich ein paar Amerikaner. Hauptbeschftigungsmglichkeit: Gaming! Wer mit Kindern unterwegs sein sollte darf sich auf den Freizeitpark "Adventure Dome" und halbstndliche Artistikeinlagen freuen - fr Hotelgste natrlich kostenlos.

Etwas abgelegen vom brigen Strip und umrahmt von Bauruinen hat das Hotel aber von seinem ursprnglichen Charme nichts verloren. Unser Zimmer zhlte zu den etwas neueren (Casino Tower) und war der Gre eines Zimmers im Interconti oder Hilton ebenbrtig. Gut, bei der Ausstattung hat es dann doch nur fr vier Sterne gereicht, dafr stimmte das Preis-Leistungs-Verzeichnis umso mehr. 

Dies zeigte sich vor allem beim Frhstck. Fr 15 Dollar gab es ein riesiges Buffet mit einer Omlettestation, einer ausgedehnten "Beverage-Oasis" und einer hauseigenen Patisserie mit einer ppigen Kuchenauswahl. Zahlreiche Restaurants im Hause warten mit Leckereien auf, das Highlight ist das mehrmals ausgezeichnete "The Steak House".

Es gibt einen hauseigenen Beautysalon, der sich vor allem auf Hochsteckfrisuren und Make-up spezialisert hat. Die Hauptattraktion des Hauses ist wahrscheinlich das Casino, zusammen mit dem benachbarten Slots-of-Fun von der Flche locker so gro wie "Auf Schalke". Parken inkl. Valet-Parking ist gratis (Trinkgeld von 1-2 Dollar werden allerdings vorausgesetzt). Dafr wird das Gepck bis aufs Zimmer geliefert. Der gutgemeinte persnliche Zimmerservice war zu der Zeit als er gebraucht wurde leider gerade nicht abkmmlich. 

Es gibt keine Minibar im Zimmer, dafr aber einen Supermarkt im Hotel. Am besten kommt man mit dem Auto in die etwas weiter sdlicher gelegenen Shopping Malls des Venetian oder des Ceaasr's. Auch in den anderen Hotels ist das Parken kostenlos. Von beiden Resorts ist die Water Show des Bellagios fulufig zu erreichen.

I am usually lazy to write reviews, but when I have an awful experience, I do write them...just to warn others to not fall in the same trap again.
There is no other hotel in Vegas that I have stayed in that is worse than this. The hotel is aged, which that may be fine if you are going for cheap places. But they play tricks, that's what annoyed me. They have this sketchy motel like property next to the casino hotel, and they just assign you to those sketchy places without notice. On the booking site they show you the hotel rooms, which all look OK. However, at check in, they will tell you Oh you are assigned to those OTHER places, which takes 10~15min to walk at night, in a appealingly unsafe place, to a dirty, aged, ugly place, with smell, at about the same price... This is FRAUD. I am truly disgusted by what they do. NEVER EVER stay at this hotel, trust me.

My boyfriend and I stayed here a few months ago to celebrate my 21st. We originally had booked a room in the manor to keep costs down, but upon walking up to the check in counter, the lady there saw my birthday tiara and gave us an upgrade to the West tower, as well as a coupon book and flower! I definitely appreciated the gesture. Probably doesn't happen too often, but we did go on a "slow" day and were also celebrating. 

The hotel's for the budget conscious, so obviously it's not going to compare to something like MGM or Bellagio, but it's a decent room for the price. We had comfortable beds, a nice bathroom, TV, air conditioning, etc. and some shops to explore, as well as a fun mini theme park in the hotel. We also enjoyed playing carnival games on the midway and seeing some free circus acts. 

Overall, I would say I'm pretty happy with how everything went. Would definitely go again.

Next time I'll just sleep in my car.. Less stress, more safety.  
Wasted about an hour at least trying to check in.  Tried to charge us double the resort fee, conflicting information, very disorganized.  Also the only establishment in Vegas I've tried so far where my credit card does NOT work, which made things increasingly difficult. (had to run to find a cash back place, which had NO problems with my card) When we finally made it to the hotel room, we discovered that the towels were badly stained, and upon gently unlocking the door from the outside, the deadbolt, along with the entire side frame of the door, ripped right off.  Didn't feel too safe at all.  Stains on ceiling, wallpaper coming off... Quite disappointing, as I was really excited to be staying at Circus Circus for the first time.  Will definitely be the last.
A very old, dated hotel with a terrible customer service and with a ghetto neighborhood. Find a better place to spend your money.

Wow has this place changed, I haven't been to circus circus since 2009. Everything is so old and outdated. It does bring back so many memories as a kid but the aroma of smoke in this casino was very strong. They added An arcade area that reminded me of chuck e cheese, that was like $1 a game. Which is pricy to me, since the carnival games aren't that bad.

Do not I repeat do not stay here. There are so many better options in Vegas. This place was absolutely filthy and I didn't feel like a VIP that's for damn sure. I felt like we were standing in a social services line for government aid when checking in.The line was super slow. I would never stay here again unless they did a total renovation and gave me an offer I couldn't pass up.

We stopped here quickly to check it out and was able to catch a free show while inside! 2 girls on unicycles- it was great! unfortunately the adventuredome (indoor amusement park) was closed when we were there. the hotel is like an adult arcade with carnival games- pretty cool. it's definitely an older hotel and casino and smells like old ladies and cigarettes badly but I appreciated the experience!

Comparing Circus Circus to the newer places on the strip is a non starter. Newer=nicer=more amenities ergo, more expensive. Is the lobby and casino dated? Yup. The shops a bit few and lacking extravagance? Yup. BUT....was the room clean? Definitely. No bedbugs? Correct! Stink of 40 years of smoke and vomit? Not at all! No smell of any kind except on the casino floor. At 25 bucks a night, I was quite happy and slept well. If you want a resort with snobby, debt laden people, go elsewhere. Want a place to put your stuff, sleep, bathe, and rest? A base of operations? Circus Circus is good enough! And cheap.

Well, it's circus circus. Its where you stay if you want to visit vegas but you're on an extremely tight budget. I think the best thing about staying at circus circus is that you're right next to slots-of-fun where you can get h-a-m-m-e-r-e-d for like $15. You're going to need that alcohol if you plan on walking anywhere else on the strip. The tables in the casino are fairly cheap and you can find blackjack pretty easily at $5. The rooms were much cleaner than last time I stayed, and they're no longer disgustingly pink and purple, which is always a plus.

Clerks are rude! Hotel is dirty, dingy and 30 years out of date.  Buffet is no better than dog food and they charge a $14.50 resort fee for each day of your stay but they dont tell upfront.  Dont stay in the manor rooms. They are unsafe! People hanging out all hours of the night. Security is needed during the evening. This hotel is not for children!

Stayed over MLK weekend and hotel was full.   Glass under desk that was not cleaned after calling and telling cleaning crew.   Wi-Fi was down and tech brought me in to other rooms with other patrons personal belongings (and left me in one room while he knocked on other doors).
They gave me a 2 for 1 buffet ticket for the trouble... Whoopie!
One star since they were at peak capacity.

I will never stay here again.  I booked because of low rate.   I had my vegas trip split in 2 because i went to grand canyon in middle of trip.  My first 2 days spent at circus and my last 4 days were supposed to be at circus but i canceled circus and switched to golden coast.  Golden farther from strip but has shuttle. Waited 45 minutes to check in at circus, dirty room, long walk to get from room to outside hotel.

I am not giving this a 5 star review, because this is a 5 star resort. I give it 5 stars based on the VALUE. A lot of reviews are hilarious people who paid a third or a fourth of what a mid strip Hotel would have costed them, and are upset they didn't get the same experience. They advertise themselves as a BUDGET RESORT 

Yes, the hotel is older, it is not very fancy, I stayed in the Casino Tower. It was nice, yes the dcor was older, but staying monday-thursday, I paid about $53\/ AFTER resort fee. Since the room was clean, had a bed, and a shower. Thats all I could ask for. Since I just used the room to sleep and shower. Before staying here I looked into places like Flamingo, Harrahs, the Linq and the next cheapest room, per night, was $60 BEFORE resort fee.

To people complain about the Manor, I laugh so much at you. You paid next to nothing, and expect it to be a luxurious stay?! Stop being cheap, and cough up a few more bucks and stay in the main hotel somewhere.  All I'll say is, since the sky rise tower is closest to the theme park, that is most likely to have the most kids in it.

The casino had fun dealers, and a more laid back atmosphere, if it's to "low class" for you, take the bus that stops right outside, on the Boulevard, and take your high and mighty ass down to mid strip, since your too high-class for Circus Circus, but not high class enough to pay to stay, at the places you want to be.

The only reason why I stayed at this place was because I booked last minute on a busy weekend and didn't feel like forking out an arm and a leg just to sleep. 

If you have the money and prefer the better experience, don't stay here. If it doesn't really matter to you and you won't be spending much time in the bedroom anyways then stay here for cheap. 

The rooms were okay, The fridge didn't work.. The windows were broken and the frame was coming off the "glass." But like I said, I didn't spend much time here anyways. 

It's quite far from the main strip. I walked one day and knew that I wasn't going to be walking again.

Went on a road trip and spontaneously decided to go to Vegas. Looked online for a family hotel and chose Circus circus! Great place to stay at if you have kids. The circus shows were interesting and entertaining. The arcade and games were pretty cheap. The hotel itself was decent although the shower kept on getting clogged haha. The adventure some was perfect for my nieces. They enjoyed the rides. Tons of gift shops and food places. Super close to the Strop! Walkable to other places!

This was the first time my wife and I went to Vegas. First mistake was staying at Circus Circus Hotel. This place needs to be torn down and rebuilt again. Is a dump. The first room we got the A\/C did not work. The second room they offer us we waited 45 minutes before security came to open the door. The room was worst than the first. They never came to clean the room we had to call the front desk deal with the attitude of the employees to get clean towels. Never again I prefer to sleep in my car than that dump-ghetto of hotel. All my friends back home told me the same " i could of told you that" Is a dump. Well lesson learn and money waste.

I will never stay here ever again and here's why. Our room smelled like rotten feet. The toilet didn't flush and there was a huge cheese log in there that was so lumpy it looked as if it was flexing its muscles. We complained about these problems to no avail. I'll still bring the kids to the fun dome but like I said never will I stay here again.

DO NOT BOTHER STAYING HERE (or even visiting really...) The person we checked in with was uninterested and borderline rude, mumbled and talked barely loud enough (my sister had to repeat everything to me as I actually could not hear her properly). 
The room itself was average, although the walls are paper thin! Everything about the place screams out the need for updating. The shower was good and the room cleaners were nice. The halls though had wallpaper peeling away and what looked like mould or stains from aircon vets
Also, the McDonald's staff inside were awful! Rude, leaning all over the counter while taking orders as though they were bored, and bitching about other staff members openly in front of customers! 
All in all, I Would definitely NOT recommend this place as somewhere to stay.

Been coming to circus circus since I was a kid. My family has our annual family reunion at Circus and have never been disappointed. It has everything you need all within the hotel\/ casino. We love the roulette tables, the steak house, and the Vince Neil Tatuado.  The dealers at the roulette tables are always friendly and outgoing, especially Mike. If anyone ever has him as a dealer be sure to have some laughs. Always a great time there and can't wait to go be back for the next reunion.

While I just got woke up at 1:30  in the morning in the hotel, I might just do this.
This is the worst hotel, my guess is u probably can't find any worse in Vegas.
It's not my first time in Vegas, but it is my first time in circus circus. So I'm guessing ppl who work here are all clowns ?
We got put into a place that's nowhere near a "tower" , called manor tower which is more like a no star motel. We found out later that for $5 more, we could be in a better "tower", which was never offered when we checked in.
I tried to be positive and just thought, OK, this is my get away time with my family, just settle in. 
Not to mention it creepy and gettho. At 1:30 am in the morning, the hammering started next door and lasted half hour or so.... this is a joke ? Who does maintainance at this hour ? And the wall is like paper thin....
So yeah, this wud probably be the last time I stay here....

We stayed at Circus Circus August 8-11.for the first time .and it will be the last ...bathroom clogged twice smelled like mold, I think it was the shower curtain, and on top of that a roach on the wall.....it's sad that this is a kid friendly hotel.....please do a research before booking a room...

We enjoyed our stay here enough. Sure, this isn't the most modern spot you can stay at on the strip, but it is cheap. Our room was clean and our service was friendly. Did have to wait in a line for 40 minutes to check in but, meh, I can deal with that. Free wifi was given and we enjoyed a few of the restaurants located inside the hotel. Would have appreciated having a mini-fridge in our room but again, you get what you pay for. All in all, we would stay here again (our room was located in the Skyrise Tower).

This was the worst hotel experience ever. We stayed on one of the side units and the bathroom was dirty when we got there (with hair on the toilet seat), there were huge stains on the carpet and the sheets were too small for the bed. Our key things didn't ever work, so we had to call and it took forever to get someone to come. The customer service was horrible. For the price, this was the worst option. Would rather pay $200 more than stay here again.

My boyfriend and I visited Vegas for the first time last week and chose to stay at this hotel due to how reasonably priced it was. We arrived around 10 am and gave our bags to the bell desk. The women who took our bags was extremely rude mumbling "tip tip" numerous times to myself and my boyfriend. She continued to roll her eyes at us as we were getting our stuff together then proceeded to argue with my boyfriend when he asked to put something in his bag. We walked away from that situation frustrated because it was our very first impression of this hotel.
When we were able to check in, we stayed at the manor which was separate from the hotel. The man who brought our bags to the room was extremely nice and very welcoming.
Room was nice for the price we payed! Couldn't complain about the room itself.
As we went to check out we had to leave our bags again with the bell desk. There were two older women sitting behind the desk as a man around 21-25 was running around while they sat there chit chatting. He was very warm and welcoming. As I had my tip in my hand to give the gentleman, the two ladies shared a tip they must of received earlier. Then proceeded to discuss how people need to learn how to tip better and "what is this $2 gonna do for me?? They might as well keep it" I was honestly blown away at how ignorant these ladies were. 

Overall the stay and the room were nice but the bell desk employees need improvement. Most likely won't return to this hotel due to how rude the ladies were at the bell desk.

This is my favorite Hotel Casino in Vegas.
Clean rooms, great staff, they help you out with any and all needs.
Great casino, and lots of other fun stuff going on as well.
Great prices as well.

its not that hard, I just stayed this weekend 7-14 to 7\/17 and it was Good, all these horrific reviews are all for the MANOR part of the hotel, dont be cheap book tower rooms or casino tower rooms its only like $15 more, we stayed in the West tower and got upgraded to a suite for 10$ extra a night such a steal, besides that the hotel is OLD but still good, better for families, but i repeat DO NOT BOOK THE MANOR and expect to stay at a Class Room, i give it 8\/10

Horrible and disgusting! PEOPLE there are just plain gross. Starting with the rude staff. We booked one night there and they ended up saying I had a 3 day stay. So if I checked out in one day my room was going to be 259, When in reality it was 49. We ended up staying there because our bags were there and people were so grumpy and always give you attitude. Our first room was hot and our shower was always flooded when you took a 5 min shower. They ended up taking our resort fees off but still, she didn't seem so happy about doing so. The deli there is beyond gross! We asked for a turkey and cheese sandwich toasted.. we got a black turkey.. BLACK. How?? It DIDNT even say it was smoked or anything, God that smelled so awful and the chips were stale. Every person there is miserable. Would not recommend ever.

Mine and my husband's first and last trip to Vegas was somewhat spoiled by our stay at Circus Circus. We are moving across the country in July and had never been to Vegas so we took a spur of the moment trip to experience the bright lights and magic of the city before we leave. We booked a room at the Circus Circus online, and at $130 we thought we were getting a good deal. Upon check in we realized we were very wrong. They tacked on a $30 "resort fee" so after taxes it ended up being almost $180. I'm not sure what exactly that fee is for, seeing as the water slide, splash park and pool were closed. Our room was over in the Manor, which was about a quarter mile from the check in desk. We went through the building to get there, but the escalators were broken so we had to take the stairs. When we finally got to the room we were appalled. It was dingy and gross. There was mildew on the ceiling in the bathroom, mold around the shower and on the walls, and thick dust on top of the armoire. A previous guest had even written the date they had stayed in it, 12\/28\/16, 5 months before we stayed there! The tv was an ancient box tv, and there was no microwave, fridge, or coffee pot. Mattresses are supposed to be changed frequently in hotels and the one we had was manufactured in 2007 and had holes in it! This hotel doesn't deserve to be called a hotel, rather it should be listed as a dive motel that shouldn't charge more than $30\/night. Total rip off, and such a disappointment to what should have been a fond memory and pleasant experience. Don't waste your money here! Spend a few bucks more and spring for a better quality hotel or resort!

I really don't get the bad rap this hotel is getting.  I was very heistant to stay here because of all the bad reviews but my wife said we should check it out for the kids.  To say the least we had a great time.  I spent $80 on a room for two nights, including a $20 food voucher, a coupon for $45 in chips for $30 and numerous other coupons.  We spent around $85 total on an all day passes for the adventuredome  for 4 people and we loved it.  The hotel was extremely crowded but it did not smell like smoke and in fact my wife and I agreed the hotel seemed as clean as any other hotel we stayed at in Vegas.  I was up at 4am walking around jetlagged and I could not believe the cleaning that was taking place.  Guys on their hands and knees scrubbing the lobby carpet and one guy cleaning every stair on the escalator, one by one.  Our room was extremely clean and newly remodeled and the bed was very comfortable. Some of the hallway carpets were a little worn and the gym is sub-par, but my take is that for $40 per night it does not get much better and easily 5 stars at this price point.  My kids are already asking if we can go back.

Circus Circus is one of those places that will never change. Of course the games are more modern but the overall atmosphere is still the same. I've been going to Circus Circus ever since I was a little kid. The one thing I did notice about Circus Circus is they have removed quite a few slot machines. It's not as crowded as it used to be. Circus Circus is a place that I will always go back to and I would definitely recommend it to others, especially those with kids.

My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights. We needed an inexpensive room for the weekend. Checking in was easy, staff was quick and courteous. We were told we would be staying at the Manor. The benefit to staying there was our car was close for us to use. However, you are not attached to the casino. The room was older as was the furniture. The king size bed was very new and very comfy, as were the pillows. We had a keurig for am coffee (something our friends at a higher end hotel didn't have). 
My huge complaint is that 1 1\/2hours prior to checkout our water was shut off. ( no flushing the potty, hot water to shower, washing your face\/brushing your teeth). Water was returned 10 mins before we left. 
This was not my first time in Vegas but it was the first and last time I will stay here.

Old and rundown, nothing like what I remember. Went in to take a shower to find that the bathroom had not been cleaned before we checked in. There was someone else's soap stuck to the wall. So gross. They offered to refund our upgrade fee and DOWNGRADE our room. Basically we can get our money back for the upgrade since we weren't getting it anyway. They offered that and a "sorry for the inconvenience" after being on hold waiting to get a supervisor. Total joke. The arcade was overcrowded and restrooms were out of order. Most of the games took 4 quarters to play. Total rip off.

I read a ton of reviews on this place after I booked it and they scared me. My husband and I took our first trip to vegas and stayed here. After getting there I decided to make up my own mind. 
The staff: we only encountered one lady at the baggage check that was very rude. Everyone else was very nice and helpful.
The pizza place in there there was one gal that was not quite all there she was rude but I don't think she thought she was. Hmm

The room: Wow lets talk about out dated. NOT dirty out dated. There is a difference between dirty and out dated. It is your run of the mill room nothing more. The smell of marijuana I don't think is that. Every time we walked by a room being cleaned they where using a chemical and I think that is what everyone is talking about. 

There where some very bad smells in the main walk ways. Didn't like that to much.

We have a 2yr old and we are very glad we stayed here cause now we know we can bring him here and he will have a great time and so will we. I would rather have an out dated room at a lower cost so that I can spend more money on my kid. That's really what this is. W will one day take our son here and it will be great.

Stayed there a kid in the 70's and it was fun and bright and clean.  Got married there in the 80's and it was still bright, fun and clean.  Planned to stay there in 2005 but wound up at the Golden Nugget...thank God.... We had a lot of trouble finding the Chapel of the Fountain where we got married.  They had moved it upstairs and it is staffed with a nasty lady who was not amused we wanted to visit.   The casino was filthy, we ate at McDonalds there and it smelled like vomit.   We peaked at a room being cleaned and it was truly ugly.   Was so glad to get back to the Nugget where by the way check in was really quick.
It needs Hotel Impossible to come and rescue it.

I have 2 issues with this resort.  My first complaint is the $14 hidden fees that is charged upon arrival and is not reversed when you leave.  This $14 additional cost should have been included in my Expedia reservation costs.

The other issue is the distance from the room to the parking garage.  It takes several elevators, shuttle, escalator, and a great distance of walking just to get to\/from the parking garage.

This place is dirt cheap, and that's the joke. You get plenty of dirt, cheap. 
Once you've checked in and they've got your money, you are on your own. No customer service whatsoever, the hotel never answers their phones, whether it's for the highly limited and lacking room service, or information requests. Circus Circus advertises free in-room wifi, but it was so slow it was barely functional.  

Every public area looks and smells like a zoo constantly, and the rooms are shabby. Everything looks old and worn out and reeks of cigarette smoke. All carpeted surfaces have a good 3 decades of wear visible, and any non-carpeted surface is sticky from the goo of children. The elevators are constantly breaking down, and the casino is always happy to inconvenience its guests by closing off staircases and corridors (fire hazard?!) when the elevators go AWOL. God help you if you stay in their Skyrise tower, it will take you a minimum of 15 minutes to get from your room to the outside world every time as Circus Circus is a labyrinth.

The food is expensive and mediocre at best, and poses a serious health risk at worst. Do not eat at the buffet unless you are on a bulimia-by-botulism diet. Rock & Rita's is alright, but considers ketchup with cayenne pepper mixed in "barbeque" sauce.

On the plus side, it has a Krispy Kreme on the premises. 


Stay here if you have no standards.

It's a great place for families with young kids. Lots of fun for the kids and of course adults have their thing as well. The hotel is not that great uncomfortably beds and the room service, don't even go there. Very uncomfortable. The only thing is the convenience of it for families.

Front desk was amazing BUT thats where it stops. The worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Very outdated smells like must and fresh paint. Every time I go into the hallway it smells like smoke even though everything is labeled as no smoking. We booked a 1 king room and got 2 queen beds. 1 bed had a bed bug a yellow stain I'm gonna say its piss and a blood stain most disgusting bed ever. If you can afford somewhere else please do it. I will never stay here again.

I give circus NO STARS!!! This was the worst experience I have ever had Las Vegas. 1st I was in vallet parking for 35 min because there was no door men to take my bags to my room. 2nd the room they gave us, the air conditioner was out. Our room was so hot I felt sick! So I complained and yes I got another room but the beds where so worn out that they had sink holes in mattress(who knows how old they were) when we looked under the bed there was broken wood from the box spring and to top it off we went to the pool and out of nowhere the life guard comes out and ask all the people to come out of the pool laughing because someone POOPED in the pool! This has been the WORST EXPERIENCE EVER AT CIRCUS CIRCUS! I don't think I will ever stay here again and I will make sure to tell my family members as well. I use to stay here all the time when I was younger with my family. This place has really gone down...

It'll do in a pinch if you want an epically cheap room. Circus Circus is serviceable, but its once prime location has been marred by the fact that projects meant to go up near it have been abandoned. Now the place stands alone on the North section of The Strip. Still, walking, taxing, or training to the more bustling mid-Strip won't take too long and the rooms are, once again, dirt cheap. You won't find anything resembling luxury, but why not save money you'd spend on a room for the casino and a nice meal?

Speaking of which, Circus Circus has a suprisingly good Steakhouse. Great prices, a large amount of food, and the quality is super high. It might not be as hip as places in newer resorts or have a celebrity chef's name attached to it, but it's a great Steakhouse. Save money on your room and dine like a king at the restaurant.

This place is not worth the price. I heard a lot of great things about this place and was highly disappointed. We were going to book a room here but the prices were way too high for what you are getting. We ended up staying somewhere else but visited Circus Circus for the Adventure Dome. It is overly crowded and disgustingly trashed. The carpets were once red but are almost black now and there's popcorn and trash everywhere on the floor. The rides are outdated and the arcade games are extremely dirty. It's sad to see what has become of this place.

See her before she blows!, ow wait she already does!" 

I went to this hotel because it was the cheapest hotel close enough to the strip at a reasonable price, granted we didn't do alot of investigating before we went here, so that was pretty much our fault. So in the end it boiled down to price and enough available rooms. We checked in after having reserved our room on the drive towards Vegas, upon getting there we were automatically turned off by this hotels overall presence. The parking was confusing and there was no one to guide us through the maze in which we found ourselves driving. Finally we parked in this industrial mall style parking structure and checked in. We were forced t wait as our rooms were being cleaned and 20 mins later we were given our keys and told what elevator to take, apparently our party was split 4 of us were forced into a smoking room (more like smoking floor, it was truly horrific) that was just about soaked in smoke, it was as if the maid had forgot to use air sprays either that or the smoke was so strong the spray didn't even stand a chance. Our other party was on another floor only accessible through its own separate elevator. That alone was a huge inconvenience, we ended up going back and forth several times until we had had enough. We complained and eventually, 1 and a half days into our 3 day weekend, our both party's were placed on the same smoking floor. Apparently non smoking rooms are requested more, as it is a hotel geared more towards those with kids. As if that was not bad enough the view from the room was horrific, all you see is the sad gray roof down below of and the parking garage in the distance. The hallways had missing segments of the ceiling, which showed off the buildings rusting water pipes. Which only deterred us from drinking any of the tap water or from showering in excess. 

As for the amenities, seeing as how I was 20 when I went on this trip I was not allowed to enjoy the gambling experience while in Vegas, therefore I can not really comment on this. However my friends that did end up gambling at the hotel said it was "whatevers", the drinks were alittle on the light side and the games just didn't seem "lucky". On the opposite end of the casino level lies the "The Buffet", now no Vegas hotel would be complete without a Buffet and the Circus Circus is no different however don't go into "The Buffet" expecting a 5 star gourmet dining experience, in fact don't even expect a 2 star dining experience. Overall the food choices were varied from American cuisine to Italian to even Mexican, however the quality was about as great as any "Home Town Buffet" and if you've ever been to one you know what I mean. The food lacked flavor and was designed for a bland American palate, my friends had to cover their food in salsa and salt just to make it worth eating. If you do decide to eat here go during breakfast as it seems to be when they serve their better prepared options. Yet how difficult is it to scramble an egg and heat up some pre-made sausage, not very I'd assume. 

In the end the Circus Circus is a good hotel to see if your traveling with Children. Its also great if you want to see an old classic before the dynamite is called in. However do not fear when that day does come there are still plenty of great hotels I'd suggest for parents, "Mandalay Bay", "Excalibur" or "Treasure Island" all 3 themed hotels offer afew more options then "Circus" and aren't as "aged". As for booking plan in advance and seek out promotional offers on-line (found 3 when I got back home, which could have saved us about 112.00 [each room].....darn!) Also always request non smoking rooms close to each other or gathering your party might end up a daily rusense. The buffets okay in the morning and around brunch time but avoid the dinner menu, its your chance to sample what you missed if you would have stayed at the "Hard Rock" (GREAT FOOD, awesome adult atmosphere). In the end I CAN NOT recommend this decrepit old building. The whole stay felt very depressing and the staff came off unfriendly and uncaring really. Getting an extra 30 mins to leave our room was a HUGE issue, they wanted to charge for an additional day (on both rooms). If your staying here I'd recommend booking someplace else, this hotel is on its way out the door. Ow and its not even THAT close to the strip, about something like 1-2 miles away. Walking from Circus to Mandalay bay was grueling and in the end we were forced to get a taxi.

I'm only rating the midway sections: 

I like going here for the claw machines. It's a dollar each game. It's kind of expensive on certain prizes, but worth it on others. I had problems with certain machine and had to ask for assist. Service was fast compared to how busy it was. One thing I didn't like was how smokey it was for an arcade. I won't want my kids to be in that area for a long period of time. No smoking is allowed in midway, but all the smoke from the bottom casino travels up. They should make the bottom section non smoking to reduce to smoke from traveling to the arcade.

The good;
It's on the strip. It cost $75 for a 2 queen bed room with a view of the strip from the 34th floor. 

The bad;
Nearly 2 hours to check in. There was along line and they had 6 people helping that line but it just takes a while when you do finally get to a person. 
There was a line for the 4 elevators that go to floors 22-35. That's 1000 rooms served by 4 elevators. It took another 30 minutes after check in to get up there only to find the first  room was not cleaned. 2nd time in a week for a dirty room at check in.  Then you wait for the elevator to show up so you can go back down to check in again. 
All of the rides closed at 6pm. 
No shops were open at 8 am. 
The bed was hard. 
The place is old.

Every year my family and I visit Las Vegas to get away and also to visit family. We wanted to do something fun while my parents were gambling to be entertained however it was an experience that makes us never want to go again! I know Vegas is more for the "mature" folks but I mean we want to enjoy ourselves too. 

**This review is mainly for the ARCADE AREA** Everyone working in the games area are roughly 16-20 years old, I understand this may be their first job okay whatever. Anyhow, the machines in the arcade are pretty old so some of them are bound to take a quarter here and there but not every other machine. Come on! I learned after the third time it happened to my sister. The game area is just unorganized. We tried finding someone to help us maybe point out the machines that were working properly but no I did not find anyone on site. 

I saw employees more worried about their social life with their coworkers. They were chatting away on the side. One girl was wearing these glasses with a large bow on the side of them looking very unprofessional. When I asked her for help with the ticket machine she just said "well it should've had a sign that says it didn't work" basically saying she couldn't do anything about what happened to my ticket receipt. Couldn't she just ask how many tickets the receipt was supposed to print? My siblings didn't have a lot of tickets only 107 but my little brother was so excited that it just really pissed me off. 

The gaming area did not look clean. There were bottles and cans along the games and I was just not impressed. I used to come here a lot when I was a kid but now my family and I won't be going back anytime soon. They need a better and more strict sort of management. It's just not the same. We are taking our money elsewhere. For example, the Orleans which is off the strip, is a better casino overall BY FAR! Movie theaters, arcades, bowling, a large buffet. Yea, sorry Circus Circus the only thing I will give you credit for are your pina coladas near the main entrance.  

I forgot to mention the security guards are just rushing you when you are near the gambling area. I know they are supposed to keep clear but I was with both of my parents just waiting for my brother to get out of the bathroom. It's not like I'm going to run to the machine and start playing.

Manor Building is SKETCHY. Big rooms, uncomfortable beds. No attendant in building so if your in need in of service or help be prepared to walk about a block or two to the main casino\/hotel.  Did no see any security as we were parking. Stay at your own risk. Wasn't filthy but could have at least smelt cleaner..

From the Movie Forest Gump I conclude the following along with al the other crappy and negative feedback written about Circus Circus.......

"RUN FORREST RUN"

After trying to get someone on the phone that actually knew around the hotel and was polite was our first challenge.   I finally got someone who raved how ALL THE ROOMS HAD BEEN UPGRADED AND REFRESHING INCLUDING CARPET......WHAT A BIG FAT STINKING (like the room smelled) LIE  !!!!    Welcome to Malborough Country !!!  Nasty

There is nothing more annoying than travelling many many hours and just wanting to check into a clean fresh room and relax for a few......not happening here.   We checked in to a room that had an extra pull out bed right in front of the door with no access to the actual room.....So I moved it and we noticed crumbs, glitter, confetti underneath it....way to go Maid Service.  No big deal but the leaking cielings with moldy water stains, dirty bathroom mirrors....Hmmmm ok I guess...... BUT THE URINE STAINS ON THE TOILET SEAT WAS DIRTY, SMELLY and  DISGUSTING.    We were moved to a new room and floor (one I was told was not available at check in about 45 minutees prior)  which now all of a sudden was available.  This room was a bit better becaue there was no pee stains and less of a smoking smell.

On a scale of 1 to 10, The rest of the trip was a   Minus  -3  in which I am not even going to write about beacuse the dont give a rats furry behind anyway.   Never Ever Again !!!  Yes its kids land because of the rides....My favorite one was while we were walking along the carnival like games....It was the asian ladies (several of them)  that were bored while working becaus there was no customers and they were sitting on the actual front of the midway games while they were texting away or working hard........which one is it?
Cannot get a drink to save your life. Kept asking for my sever who kept walking by us ignoring us.

We came here to play the kiddy games. We had two of the largest prizes you could win, a couple mediums, and several small prizes. Knowing we can not take all of these on the airplane, we approached the office to ask if we could trade all but one of the prizes for a unicorn. After the 150.00 we dropped, the man said "No" citing that the Despicable Me unicorn is hard to get (20.00 at Toys R Us). Mind you, we were trading much larger prizes. Then, he tried to trade all of our prizes in for a medium size crappy unicorn. This place is run down and overpriced. Go somewhere else.

I will rate 1. Hotel, 2. Casino, 3. Kids venue, 4. Overall quality
1. Hotel rooms are okay 3.5 stars. The elevator system gets (1-generous heavy weighted star). We stay here every year and its the same thing every year. When 10:30 to 11 AM rolls around, everybody is trying to get out of the building, however the elevators are so slow that it takes 40-minutes to get down. By the time it gets to your floor they are already full. If you don't have luggage, take the stairs, but if you do, prepare to wait for a ride and stop on every floor.!! THE ELEVATORS SUCK.!!!!!
2. Smokey Casino is okay, nothin special, 3-stars.
3. (2-stars) The smokey mid-way is old and could use a overhaul, but my 5-year old son knows no difference and loves it. The circus acts are entertaining too, this is why we come back every year. Very crowded so get used to bumping into folks. Adventure dome is fun too, but pricy. (Not smokey) The rides seem a little old and a little young for my 5-year old, so we didn't spend much time there this year. (3-stars).
4. Overall, this place is okay (2-stars), very smokey, pricy food, dirty, old; nice upgraded rooms but getting out during checkout time is a challenge because of the  HORRIBLE ELEVATOR  system. Circus Circus gets a well deserved 2-stars mostly because of the smokey venue and horrible elevators.

It was a hot minute ago, but we stayed here (family of five) with other relatives because my wife's niece was getting married, plus we all had small kids, and older to kids to babysit...you get the idea.

   Eating here, good. Just arrive earlier than the rest, you know, the "early bird..." quote.

Rooms were okay. Nothing too special, nothing to bad.

A workout room, about 2 hotel rooms put together with walls kicked out, was nice to see. Went like super early morning, only 3 or 4 of us in there.

  The circus shows; yes. Def not Ringling brothers, as it was mostly acts without animals and air-defying feats. But, very cool! Kids liked it and us adults were impressed.

They have a dome with roller coasters and those rides, which we walked thru but we wanted to spend our $$ on other stuff, so...idk anything about those rides, sorry.

  Like all hotels (I..guess?!) they gave us coupon books for our next visit.  Expired now for sure, but it was a nice thought. It was good here, if you have kids (or love the circus). Not a bad deal.

I got a room on the 25th floor and the hallway smells like mold.  The shower in our room leaks and the shower head is terrible. There is also no comforter or heavier blanket on the beds. I'm over all most disappointed because I expected a circus type theme, but the room just looks like a cheap hotel 8 room. Not worth $200 for a weekend stay.

Me and my husband had a great stay at the circus circus. We arrived on a sat. afternoon and proceed with the check in. I honestly thought it was going to take longer than it did, the whole process took probably like 15-20 min. The gentlemen that took us in was really kind and friendly, he let us know that the package we had gotten (which I was unaware of because I had purchased it trough Groupon) was for us to stay in the hotel structure in front of the circus circus. He offered us a room in the actual casino hotel for $10 extra we agreed and he even gave us the option to be put in a lower or higher floor. When we got to our room I was really surprised the room was a decent size and it really clean so was the bathroom, we had in mind that it was going to smell like cigar but luckily we were placed in the nonsmoking part of the hotel. We had access to free WiFi, pool, discounts at some hotel stores, and parking is free. Overall we had a great experience for it being our first time staying in Las Vegas.       

The only downside I really have is that it is a little further away from the strip. Though there is a bus stop just outside of the main entrance of the casino that takes you to the strip. But I recommend driving and parking at another hotel, we did that on our last day and parking actually came out cheaper than the bus fare.

Don't go to vegas on a whim with your kids if you are a frugal person. I've been to Las Vegas many times before but never with my kids and never stayed at circus circus. This was the only hotel that had rooms available on a saturday night that was on the strip that seemed "family friendly" for under $250.00. I was told at the front desk that all the rooms were nice and I overheard someone else say that rooms had been remodeled. Must not have been mine. I stayed at the sky tower for about $130.00 and the room looked like it had been the same since late 80's early 90's. My sheets had holes in them, the decor was dreadful, and the whole way to the room looked dingy and old. Lesson learned, don't stay at this hotel, and don't bring the kids. They where underwhelmed by the adventure dome and wished I had just taken them to six flags or knotts.
I don't know what the hype is about. I have had better steak in Las vegas.three stars because the steak is average .customer service deserves a five stars. That is what will bring me back.

Very comfortable and hospitipal environment at all times, was our experience. No, it's not perfect. But neither is getting bent over for Ten X'S the cost else where for not much better accommodations at so called high-end luxury resorts. It's all about perceptions in LV. No smoke and mirrors here! Just great bang for the buck! Nice. Simple. Easy. Casual. Relaxed. Unobtrusive. No pressure. Family friendly. Comfortable. Very underrated dining and entertainment options. Secure and safe environment. Best thrill ride-El Loco roller coaster-in all of LV!Easily less than 1.00 a ride with wristband and ride warrior commitment! LOL! Personally rode it 30 times in a row, no problem, on a Wednesday. Seriously-what's not to like at Circus Circus? Room 28703 in Skytower provides kick-ass view of North LV! We will absolutely be glad to be back to Circus Circus!

It's as if Jerry Springer decided to open a casino in Vegas and hired all his guests as employees.

If you enjoy white trash AMURRICA by all means stay here. 

If you enjoy tons of screaming kids in a casino by all means gamble here.

If you enjoy being up on the seedy part of The Strip by all means stay here.

If you enjoy cheesy-bad circus acts and evil clowns by all means drop in here.

If you like filth then by all means come here but make sure you have your shots.

I walked around for a bit and quickly left feeling the need to shower with scalding hot water. 

This place even has a parking area specifically for RV's. Nuff said!

Again this seems to be one of our favorite spots! We took my mom here and she loved it. 
The drink ladies seem to come by quicker than most other casinos. They make the best Pina Colada! We did the rides again and take the group photo and had so much fun. This is like an amusement center\/casino and bar all in one! Wait a second, this is exactly what it is!

We always drink and play by the West Bar section. Seems less crowded. This is still our place to buy souvenirs. Some of the best deals on the strip. A great place to people watch too. 
We'll see you guys soon!

Kids kids kids everywhere! The game room area with carnival games was fun. Some of the things were dated and needed maintenance, which was a bummer. The staff seemed to hate their jobs, which kind of dampens the mood. The casino isn't as nice as other hotels. Overall, if you are with kids and want a cheap location, this is your place!

Okay, I really hate giving bad reviews but I cannot help this one. I purchased two nights at Circus Circus through Vegas deals and was highly disappointed. We asked for a nonsmoking, which is what they said we got, and the room stunk of smoke. Not only that but there were burn holes in the comforters on the beds. The ad also showed flat screen TV's... they were not. To top it all off, during our second night there I had to kill a coach roach in my own room!! Not cool Circus Circus, not cool!! I give them two stars for the price and that is all. Not going back. Do not recommend.

Stayed in the casino tower with my boyfriend for 4 days.... honestly better than I expected, however I believe we had the most expensive room you can get (still didn't have a microwave, fridge or coffeemaker though.) Room was clean and the concierge asked us what floor we wanted to stay in, which was cool. The whole hotel, however, REEKS OF CIGARETTES. This is coming from someone who smokes cigarettes. I couldn't even stand it. I get it, you can smoke in the casinos, but I went to every single casino on the strip and none of them smelled as strongly. Also: kids everywhere. Literally everywhere. The area is pretty shady. The pools are super old. I don't understand what my "resort fee" goes towards because this place is really run down and honestly kind of frightening at night. Only giving 4 stars because we met some cool people here, and we were hot on the same blackjack table for 5 hours and our dealer, Cesar, was awesome!! If not for my man Cesar, I'd give it 2 stars. Pay $30 more somewhere else, trust me.
Best place in Vegas for Kids! Adventure Dome is awesome. Just $30 for all day pass & unlimited rides & laser tag! If you have kids this is the place for them!

We took our kid to see the entertainment and games at Adventure Dome. It was fun and entertaining for her which is exactly what you want. 

We came back again without child to gamble because they have coin slot machines which are RARE! We played table games and it was super crowded since it was Friday night. We were gambling over an hour at the table games and waitress came around 3 times. At the Slot a Fun area we were there gambling for an hour and not one waitress came around offering drinks. I would probably stop by again on my next Vegas trip for the coin slots.

They have beer pong tables, pool tables and few bowling lanes. If you want classy, don't come here. If you are laid back and super casual, then this may be the place for you.

Requested a quiet room, was giving room on 4th floor over loading dock. Giving a room on 12th floor. Middle of the night room was 85 degrees, 2nd night room changed to 55 degrees. Now at home sick from room not staying same temp.

Worst hotel I stayed in years! The non-smoking room stinks with strong nicotine vapor, the carpet is so dirty, and the quality of people staying there is poor! We stayed there cos we have a nine year old, but the adventure dome was not as fun as we thought. We would be better off just going to Boomers.

If the Sahara is the armpit of The Strip, then Circus Circus must be its unwashed buttcrack.  The front entrance starts things off by looking tired and depressing.  And it didn't help that as we walked up we got to pass by a gang of 15 or so thuggish adolescents crowded around, just looking sketchy.

The inside is dingy and dark and just looks downright dated.  Yes, there are $1 blackjack tables here... but there are also slot machines in Vegas that take nickels, $5 buffets that serve "shrimp" and cans of paint you can open and sniff to get high.  Are any of them really worth doing?

Shortly thereafter we ventured up to the circus \/ midway area, a crowded, noisy, child-infested trap whose only purpose can be to shatter eardrums and spike your blood pressure.  Usually I'm a sucker for childhood nostalgia but this made me remember all of the bad things, including a flashback which included a creepy uncle that I never even had!

To top it all off, we encountered two cabbies at the "cab stand" (actually just a line of cabs out into the parking lot) who were the two biggest a-hole cabbies in we had in Vegas, and that's really saying something.

It's like this entire casino is a giant magnet for things that suck.

First let me say I read the yelp reviews and thought No Way it could be that bad.  IT WAS!!!!!!!!!!!
This was my boyfriend and I's 4th trip to vegas in the last 2 yrs and we always stay on the strip further up in nicer hotels.  We teased and said we were going to "slum" it this time. WOW we were teasing before we got there.  When we arrived I thought I would cry, because our joke came true and so did the Yelp reviews.

1.) The check in line and check in area looked like a refugee camp.  The line was about a 100 people long on a Tuesday night about 10pm.   People laying on the floor asleep, laying on couches and sitting every where waiting for the check in.  We checked our luggage with the bell boy and we left and came back at 1am and it was still about 60 people long.  My boyfriend say NO WAY and went to talk to someone,  next thing I know we were checked in and in a Suite.  I felt so dirty at this point even though we got very lucky and got upgraded and checked in ahead of all the other refugee's.

2.) The Suite was okay.  I was thankful because I was sure the rooms sucked if the suite was just ok. The tv was small and staticy.  The maid could not remember to leave wash rags and we were there a week!!!!

There is nothing at all I can say nice about this place.  I am sure it was something back in the day but no way I will ever stay there again!!!!!!  Nor do I recommend it to anyone!!  People kept asking us where we were staying and we lied it was that bad.

I stayed there 2 nights Friday and Saturday night March 2nd and 3rd 2012. We chose the circus circus because this was the only place that was kid friendly as we were meeting a family member there that wanted to visit with the kids too. (otherwise we would not have brought our kids to Vegas period) 
  Friday night we were approached by the same black man trying to sell us weed right in front of our kids next to the elevator in the skyrise tower twice in one night. Then Saturday i had gone downstairs to smoke as I always get a non smoking room. (i know I'm a smoker but cant sleep in a smoke filled room weird I know) Anyway, I sat down at a slot machine next to the elevators and was going to play a few minutes why I smoked. Next thing I know I am being grabbed from behind, my arm was pulled out of socket by some crazy old lady that was yelling... I was sitting there thats my machine...  I get her off of me finally and she came back punching me. WTF??? I was simply minding my own business... Thank Goodness there were a few witnesses... cause that old lady told the police I hit her... and I never touched her even after she started punching me because of her age. 
 Then come to find out... the circus circus's policy is that in any incident, that they kick both parties out, regardless of who started it??? Even if your the one being attacked for no reason... even if they have it and see it all on video (which they did capture it all on video in my case) unless the Las Vegas Police sign some form stating your the victim (which luckily for me that is what happened) Still though that is craziness that someone can get attacked in their hotel and there is NO justice. You can be kicked out too??? What kinda crap is that??? That wasted about 3 hours of our carefully planned day....
 They did kick that old lady out along with her entire family. They escorted them completely off the property...  and on Sunday low and behold they had security posted in there where they should have been all along!!! Especially on a Weekend and Especially being it was the beginning of college spring break?? 
 I agree with the other reviews that the food had no flavor the blue Iguana mexican place had no flavor whatsoever....  The food looked nothing like the pictures... (we had the ultimate grande burrito) it was a dollar more for rice, for beans and for sour cream...  3 extra dollars and then it was 3 bucks for each drink as well... They only sold one size!  We didn't even bother after that to try their buffet as we had read these reviews before we left.. 
 The room in the Skyrise tower was alright but everyone was right about the outdated TV.  The beds were comfy and loved the pillow... Loved the pillow so much in fact I ordered one off amazon.  The bathroom was alright too until we realized the things in the shower were not ours (we all assumed they were each others things eww) and were left by the guest before us,,, they were still in the bathroom when we left as well.  we had 2 rooms adjoined and only one key out of 5 total keys worked... they mixed the keys up too... we were supposed to have 3 keys, my family members was supposed to have 2 keys and their key worked only on our room... (Thank Goodness we had the ajoined doors left open to each others rooms) The slot on her door was completely broken.. It did not even light up at all... Our keys all had to be re-keyed. After spending forever in a long line to get that done. Ugg (forget it we sucked it up and used the one key... until after the incident when security took me straight to the front of the line to get it done)
 We also signed up for and received players cards when we got to the circus circus and mine quit working, so I went to get a new one... everything was supposed too and should have been transferred over to the new card but... I lost all of my points... 
 The kids 14 and 8 had a blast at the Adventure Dome and at the Midway carnival games. The circus acts were much better then we expected! Those were actually spectacular and a joy to see!! The kids loved it!!! 
 The roulette table on the other hand had an admittedly strung out on crack guy at the table... He was clearly messed up and kept saying loudly how he needs to stop doing so much crack? 
 Rockin Ritas was full of hookers... They were bragging about being hookers and the bar tender seemed to know they were hookers too... 
 It is so sad that the Circus Circus is turning into a drug and prostitution hub for Las Vegas!
So all in all we had a good time and bad time all in one trip... It kinda evened itself out with the good and bad... Circus circus not great but just Okay. We also stayed  2 nights at the Flamingo and 2 nights at the Cosmopolitan... So the circus circus was defiantly a downgrade but was perfect for the kids!!!

I stayed at Circus Circus in February of 2012 with my husband. The price for the room was very very inexpensive, which is why we chose it. The rooms have been recently renovated and we found them to be very nice. There was a long line at check in and it took at least 30 minutes to get up to the desk. The casino is pretty sad looking, smoky and run down. We didn't spend much time there, so that didn't both us too much. We were there for a convention in another hotel. If you want a nice room, at a cheap price and you don't care about the other parts of the hotel\/casino, then I recommend it.

Located on The Las Vegas Strip, this was one of the first family friendly resorts. It has n amusement park inside!  But most importantly it was used in the James Bond Film Diamonds Are Forever. The interior has changed quite a bit, however if you look carefully you can see where the film was shot. The property itself is a bit rundown, but the room prices reflect that, so you you will get a great deal. It wouldn't be my first pick but check it out for the James Bond connection! Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I been coming to circus circus since I can remember, I'm older now and now come for the price of the hotel and know my way around the casino with my eyes closed. Circus circus is awesome. The restaurants are awesome. Bang for your buck this is the place to go

Plain and simply, with a million places in Vegas to go eat, gamble, party, and rest your drunk little head, Circus Circus doesn't even make it onto the radar. I was staying next door at the Hilton where they don't have a casino, so I walked over here one night and it was simply depressing. I felt like I walked into the 70s as well as an ash tray. Just stay away.

I've been to Vegas dozens of times and had never stepped foot into Circus Circus.  For one reason mostly, the resort is marketed to familes that travel to Vegas, so what business does a twenty-three year old have at Circus Circus? Well, I needed a room for one night and I got on hotels.com and the rate was only $24 so I pulled the trigger.  Upon arriving, the interior was nicer than I expected and check-in went by fast even with a long line.

The young lady checked me in and explained how to get to my room, which looked like quite a journey. I eventually made it to my room and bypassed the kids area, restaurants, and bars. I entered my key card and was surprised at how nice a room $25 could buy. Sure, this isn't the Wynn or Bellagio, but nevertheless, I was impressed. I only stayed for the night and was unable to thorougly explore the property. My only complaint is the casino is difficult to navigate and needs more maps and signs. Regardless, if your on a budget and need a quick room, Circus Circus can stretch your dollar.

awww c'mon guys. what would vegas be like without circus circus and the cheesy carnival games in the midway section? how would we derive joy and up our self esteems through our ability to win, somewhere, somehow? i mean, who cares that you paid $2 to lose at the clearly rigged fishing game. at least you got a 3 inch stuffed santa doll out of it. holla.

I'll be first in line to watch this dump get imploded. 

Where to start? Reserved a room with 2 queen beds 2 months in advanced and they gave us one with 1 king bed when we arrived. They didn't even notify us at the check in that they messed up (which by the way the check in line had over a 100 people in line at 1:30am) The room had mold every where and we found a cockroach in the bathroom. We didn't care too much at that point because we just wanted to use the room to crash. 

It's very poorly laid out, you'll find yourself doing way too much walking in there, you're far away from every other casino so a cab ride is needed each time you want to leave. It took us 10-15 minutes to get from the room to get outside to the strip. Then its another 20 minute walk to Encore and Wynn. 

A dealer at a blackjack table asked us how our stay was going and we told her it was alright and that we had a cockroach in our room. She told us we should get a new room and a discount so she brought the manager over as we were playing and he set us up in the Skyline tower with 2 queen beds like we had originally reserved and 40% off. So for that Circus Circus gets an extra star. Otherwise it's a 1\/5, Excalibur is the same price and much better.

Great for kids. If you do not have kids dont go. There is no real reason too. The manor rooms suck and are far. The pools is ok. The tower rooms are much better. I would expect worse from the tower rooms, but they actually are decent. The casino is fun. Beer is ok for the strip. Buffet is horrible. Id only come here if you are on a budget and have kids.

We love it here. The rooms are clean, quiet, and the service is great. We have stayed here 5 times and stayed in the Skyrise, West, Casino Towers. The West Tower is my favorite but I am happy in all three. Why spend hundreds of dollars more to stay in hotels whose rooms are the same quality or worst. Several of the other hotels on strip have thin walls where you hear everything going on on the hallways. With this hotel you can get a good nights sleep. Yes it's far from some of the other hotels on the strip, but we drive in from CA and just drive the back roads to one of the other hotels' parking garages. 

 I honestly don't understand all the people on here giving this place bad reviews. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels in Vegas and they more noisy then Circus Circus. If you want to pay several  hundreds more during your stay then I recommend the Mirage, otherwise if you would like to save your money to spend on shopping, gambling or nightlife then this is a great place to stay.

The 4 stars that I'm giving this hotel have a lot to do with pricing and location. When I stayed multiple times last fall, the total came out to be around $40 or so on weekdays, after the resort fee (about $16, if I remember correctly). This doesn't mean that you'll end up getting this price. 
Anyways, it seems like one of the only kid friendly hotels in Las Vegas. I don't have any, so I don't need that but it sure reminded me of the restaurant Circus Circus which I went to a few times as a kid. 
It's likely that you'll hear your neighbors at night, at least this is what I experienced when I stayed in the manor buildings. You would probably experience this in the tower buildings as well, but I only stayed there once and I didn't. I'm not sure if the walls would be less thin in those, probably not. 

I recorded a very short video on my stay, it's only like 15 seconds. 
https:\/\/instagram.com\/p\/uYtcRvIa1n\/

Avoid this place, avoid the kids, avoiding the terrible gaming, avoid the smell, avoid the vomit soaked carpets, avoid the terrible food.

The only ONLY ONLYYYYYYYYYYYYYY good thing about this place.  The Steakhouse in the middle.  I wish it could be teleported to a hotel that didn't suck.  

Even then, it gets one star.

Hunter Thompson must have been totally blitzed to come and stay here for an hour or two.  I couldn't make it ten minutes each time I come.

if you go in knowing what you're about to get into - its not that bad...
1. don't stay here if you don't have kids! don't stay here if you're on college spring break - you're going to pay a fortune taxing down the strip to the hotels you should've stayed at.
2. get the $25.99 All day All you can eat buffet - its not advertised, you have to ask for it. for 2 adults and 2 kids who eat free - its well worth it. the breakfast was awesome, lunch and dinner was so-so. stick to salads and prime rib and you won't be disappointed. the desserts were awesome! we kept going back during the day just for some sweet treats!
3. stayed in the casino tower - so that we could go back and forth from midway to take a nap! 
4. check in was FAST! we came on a monday at 3pm and waited in line for 10 mins, no lie - it was FAST!! they made a mistake in our reservation and booked us a West Tower King - but i showed them my Expedia itinerary for the Casino double queen - and it was fixed right away. 
5.everyone was so nice - i don't know about the other reviewers who had such a bad experience - if you don't expect the Bellagio, then its really a good stay. for $36\/night - you can't beat it!
6. my only complaint was that it was incredibly smokey. with my 3 year old's allergies, his eyes were puffy, watery, and he got a runny nose. i didn't think it was a valid complaint until we went to Caesar's and noticed that there wasn't any smokey smell in the air! Circus definitely needs to work on their ventilation.
7. all in all - it was a great vacation. breakfast buffet - pool - lunch buffet - midway games - dinner buffet - adventure dome - and finally sleep!!!!! we didn't have to leave the hotel at all (except to go to Caesar's Serendipity for some ice cream!).  its great for families on a budget!

The fire alarm was going off at 2 am.  I went down to the front desk to ask what was going on.  Not only did the front desk supervisor not realize that the fire alarm was going off, but she threatened to have us removed by security once I told her I thought it was ridiculous that she didn't know fire alarms were going off.  In light of the recent massacre in Las Vegas this could have been a ploy to get people out of the room to commit mass murder.  I am absolutely appalled at her unprofessionalism and incompetence.

Kinda crappy but i would stay again on a budget. Their is a weird place in my hard for circus circus, it bad but not unsanitary. 

First, the people that do the check in are the most miserable humans in the planet. Did some one tell them to go as slow as possible? Seriously, it should take you no longer then 2-3 minutes to check me in.

The place is musty with smoke, i mean w\/e i don't care that much but some people do. Their is a stale taste in the air. 

The place as a whole is kinda cool, the look of it, the indoor activities like rick wall and extreme rides like you would find on the boardwalk.

The rooms, poor without being dirty. They are boring yes. Do i feel like I'm in the 70's yes. But they are clean so i cant complain too much. 

The steak house inside is good but expensive. Avoid the buffet for sure (much better options in Vegas for same price)

If you are going there because you have too and your on a budget don't fret. But their are much better options if your going to do Vegas do it right!
Not the greatest hotel, but best for children.  Fright Dome was overrun by teenie-boppers.  They need an adult night.

For what we paid, this hotel was worth it. The room is spacious, the bathroom is gigantic, but its worth noting we stayed in the Sky tower floor 3, ive heard less then positive reviews for the "Manor"

The casino smells heavily like smoke, its embedded into the carpets at this point but thats the nature of the beast i guess. 

The only thing that defers us from staying here again, is that its a bit further down the strip than we'd like to be.

Circus circus has comfortable beds, a good shower head, clean and simple furnishings and Wi-Fi that works well. There is no fridge or microwave in my tower room but there is an iron and board to keep your clothes sharp. For the price I don't think it can be beat. My view alone is awesome from the 27th floor. I personally have nothing to complain about here.
Pool is always busy and they wnna charge you to sit on there cheap a** chairs. $20 to sit pool view like they have nice pool. Ridiculous!!!!

Kids everywhere, outdated. There were only 2 women checking in a massive line of people, and then the manager (not sure if that's his position) says that if we check in before 2pm we have to pay an additional $35- I stayed here to save some extra cash and was going to stay at a nicer hotel. Drove all the way from la for a convention show. NOT HAPPY. Do not stay here.

Rooms smelled old and like weed. The ONLY PLUS was the sheets, they were nice.

I went to Circus Circus thinking it was clean and nice just like most of the Las Vegas hotels. Wrong Idea. The Rooms we dirty and messy and there was a big wet spot on the rug of are room. They gave me and my family the view of air vents and the bathrooms had rust everywhere and you could tell they haven't been cleaned right. After 2 days in the rooms we had to switch to a more expensive room in Circus Circus. The pool was disgusting and EXTREMELY SALTY.  The ONLY thing good here is the adventure dome. Definitely won't be coming back. NEEDS MAJOR RENOVATIONS

I love having to purchase my own extension cords when outlets don't work.

The scenic view of exterior pipes is utterly breathtaking.

I hate being treated well so I felt right at home.

Thanks for not providing a small fridge, microwave, or coffee maker as I love paying over $3 for a medium coffee and not being able to save this place's below average food.

My favorite feature of CC is still being charged an entire week when we decided to head home to finally relax.

Highly recommended to anyone who finds camping to be luxurious.

I haven't been here in quite some time. I remember as a kid we used to always come here Circus Circus and visit the Midway and Adventure Dome. This review is pretty much for the Midway, which was the reason to come to the hotel. For the hotel in general, I see that the buffet and some eating establishments have changed. They've added an Auntie Anne's Pretzel and Krispy Kreme, while the pizza place stays. Can't say much for the rest.

As for the Midway, it's pretty much the same since I was a kid; over 15 years ago. In my opinion, they need to change the games up. Maybe once in a decade or so often wouldn't hurt. The 'claw' in the claw machines are still loose, so it won't grab the prizes. Sad to say I spent $25 and didn't win any prizes. On the brighter side, they still had the McDonalds there which is always packed by the way. We stopped and had some refreshments before leaving. Unless they change the games up, it doesn't look like I'll be back; at least anytime in the next decade. Thanks for the couple hours to pass the time though.

Next time I come, I would like to visit the Adventure Dome and see how the place is. I'm not for the rides, but the atmosphere is for the older kids in my opinion. Maybe they'll have changed some things up when I visit.

Our family stayed at the Circus Circus for 3 days in July. I would not recommend you stay their. The furniture is really old, rooms smell and the parking lot by the pool was scary at night. We stayed their so our kids (4 and 8) would have a good time, ghetto side of the strip (dark with out of business hotels). We spent more time at another hotel, the Hilton. My sister was staying their: nice new rooms, cable tv, pool with shade, gym, close to the monte rail. We will be staying at the Hilton in our next visit.
Warning: They might put you in the Manor motel rooms, which is worse than pitching your tent at the KOA campground next door.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would. I am in tears as I write this. I've never had management laugh IN MY FACE before today. This hotel is extremely outdated. No mini fridge or coffee maker. They slapped a new tub over the old one, so I almost fell getting out of the shower. Not sure what qualified my room as a deluxe king either. Bring your walking shoes because it's a 3 mile hike to the good part of town. This is our first time in Vegas and I am having a terrible time. Don't come here.

If you think your going to bumped into clowns and trapeze's in the hallways your not!! So for those of you who relate "it" with real clowns no worries your safe!! It's a cheap hotel and if you have a tight budget like I did then it's the perfect place to stay. I spend 330.00 on a round trip flight and 3 nights to stay here. I honestly didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel so I can't detail it to much!! As far as the price it fit my budget perfectly!!

It's gross. But it's cheap.

The check-in line wait is at least 30 minutes, and probably more if you check in later at night (we saw it double the length we waited). The parking situation is a real disaster and the garage is scary in both a "I might get mugged in this dark and winding weird building" way and in a "I might get run over by a taxi at any minute" way.

We stayed in the nicer remodeled rooms in the West Tower (we paid more for these, about +$18 per night) and it was worth it... we didn't experience any nasty problems that any of the other reviewers stated - except a leaky sink and a slow to drain tub. And the carpet was a little crunchy. But for like $175 for 4 nights, I can't really complain. I wouldn't stay here unless you have a rental car though - it's not very walk-able in relation to the part of the strip where the good stuff is.

Next time if we have a car (which we did this time) we'll stay off-strip and get Circus Circus prices without all the screaming children and inconveniences.
For a Las Vegas hotel, the pool was totally disappointing and disgusting.  The smallest and dirtiest pool I have ever seen.

Friendly concierge staff, but HORRIBLE housekeeping practices! It's a very old hotel - needs major renovations! 

Only giving a third star because they were nice enough to waive the resort fee for our troubles and they apologized. Definitely appreciated that.  

We had to switch rooms twice upon check in due to a combination of: dirty sheets, unclean room, damaged furniture, and our third room was missing furniture. We could hear the room upstairs toilet flush, our wall paper was peeling off, towels had hair in them, rooms by elevator might as well be in the elevator, from ANY room you can hear hallway conversations loudand clear, elevators were always dirty. 

The water park is free to guests and a fun perk. Our bed was fairly comfy. AC worked well. Used to stay here all the time as a child. The hotel hasn't changed since then unfortunately. 

If you just need a place to crash, this is great. If it's modern luxury you seek, gotta go elsewhere.

This was honestly one of the most disgusting places I have been inside. Old pillow cases were all over the floor, the pillow cases and sheets on the bed were stained, the bed spread is probably as old as the building. Our shower ran all night long the walls had brown stuff smeared all over, half of the power outlets did not work. The hallways smelled of rotten old building. I would absolutely NEVER stay here again. With all their money they need some upgrades I'm hoping I didn't catch anything while I was there. Gross!!!!!

This was worst hotel I've stayed in. Gave us a room with a "view of the strip" which was actually just staring into the side of a building. When we called to ask to change rooms they refused stating that it still had a view.

After check in and realizing we weren't getting a view we decided to go have a few drinks by the pool. Well. They closed the one pool that still had sun at 4:30 in the afternoon! With no explanation! 

The Bathrooms were falling apart.  And there was NO HOT WATER. You read that right, no hot water. HORRIBLE. Will never stay anywhere in this hotel. I recommend you don't either.

This place is a piece of crap. That being said, you can still have fun, but don't expect much. It's cheap (I paid about $30 for an off-night only a week in advance). Our room was hella far from the check-in (across the street and down a bit to be exact). Not out of walking distance, but unlike other casinos, it was not connected at all to the main section. This was annoying (but I suppose it made it quieter). Check-in was also annoying--there were probably 20 people in line ahead of us and only 2 or 3 receptionists. This meant a long wait time, and throw in bratty little children running a muck... I was about ready to break out my fifth of 100 proof SoCo right there in the lobby and start taking shots. At 4pm. No joke.

There is a $5 additional hotel fee upon check-in. This includes pool access, the fitness room, etc. It also meant free wireless internet (in theory... it was painfully slow, we gave up on it after only a few minutes.
