Even a 3G network on your iPhone would be faster). The coupons were a joke--nothing really worthwhile (though 2 free midway games were valid on any game, so I recommend using them on the most expensive ones like throwing the dart into a star for a huge prize).

The casino itself is pretty bad and noisy--no high class establishment here. My friends and I ended up just playing midway games while completely intoxicated (which is always fun). The games are not too expensive considering how much they could jack up the price.

The location is walking distance to the main part of the strip... only if you're FUBARed (aka F-ed Up Beyond All Recognition). Seriously though, it's not too long of a walk if you're wearing good shoes.

All in all, I'll probably not stay again, but it was fun while it lasted. You get what you pay for, but I'd even prefer Hooters (see my other review) over Circus Circus. It is, however, saved from a 2 star vote due to their pretty fun arcade and midway section (but otherwise, for the hotel itself, would get 1 star for sure).

Ever since I was a kid, when we'd have our annual (or sometime bi-annual) vegas trip, we'd always stay at Circus Circus. Now that I'm older, I can see why we did.

It's more north of the heart of the strip, but it used to have several hotel\/casinos surrounding it which made the walk to the heart safe and nice.. Nowadays, since the closing of everything around it, it's a much darker longer walk to the heart. 

This is a fantastic hotel if you have kids, since there is the adventurezone, which was the highlight of my vacations in vegas as a kid. My parents would take us to sightsee all the landmarks then, when they wanted to go gamble and didn't want to worry about us, they would give us enough money for the wristbands which would allow us unlimited access to all rides within the dome. It kept me busy for entire days, which was nice. We've gone in October where it's halloween themed (they turn it into a zombie\/monster dome..ohhhhhh scary!).

The buffet is real good here too, though my mom said that lately they've been lacking. Fortunately, though, you get 2 free buffet tickets if you stay here for the weekend, so that's definitely a plus!

We stayed there 7\/11-7\/12.  On check-in I used the men's room in the crowded lobby, and saw a homeless man bathing in the sink.  Once we got to our room, the AC was on but didn't adjust so we were stuck with a slightly warm room the whole stay.  Everything is over priced (in include the $29 resort fee that's in addition to the price we paid for the hotel).  My family of five paid $80 for the breakfast buffet.  We probably won't stay there again.

The king sized bed in the Casino Tower is a very large room! The lobby and casino have a strong cigarette smell unfortunately. But the room itself wasn't bad. So far we like the rooms. My siblings's bathtub was a bit clogged, but they called room service about it and the issue was fixed.

The hotel staff was nice enough to allow me to park in the 15 min spots in the garage in front of the lobby area when we first arrived so I could check in. They wouldn't let us borrow a bell hop cart to bring the stuff up ourselves, only the real bell hop people can use it I guess. 

Despite being a budget, family Las Vegas hotel (somewhat far away from the other hotels) it was better than I thought it would be. 

Ask for military or other discounts. 

As we were leaving, the line for hotel check in was insanely long. I'm not sure if that is a common occurrence on weekends, but be beware.

For some reason despite this casino being old, dirty and smokey and that is why I give it three stars.  You come out smelling like a cigarette and your ears are hurting due to the huge crowds and the kids screaming and yelling.  However, it is a family casino. I never stayed here even though the prices are cheap $26 dollars a night, I am sure what you pay is what you get.  They did remodeled he place a bit especially near the adventuredome.  I ate at the buffet as well, and it was horrible.

However, I definitely love going here. I like playing their dollar games and it does not put a dent in my wallet.  I do like playing the arcade games and liked the adventuredome as well.  You can buy the unlimited pass for $25 dollars and get on most of the rides in a day or so.  I win several prizes here as well, but they are cheap looking though.

Staying at Circus Circus Hotel was interesting.  The room were very clean but lacked in a few items such as the room did not have a fridge to keep drinks cold or microwave to heat up anything, there was not a coffee pot or anything of the like to drink coffee in the morning.  Lastly, the TV though it was a flat screen has been rigged so that I (or anyone) could not connect anything to it in order to review family movies from my tablet.  We learned to overcome the issues in the room.  The lobby was packed with kids and adults along with the smell of cigarette smoke around the casino area, which you have to pass in order to get to a lot of the things available for kids.  The amusement park in the hotel was phenomenal.  It was a lot bigger than I had initially figured.  My wife and I got lost trying to leave the amusement area. The hotel have several restaurants but I found the cheapest one is Rock and Rita.  The meals are reasonably priced. There is also a McDonald in the hotel as well which I guess wold make it the cheapest place to eat.  If you plan on buying tickets for any shows there is a place for it in the lobby but be warned get there early because the line grows fast and the shows will sell out quickly.  The staff was very friendly and helpful.  Overall the place was not bad.  It was definitely designed with kids in mind.  I think what it missed in room amenities they made up for it in the rides and games they have available in the hotel.  I give it three stars because of the cigarette smoke in the lobby area and where you have to transit to take your kids to the amusement areas and the lack of amenities in the room.  If you are traveling with kids to Vegas this is a good place to be and it was very cheap to stay there.  If you are going with adults and you can spend the money go for one of the hotels that give you everything you are looking for.

Great for families, specially family with the kids. This place is almost as loud as it can gets. So if you're looking for some intimate time, you might wanna look for some other place. But if you're looking for arcade full of kids who's running around or indoor theme park full of adrenaline junkie kids & their parents, then you're at the right hotel.

Arcade has mostly machines\/slots that gives you tickets. I was surprised by the number of items you can win with the tickets. They weren't priced crazily. So you can actually win something from here. AdventureDome is the indoor theme park on the 1st floor of the main hotel. It's a must go for families. Kids will love free circus show for sure.

I'm really glad I picked this hotel. I had kids with me & Vegas is like a pressure-cooker during summer. We couldn't go anywhere & had to ditch Grand canyon trip for the unbelievable heat. Circus Circus made our stay fun. We were inside the hotel most of the time & we had one of the worst but still a buffet to go. They have Krispy Kreme doughnut, pizza place, steakhouse & some other restaurants.

Just make sure you know about their resort fee, cuz sometimes it's more expensive than the hotel room rate. And their front desk service is not that great.

Our family had a blast here!!! There are lots of games to choose from. And we played almost all of them. The prizes were almost all the same throughout the games but that's okay as some games are hard as hell!!!! DONT DO THE BOTTLE RINGS. I wasted 30 bucks on 6 buckets filled with rings ($5 each) and didn't win one time. It was terrible. My daughter wanted the giant unicorn from despicable me but we ended up getting her a smaller one from another game. 

The shows were fun!!!!! Definitely recommend watching the shows!!!!!!!!! This place is a must see if you have a family with little ones cause they will go nuts over everything.

This review is based only from the Midway and the Adventure Dome.  

At the Midway, I was a bit sad that a lot of the games were closed down. Some of the prices also got smaller.  It is harder to get the large prizes. I feel like the crane machines are all rigged in someway because none of them grabbed anything. The crane would just fit perfectly around the prize and then just swift off without even moving it. What a rip off!

Luckily, the Adventure Dome was a lot better. Though chaos was closed everything else was like how it usually was. There was a new Lazer game which was cool. It reminds me of secret agents. 

The whole place is just starting to look old compared to all the other buildings at the strip. It still is good ol' fun but be prepared to spend a lot of money for cheap and almost unreachable prizes. 

Oh and the parking lot is creepy. Always go here with other people.

I didn't realize we got the lodge rooms that are not connected to the actual casino until we checked in. Its fine for the price we paid. The lodge is HOT. The hallways are super hot and they don't have an ice dispenser on each floor. The rooms themselves were nice, our bed was super comfy! She shower was a bit cramped though.

The place smell old and not in a good way.
The amusement park is fun for children.

My girlfriend and I stayed at CC for one night and all I can say is this place is a shit hole. Sure it's old but it's time to cut their losses and just demolish this place. We got put in The Manor which is across from the actual casino and just looks like a separate motel in another parking lot. It looks as though a bunch of tweekers and low end escorts (hookers) stay there full time. Not to mention the walls an windows are paper thin. If you think you're getting sleep at CC think again. From meth heads screaming at 330 in the morning to all the drunk idiots pounding on their buddies door at 530 in the morning you'll hear it all.

Stay away from this hotel you can find something way better at the heart of the strip for the same price that's way more comforting.
Worst hotel ever. Whole room smells like weed. Front desk never picks up the phone. Wifi does not work at all. Barely anything in the room to use

I've stayed here multiple times, but over the weekend i got a room in the casino tower, they gave me a dirty old room there was a roach walking around by the bed, i didn't feel comfortable whatsoever so i called the front desk as i was asking the person to change my room and explaining what was going on she cut me off and put me on hold didn't let me finish and didn't even say hold on a second i had to talk to almost 3 people before a supervisor and she didn't want to switch me either. After i told her about the roach she switched me. Not happy with the service at all.

This hotel and casino is super kool. It was there the first time I ever came to Las Vegas in the summer of 1979. I paid a visit to it then and over the years I  have been back many times. I can tell you one thing the place looks different then it did the first time I came that's for sure. 

There are only three other strip casinos older than Circus Circus and when it opened in 1968 it was only a casino no hotel rooms. It's has a lot of kool history. Tony the "Ant" Spilotro ran the gift shop of the Circus Circus in the early 1970's. He is the Chicago mobster who's career was the basis of the hit movie casino. Joe Pesci play his character. 

I give the Circus Circus a strong three stars. There is good and not so good here. I have a little sentimental ties to this hotel and casino. There aren't many casino left from my first visits to Las Vegas. So it does bring back memories of the way Las Vegas use to be. 

Let's start with the good. Rooms are super cheap here. Probably the cheapest on the strip. It's easy to get rooms here for like $30 or $40 bucks a night.  This is nice because it give people that can't afford the Aria or Wynn a chance to stay on the strip and to have a lot of fun with the kids. How can I say this without being mean and it's not meant that way, this hotel at times had a "different" clientele then say the Aria or the Wynn. Hope that makes sense without being mean. 

While from its opening in 1968 and for a couple decades this hotel was constantly upgraded. From just a Casino to a hotel and casino. Constantly adding hotel towers and buildings, to the super kool Adventuredome. This is a five acre enclosed amusement park complete with roller coasters and 25 other popular carnival type rides. It had a huge carnival\/Circus midday with all the fun games. They also still do a circus shows I believe daily. 

There are some nice shops here that give you a boardwalk feel. You can really get some good buys here. There's plenty of places to eat and drink, the Steakhouse is good food, Vince Neil of Motley Crue fame has a bar here, they have a buffet and several other decent places to eat. 

The hotel is is on the far north end of the strip. It's a good location. It's a bit of a hike to places like New York New York Hotel and Casino and the MGM Grand for example but, with all the new developments going on around it should be kinda smack dab in the middle of it all. It's not a bad walk the the Wynn or Venetian for those more northern strip casinos and right across the street of the newer SLS.

The future of this place? A lot of my casino friends say it will go. But I have a little insider informant saying it won't and that it's a cash cow for MGM. I get it, the place is always crowded and I'm sure the place has paid for itself many times over and has probably helped to finance other MGM Hotels on the Strip. 

As far as gambling, the minimum table bets are some of the lowest in the strip. This last visit we met a super rude roulette table operator though. Most others working there are nice.

I'm a Blackjack guy and don't really do Slots but I believe it was one of the last strip casinos (and maybe still has a couple) to use coin in and coin out Slots. I like those older slot machines. 

My first visit to Las Vegas Circus Circus had just purchased Slots-a-Fun Casino next door. Circus Circus is and MGM hotel and Casino now. I'm my opinion, this hotel could use an upgrade. A major upgrade. Other than that it's a fun place to bring the kids while in Vegas and a nice place to gamble and eat. I hope this place sticks around.

Booked 1 week through Travelocity to stay here. We arrived to the hotel at about 2:30 pm and were not charged an early check in which was nice. They also didn't hold my card for incidentals, and the woman who helped us check in was very kind (I think her name was Grace). Being the first face we saw at the hotel, she made a very good impression on behalf of the hotel! Our room was good, clean, and we got a nice view out on the strip. I would say the buffet is quite expensive for what you really get out of it, so would avoid it. The pool is not notable really. Kinda dirty and a bit smaller, but it does the job on a hot day. Also no microwaves and fridges are only available for an extra $22 a night (instead we went to the nearby Walgreens and bought a cheap cooler and filled with free hotel ice). My other comment would be housekeeping is not the best. We had a Do Not Disturb up while we left for the day, and when we came back they had come in and put the sign back inside and cleaned and moved things around. Also instead of replacing towels we had put on the ground, they just picked them up and hung them back up (gross!); and they didn't change our sheets for the week we were there. It is located on the very middle of the whole strip, so you do have to take a bus or walk to go to most popular places on the south end of the strip. Overall, a pretty good hotel and worth it for the price we paid and no big complaints.

I stayed here Apr 8-12th 2017.
Although I've traveled to Vegas numerous of times this was the first time i've stayed at Circus Circus Hotel & Casino. When arriving it had a very easy parking entry. Parking is slightly hectic but luckily we found parking right near the elevator on the 4th floor. Check-in was a bit difficult for us. Although I booked my stay through my bookings.com account I used my grandpas card for payment. I even emailed the hotel as soon as I was done booking to ensure our check in would be a breeze. Of course the hotel never emailed me back. (best too call)....But they ended up not accepting payment even though I had a copy of his state ID and card used. PLUS a video of him authorizing me to use payment and they still denied that. I was pretty shocked because I've done this before at west gate and other hotels with no problem..the room was very clean but my boyfriend was upset the tv was so old he wasn't able to hook up his PS4 too the tv. the bed was super comfy! the bathroom was the perfect size. there was no fridge or microwave so be prepared to finish all food you go out and buy and get ice from your drinks lol. I enjoyed adventure dome! but I don't like how the wrist bands only last for the day.....they should be 24hrs from the time you buy it...I also LOVED Blue Iguanas! It was sooooo good! We also experienced the morning buffet and it was great! I enjoyed Circus Circus. all staff were friendly and it was at a good location! definitely will return!
Does the job, not great, not amazing, not anything really except a room with a bed. You're better off at Stratosphere for the same price.

Currently staying here, first timer. Room smells like an old smoking moist room, we got a non smoking room.....Rooms are completely far away from the lobby. You have to cross the street. Pools are small! We were excited about the circus show. When we finally got there the stage is small for a show and after two acts they took a 30 minute waiting period to watch the next act.  We waited, after the next act had to wait another 45 minutes to watch the next one! We said screw it and left. Rollercoaster rides are too expensive! They try to charge you $30 for an all day wrist band or pay $8 to $12 each big ride. Arcade and game sections were good. Casino is outdated for Baccarat game. Never staying here again.

There's a reason this is one of the cheapest hotels on the strip. It's a dump. It's almost always been a dump. It's a dump now. It's probably always going to be a dump. And it's run by people who know it's a dump and treat it that way. Try to valet a car. The valet screams at you to pull up because he doesn't want to have to walk the 10 feet to your car. Try to eat at a restaurant (if you dare.) The food is cheap because it's poor quality and cold. The place is worn out. The service staff is worn out and if you think this is a great place you probably don't get out of your trailer park very often. I'll never go back. I tried it to be fair to see if it was a bad as everyone says it is. And it is.

Considering that this hotel is one of the cheapest spots on the strip that caters to budget conscious families, this hotel serves its purpose.  If you want luxurious gleaming marble surfaces and huge fancy statues at every turn, go to another hotel.
     The room was decent and clean and the staff was helpful and polite.

I regret that I had already booked our stay before reading any reviews. I was under the impression that Circus Circus was a good, clean, family-friendly hotel. We stayed one night because my stepdaughter was flying back home from Vegas. After I read these reviews, I immediately called to upgrade our room in hopes to have a better experience. Parking was confusing to navigate at first, but check in wasn't bad- the line moved quickly. There is definitely an odor inside the hotel and hotel room floors. Our room wasn't that bad, the toilet didn't flush right and some other minor things. I was optimistic. 
My husband and I had immediately woken up after midnight due to a REALLY strong odor coming into our room, because someone was smoking marijuana! It was awful and I was livid! We had two young children in this room and here my husband and I thought we upgraded to keep away from this exact situation..
I had a terrible headache from it and sat on hold with guest services for 20 minutes at 12:30 in the morning to answer the call! By that time, it was probably going to be difficult for security to pin point exactly which room it was- and I highly doubt they sent anyone anyways. They didn't even care..
I'm very disappointed in the quality of our stay for how much it was just for one night. 
Therefore, I will never return to this hotel because I never imagined that my children would have to be exposed to that.

Welp... I remember going here as a kid, and I thought it was pretty cool back then (so I thought).. I ended up taking my own kids there this weekend and I'm ready to see this place demolished.. After spending only 30 minutes in there, we ended up leaving and instantly felt like we needed to take a shower.. So long Circus Circus, I'll be back once you tear down and open a new hotel..
Sorry this place is not the place. They need to clean it up. From parking lots to rooms.

the good news is... the rooms in this place (west tower) are not too bad. in fact... after seeing the rest of the place... they're a pleasant surprise and cleaner than expected.  unfortunately the (what sounded like a) family of fourteen staying in the room next door ruined that by repeatedly kicking the walls with their feet... banging on the connecting door... and yelling at us through the wall (awesome!)... 

the bad news is... most of the people who frequent this hotel bring ALL of their bloodshot... bleary-eyed... screaming children to the casino and keep them up well past midnight so that mommy and daddy can WIN BIG at the slots. 

there are people consistently sleeping on benches in the lobby...  and the place is packed and overwhelming at all hours... 

this place is sketchy to say the least...

after three nights there i couldn't figure out what was on the back of my neck... and it was indeed: THE HEEBY JEEBIES!

I was in Las Vegas more than 10 times and always stayed at expensive hotels like Caesars, Bellagio, Trump hotel etc. But today I don't need nice view, super service and luxury life. I just need room for sleep. That's why I choose this hotel and paid 80$ (include all taxes and fees). I was surprised, because this is a cheap price but I got large and clean room with good view. 

What I like at this hotel?
1. Free Parking. Most hotel at the strip charge 30-40$ parking fee.
2. Free and fast internet 
3. Large and clean room. Room at Circus Circus in two times larger than at LINQ Hotel
4. Nice view
5. Affordable price

This is one of my favorite places to gamble in Vegas. I basically came to this casino as a kid and spent hours in the arcade. It is a great place for children to win toys and adults to gamble. There is also a free circus act show that is fun to watch up in the arcade. I would recommend signing up for the rewards membership if you are an adult!

Came here as a last minute stay to celebrate my birthday. This place Is horrible.

Pros
-front desk staff seem to be cool and professional 
-Very big as far as hotel itself it has about 3-4 buildings. 
-Has a lot of things to do for the family.
- Gives you a coupon book to use at the hotel for food, beverage, casino, and fun activities. 


Walk with me as I explain what I saw 


Cons:
The front desk agent kept hinting several times about paying for an upgrade in hotel ...which I should have taken her advice on if it looks better than what the hell I stayed at. The price to  upgrade was $25 more. (Next time I will trust my instincts) 
-We stayed at The Manor (aka rat trap, aka the place the prostitutes bring their John's, aka roach motel, aka Bates Hotel, aka Original hotel from the Rat Pack days. The manor is located behind the high rise hotels. 

-it had graffiti on the buttons in the elevator..smh 

- We walked into the room and it looked so dated like from the 60's. The wallpaper is dated and there were stains on it. There was  this one spot in particular that had this brown-ish- red spot which is either blood or water stain. The shower curtain was dirty. The wallpaper near the entry way to the bathroom was stained. The curtains in the room has slashes in it as if some either did it on purpose or someone was trying to stab someone. 
-The tables in the room was old and there was water stains on it. The lounge couch was dated and I didn't want to sit in it.  I immediately thought this place had to have bed bugs. I checked and surprisingly it didn't. The bed was comfy despite how old it looks.
-TV was definitely old and it was a box tv (who the hell still have these kind of TV's in a motel) the channels were blurry and the TV kept shutting off and on. For all the high traffic of people I saw checking in the hotel they could afford to buy some flat screen TV's at a wholesale rate at Wal-Mart. 

-the shower head needed to be replaced and you had to play around to get the shower to turn off completely.

I tried to maintain the motto "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" but this was too much. 
I normally give places the benefit of the doubt and rate no less than a 4 out of 5 but this place needs to do some real remodeling. 






If I come back it would be in the high rises.

Bottom line avoid saying at the Manor

5 days, 4 nights at the Skyrise Tower Two Queens with $20 Food & Beverage Credit
Booked on Expedia 
Check-in Information

Check-in time starts at 3 PM
Minimum check-in age is 21
Your room will be guaranteed for late arrival

Fitness center access
Internet access (may be limited)
Phone calls (may be limited)
In-room coffee
Resort fee: USD 12.95 per accommodation, per night


-Good and cheap hotel that is family friendly. 
- $5 tables during the week 
- buffet food is okay. Not the greatest and not worth full price. 
- close enough to other casinos 
- beds and rooms are decent. Good for a couple nights rest since we were out all the time.

I'm not even sure where to start. We stayed for 2 nights this past weekend and it was a horrible experience. The elevators were down so often that there was often a long line to get on the only 2 working ones. And as an added bonus, there was no air conditioning in the elevators or in the attached hallways. Waiting in that line and in a crowded elevator full of people that have been in the desert heat does not smell nice...27 smelly floors. :(

While we were there, we went to the pool and rented one of the family umbrellas. Throughout the day we had to fend off people trying to come in our rented space (our kids chairs while they played). It would have been nice if they occasionally checked in to monitor that. Also, I waited for a cocktail waitress to show up until after 1pm. When I finally see them walking around, they never make it past the first row of chairs to take orders. 

For the $71 a night, you can definitely stay somewhere nicer.

We stayed here this weekend and I guess I should start by setting expectations because that is what I did before coming out here. If you compare Circus Circus to a newer hotel on the strip, you will be disappointed before you even get there. Now, if you compare Circus Circus to another kid friendly spot on the strip, you will be pleasantly surprised! There is so much to do here for kids AND for the kid in you! And it turns out that the Vegas strip is not really for kids!!! Go figure! We stayed in the "newer" hotel section and this review is based on that. 

The Hotel: 1 Star =(
Without a doubt, needs a facelift!!! It is very old, and has a grimy feel to it. We stayed in the "newer" West Tower and even this felt old. I don't think I will ever stay here again. The place seems clean and the room service was attentive, but it's true what they say, you can't polish a turd. It did the job though, we slept and showered and it work fine. 

The Pool: 3 Stars
Decent size(2 of them), but also very old. There is a bar and snack bar for convenience, I ordered a bloody Mary for $10 (Includes the cup). It was great! I suggest getting there when it opens up before the crowd arrives. When it was crowded, it was too much. 

The Casino: 3 Stars
There was a good variety of slots and tables. It's not too big and yet not too small. 

The Food: 3 Stars
Here's a quick rundown of the spots we hit. All of these spots are a mix between a sit down restaurant and a fast food. You order and pay, then seat yourself and pick up your food. 

***The Pizzeria was very good! Recommend this spot!

*The Garden Grill was OK. The burger was just OK, the Caesar Salad dressing sucks, stay away. The wings are decent. The portions are pretty big!

*The Blue Iguana was again, just OK. It was NOT authentic Mexican food and needed some seasoning but it was edible. 

***Barista Bagels was good! Breakfast special was good and you can't really go wrong with a bagel and coffee. 
*** McDonalds was actually "fresh" and tasty. I don't eat at any McD's and was happy with what I did eat here. Yes, I just said that I liked McDonalds...here. 

The Fun: 5 stars!
Lots to do in the Midway and also in Adventuredome. Carnival games that only cost a buck or two and are easy enough to win a prize. Video arcades galore. Rides, rides, rides! Fun for all ages, literally. There are plenty of rides for the little ones to get on and some exciting rides for the big ones! 

So, in case you missed it...LOTS of fun if you have kids with you in Vegas!!!

The worst service and place where I have never seen... I stayed for 2 days and no room service for us even housekeeping came and asked for room service... The hotel is very old and no fridge inside my room.. This is the first time I came to Las Vegas and this hotel made me feel so disappointed... Moreover, they charge for " resort fee", that is so stupid when you paid and nothing you can do over here. I will not come back this place anymore...

I've stayed twice in less than a year, the 1st time so amazing I was forced to come Addison because I didn't have enough time to do everything I wanted, this past week we starred , 3 days, the adventure dome was closed all week which would have been nice to know when we booked, I would have booked somewhere else and just visited the joke of a circus, room was ok I liked the skyrise tower better but not a big deal, leaving hotel my 4 year old almost gets ran over by Terry the female valet driver, everyone was nice to me then trying to comp me wristbands for the park that wasn't open and buffet tickets like it makes up for scaring the crap out of myself and my child because they hired people who drive like bats out of hell, I loved this hotel, I used to go there when I was small with my family, im close to 30, I'm sorry I took my kids there I will never recommended this place to anyone again after raving about it since I stayed there the time before last, my kids were treated better at caesers palace, venitian, and planet Hollywood staff and security, where you would expect to see no children....

Good place to bring kids to the Adventure Dome and to buy discount concert and show tickets, as far as staying in the hotel though... I think not. It's an older hotel but has not been maintained properly. Also, it's at the end of the strip and there are no trams that they offer to take you to the center of the strip. It always smells like smoke inside and you feel like you walking into a bad part of town. Will never try to stay at this hotel even if it cheaper than all the others on the Strip.

I came here a lot with my parents when I was a kid, and it seemed like the greatest thing ever. However, they have done little to improve the place since then, and it seems to have steadily gone downhill.

I stayed in the Manor Motor Lodge during my recent stay. Here are just a few of the things that sucked about it: there is no fridge, no microwave, and no coffeemaker; the outlets are loose and won't hold your plugs; I found several bugs. The wifi was pretty decent, but then again it should be for $10 bucks a day (aka the resort fee). 

The Midway, at least, has been updated. One of the last times I made my way there, everything was broken down, so it was nice to see they had fixed some of it up. However, so many of the games are like 2 bucks a pop, and all you win is this crappy little stuffed animal.  The circus acts are pretty cool, though. Oh, and they took away the Carousel Bar. Why?!

There are so many other options on and off the Strip that you really don't have to settle for Circus Circus if you're looking for a cheap option. I really wish they would step up their game just a bit.

Oh...where do I begin? This hotel used to be great! I picked this because the room prices were good and I remembered how much fun I had there when I was younger. 

Fast forward to 2017. This hotel has sure changed. Sure with the time that's passed, things will be different. But oh they did not change for the best. 

The cheapest rooms are in the "old" tower. If you book those, after check in you will have to walk quite a ways to get there. We upgraded for an extra $10 a night so we could be in the West tower. Avoid going back out in 100+ degree temps, and not have to lug our bags a half a mile away.

The elevators are ridiculous. There are 4 that go to the first 10 floors, and then another 4 that go to the rest. They are so slow. Crowded. Rickety. Borderline scary. Definitely not enough for the amount of people in that hotel. Several times we spent at least 15-20 minutes to even get an elevator, and most times it was so packed we couldn't even get in it. They had trash in them most times. Someone barfed in one. Super.

The room was clean. Newer furniture. The king bed had 3 pillows for 2 people. No comforter on the bed. Just a thin blanket between two white sheets. Fridges and coffee pots are no longer in the rooms. The flat screen TV looked like the 1st model ever made. The bed was hard and not very comfortable. I think the sewer system was overloaded because there were times it smelled like a porta potty in our room that was used by 100 people and left to sit in the sun for a couple days. It was pretty disgusting.

The gambling area was okay. The machines hit pretty decently. The Pizzaria and Deli were delicious. But the buffet was wayyyyy overpriced. Almost $50 for two people to eat dinner with a mediocre selection of food.

Being there felt like Grand Central Station. You couldn't walk anywhere without running into a kid or a stroller. Buy waters, sodas, beverages at Walgreens or somewhere else. The lobby store was selling Aquafina 1L bottles for $4. The vending machines on each floor sells 20oz bottles of soda for $4. 

I'll never stay there again. It's just too run down and too busy and the food is way too expensive. Cheaper is definitely not better.

Air conditioning is nice for 115F weather but don't even bother coming here. It may be cheap (at the manor lodge) DONT SPEND YOUR MONEY HERE. Spend the extra bucks and get yourself a nicer hotel. Horrible stay. Saw 1 inch bugs and some bed bugs too. Spend your money elsewhere

It's an old casino but has a great arcade area for the kids they even have roller coasters in this one the last time I came here they had a log ride but I guess they took it out and are doing construction for another ride but still a lot to do and great fun.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!! YOU'VE BEEN WARNED!!!! This is the worst freaking motel i have EVER  visited and yes i said MOTEL because thats what it reminded me of! The sheets were dingy, my bed comforter had stains and fucking GUM on it! Looks like they just threw it in the laundry which only made it hard and more noticable! I ONLY booked this room because i went on Horwire at the last minute to reserve because i really wanted to support my son in his basketball tournament.  Even my kids hated it. They are early teens. Elevators werent all workibg so checkibg out sunday was a 45 minute elevator wait!!! My kids didnt like how they were nickled and dimed for every attraction here. And for kids to complain about money...u know its bad. I looked out the window at the tiny dismal pool that wasnt big enough for all the number of guests they had in it! Again...DOT STAY HERE! We checked out after only 1 night and went to the M Resort which was AMAZING and Cali residebts get a huge discount!

We found a deal online so we went with it.  Stayed three nights and from start to finish had a wonderful time!  The guy who checked us in [Joseph] was awesome!!  We have been going to Vegas for 6 years now and this was the first time we actually had a view of the strip!  The room was spacious and comfortable. It's a bit outdated, but we would stay here again.  We don't have young kids, but never felt like we were out of place, this hotel definitely caters to families...so if you don't like kids, do not stay here!  The Midway was SO much fun!  Carnival games, shows and goodies!  Looking forward to bringing our grandkids here.  It's almost at the very end of the strip, probably the only down side.  It's a little spread out also, it wouldn't be a comfortable walk to the pool from the West Tower (quite a trek). Vince Neil has a restaurant here, Tatuado, food was amazing! Will def stay here again, we never got to enjoy the rides!
I will never stay here again! Horrible customer service, horrible location and horrible experience.  Im so disappointed..

I went here many times in the hotels kinda am underavererage hotel if you ask me just not for me I dislike the vibe here, tiny bathroom, my dad dislikes the casinos he lost $20 bucks by he said it wasn't fair how he lost

Over all the hotel installations and kids attractions  are good but, you guys need to improve big time into training casino dealers for customer service and to be polite to people. (Not rude or moody) I go there 2 or 3 times per year and I love to gamble and expend money. I never expect to win, only to have fun, meet friends and gamble in a hassle free atmosphere. But, this is the third time I visit Circus Circus and  I've been forced to switch tables every time a couple of Mexican rude dealers are in my table.( I am Mexican by the way ) they are always mad, slap people hands, and give a very killer looks, when some body complains about their attitude. Also there is a Black fat lady she is the same as those two. OMG! are they working for free?? I was giving $5 to $10 dollars to this dealer on every wining hand, and he not even pick up his tip until I tell him to. I am not Shure if he considered the tip as an offense or very small. I stop doing it so after the third time.

You guys need to improve dealer customer service or people won't want to gamble there any more! the Asian dealers are all great! I have never had a single problem in 29 years visiting your casino.

Maybe this review will go to trash but, at least I had expressed my opinion to you. It is in your hands to do something or nothing in regards.

Have a great day.




Sincerely,




Alberto

Spent three nights here and I must say I wish I spent a little more money for something nicer and something on the strip. The area of the hotel I stayed in was very run down gross and OLD. The pictures they post at check in or around the main lobby is by far nothing compared to what I stayed in. Also the people that work there are beyond idiots. When checking I asked if we could get a King instead of two queens and the lady said no problem. We go to our room and we have two queens. Then I go downstairs and the lady who fixes the issue turns to my boyfriend and me and says just so you know all that non smoking and number of beds or having a view is all request we don't have to honor it. Really?? Who says shit like that.

Needs a remodel. Dirty and smokey. The staff is nice and the bars are nice but over priced. To get food in the hotel is a long wait. The casino is ridiculous I could spend hundreds and not hit a thing. The price of the room for four nights was reasonable and it's convenient for going to the strip or Fremont. I think if they don't remodel then circus will not be around much longer.
This place was a lot of fun - we had a great time going through the amusement park part of the place - just a fun time.  My wife played blackjack and had a great time!
Free acrobatic performance. Cheap tables. Play area for kids. Don't really offer drinks on slots, and only occasionally on tables.

My son and I were looking for a kid friendly hotel and this one was not bad.  He liked that it had a Krispy Kreme!  We had a pizza there and it was overpriced.   There is a game area that kids enjoy.  Our room was clean and smoke free which was nice.

We only go to Circus Circus to play the midway games or visit the adventure dome. They have a ton of claw machine games, carnival games and arcade games. If you don't gamble or have underage folks traveling with you, this is a great place to come and kill some time. 

The only downside to coming out here is that you have to walk a pretty far distance from the parking garage to the casino and then to the midway games area. 

Yelp 100 Challenge 2013 - 62 of 100

An overpriced ghetto filled with dated ironic t-shirts, spandex weed outfits (they sell these as of today at the store inside) and weathered-looking people desperately hoping to turn their luck around soon. Kinda depressing and overpriced considering the experience.
We had a great stay at Circus Circus! Our room was clean and the bed was quality. The lovely African American woman working cashier at the Buffett was hilarious!!

I've stayed at Circus Circus more times than i can count. I've stayed in every type of room at least once (Manor, Skyrise, West Tower, and Casino Tower). I'll review them in order from cheapest to priciest. 

I stayed in the Manor once because all the rest were so expensive (it was a weekend with a huge event somewhere in vegas). It is a looooong walk to and from the casino since they are located outside. However, when i went they had a mini fridge which no other room has had (i think this was in 2012). It was awful but it wasn't the best. I wouldn't stay in the manor again unless i absolutely had to.  

Now the skyrise, it is located inside the main building (no need to walk outside) and it was really nice, nothing special but nice. It was clean not far from adventuredome. Not much to say. Definitely would stay there again.

Now West Tower my favorite! This is where my family and i usually stay! It is near the adventure dome for my brother and i. The rooms are nice, the gym is really close by! Its the perfect place! Out of all 4 rooms i'd say this one is the best!

Casino tower... the most expensive. My family and i booked the hotel room online and we were super excited. We booked it because the rooms were cheaper than usual and we decided to stay in the best room we could. Upon walking in the room seemed small and cramped. Maybe we just got a bad spot but i didnt lkke how the west tower rooms were cheaper and more spacious! There was nothing special to room which was really disappointing because it is the best one. It had beds toilet and a shower but i thought it was missing a little umph. Definitely not staying there again!

All in all i love Circus Circus. All of my stays there have been wonderful and i hope they continue to be great. This is a family friendly hotel and i dont understand why people leave such nasty reviews. Circus circus is one of the cheapest on the strip i dont know why people complain if you want a good hotel go to Cesars Palace or Bellagio. The Adventure Dome is great, Midway is great (free shows)! Definitely a great place for FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN!

circus circus where kids train to be a future gamblers
I stop here for curiosity I just stay for 5 minutes look old and dirty

I came to this hotel to save money and I have to say that was a mistake.  The parking is terrible, there isn't enough spaces to accommodate all the guests that come to this hotel during the summer and it took 20 minutes to find a space.  In addition, there aren't enough elevators to let you go in and out of your room to the casino floor efficiently.  I literally waited 5-10 minutes for an elevator that wasn't completely filled with people during the day.  

Don't come here unless you have kids that absolutely need to stay at Circus Circus.  For around the same price or a few extra dollars more (IE. Tropicana, Stratosphere, Monte Carlo), you won't have to deal with these annoyances.  FYI, they also make you pay a resort fee of about $7 dollars a day for internet that is slow and a fitness center that has poor quality.

Checked in on 5\/22\/2016 check out on 5\/24\/2016. Upon checking in everything went great till I went up to my room in the west tower on floor 34 room 34817. Once I walked in it smelled like smoke. I immediately went back downstairs and ask for another room and was told either I can have a 2nd floor room or have house keeping come up and spray. I said have house keeping come. So back upstairs and a nice African American lady was waiting for me and said the people before was smoking and its a non smoking room. They are getting charged $1,000 because of smoking. Anyway she sprayed my room and said its probably not going to help much you be better to switch to a different room. I told her I would walk down to Walgreens and buy a air fresher. I walked over to TI CVS and bought a air fresher and it's helping right now.

5 star price.
1 star decor.
3 star average.
This place serves its purpose. It has incredibly cheap accomodation (seek and you shall find) and you don't have to have the nicest room on a budget when in Vegas. Who needs sleep?!
However, it's definitely dated where the carpet almost sticks to your shoes and takes an eternity to check in.
I remember visiting as a kid a very long time ago and the amount of things to keep a child entertained are amazing. It's the perfect place.
For adults, it's not like you can't get to another casino to enjoy the glitz and razzamatazz if you so desire!

I knew what I was getting into when I booked reservations at this hotel so I can't really say I was surprised at the experience. I was expecting dumpy, run down, lots of kids and probably not that great of service and that's basically what we got. 

Why'd I still go ahead and book my reservation? Frightdome. Frightdome was one of the big reasons we came to Vegas on this trip. So we figured "Might as well book a room in the same hotel that Frightdome will be in so we can just crawl back to our rooms when all is said and done." and that's basically what we did. 

We booked a room for Saturday night. Arrived a couple of hours before Frightdome was set to open, dropped our bags off in the room and actually rested a bit. To be honest...the rooms were actually pretty decent and the walls must have been super thick because I never heard anyone in the hallway or in the rooms around us the entire time. 

The hotel\/casino itself like I stated before is rundown and just not a pleasant experience. But on the upside it was a 10 minute walk from our room to Frightdome. Check in was a nightmare. They only had two people checking people in. We got in about a 20 person line and by the time we got up to the desk the line had doubled. When I commented about the lack of staff the person checking us in said that the hotel had made lots of cuts. Wonderful. 

Oh, well. We had a decent night's sleep and got the hell out of dodge come 8am.

The adventure dome review.
1) Please update your video game arcades! They are super old and no one plays them. Faded displays and broken handles. 

2) more staffing is needed in the food areas on holidays, makes no sense to have one person with 20 people waiting for food or drinks. AND! Not having a sign saying you are out of certain items. No cheese for nachos, no hotdogs, only one type of chips, wtf! Put a sign so we don't wait in line. 

3) why can't you pay with two credit cards for admission?? Please update your system. 

4) need to expand that area, way to small.

After staying here, I decided I will never leave Aria or the Cosmopolitan ever again. We decided to stay here because we were bringing our three kids to Vegas. We thought it would be wise to steer clear of the main part of the strip due to the Mayweather and McGreggor fight and the kids would love the Adventure Dome and Waterslides. First....the kids LOVED the Adventure Dome. It is open until midnight on the weekends and we had to drag the kids away from the video games, carnival games and amusement park rides. They also have a few circus acts throughout the day that the kids really enjoyed. The entire place is set up for you to constantly buy things for your kids....magic shop...fidget spinner shop....skateboard shop....you name it...it is there. 

In regards to the hotel, it is so old. The entire hotel wreaks of stale cigarette smoke. The room is even more stale and makes it super hard to breathe. We had to keep the ac going to try to filter the air. By the last night, my throat was so raw and I vowed to never leave Aria or Cosmo again. 

The service isn't bad but it is super slow. Most places in the hotel didn't know how to charge to our room and seemed completely lost about the entire concept. 

Great place for kids but next time we will sleep somewhere else and come play here instead. 

Overall, the hotel felt dirty and cheap but the kids absolutely loved it and wanted to stay for another week....hence the 2 stars.

All the bad reviews are about the rooms that are in the very cheap section. When you pay motel 6 prices do you think your going to get a 5 star room. Uh no! Pay a little more and get the better room. I'm sorry but everyone complaining about how bad the room was should have already knew what they were paying for. The tower rooms are very nice and not much more. You get what you pay for people!

I stayed here one night when everything else on the strip was way out of my price range.  I tried to convince myself that it was just for one night, that part of Fear and Loathing took place here so at least I could have some sort of an ironic Hunter S. Thompson like experience here.  

Ugh.  

The casino was gross.  Vegas is flashy, for sure, but this was over stimulation at it's worst.  The hotel section was pretty bad too and the rooms decor was tacky.  I really didn't expect anything great and you definitely get what you pay for.  We went and watched the small circus show in the casino.  It was ok.  Wouldn't have gone to see it if we weren't staying there.  Kids were running around everywhere screaming at all hours of the night.  

The one plus side to my experience here is that I won $2500 on a slot machine.  So thank you Circus Circus for the cash.  

Haven't been back since.

I understand the room was very inexpensive for being in Las Vegas and I was NOT expecting 4 star service at all. But I could not get over how much the staff hates their jobs. It is written all over their faces. The front desk staff was rude-talked very fast, had to ask her to repeat herself a few times, and didn't explain where our room was at all. We got lost going to our room! Adventure dome was as we expected-but it was dirty, and again the staff had the look of death in their eyes. They did not give a crap about anyone; in fact they looked annoyed when my husband stated he wanted to purchase a rock climb and bungee jump for my kids. The food was not worth the price at all! And the coffee maker in my room didn't work. So glad it was one night. So glad I will never go back!!!

I would give it less than one star if I could.  Some backstory:  I came to Vegas for only one reason - my daughter was undergoing radiation treatment for cancer and needed to be isolated in her home.  When I found that out, I began searching for affordable hotel rooms so I could come to town and take my 3 grandkids out of the home during this time.  I did a lot of research finding a room I could afford, knowing I would have to buy meals for myself and 3 kids for 5 days as well. I finally settled on this hotel because I thought at least the rooms are reasonable and the kids would have something to do in the evenings (two are in school). I booked my room online, but needed to add an extra night a few days before travel. That is when I had my first negative experience with Circus Circus, when I spoke with their reservations person, I asked her, due to my situation, if they could waive all or at least part of the 23.00 "resort fee". She cut me off before I could finish my sentence with a loud and rude, "no" and went on to explain all the "benefits" I get for that fee, including a coupon book with "all kinds of free stuff".  I asked her if I was getting one of those books for each night of my stay, and was again told, "no". One coupon book per reservation.  I wasn't sure I really understood correctly or understood the reasoning of it, and I asked her to explain. Her answer was, "well, its pretty simple. You get one. Do I need to get a supervisor to explain that to you?" To which, I said "yes". So on the phone came a supervisor, and she explained one per room, but as a special "favor" offered to upgrade me to the west tower, which would put me closer to the casino. Apparently, she missed the whole part of my story that I was coming with 3 kids.  I never visited the casino.  So here are the reasons for such a low rating:

1. They told me all about the free stuff in the coupon book, such as rides and games, things for the kids to do.  There are no free rides. There are discounts on a ridiculous 37.00 ride bracelet and 2 for 1 roller coaster coupons. Same for games. Basically, all their coupons are buy something get something, or discount on something. NOTHING is FREE without spending MONEY on something else.
2. The rides and games close at 6. My grandson doesn't get out of school until 3:20. By the time we get back to the hotel, its after 4.  That gave him less than 2 hours to do anything
3. "High Speed" Internet. Another "perk" of the resort fee. The wifi they had has an upload\/download speed of 5 mbps. Useless. I couldn't do any work during the day
5. Restaurants. Blue Iguana. One step below taco bell. The food was tasteless. They charged me 3.99 for a little plastic tub, about 3 tablespoons, of guacamole. My granddaugher doesn't eat Mexican, so she had McDonalds. Lucky her. The rest of us did - and got sick. I've been changing some rank diapers for 24 hours now.  Our last night here, we at at Vince Neil's to take advantage of the coupon in the book - two 8 oz new york strips and a bottle of wine for $29.  We ordered cheese sticks as an appetizer, which was supposed to come with marinara and ranch dipping sauces. Instead, it came with 5 cheese sticks (for $10) laying in a bed of marina sauce. No ranch. My steak was over-cooked, so I sent it back. They never brought me out another one. When my granddaughter was done eating, the waiter appeared to see how everything was. I pointed to the empty spot in front of me and told him that I had sent it back with the server (guy brings your food out is not the waiter).  He went into the back and reaappeared with my steak. I told him it was a little late, we were ready to leave. Did he offer to discount my check? No. He offered to box it up to go.
6. The room itself.  These rooms are old, they stock cheap soap and a small off-brand combination shampoo\/conditioner. Motel 6 level. The "free in-room" coffee was cheap packs with powdered cream. The beds come with 3 sheets and a thin blanket - no coverlet or bedspread. The whole first day, I kept thinking, "well, anything can be forgiven with a nice, hot shower." Until I took one. The shower heads are your basic, cheapest shower head - reminiscent of my first low-rent apartment years ago. No water pressure at all, and no way to adjust anything. Bathtubs are standard with the curved shower curtain bar that's supposed to fool you into thinking its better.  In a nutshell, the room was below what you'd expect from a Motel 6.
7. Service. The first night here I called down to order a crib. They told me it was 22.40\/night to rent one! After complaining, they agreed to waive the fee, but then never brought the crib. I had to call again the 2nd night.

There were 2 nice things about this place, the maintenance man who came and opened our safe. Very nice guy. The housekeeper the first morning. Very friendly. 

This  was a nighmare. I know you think you'll be saving money, but don't. Go somewhere else.

A complete and utter dump.   Shame on you MGM for owning and neglecting this property.   The rooms are terrible.   Paint peeling and faded.  Bad smells.   Awnings tearing and damaged from the sun. Trash everywhere.  Weeds growing everywhere. The room we stayed in was 2nd floor with no ventilation in the bathroom (unless you call an old dirty unballanced fan that pulls air through a small filter and immediatly spits it back into the bathroom).  The air conditioner would blow the curtains across the room like a flag in the wind. We either had to put a shoe on the curtain or open them.  And the SMELL!  You can't open a window because there are no screens on window.  An old cathode ray tube telivision with faded and off colors! Because thier RV parking lot was full, they let us park in their RV park for $20 a night.  Our door opened to a full and overflowing dumpster.  At 1 am the people accross the hall kept slamming thier door because thier door was malfunctioning.   Those poor souls eventually got moved to another room.   As I decended the stairs the next morning I nearly slipped and fell on a corndog. The adventure dome so under staffed a good portion of the attractions and games are not even available for use.   Escalators broken.  Walkways not running.  I thought they must be bankrupt then I found out MGM owned them.  I remembered this place from when I was a kid in the 70's.    I took my family there based on that memory and what a complete let down.     The only saving grace the young lady who checked us in was incredibly friendly and the manager who refunded us our second night (we left early) was also very pleasant.  I wish I had taken thier names they deserve to work for a better company.

I recently stayed here with my GF and we had a lot of fun. We stayed in the Casino tower and it was very clean. The bed was really comfortable and roomy. The only negative review I had was the fact that the Valet was really slow but other than that I enjoyed my stay. I would definitely stay here again.

Until recently, I have never been to Vegas alone. Alone as in without parental guidance. Vegas Virgin yes I was. 

(wait. let's get this straight.. California Virgin is 3 months. What's a Vegas Virgin? 2 weeks? Then hell yes I'm a born again virgin fo sho)

Anyway, the only experience I have ever got of Vegas was Circus Circus. It's like carnival games but indoors. But with a lot more people. And way more expensive. And without the cotton candy? Actually don't quote me on that. I don't know if they have cotton candy. I grew up with a mother that told me cotton candy was made of old women's hair. But that's a whole 'nother story.

So back to carnival games. I suck at anything involving coordination which apparantly is the root of carnival games.

but I'm also notoriously lucky. See proof:

http:\/\/static.px.yelp.com\/photo\/wtTC028I84L_ZwR-1bUYJw\/l

My lucky monkey! Am I a cute 14 year old? Back off pedos.

I'm staying at Circus Circus for two nights and thus far I have no problem with it. The room is clean and spacious (no Food Network though, boo) and the staff friendly. The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is that it's a little out of the way -- but that's why I managed to book a room for something like $58 total for two nights! Score!

Circus Circus has not changed much since 1995, except that the buffet is $15.95 now instead of $4.95 back then!  The decor is stuck in the 1980's and the rooms are, unfortunately worse, with wildly circus-themed decors.  Much better choices!

i have never stayed here and there are no plans in the future either. but i always have fun here. the games are cool. I'm always wining stuffed animals. last visit it was 2 Domos. a dollar a game cant beat that better than the carnival. everything is a bargain here from drinks to souvenirs. i have no idea how the food is here.

Clean and functional rooms for a great price. 

This is quite obviously one of the older places on the strip and it seems that Circus Circus knows it and doesn't really care or try to keep up or compete with the rest of the strip. We stayed in the Circus Manor across the street from the big hotel. There is NOTHING luxurious or fancy about this place. You get a shower and a bed. The only high tech thing in their rooms are their Keurig coffee makers which are located IN THE BATHROOM. Totally didn't use that thing. GROSS. You do get a lot of space in your room so if you have kids this would be a good thing. The bed was surprisingly comfortable. I was able to get full nights sleep with out tossing and turning.

You pay a $15 resort fee per day with your stay, as if you would really use their facilities besides the casino unless you are traveling with children. Everything just seems cheesy and run down. Old video games, carnival games, rides and "circus" performers. They do offer free parking which is great! The pool area is decent. 

If you are wanting a luxurious Las Vegas experience don't stay here. If you want to stretch your dollar this is a ok place. We were only in the room to shower and sleep so it turned out to be a great value. Check in was easy, check out was easier. You are able to do express check out via text message. With the amount of volume that Circus Circus gets I really feel like they could put in a tad bit more effort in keeping this place modern. Even just a few new coats of paint and some small details like faucet fixtures in the bathrooms and carpets. 

I wouldn't say avoid the Circus, just know you are getting what you pay for.

How to sneak out of your "hotel" room at night.

Going in: First, grab the door handle and pull it towards you.  While you are pulling, insert key card and pull it out.  The left light should turn green.  While you are still pulling the door handle towards you, turn the door handle and unlock the door.  Hold still.  Take a breath.  Now slowly push the door open with your free hand.  Viola!  You're in.  When you close the door from the inside, turn the door handle down and make sure you close the door tight until you let go of the handle.  If you forget this or do it incorrectly, you're gonna wake everyone up.

Going out:  Open the door quietly.  The door will creak a bit, hopefully your roommates are passed out cold...  Grab onto the outside door handle.  Insert key card and pull it out.  When the lights turn green, crank the door handle down and hold it down.  As you're leaving, pull the door as tightly closed as possible before slowly letting the door handle return to its position.  If you forget this or do it incorrectly, you're gonna wake everyone up.

------------------------------------------------------------

About my stay:  $50 a night (for 2 beds) in the Manor Motor Lodge for 3 nights.  Registration is separated from the motel room, so drive your car to Manor Motor Lodge and then walk over to registration.

The room seemed clean, but the halls have a musty old smell.  You get a small safe next to the TV.  USE IT.  The bed was comfortable.

Bring your own soap and shampoo, the stuff they have sucks.  Bathroom was clean and the water pressure was good, but I wished the shower head would spray water down instead of at an angle.

There are 2 pools outside, but you can't go inside at night, which was the only free time I had.  Casino was meh... easy to get lost in, so beware.  Didn't get a chance to do arcade and rides, nor see any Circus-y stuff. 

If you're going to get one of those penny souvenirs in the "mall," use older pennies.  The new pennies I got from the cashier did not have enough metal in it to make a complete stamp.  Boo...

Yikes! I don't recommend staying here...this was our first trip to Vegas and we got a great deal on Groupon- didn't know any better. I could tell just by pulling up in the parking lot that it was old, dirty, and not in a safe place on the strip. It is at the very end of the strip. As we pulled up, my husband pointed to some motel looking buildings next to it and said "just be glad we aren't staying there." Well when we went to check in, it turns out that is where our room was! They have this old motel next to the main hotel that is not even attached, she explained this was the location of our room and offered me an upgrade to a deluxe room in the main hotel for $20. I took it because there was no way I was staying in that other place. If the room we upgraded to was a deluxe room then I don't even would want to know what the motel rooms looked like. This hotel is VERY dirty, the carpets in the hallways are all stained and there is trash laying everywhere. It smells terrible, the rooms are non smoking but the whole entire place smells like years of smoke and body odor, the rooms smell like they overdid the cleaning products just to cover up the smell. I didn't sleep at all, I felt grossed out the entire night. The walls are super thin and I could hear the man across the hall cursing and yelling and fighting with whoever was in the room with him. People walk through the casino and restaurants in slippers and pajamas. We checked out first thing the next morning and found another hotel. Won't stay here again and don't recommend it to anyone. Especially not people with kids! I would NEVER bring my kids here!

How can you complain?  Rooms on the weekend- yes WEEKEND- are sometimes priced below $20- and that isn't for the Manor rooms, that's for a tower room.  Three weeks ago, I booked a flight from San Francisco to Vegas, PLUS four nights at Circus Circus for $170.  Compared to other strip hotels, Circus Circus is filthy.  Once the largest casino and hotel in Vegas, it's now ready to be torn down.  It makes sense to stay at Circus Circus- I mean, who really stays in their hotel room in Vegas.  If you have a "west Tower" room, the rooms are as nice as Bally's or Harrah's- almost as nice as MGM.  It's always my recommendation to get a cheap room here, and then spend your time on the South Strip.  Take all that money you saved and play some blackjack on Fremont Street (better odds and selection).  I think it's silly how people spend over $200\/night for a room, when they're hardly there.  If you have children, go to Excalibur, not Circus Circus.  If you want to stay in you're room, and watch TV, and have no idea how to vacation, then spend $400\/night at bellagio or the Venitian, not Circus Circus.  If you're looking just for a room that's clean and will sleep you well, and a casino that gives you a "decent" gaming experience without the large crowds and high limits, then Circus Circus is for you.

For the price I payed to stay here ($200+ for one night) I was pissed at the poor quality. Yes it is on the strip but it is right at the very end and in the Vegas heat not really walking distance. Also I was put up in the "manor" rooms which meant that the room was in a separate building a good 5 min walk outside from the front desk and valet. The manors looked and felt exactly like a cheep motel any where in the country and the hallways and room (which was non smoking) both smelled. The free Wifi was so slow I could barely check my email and the bathroom and sheets where awful.  

Also because it is "family friendly" the place had none of the class and elegance I had previously experienced in Vegas. If you are an adult traveling with out children there is no reason to stay her, either save your money and stay off the strip of for $50 more stay in one of the much nicer hotels just down the road.

Horrible. The room had a weird smell, the windows were streaked and looked like someone had once sprayed windex on them and never bothered to wipe it off. They don't look at all as nice as the pictures online. And it was almost impossible to find the front lobby for checkin. When we first got there, we tried to place an order for pickup at the pizzeria downstairs. They wouldn't do pickup orders, only deliveries, and would charge an extra 15% delivery fee - what a joke! Never coming back.

Next time I go back I will definitely pay more to stay somewhere nicer. Extremely run down and dirty. Smelled like air freshener covering up smoke. The floors and walls were dirty. The room was standard, but again, below average. You get what you pay for I guess. The hotel was cheap and it showed! Also it was at the very edge of the strip so it took a long time to get to anything walking. That being said the staff was very friendly and helpful.

My husband and I have been staying here of the past 3 years on our anniversary. We love booking our stay here because of the friendly employees and the location is great. The Adventuredome is automatically 5 stars for us. Not including the Grill, the room and the overall experience. 

Room: Was spacious, quiet, clean and safe. 

Internet: Why do you need internet when you're in VEGAS?? Go out and have some fun! You can be on the internet when you are at home! ;)

Food\/Restaurants\/Buffets: We loved everything we ate there EXCEPT the Pizzeria. Everything else was great. 

Employees\/CheckIn\/Out: We had no real big issues. The first time we checked in, we did not know check in was at 3PM, so our room was not ready. We were there at around 11AM and we ended up taking a room that had two Queen\/Full beds rather than the King. But we were hardly in the room. We were out roaming around Vegas so it didn't make a difference much. 

Casino: I mean what can you say-its a casino! Slots, tables, people everywhere gambling having fun! As long as I can play my favorite game "GoldFish" then we have no problems! ;)

We will be there again this year for our anniversary! Can't wait!

Very unhappy with our stay at Circus Circus this past week. We chose it because we got a "great" deal on the room (clue maybe?!?), and we have young kids we thought might enjoy it. It's a very hard hotel to navigate, if you request a non smoking room you stay on the other side of the street, in a long forgotten building. I believe it is more than time to update your property. Please invest in your hotel!!

The outside of the building is trashy and looks more like barracks than a hotel with a resort fee. Our room was musty and hot when we got there. Our A\/C unit didn't work, I called maintenance to come fix it, and had to call to remind them since no one showed up. Our non smoking room smelled like smoke constantly. Our tv didn't work right and the bath tub leaked water all night.

There was a large stain on the ceiling and several stains thought out the room. The towels in our bathroom smelled like they had been soaked in bleach and hung to dry. 

The buffet was ok. Not terrible but not great. I'm glad we had a 2-for-1 coupon. 

The midway gaming center was full of games long past their prime. My kids enjoyed it though.

We will likely never stay again, and likely won't recommend to our friends. Please invest in upgrades!
This hotel is very dirty bugs nasty restroom in room dirty carpet pillows smell so bad wow I pay 240 2 nights for it wow I can't believe never come back to this piece nAsty hotel 1\/2 start

I don't have hot water, the cold water is literally brown, the tub doesn't drain, and management won't answer the phone. I would go down to the front desk but I haven't been able to wash my face or brush my teeth because the water is so dirty. How is this acceptable?!?! I understand that things go wrong sometimes, but the lack of response is ridiculous and very unprofessional. If there was an option for no stars I would've given this place that rating. This situation is unsanitary!

Forget about fear of clowns, if that's your issue.  I was more scared of the fact that my room was the scene of an obvious Crack party prior to my check in.  Upon entry none of the lamps would turn on,  so I reached for the lightbulbs.  Simply put, they were greasy with fingerprints.  The remote control was sticky.  The TV and wireless modem had been unplugged behind the TV cabinet and brownish toilet paper had been stuffed in the peephole.  No doubt some very important crackhead was trying to keep "the man" from surveilling their going's on in the room while they binged.

On to the exercise room.  After signing out a key for the workout area I had to be escorted there by security as it is impossible to find in that aging labyrinth.  Neither my key card nor the security guards worked so I had to knock to be let in.  I wish that I hadn't.  The smell of old, penetrating and sour sweat hit me like a sledge hammer.  Like if I kept my heavily used workout shorts moist and warm in a plastic bag for several years.  Not good.  It took more work to find an operational machine than anything I did in that terrible room.

Second night in the hotel I returned at 11pm, tired and ready to sleep in my crack sheets, when alas, my card key didn't open the door to my room.  I called the front desk and they sent security up.  The first security person's card didn't work so they had to call up another guard.  I told the first that, "this is Vegas, and if I were a betting person I would wager that the fact that my card worked earlier but doesn't now, and that your master card doesn't work, the door lock is broken."  My logic was apparently not sound enough because they called up another, whose card didn't work either.  They had to call up maintenance with some secret room opening device that I couldn't see.  I then had to relocate to a new room at 1am.  They were gracious enough to offer me late check-out for the inconvenience.

Finally, the food at the buffet.  I was really hungry.  However, my hunger was clearly not powerful enough to make a single item on the nasty buffet palatable.  I even tried simple things like the chicken strips just trying to get some sustenance, but even they were inedible.

If you are someone who has young children that you don't mind dragging around at midnight while you while away their college tuition, then this is the place for you, as it was for countless others of this description.

That ain't me though, and I won't be going back to the place that made me think even less of Vegas...

Visited and stayed at Circus Circus, "Manor Motor Lodge,"which is the motel portion of the resort. The rooms were older, but clean. The casino attracts lots of families and there's a lot of stuff for kids to spend money on. Didn't feel ripped off at all.

My advice is to get totally piss drunk and then go to your room. This way you will not notice the peeling wallpaper , stinky hallways and huge moths that fly into your room. It is definitely what you pay for.

This is old las vegas. If you're young and traveling with a group looking to have a good time and party, although it'll be cheap this isnt where u wanna stay. Vegas blocks are long, and you'd be taking a taxi everytime to get back and forth versus just walking bc this is waaaaaay north of the strip obviously. Maybe im just salty bc i lost too much money gambling here lol. We went to the weigh in live at MGM, but we did watch the fight on closed circuit here. It wasnt too bad. They had 4 HD screens in a big room. They sold drinks and food but it was totally a nickle and dime process. Whatever. Still had a nice ass time!

Stayed here on a four day trip, horrible customer service, said our rooms would be ready by two, and they were not.  Rooms were okay. Buffet was gross, bugs on the food. Only positive was the pretty cool circus they had. But I guess that's what you get for the price. Oh well.

You get what you pay for. It's one of the cheapest hotels on the strip (the last one I believe). If you come to Vegas expecting a luxurious hotel, don't choose Circus Circus. It's old school , hasn't been much updated. But if you come to Vegas on a budget and don't mind walking to the rest of the strip then this one is relatively cheap. Nothing fancy but you have a bed to stay in and showers to get ready in to leave for whatever is planned.

I couldn't stress enough to splash out a bit more and never stay at this run down hotel. From start to finish our 3 night stay here was absolutely horrible. From stained sheets, to a slanted room, a safe that was locked open on arrival, the 5-10 trek just to get out of the casino. We stayed in the skytower, we couldn't have possible been any further away from the front of the building if we tried. Zero customer service skills.

Thank you SO much for the wonderful lady who answered the phone today. I was trying to book a room for our Cinco De Mayo weekend and all I got from her is all attitude. Maybe she woke up on the wrong side of the bed or something but all I was asking is regarding the resort tax and deposit. Yes I can read online and it does say what it is but it didn't come up right in my total that's why I called. So no you don't need to sound so sick and tired of explaining to your future customers. Go find another job that you would love instead of making your company pay for it. We'll just book the room somewhere else.

Hmm ... how is it that they haven't torn this place down and built something spectacular in its spot? I have to say this is probably the dirtiest, grossest place on the strip and remains so even though they have that mid-way gaming area. The food here is definitely sub-par, the rooms smell and the curtains are STAINED?? 

The casino itself has terrible ventilation so all you smell is smoke and it gets into your clothes unlike when you walk through a nicer hotel with better ventilation. They do have cheap tables and cheap eats but goodness I would pay more for better company. I am waiting for the re-vamp and built of something fantastic here ... hopefully soon ...

When my husband and I booked a two night stay at Circus Circus with one full day in Vegas. When we arrived the first evening, they did not have our pre-payed reservation in the system that I had booked through Spirit Airlines. The employees were extremely unhelpful and would not call our travel agent to figure out the issue. I ended up on hold with the company for 45 minutes until they closed and bumped me off the line. We payed for the rooms again and went to bed extremely frustrated. I called again the next morning and after 4 hours of back and forth calls between our travel agent and Circus Circus, they finally figured the issue out. As for the hotel itself, the walls of the rooms are paper thin. We could hear our neighbor's baby crying off and on all night with him yelling at it to "shut up." Our floor also smelled like pot and you could hear TV's and conversations next door. I would not stay here again.

Just a heads up... I'm reviewing this place solely on what it offers, entertainment-wise. I always go to Circus Circus for the Midway area. It's a great place to take your kids, friends, or even your date. They have free shows going on like every 30-40 minutes and have lots of arcades and games to play. How much you spend in this area is up to you. Even if you don't spend a dime, you can still enjoy the free shows (acrobats, jugglers, trapeze, can't beat that!). Then of course, there is the Adventuredome. You are never too old to enjoy an indoor theme park. Most of those rides aren't extreme, so its a safe bet for most people.
