My friends came to Vegas for a few nights and they spent most of their time inside the Adventuredome and Midway area. I definitely had no problem frequenting these places with them throughout their trip and I still do every weekend.

After booking my room 6 months in advance when we attempted to check in we were informed that our room level was totally booked and not avalible so they were going to "Upgrade" us into a suite.  Liking the sound of that we took the key and headed to the room.  Upon ariving we found the suite to not be so sweet.  The furniture had patches on it, with a fridge that  the door wasn't even attached, the bathroom toilet was leaking.  But the biggest problem, was the fact that they were trying to put 4 of us into a suite with a queen bed and they were bringing up a roll away.  had we not already paid for it I would have taken my business elsewhere from then on.  We were moved into another romm more suited for us and stayed in that room, but even this NON smoking room had burns on the bed, the carpet, and the bedding had multipul burns.  We attempted to have them change the sheets for us, but when we asked they told us it would be done the following day, but when in vegas you dont get back to your room until late, and when we did the comferter had been changed but the sheets had not.  We will not be staying here ever again.
  The so called bar of this hotel Rock and Rita's shuts down at 10.  How can you be in vegas and have a bar that shuts down before you even get back to the hotel?  No thanks.
  The only part of this hotel that we will be going back for is the pizzaria!  If we were locked in this hotel we would have eatten here everyday.

OMG... do not stay here! My girlfriend had stayed here when she was a lot younger and wanted to go back again to see what it was like. When we booked through hotelscombined we got a 1\/2 price flash sale and only paid about $39\/night for what were supposed to be the better rooms. 

This hotel is horrible and the worst we encountered in the US. That's a considerable feat considering we did 9000kms across 10 US states over a month. The hotel is horrible. People trying to sell you stuff every time you walk through it. It just seems run down and old. And there is a horrible musty smell throughout the tower we stayed in. Not surprising we found mold on the walls of our bathroom. The walls are also quite thin and we could hear screaming kids till 1am two rooms away on two nights. This hotel is clearly for families travelling on a budget. Do yourself a favour and look elsewhere.
Rude !! They lie on the website . For instance, the details about the room are scams . Youll find a 1990 TV  and so on .Moreover, service is bad , I won't recommend it at all .
If anyone doesn't know what to expect when you book a room at circus circus that's on you, it's been around forever and is known as the cheap dump at the end of the strip. It's not belagio north lol.

Came to Las Vegas for my friend's wedding and I stayed here while they stayed at the Imperial Palace in a higher end room.  I spent 1\/3 of the money they did and actually had a very pleasant stay in a nice room.  I didn't stay in the main hotel but in the little apartment complex rooms that are detached.  My room was very quiet and very cold for it being over 100 degrees outside.  My friends however were very jealous of my room because it was quite big and everything worked.  As where there room was a bit run down and requiring maintenance.  

The only real drawback here is that you'll have to walk quite a ways to get to the really good casinos and attractions further along the strip.  Also there are indeed a lot of children here but I could care less because I rarely spent time at the casino here or my room.  I come to Vegas to explore, not camp out at my hotel.  They have great food here too and the best hotel rates for the quality of the rooms in all of Vegas in my opinion.  

Not for nothing, they do have loose slots in the Casino, and they would be a good start or end to an evening of gambling further along the strip.  But I cannot stress enough how cheap the rates are here, I was usually half lit and fell straight to sleep in my ice cold room when I returned from a night of debauchery anyways.  For gamblers I recommend this place because it will save you money and allow you to gamble longer, just remember to bring your most comfortable walking shoes.

You get what you pay for I guess. Not a place I'll be returning. I don't ask for much, but when you walk into a casino after being out all day in the heat it'd be nice if it were cooler inside. Nope! Not here! I'm not sure if the air conditioner was broken or was just terrible but it was 80+ inside at all times! You start sweating the second you walk inside. Room AC works amazing though.  Every employee that I came in contact with, minus 4 of them, were rude and just acted like they were over their job. The 4 that were so great is the reason I gave 2 stars. The sportsbook... It's march madness and you have 2 people on your registers, your TVs aren't HD?? And they wouldn't put the sound on to the main games and the air wasn't blowing in their either. 

I understand this place has been around since the Bugsy Siegel days, but y'all should update some or just close down.

So let me start out by saying that if I could give negative star ratings, I would. I have never in my life felt so nasty. This hotel is disgusting. I wish we would have read more of the reviews and did research before staying here. We checked in at 2 in the morning. Between the time we checked in until 3:45 am, we moved rooms 3 times. The sheets where nasty and had old blood stains. The beds had hair from previous guests as well, the bathroom and there was a bug in one of the beds. They upgraded us to a suite and comp'd is 2 breakfast Buffett. Idk what or why the new room was considered an upgrade because it was still nasty. Which in all honesty, if the rooms are this nasty, I have no desire to eat anything prepared, stored or brought into this hotel. I have to say that the manager on duty whose name is Carrie, was more than helpful and apologetic for everything that we had issues with. To be honest, the staff was nice, but the entire housekeeping staff needs to be fired. This makes no sense that we had 3 rooms in a row that where that nasty. Even the upgraded suite was dirty and smelled like cigarettes, but after driving 12 hours to get here and having to change rooms so many times, we just slept with our clothes on. I've never stayed anywhere that makes me feel as dirty as I felt while in this place. I can honestly say that I WILL NEVER STAY AT CIRCUS CIRCUS EVER AGAIN. No matter how much they want to give us free, they can keep it because there is no reason that any place in the service industry should be that nasty. I have to agree with one of the reviews that are on here as well, this hotel is definitely where you see all the people of Walmart.

rcus Circus. What to say? About 20 years ago, I think this was one of the finest hotels throughout Las Vegas. It is nicely decorated, good casino, although it is far down on the Strip.
Today, it is not as nice. It is worn, smell Christmas in the corridors of a non-nice way. When we checked in we had to wait in line for almost 30 minutes, which is crazy. We paid for a continental breakfast. Breakfast?! What you may choose to include milk, coffee, juice or a bottle of water. Then a croissant, muffin or danish. Finally, an apple or a banana. The bananas are almost always the end, one is allergic to apples, there is no one to do. If you want a cup of tea instead of coffee will cost you $ 4. The queues for breakfast is miles long.
Not even the staff is especially nice. They stand behind the counter and just looks bored. You get no information about the hotel, about where the breakfast is, where the pool is located, or you can pay $ 9.95 to receive a coupon booklet with a lot of discounts.
Must commend the hotel room. It is great, sofa, fridge, big giant comfy bed and free Wi-Fi.
Despite the nice hotel room is not the hotel worth more than 1 star.

If you choose this hotel please do not book a "Run of house room" out of all the hotels My husband and I have stayed in whenever we come to Las Vegas this is by far the worst... upon arrival to our room we had to insert then then re insert our room keys over and over again because the room door seemed somewhat damaged and would not open immediately after inserting our key after we finally got into our room we noticed that the ceiling smoke alarm was broken called management and they sent an engineer to come fix it we also noticed that there was blood stains on our pillow , small but noticeable very disgusting so we used a fresh bed set for the night but the next day when we return from the strip we noticed that room service had been present in the room but the made our beds with the same sheets including the same blood stained pillow case also we noticed upon check out morning we found a small roach like bug just hanging out on the second bed!!! super nasty I really don't get it because the circus circus in Reno is one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in I was hoping for the same out of the Vegas branch but the difference is like day and night I'm super surprised if you absolutely had to stay here get a room in the towers I'm pretty sure the experience would be better as far as the run of the house I advise stay away especially if your with children room felt very dirty. Last but not least, the back of the toilet had a leak so we had to keep a towel on the floor to not step on the water while using the bathroom. Hopefully, they upgrade a bit so they can somewhat be like the Circus Circus in Reno.

If you have kids with you in vegas this might work for you. If you're 21+ why are you looking to stay here?

I've stayed here for SEMA, I never like staying here since I turned 21, but it is a step up from Sahara and a cheaper alternative to stratosphere. The rooms here are usually the cheapest on the strip. And if their not, then don't stay here.

""Meh. I've experienced much better.

Too crammed up & smokey. I like the look of the outside in the night time with the lights though. Happy about my favorite slot machine they have there too. I also like the fact that they have two Merry go rounds, because instead of riding horses, your sitting at slot machines, going around & around. LOL

My brother was disappointed that they didn't have much kidie games like a real "Circus Circus" would. I guess he was expecting this circus circus to look like the one in Reno; much better!! Even I think so too...

Glad I came here once, just to check it out. That way, I don't have to come here again to waste my time...
Had a blast!! Some rides were closed. :( overall great place. Food and drink!!! Room was nice and clean!

circus circus, my favorite place in Vegas.
yes, it's run down but 
I visit here every time I am in Vegas.

1. arcade and games
2. $2 black jack table
3. cards are washed by hand not machine
4. always has some kind of deal
5. one time I win over $100 at the slot with the free slot play they gave me.
6. you can get a last minute room for cheap

the buffet I don't recommend. unless you like fried chicken.

PS the Halloween maze is amazing.

Ok seriously? So this place is out of control.  I will NEVER return.  I didn't care for Vegas as a whole but this establishment really did it in.  The service was absolutely horrible.  They need some serious Customer Service intervention.  At first sight I was mesmarized, as I am sure all Vegas Virgins are.  We got an impromtu tour across the entire Circus Circus ground because they can't seem to articulate their own maps, but I don't blame them neither could anyone else.  We ran into plenty of people in their Peasant Wing where the project housing\/extra rooms are located.  When we finally got to our rooms, after our hour long hike (with 2 kids and  my mother, we were highly amused.  I felt like I had been thrust through a time warp to the 1980s.  WTH!  My husband and I laughed for about an hour at the decor.  I really don't think I had a decent meal the entire time.  I felt like I was vacationing at a mall\/airport.  The mallport of America.  The amusement park was pretty fun. My kids had a good time there.  The rides were exciting.  I loved the 4D theater and the roller coaster.  The lines were not long either. That was about the only decent money we spent.  That place needs to be torn down and rebuilt completely...starting from bottom up..all the way up.

There are just too many affordable options on or near the strip to justify staying here. First off the manor sweets should not be offered as a circus, circus property. Bad! Service here is like a bad hotel, not up to Vegas standards. Food options are bad. The Steakhouse is legit but if you are staying at Circus Circus you probably can't afford to eat there every meal. Avoid this place if you can.
Kids like it. Great variety of rides for all ages, including the video games. Cheap gambling. Have never actually stayed here, just visited. Fun little cheap stores.

We just got back from vacation and I'm glad we got the hell out of there!! Here is what my experienced went at Circus Circus...........

The lady in the front was not friendly at all. I tried to crack a joke and she wouldn't have it. Where is your sense of humor. 

Our room was very out dated and the furniture was chipped and dusty. Sheets where clean from what I saw. There was a piece of used soap on the floor of our bathroom. Yuck, it stayed there the entire time. Hall ways where old looking and very outdated. The smell was horrible. Our lovely neighbors where smoking pot the last night we were there. The smell came into our room. It woke me up and I got a nasty headache. They had an infant in the room with them. BAD PARENTS! We called security but nothing was done! There is a new rule at the hotel about smoking. It's a $300 fine if you smoke in the rooms. Our view was somewhat ok. They just open the new water park. It was awesome and all the kids were very pleasant. I don't know if I would ever stay there again. I do not want to smell weed it made me hungry. I almost robbed the Krispy Kreme doughnut shop down stairs. I wanted to eat so bad damn marijuana smokers next door to us. 

Location is not a very good one. This Hotel caters to a lot of families and there should be more security out in the premises. There are a lot of homeless people outside the building. These panhandlers make more money than playing slots. I almost stood there and asked for change, that would of paid my whole damn vacation. 

Circus Circus is cheap to stay  and it's right on the strip far away from the luxury casinos. Avoid the Circus Circus Manor in the back. I saw a lot of shaddy folks out there when I was in the pool area.

Do not stay at the manors no matter how cheap.

They are too far from anything and you'll be walking miles to get to the casino.

Circus Circus is also a really old casino and needs major updating. My room had stains on the wall and a roach in the room.

Bed was comfy tho.

While on vacation we stayed at Circus Circus for a week. We stayed in the Manor part of the hotel. The stay was great there was little noise or issues. The rooms are standard with 2 queen sized beds an older tv and a large closet for clothes. The AC worked fine and kept the room cooled thru the night and day. The bathroom was also standard tub\/shower with very hot water combo and room on the counter for your items. The vent in the bathroom needed some updating due to not keeping the steam out if the room. The only issue was that we were so far from the front of the hotel to walk to the Vegas strip, but we found our way thorough the hotel to the front. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. When you had questioned the staff answered then very quickly. The hotel has several different little shops for souvenirs and food and drinks. The prices are a little high but this is Vegas and you expect it. They do also have several different food places to eat including Vince Neil's restaurant. This also has Krispy Kreme Donut's, Starbucks, Mc Donald's and the Buffet. We had breakfast at the buffet and there were an array of food including fruit, waffles and standard fair. If you divest here they also include brunch with a full lunch menu. The price is $18.99 per person, but it is all you can eat. They also have a full floor and several different area of machine and table games. The second floor is mostly for the kid with games and amusements. They also have a place for the kids and adults called Aventuredome which has kid and adult rides. This is a separate area on the second floor on the other side of the hotel. All in all this was a great stay at this hotel and I would book this place again.

Sitting at the first bar you come upon as you enter the Casino.  Wife is playing slots.  Pays for a glass of wine that doesn't match what she ordered.  Wife comes to bar and asks Tammy (waitress) if she could return the drink\/change the drink, or whatever.  Tammy pretends that she's never seen her before, and basically tells her it's her problem.  

All this being said, the oddly poor treatment of my wife, the bartender Tom, was amazing.  

Likely won't be back

Circus Circus is the seediest joint I've been to on the strip.  It wins my personal prize.

You know what though?  It's not pretending.  You can go in there and play some cheap games with your low rent pals and have a good time.

There's also a pretty awesome steakhouse which was completely empty when we went there.  Aged steaks and serious drinks.  Think of it as a value-priced Mortons.

Avoid the penny pinching deadbeats at the poker tables.  Go elsewhere for that, but everything else is fine if you don't mind a bit of dust and grime here and there.  If you do, you had better pawn your ass and head over to the other end of the strip to play with the beautiful people.

We stayed here for a quick overnight on our way out of town. The hotel seems dated - as are many in LV - but the service and amenities were great. There are tons of activities for kids which was important for us. The room was clean and bed very comfortable. We ordered room service which arrived piping hot and was very reasonably priced. This hotel was very inexpensive which made it all the better! 

I would definitely stay here again!
Cant believe these low reviews lol.....if you want better then by all means go spend $500 a night at the Bellagio

Most horrible casino\/hotel I have ever been to! 

We checked in late at Circus Circus and they gave us a room in the back buildings located in Manor4.  We were suppose to have a room in the main tower but we did not get that.  We proceed to our room and once we finally figured out where it was at we were in disbelief that this was even part of the casino.  I think this is the most ghetto casino in existence in Las Vegas!  As we walked to our hotel room I felt as if I was in the hood getting ready to experience a drive-by shooting!  We quickly walked to our room through the smoke-filled hallways.  Our rooms were disgusting!!!  There was even hair in the toilets and sinks that had not been properly cleaned after the last guests checked out.

We didnt even want to touch the beds and decided that any other hotel in Vegas would be a better experience than what we experienced here at Circus Circus.  They seriously need to retire this building from the strip.

We will NEVER be staying or going here again.

Ok so this isn't a five star hotel! So I'm going to rate it off that. We stayed at Skyrise Tower. It honestly wasn't bad. We stated just one night cause our trip was quick! This also was our first time staying in this hotel. I booked this hotel because we thought the kids would love it (and they did) it's kid friendly which is a huge plus for us! Even though we stayed one night, the kept are kids busy the whole time we were here . Now I was sketchy about staying here because of the reviews, but I had a few friends stay here and said their experience wasn't bad. So I decided to book it. As soon as I got into our room I started checking for mold, roaches, bed bites etc. & found nothing. The only bad thing I could say is the elevators took forever, I think only like 3 worked so it took foreverrrr to get where ever we wanted to go. It was pretty crowded in the halls due to that.

Upon  walking into check in this line was ridiculous that should have been a warning that this stay was not going to be good. It took a hour to check in, we then headed to our room and the air was not working after calling more then 3 times we finally got someone to come. Mind you we came during the week on a tues not the busiest day of the week. They finally fixed the air, but the wait was horrible. The bathroom is tiny and where the coffee pot was stored DISGUSTING!!! We then took our kids to the arcade area over prices and a bunch of kids running rampant. The only reason we stayed there was for our kids, NEVER again!!! We will be staying at Excalibur or somewhere else this place is disgusting.

Dear Lord, I could have easily spared myself the humiliation by not letting the world know that I stayed here. 

On a super last minute trip to Vegas this past January, Circus Circus was the best deal we could find for the week we were going (CES convention= $$$ for hotels) and with the amount of broke people going with us. 

My friends and I booked to stay in the "Manor Rooms." Little did we know that these rooms were actually across from the main building\/tower (as if we weren't far enough away from the center of the strip). 

Positives:
-Spacious! Lots of room for luggage and moving around
-Fridge! So rare in Vegas rooms, unless you're splurging on a suite or whatever. This kept all our booze nice and cold.
-Self-parking
Negative:
-Broken hairdryer, iron, and light. We called the hotel about these issues and the person  they sent over to fix it never came. 
-I know its only across the street from the main tower but staying in these rooms didn't make us feel like we were in Vegas whatsoever! 

Bottom Line: will not stay here again. ever.

Worst hotel stay in a very long time. After traveling all night we arrived at the hotel with 3 very tired children at 2:30 am. Went to check-in for the room we had reserved weeks in advance, only to be told the room was not ready and we would have to wait " at least 30 minutes." Came back 30 minutes later and were told the room was still not ready. We asked how much longer were told we don't know. When we asked to speak with a supervisor she was incredibly rude and unhelpful. Ended up waiting over 1 1\/2 hours. If I could give less than 1 star I would! Horrible customer service, less than sub-par hotel. We will never stay here again and will be telling everyone about our terrible experience.

I stayed in the 3rd floor Room 343 and the carpet was dirty. It needs to be replaced. I don't see any security patrolling the rooms? However the housekeeper was friendly and sweet! I regret booking the room there. Next time, I will pay more and stay at Treasure Island.

BEWARE OF THEFTS AT CIRCUS CIRCUS!!! My room at Circus Circus, LV was broken into last weekend. It appears that the thieves used the "Do Not Disturb" sign to break in. CC DENIES "ANY AND ALL LIABILITY" as there is a "non-liability" sticker on the inside of the room door and there is a safe in the room. 

I guess if I were "self-insured" I would be hesitant to accept any liability as well. However, I would have at least had the courtesy to discuss the matter personally over the phone rather just send a denial letter.

BUYER BEWARE!!! Before you or any loved ones consider staying at Circus Circus, please take this post into consideration and pass it on.

To date, worst hotel I have stayed at.  I booked my family vacation here because the "new water slides and renovated rooms" lured me in; normally we stay at Mandalay Bay because of the lazy river and wave pool.  First off, the pools were disgustingly dirty!!!! I jumped in once because it was 112 degrees and my eyes literally burned for hours! I'm surprised i didn't get an eye infection! My kids were disappointed that only 2 of the slides were working, one was out of service.  The bathrooms don't have ventilation so we were all suffocating while taking showers!! The ice machine on our floor didn't work!  the elevator kept jamming! WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! We were supposed to stay 3 nights and checked out after the 2nd! My kids couldn't take it anymore and did not want to jump in that dirty pool again.  Needless to say they refused to refund me the last night, which I didn't even care.  There was no way i was staying another night in this ratchet filthy hotel.

The only reason my friends and I stayed here was because it was cheap and they were having a promotion for a particular weekend I decided to fly out here.

The place is outdated, musty and in need of a facelift. The hotel has two towers and has full casinos downstairs, restaurants, mini marts, bars and the midway where you can watch free circus acts and play games.

The room we got had two queen beds with a bathroom. It was small, smelled musty and the walls were so thin. You could hear the family in the next room. They didn't have a fridge and the given toiletries were minimal. The only good thing about the room was probably the beds and the thick curtains to keep the sun out. During the night\/mornings there would be weird noises, every time someone would flush their toilet or shower you could hear the pipes making loud noises in the wall. I didn't get much sleep because of the darn room!

I enjoyed the mini bar downstairs in the lobby where you can buy yard drinks, definitely get a strong Strawberry Daiquiri! Keep the cup to refill, saves you about ten bucks. The Westside Deli and the Pizzeria is pretty good to fill up your tummy as well. Hit up the Blackjack tables, my friends got pretty hot tables here.

This place is cheap, but inconveniently located off the strip. So this is idea for families or those not really here to fully indulge in sin city. 

Paid about $570 for 3 nights here.

This place is almost a 5 star for me.  Almost.

It's clean, it's reasonably priced, and it's on the strip.

Parking is free (though it is at most hotels in Vegas).

Our AC wasn't working when we arrived.  We called the front desk.  They sent a maintenance guy, and he came up and had it working in no time.  We had no other issues after that.

The only thing that keeps it from being a 5 star for me are two things: #1: they nickel and dime even worse than other hotels (like $7 to receive a small package from Amazon!), and there are people roaming the front lobby who will accost you *EVERY SINGLE TIME* you leave the damn hotel to try and get you to buy 'half price tickets' to various Vegas shows.  It got to the point where I started ignoring them like they weren't even there.

Horrible horrible horrible!!!! Smelled like urine in the hallway and was sketchy feel to it like I was expecting somebody to come offer us Crack at any point. My daughter needed to use the restroom and we had her wait till we left the hotel instead. We called front desk immediately and asked to cancel our stay. We paid the extra money and went to Palms instead. Never again.. sorry!

I would give it 0 stars if I could. Just checked in and I'm already searching for another hotel to stay at. Booked rooms online. Our rooms are not even connected to the hotel. Had to go outside cross the street with my luggage through another parking lot to get to my room. I did not feel safe wheeling my luggage at night. It would have been better to stay at motel 6. The curtains look like they are falling off and won't close all the way I had to rig them to keep them shut. I can here the people in the room next to us talking. This place seems so shady!!  NEVER AGAIN!!  ******* update......Okay I update my review from negative 10 stars to 1 star only because Belinda at the players club check in helped ease my mind and made things better for us. If I was doing this rating on Belinda's customer service I would give it a 10 she was awesome in explaining our room upgrade and changes.  We have checked out of the circus circus Manor hell hole and are now stating in one of the updated rooms (FYI it's still weird when I hear everytime the neighbors flush their toilets .... But that's just me).  FYI unless your kids already know about the birds and the bees you might want to keep them at home. Even in the upgraded room the walls are thin. I'm writing this as my neighbors are having a "great time" next door. So if you don't want your neighbors knowing when you start and finish you might want to keep it down lol.

This is an old family style hotel, which is evident in the lack of hotel room mini bar, which was given a circus theme.

Our room: Although spacious, upon entering the first light switch was blown which meant you had to fumble through the room to find a working lamp. The bathroom also needs some serious attention as there are water stairs on the walls and the shower cannot fully be turned off, meaning you listen to dripping water all night. The lack of mini bar, fact there is no menu for room service or television channels was also a negative. 

The hotel: This is an older hotel so between the old and worn carpets alongside the serious spend required to update the whole building, this is not a place for lovers or high-rollers. This is a hotel for families. 

The hotel in general smells of stale cigarettes and while the staff checking in are tops... This has to be more about the hotel. 

All said, if you we coming to Vegas with a group of money minded friends to get hammered and visit another casino you should be fine. If you are working, go somewhere with good wifi and a clean shower. Not Circus Circus.

I didn't expect a 5 star hotel at all for the price but the dirt...in the room and the hall way ...the noise... I can not stand!!!The view in our room was nothing but roof in which I requested to be roomed in the TOWER!!!.... Didn't happen... So crowded... I regret... There are lots of hotels that similar to their price range yet very clean and quite... Never stay there again.. Never...

I don't know why there's so many bad reviews on this place, but I love it.  I always win at this casino.

I've never stayed at the hotel or ate from the buffets here but gambling in this place is A LOT better then any other casino because when we come here, we always win something.

When you come here, (and any other casino) make sure to get the Player's Card.  They have a deal right now that if you spend $10 they give you $5 for free or spend $20 and $10 are free.  Make sure to get this as they give them to you as chips and you have to go play at the tables.  You CANNOT cash them in but if you win at the tables, you get your money plus extra back.

I came up about $40 on tables and $20 on slots.  My boyfriend came up about $50 on tables and $20 on slots.  

This place doesn't look all that run down, maybe the outside does a little bit but the inside looks decent.  Playing tables at this place has been the easiest compared to all the other casinos i've gambled in.  I came up money, so that's all that matters.  A lot of other casinos take your money in a blink of an eye but this casino, is for me, much more lenient then the other ones.

I don't know why any family would take their kids to Vegas as there's always naked pictures on the floor, passed out drunk people outside and cigarette smoke EVERYWHERE but if you do decided to take them, this place is probably where you should bring your family as they have a huge arcade on the 2nd floor and they're always showing acrobatic shows every so often.

As a kid, I'd give it 5 stars, but as someone old enough to enjoy the many pleasures of Las Vegas, I'd give it 3 stars just for the sake of it being a kid-friendly establishment. We need a place like Circus Circus in Las Vegas. We gotta have a place to start them off young, ya'know.

This review is for the Circus Circus Manor Motor Lodge. Avoid the Manor Lodge at any cost! 
I finished my two weeks trip in Utah and was heading back to Los Angeles. My plan was staying at Las Vegas for One night and then continued my trip back home. Because it was Friday, every hotel in Las Vegas was expensive. I picked Circus Circus since it had a decent rate. Still, it cost me 134 dollars for one night. When I I booked the hotel, I didn't pay attention to the fact that the room was in the Manor Motor Lodge. Now I regretted my carelessness. The Manor Motor lodge is nothing but a motel.
The motor lodge is separated with the casino and the West Tower. After check-in, you will have to walk a long way to your room, which is not a pleasant experience considering the hot Summer of Las Vegas. The worst part is that the room is outdated. Furniture in the room is exactly what you will expect in a Motel 6 or Super 8. In addition, one desk lamp in my room was not functioning. If you stay during weekdays for 30 dollars per day+ the 14 dollars resort fee, it is somehow acceptable. However, if I spend 134 dollars for one night in this room, I really expect more than motel 6 experience.
If you spend your vacation in Las Vegas, I will suggest you spending a little bit more picking one of the room in the West Tower or going somewhere else.

We stayed in the Casino Tower a couple weeks ago. We got a double queen room and from what the check in person told us, the rooms in the casino tower are the most recently updated rooms. The rooms were really cheap, these are considered the nicest rooms and it only cost us $45 for the room for one night. 

We got a room so we could take our 5 year old to the Adventure Dome. We played all day and our feet were killing us so we decided to go up to our room and figure out dinner. We ordered from the pizza place that is in the casino. They deliver and the little one was pooped and grumpy so that was perfect. No need to lug her around any longer. We ordered a large pizza and wings and it cost $40ish. Totally regretted not trekking it back across the casino to go to mcdonalds to save money, but it was nice to  have a little pizza party in our room. Also, if you think you will be thirsty, bring your own drinks to your room. Sodas cost $4 from vending machine

The room was standard. It was nice and clean and we were actually shocked how nice it turned out being. Will stay again when we decide to go to Adventure Dome again. 

One thing I will say that is negative is the elevator is SO super loud. We were around the corner from one but all night long we could hear it going up and down.

Whoa, this place is so run down! My boyfriend and I were in Vegas and it was 108 degrees outside. After the pool party at Tao Beach at our hotel, we decided to hit up Circus Circus to battle each other in some good arcade games. It was quite a bit of walk! Circus Circus is on the strip but really far North. When we got inside, over half the machines weren't working. Sadly, we already exchanged our money in the coin machine before checking the games.

Anyways, since we didn't get to play at their arcade, they have the carnival games where you toss balls to win prizes. My boyfriend and I won several stuff animals - it was pretty much free. Everything we touched, we won. They are good quality toys too! Not the generic cheap ones that you usually get at the faire! i got a couple Yoshi's and Angry Birds, and a random cheetahs and several other stuff like a giraffe? hahah

The circus acts are fun and they're free! If the machines were working, I'd probably spend several hours here but because nothing was working - there wasn't much to do and it makes you really pay attention to the outdated, dirty environment.

Not reviewing the rooms\/hotel amenities. I'm just reviewing the experience of hanging out in the casino\/arcade for a few hours. The arcade\/circus area is really fun. It's probably one of the few truly kid-friendly places in Vegas. (Though, if you're bringing your kid to Vegas, I'm seriously judging you hardcore right now.)

The games a tiny bit pricey, but hey, you may walk out of there with a giant stuffed dog that you think is adorable but you really don't have any space in your apartment for it...like I did.

I got to this place after hearing about it for so damn long and it was not at all what I was expecting. I would have been perfectly fine without even walking into this place. The place is obviously over crowded as one may expect but it's just better not being a part of this and going to an other spot in stead. The location is ok just left me wondering...

Circus Circus is a family hotel. My family used to stay here when we went to Vegas because it was cheap and had a midway section and it was on the strip, albeit not in the middle. But it allowed my parents to gamble and us kids to play games, all in the same casino, and that was good enough. I love playing midway games and winning stuffed animals, so this would be why I give Circus Circus 3 stars. Yes, the hotel rooms are not that great and sometimes smell funny, but come on, it's CHEAP! Not to mention there used to be a 99 cent margarita and hot dog next door at Slots-A-Fun. I'm not sure if it's still there. I know there's a lot of renovation with the towers and Vegas in general.

I didn't stay anywhere near here on my most recent visit to Vegas, but I came to play the midway games. There's something that makes this casino a bit depressing now. It seemed like no one was here and the games were harder and the stuffed animals not as cute. Also, back in the days, a lot of cute guys worked at the midway. Now, it's like all old people. It made me really sad. What the hell happened??
Great time with the kids.... The staff from the valet to the vendors were super nice & professional. The entertainers that come on the midway stage were good as well.

I first arrived in Vegas too early to check into Circus Circus, so I stayed at the local Red Roof Inn for a few hours to get some sleep. 

I wish I would have just stayed at the Red Roof Inn the entire time, because it was so much nicer than this massively gross hotel. 

The only positive about this place is the massive free parking garages that they have. That's it. 

Between the air conditioning in the rooms that hardly worked, the disgusting elevators, the difficult staff, the annoyingly pushy housekeeping people, the overpriced food\/alcohol\/EVERYTHING that they have in their building, it makes for an unpleasant experience. 

Circus Circus is probably the cheapest large hotel out of all the big ones in Vegas - But do yourself a favor, whether you're coming with kids, or a significant other, save your money, stay at the nicely remodeled Red Roof Inn down the street where you'll save a ton of money that you can then spend on doing fun stuff in Vegas. Sinking your money into this damn Circus place is just a waste.

The only reason it got 1 star was for the price and free circus acts which I haven't seen yet. The non smoking rooms are mixed with the smoking rooms so you smell the smoke. The wallpaper is peeling and the tub\/shower is breaking apart. The rooms smell musty. Very inconvenient parking and access to the monorail. During our stay the fire alarm went off at 4 am with no announcement so we thought there was a fire. We pack our things quickly only to find it's a false alarm. The hallway smells strongly of marijuana, and so someone had set off the fire alarm due to smoking. I called the front desk and had to wait 20 minutes for them to answer and all they say is "sorry" and "people are allowed to smoke it with a prescription but if you can smell it in your non smoking room, we will send security to investigate." Wow, what great customer service. I will never stay here again. Also, the buffet is like hometown buffet but twice the price. And it is supposed to be kid-friendly but everywhere you walk the smell of smoke overpowers you. I would never bring my child here.

Just got home from vacation.  Circus Circus was a fine hotel.  I would call it great but for the price the room was clean and convenient.  Next time I may stay somewhere more center strip as we had to cab it a lot.

The circus circus is a very kid friendly hotel with with the adventure dome and midway arcade. The arcade and adventure dome is very enjoyable as fir the rooms they were decent not the greates but ok. The casino is very smokey and dirty.

My friend got in a fight with his girlfriend I needed somewhere to stay for the weekend he to get away from her he asked me to stay with him just so you have someone to talk to you plus I just got out of the hospital and he wanted to catch up and hang out with me I was so uncomfortable and that hotel room and kind of felt so Yucca even touching the remote control that I couldn't stay there I literally treated him paid for the hotel for the night and met him in the morning for lunch. Stay at this hotel if you like dumb kids screaming and jumping on your crap and if you like to step in gum and if you like dirty hotel rooms we can totally despicably old coffee.

Haven you ever had one those gut feelings that something bad is going to happen? And when it happened, you felt very regretful because you knew you should have gone with your first instinct? Thats exactly how my experience went at this hotel. 

The price was decent(you get what you pay for, and that has been proven). The rooms were okay, however the service was abysmal unfortunately. The moment i walked in the lobby(while carrying luggage), I was aggressively harassed by a so called greeter employee trying to get me to book for the following year. I wasn't even greeted before they started trying to get more money out of me. Can I just enjoy the night first and see how I feel after my stay? I politely declined the offer and was still harassed by the employee. I waved them off with a no. They still wouldn't leave me alone, and tried following me. So I had to be rude to them just for them to leave me alone. Now I feel bad because I'm sure everyone treats them like that and that puts me in a poor mood. 


Lets fast forward this till check out.  I Had a great night, had fun, etc... I go back to my car and noticed the rear passenger window has been punched in and someone broke into my car. This happened on hotel property in the parking garage. Things that were stolen weren't even f##king worth breaking into a car for. Seriously, to whoever stole from the car, I hope you step on a dirty lego. 

So I called security and tried to utilize their expertise in handling this problem. I felt like I could have gotten a lot more accomplished during an aftermath at a cheap all you can eat buffet in a porta-potty in the middle of the desert. Basically the one of many security guards I saw at the hotel was less hopeful than Colin Kaepernick getting a starting QB position on the NFL. The term "security" means the state of being free from danger or threat. I believe that is being disregarded at the management level. The parking garage I was parked at did not have surveillance cameras. This is the 21st century, we have cameras on our phones which can also be used to control a television, to navigate us back home, to find out whats a good place to eat, and to make a phone call. What a time to be alive! And this hotel doesn't have SECURITY cameras in their parking garage. What kind of security is that? I'm sure this has been an ongoing issue in the past and will continue to be an issue in the future. 

I filled this report out that was provided to me by security which looked like it was developed by an individual learning how to use microsoft excel 1997. I filled out all the information with details. I was promised to get a call back from a manager, or corporate to get to the bottom of this and talk it out because that's all i ever wanted was to just simply speak to management. Well, the results came back and the lie detector determined that was a lie. Nothing happened. Filling out this piece of paper gives customers\/victims a false sense of SECURITY. This is just their clever ruse. This hotel does not care about their customers or victims. We are just looked at as a number, not people.

Circus Circus is an inexpensive option close to the strip. Our room still had its 90's decor and very bad plumbing in the restroom. There is no fridge or microwave and it only offers basic television. It clogged at first and the room had an overall muggy smell. Frankly, I felt unclean at times because of the overall room. However, If you are looking for a place to simply sleep because you plan to be in the casinos or clubs, then this might be a decent option. Do make sure to request to stay in the main building or your room may be placed in the unattached "manors" on the other side of the hotel, which is a block from the main building where the casino is. If you are looking a "classier" experience and the esthetics of the room are important, it is best to look elsewhere. You won't find the tranquil  and contemporary set up that you may find in newer hotels. The price is decent but you get what you pay for.

this is the best place to be after a long stressful week at work. Throw money away and have some fun with your nieces and nephew at the arcades so they can win some toys. Be smart people and don't use there atm. I used there atm to get cash out to change at the change center to get the buy one get one free ticket. I did over 400 dallors worth. The fees here are ridicously not worth it. It was 5.99 fee to take the cash out, another 2 dallor fee for balance and another 2 dallor fee for icq. All these fees for one money withdrawals. Anyways some of the circus circus employee were kinda getting fed up because we had a stash of buy one get one free tickets and they weren't meeting there quota.

I love Circus Circus Las Vegas been coming here ever since I was born! And till this day I come to Circus Circus atleast 6 to 7 times a year!! Its a lot of fun not only for kids but adults as well. I love everything from the pizzeria to the acrcade to the casino and the adventure dome! I still stay here when I come to vegas, Circus Circus is like my second home..

Absolute craphole. We come here after fully paying for two adjacent rooms only to find out they screwed up and booked one instead. They give us excuses such as "You checked in too late", after they already said they screwed up. The rooms are musty and look like dirt. The Wifi, they claim to have "5x faster speed, trusted security, reliable coverage, and 24\/7 tech support". I'd love to sue them for this scam of an advertisement, but seeing as they didn't write 5x faster than what, I guess I can't. Their internet sucks donkey nuts. Slower than dead snail. DO. NOT. RECOMMEND.

Reserved a room here, checked in, saw the room, and left. We were so skeezed out that we didn't care that we didn't get a refund even though we were there for probably less than 30 minutes. We booked it back to Las Vegas Bay campground. I know it sounds bad that we didn't give it much of a chance, but everything just seemed so... Slimy... The room had dust on the bedside tables and there was a bobby pin on the bedspread. At least I was traveling with someone who also follows their intuition about such things. I think they had free wi-fi because I was able to google "circus circus bedbugs" before we got freaked out enough to get outta there. We left a tip for the maid (not sure if they even exist here, though, based on our room). Nope, nope, nope.

Yay! no smoking allowed anymore, me and the kids can finally breathe!

The Midway is full of fun games but prepare to lose lots of money and come back with a lot of stuffed animals for all your little cousins

Don't forget to watch a couple of free performances, all of which are pretty good for free (ppl juggling with feet and trapeze acts)

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.
Due to a last minute change in our vacation plans we decided to go to Vegas for a few days. Because we had no reservations for accommodations we sat in the baggage claim at the airport searching for places to stay. We called a few places prior to picking Circus Circus, but because of a large convention in town they were all booked for the night. We decided to "roll the dice" and let Price Line pick the cheapest deal (which wasn't very much of a savings!) and Circus Circus was the accommodations picked. Just walking into the lobby I could see that it was run down, but the staff was very friendly and helpful. The check-in went smooth and we were given directions to our NON-SMOKING room in an adjacent building. The minute we walked into the hallway we smelled marijuana smoke and the stale musty smell of a tired motel. As soon as we unlocked the door to our room the smell of cigarette smoke was overwhelming. The walls were paper thin and we heard everything our neighbors said, albeit we don't understand Spanish. Everything about this stay at Circus Circus was unpleasant! We will not ever be staying here nor will we ever recommend it to anybody.
Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees.

Ok, so keep in mind I live about 100 yards from this place......

Rude cocktail servers more often than not. I asked "can I get a drink please?", she says "your gonna have to WAIT". 

Bums sleeping on the front lawn all the time, how quaint!

Valet sucks, always too busy and not enough valets when I pull up. I waited 12 minutes to drop off my car the other day and gave up as they were too busy to even take my keys.

NO alcohol in the comp drinks.

Dirty and old...obviously.

Players card is different from all other MGM properties, can't combine points.

MGM needs to sell this place or remodel before it becomes a COMPLETE dump.

The whole theme itself needs updating. I will not go back. We need a place where professional millennials can stay, and this is not it. Go somewhere else in the strip. Our breakfast experience was horrendous at the hotel restaurant Vince Neil's. We felt unwelcomed the first moment they "ignored" us. They made a prejudice comment on how we are too young to drink coffee, and expedited the process to get us out of there. We just needed a nice place to have breakfast before we start our work day. We are not living in the 80's anymore!

This review is for the Manor Motor Lodge:

Horrific, but I'm sure there is a lot worse in Vegas. After arriving, we just didn't really want to be anywhere near Circus, except to sleep. The crowd is mostly low income trailer trash people, the casino has an awful and confusing layout, our AC didn't work, the air in the rooms is stagnant with no air flow. Everyone ended up getting soar throats and coughing, the walls we paper thin so we always heard our neighbors in the early morning (5-7am). 

Do youself a favor and stay somewhere else, Excalibur or PH.

The ONLY benefits of staying here are, it's dirt cheap and VERY close to Sapphire.

My experience at Circus Circus was awful. The trip was booked through Travelocity and I was highly disappointed. The manor was where our rooms were and it was the worst room I ever saw because I didn't stay there. Chris was very nice and extremely helpful. The manager Mary made it right by upgrading us to the Casino tower which we paid a little extra for, but should have been free. I have pictures but this app doesn't allow me to post. I have to give them one undeserved star.
Never valet at circus circus they will charge you and make you wait an hour before you get your car from valet.

Back when I was young, this place was definitely the place for parents and kids alike.  Times do change, however, and so has this place.  My review is based on everything.  I will just list:

*  The crowd is more ex-con, welfare, and hoodlums 
*  The place has a stink to it that just emanates throughout
*  Men's restrooms has wallpaper dirty and peeling
*  Staff members, you try and say hi or something, and they give you this look like you just spoke a foreign language (For 99.99% of them)
*  Air-conditioning would be nice in the casino and adventuredome, at least when I was there it was humid hot throughout

Recommendation, don't come here if you can afford not to...

Circus Circus sucked. Really bad.
It is VERY dumpy and "all used up".

It could have easily passed as an extension of the dumpy TraveLodge next door.

Here are some of the things that we didn't enjoy:
The half-mile trek from the hotel desk to our room.
The rude service at the hotel desk.
The beds were very uncomfortable (The floor was more comfortable!)
The TV got channels 2-13, of which 3 were static, 2 were "in house" channels, 2 were news .. 
The TV checkout system didn't work (hotel-wide).
The bathroom floor of our hotel room was dirty when we arrived
The table-lamps in the room were falling apart
The parking lot lights seem to be pointed directly at the room window and shine around the blackout curtain
The "security guard" at the entrance to the parking area checked for a room key the first time. There was nobody there the second time, and they waved us through the third time.
We asked housekeeping for more pillows and waited about an hour before giving up and buying some at Wal Mart
The arcade game areas were full of broken games
Ugliest Carpet Ever!
Our non-smoking room smelled like stale smoke, worse than the hallways.
The card-lock entrance to our  building didn't have anything to lock onto
No vending machines in the remote hotel room buildings
Clowns. Lots of them. Thankfully none in the hotel room.
Our hotel door didn't close\/lock all the way on its own, even though it slammed every time.
The a\/c system in the room wouldn't allow you to have the fan running all the time.  It would shut off the fan after an hour or two (making it hard to drown out the outside noise)
The walls were thin .. We apologize if you had the room next to us, but you started it.

Good (which can be found at other places too):
In-room mini-fridge
Water pressure in the shower
An impossible-to-clog toilet
On the strip
Cheap (Although, we're going to pay more next time for a better place so we can enjoy our trip more, instead of bitching about how ghetto Circus Circus is)

We'd agree with other users that this is a good place to take kids.  They don't seem to care that you leave them unattended to run amok, and there are lots of things for kids to climb on.

I mean...I get it, it's the only like fun place dedicated to kids. But there's literally 500,000 kids everywhere at all times! I mean, it probably didn't help that we were visiting during the Junior NBA's and I think they were hosting it. So I mean, make a wrong turn and feel like a sardine in a can. 

So the pros about CC: my kids liked it here. 

The cons about CC: my kids liked it here. 

The games are like fair games...you keep playing trying to get the bigger prize. The employees look unamused to be working there. They look like they wish they could be anywhere else, other than there. I'm not sure if I blame them. NOTE: if you have multiple kids, make sure to bring the bank roll. Or deal with some seriously disappointed kids with their flower prizes. 

They have shows that happen maybe every hour and a half. We got seats for the scarf arial dancer. My kids liked watching the girl do that. An employee walks around selling popcorn and cotton candy. Kinda gives you that circus without the animal smell feeling. 

We didn't go o adventure dome...but I'm not too sure my kids would be into that. I believe it's $30 for an all day pass. They have a McDonalds in the game area...of course they do. Well played, Circus Circus, well played. I'd probably never stay in this place...but it's a good place to let your kids run wild for a few hours.

This place considers itself a "resort" and charges a "resort fee" but to me it felt almost like a Motel 6 but the bed was more comfortable.
***Thin walls.   I could hear the words of an argument on both sides of our room (we were in between two rooms that seemed like they were all from the same, arguing family).  This was in Manor C.
By the way, the Manors suck.  I would never let them put me here again.  It is far away from all the shops and coffee places.  So in the morning, you gotta trek out of the building, into the sunlight, walk to another building, take the escalator up, walk a long pathway to finally reach the nearest place that sells coffee and pastries.  Yes, there is coffee in the room but it sucks and it isn't enough for a real coffee drinker.  The rooms show a lot of wear and tear and grime.  It really makes me want to spend MORE money at a better hotel next time to have nice, clean surroundings.
***The fire alarm went off at 4am our first night.  Everyone went outside in PJs, wondering what happened.  There wasn't a fire.  The security guards rode over on their bikes and nonchalantly informed a few guests the alarm must have been engaged by someone on purpose.  They didn't make an official announcement that is was OK to return to our rooms, you just had to guess by noticing everyone going back into the building.  Very unprofessional.  It was obvious they don't have a real disaster plan.
***The pool was closed at 2pm on our 2nd day, the one day we had planned to take the kids swimming.  Not sure what happened.  There wasn't a cleaning crew or any activity.  It was 106 degrees outside.
***The Midway games are still fun!  The people running them are all cheerful and good at making the games fun and exciting.  I liked that.
***The wi-fi is good and fast and free.

I won't stay here again and I would not recommend it to anyone else.

This place is a real circus!!  I used to like going there but my that was years ago when I thought Hello Kitty was cute and Barbie was this smart blonde who was rich and lucky (hi surfer Ken doll!).

So I went there recently to meet some friends with kids who stayed there.  So I walked in and people bumped into me without saying sorry.  The place was dirty, messy and crowded.  

Then I heard...........

"Where are you going? ***in Mandarin*** "  
I heard a loud voice saying that and yes I understand Mandarin a little.
I kept walking and I heard even louder voice.
"HELLO!!! Where you go?"***in English***
Wait a minute...why is everyone staring at me? And why this Chinese tour group (more than 20 people) was staring at me and the tour leader with the flag was screaming at me.
"You got the wrong person!!" I yelled back.

The tour guide got scared and left.  
Yep...a lot of weirdos here.

And this is why I don't like circus circus.

Check in was a circus. Nowhere to park, line longer than airport security, and we find out the "deal" we got online was for a room in their motel, which was not clear at all from how it was advertised. My advice is to skip this one.

I stayed at way worse, and I've stayed at way better. The price is definitely right. This place is definitely the most family orientated hotel\/casino on the strip if that's what you're in to. The customer service could definitely use improvement. If you're a low frills type of person, go for it. If you're looking for a Vegas experience, keep looking.

they have a really disgusting buffet!

tons of kids running around throughout the entire hotel \/ casino \/ amusement park

the best thing was their information center at the front, where they gave information, pamphlets, and coupons for shows on the strip.

basically, at the same rates for rooms and prices of buffet, you can get much better in the same city.. just do a little research.

+ kind of cheap
- bad buffet
- kids are everywhere
Never will I come back to this place for their rooms.  Too many kids. What is this, Chuck E Cheese?  I've never eaten the food at the buffet here, it doesn't look safe.

I really liked this place. 

It's grimey, it's ugly and it smells like stale popcorn and cigarette smoke. But it's also charming in this kitch way that makes you feel like you stepped into a weird dimension where debauchery meets chucky cheese and everything is 20 years old.  

On the main floor you have all of your table games,  slots and bars. These are all old and you can even find a few slot machines that take and pay out tokens. Like most of the casinos in the area,  they also have a frozen drink bar. 

Step upstairs and you'll be able to answer the question that's been bugging you since you set foot in this place. Why are there so many damn children?!  The upstairs is full of arcade games and the kind of skill games you'd find at a cheap carnival. 

But the real gem of circus circus is located in the middle of the second floor. A small area where gymnasts perform a set every half an hour. This free show is unexpected and sure to please all ages. 

It's weird,  it's different,  and it's definitely worth a visit... Much more so than the conservatory at the Belagio.

We came here because we had family staying here with kids. It's great for kids because of the rides and games they offer. Hotel is old and out of date. Needs a remodel. If it wasn't for the activities for the kids we probably wouldn't come here

I am giving a 5 star mainly because of how attentive the staff has been to any issue I've had. The hotel is not a luxury hotel, but is clean and nice. When I initially got the room, they broke down the fees "hotel, resort fee for this day, and that day, and tax, etc" it was clear and there were no surprises. I had an issue with the wifi in the room, and the staff on the phone walked me through tech settings. The issue was beyond that, and they said they would send someone to reset the network in the building and I would have internet in the next 20 minutes. I thought they were just brushing me off, but they really did fix the issue. Just general friendliness from the customer service people. I'd recommend it.

I miss going here with my family when I was a kid...

-it was a way better vibe back then because back then, Circus Circus wasn't surrounded with stupid trendy kids and wannabe gangsters running all around. 

-This used to be THE family hotel, and it STILL is when you go at the right time. 

-I still love their buffet! 

-This is one of my favorite places to play BLACKJACK! I remember spending only $20, but I ended up playing for 24 hours straight because I made up to $800! But ended up losing more than half because I couldn't sleep and I was bored! hahaha! But man, their staff were really cool and nice!

-I also attended a cousin's wedding here and it actually kicked ass because of well...my family is funny like that! haha!

-Circus Circus is pretty damn affordable....fuck the slots...play cards!

If Yelp would allow for a purely expletive review I would do so for this place.

I'll start with what just happened. House keeping has a storage room right behind the headboard of the bed I'm sleeping in. It's 2:30am on a Thursday morning. The brilliant class of person who works for this sort of run down dump decides NOW is the perfect time to slam fully loaded carts around with all his might. The headboard on my roommates bed hit him in the head. We're both wide awake thinking that there's a huge fight going on. The employee continues to slam the shit out these crates for the next few minutes. I get dressed and go over to whoop some butt, this little house keeping idiot looks at me like nothing's going on. I tell the idiot off and luckily he heeds my warning. 2:30am... In a hotel. What makes you think this is an appropriate time to be slamming things against the walls? 

Every hallway in the hotel smells of smoke. It's nonsmoking, but everything including the carpets are from before it became nonsmoking, so it all still stinks. Why bother replacing carpets?

The room I'm in smells, but not terribly. The bedding has changed but not the drapes or carpet. The A\/C dehumidifies the room so bad that you wake up a few times a night needing a drink of water. This isn't a joke, seriously it's bad. Most A\/C units have at the very least some form of returning humidity, in small spaces like a hotel room you need that. 

Ice machine on my floor doesn't work. But you can buy a bottle of water for $3, or go to the store in the lobby and save $1... How that makes any damned sense is beyond me.

Every working auto sliding door in the place has metal to metal wear marks. They aren't even bothering to maintain the facade here, let alone keep things working. 

A few of the buttons on the elevators don't work. Not one or two on one elevator, multiple. Luckily every elevator has two button panels. So if you can't get to your level, just use the other side. (Makes me feel super safe in the event there is a malfunction)

They have a roller coaster park here, takes up a fair portion of the overall size of the place. It's closed for repairs... Not one ride, the whole place. 

Monorail runs through the side of the building. But they stopped bringing it up here. Not sure who they pissed off but the rail to Circus is defunct. So you'll either need to walk, or pay to get away from this tragedy of a hotel\/casino.

Let's talk about the casino. Low ceilings, you can touch them in most of the lower level if you're 6ft tall. Feels like a dank dungeon compared to most the other places. Dated inside and out. And not that hip trendy dated look. More of a sad dilapidated feel. All the cool shops are here, like the wall boutique that sells bad knock off Japanese-ish style kimono and other super trendy fake silk fashion. Not to mention the "crystal" store that sells no crystal anything, just plexiglass chunks with laser etching. Top of the line throughout.

The view from most of the rooms is the ghetto motel next door, a few chain link wrapped half torn down buildings, the parking structure, the flat expanse of roof over the low casino, or if you're lucky you get a high enough room to see the empty half built hotel\/casino that's abandoned across the street.

Save your sanity, save your money, stay at a Best Western, or even the Startosphere is a huge upgrade. Circus Circus is a sad joke. I feel half bad for the people who work here, but there is a big McDonalds next store so they might be able to move up in status if they apply there.

Hotel needs to be updated. Upon arrival to our room we opened the door and the smell of Marijuana smacked us in the face. The safe had an old pair of stinky loafers. The water pressure in the shower was terrible and it took forever to rinse out my hair. The room was not very clean. Trying to park close to the tower you were in was a cluster. Rooms were cheap, but like they say "you get what you pay for"  definitely will not stay at this hotel again.

I've never stayed at this hotel but I've visited on several occasions.

Very good for family and kids.  There's lots to do and restaurants are reasonable.  

The slots are good and the gambling crowd seems to be laid back.  

All other hotels should pick up on what you get for your resort fee here.  Here, you get things you can actually make use of.  Freebees, discounts, and that long lost Fun Book.  Here you actual feel you're getting something back for your resort fee.

Yes, I'm not a fan of resort fees.  Speak up everyone so other hotels can learn from Circus Circus and gives guests practical things for their resort fees or just dump it all together.

Okay and affordable place to stay. It's old and everywhere you go be prepared to walk through walls of cigarette smoke. It's really bad. My young son hated it and we were only there for a one night stay. I thought we could go to Adventure Dome but it was closed for Fright Night. We had the pleasure of seeing the Fright Night cast in the parking section in full costume playing the part as they drove through scared of and so crazy looking!!!! I bet Fright Night was sure to please it's attendees. 

Only 1 real restaurant in Circus Circus which was a bummer (The Steak House which is really good) we just didn't want that big a meal. Pizza might have been ok but it was in the casino and way too smiley to eat in there.

Oh the pool area looked fun but we didn't get a chance to visit there maybe we can try again ...
I was staying in this hotel for three days . On my second day water supply didnot work for hours. The hotel is old , definitely not a vegas experience place.

This place is great. The rides are so much fun. Reasonable prices. Everyone with a bad review is a snob I'm sure. Thank you circus circus! Staff was awesome room was great. Who cares about the room anyhow? Aren't you there to go places? Anyway everything was great will come back

Check in process was pretty slow, even for a VIP. Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable actually one of the best showers in vegas. Its a very complicated hotel to navigate through. I think they only had 1 24 hour food option which kinda sucks. But hey, our room were free so what the hell am I complaining about? This hotel is kind of in the ghetto.
Very kid friendly...but i went with some friends for a drinking weekend. Didn't see many kids after about 9pm so that's nice not to see them when stumbling in drunk from the strip club at 5am. My friends didn't like the hotel but I didn't think it was half bad. I've stayed at much worse, they don't need a credit card for a deposit either which is pretty cool.

I am so shocked to be giving CC 4 stars...... why? I have been to the Reno one numerous times for work with no option to stay elsewhere and it is HORRIBLE. Filthy rooms, bland, hassle to walk through, loud kids, boring unpleasant employees, length of the check in line...... I was very hesitant to stay the the Las Vegas location and I must say WOW!!!! Every employee we interacted with was so friendly\/fun\/helpful! Our room was clean and it had all the amenities we needed(other than a fridge) and a huge lit up armoir closet with full mirrors! The bathroom had plenty of counter space. It was very modern! However parking was a concern- their self parking is questionable for safety, but valet is ridiculously priced and should be complimentary to hotel guests, but I guess that's the new Vegas thing now. Normally I tip valet personnel $10 to take and get the car, but parking was $13 nightly- no way I'm paying $33 every night to valet.

I have been coming here since I was a small child.  Growing up as a Southern California Asian, family trips during the summer meant trips to Las Vegas and now after turning 21 I still take trips to Vegas, now with only certain members of my family.

So now that I have established the basis of my credentials for writing this review, please read on!

If you are reading this because you are trying to decide whether or not you would like to stay here on your Vegas trip.  I have a short and simple answer for you: NO!!!!

If you have any sort of decency or standards or if you care about your family at all, DO NOT stay in this hotel.   

This hotel is old, in desperate need of a remodel, has the permanent lingering smell of cigarette and it is in the older part of Vegas.  You cannot just walk out of the hotel and expect to be on the strip.  It is a good few blocks away from the center of the strip.  Not the greatest place to be staying with a family, oh and if you are over 21 and thinking of staying here, same answer applies.  No!  You will hate it.  It is far from the strip where all the clubs are.  Yes, it is cheap but it is not worth it.  The hotel is ghetto, sorry, no other word to describe it.  

Every time I step foot in this hotel I forget how old I am.  Let me explain, the hotel to this day looks exactly the same as when I came here back in 1998.  It feels like a never ending time warp, nothing has changed.  Still smells the same, still the same shops, layout, everything is pretty much the same.

The only redeeming factor and the reason why I still come here to this day, is the carnival games and arcade upstairs.  I loved Circus Circus as a kid because of the carnival games.  My dad would take us to Circus Circus and win us all teddy bears that my mom would later complain about because they would just end up in a plastic bag stuffed in the garage somewhere or donated to goodwill.  

Circus Circus is an awesome place to take your children, just don't spend the night there.  The carnival games are super cheap, with the majority of them being only $1 and they have pretty legit prizes, comparable to the la or oc fair.  

The arcade is pretty fun and it's big.  My grandma used to spend hours here dumping tokens into that one game that has a bunch of tokens that are pushed down by the little bar that moves.

Despite it being stuck in a time warp, ghetto, far from the strip, old and smelly, chances are next time I'm in Vegas I will come back, just for the carnival games.

Oh they have beer pong at the hotel next door, but I really would not recommend it.  The ball is rolling around on the ground and who even knows what years and years of build up is on that carpet.  I am not a germaphobe or anything but even that makes my skin crawl.

If possible, I'd give Circus Circus a 50\/50 type of rating . 

Pros: The booking price was reasonable, around $75 & this was for a one-night stay. We then decided to stay an additional night for the price of $40-$45 (this includes any taxes) . Our building\/neighboring rooms was\/were quiet . The room was clean upon arrival. The slot machines are pretty "cheap" (Penny & $1 machines) . 

Cons: We stayed at one of the Circus Circus Manor buildings (Section E, which is the last one all the way at the end ! :\/  ) I personally didn't like that the Circus Circus Manor reminded me of a cheap motel. They're across the street from the actual casino\/hotel, towards the back. They're too secluded. The rooms could use some remodeling . Nothing in our room was dirty or broken, necessarily, but the building\/rooms could use some new carpet, furniture, etc. It has this 70s vibe to it . Circus Circus is a little further away from The Strip . In order to get to all the main casinos, you definitely need to drive or take a cab. When we returned to the front desk to extend our stay, there was only 4 people working (2 helping guests check in, & 2 helping guests check out) & unfortunately , it took a while to be helped . 

Maybe we were lucky, but OVERALL, Circus Circus wasn't a disaster . If they could move those Manors closer to the main hotel\/casino  and give the place a face lift, it would look a lot better !

I stayed in manor A part of hotel the weekend of august 21.   Electronic sockets don't work. Had trouble charging my phone. Hair dryer don't work either and the hotel is in the middle of nowhere its like a 5-10 minute drive to strip. Also found garbage under my bed.   It got a motel 6 feel. Cool arcade casino and love that there's a krispy kreme inside. And the front desk agent that checked me in was nice.

the casino? alittle outdated, but what do you expect for one of the oldests casinos. 
we came here for the adventuredome! 26.95 not too bad, however they place a ton of games and other (not on the menu) rides all around to drive your kids crazy, and to try to make more money , the rides were well maintained , and they are all indoors.

Wow! is all I can say about Circus Circus. Five days in Vegas and everyday I brought up going to see the infamous Circus Circus. I wanted to see old Vegas. On our last day in Vegas our group indulged me and we took a trip to Circus Circus.

I remember as a child my friends talking about this cool casino in where the kids had a wonderland of arcade games and where circus acts are performing overhead while there parents play black jack. 

We rolled up to Circus Circus and I see all these cheesy old school Vegas lights. I was pumped up!  As I walked in I couldnt believe my eyes. Circus Circus looked like a  toxic waste dump. Sadly Circus Circus looked like an old prostitute who had her best days twenty years ago. The casino is completely outdated, dirty, and just looked like something sad. I caught the circus act which featured a decent performance but the presentation, stage, and lighting looked like it was from 1927. Walking upstairs I was afraid for all the children. I could never imagine letting my kids touch anything in this space.

If you have never been you should at least pass by the casino. This place is historical in its own way so it deserves a visit. This is old Vegas but I would never eat, gamble, or stay in its hotel.

Truely dissapointed.....
subpar clown theme. visit clown motel in tonopah for an authentic clown experience. top notch clowns there... not here

I stayed at "the manor" section of circus circus. It was clean, but run down like an old cliche motel. Everything inside was out of date and at least 30 years old. The bathroom was small. The outer security doors didn't seem to close all the way. 

I do want to point out that the man at the front desk was very helpful and courteous when I checked in and that he did offer to upgrade my room for more money if I didn't like "the manor". 

I needed a hotel room at the last minute and got it for a total of only $50 a night, including the annoying resort fee. For $50 it was fine for 1 night, but it was depressing. They wanted $112 for Tuesday and Wednesday, I guess because of the conventions in town. At that point j decided to just pay more and go to the Stratosphere. 

Unless you have kids, or can get a room for only $50 total my suggestion is to consider paying more money if you will be staying long. The entire hotel is just old looking and depressing in my opinion.

This hotel has made me never want to come back to Vegas.   So dirty and gross.   My kids wanted to go to the pool(I did too but it looked so nasty I was scared to get it), so I braved it and was going to go down, but the line to get in the pool was wrapping around the lobby back and fourth.   I had so been looking forward to relaxing by a pool while I was in Vegas.   Our room was not horrible,   although they had stripped it of some basics.   The worst one being no coffee pot!!   No clothes iron,   no fridge,no shower cap, no extra linen.  No good food available at the casino either.

This place is really awful... There's nothing to offer in it. It wasn't worth the price. And when I bought stuff from the gift store, everything smelled like straight cigarette smoke. I can't even get the smell out of the stuff I bought. The room was gross and the heater was blowing out cold air.

I've stayed here the passed few years (not by choice) work puts us here. Tonight we called roomservice to receive water bottles and cups and they said they don't provide that service!? It's sad staying somewhere with no fresh water !

Terrible.  Have to walk forever just to get something to eat because most of the rooms are completely not connected and across the street.  Too many dumb uncontrolled kids running around. Def a family hotel which is stupid for vegas.  Also, if you want to be get third degree burn then be freezing in the shower then stay here. The tv is from like 1937 & they charge $7 to wash 1 fucking tshirt and then $6 for a scarf hahaha this hotel is funny as shit ,  xoxo

Really, but in reality what should I expect... 

This is the crap they emailed me.

Good Morning,



Thank you for taking the time to write your comments regarding your recent visit at Circus Circus. Your valuable feedback allows us to review our operations, and enhance our guest's experience by identifying the areas that require improvement.

Please allow us to sincerely apologize for the problem you experienced in regards to bed bugs .
