This chick shows up @ 10am.  She gives me some excuse.  Honey thats not my problem.  You had my # you could have called me to tell me you were running late.

No receptionist, so she is constantly answering the phone while she is suppose to be doing my pedicure.  

She is unorganized.  Didn't know the correct steps to apply the "gel" polish.

At my regular salon it only takes 45 minutes for a pedicure.  I wasted almost 1-1\/2 dealing with this woman.  Desiree, you do not know what you are doing!    

They say they take walk-ins...but no one works there.  1 hairstylist & 1 manicurist.  Slow staff.  This place is unorganized and not kept up very well.  

I WILL NOT BE BACK & I WILL STRONGLY SUGGEST NO ONE VISITING VEGAS GO THERE.  WHAT A WASTE OF TIME & MONEY!

Absolutely not the place to stay

Filthy, the room stinks, all outside areas are trash strewn and soiled. The building facades are cracked and crumbling. It is suppose to be a family atmosphere but I listened for 30 minutes a man threaten a young woman with bodily harm and refer to her with filthy language while tying to get money from her. 

The room was smoked in and three nights were over $500 dollars while my buddy got his room for less than half this value. 

It truly is a one star place. I could go on I'm sure but I'll leave it to you. I realize my. perceptions are based on experience. Well good luck you can do better.

This was actually better than we expected it to be. Our room wasnt in bad shape, we chose a room in the West Tower 29th floor. It didnt really have that 70's look as we were prepaired for. The casino was good to us. Its one of the only ones we found that had blackjack tables for $3 everyday, every hour. The beer specials in the Sports Bar were also good and made our dollar go alot farther.

This was probably the worst experience that I have ever experience while staying in Vegas I got poor service from the front desk to the bell stand to valet (no one had a since of urgency) and elevators did not work so I was forced to carry all of my belongings a stroller and a two-year-old down 8 flights of stairs because the elevators did not work they had 6 elevators and only one work so if you expect to go to your room anytime during the day you might as well wait till about 11 o'clock at night is the only time that the elevators work properly

It's a hot day, 108. Took the boys to Adventuredome for some indoor fun. Let's face it, signage is horrible. So, we ask the bike patrol officer where is the best place to drop them off. He doesn't want to stop, seems annoyed at me for asking a question, stays at least 10 feet away, then begins berating me. Instead of simple and nicely answering my simple question, he asks his own. "How old are they?" "They have to be 15, or you have to with them". 
Now I'm really biting my tongue. I'm an adult and called ahead of time to check age, was told 14. I'm not going to argue with him. Finally, he very vaguely and reluctantly tells me where to drop them off.
One kid says, "Is he having a bad day?"
Another says, "it seems like he doesn't like his job very much". 
So here's a message for you young military wanna be (should never be) cop punk bike patrol officer: 
We are guests. You work in hospitality. Start acting like it and treat people with respect. I don't know if your girlfriend just broke up with in a text, or your shoelaces are too tight, or someone called out sick and you need a break. Please don't ever treat people like that. I'm going to cut you a break. But next time, I will call your boss.

I'm writing this review because I stopped by to win my kids some toys. They make it so easy! Had no problem winning both my girls huge stuffed smurphs! They're very excited! I wouldn't really want to stay here, but it's a good place to take the kids when I'm in Vegas.

Circus Circus isn't as glamorous it used to be. Then again I was young and naive back then. Went back with my girlfriends recently and it was a terrible experience. The casino is old and reeks of smoke. I would never gamble here. The Adventuredome was unspectacular. It happened to be raining that day and guess what? The dome was leaking. The cherry on top was they decided to place buckets and rags on the floor to catch the leaks. Pretty ghetto if you ask me. I can't believe we paid for the cab ride to get here. Also, there's this moving walkway that leads to NOWHERE. Spare yourself; avoid this place!

last day of vegas i took the bus to the end of the strip with my friend, we just gamble and drank the whole night... got so smashed barely made it back to the hotel room for the morning flight, haha...

If I could give it 0 stars, I would. SUCH a bad experience with this hotel. The pictures on the internet make it seem like its pretty decent for a "GREAT" price. We thought it would be nice since we have small children. I was wrong. I rather pay more and do other activities on the strip than to EVER stay at such gross hotel and horrible, horrible CUSTOMER SERVICE place. I was scared to even SLEEP in those rooms. Adventuredome was pretty lame as well and OVERPRICED. 

The parking garage feels like it's about to collapse too! the elevators to get to the hotel entrance ARE DISGUSTING. They smell like urine, cigarettes and alcohol. I mean it is even disgusting to touch those buttons. I felt like I needed a shower every time i would come out of those things.

I usually take LOTS of things into consideration, but there was absolutely NOTHING good about this place. Such a a disappointment. 

 To their manager CHAD - either he needs more intense training on management, or he needs to find another career he is good at. Having other reps telling me what he said is NOT professional. ANSWER customers calls, don't hide from speaking with them. 

DO NOT CONSIDER CIRCUS CIRCUS even if it's just to "sleep" there... 

Good Luck!

We stayed here this week because it was very cheap.  Southwest didn't tell us, when we signed up with their vacation package, that our room was in another building from the main hotel and casino. However, we just paid $10 and they found us a closer room.  The room was fine.  No complaints at all.  There was a gross odor in the hallway (kind of skunk like).  The elevators are a little confusing at first.  They should have more restaurant options.  They should also bring back the great carousel bar that revolved, and the circus acts.  That was our favorite bar!  The hotel staff were all great and we were allowed to stay until 3pm for a small fee.

Rv review:

We reserved a space 2 weeks in advance and paid extra for it to reserve it.
The day before we called to confirm our reservation. A lady named Karen told us that even though we made a reaervation it is FIRST COME, FIRST SERVE. Confused but desperate to "fight for a spot" , we left our homes one day early to make sure we we were able to keep our spot.

 When we get there we see that someone beat us to our spot. And since karen  told us it was first come first serve we realized that reservations and deposits dont matter so we found an empty spot to take for the night.
 The next morning we went to the office. They said no-one would say it was first come first serve as that reservations DO matter. After we gave them the name of the person who told that to us they changed their tune but said unfortunately they gave our reservation to someone else. And That it was not possible to override.
We told them to then move the people who took our original spot to move out of oir spot since reservations and down payments  do matter. They said they werent able to.
We spent 4 hours argueing with them, including someone named Sophia and the manager who refused to come down to talk to us and said we should go to the managers office to complain, they wouldn't come down to us.

 After being moved for the third time we decided to leave. They sais that "for our convenience" they won't charge us the higher rate, as if they did us a favor.
Very disappointed. Because there aren't meant RV parks on the strip, i will be sure to video record or conversations and ask for names and a confirmation code before hanging up. People in the park told us we should sue.

I stayed here a night with my mother, and the water did not turn on.. The sink or the shower... I guess I didn't need to shower, thought I paid for a room with running water but okay... The room was moderately clean, but not great floors dirty and sheets were ripped. Definitely won't be my choice next time.. Fun hotel just not the best quality.
If you like little kids screaming and running down the hall at 7am non stop while you're trying to sleep off your hangover, I highly recommend this hotel for you.

I'd read enough reviews online before we went to know not to expect much of anything.  Old, not updated hotel with kids running around everywhere... check.  Honestly, there weren't as many kids as I'd thought there would be, but I guess compared to the other hotels we visited there were quite a few.

We stayed there because it was the cheapest option "on" the strip, and we'd rather use our money for other things... like booze.  I made the reservation through some website, not the hotels directly, for tower rooms.  I was told I'd most likely be able to upgrade to the West Tower (newly renovated) when I checked in; but they were sold out.  We were stuck in the Skyrise Tower.  Aside from the fact that our room smelled like a Playschool dollhouse, it was fine.  No fridge or microwave though - luckily we knew this and brought a cooler to keep the drinks cold (priorities).  But like I said, I knew not to expect much.

The buffet was disgusting, like worse than my college cafeteria.  However, for breakfast, it was awesome because as far as I'm concerned you can't go wrong with a plate full of greasy bacon and tater tots after a night of drinking.

The staff is retarded.  I think they all are retired carnies, who know nothing.

Since we weren't leaving til 11pm on a red-eye, we tried for late check out\/another night... again, sold out.  All rooms were sold out, except for 2 rooms they had in the back manor "motel."  Now I don't know what dead people smell like, but if I had to guess, they smell like the Circus Circus Motel.  Luckily we didn't sleep there - just needed a place to store our luggage for the day and shower before the flight.

But still for some reason in my heart I love this place.  It's got some cheap, old school Vegas charm in a really weird, I-need-to-wash-my-hands kind of way.
Nice room. Average service. The worst and most overpriced food I have ever choked down.

A review for the casino portion. Not a classy place. And it is one of two of the smokiest smelling casinos I've been in. Everything about that place made me not even want to sit down. Staff was nice though.

Just had to wait 32 minutes for a very simple machine error.  I checked my watch.  There was a cocktail waitress who tried to help.  She got an off the clock attended.  Again off the clock and half hour later.  She was 55 to 65 years of age with short curly hair.  She did everything she could do.  A hats off great employee I felt the need to complaint her and her effort.  I looked for a manager none in site. Ask the bartender his idea was to try the house phone.  Tried the house first time got the bartender I just talked to in person.  Tried again on the phone got disconnected.  I truly thought her supervisor should know about her.  I did everything I could to compliment her efforts.  Sorry no one in this place knows anything about costumer service.  If they don't know how to handle a complement and don't care about costumers time a total of 1:12hour.  My business will no come back.  TERRIBLE JOB management.  GREAT JOB EMPLOYEE I REALLY APPRECIATED YOUR TIME.

For those looking to stay on the Las Vegas Strip for the low, this is the place to go.  This is so far the ONLY hotel on the strip that caters to families.  Circus Circus is also the few remaining hotels from the 1969 era still operating today.  This hotel has many rooms scattered around in different buildings.  Getting around can be quite confusing but should be ok once you get used to it.  Check-In lines are extremely long.  Most of the shops here are low-end.  There are shops here with Asian vendors.  Except for Krispy Kreme the eateries here are low-end as well.  If these aren't for you, there are other hotels with better food ad better stores.  There is always a Subway and a McDonald's nearby that are open 24 hours to cure your hunger blues.  The Adventuredome indoor amusement park sets this hotel apart from the others.  Keep in mind that New York New York has a roller coaster and The Linq is a ferris wheel that gives you breathtaking views of the Strip.  Circus Circus also has an old school photo shop where you can dress up and take personal photos.  The best thing about this hotel is the free Wi-Fi for those staying here as well as free access to fitness rooms and discounts on certain items (the resort fee covers all that).  Selection of TV channels are subpar and need immediate improvement.  As for my stay here it was decent.  It can be a bit loud in the lobby at times.  After all, you're on the Strip.  If you are looking for something good to eat I would eat somewhere else.  The food quality is extremely low budget and not worth the time.  There are other hotels (Downtown or Off Strip) that offer a better experience.  However if you are looking to save some money this is the place for you.

I didnt even make it in the front door before I figured out I was about to make a very bad mistake. I just moved to LA and Vegas has been on my to-do list so me and my lady were going to be spontaneous and head out this weekend. I figured it's an old hotel, okay I can deal with that so I booked the room through Hotels.com. After reading reviews I noticed I didn't get a  room in the main tower I was booking for some sort of Motel property near the actual Casino called Manor Motor Lodge... I noticed the rooms looked a bit outdated so I called to see if I can change reservation to an actual Tower in the main building. I called and was talked to soooo rudely by this lady that after I got off the  phone I had to just sit and think  for a  second... I was pissed. So I called Hotels.com and cancelled and began to realize that saving 100 dollars is not work having a  1star experience for my first time in Vegas. So I booked at Bally's who has updated rooms and is located in the heart of the strip for just 75 dollars more for the weekend. I saw the reviews and was still willing to give them a try until I called and realized the reviews are very legit... and I was about to find out the hard way. Thank you Yelp!! and Circus Circus people you guys have a niche with the carnival atmosphere but pretty soon all these bad reviews are going to catch up with you and you will need to spend the money to hire and train people who actually appreciate their jobs and HELPING people.

Knock it down and start over.

I love my husband but this time he blew it.  

Actually, I'm even embarassed to write a review and admit that I stayed the night here.  

Is there such a thing as zero stars?

The hubby picked this place thinking it would be great for the kids...after my experience, I would rather sleep on the street.  

I have to say...honestly... if you stay here, you probably don't have internet access.  

Sorry to be so cruel but this place was a dump!

I literally had a horrible allergic reaction in the room and ended up with a sinus infection. 

The carpets felt, looked and smelled disgusting. Who knows how many layers of vomit and cigarette ashes were on them. Yuk!  I didn't walk barefoot in my room. 

The smoke from the casino permiated the room, so I couldn't sleep all night due to the cigarette stench and the noisy rif-raf running up and down the halls. 

We left immediately the next morning. I was against staying here to begin with but I was trying to be the nice wifey and agreed to go along.  

Never again. 

We found a room at Treasure Island-which was sparkling clean, modern and renovated.

Run far away from this place.

Bed bugs!!! My friends and I got in bed and my friend felt something crawling on her arm! Low and behold it was a bed bug!! We called the front desk and they "upgraded" us to a smoking room which was supposed to be non smoking. There are cigarette burns on the sheets and it reeks of smoke! We have not slept!!! After being moved for the third time Johnny the manager gave us a free buffet for all of our troubles. I will not stay at circus circus again. This had been a horrible experience. Also the water in our shower is freezing!! I had it on the hottest it could go and water was cold. Shame
An absolute disgusting dump. Never come here. This place is run down and dirty. The Excalibur is better than this piece of poo.

I have stayed at over ten hotels in Vegas, ranging from little motels and the Days Inn off the Strip to the fondly departed Stardust, Tropicana, Bally's, Luxor, MGM Grand, Mandalay Bay, and Aria. This was by far the worst. I was greeted by gruesome stained carpets and grungy, smudged wallpaper, plus a vicious chemical stench piped through the ventilation in the hallways. Filthy piles of laundry on the bed when I checked in, many light bulbs burnt out, safe didn't work, no CNN on the TV system, then the TV stopped working. I called for repairs or exchange every day for 3 days, every day they sent a technician out, and still the problems persisted. Was unable to do the express checkout. When I mentioned all of this to a supervisor at the front desk, I got "Oh." Zero customer service. "$150 in promotions" were useless. Ripoff, stroke job "resort fee" (resort? hah!) with tax was $10 a day, this was not apparent on the mobile app. Bad location at wrong end of the Strip in a seedy neighborhood with endless drugged out panhandlers. Long, long walk to the next hotel. Buffet was vomitrocious. Next time: Luxor!
The price is right if you want to be kinda close to the strip.  We upgraded to the West Tower for 10 bucks a night.  Glad we did!  I probaly wouldnt stay here again, but it wasn't all that bad.

So far, not so good. I was weary of staying here after reading some frightful Yelp reviews, but we decided to give this place a try anyways.

The room is okay, it seems clean enough, though it's painfully tacky with decorations, like an Italian woman from the 80s styled it from Walmart.

Heard reports that the beds were infested with bed bugs, so we looked on the sheets and under the mattresses. It looked safe for now, but I guess we'll find out in the morning!

Luckily we did not find a dead roach in our room, but there was a little bug in the bath tub when we checked in. As well as left overs from the previous tenants: a shampoo bottle and a hand written note of random stuff. 

The room has ac, safes, a small TV and two closets, but does not have WiFi, a fridge, or microwave. I guess they really want you to eat at their restaurants (we tried, food was greasy and upset my stomach, scene was kind of sparse and sad). Sink and bath clogged instantly upon first use... saw horror stories below of huge hair wads in the drains, was too scared to check, but not surprised. 

Bell desk broke my husband's luggage, and all the bellman said was "It wasn't me" and left. We called the front desk, and they said to call security (what??). Whatever. They just broke my husband's birthday present from a friend. No big deal! Not. 

I could go on, but long story short, there's way better places to stay for the same amount of money... not to mention this place just has a seedy, musty feel to it... I can hardly wait to move to another hotel... it was not as horrific as I was fearing, but it's still pretty bad.

First time in Las Vegas and spent it with my family of seven, including a 5 year old brother, now wouldn't that be fun (please read this with sarcasm). 

Well let's just say it was perfect timing (again with the sarcasm), we were only able to find time to stay over on a Saturday night. What's wrong with that you ask? That's when the prices for each and every single hotel skyrockets. I was in desperate need of a cheap and family friendly hotel and that's when vegas.com and fellow yelpers led me to to Circus Circus.

(Disclaimer: Other hotels might have the same or similar offers, but please note I would not know any better since this was my first time....in Las Vegas that is).   

I got the standard tower queen room and it was quite roomy. The room was clean. Okay I think I want to rant about the cons right now. The hotel is quite confusing and I felt it was like a maze. You have to be careful when it comes to elevators because they to certain floors. Like one set goes to the 20th floor and above (something like that). Check out is the worse thing that can happen. I ended up waiting 30min for an elevator. There were 4 elevators but even living on the 12th floor it was always packed and up to a certain point none of the elevators stopped at our floor. I found another set of elevators but once again the hotel is a maze and it took me a while to get to the front desk. I mean I found no problem with the rooms, but it was just the hotel can get confusing. The staff were great though. There was an information booth by the elevator on the second floor so that really helped with everything. 

As for location wise, Circus Circus is said to be located on the strip, but near the end, so getting around still required a car. There was pretty much nothing to do or any sight seeing to do outside the hotel. Oh and Downtown is pretty close to Circus Circus so that might give you a better idea about location wise. 

One thing to be careful for is the rooms: Tower and Manor. Towers are obviously located in those tall buildings with the extremely complicated elevators. Manors are cheaper for a reason: they are three-story buildings located near the parking. In other words they are not connected to the casinos. Since I didn't stay there I can't really say it's a bad idea to book a room there. 

I would have given this hotel a 2 star but because of my 5 year old brother it deserves at least a 3 stars. Adventuredome! As a part staying at the hotel you get a coupon book with offers ranging from specials in their casinos, dining and let me say it again Adventuredome! We got two free tickets for the premium rides and a coupon good for two games (carnival style games). That kept my brother entertained, so on behalf of my brother I add a star to my review. Adventuredome is not the only place kids can play games. In fact right above one of the casino is another area kids can play. That way parents can dump their kids there and go down one floor to gamble.

Oh something I did to make sure I earned a prize with the coupon for two free game play. I picked one of those games that ensured a winner every round, made sure there weren't people interested in playing the game, sat down with my brother and played the game. That way it doesn't matter who wins. Cheap Asians for the win.   

Another point I wanted to make is the "Free World Class Circus Acts" Circus Circus loves to promote and exaggerate over the top is not as great as you think it is. I saw only one show, but let me explain to you what happens. It's a small stage so you can already guess how limited the performers have in terms of props and what they can actually do. I was expecting lions, and tigers and bears, oh my! but instead I got a 5min show that starts every hour with different performers every hour. Well nothing in life is free and I guess if I want to see such performances (performances I would actually consider World class then I'm going to have to empty my wallet a bit). But now think about it this way, if you really want to see every performer and since it's free would you really leave the hotel for a quick 30min to do something else and return again? Of course not, and this is where Circus Circus gets smart. They dump the stage right in the middle of  the carnival games. What does that mean? Even though that 5min performance is free, the 50min til the next show is not. Family friendly  = little kids. Pure genius to attract parents and their kids to a free show and then surround the children with flashing lights, silly sounds and tempting prizes. But despite that I still give props to the performers even for that short 5min for doing things that I can never learn to do.

Bottom line: Good for families with little kids and on a budget, bad for sight seeing.

Why do so many black people hangout in the corridors of their hotel rooms? you paid for a hotel room, now stay inside. entire families sitting on the floors outside their hotel rooms, kids yelling screaming and running around. No hotel security person to be found anywhere. It is kind of intimidating for people exiting the elevators to see all these people loitering in corridors.

I stayed at the skyrise tower. Inside the room was clean and comfortable, the wifi service was great and parking was close by and easy. cheap price for the rooms and definitely got my money's worth. can't complain.

You get what you pay for.  I wish I had realized this before booking a room there through Orbitz.  We stayed in the most elegant section of the hotel called "The Manor", which was truly awful.  You exit the main building, walking across a street of traffic, through an unrestricted parking lot where anyone can access, to one of five standalone buildings where you have no access to any amenities (unless, of course, you trek back into the main building).     Our room smelled, and our curtains (being on the ground floor) didn't close all the way and left a crack through which someone could peek through walking by.   Needless to say we didn't stay there that night, and we high-tailed it out of there and booked elsewhere.   While trying to save money by being really cheap through Orbitz and staying at Circus Circus, I ended up spending double what I wanted to spend.   You get what you pay for.   It's my own fault for not understanding the room situation before I booked.  blech!

We didn't actually stay at this hotel but, went to the indoor amusement park with my nieces and nephews. The two roller coasters were amazing and the kids loved the arcade. It's $30 a person so keep that in mind. The girl at the register said that we could of gotten coupons at stores like Walgreens to reduce the cost of the entrance tickets so I wish I knew this beforehand.

People are pretty friendly and service isn't bad, but they have extra random fees when you check in. 
Hotel room was decent but the sheets are super thin so we had to order more and were told they would only bring us 2 blankets and 2 pillows. We got the 2 pillows and 0 blankets but 4 extra towels. 
The towels we got the first night, i noticed, had stains and after checking the others,they too had stains, gross! 
Overall the price and service wasn't bad. 
Buffet was okay too, a bit overpriced however.

Great experience I can only write on what I did. I ate McDonalds here by the service was really slow. 
What was really nice here though was the free circus acts. Hand balancing, foot juggling, trapeze, and a bunch of other variety acts that come in all the time. Free of charge. Zero cost to park or admission. If you want you could even come in just to watch the shows. Drinks aren't priced ridiculous. 
Never stayed at the hotels so I can't say anything there. Some bathrooms are dirty but majority of them are nice. Same cleanliness as a unkept target bathroom.
Table games (blackjack) here are worth playing if you don't want to be crowded or 4 people at the table.

I paid $389 for 2 nights , extremely expensive for a cheep looking hotel like this . The rooms were in a different building,  the bathroom is terrible,  the carpet is old and dirty .... beds were comfortable this is the only good thing about it 
And omg I had to pay $33 for resort fee.... I didn't even see a fucking pool or jacuzzi like why the fuck u change the resort fee ????? The only reason I stayed there cause in a month like this all the hotels are over $400 for 2 nights and Circus Circus was the only less expensive one .... but comon for $389 for 2 nights , just never again , lesson learned . Wish I can rate it with 0 star

I am giving this casino\/hotel 4 stars because I have a 3.5 year old.   True the decor is beyond tacky.  The midway is great and the free circus acts are fab.  What I really like about this place is they are truly kid friendly.  They actually have a toy store!  Their gift shops are fairly decent and they still have the penny slots and 2 cent slots as well.  Overall it's fun...

OK, so check this out.  I know I have been long dormant with the Yelp reviews (bad girl, BAD GIRL!), so to make it up to ya'll, I am now embarking on a casino-by-casino tour of my new hometown of LV, NV, and will include reviews of each as I tour them.  Now, these will not include room stays, but just schlepping around the premises - eating, drinking, and checking out anything that moves or doesn't move.  Got it? OK, let's proceed...

Review #8:
well, the super-creepy leering clown neon sign out front sets the stage for this joint; I suppose my advice to you before you come here is to gain 40 or so pounds, go clothes shopping at WalMart, and have 2 to 4 rugrats to drag along; if not, Circus Circus has plenty of low-end eateries to pack on the pounds, low-end touristy shops for the wardrobe, and I believe they even rent out loud & hyperactive children if you don't have any of your own; OK, I'll quit being mean now...; the place is surprisingly large; there's a strange separated annex building with more slot machines; a 2nd floor of low-end shops & eateries surrounds a humongous amusement area that I am sure most 4 to 10 year olds would love; best craft brew bet = shockingly, the Circus Spirits store has some decent craft 22 oz. bombers, including Tenaya Creek, at very reasonable prices

GHETTO. When I was younger, my dad would take me to Circus Circus whenever we made a stop in Vegas. If anyone remembers, Treasure Island used to have this AMAZING arcade with midway games next to the Cirque Soleil theater. We used to play the Treasure Island midway games but because they closed, we had to go to Circus Circus. It's so rundown and some of the people that go there are kind of shady. 

I'm hoping they will get a renovation soon since this is probably one of the only big arcades that kids can go to now. 

OH! They also have a good circus show that plays every 20 minutes or so. Clowns, acrobats, almost anything you find at a real circus :)
One good thing about Circus Circus is that they have this indoor amusement park, dunno what it's called but it's pretty cool! You should definitely check that out if you are ever in Vegas with kids.

Came in for two nights here with my family  ,was great to come in with the kids ,got a really good deal was pretty clean  ,the only thing we didn't like ,was that the lady from the black jack tables are sooooooo rude!!!!other then that very awesome weekend

If it wasn't for the kids games there would be no reason to visit the dump. Tired. Run down. My main beef was the $10 charge for for valet parking. We had to wait 15 minutes for our car in 110 degrees. Thus used to be a great family spot. No more.

Je n'avais pas choisi mon htel, alors forcment... J'avais un peu peur. J'avais raison. Je suis un peu mchante avec cette note, mais en soit, j'ai pas du tout aim ma chambre:
- trop kitsch
- trop vieillot
- trop chelou (je sais a vous aide vachement  visualiser ma chambre a)

L'emplacement de l'htel tait vraiment pas top par rapport au Strip, tout au nord. Alors, c'est cool parce qu'au final j'tais pas loin de la stratosphre mais bon, j'y suis alle qu'une fois, et tant qu' tre  Vegas, autant tre au cur de l'animation! Bref due de chez due.

Bon, le casino est normal, rien de folichon. En revanche, et ce qui relve la note, c'est le buffet ! Un buffet petit dejeuner comme j'en ai rarement vu: vous pouvez manger ABSOLUMENT TOUT ce qui vous fait envie!
Donut? Checked!
Muffin? Checked!
Pav de saumon? Checked!
Oeufs benedict? Checked!
Ptes? Checked!

Un buffet IM-PRE-SSION-NANT qui vaut  lui tout seul sa petite toile.
Sinon, ben... allez-y si TOUS les autres htels de Vegas sont complets, y a largement mieux  faire et pour des prix similaires.

Diana checked us in. She was such a sweetie. We came to Vegas for my friends 21st birthday and decided to stay at Circus Circus for the value. Overall the rooms that we got were very clean. They had so many little shops to go to. They even have a mini theme park that surprisingly was awesome!

We've stayed here quite a few times in the last 10 years and have always been happy with our stay. 

A detailed review about our many stays....

Check in: is usually quite quick but make sure you're checking in at check in time especially on a holiday or a weekend as rooms may not be ready. Staff is usually friendly but I've had a few times where they weren't. Hey, everyone's allowed a bad day right? 

Kids: yes, there are lots of unsupervised children running around acting like children. This is a hotel geared towards families so if running, screaming, playing children bother you then it might be best to consider another place to stay. The adventure dome is a lot of fun for both adults and children. The games and attractions are pretty cheap and your normal run of the mill circus games. 

Rooms: we've stayed in many different types of rooms and you are best off to avoid the manor rooms as they are a walk from the casino and main entrance. There used to be a mono rail type thing that crossed the casino but I don't think it's in operation anymore. We mostly stay in suites now since my players club card either comps the room or makes it very cheap. I do love the suites! They're large, clean, have a wonderful whirlpool tub and are a little more updated then other rooms. 

Food: there are dining options for every taste and price point. The steakhouse is the best by far I've eaten at on the strip. The portions are huge, the food is excellent and the decor is nice. I've used points towards meals here and paid $7.00 for 2 prime rib dinners within appetizer,dessert and cocktails. The Mexican\/Italian resturant is unique in selections and is pretty good for American Mexican\/Italian food. I haven't had anything that I was disappointed in eating and I'm a foodie. 

Casino\/comps\/games: one of the most annoying things I ever experienced here was being carded to the point I felt almost harassed. I was carded twice before I even made it to the bar and then a bartender called security on my very valid California ID acting like it was fake. They asked if I had any other forms of ID which I had to go to my room to get and then acted suspicious of my civilian ID from a military base. Two valid government issued IDs and they still acted if I was under age and trying to pull something on them....I was 25 at the time. Another bartender asked me my year of birth, when I graduated high school and other questions that I felt kind of harassed by also to verify my age. this only happened at one stay and they may have been on a strict ID policy or had an age issue recently happen. Still very annoying to the point I began playing across the street which hurt my points and comp ability. 

It's a regular run of the mill casino, typical games. I do like playing slots on the carasouel and I'm not a big slot player. 

This hotel comps very very well. I play table games 90% of the time, roulette, craps and a little blackjack. I was very pleased with after just 2 days of playing I had enough points to pay for a $95 dinner at the steakhouse. 

Yes, this hotel needs a pick me up and make over but as those of us with kids know....you don't get kids really nice things because they tear them up. I understand the hotel not spending millions of dollars to have children tear up everything. 

I've never had issues with my car but I always vallet, it's worth it to me. I've never had any issues with vallet or the bell hops. The staff is usually very helpful and polite. 

The hotel is located at the end of the strip and is closer to Freemont street then the strip in my opinion. It's a fun place to stay for a decent price. 

It's worth the extra bucks to upgrade to a suite and to vallet\/bell your bags. If the children bother you then avoid the adventure dome and kids eateries. Also, try and avoid the first few weeks and last few weeks of summer as that's when it's most over run by kids. If you're expecting a fancy hotel\/casino like other places on the strip then you will be disappointed. Don't be afraid to let the front desk know if you're not happy with the room as they have always been helpful in correcting or relocating in my experience. Even if you don't stay or play here the steakhouse is must when in Vegas, it's seriously some of the best food and service I've ever had.

Took the kids to the midway and adventuredome. 

Circus Circus seems the exact same. Doesnt seem to change. 

The kids had a good time riding the rides and playing the games in the midway. 

One bad thing is IT IS VERY HOT INSIDE THERE! TURN THE AC ON GUYS !

It's a giant playground for all ages. The hotel has an indoor roller roaster, arcade and live circus for kids. Plus there is casino, drinks and food for grown ups. It's a good place to stay if you have small kids.
The room was clean, comfy and spacious. However it is not located on strip.

The only reason we stayed here is because of the price. However, after realizing that you have to pay 15 bucks to have a coffee maker,  all of the incidentals that many are used to will add up to a night at one of the nice hotels . Sadly, our room had lipstick kisses on two walls, a mysterious sticky black thing under the bed, an almost backed up sink, and a dirty brown smudge on the wall. However, the bathroom was clean and the beds are okay. If you have a family, this place is awesome because there is always something to do! There is an arcade, an amusement park, lots of food places, and venders selling useless crap that will make your head spin. The slots aren't too shabby either, especially the carousels with penny slots! If you have not stayed here, it's definitely an experience. For me, this is the first and last.

Thank goodness our kids are grown and we don't have to stay here or at the Excalibur anymore.

My hubby still has his thing where he HAS to visit the game section and win SOMETHING.  Even after all these years.
This trip, $50 got him this:
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/6Q7-wkCPc1KF75jZLOTcMw?select=rekq4i-s-RU4qaXd5SCqdA
*sigh*

In the meantime, I parked myself at a penny Wheel of Fortune to amuse myself.   I'm not crazy about these penny slots, but managed to get a lot of play for just $20.  Nope, didn't win anything.  Just played it down to zero credits for the fun of it.

I'm too much of a grouch for this place.

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, even though i am underage and i cannot gamble, i really had a great time in their Super fun Arcade section!!!! i even got a huge pink colored teddy bear for my younger sister, with all the tickets i collected! haha

You can find a better deal for the price. The hotel turned out to be a huge mall with a casino and some rooms. The staff throughout the building were rude. We tried purchasing various trinkets and the staff(carnies) were rude. 
In the morning, our shower had no hot water. We supposed to be compensated, we're still waiting. 
The room wasn't anything special and honestly compared to low end hotel like super 8.

I stayed at circus circus on april 13th - 14th. 
There were roaches in the room. 
Casino staff was nice though.

This place is not the nicest\/fanciest place to go. I definitely wouldn't stay at this hotel. BUT I will go to play in the midway and gamble. My favorite game is the horse racing one! ;) I'm a sucker for stuffed animals. 

Also they have $5 black jack tables, monopoly\/deal or no deal slots. So thats good for me.

Plus, it is a nice for kids, since most hotels in vegas are not really children friendly. They have a circus show every 30 mins or hour upstairs in the midway.

My wife and I stopped in here on a whim to try one of their nicer sit down restaurants as my wife is pregnant and got very hangry.  First things first, navigating the parking structure was a real pain in the butt...no actually a real pain in the butt.  There must be a road bump every 50 dang feet.  It was insane how many there were.  But the car was a rental so I didn't care much beyond my own rear end.  We then get into the casino and locate what we thought was the upper end sit down restaurant ...we were told that it was changed to a burger bar.  This info was not on their website.  So we decided to go to the Blue Iguana Mexican Grill.  Sounds good right?

This reminded me of Taco John or Taco Bell...if (taco bell and johns they were shittier, more dirty, inefficient and full of loud obnoxious people (which the hotel really can't do much about)  After we ordered our food we went to a few tables trying to find one that was actually clean
  Whelan I found one, the table wobbled.

The food comes out and I know before my first bite either my wife or I will be leaving a shit stain in our underwear.  Time did tell.  She had the mystery burribto and I had the Nacho supreme.  we each ate about half our meal and left.

A few hours later my wife began to throw up and was down for the night (not alcohol related as she was not drink)  I ended up burping all evening and having good a sour stomach and heart burn.

I've got nothing else to review.  After experiencing the Mexican Grill we left for our hotel bathrooms.

Just got back for Vegas stood at circus circus  didn't really enjoy my stay a black out no TV no WiFi and my sheets had blood on them and the sink was clogged we stood in the towers floor 11 room 1147

This is a real scummy pit of a casino located on the end of the Las Vegas strip where the neighborhood looks dangerous. This time I came here only to return my Dollar rental car. I've stayed here in 2005 and at least can say you get a decent room for a low price. One of the stars for this place is for having a dollar car rental place where I could drop my rental car off. Otherwise, it would be just 2 stars.

I'm giving it 2 stars because the front desk staff was so nice.  The Reservation Specialists, Ron and Ronda, were condescending and rude by insinuating (Ron)  I was going to sneak more people in the room than I had originally made the reservation for.  I only called because their app charged my card twice in which he promptly refunded but not without some harassment.  The details are too long to write concerning RON so make your reservations online or go elsewhere.  SO, I was here in Vegas for a wrestling tournament, held across the street at The Riviera, with my 2 sons.  Nothing more. I was tired from working all week and my husband couldn't get Friday off so all I wanted to do was record my sons matches and sleep.  After the crowd became too much, I decided on FRIDAY that I was leaving on SUNDAY at checkout instead of MONDAY at checkout so I called reservations to cancel for Sunday night. Reservation Specialist RHONDA said I would need to contact the Accounting department Mon through Fri 8-5 for a refund.  WHY?  I should have just walked my tired behind to the front desk in the first place but NO, I had to call these bitter, angry folks with hopes that they would help.  So I say to Rhonda  "I'm giving a 48 hours notice to cancel my last day here and I'm already checked in.  A refund can't be issued to my card for 1 day?". I saw that the balance hadn't cleared but it was still pending on my bank statement.  So as nice as I was to this lady, she says, "Ok I see you just don't get it"  CLICK and transfers me to some music (LOL). So a recording answers and transfers me back to her at which point she hangs up in my face after I say, "Hi Rhonda, "it" transferred me back to you I guess".   (CLICK!)  LOL!!  What in the world?   I'm assuming Rhonda gets irate calls from dissatisfied customers often or she has poor customer service skills.  Either way is unacceptable for Circus Circus Casino Resort who charges NV residents outrageous resort fees.  I walked to the front desk and was immediately issued the refund I requested.  Apparently, it was Rhonda who didn't get it because her job is to listen to customers and she failed.  All she had to do was send me to the front desk.  PERIOD.  I live near Reno and I bust my butt  and do my part to ensure Clark Co is one piece.  Even though I have a one sided, professional negative perspective of Vegas, RON AND RHONDA could have been a pleasure to speak with but instead she chose to be another reason why I never want to go back to that place.  EVER.

I WAS ROBBED!!!
someone came into my room while i was sleeping and stole my phone and wallet, the doors don't close all the way, and when i told security they just took my information and said this thing happens all the time and they are not responsible.  this place is so trashy and awful, it had been a while since i had been to the circus circus, but i was only there for a convention for less than 24 hours so i figured i would go the cheap route and stay here, if you don't mind getting robbed then stay here.

Great hotel. We got upgraded because it was our honeymoon and also my birthday. One problem was our pillows were gross and had stains on them. But the staff gave us new linen and stuff so we were cool. I will go there again maybe next year. The food and games are also great. My husband hit the jackpot when he was there. I love this place
Terrible experience. Mold in my room, wallpaper peeling and water mark on the popcorn ceiling. Don't stay in the "run of the house" rooms no matter what. The nicest part of the casino is even musty.

Our room stinks, not just the occasional waft of cigarette smoke but an overwhelming smell of glue (affix the wallpaper once again?) It was so bad last night I could taste it! The room is clean and has the very basics. No mini fridge  but the prices here are fantastic. The other thing I would like to say about Vegas is that it is huge! Everything is so spread out, nothing is close. Midnight snack? Better strap your hiking boots up!

We needed a place to sleep, and this did the job =) it's not the nicest hotel in Vegas but it sufficed. We were in "A" Manor. I slept great both nights we were there. Clean rooms and bathroom, just an older hotel. Wonderful check in staff and housekeeping. We checked in super quick, waited in line maybe 5 minutes. My only nitpick is that it's so far from the main Strip, but that's not the hotels fault. I knew the distance from the center when we booked! 
We really enjoyed the casino and the buffet inside (delicious brunch for 17.99!) Another plus was a 24\/7 Krispy Kreme. 
We would stay here again for sure if we were looking for a cheap rate! I think most people have high expectations because it's Vegas, but this is OLD Vegas. Loosen up!

Went with the kids on the weekend of 10\/23\/10.

PROs:
 
- Had a lot of fun playing carnival games in the midway.
- Stayed in the West Tower (newly renovated).  Room was VERY CLEAN.  
- Got 2 free buffet passes for the kids.
- Has old school roulette tables, which I prefer. 
(i don't like the computerized ones.)

CONs:

-Buffet had no french fries or chicken nuggets!  I found this hard to believe, as I thought it would be geared towards kids' tastes.
- tub\/shower  had drainage problems. (but they let us use another room to shower the next morning)
-the TV did not have kids programming!!!!  no nick, no disney channel, nada.  UNBELIEVABLE!  (and, yes, I did call the front desk to ask about the TV.  it's not just me not working the remote right)  

OVERALL, i would definitely go again when taking the kids.
I would definitely stay somewhere else without the kids

:)

So we were in Vegas for EDC and finding a hotel was difficult.  Circus Circus charged $180 per night.  Interestingly the rate dropped to $26 per night the Monday after EDC so we decided to stay an extra day.  We booked the exact same reservation but the front desk staff told us we we need to change rooms and pay an upgrade fee?  What?!? We booked the exact same thing! The staff at the desk was rude.  Eventually they did give the same room at our booked price but the supervisor was unbelievably nasty.  She told us "well I'm gonna do this for you this time but in the future it won't be an option for you" Really??? You honor my reservation and then scold me?  That's breaking Customer service rule 101.  With such stiff competition in Vegas I would expect a below average hotel to at least make it up with fantastic friendly service.  I won't be back.

I do not suggest you stay here during your trip to Vegas.

We booked CC for a 4 night, 5 day trip having never been to  Las Vegas before. A lot of things confused us about this trip, but some do seem standard across the board so maybe Vegas just isn't for me. These include; no coffee pot in the room so you have to spend OVER 10 dollars at Starbucks EVERY DAY, because they want to rip you off and nickel-and-dime you, as well as not putting a fridge in the room so that when you go out to dinner and get these giant portioned meals, you have to throw it away. Not only is that wasting food which makes me feel terrible, but it makes you spend more money (shocker!). Not to mention the "resort fee", but I'll expand on that. I should mention we "upgraded" our rooms so we could avoid staying in the manor, which looks like the scene of a serial murderer documentary. 

The resort fee is apparently PER room, not reservation. Had we been notified of this, we would not have stayed. 25 bucks a night is supposed to include the extras like the swimming pool etc but half of the amenities are terrible or don't exist such a coffee pot\/fridge. What are you really paying for? NOTHING. There is a pool but it closes at 6 when the children go to sleep I guess.  What about the adults? This "resort fee" may include the walking sidewalks to the pool (broken) and the escalators (also broken) but after getting a recent food injury I can tell you, these small inconveniences add up pretty quickly.  Also the wifi is unsecured, which means anyone can use it even though it's supposed to be just for guests. I assume that's part of this "resort fee". The least you can do is put a password on it, and half of the time it doesn't work. 

Furthermore, I am glad I don't have kids because you have to walk them through a GIANT hotel full of smoke. If it's catered to families, how does this add up? Second hand smoke at a young age? I'm just glad I don't have kids and can manage. 

The room itself was mostly clean, but I can definitely see where people have smoked in the room despite it being "non smoking". The last night we stayed, I found a lid to a salsa or something under the nightstand. I didn't bring that into the room so it had been there for quite a while. Gross.  They also failed to mention that we had adjoining rooms (my friend and I had separate rooms across the hall from each other instead of next to each other which makes NO sense), and nobody warned us that we would be next to strangers. This doesn't exactly make me feel safe with all of my belongings in there and of course, there's no safe or anywhere to lock things up.

On the second to last day, we went out and came back to hit the pool since we paid so much money for it, and my makeup was missing. I couldn't find my 50 dollar foundation which I had just bought so of course I went into a panic and called down to the desk. They said the housekeeping staff accidentally broke it, which is fine, because accidents happen. However, they didn't leave a note or anything in the room which could have avoided this panic. The woman stated she tried calling the room and I didn't answer. Well, I'm on vacation, not hanging out in this hotel room. So they tell me there will be a note on my account so they can reimburse me, cool. I get down to the desk to check out and nobody has any idea what I'm talking about. So clearly, the management of housekeeping is useless here and didn't do her job. Fortunately, the manager at check out (Cheryl) was extremely helpful at handling the manner. Furthermore, she was interested in hearing what we had to say which definitely made the experience better. 

With that said, I won't be returning here. This place is not worth that kind of money and I honestly feel jipped having spent that much for a "resort fee" which does nothing for me at all. I honestly considered demanding money back at check out especially considering my foot injury which made this experience horrible. So if management is reading this, I want my 180 back. Also, I will be emailing this information to corporate to hopefully have these issues addressed before others suffer.

I just finished my vacation here. I was a little nervous after reading the reviews. But I figured I would give it a shot any way. I was pleasantly surprised. Check-in was quick and easy. We were upgraded to a king Minnie suite. There was a problem, the floor was not vacuumed , I called house keeping and they came and vacuumed. I did ask them to change the sheets the next morning. Because they didn't have that fresh sheet feel to them. So after that they changed them daily. I thought the food was great. Pizza was great. The Steak House is the best I've ever been to. The casino is lots of fun. Staff very friendly. I stayed in the casino tower. I think I would definitely stay away from the manor rooms. The casino gave us some free perks, such as free buffet, free specialty drinks and two free nights when we return..plus we earned lots of comp points and comp $$ on our players card. Just keep an open mind if you decide to stay here. If your expecting Ceasars Palace , then book Ceasars Palace. This resort has its own personality and vintage feel to it.

Visiting Vegas for softball tournament and had to stay at circus circus with the team. Hotel room has terrible beds. Terrible pillows and the water tastes like rust. Service in the entire hotel is terrible. While watching the football game in a bar I waited 20 minutes and had to seek out someone to get a beer. Charged $6.99 to use ATM. Everyone says that's the strip but while here we get up and immediately leave circus circus.  for the amount overpriced everything and quality of the rooms they should not charge to stay in the rooms. Superbad

We didn't stay here so maybe this isnt a fair review but I will never be back! First off it stunk. Like it needed a huge bath in strong cleaning agents. Second the service was not great while we gambled. The amusement park reminded of a shitty carnival that rolls through small towns. Maybe way way back in the day this was a great place BUT for me I wouldn't be back

Outdated remnant from the 70's hostile corporate junk bond takeover of the old mobster Vegas.  Circus' is about due for a good taste of its own medicine.  Please, someone buy and revamp\/demolish this casino?!  It has been renovated but never actually updated since the 90's.  It's smelly dingy and awkwardly laid out.  

There are many activities for the kids.  Most are also outdated.  The rooms are cheap.  Expecting a Motel 6 rather than a resort type room.  I would have to say that this casino, Vegas terms, is embarrassing.  To think international visitors come to our town imagining the City Center but get weasel'd here because of the low price.  

Embarrassing.  lol

$185 for a room on the 26th floor. I asked for a quiet room. This Does not exist at this place. 1. Its a family place (tons of children, screaming, crying, anger ones) If you want to pay for a hotel that does not charge for parking but most likely your car will be broken into this is the place as when I got to my car in the morning the car next to mine had a busted window and glass everywhere. Parking lot is very un-maintained. The elevators do not work. I have to walk 26 floors to get to my car parked 3 parking lots away because of the overly parked lots. My sheets had blood stains all over it and they were not stains by me. The room had drywall that was falling apart, I am shocked by the details of this property and how unwell maintain the property is. The windows where extremely dirty. I spent the night unrested because my neighboring room next door was shaking the wall no idea what they where doing with what sounded like ten children in a room. This is not a place for a "restful" night, there are endless clowns everywhere, 30 years ago this place was worse, I see there efforts but it has not changed much other than seeing more security patrols probably due to all the drama that happens at this establishment. I would not recommend this place for children. Take them to disneyland instead they will be less traumatized as adults.

This hotel is a piece of shit, old as fuck, dirty as hell. Expensive like all other nice ones. Hotel rooms is like a mile away from the main building, just the building by itself standing there. Spiders on my bed, furnitures old like shit. Paid $400 for one night. Seriously WTF? Zero fking stars for this piece of shit hotel

A very very good deal $28.00 per night in the West Tower. Valet was easy and $14.00 for the night. Check in was a 10 minute wait not bad especially with the Professional Bull Riders Association in town. Bell hope was quick and friendly. The room overlooked the amusement area down below which has a glass roof. Two queen sized beds, flat screen and nice deep tub. The room was clean and large for the price. Negatives the towel are like sandpaper and the food is rather expensive. I would definitely not suggest the the pizza place, see separate review. Overall great stay and will definitely return.
Viva Las Vegas...

We stayed for 2 nights recently because my 11 year old niece was here. The room was OK. No refrigerator so we filled the sink with ice. The sink dos t hold the water. The wallpaper in the room was torn, holes in the sheet on one bed. The AC in the elevators and hallways was broken so it was HOT in those areas. The smaller pools water was green and it's a salt water pool. Could definitely taste the salt. Great splash pad area for the kids and the adventuredome and midway are awesome. Room service prices are pretty good. I had ankle surgery and brought my knee scooter. The flooring in the the casino and balls is horrible!!!!  With all the cracks my scooter wanted no part of rolling over it. I had to be very mindful and good very slow. As we all know people can be rude so they had no problem trying to push me out of the way. You are t allowed to bring any outside food or drink to the pool. The 2nd day, my birthday I wanted to buy a souvenir drink at the bar. Of course they were out of the size I wanted they didn't have. I ordered something else and they ran my card with the chip. It came back they said unable to read the chip and I was told 1 in 10 wasn't being read. Hmmmm imagine my surprise when I checked my bank statement and it had gone through after all
This Hotel is very low budget. Rooms were not even cleaned well. No hangers in closet, Room Services took close to 1.5 hours. Tried it once, never again.

This hotel is cheap but its all the way at the end of the strip which really sucks.. i remember when i came here in highschool i was freaked out. the clowns on the walls scared the freakin crap out of me! I remember getting off the elavator to go to the room and when the doors opened i remembered thinking " umm.. did i just take the elavator to hell? SHIT! " I hated the decor the halls and the decor in the halls looked like death. The only good thing about this hotel was the dome..! =( i hate clowns....
had a great vaca. not really a great place for kids not just the hotel but vegas period. bc of all the smoking

Date of trip: October 2010 
Purpose: In town for a wedding 
Status: Vegas Virgin 

I was sucked in by the price for a room "on the strip". I found a deal on a room and could have spent another $20 for a room in a NICE hotel that was ACTUALLY on the strip, so once I knew this, I kicked myself. Hard. 

The decor and condition of the room is on par with tired, dingy $25 rooms on the side of Route 66 in the middle of nowhere, I just WAAY overpaid. The bathtub spout wouldn't stop dripping loudly. The alarm clock was broken - didn't just not work, but some prior guest had smashed it to smitherines. There was actually a list of 6 things wrong with the room, which I called downstairs to tell them about. They just said ok, that they wrote it down, and suggested I order a wake-up call. SMH 

I also didn't appreciate them saying they're on the strip without a disclaimer, "TECHNICALLY we are on the strip, but you will be so far away from everything else on the strip that you will have to pay through the nose to get back and forth from your destinations and your room throughout your stay". 

Meanwhile, my friends on the trip were staying at nice hotels on the strip at or near The Venetian, where the wedding was held. They were sending pics of their rooms to FaceBook - gorgeous rooms, drapes with remote controls, etc. Then after I visited my friend in her Venetian room, my Circus Circus room looked like a total &*$# hole. I asked why nobody told me, they said nobody told them, either, that it seems to be the way of Vegas, Vegas Virgins stay in Circus Circus their first trip, hate it, and go to the nice spots every trip after.

Watch out for your kids at Circus Circus!!!
Midway arcade area by Mc Donalds. 
There's a ticket exchange counter that has 5yr old tootsie roll money banks. 
Bottom of the can reads JO9511 11:14
My friends daughter broke 2 teeth. Her adult TEETH! 12 yrs old and starts school this week.

I asked for a manager and I was told Risk Management is the only one who can help!

WTF Kind of shit is that as a guest!!! 
We spend hundreds of dollars or thousands of dollars to come to a place that allows adults to be kids and kids to be kids. 

You'd think that they would play close attention to what is brought into the hotel, that may effect our children. 

Tootsie rolls aren't suppose to be hard as ROCKS!!!

NOT ONE MANAGER OR HIGHER UP CAME TO CHECK ON US!!!

WATCH YOUR KIDS!!!!!

We spent the early morning sleeping here last week after driving who knows how many hours on our way home from New Mexico. I have to say the room was cheap even for the upgraded one we were in. It was decent, still we brought our own pillows and blankets. The complaint is about the room service. Yes the morning buffet would have been a better value but no one was about to stay up any longer to go down to the buffet. The tab came to $51 for 2 eggs and hashbrowns, 1 oatmeal and 2 oj's!! Crazy expensive.... they really got us there!

One word sums it up: Ghettoooooooooooooo.

If you're coming to Vegas with kids, read on... this should prove useful for you.

I have a kid too, so this place should be a slam dunk considering the rest of Vegas is targeting the scantily clad 20-something-way-over-the-top parties (hey no complaints).  It's not. The place is littered with trash both outside and inside. The lobby toilets were quite the adventure;  and did I detect a faint scent of barnyard in there? The pool area is loaded with seedy, overly tattooed, douche baggy, wannabe gangster types. Not a good kiddie scene. To boot, they didn't seem to have a separate kiddie pool from the main pool, so you know what's going on in that water. 

That was enough for me. 

I didn't even bother to check into a room - just immediately told the management I'd like to cancel and instead booked a room over at NYNY.  It's a shame really. This place has the potential to be "the" place to go for families in Vegas. 

If you are brave enough to check in, I strongly suggest you skip the Manor and Skyrise towers in favor of the West Tower, which I'm told is remodelled and much nicer.  And may the force be with you. 

Sorry Circus, I really wanted to like you, but I can't get over the yuck factor.

Thank you for hearing my concerns #mschristie ( guest relations manager) I'm not a hard to please person since my nieces like the adventuresome so much, still I'll make way to check in to your hotel. This time I'll make sure not to get a room from the manor lodge. I give 5 stars to you for being a good guest relations manager. You really knew your job. 5 stars for the valet parking attendants special mention to Eddie ( security ) when we got lost and park so far before checking in.

First of all... let me begin by addressing a common complaint I'm seeing on here: the massive abundance of children.  For those of you complaining that this place is packed with kids - take hand, smack face.  The name of the place is Circus Circus, for crying out loud!  There is a circus and an amusement park inside of the place, and you're surprised that it's wall-to-wall kids?  While I fully agree than The Strip is no place to bring your children, it's pretty obvious that everyone who's oblivious to that fact is most definitely going to bring their little screaming banshees to the giant indoor amusement park\/circus.  I mean, c'mon people!

That being said, the hotel is, in fact, terrible.  It most definitely needs to be downgraded to a 2 star rating, because I have stayed in nicer motels than this supposed 3 star hotel.  We chose it knowing that it wasn't the nicest hotel on The Strip, and because they were offering a promotion of 2 free Cirque Du Soleil tickets with a 3 night stay, but the experience was certainly not one that I would expect from a 3 star (above average) hotel.

After dealing with airports, flights, luggage, rental cars, and traffic for the past 10 hours, we wearily entered the Circus Circus hotel lobby, wanting nothing more than sleep.  What I saw made me want to cry: a line of at least 100 other people waiting to be checked in stretched across the entire length of the dark and dingy lobby.  Rather than having someone at every desk position, there were only 5 or 6 check-in clerks on duty.  We waited over an hour to be checked into our room.  Once we were finally in our room, we immediately noticed that we had been given 2 double beds rather than the one king bed we had requested when we booked our trip several weeks prior.  We didn't feel like dealing with the hassle of having it changed, nor did we expect that they would even be able to, so we decided to just deal with it and went to bed.

We weren't particularly close to the elevators, but somehow the mechanical whirring and banging of the elevator machinery traveled quite nicely through the walls to our room.  Being a light sleeper, I knew that this would most certainly keep me from sleeping.  Fortunately, using a combination of ear plugs and a white noise maker, I was able to drown the sound out well enough to sleep.  The check-in process and front desk employees discouraged us so much right off the bat that we just didn't feel like bothering with trying to get our room changed.  None of the employees we came across in any of the shops or the Adventuredome were particularly pleasant either.

The one good thing I can say about this hotel is that our room was clean.  After reading some of the other negative reviews on here, I was pretty terrified of what the room would look like (smoke stained walls and sheets, funky odors, etc.), but the room we ended up in was perfectly acceptable in that regard.  The sheets and blankets were clean (although I never ever use hotel comforters just as a general rule, since they don't get washed regularly), the bathroom was spotless, and the walls and carpet were perfectly acceptable.  I think that may have been another reason we decided to stick with the room we got, after seeing some of the horror stories on here.

Overall, I am giving Circus Circus the same rating I believe they deserve on the universal hotel rating scale:  2 sad little stars.  If I ever return to Vegas, I will certainly not be staying here!

MIDWAY REVIEW ONLY:
After seeing the sad looking Dungeon of Fun at Excalibur, we brought the girls here to have some. 

There were a lot of game choices the girls played on their own as well as ones we played as a family. A lot of the same\/similar games we have seen over time but still as fun and not bad for $1 or $2. Luckily the day we went I also scored six 2-for-1 Midway games coupons through another source. That was a maximum $12 savings for us. 

The employees working the games were friendly and nice so it made approaching them and playing the games even more fun. I think this is a different shift than the weekend employees who have to deal with the mass numbers of people and craziness on the weekends. LOL! Maybe that's why they're nicer and happier?

We did catch a couple of the short shows they have in their little circus arena so that helps stretch out the time in between spending money. It's definitely a fun place for the family but be sure you're ready to spend some money.

Not the worst hotel I've ever stayed in, but it was close. The only redeeming factors where that it was cheap and the bed wasn't horrible. The room was vastly out of date, I kept getting whiffs of someone smoking through the walls and floor, nothing really seemed clean, and the wifi was terrible. I would never stay here again if I end up in Vegas for some reason.

This is the best value hotel and casino in las vegas

1. Free circus shows (where else in vegas)
2. Friendly staff and casino floor smells great
3. Lots of things to do at the midway, great for kids
4. Our room was clean at all times (west tower)
5. Affordable restaurants inside

The only downside is that it is further up on the strip and away from the center of the strip but we had a rental

The location is not bad if you are looking to visit downtown too

All in all for the price it was great in the best tower for 35\/night

Those that complain need to go pay 350 somewhere else for a deluxe room

The location was great. We had a car, so this was a great jump off point. At first we thought it was great, but as the days went on, we noticed the lack of cleaning staff around the resort property. The pool was ok, but the ground was disgusting. Cigarette butts all over, rocks on the ground in the splash pad - which is dangerous with kids running around. Crap all over in the hallway to the pool, it was there for two days straight!!!!!! Also, I went to print my boarding pass and they were out of toner and 'nobody was available to help'.... apparently I was supposed to call a 1-800 number. What?!?! Ugh, frustrating. I would honestly spend more money and go to SLS or even The D!

Worst hotel ever...old,smelly, filthy ... nothing like what i expected....booking.com showed this amazing room but when we arrived it was more like the projects even the inside of the casino was dirty and overly crowded ...never ever again . I DO NOT recommend this place ...yes its inexpensive but remember you pay for what you get
I've had better accommodations as a soldier in the field compared to my stay here at circus circus

Coming to Circus Circus yesterday for celebrating my girlfriend's birthday ! Was upgraded to Mini Casino Suite. Amazing Experience I would said. A lot of people complain about smoking, smelly Casino, but no problem for me at all. Reasonable price, worth every penny I spent. Remember this is a budget resort you can find on the strip.
The only problem for me is the self-parking garage, I hope you have more security running around.

Circus Circus was a wonderful experience for us. When we arrived our check-in was suppose to be at 3:00pm. But because of the outstanding service of housekeeping I was able to check in at 1:30pm. LOL. When we arrived at the room it was simple. large window, two queen beds, TV, table with two chairs. And the best part, THE A\/C was already set at 70, because it was extremely hot outside, 99 degrees! Bathroom was small, but yet it was very clean. We enjoyed our stay there and plan to be back to the Circus Circus Manor. We also had free wi-fi that was included to the room. Like i said on my quick tip, not pricey but COMFORTABLE!

Well, it's cheap and you can park an RV here.  
While it's on the Strip and seems like a good deal, do not stay here.  Stay somewhere else.   
Seriously, this place needs a total fumigation and makeover.  And maybe a tetanus shot.
There are better deals.

Well, First off...They sneak a 'resort fee' when you first get there. 14.00 a day in addition to the room fee. Sounds kind of like B.S. Especially since we were pretty much staying in the ghetto. As soon as we got into the room, I noticed that there were couple of wet spots on the floor...Not sure I really wanted to know. Hairs on the sheets, No fan in the bathroom....Weird spots on the ceiling....Yeah...Resort fee. I think what they meant to was "Your last resort fee" Next time....No.

A very old smelling casino with dirty carpets, it definitely looks its age in comparison to the newer ones, or even ones the same age. Idk how the rooms look, I imagine not all that great, and its on the upper end of the strip so it's quite a walk if you're staying at the more popular ones, but that can be easily remedied by catching the Deuce, which stood right in front. 

this place's saving grace is definitely it's theme park, which is really fun for all ages, and the fact that it has circus acts from morning to evening in its pretty big arcade park, the acts themselves are actually pretty good too. Circus Circus is definitely for families and the young at heart, and it's worth stopping by to check out these things  :-)

Unless you are a fan of Walmart, as in customer service, cliental and overall experience then stay away from this place. I realize it's cheap but there are other options. My room wasn't as dirty as others mentioned in the review but wow, this place is a circus! 

Funny fact: Advertised as the most family friendly place on the strip. On the way to pool and by room elevators is a Playboy Bunny video blackjack machine showing off a Playboy Bunny on the big screen!!

Wow...my trip would have been perfect if it werent for this uber crappy hotel. First we try to park and find that signage in the parking lot\/garages is not very good so we end up parking very far from the entrance. NExt the only upgrade they had to offer was for a king bed (we wanted two beds). At once point we had requested clean towels and had to call three times over the span of a day and got some really bad attitude before we actually got some towels...the requested extra pillow never showed up. By Saturday the parking and crowds were insane. Room service is only 6am to Noon. No coffee or fridge in room. Pool is really far from rooms, beds are stiff and uncomfortable...definitely not a great place to stay.
Worst hotel on the strip. It attracts horrible cheap people and is a dump. If planning on staying here think again. Horrible hotel. Might as well stay on the streets if planning on staying here

I will NEVER stay at Circus again
1) smoking is everywhere, I wouldn't let my kids(if I have any) to play there 
2) the gift shops & restaurants are expensive. Small water for 3$
3) at 8 am, u will see the drank people everywhere, elevators..etc 
4) people misbehave, I woke up in the morning and I found garbage in front of my door.
5) hotel area is far from the strip and the hotel is really old. 
6) the area around the hotel is super scary at night. I don't advice anyone to walk around it

I booked a night from Groupon for $27 plus resort fee of $30 I had to pay when checking in. The day I booked was Sunday,July 9. When I came to the hotel,at registration desk I was told that I booked a motel's room which belongs to Circus but not a hotel,and if I want to get a normal room at the hotel I will have to pay additional $15. So total price got to $72 for the night at this shitty room. It smelled like toilet everywhere,even at buffet on the first floor. I do not recommend stay at this "hotel",you can find much better deals for this price!

Since we were having to be in Vegas with kids (ages 4 and 10) several people suggested Circus Circus as being the most "kid friendly" to stay. My husband paid for the stay online and upon checking in we were told the $37 a night plus tax rate was a "glitch in the system" and actually owed $453 in addition to the $137 we'd already paid. Because I am OCD and printed the actual receipt from the internet that showed the nightly rate, they dropped it down to $223. Still a huge cost and, in my opinion, not worth it, and just a huge disappointment. The entire place smells of smoke but that's Vegas. However, other hotels\/casinos must filter their air differently because we did not notice it as much when we got to the Luxor (also 100 percent kid friendly and a better value for higher quality). Anyway, our room was fine. It had two queen beds and a television. It was missing a chair and table (it was obvious because there was discoloration where those things used to be), but we just wanted to get the stay over with. The kid areas (Midway and Adventure Dome) happened to be closed the first two days we were there, even after we called to verify their hours before choosing this place, so we ended up not being able to visit them until our third day BUT they were a huge hit for the boys once they were open. The games were things they enjoyed and not too much of a waste of money. Vince Neil's was surprisingly good for breakfast (there's someone that passes out coupons for it, get one!). Starbucks was SO EXPENSIVE compared to anywhere else on the strip. I've been a partner for 9 years and I was surprised how much it cost. They said it was "resort fees" (Luxor Starbucks did not cost as much). I love my 'bucks but not for $4 more than the $5 I already pay. In closing, if you use Uber, you have to walk literally a mile through the Casino where they are allowed to pick you up. Really difficult with kids but once you're in the Uber you can escape to other wonders of the Strip that aren't so smoke stinky and meh. You have to request the wi-fi login and it's not 100% free.

No bot water. 
Tub doesn't drain. 
No outlets. 
Random lamps. 
Good service. 
Walmart hotel form sorta, except the employees seem to care.

Parking is cramped, smelly lobby and hallways. Booked a non-smoking room gave us a room smelling tobacco with ash on the floor and used towels. Called guest service they hanged up on us twice. Terrible service and very, very low class hotel we should have stayed in a motel.

To the comments about bed bugs, it is absolutely true! After my stay here, my boyfriend and I started getting bit by bedbugs and unknowingly brought them home with us. We had to go through days of extermination and it was just the worst situation to deal with. If you stay here, do not leave your belongings on the floor as that is how the bedbugs crawled into my suitcase!! BED BUG BEWARE AT THIS HOTEL!!!! I am still surprised that recent guests are still commenting on this problem, since I stayed here one year ago when I got bed bugs from this place. I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!

I been coming to this hotel since I was a little boy when my family would visit Vegas every year. Strange, it seems to more fun as a youngster than as an adult, but I guess the Midway Arcade is more entertaining as a kid then as a adult. Perhaps because I'm older and making my own money, gaming at Circus Circus isn't appealing like at the other casinos. But when I come back to this place, it brings back a lot of memories.
