I am surprised how low the ratings are for this hotel.  We found a room on Expedia cheaper than any other on the strip. We ended up paying an extra $10 for a room above the casino area and had gotten two free buffet vouchers.  A fridge or microwave would have been nice, however, you are in Vegas and should be spending little time in your room!  Look at where the rooms are located before making your choice, the casino rooms are in the perfect location, being central to the hotel and hotel activities.  The bus stop (Deuce) is in front of the hotel, costing $20 for three days per person.  This is a lot cheaper option than taking a cab if you will make more than a couple of trips.  If you have not been to Vegas, Circus Circus is on one end of the strip with the Luxor on the other end.  Most of the fun and activities will be had in between these two hotels. It took 30-45 minutes, depending on traffic, to get from one of these hotels to the other.

Ok 10 years ago, when I was playing all the kid games at the midway, this was the place to be. 

10 years later when I have a different apetite for entertainment, this place just doesn't cut it anymore.

I do feel however that this place is for traveling families that have young ones with them. Leave your kids at the theme park while you go gamble. Ok, not a bad idea. The problem with that is that they made this place more geared to attract young people and not convince their parents (and grand parents, for that matter) to stay here and gamble while leaving their kids (with supervision, of course) to all the fun areas. 

The casino floor is in the SAME EXACT CONDITION that I remember from 10 years ago when I was not of legal age. It's the same red\/orange\/weird carpet they've had since the beginning of time and they've not done much to change it.

The poker room is also at one extreme corner of the casino, and is very small. Not much action going on there. Last I remember there were 3 tables of 3-6 going on and nothing else. The tables weren't even full.

The hotel rooms are very similar to motel 6 (not that it's a bad thing), but for a hotel\/casino in Las Vegas, they are below standard.

Circus Circus was a great idea to begin with, but I believe that unless they change up what they're doing, they may have to blast this hotel\/casino to the ground like Dunes and Frontier.

Not a bad hotel and pretty reasonable prices.. The older rooms are in the MANOR which i think thats where they place ppl who get deals online unless u pay an upgrade fee.. My room was clean and decent old tv and my window wouldn't open.. The casino isn't too busy most ppl go to other casinos along the strip better luck.. Theres lots of things to do inside including ADVENTUREDOME which is great for kids and pre teens.. A bit expensive but its all day fun.. If you stay in the hotel u get a $5 discount on wristbands fyi unless u can find an online deal.. No complaints ill def be back

I knew what i was getting into before i went there. But wow did they surpass my low expectation. It's vegas, i get. I know that on some weekends  when there are events going on, hotel prices are going to be a bit higher. But the quality of this place was no where near the price we had to pay. (there were no other options.) Besides being out of the way on the strip, the interior and decor are completely outdated and worn. There was some weird smell that was flowing through the entire downstairs. Like wet floor, urine and burning clowns. All the staff wasn't exactly hospitable, nothing terrible just a little sub par. The rooms were really crappy, especially compared to what is available on the strip for the same price. Never if i have the choice will i stay there again.

I realize that Las Vegas has tried to transform itself into a destination resort for families, but Circus Circus has become overrun by children and teenagers who's parents have dragged them to Vegas so mommy and daddy could gamble. l

I stayed here on my last trip because it was the cheapest on-strip hotel I could find on such short notice. If the families weren't everywhere (at literally all hours) this would simply be a scary nightmarish clown city that overwhelms the senses. I will say, that it is worth your time to head upstairs to the 'Horse-a-Round Bar' - the rotating bar that overlooks both the casino floor and carnival madness. 

Many people will tell you to stay somewhere else, but I will tell you, for all its faults, there are few places you will find that are more absurd than Circus Circus.

Inexpensive, but they saved money in construction by making the walls PAPER THIN! Snoring guy one one side of our room and loud children going at it until 1:00 a.m. on the other side. You could hear every word, every cough, and every sniffle, too. 
We were also told smoking in the room would result in a hefty fine, but this place certainly smelled of smoke.
No coffee maker.
Not staying here again.

First time for my guests and I.

I ended up booking my room last minute for a friends Birthday. We stayed in the West Tower, which has access to the Adventure Dome. Our room was basic. Very small T.V. that was about 20 something inches in size, with blurry channels. The carpet in our room was wet for some reason. I called the operator for extra towels. When the towels were brought, I noticed that all 3 towels were stained and dirty. I called again and had them replaced. There was no reception at all through the casino floor which made it hard for me to contact my friends through phone calls or text messages. Overall experience was good, but not at it's finest. For it being a last minute trip, it went smooth.I had fun and so did my guests. I like how they have circus acts towards the middle of the casino on the upper floor. I was only able to catch one clown, who happened to be walking the opposite direction I was walking to. Would I come back? Sure. I'm just not a fan of where it's located. For one, it's somewhat off the strip and two, it reminded me of Down Town Los Angeles - Skid Row. I would encourage anyone to stay or visit this place, but at your own risk!

Oh yea, before I forget. The dealer at the Black Jack table was somewhat giving me a hard time, due to the fact that I had trouble reading and adding the "Ace" card to the rest of my hand. I'm used to playing with the Virtual dealer Blackjack tables, which obviously adds and display your total. The guy next to me, who was there before me, was getting annoyed with the fact that the the dealer would delay the game and put me on the spot. The dealers intentions were good but the whole thing with him putting me on the spot in front of others and delaying the game was not necessary. Either way, I tipped the dealer out because he was doing his job and brought me some luck. I'm not going to sit here and cry about this but it was somewhat embarrassing.

But any who, I had fun and I'll becoming back eventually in the near future.

I don't understand the poor reviews of this place.  I am here right now the service is top notch all around aspects of this place; my room is clean, sure its an old hotel & you can definitely note this fact re: smells & decor - but for the price this place is the best value on the strip - i am a fan i will be back & again the staff here are top notch excellent service, very friendly & down to earth. 

Save $'s & time book here, if you want a decent location re: proximity to the strip with comfy rooms and again excellent facilities - great mix of folks, families and gamblers!

Midway review
With so many kids in our family, this is a stop we always make when we visit Las Vegas

I've been coming here since I was a kid and now that I have my own rugrat, this place is a kids paradise. 

The arcade games with hundreds to choose from for all ages is great. They keep it in good working order which is a plus. 

The carnival games are classic. Winning those stuffed toys never gets old. What do you really do with a giant minion, hahaha. Kids love them though =)

The circus acts are good. Hey, they're free, enough said. 

I'm glad Circus Circus still has the Midway. After all these years, it's still the same =)

I absolutely loved my stay!! I went with my family and our room was perfect even my mom (she's picky) loved the room! The staff was friendly & the experience was super nice! Not only that we also won in the casino!! We requested extra towels and pillows and within a couple of minutes got some! Our room was clean & the kids loved the play area super family friendly and clean!

My family and I stayed at this hotel over the weekend because there was some big boxing fight over the weekend causing all the rooms to be sold out\/expensive in a last minute's notice. I haven't stayed here in ages and from what I recall as a kid, I kept my expectations low. I had found it interesting that the lobby was packed with adults. Not families, but adults. I was guessing a majority of visitors use this Circus Circus just to have a bed. When I entered the room, it smelled like someone sprayed an overwhelming amount of air freshener (I'm guessing for the smoking rooms?). The room actually didn't look that bad. The double full beds were nice and clean, the bathroom seemed spotless, but you could tell that the rug had not been cleaned for years. 
I wanted to visit the arcade area since I haven't visited in years, but this time I was actually excited to pass through the slots area as I am of age. I totally regret that. All the slot locations in this whole casino wreaked of smoke. It felt like the air wasn't being circulated and you were just inhaling smoke. Once I got the the arcade area, it felt empty especially for a Saturday night. There were a lot of carnival games where it seemed like they were begging you to play. I only played the claw machine games where they pretty much jip you because I knew I positioned the claw perfectly, but somehow they just want me to insert $20 before I can actually get a $2 stuffed animal. 
In all, I would say I wouldn't mind staying here just to have a room, but that's pretty much it. They don't really have a food court just to grab a bite, except for Krispy Kreme donuts and Auntie Anne's pretzels. Otherwise, you can step outside and have some Mc Donald's next door.

Circus Circus has some very good prices on a weekday (probably the cheapest in town). It is a family friendly hotel but that doesn't necessarily mean it's zero Niveau. In that case it was. The pool is super small for such a big hotel and totally overcrowded. And who builds a pool right next to the street in the ground floor? People walked in with McDonald's bags full of junk food and kids jumped into the pool making everyone else wet. 
Kids are running wild inside the hotel as well. We did enjoy the free circus act which was done very well and very entertaining.
Circus Circus has the BEST Breakfast\/Brunch Buffet and it is inexpensive!  The indoor amusement park is a must see and must do for travelers with children and the young at heart.

The last time I was there was with my family.  The interior is so outdated it just paints sad clowns. The inside smells musty and the housecleaning is deplorable in there. I went into the bathroom and it looked like there was a booger on one of the towels. Disgusting! The toilet didn't work and was plugged the whole time. I can say the only thing I enjoyed there was playing a few of the games at the game booths and watching a dog show. 

Another incident was four years ago and it was a nightmare in that hotel. I came with a group of friends for New Years. When we received our hotel key we were directed to the back? I thought we were going into the hotel. Instead we were directed into the shady back area called the manor. All of us were creeped out by the vibe of the place. It was tiny and the interior looked as if it was peeling. The bathroom was puny and the place looked as if we time-traveled to the 70's. So we tried to make the best out of it anyways. The shower was terrible and the  plumbing was loud. 

The walls are paper thin and you can hear everybody from up, down. Once we got in our rooms we finally crashed only to hear some obnoxious and rude a$$ neighbors loudly coming out the room and pounding our door and complaining that we were loud. It was a wtf moment.  Do NOT stay in the manor. It was an awful stay and I would not recommend anyone to ever stay there even if it's cheap! 

Lastly, I had a bag ofclothes that was left behind. My friend informed me they gave it to front desk to send it to me. Guess what, I NEVER got my clothes back and my favorite sweater was gone! The customer service SUCKS.

Good place to visit for kids but get out quickly. The hotel is a joke stinks to high heavens it may be cheap but not worth it. I expected the worse when we arrived and that's what I got.
STAY STAY FAR AWAY.

Stayed at the manor. Room was clean but did not feel safe walking around at night even to my car which was just parked outside my room. It was the cheapest deal online glad I came here only for business. There was a guy with no shoes on outside smoking. Had some kids call me aye foo, do you have a light?  It feels ghetto and trashy. I would book again for the price but would not leave the room. If I was coming here with friends this would be the last option.

C'est une usine ! Mais bon on s'y attendait. 
Rien que la rception pour rcuprer ses cls ... Les guichets d'une gare !
L'htel est sur le strip mais un peu excentr au nord par rapport au reste des autres htels\/Casino.
Il est bon march par rapport aux autres tablissements et il a son parc d'attraction sous son Dme et plusieurs piscines.
Le wifi n'est pas gratuit et celui-ci est obligatoire ( rajouter donc sur le prix de la rservation).
Nous tions 4 (dont deux ado) : la taille de la Chambre tait correct, par contre la dcoration est vieillissante et sombre avec des gros meubles (une armoire immense pour la tl par exemple) mais nous avions la vue sur la Stratosphre. 
Avec le nombre de clients dans cet htel, il faut compter quelques minutes avant de regagner sa chambre (plusieurs ascenseurs, temps d'attente).
Suffisant pour 2\/3 jours.
Good place to stay at if you have younger kids. I spent most of the time in other hotels because this one was infested with little rugrats.

If it sounds too good to be true (the price) it is.  You get what you pay for.  Cheap rooms, little dirty, no coffee pot, microwave, or mini fridge (but you can pay $20+ a day to rent a mini fridge.  We asked for a view....got one of a new building being constructed and Trump Hotel .  It took us 2 days to figure out how to get to our room....layout is so confusing and have to take multiple elevators to get to the swimming pool.  It's also a bit of a walk to the cool things happening way down the strip.  Next time I'd definitely pay double for something better and closer to the things going on down the strip.  Oh and if you want bottled water it's $3.33 and up or go next door to the little gift\/convenient store and get 2 bottles for $1

Das Hotel liegt am nrdlichen Teil des Las Vegas Strip. In der nheren Umgebung befinden sich die Hotels Sahara, Riviera und das Stratosphere.
Das Circus Circus ist ein familienfreundliches Hotel und durch einen Sky-Shuttle (Bahn) mit den einzelnen Hoteltrmen verbunden.
Im Inneren des Hotels befindet sich der grte Indoor-Freizeitpark Amerikas. Der so genannte Adventuredome bietet unter anderem die weltweit einzige Doppel-Looping-Indoor-Achterbahn. Den ganzen Tag ber finden Zirkus-Vorstellungen im Hotel statt, man kann aber auch eine verwegene und atemberaubende Fahrt mit dem fliegenden Trapez ausprobieren.

Alle komfortablen und grozgig geschnittenen Rumlichkeiten (3.700 Gstezimmer) sind mit allen Vorzgen und Annehmlichkeiten fr den modernen und anspruchsvollen Reisenden ausgestattet. Die Zimmer haben natrlich Bad\/Dusche und WC, eine Klimaanlage, Telefon und Fn, Kabel-TV, Safe und 24h Zimmerservice.
Ich finde, das Circus Circus berzeugt durch ein gutes Preis-Leistungs-Verhltnis und verfgt ber mehrere Restaurants. Das reichhaltige Buffet ist ein Augen- und Magenschmaus.

Auerdem verfgt das Hotel ber zwei Swimmingpools, einer Shoppingpromenade, drei groen Casinos auf einer Flche von ber 10.000m2. Fr Hochzeitskanditaten steht natrlich eine Kapelle zur Verfgung. Das Parken ist kostenlos.

I was sleeping in my room nber 25708 and sebody while I was asleep broke into my locked room and stole my purse.

Risk management at the casino said it was my fault for not using the deadbolt!! 

Really??

I asked them what if I would have been raped and they proceeded to tell me it would still be my fault!!

Never again circus circus never again

I have never had any problems with the rooms. They have always been helpful if I needed something extra. My kids love going and we always stay here when we come to vegas. It is a bit far from the main part of the strip but it's worth staying at if you have kids.

What the hell was I thinking? It's time to blow this hotel into oblivion. The place had more kids running wild than Michael Jackson's love grotto. Sure I saved a few bucks on the room, but I spent the savings on cab rides to the part of the strip that actually has a pulse. The dealers looked ashamed and pissed (like they failed some card dealing course and this was their continuation school). The buffet is pukable at best and the rooms require a hazmat suit on entry. Perhaps a small price to pay for being on the strip, but now I have lice.

No, no, no, no... my family stayed here for 1 week because my younger cousin did not want to stay at Caesar Palace with boring old people is what he claims. Worst decision ever we should have gone to Ceasar's and my aunt and uncle should have stayed there. When we got to our room, they told us it wasn't clean and we needed to wait 3 more hours, when they finally let us in I decided to take a shower and the shower head was not working! I found a cockroach inside the nightstand, and the worst part was me and my brother had a separate room, what a big mistake that was at 2:00 am these two men were banging on my door drunk saying they were going to kidnap me they didn't leave till 2:30 and I had called the concierge telling them what was happening the security never showed up! The main reason we stayed at circus circus was my cousin wanting to have fun and go in the adventure dome, he got bored after one day he said the rides were dirty and stupid he was (12) at the time. Oh word of advice, outside the Adventure Dome they sell these "MAGICAL" fuzzy worms that are like $40 don't buy them they come with a string and don't work they ripped my brother off. Never coming here again!

I stayed in the manors for 2 nights.  It was the worst Vegas experience ever.  Might as well have stayed at the Travelodge right next door...because they look,  feel and sound like a 3rd class motel.

This "hotel" seems like it hasn't been updated since it was built in 1968.  I got a callous on my thumb from pushing the awful toilet flusher button.  The blankets were covered in suspicious-looking hairs.  There was a brown stain I could only hope was chocolate.

It's at the butt-end of the strip, you have to walk through the main Circus Circus hotel, then past 2 empty lots facing some "fancy" shops such as 7-11, Ross and McDonald's.  By the time we walked to the Venetian, we were so exhausted we turned back without even gambling.
Kids loved it here!!!! Tower room is not bad but lobby is smelly. Definitely won't stay here anymore except go here for activities.

Just no, it was my husband and my first trip to vegas with kids and we saw a couple of articles stating circus circus was good with kids,  no, it's ghetto, old and not kid friendly at all.  The pool is tiny and dirty and just no on all levels, thank God we were only there for 1 night.

I don't know where to begin I'm still here as I speak I'm in my hotel room at Circus Circus laying in my bed now. I have spent all day gambling on slot machines: dollar, quarters, pennies and $25. and I've lost $1000 or perhaps  a little less than that. However I did win a huge mug with margarita, a t-shirt and now I have two free buffet tickets or points to use tomorrow. I started gambling earlier today and I made  my first mistake by placing my $100 bill into the wrong machine thinking it was a 25 cent machine; however it turned out to be $25 machine!! and I lost a hundred dollar bill in one minute probably less than one minute more like seconds. It was gone. Because I messed up One of the nice managers named Jim was able to help me out and he credited my Circus Circus Players Club card $50. he was hesitant but finally made a decision to help out. That was pretty nice. would have been even nicer if he credited the whole $100 to the card but that's fine. I lost anyways so circus won haha. And if you're reading this Jim thank you anyways for your $50 credit. Aside from all of that I love my room I have a great view of the South strip I can see Trump Tower, encore, Mirage, Palazzo, Caesars and I can see Treasure Island and part of Wynn and other hotels...great view at night. I'm on the top floor 29th floor of the sky rise tower. Very clean room comfortable two queen beds. I will ask for this same room next time.  I've stayed at top strip hotels over the years and NONE with this view.  I was here in LV 3 weeks ago with friends and I stayed at the Flamingo (and I went to see the O circus show at the Bellagio hotel. Great show) but views are limited because close proximity to other hotels w depressing views of dull sides. The pool and its view at Flamingo is wonderful. Circus Circus pool SUCKS.  It's very outdated and dull. But Circus Circus offers a great observ ers view few blocks from the hussle and bustle of ctr strip. In addition The buffet here at Circus Circus is very very good. Everyone seems very friendly here. I like that. I did have to walk xtra distance thru hotel to get to my room which is far in the sky rise tower but worth it. And luckily I brought my tennis shoes. I even dared myself to walk all the way to Excalibur yesterday and back took me 4 hours. Wow. But I'm athletic anyway. My room was very serene quiet with the buzz of distant traffic but very relaxing. Would i come back to circus circus? Sure! P.S. let me add I  was given exceptional room service courtesy of a Hispanic lady named  Connie. Very friendly very happy lady. Also at Big Chili Roberto and a night shift guy on May 20 were exceptional and the giant mug of margarita was\/is superb!! LUV THEIR MARGARITAS. Employees seem happy and lighthearted here compared to other strip hotels. Says a lot for Circus Circus. I will say one last observation regarding the slot machines. I noticed that in the beginning they would play payout and then immediately start taking the money back which was disappointing very disappointing. There was no way I could win because machine would dole it out like I said but take it back quickly. This is how I ended up losing so much money. Money is just money. I will not love it nor will I worship it. yeah I am disappointed I lost $1000  here at Circus Circus today on slot machines but next time I come perhaps I'll be playing the blackjack tables.
BUY GALLON BTL WATER ACROSS STREET. USE FOR COFFEE TOO. YOU'LL GET 2 COMP CUPS IN RM DAILY. COFFEE TASTE AS GOOD AS MY ORGANIC COFFEE AT HOME. lastly easy on alcohol... energy needed to walk everywhere. Cheers!

Monday night at 10:30 pm and the line to check in is at least 50 people and growing. I'll try to attach a picture. There are only three people checking in guests. And one line has been essentially stopped for 20 minutes with a woman with a pile of passports.  I may update later once I see the room but if I wasn't already so tired, I'd go stay somewhere else.

A more accurate name would be Shit Stank Palace. Unless you want to contract syphilis or diarrhea, stay away. My early childhood nostalgia became obliterated once my friends and I stepped into this dump on New Years Eve (They were Vegas first-timers). An overwhelming stench of smoke, body odor, popcorn and alcohol pervaded the casino and midway area. As we were leaving, a woman quickly remarked once she stepped in, "Ew, do you smell that? Ugh. Do you smell that?!?" Yes, ma'am, that smells like shit. No amount of cotton candy, foot long cocktails, and $1 hot dogs would have made it better. Even the famous Adventuredome isn't a good reason to visit (except during Halloween) anymore. Like most hotels on the north end of the strip, they have fallen victim to poor maintenance and cleanliness.

 It's too bad, I think with better management and investment in upkeep, Circus Circus could've been iconic...in a good way. Now it's legacy will be associated with the smell of fart.

Ok I knew that this was economy\/budget lodging but I didn't expect to wake up smelling like an ashtray! I don't smoke but after sleeping in Circus Circus "Manor" I smelled like I was a chain smoker. I had to wash my shirts in the sink to get the smell out.... do they wash the sheets between guests ? would not recommend this hotel.

I know this is a cheap hotel, and it's true that you get what you pay for. What makes me angry is that they advertise certain rooms and towers as "remodeled". We stayed one night in a "remodeled" room. It was honestly disgusting! The room had a very strong odor of cigarette smoke and musk. As soon as we walked in the room I called the front desk. They told me there were no rooms to move us to, even though there were still rooms available on the website. They said they would send housekeeping up to clean the room. The housekeeper came up and sprayed some febreeze type stuff on the carpet. That seemed to make our allergies and the smell worse! The carpets were so filthy that It was disgusting. My grandkids ran around the room with their socks on and they were so black and filthy that I had to throw the socks away! 
The kids did enjoy going to the amusement park but there weren't many rides they could ride. It did help that they give you a booklet with a $5.00 off coupon for the park, so we only had to pay $13.00 each for the kids. 
I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!

Updated review.

How many times do you have to tell the damn room service maids to not come in your room when a do not disturb sign is on the door, and you're naked in your room?   Answer:  Apparently more than twice.

I had placed both do not disturb signs on my door and the maid opened the door......not once but three times.  Once to make the signs on the door handle fall to the floor and her to open the door to see me naked. Twice to open the door and see me naked again.  And the third time to knock first, then open the door to see me naked again.  Her excuse was the signs weren't on the door, but on the floor.  Bullshit.

Then again the next day, with both signs on the door, the maid opens the door, no knock, to find my fianc laying naked on the bed, awakened by the door opening.

Both times they were asked if they noticed the do not disturb sign on the door.  Both times we got bullshit excuses.  What do these women want?  Why is it so important to see us naked?  And lastly, why does the hotel condone such activity? 

My thought on this is to never come back.  Period.

I can remember when Las Vegas went through their "family friendly" phase. Most of the popular hotels featured motion simulator rides, IMAX theaters, really stocked arcades, free "tamer" shows, and the like.

After "The Hangover" came out, Vegas ran with their "What Happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" campaign, and the family phase was phased out. No more simulator rides, arcades fell to neglect. No more G\/PG rates free shows and attractions. So these days, to take children and teens to Vegas is a true challenge.
Enter Circus Circus, the only hotel that the younger set has a decent chance at surviving during their Vegas stint. This is moreso due to a very nice amusement park and the ongoing circus acts.

But not all is good in Circus Circus Land. Here's the break down:

GOOD: The amusement park is a nice bargain. There's enough there to entertain toddlers to teens. I really enjoyed the two roller-coasters, and I'm thankful that Circus Circus is the only hotel on the Strip that still has motion simulator rides. Also, the circus act continue to be a nice add-on. It features great stunts of balance and high-flying acrobatics, and it's a consistent venue that's close to McDonalds.

BAD: Kids like buffets, and so do families with kids. But the Circus Circus's buffet is subpar. Yes, it will do the job of getting food into empty bellies, but with so many better buffets on the Strip, and a $17 dinner cost, I'm expecting much more, and better quality. Kudos to the pasta bar; easily the best part of the buffet.
The hotel is also way down at the end of things. It's bordered by a vacant lot that has been vacant for years, and the lot is a few blocks long. At night, it's empty, very dark, and eerie walking south from Circus Circus to the main element of the Strip. There are also some unsavory characters hanging out in the area.

UGLY: Smoke ventilation is horrible. As a non-smoker, I could feel the nicotine doing a number on my lungs. Circus Circus is an older hotel, and they've really neglected their ventilation system. It's so bad that you can cut through the smoke-odor with a knife. This is bad news for children and their young, developing lungs.

All and all, I'm recommending Circus Circus for families with children only because there's no longer any other family-friendly hotels on the Strip (including Excalibur). And while the amusement park and the circus are great touches, families need to be wary of the location, the poor buffet and especially the poor ventilation.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS PLACE!!!!  Worst customer service in Las Vegas. NEVER stay in the north tower. The rooms are old and smell like smoke. The AC unit sounds like it was having a securer every 3 minutes and if you decide to stay around Halloween time beware of the traffic nightmare getting or out of the parking garage.  The staff will not tell you these things when you check in and they will not compensate you for your loss. Recommend you stay away from this property.  Slots are ultra tight and table games are hard to find.

My advice is to just stay away from this place unless you don't care about any cleanliness noise rude managers anything you could imagine about going to a hotel that could be bad was bad if you want a cheap place to take some kids to run around like Helter Skelter make a lot of noise get bed bug bites get sick from the buffet this is your place. Don't try to call the front desk at takes 10 minutes to get ahold of anybody the manager is very rude had a problem at the buffet the buffet manager said to talk to the hotel manager since I was having problems he said that they could send me to a different Resort in the same group she said can't do anything about it offered me $30 off for the resort fee that you are charged every day I told her it really wasn't about that she said sorry can't do nothing for you call Expedia to let them know what was going on because she informed me to do that when they call me back they said she was rude and stubborn

My sister & I just entered the front-most building, because we wanted to experience a piece of our childhood. We visited when we were both age 5 and under. Besides, that they have FREE CIRCUS ACTS DAILY! So yes, I highly recommend dropping in for a short-while to see some acrobatics. There are some great talents there. In order to enjoy that, you'll have to endure some horrific smells and crowds (especially people with children and strollers). I cannot put my finger on the smell, but I think it's just old\/stale and smokey. Although, I think it's smoke-free and the smell is residual. To be fair, it looks like they have newer\/nicer buildings and they have that Adventuredome with rides. We didn't experience any of that. If I had more time I would have checked out the Adventuredome, but we had a lot of things we wanted to see first. Even if the hotel was nice, I would prefer to stay closer to the heart of the downtown Las Vegas Strip. It's prettier, closer to most of the attractions, food, clubs, and so on. Also, Circus Circus is in a sketchy area. The front building that we entered looked pretty sad and rundown, the upkeep on the inside and outside (of that 1 building alone) was poor.

This place is a circus and a joke, i thought the Stardust was bad but this one goes right along with it. They both need to be torn down and maybe Donald Trump can buy the land and rebuild some new casinos that would actually generate good business and jobs for Las Vegas. This is in the best prime Las Vegas Strip location and why this hotel is still standing there is beyond me? The rooms are horrible, the food is terrible and i refuse to gamble there...

I will literally be to the point as I'm using qwerty right now, no keyboard.

1.  Walls are thin
2. I can hear my neighbor fart, have sex, and listen to their ENTIRE personal conversation without yelling. Disgusting
3. TV next door are loud and magnified. You will not sleep. Trust me.
4,  too too many children
5, again, too too many children
6.  Too "ghetto" and trashy place. Never again. I was afraid for my life! 
7.  All rooms are smoky smelly! 
8.  Staff socialize too much ignoring customers.
9,  old CRT tv
10.  Def ancient feel to this whole establishment
11.  Trust me on this please, YOU WILL NOT sleep! 

Oh yeah

12. Parking is very weird!
13. No fridge just a cooler box that never gets colder than 60F. What the heck?
14. SLOW Internet that crawls! Seriously
15. They charge $7 convenience fee a day for their SLOW dial up speed Internet, pool usage that's overcrowded (I never used it - full of children).


Checkout is a very slow process by the way ...... ONE person to check you out while the line piles up. Good luck if your flight scheduled early!

I just got back staying here for the first time from 9-6-15 to 9-11-15. I first stayed at the Manor in the back and I slept there one night and had bed bug bites all over! Put on a clean pair of socks and they were very black on the bottoms after walking on the carpet for 5 minutes! I was then moved to the West Tower and had a bed bug jump on my arm after an hour of being in my new room watching t.v. 

     I then told the management and they moved me to another room in the West Tower and was fine the rest of the trip! Best thing about the Circus Circus is the steakhouse there! Best steak I have ever had in my life! Who wants to be in an old, run down, smokey, bed bug infested room! I had to move twice and who wants to do that on vacation! 

     It is better to just spend a little extra money and stay at the Luxor, Excalibur or another one for an extra $100 - $300 bucks! Vince Neil's Bar also sucked as well! The food there was overpriced and terrible!  Best to skip the Circus Circus to save a little money! It is just not worth it! A lot better places to stay at for a little more!

Best at Value and we love Circus Circus its the best for family every detail on the Hotel is Circus theme its really BIG and VERY FUN WHEN I WAS HERE I OVER HEARD PEOPLE SAYING THINGS LIKE Circus Circus is this and that Nooooo its affordable and a site to see i will be back with my kids GODWILLING its very BIG and if your to lazy to walk the las vegas strip you can be lazy lol everything you need is in CIRCUS CIRCUS EVERYTHING AND OUR HOTEL WAS VERY CLEAN I REALLY ENJOYED MYSELF

I didnt stay here but visited. That was a mistake. The Midway area:  I should have known there would be a million kids. It was a madhouse. And dirty. Railings and games had grime. If I had children I would not want them in this place. Who knows what they would catch. 
I did have some friends who stayed in this hotel and they seemed  happy with it. So I dont want to say too much negative stuff. 
But if you dont like kids, dont go here.

My mom and I flew to vegas for my sisters wedding and the first room we were in smelled of shit as you walked through the door, called the front desk about they seemed to not care, because they did nothing about it. The room was dirty there were hair balls from God knows when on the floor and food from who freaking knows in the closet drawer.
 When my mom went to take a shower, the water didn't drain. Called the front desk again and this time they gave us a different room. On our third day in the hotel my mom woke up to find roaches in our bathroom. We tried to take a shower only to find out that the hotel is out of wash rags! How does that happen it's not like this is a small hotel. I walked down to the front desk to speak to the manager and he tells me he's not a manager just a supervisor, like that makes a difference, I tell him of the roaches and he says I need to speak to the housekeeping manager. 
They send this little woman who barely speaks English to try to help fix the problem, she can barely understand what I'm saying to her. What their response to all of this is to have housekeeping clean the room and spray. This is just crazy, I have never stayed here before and I never will again!!! Buyer beware

Alright so we had rooms booked at the Wynn but we decided to get into vegas 10 hr earlier than planned. Rather than pay $500 for just a extra couple hours I booked a room here for 30 spanking dollars. Threw our luggage in the room, and then head out. Came back to the room a couple hours later and had a power nap. Not sure why everyone is complaining...I mean you get what you pay for.....and for what I paid I felt like I got a pretty damn good deal. Clean beds and a clean bathroom.

If there was an option to give this hotel a Minus 5, I would love to. Wow wow wow where should I start, last minute Sema Show booking. I wish I stayed at Motel 6.Terrible Nasty Dirty Stinky Room. Walked 20 minutes just to find my Chateau... A Nasty Chateau. For $135 per night, I would've stayed at Belagio if there was any rooms available. Be smart... Never even drive in front of this Hotel, cause your car might Stink too

The rooms in The Manor behind the main resort are horrible and outdated. It is too far from the rest of the resort and the Strip in general. They smell like mold and the toilet barely flushed and the sink kept clogging up. There was mold visible in the room walls and the carpet was very dirty. The TV was a very old box type tv. The room looked and felt like something out of a 1950's time warp from the early days of Las Vegas. The room was grossly overpriced for what it looked like and had in it. The bed was comfortable but that was about it. I will not be staying at Circus Circus again.

The prices are cheap for a reason, the rooms were dirty and dated. The bathroom had long black hairs all over the floor and a leaky shower faucet.  After staying a weekend in this hotel I noticed I had bed bug bites on my stomach and after research have found out this is a normal occurrence in their rooms. I cannot believe MGM allows there name to be associated with this filthy establishment. I Will never stay in this dirty hotel again!

Honestly, Circus Circus doesn't get enough credit for their relatively cheap and fun carni games at Midway.  While I wouldn't recommend the hotel to stay (though there are newer\/remodeled non-smoking hotel rooms that are now available), you can't deny the children their fun and games while they're in Vegas.

Games cost from 25 cents to $3 (that's cheaper than our local OC Fair, folks, and available 365).  As it goes, the higher the cost the larger the prize.  Most of their prizes are current, including Hello Kitty and Minions from Despicable Me.  Most booths allow you to trade in your smaller prizes for the larger ones, if won from the same booth.  Midway also has a fun and FREE acrobatics show performed every couple hours.  It seems always crowded, even later at night, but the energy is vibrant and the kids (and adults) always love it.

There's also a small carousel themed stand\/booth that sells fairly priced snacks and drinks.  The best part is that the entire thing slowly rotates and has ample seating so you can take a load off from all the games.

This is my favorite casino to gamble in. This is based off of the penny slots, though- that's all I ever play. They have plenty of the old school, non-video machines. I always feel more lucky with those, like they're more by chance than the computer ones for some reason. Maybe it's my distrust for developing technology, who knows. The free drinks are not the strongest, but the waitresses come around pretty often so that's tight. It's almost bone empty if you go during the week, just a bunch of little old ladies winning big! Very cute and old-vegasy.

You pay for what you get first off.... Rooms are clean but dated, you can smell the oldness in the building. The casino gambling prices are cheap and the points you get on your players card go farther. Overall not really my style place, loud and noisy... But if you are learning to gamble it's a good spot or if you for some strange reason wanna drag your children to Vegas it's acceptable lol.
Hard to explain this experience.  Very flea market vibe.  It is most definitely not as glamorous as say the Cosmopolitan.

A family vacation turned into a nightmare at Circus Circus!!!  After a week, I'm still traumatized by the fact that the intruder standing by my bedside.

A burglar broke into our hotel room around 2 AM on Thanksgiving day while we were sleeping.  My husband woke up by the noise and saw a man standing at the end of the bed.  The thief then immediately slipped out of the room.  After checking the room, we realized that he had turned on the bathroom light and took my wallet from the nightstand next to the bed.  My driver license, credit cards, and some cash in the wallet were all gone.   

We immediately reported the incident to hotel security and they took a report, but couldn't do anything about the robbery.  The hotel made it look like our fault that we didn't lock the deadbolt in addition to the door lock and reluctantly refunded us for the second night as we were too horrified to stay for another day.  Later I learned from hotel staff that the door lock malfunction has been an ongoing issue. One of the employees said "The door is difficult to lock. Sometimes the cleaning ladies don't lock the room properly after cleaning and security has to check afterwards.  l'm sure they (the hotel) will fix the problem as they are currently going through renovations." 

After my trip, I found at least seven reviews (the earliest dating back to 2011) about stolen items at Circus Circus, some even with follow up messages from the hotel management.  Since the hotel management has been aware of the problem for a long time, why haven't they done anything about it?   Clearly, burglars are aware of this door malfunction and continue to take advantage of it.  

I don't recommend staying at Circus Circus at all - disappointed in management's lack of response to this serious issue.

I give a 2 simply because I have no complaints  about the room.  It was clean .. And well kept, nice. I just won't go back to this place . . I was happy about the deal I got, but you get what you pay for.   . The pools are so small , the water pad they have.  .  I expected more. And there is alot of ghetto people ( it's a cheap hotel , why wouldn't there be) . I feel like an idiot for being surprised . I should have expected that. Definitely won't go back.  I'll pay more somewhere else to lose 80% of the ghetto baggage that hotel has.

When you walk into Circus Circus, you see the kind of people you see in a truck stop-- like a Flying J or TA.  Seriously, expect too-blue bluejeans and NASCAR jackets and non-ironic airbrushed wolves on t-shirts.  The interior is dirty, smoky, and a creepy retro throwback to the "golden age" of Vegas.  

That said, they have tables with $1-$3 minimums, which is TOTALLY AWESOME.  The drinks are cheap (though not free), and the staff is really, really friendly.  And while I can see the point of the criticism of Circus Circus, shouldn't there be at least ONE place on the strip where a blue collar truck driver\/farmer-type from Mid-America can go with his family and not spend too much money?

In conclusion, if you're looking for a "fabulous" Vegas experience, obviously this is not the place to go.  However, if you just want to go gamble in your blue jeans for a few hours without a lot of fru-fru, Circus Circus can really hit the spot.

Thought that it was better than the reviews posted. Kids had fun and loved the haunted houses. Plenty of ghouls always scaring everyone. Be warned you are not safe from them creeping on you if you are in line for a ride. Safe place that you can drop off your kids for a few hours. There's plenty of security and a private waiting area that your kids can wait until they are picked up if it's after curfew hours. Also the Fast Pass was well worth it. Not every ride had a FP lane but we passed up plenty of people and were able to do more rides in the end. If I don't get the fast pass I wouldn't go.

Checked in on Sunday August 2 and when I got to my room the lady across from me was getting a different room due to bed bugs..... I left and took my children out and came back and it was red ants all over my stuff....I immediately called the front desk and went nuts..we checked out on the 5th and ever since we left my kids have been itching.......I'm not pleased with this hotel for all the money they charge that hotel should be well taken care of far as being clean and bug free....they make way too much to have bugs and they know children will be there...
Should be the cleanest hotel

Stayed here on a weekend with friends and had a such a BAD experience with theft. We had left to go out clubbing on a Saturday night at around 10pm to come back at 3am to find items from each of ours stolen. We were missing a Coach bag, Fossil watch, Michael Kors wallet, fur boots, along with makeup that were costly to us. It was VERY DISAPPOINTING at how management handled it because they didn't help us and just told us that they weren't responsible for our stuff even when we were sure we checked the door was closed before leaving. We weren't able to track anyone down due to the fact there were NO video cameras in the hallway. UNBELIEVABLE. It left us very frustrated that we had no way in figuring out the thieves and security weren't able to help us. This incident left us very uncomfortable in staying at a place where anything can happen and had unprofessional help from the management and staff here. Not planning on staying here again!!! Well deserved ONE STAR to this hotel.

I cannot say that I will ever stay here again..the room was remodeled so it was decent but the help was rude, the food was bad, and the location sucked. The only good thing was the adventuredome for the kids but it was so crowded that you could not enjoy it. The place smells badly and there are rude people everywhere..this place should be imploded

This hotel is just not worth it. I thought why not stay end of strip and save?! Spend extra and you'll be happy you did. 

The rooms are spacious. Front and bell desk are friendly but that's all I can say good about the place. 

My bed had red and yellow stains and a bed bug! The Manor lodge is a short sketchy walk from the main hotel. There was more than one sign saying dead bolt doors. 

The rooms are very outdated and smell like old wet laundry. The shower is about the size is a cruise ships cabin shower and the curtain clings to you!

Oh ok I forgot the trapeze artists we're actually good! But I'd rather have clean sheets honestly....

I stayed at west tower building 13 floor! I actually enjoyed it! My room was nice and clean. I don't know why some people are so picky! Why bother getting a room there if they can't see a piece of hair on the floor. Overall it was great. The buffet wasn't so great $44 for 2 people
With all the negatives reviews, it sure put a questions if this was a good choice.  You pay for what you get and it's not bad. Very pleasant stay. The only things is the Buffett was just ok.

When looking for a hotel to book for our visit to INFOCOMM 2016, I decided to give Circus Circus a shot. Never again. First of all, our room was generally sub-par. Stains on the walls and ceiling. Dust is abundant everywhere. The lack of convenient power outlets was also staggering. The kicker was the bathroom. Mold\/mildew on the walls and fixtures and the wallpaper was peeling off in several locations. The shower\/tub handle was also filled with mold\/mildew. 

The most interesting thing that happened was during our second night\/morning. Someone knocked on our door and proceeded to enter our room at 6:30 AM, which woke us up. We didn't see who it was, but they turned on our hall light, apparently saw us, and then left, leaving the light on. I spoke with facilities, housekeeping, guest services, and a front desk supervisor and all I got was "I don't know what to tell you," "use the latch on your door," "our maids don't start service until 8am," and a free breakfast the next morning when I finally got connected to a supervisor after a half dozen phone calls.

Also note it took over 30 minutes to check in, as the line was longer than something you're likely to see at a security checkpoint at the airport.

The price difference between this hotel and ones like the Hilton Grand, Treasure Island, Best Western, or Mandalay Bay (all of which have better ratings) is not worth it. Book somewhere else.

The hotel itself looked quite interesting from the outside, but didnt live up to our expectations at all. We had the misconception that all hotels on the strip had a certain standard to maintain and that any hotel on the strip would be better than the average best  western or American best value inn. Well, Circus circus proves that it doesnt.
Its quite hard to pinpoint exactly what it is but the lobby, the casino, the shopping area all just felt real shabby and dirty. The bathroom was really disgusting with mole-dew? (or at least it looked liked it) along the floor line. We strongly considered checking out and go looking for another hotel, but instead we went out to the streets and spend the night at the strip.
I wouldnt recommend this hotel for anyone. OK, its cheaper than average on the strip, but come on! Spend a few more dollars and youll get a way better experience than living on circus circus. Im sorry to say it but we have nothing good whatsoever to say about circus circus.

It literally stinks!

Unique Quality: There is an indoor theme-park at the site.

Well had a great time except for the repairs they were do at 330 in the mornings we were booked for 4 nights  and we left a day early because could not sleep at night and didn't say anything about it and let me think it was the other people in the room next door I think they should comp me a few days for that if they don't I will be going somewhere else if been going to circus circus  for a long time I hope they read this

This has been the worst stay ever!

First incident: We booked rooms in the sky tower, the bell hop tells us to park then check in before we unload luggage then after that gave us directions to parking for the sky tower. There is no bell hop assistance at the sky tower parking! I give them the 1 star because they did send assistance over to the parking structure. 

Second incident: woke up the next morning to make coffee and the coffee maker is just squirting hot water everywhere and melted the disposable coffee tray. Called the front desk and it takes almost an hour to get a replacement coffee pot. Caffeine addiction on hold...

Third incident: my friend takes a shower and the bathtub clogs. The water started going out slowly then stopped. Called the front desk once again and he mentions sending someone to fix it.... I had to suggest switching rooms, we didn't have time to wait for them to repair it. Upon MY request he switch our rooms. 

Fourth incident: Get to the new room... and THERE'S NO REMOTE for the TV. I call the front desk once again... they'll send someone with the remote. Over an hour has passed so I called again to check the status because we were about to leave. Same guy answers and I guess is putting the info in, I told him I called over an hour ago about it and he says oh you called already? Uhh yes! I asked if we could just get the remote from our previous room and again he says someone is bringing one right away this time. 

Fifth incident: after we move to the new room I guess they didn't switch the free WiFi access we were getting in our previous room. So I'm writing this review using my own data! I didn't even call the front desk about it. 

I asked is there anything he could do for us since we've encountered all these problems in less than 24 hours of being here. He said he could switch our rooms... I asked to a suite? He said no just on a different floor... I told him it makes no sense to move yet again unless it's to an upgraded room. I asked for a supervisor to see if we could be compensated, he transferred the call but there was no answer....

This place is Awful! In town this week for a basketball tourney. Somebody broke into the room from the a joining room & when they came back it smelled like somebody smoked a pack of cigarets! Thursday night while the boys slept somebody came into the room while they slept & stole my sons money! Coach called front desk & security & nothing was done. Same thing happened last year! Never stay here! Pay a little more money & stay somewhere else! They deserve no stars!

This place is a dump.  

I hate to have to be negative but I feel like I should warn people.  Here is why.

You will save money initially, but it costs $25 each way to get to the top of the strip at Mandalay Bay.  You figure 2 round trips a day and that's an extra $100\/ per day to save a buck and stay at the most disgusting hotel in Vegas.  

The air quality is so horrendous everyday our lungs were wheezing until we could get out into fresh air.

Nothing is vacuumed and did I mention it smells like farts and cigarettes everywhere.

There is nothing around this hotel\/ casino except empty abandoned construction sites and homeless drug addict transients.

None of us felt safe walking to our rooms alone.

This place should be condemned it is a health code violation.

I could barely see out my window it was sooooo dirty!

There was a pubic hair on the glass table in our room.

I had to pay 50 cents every time I wanted to lock the safe in my room.

The buffet is gross and expensive.  If you want to eat anything that's descent off you go in a cab for $25 bucks to the top of the strip.

Ending this review on a positive note all the staff were kind of nice, but when I told them that my impression of the hotel was that it was really dumpy and smelled like "parmesan cheese cigarette fart pie" they just stared at me and told me they were repainting it soon!??? 

SAVE YOUR HEALTH AND YOUR MONEY AND DON'T STAY HERE!!!!!

Ok, I'm behind on this review but I had to leave one! I was in Vegas last February, I told you I was behind, and I stayed here with my niece, son, mother, and sister.  Upon arrival we asked for an early check-in, we arrived early that morning and didn't want to wait. We were able to get the room early and it was $20. I was very impressed with the room, clean and big! I was never a fan of this hotel,  but I must say, they have improved. 

Everyone was extremely nice, beds were soft, bathroom was nice! My son and my niece LOVED their stay in the hotel. 

We ended up having to stay an additional night. I was able to add the additional night over the phon! The woman I spoke to was so nice and it was quick and painless! The restaurants were ok, but I wouldn't recommend the buffet! 

I will definitely come back with my son!

I've stayed here many times during my lifetime. As a kid, this place is awesome. As an adult... only awesome for the price. If you're an adult with kids, probably a great place because your kids will love The Adventure Dome and you'll enjoy seeing them smiling and happy. Plus, it'll wear them out and they'll go to bed early.

I haven't stayed here in about 8 years. It really looks beat. They need a lot of upgrading. First thing you'll notice when you are checking in is the receptionists are, to put it kindly, not the hip well dressed type that you would find at the more upscale hotels. You'll also notice the girth of most of the corn fed guests.

I got a non-smoking room, but the stench of cigarette smoke still permeated throughout the entire hotel. So not used to that. What can you do?

The pool, trust me. Pass on that. Even if you have kids.

Didn't try any of the dining offerings. Judging from the reviews on here, I wasn't missing much.

What did I like about Circus Circus? The memories I've had as a kid here, the price, internet included as part of the stupid Resort Fee (which is only $7.50 a day) and the room, aside from the stink, was pretty decent.

They promote the Watersplash like it's a big water park, It's just a water slide  with 2 tiny pools 
Worst experience ever.

We had to stay at Circus Circus for almost 2 weeks waiting for our moving truck to arrive from Michigan. You can't beat the price and our room in the West Tower on the 20th floor was beautiful and very accommodating as I am in a wheelchair. We were very happy with the staff there.

The tables weren't great and the slots were ok.  The worst part of the whole thing was security. I left my purse in the room and of course like any normal person I'm freaking out.  The idiot security guard comes up and wouldn't let me in the room because my husband's name is on our room,  mind you we have THE SAME LAST NAME! Then she proceeds to call her manager who gives her a first name of no one in the room, and she tells him he needs to figure it out because I'm crying and carrying on? They make my husband, who's at the airport,  call and add me to the room.  Their "help"was a freaking joke,  they were a bunch of jerkoffs, and they suck. If I could give them half a star I would.

Here is my experience staying with Circus Circus on October 14, 2015. 

9:45 AM-11 AM : No water In our rooms 
11 AM Escalotors down. 
12 PM  Restaurants closed in hotel due to no water available 
11:30 PM - Maintenance issue- our bathroom was flooded 
Maintenance informed us it's a bathtub issue  Requested Security- 1:30 AM - Aggressive, constant knocking at our door.  
Requested Security: 1:45 AM Continued aggressive, non-stop knocking at our door man was smoking and blowing smoke into the peep hole 
2:15 AM- Called the "assistant" manager Mary grace -  sent the deputy of the night  at which he told me I was calling the wrong number I needed to call number 6 not the manager.  I Informed him that A man wearing a  striped shirt was smoking into the peep hole and knocking aggressively for over 45 minutes. The man arrived again when the deputy was at our door. The man stated someone from 316 called him and told him to come over but he must of had the wrong 316 room . The deputy told him to stop knocking on our door.

Stayed here the weekend of June 5th with my cousin and it was amazing. The staff was nice and the rooms great. Only thing was my key stopped working and they wouldn't let me in the room because my name wasn't on the registration, something the woman forgot to mention at the time of check in. Overall we had a great experience and would return to Circus Circus. The casino was also a huge hit.
Bedbugs, urinated carpet smell, shady looking people, and probably drug dealers and prostitutes. If this is what you like you've come to the right place. Enjoy!

My experience here last week was amazing!  They upgraded my friends and I to a suite from a regular room at no extra cost and boy was it spacious!  There was a bar counter with sink, vanity mirror area, fridge, and an extra couch. It was clean and well kept too for how old of a casino this is!  Great rates on a low budget makes this hotel a perfect pick!

I haven't stayed here in awhile but I'd still say it's a key family scene\/hotel.  They offer free circus shows several times a day upstairs near the games.

room clean, not fancy. temp tricky.  Deli - don't even think about it, we sent our food back.  Blue Iguana we loved.  Customer drop off\/check inconvenient - front is for taxi\/bus\/limo only - rest have to park (a distance) and walk luggage in and out.

7 Good  Reasons to NOT stay at this hotel.

1. The rooms are dirty- and I mean nasty dirty. We checked in and then asked to change rooms 3 times due to heavy smoke smell, mildew and mold growing on the walls, and then large gobs of hair on the bathroom floor.  Not to mention cigarette holes and other random stains on the blankets and sheets. And this was in the more expensive "West Tower" rooms. I can only imagine what the low end rooms are like.

2. They will loose your laundry- I guess I should have known better then to send some stuff out given the establishment in general but we needed to have my sons ring bearer tux pressed and I didn't have an alternative. Well, they lost one of my shirts and offered no compensation or even an apology.

3. You will NOT get housekeeping service- Overflowing trash and out of towels by day 3,  it wasn't until I went downstairs and raised holy hell after the second night did they send someone to clean our room. I was told this was due to under staffing and the bad economy but seriously.....

4. No room service- Oh, excuse me...they do have it from 6am to noon. What good does that do me when I have exhausted children who need dinner and I can't bear the thought of taking them out?!?!?

5. The arcade is not maintained- Half of the games and rides do not work and when we went to tell them the DDR machine stole $2 they made us wait 30 min to have a manager sent over to give us our money back. Then they refused to put an out of order sign on the machine....anyone smell a scam? With all of the closures the kids were only able to go on a handful of rides. NOT worth the $18.95 price of admission.

6. They will charge you for a phone you don't use- Hidden $1 a night charge to just have the phone in the room. Granted it's only a $1, but REALLY??? A total insult after everything else we had gone through. 

7. You will have nowhere to park your car- The valet and self park filled up every evening leaving us with no where to park the car after returning from the day. 


There are so many hotels hurting for business in Vegas right now it seems ridiculous that this place can get away with offering this kind of suboptimal service and lodging. We chose this hotel for the children entertainment factor and I have to say we ended up deeply regretting it.

Went to Las Vegas last week and stayed at Circus Circus Hotel for three nights and two days. The stay was very unpleasant. 
To keep it short and simple, there were BED BUGS. Now I've seen the reviews about Circus Circus before and believed people were over exaggerating about their complaints but they are absolutely true. 
Also, room service left their cleaning supplies in our room such as a wet rag and their duster. It was very unprofessional. 
Overall, the room wasn't ideal to sleep in because of the bugs but you pay for what you receive. I definitely won't be coming back to this hotel again though.

our camera was stolen from our luggage while in the possession of the hotel bell desk.  The hotel refused to take any responsibility but failed to give any substantial reason or proof that they were not involved.

Very unsafe environment. We got robbed in our room during the night while we were in the room.
It took over 20 minutes to security to arrive and today, over a week after we still haven't heard from the hotel about the investigation. Do not stay in this hotel, it is a warning. Very vey dangerous.

Family of 5 and yes we did stay at a different property but I told my kids it was a MUST DO, to visit Circus Circus and see the sights there.  Wow was I wrong.  My memory failed me from days of long ago.  We got there later in the night and of course the adventure dome was closed so we couldn't even walk around there.  No circus acts, just a "hand balancer".  We were at a gymnastics meet, they all can do that.  No disrespect to him, we just wanted more.  Went to the buffet, worst ever and we live near an Old Country Buffet.  The 'create your own pasta' had just sauce and noodles.  Too much to ask for some odds and ends to toss in there?  Mushrooms, shrimp, chicken.....anything.  Tried to find some of those elsewhere to toss in at our table but nothing but cold mushrooms from salad bar was to be found.  Walked with kids to the arcade and we were all excited to see those frustrating games with all the quarters piled up and you shoot one in to try to get them to all fall down?  Well imagine our surprise when they fall down you don't get them, you get tickets.  Great, just what we wanted.  Some overpriced candy to not eat.  We had the whole next day to check things out again there when it was opened but we all decided it just wasn't worth it.  My ONLY positive was the milk a the buffet was cold.  Dang cold and delish.

You should avoid this hotel. The casino, lobby and the elevators reeks cigarette smoke. I was in the west wing king room and did not like it as much. On my previous trip I was at the MGM Grand and I would recommend that one. Circus Circus has a dim entrance the carpets seem worn out and overall the property feels shady. It's got the adventure dome and all, I did not use it though. Overall the rooms are very basic and hardly any plug points for charging. The property is also at one end of the strip. I will definitely giving it a miss if I go back to the Vegas.

This was a pretty crappy hotel, but at $37 a night on the strip, what do you expect? The building itself looked like it hadnt been updated since the '60s. Our room was in Skyrise Tower and looked like a low-end motel. Looked clean from a distance but on closer inspection, we found crumbs and sesame seeds on the floor and a quarter inch of dust on top of the entertainment center. One of the issues I had was with the AC unit. Although it keeps the room cool, the fan doesn't stay on continuously and kicks on, rather loudly, in the middle of the night. My boyfriend is a light sleeper and didn't have a single night of decent sleep while we stayed here. The ventilation in the rooms is pretty bad too. I have asthma and had difficulty breathing the whole time we were in the building.

The only interaction we had with hotel employees, besides at restaurants, was the day we checked in. Joseph helped us out and was very pleasant and knowledgeable. We rented a car for one day from Avis, which is located in the hotel lobby. It was convenient to have a car rental agency right in the hotel and the woman who helped us was speedy and polite.

We don't have kids, but Circus Circus seems like a great place to bring them. We walked through the Adventuredome, which has rides and games, and the Midway, located above the casino, has carnival-style games and circus acts, like acrobats.

Although Circus Circus isn't nice by any means, we paid for one week what we would have paid for one night in a nicer place on the strip, so I'd definitely stay here again (I'm not super picky about where I stay as long as it's relatively clean and safe, so if you're one of those who refuses to stay anywhere but a 4 or 5 star hotel, this is not the place for you!). People complain about it's location on strip (it's way up north, just before Hilton and Stratosphere), but we had no issues and took the Deuce everywhere, as there is a stop just outside Circus Circus.

If you want to be on the strip at a decent price, this is your place. Stayed 5 nights in a West Tower room. Room was nice, had a great view of west Las Vegas from the 33rd floor. Room was clean, had ample ammenities for the amount of time you actually spend in your room....this is Vegas afterall. Downside is the property has been expanded\/added too soo many times that its not cohesive...getting from one parking garage to the hotel is ok, but a real pain from another. Likewise if you stay with another party and their room is in a different part, could be in for a long walk and 2 elevator rides. Still overall a good deal.

Yes Circus Circus is kind of a mad dump.  I only go here when I have to, which I did last week because of my presence of Frightdome this month.  Otherwise, I would never come here, although I still do think their steakhouse is pretty good and cheap.

I stayed here many years ago, and remember this place fondly as a kid in the 80's when it was actually a happening place.  It's sad how MGM Resorts let it go to pieces, and I'm not sure why they haven't tried to class it up a little, but I guess they want this property to stay cheap and attract the undesirables, like gangbangers, and mix them up with families going to Adventuredome.  I'm not sure why they don't clean it up and make it more family friendly and safe, maybe that is what security is for.

And one more thing about this Casino I hate - the parking.  It is worse than Hooters Casino, which I thought was the worst until I came here.  It's like everyone turns their brain off when they go in the parking structure and drive like idiots.

We went here for the buffet and it was the worst mistake we made while in las vegas. There was a very small selection of food, almost all of the food was dry or stale. The silver wear was dirty and the cups were sticky. The food was unflavored and you could tell it was not fresh. The staff was unfriendly and looked very unhappy.

Unbelievable. Perhaps 100 guests or so were atop the parking garage last night to view the Riviera implosion. About five minutes before the blast, two security 'officers' were telling guests to vacate. Seriously?  MGM RESORTS, you make people pay to park, vacate an historic event. What's next. MGM RESORTS, 100% through with you. Jim...have a nice day.

This hotel had a lot of stuff going on! It was extremely loud. They had good promotions going on. This hotel is more for people who decide to bring their children to Vegas. It had circus performances, karaoke, the amusement park, etc.

I am currently still checked in while writing this review. My husband and I got here Thursday night late pretty much at midnight. Check in line was crazy long and a good wait. We checked in and was given our room. When i purchase the trip through hotwire i paid extra for a king room in the west tower. We walked into the room and it was a double. Y would me and my husband need a double. I had called a week before the trip to request a high floor with a possible view and was told i was all set
When we went back down to inform them this was not the room requested. We were moved to the casino tower on the 4th floor with a view of a brick wall. The next morning we realized our toilet  didnt flush, we called before going out to get it fixed when we came back no one had come. Finally later while getting dress to go out he came. The next day same thing happened. Today the same thing happened we had to call 3 days in a row to have our toilet fixed. The room problems and toilet are my main complaints. I stayed at the hard rock before and the rooms were so much more maintained. I wish the offered more in the room like a coffe pot, HBO like what hotel doesn't have HBO. I was told my room was an upgrade but didn't really feel that way. Even tho the hotel is full of kids the floor was quiet. I wouldn't stay here again but if your on a tight budget stay.

Just stopping in to gamble and check the circus acts out.

Not somewhere I'd stay. Great place for families and people who don't mind hyper screaming kids lol.

The circus acts were cool. The game area was fun.

Place seems kinda old.

Avoid this place for everything other than the steakhouse.

Yes, it's a good deal for the price, but it stinks, it's dirty, it's on the end of the strip, and it stinks.  It really, really stinks--like smoke and ammonia and rotting food.

Whom would have thought that a circus themed place could be the real"happiest place on earth".  I won BIG. My winnings were unmatchable 6 goldfish (3.5 made it home) 2 stuffed alligators (one with tongue out) and one giant vintage sponge bob. The slots were not so loose (lost 14.63) but no sweat off my back already paid rent. Worth every nickel!
I got a room in the Manor building. It's a very filthy smelly old building. The price for the room is $160 per night, but honestly, Motel 6 is much better.

I love this place. Old school Vegas ambiance which is much cooler than these gaudy new luxurious places on the strip. This place has charm. And it's fun. And for god sakes,  Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas happened in it!

Clean & quiet room; cooled down easily and had HOT water instantly. 
Cheap price!
Located directly between the Strip & Fremont Street-two areas frequented by visitors. 
It's definitely a long walk to all the rooms from the strip entry..a shorter walk from taxi\/shuttle area. We never heard neighbors above or next door. 
Sales folks are everywhere on the first floor, but they are easily thwarted.  
There's a bus stop right out front, which makes traveling the Strip so much easier.  They'll print your boarding passes for free and offer early check-in\/late check-out.  No reviews on food offered as we ate elsewhere while we were out.

We had no problems in the past checking in and checking out. Iam happy every time we stayed at Circus Circus Las Vegas. I do not recommend staying in the Manor, I didn't care for it. Kids were up running down the hall ways etc.
The hotel is very kid filled, of course. Thats fine but it is way over crowded and gross. The roller coasters are worth it

Bed bugs!!! I was itching the entire night! The walls are thin, the plumbing is bad and the sheets had short black hairs in them. I lost a friend today because I checked out and checked into the MGM. Apparently I'm too high maintenance. Apparently I need to aim higher when it comes to friends. 

On another note, the staff was sweet as pie and I hated writing this review because I wanted to talk about how great the staff were. 

I was going to take pictures but I didn't want to kill the hotel's business. Anyone who says they were bitten by bed bugs should not be doubted.

You get what you pay for I guess, we've paid less for other hotels and they offer more, this one needs a massive upgrade. Staff need more training in customer service and the food was not worth dining in after the first day\/night trying it out. Overall, were staying elsewhere so that's a bonus and that's all I have to say about this place.

Hotel is OK but if you ever get the $20 food and beverage credit it is almost worthless they won't even allow you to get drinks at the very very actually only place they allow you to that have anything to do with silver near cups it's not really a credit its more like a $20 extremely restricted coupon. So if you buk expecting a $20 credit for food you will not get to utilize it unless you want to spend $100 or so more in the steakhouse.

This place was very misleading on their website... They showed nice rooms for the price we paid. when we got there our rooms were in buildings across from the hotel! We had asked for a non smoking room and instead they gave us a mildew smelling one.. ugh they charged us for "amenities" which was just an old iron and hair dryer... When we called for room service around 7pm they said they stop serving our section rooms that late... how is that late?!! i guess they cant walk across the street to help us out. I will NEVER stay here again.

checked in great customer service,got to room it was dirty,chair to desk was missing,pretzles and medical bottles under dresser,sheets to bed closer to window still dirty,and room not vaccumed.took them 3hours to bring desk chair and extra blankets.housekeeper had an attitude,not friendly at all.i also asked because we only had 1 dry off towel,no face towels or ant other towels,i tried to give them the benefit of doult but im very disappointed. never again.

we came here from CA to get married and decided to stay here. we got a good deal on groupon for a 2 night stay with a king size bed. check in was easy and hassle free. the room is nice for the price we paid we can't complain. it is also quiet we didn't hear loud noises and they clean the room pretty good for you. parking was available and easy. our water worked and they offer WiFi for free. we also got 2 free buffets. we went for dinner and food wasn't bad. try the pasta bar if you happen to go. we went on a Sunday. it wasn't too busy. the room is good size and the ice machine worked when we needed ice. we don't gamble much so we didn't play at the casino. overall it was a good stay and great price
Don't like the customer service at the arcade. Wanted to change $5 to $1 bills n the workers at one station said they don't have change. Serious?  They take $2\/game & have no change. BS

I knew it from the Expedia reviews that it was an average hotel , and not very new compare to other once. However, our room was big and clean, with vanity area which I liked, and it was recently renovated. The room was in the main tower with casino downstairs, the casino itself was old with some cranky dealers, but some of them were ok even funny. It is on the Strip, so for the value of $50 a night it was a good deal for us.

Will never visit this place again. It smells terrible, there we buckets\/towels everywhere to catch the roof leaks. My son and I got stuck on the El Loco coaster. Our car abruptly stopped 1\/2 way up the big hill. We were then hurt by what felt like the car behind us. We had to take the stairs down the side of the big hill. My Mom & sister got very sick just after eating at one of the casino restaurants. Left with terrible headaches & soreness. My 1st and last visit.

I like it here. It is just too far from the real strip where all the fun is.
This is too kid friendly for me. 

I wouldn't come here, except for the games. That's it.

Didn't know house keeping doesn't come automatic,  so room wasn't cleaned. Tub drains slowly,  only two pillows on bed and very thin. Would never come back here unless I had my kids. It really is a CIRCUS.

Decided to stay here for the 4th of July because we have a toddler now and just thought it would be more appropriate. We haven't been to vegas since our wedding in 2006. Vegas has changed a lot, but the hotel has not. There were pubic hairs and other "things" on our bathroom floor and counter. The rest of the room looked as though it doesn't ever get vacuumed, or cleaned period!  If we could have left and got our money back we would have. When we checked in there was no parking available and I mean none, no valet, no self parking, etc....  Unbelievable!!! We will definitely never being staying here again. I just thought this place would cater to kids and be more child friendly, but instead I have to worry about what he's touching every second!!' Nasty!!

I read the horrible Circus Circus reviews but I  took a risk and booked with them.  Trust and believe.... I am happy that I did! 
Our room was located in the West Towers 21st floor (Room #21814). It was spacious,  CLEAN, and quiet. 

 Housekeeping was phenomenal... extra soft pillows and tons of white fresh towels.  Our room, hotel hallway, elevators  smelled  just like strawberries  (car scent).
