The staff at the Circus Circus  Buffet were polite  and sweet.  The Pizzeria restaurant was my favorite.....the pizza was "smack yo momma" good! I especially enjoyed the cashier named TAMMIE ....she was hilarious and kind.

One night... we ordered Room Service "bucket of chicken with mashed potatoes" ooooooo weeeeeee... that was delicious fried chicken.... I was surprised beyond belief. 

The Adventure Park , and Arcade were fun. I enjoyed the clay face sculptures made by artists for  $19.99.... BRILLANT IDEA!

The Water park was refreshing and relaxing.... and so was the bucket  of ice cold STELLAS! The kids and I also devoured the freshly made potatoe French fries, and Nachos.... yumyum status. 

The casinos were clean, spacious and hardly smelled of cigarettes.... despite the golden girls huffin and puffin as  they played the slot machines.

Long story short.... I would book another weekend at the Circus Circus Hotel.... in a heartbeat. 

Circus Circus is not outdated.... plain and simple... some have this insane taste of steak &  lobster ... ON A MCDONALD'S HAPPY MEAL BUDGET! 
 
My experience at Circus Circus Hotel  was 10+

This hotel is dirty. It smells like they have been trying to cover up funk over the years and do it by spraying a whole can of cheap air freshener in the room. This gives you a headache once you enter into the hotel room. The floors are stained, so don't even think a bout walking barefoot. I was looking forward to my stay here since it has so much history, but never again will I stay here.

False advertisement!

It's hard to rate a place like Circus Circus. Most only stay at this hotel for budget reasons, and even when most KNOW what they're getting themselves into, they still backpedal and complain. 

"You get what you pay for!" Remember that saying?

You want to for a 'cheap' hotel? Well, you're going to get one. 

I chose to stay at Circus Circus for budgetary reasons, and It wasn't bad for the amount of money I paid. I booked through hotels.com and paid about $30\/night for their newly renovated West Tower. The check-in lady gave us a room on the highest floor, and faced us towards the strip. I don't mind our hotel being at one end of the strip than the middle for what I was shelling out. Our room was clean, air conditioning was perfect, and our top-view was great. 

The reason I only gave this hotel 3 stars is because of the insane lack of ventilation in the hallway next to the casino room elevators(next to buffet). The smell is SO strong it's hard to miss.

Some reviews state that this hotel is not good for kids even though it's marked for them. I hate to tell you this, but no matter where you go...this is vegas. Smoke, alcohol and half naked ladies will follow you no matter where you stay. 

On a budget? This is the hotel for you. Try to stay in the West Tower--nicer rooms.

I stayed here about 2 years for 1 night during Fright Dome. This review is about my recent visit to the Adventure Dome, not the RESORT ROOMS. They have a huge parking lot for people who just want to visit the dome or casino area & it is free for parking. 

The place is not the prettiest, cleanest, most appealing resort\/casino, but I think it is ok for it is. I love the Adventure Dome because they have a wide selection of rides and small things to do. The current objective for this visit was for the new coaster, "El Loco." It has been 1 year since it opened. It looked amazing in person. 

I paid $12 for 1 ride. I thought it was a lot of fun & scary. I saw some work going on for Fright Dome. 

I think this place is great for the Adventure Dome and nothing else overall. Some employees seemed bored and didn't engage much as I walked around.

I just stayed at circus circus this past weekend with my boyfriend. When we booked the hotel I was very apprehensive because I'm sure you have read such a mix of reviews which I had. I was torn but at the end of the weekend I would say it was a good stay. 

We arrived in Vegas at noon and check in isn't until 2pm. We both wanted to shower so we figured why not see if we can check in early. The lady that helped us was great, waived our early check in fee of $16.50 because my boyfriend is military, she even upgraded our room from skyrise tower to west tower. GREAT! That was very kind of her. We had a very big room! The one complaint was that the bed was not very comfy and we only had 3 pillows. Another thing was that the TV was very small for as big as the room was (which isn't a big deal). The first morning we woke up and decided to go to the breakfast buffet, it was okay. Our eggs and bacon were cold. But that was our only complaint. The pizza place is very yummy! And you can never go wrong with krispy kreme! The gambling was not very great, normally when you play blackjack the dealer is quick quick. These people took forever and couldn't count! We went down to the other hotels to gamble. The one thing about this hotel is that its a pretty good ways away from the strip. There is however a bus right outside the front of the hotel, it's $8 for 24 hours which stops at every hotel and will also take you to the vegas sign as well as fremont street. We did have a good time, don't get too discouraged from these reviews.

Where little kids are in Vegas...

I really don't think Vegas is a place to take kids. I would normally avoid this place because when I go to Vegas but I went with a friend who is a kid at heart. Even though I won the most HUMONGOUS pillow pet known to man at the ring toss - I still give this venue only 3 stars.

Even if I were to take my kids to Vegas, I don't think I would go here. Just my opinion, folks, which is what Yelp is all about. The venue is creepy, the entertainers and staff obviously at the end of their careers, and the carpet has not been changed\/cleaned in maybe a decade.

I was in the casino area only and did not stay in any of the rooms. Please take this in consideration when reading this review.

I guess if you're on a budget and are the type of person that MUST get to Vegas at all costs, and with your kids, this would be the place for you. I'm just not there.

We stayed in the RV park witch cost close to the same as a room, we had our Dog with us, such a cute Doggie area but it was so grossly NOT taken care of, with hundreds of piles of dog poop raked in the corner, the health department should check this out!! most of the people with dogs were walking their dogs outside the dog area on the grass and picking up their own dog poop like everyone should!! they should have a doggie bag dispenser and a trash can inside the doggie area and a sign, "please pick up after your dog"
We did enjoy the casino but shame on that dog park!! and the Wi-Fi is a joke!! you have to go through many hoops to get it....never did get it.

Do not stay here!!!!! This was the worst room in las vegas! We booked through  expedia who showed us one room and then when we came to check in they informed  us we would be staying in "another part" of the hotel which was across the street in an alley ,no lights,security, or cameras after walking a galf a mile to our room we discovered it was an old abandoned hotel they use when overbooked! The lights in the room would not even come on.We were afraid to stay there so we walked with all of our bags back to the main hotel to complain where they very rudely told us if we wanted to stay in the main hotel it would be extra 25 per night which we paid because we were left with no choice! Then our toilet was clogged the next morning so we call front desk it took them over an hour to send someone to our room making us late for our scheduled 8 am tour.  The supervisor  pingene sisomphou or "jimmy" said basically not his problem.  Do not ruin your Vegas vacation by booking with Expedia or staying at Circus Circus! !! Worst experience ever!!! False advertising to say the least

This place is only fun for winners I guess! Dropped $40 and won three large stuffed animals and a bunch of tiny ones. Won the darts game :)

If I left empty handed, I probably wouldn't be singing the same tune...

Windows were unwashed, which spoiled a nice view.  No hand towels. Quiet sleep, beds ok.  Resort fee was more than room rate on a Sunday night. Garage crowded and elevator slow.  Ok place for last minute.

STAY AWAY! STAY FAR AWAY! RUNNNNN!!!!! Wish I could provide 0 stars.

Booked a last minute trip to Vegas for the weekend and found that Circus Circus was going to be the cheapest (about $200 total for 2 nights). When we get there, we have to do the infamous hike with all our luggage from the Uber drop off on the Strip side of the hotel, through the Casino to the Lobby. When we were checking in, customer service could have been a little better but we were able to get checked in fairly quickly. Then we were informed that our room would be across the street and down the block. 

Now our new journey to the "Manor" buildings began. It was really across the street and down the block (walking away from the Strip). The lit up sign wasn't fully lit, most of the letters were dark outside of the building too. We get to the Manor area and I felt really uncomfortable with the building and the area. First of all, the hallways were dark and smelt musty. There were people opening the doors and yelling at people that were in the parking lot. The elevator was outdated, there were towels laying in the hallways to our room, janitor closets open - this place was just a hot mess! When we get to the room, the room furniture was outdated (not that big of a deal and at this point, the least of our worries. We were staying at Circus Circus and not expecting the room to look good) and the lights were flickering! Overall, we didn't feel safe as 2 girls staying here.

We were able to check out immediately and were offered an "upgraded" room that was still not in the main building. We explained that we wanted to forfeit our reservation because we didn't feel safe staying here. Not once were we asked why we didn't feel safe which is kind of alarming. But at least we made it out alive!

There is a stench that has no equal. I found it hard to breathe in there. I avoided spending too much time in the casino because of the smell. 

The room wasn't too bad. There wasn't a chair or fridge. The ceilings are oddly low, and it felt a little dark in the halls. 

All in all it's a cheap hotel, and if you walk about 4 blocks you can catch the monorail. This helped me save on cab fair. The room wasn't terrible, but the SMELL IS UNBEARABLE!!!!!

Worst hotel in Vegas, I'd rather sleep in my car than spend another night here. It takes about 45 minutes for the bell desk to bring everything downstairs, so i had to pay 200 flippin dollars to change my plane ticket. Horrible service, its like they pick up there employees from a homeless shelter. If you're thinking of saving money staying here don't, because your better off spending a couple hundred more bucks on a better hotel

i nicknamed this "resort" the Shits Carlton!!!

 i decided to drive, last-minute, to Vegas on saturday night on Memorial Day weekend....so as you might expect, there wern't a great deal of rooms available.  so we decided to stay at Circus Circus. Jesus Christ. 

1. when we got there they had given away our room....so they "upgraded" us for free.....when we got to our room and discovered it was exactly what you'd expect from a motel 6 (basic meat and potatoes room)  we shuttered to think that it was an "upgrade"....WHAT KIND OF GHETTO-ASS ROOM WERE YOU PLANNING ON PUTTING ME IN?!?!

2. The Pool....70% Urine, 20% Water, 10% miscellaneous!!!  i'm serious, it had a green tint and was full of children, who i witnessed drink 11 juice boxes, a piece, and NEVER take a bathroom break; do the math.  when i go to Vegas, one of my FAVORITE things to do is hang at the pool all day....not here, no way, i wasn't dipping my fucking toe in that water!

3. CLOWNS!!!! THE PLACE IS FUCKING CIRCUS THEMED!!! COME ON!!!

4. The worst part about staying somewhere EVERYONE can afford isn't the quality...it's the fact that EVERYONE can afford it, SO THEY'LL BE THERE!  Just to go from one end of the casino to the other i'd have to wade through LITTER ALLY 30 minutes of white trash, and, 200 year-old Asian ladies who are always confused, etc.  (if that wasn't PC, forgive me, but i just got back).  This place is OVERCROWDED with people that don't wear deodorant, sleeves or shoes!!!

5. The floor is sticky, so are the walls...DON'T TOUCH ANYTHING

6. It'd be fine if it was geared for low-income grownups, but its not....its geared for FAMILIES!  THE PLACE IS A FUCKING CHUCK-E-CHEESE!!!! So the gift shops aren't full of cool shit like at most casinos (like crystal statues, shot glasses, etc)  its full of stuffed animals and toys....the kind of shit you see at swap meet!


7. our maid keyed into the room without asking, and WITHOUT A WORD began searching the room for her cell phone.  now i want you to imagine that.  you are standing there talking to your friend, in your hotel room, in the middle of the day.  SUDDENLY the lock clicks, the door opens, and a small mexican lady just starts combing your belongings without even looking at you.  you try and say "excuse me, can i help you?" and her reply, while lifting up your luggage and looking under it is "cell phone"  .....seriously?

if its between this place and not going to Vegas...Don't go.
Booked my hotel on Priceline.com for $50.   Hotel is dated but for the price I can't complain.

Ghetto Ghetto. 

I've stayed here twice before and both times was subjected to broken beds. Pretty much all I do in my hotel in Vegas is sleep and shower and a broken bed means the room is about 3\/4 useless to me. The first time this happened, I was able to change rooms. On the second trip, the hotel was completely booked and I was stuck in the broken bed room -- and with no discount. On top of that, rooms are very dreary and depressing. 

Plus I hate clowns and there are way too many creepy clowns lurking around Circus Circus.

Manor lodge hotel in circus circus was horrible! It was dark, bad design\/layout, and overall sketchy looking. Plus it was separated from the actual casino and the walk their was very long. Will never go back nor recommend to anyone.

I forgot to mention about the room on my previous review.


This is my first time stayed at the circus circus and should be the last time.  The hotel room is very old and dirty.  I had been to some other old hotels, but they are CLEAN.  Circus circus's room is very dirty.  I booked this hotel because I wanted to take my 7 years old daughter to enjoy indoor playground.

1. carpet is wet and sticky.
2. The room has very strong cigar smell, but the room should be smoke free room.  ????
3. blankets are old and dirty.  My daughter (7 years old) and I was very itchy and hopefully I did not carry any bed bug back home.
4. restroom floor is sticky\/dirty and I can smell the restroom smell.
5. small restroom and small tub
6. wall is very thin and I can hear sounds all night long.
7. we stayed at the manor which means is far away from the main building.  I need to drive to the indoor playground and to the hotel casino.

I been to Las Vegas so many times and this is the worst stay ever.  

Good luck to others like to stay here!

I will have to go see doctor today because my skin is still itchy.

You Get What You Pay For.. We went here over the long weekend of July 4th. The hotel needs an upgrade. This place is definitely kids friendly. The security had hard time keeping kids off the gaming areas as it overlooks to free circus acts and shows. Very congested. Very smoky. Dont let your kids stand near gaming areas for long time. Be prepare to take long walks from front entrance (Las vegas blvd)  to your rooms. Dont buy any personal items, souvenirs and gifts here chances are that you paid too much in this hotel. House keeping service was good and prompt.  We stayed on the 29th floor of this hotel and the floor hallway was like an oven. The rooms have individual A\/C, so you are in good shape there. If you can afford a little bit more, you could stay at better hotels on strip. I will not stay here next time.

This is probably the worst hotel I have stayed in maybe ever. The room stinks like smoke and is dirty and there was a piece of chewed gum on the nightstand. It is nasty and old. I would NEVER EVER STAY HERE AGAIN. The worst. EVER.

Decided on a last minute long weekend trip to LV and found hotel rates surprisingly high. Circus Circus was the cheapest by at least $50, but it wasn't worth it. It was just hellishly loud, full of frumpy folks and their screaming kids, dirty, run-down, and ridiculously far from anything considering it is "on the strip" - the buildings are set back about 1\/4 mile from Las Vegas Blvd., and with the demise of Stardust and Westward Ho, only the somewhat rundown Riviera is within a few steps. The not-that-thrilling destinations of The Stratosphere and The Sahara are within what might be a 10-minute walk at a normal gait, but turns into a 20-minute journey, slogging along behind the cattle-like herds wandering between the creepy hotels and construction sites that fill this decidedly un-glamorous little portion of LV. Words cannot express how disappointed I was to spend the time and money to go to Las Vegas, only to feel stranded in this hellish little ghetto. Any savings on the room were spent on cab fare getting the hell out of there. I love Fremont Street for retro Vegas, and I appreciate the glam of the new high-end mega-casinos - The Stratosphere, Sahara, and Riviera are in-and-of-themselves, not bad, but their location will mean their eventual demise. Circus Circus, on the other hand, puts the downward drag on this already lacking section of Vegas, and is not worth visiting at any price. It should be dynamited as soon as possible.

This place is pretty good. Tons of kid's rides and an OK carnival setting. Indoor rock climbing, 2 (or was it 3?) roller coasters, mini golf, laser tag, carnival food, some novelty stands. Great day spent with the family. I'll be back CircusCircus.

Circus circus was the most dismal attempt of a hotel I highly suggest you stay as far away from that smokey dump. The staff are as rude as they come and don't get me started on Nora she is the slowest blackjack dealer in the world but not as slow as the waitresses that take 3 hours to get you a drink. The wifi is only on selected levels and that's just as slow Nora. It's so far away from anything good you may as well spend the extra few bucks on a better hotel. Overall this place is hell and you should never pop Molly's  here because those demons will get ya!!

Worst worst service possible. On our HONEYMOON we were placed in a small little building E way across the street from the actual hotel. Dirty and smelly place, no fridge and terrible service. I called to ask about food they said "you have to walk all the way back to where you checked in and go a little further okay and there is food" in an annoying voice that just made me even more upset. DO NOT COME HERE. Can't believe how terrible the service is here.

Horrible!!!! We booked through Expedia and when I checked in they didn't have my reservations so they charged my card twice and said one would drop off. While walking to our room there was a girl unconscious and cops were trying to wake her, the hotel smelled like weed, and people were throwing their own parties in the parking lot... One word GHETTO!!!
This place needs extra negative stars! No words to describe how dirty and smelly this place is! Don't bother don't waste your money ! Its cheap and its crap ! Add extra go some other place!

I'm writing to reflect my stay at Circus Circus from October 15th-20th, 2017 which was booked as a vacation package through my preferred airline. Prior to arriving, previous reviews on this and other websites had me feeling very nervous as they mentioned bedbugs, robberies and a host of other concerns. 

While I don't doubt the legitimacy of those claims, some of which have photographic evidence, this was not reflective of my stay. Upon arriving we (I traveled with a friend) were given the option to upgrade as we had unknowingly booked rooms in the manor which is a motel-like structure adjacent to the rest of the hotel. We chose to do this which added an extra $5+ dollars per night to our "resort fee" which totaled about $180+ per guest, per room as my friend and I got separate rooms. I'd expected to pay about $100 so these added fees didn't leave me feeling too great at the very start of my trip especially since many amenities, like the pool, close early or don't exist (ex: fridge or safe.)

Added to this was the fact that we were told our room keys had to stay separated from our wallets and phones as this could cause them to deactivate which is not something I have ever heard and made keeping our belongings together a bit more of a hassle than it otherwise would have been. 

Things, unfortunately, continued to decline from there as we had to walk quite a long ways to get from the lobby to the elevators which normally wouldn't be an issue until you take into account that smoking indoors is still a thing in Vegas so you are walking through clouds of secondhand smoke for what feels like an age. Part of the reason it took so long  was due to a broken escalator which remained so for the vast majority of our stay (there may have been more convenient ways to get to our rooms but if there was we were never informed.) Once we got into our rooms the first thing we did was check each mattress for bedbugs, thankfully of which there were none, though one of the mattresses in my room had dirty bedding and an even dirtier bed-skirt. 

In order to alleviate this problem I called housekeeping who came upstairs within 10 minutes or so and fixed the issue, going so-far as to have me inspect it when she'd finished to ensure there was no other concern. Housekeeping was VERY thorough during our stay, perhaps a bit too much, as they continually replaced all towels despite a notice asking guests to hang up towels to re-use as a way to conserve water which I always did. 

My only major problem during my stay was the fact that, at no point, was I informed that my room adjoined the room next to me (my friend was across the hall.) When checking in I did notice what I thought was a closet door which, if it followed the same pattern as the deadbolt of the room door, was unlocked but I didn't bother with it as there was no handle on my side. Knowing this was an older hotel I figured it was some sort of defect and left it alone until mid-week when I was awoken by very loud commotion that sounded as though it was coming from within my bedroom. 

It was at this point that I realized my room was adjoining and I immediately got up to make sure the door was locked. Given the recent tragedy in Las Vegas I'd already been apprehensive about going through with my trip at all and this definitely didn't make me feel better, particularly when I paid extra to stay in a nicer part of the hotel. This also meant my belongings were unprotected for days. Upon checking out I brought this  up to a manager, Cheryl, was very apologetic and encouraged me to write to guest relations as my earlier email went unanswered.  As of my writing this (10\/23) I have not received a response.

One thing I do want to mention and give credit for is the increased security present at nearly every casino we visited during our stay, with Circus Circus being no exception. 

At any given point it seemed we were never more than 20 feet from an armed police officer which went a long way in reassuring any further fears I had especially after the incident in my room. Overall I'd say my stay was pleasant enough especially as this was my first time to Las Vegas and this hotel is cheaper than others. Getting around was easy once we figured out how to use public transit and it was significantly cheaper than other hotels I looked into though I would have preferred less of a labyrinth with a better pool.

Final word of warning though, be prepared to spend more than you think given that (seemingly) every hotel in Vegas has resort fees and lacks basic accommodations other hotels have like free breakfast, coffee pots, safes, fridges and microwaves. If you are ill prepared Las Vegas will almost certainly empty your wallet if you're not mindful and\/or expect freebies of any kind.

This hotel needs MAJOR upgrades. We stayed in the casino tower, which we we're told out of all the rooms this were the last updated which im not sure how true that was peeling wallpaper, no major light everything was lamp. 

Room was very basic and had no fridge or microwave, i mean really come on motel 6's have both. The day before we checked out we found out you could request a fridge an they would bring it to your room for a extra fee, umm why wasnt i told this when i checked in i have no clue. 
One star for the price another star for the adventure dome, Thats about it. 

Compared to other hotels on the strip this is one of the oldest. They are building new hotels all around this one and it stands out like a sore thumb. The beds were nice walls were super thin.

Not to mention the tub wouldn't drain and the sink leaked i slipped and fell made a complaint that was that.

Would I stay here again, NO not ever!

I haven't really stayed IN the hotel rooms and I am glad that we decided to NOT stay here and stay somewhere else. Just walking in there makes it feel like it will be not a good time. It seems like the AC needed cleaning, the floors\/rugs, and just really reaks of "HELP ME CLEAN ME RENOVATE ME SO PEOPLE CAN LIKE THIS PLACE" 

The only time I would make a trip here is for my kids to go to the Adventure Dome but that really is it.

Low class operation and clientele.  Lots of police officers with guns in the parking area to make you feel ill at ease.  Old appearing, run down.  The adventure dome was really just for kids and not worth the money.

Came here while in vegas, mainly for the indoor amusement park we had heard about.  It's cool to see a rollercoaster inside, but it did look like it needed some work.  Its a nice change of pace from all of the casinos and nightclubs.  I stayed at the Flamingo and walked over here, boy was that a long, hot walk. Will remember to go with a cab or a bus next time. I also remember them having a ton of shops, not places that I like to spend money at, but still nice to see.

We'll this is an overdue review. I stayed at the circus circus from 9\/11 - \/ 9\/14, while check in was ok they made us wait because we were half an hour early... That was not bad we went to the casino for a bit. After check in we placed our things in the room and went back to the casino. Later that night we find our bathroom sink and tub were clogged. We had to shower in a pond. They fixed it late next day. 

Second thing their servers at the casino... Very rude. They have a nasty attitude and take it out on all families. After asking my server for a drink she shouted at me because she was delivering and I was confusing her. She barked at me to wait until she was ordering, I felt it could have been better handled since she was in customer service. 

Last but not least there were cockroaches in the room. Overall we saw at least half a dozen. When I mentioned it to the front desk, I was thanked for informing then so they can make sure the next guests don't encounter them. Really!?!?! What about me and my guests? We paid our fees too. Next time I will spring the extra charges for a better hotel. One that actually tries to keep their guests happy. After all you get what you pay for. 

Don't stay at this hotel. Pay a little more and stay somewhere with better customer care.

I've been to Vegas several times in the past few years, choice of hotel usually varies, I've stayed at Bally's, and a few others.  I chose Circus Circus this time around and as with the previous times, it was a positive experience overall.  The line moved somewhat quickly, once I got to the customer service rep. I noticed I forgot my license with the rental car paperwork, so they said "just go back and get it and you don't have to stand in line", which was a nice touch (was somewhat jet lagged so I wasn't all there upon arriving!).  

Once I returned with the license they upgraded me from the manor motor lodge to Skyrise Tower, which they obviously made some major renovations to.  The room itself is very nice, and seemed more modern than Bally's, Planet Hollywood, and other places I've stayed.  A key thing which may tilt the needle toward this place over others is the Wi-Fi speed.  I was able to easily stream Netflix\/Amazon Prime, which is a perk that can't be overstated, as some hotel Wi-Fi is so slow it is functionally useless.  

Parking is a breeze, particularly if you're at the motor lodge (where I've stayed previously at one point), and Skyrise.  At other hotels it is a slog to get from your car to the room; not so with Circus Circus.  

If you do not have a rental car, and want to experience the strip, it might not be the best choice, as its a bit of a walk south.  There is an inexpensive bus that goes back and forth up the strip that is affordable, but if my intent was to enjoy the Strip I'd probably recommend something affordable further south, such as Bally's, Flamingo, Planet Hollywood, etc.

This hotel is disgusting! I stayed on several occasions and had marks every morning I woke up on my legs, arms, and stomach. I told the front desk manager who did not take me seriously. During my last stay I actually found bed bugs in my room. The hotel did not clean any of my items and only changed my room. They took no responsibility and then trespassed me once I informed them I was getting an attorney. They have a history of this behavior to customers and a history of bed bug problems. I would rather pay more money for a better quality hotel that is clean then stay at this cheap dump again!

Ehh... maybe it is because I have low standards, and that I have lived a lifestyle in which the toilet was literally a hole in the ground for me to pee on, but I did not have much of a problem with staying here.  There are honestly superior hotels in the strip, but if you've lived in a straw hut like I did you'd at least be thankful that your stuff will be safe whilst you enjoy Vegas.

You're not visiting Vegas to sulk in a pretty hotel, are you?  What is this, Lost in Translation?

Needed to stay one night in Vegas for a friend wedding and booked this place as the price was most reasonable. That was my big mistake. I'd stayed at other hotels on the strip for about the same and had a wonderful time so I didn't think much about booking a night here. I didn't know what "the manor" means. Now I do. It means not being inside circus circus at all! It means cheap motel room that smells strongly of cigarette smoke even though it was a non-smoking room. it means stingy carpet throughout the building, which is very run down. It means when the guy in the next room talks on the phone, you can hear what he is saying. if this weren't in Vegas, I wouldn't complain too much, but compared to my previous hotel experiences in Vegas, this place stinks! Figuratively and literally!! 

TL:DR...don't book "the manor" rooms. They will ruin your Vegas experience.

Wow I don't even know where to begin!! I honestly don't even think they deserve at 1!!!!! They are horrible, nasty, it's a disgusting hotel!! For the price you pay, you would think it would be decent but it's horrible and so far customer service is awful also!! I got out of the shower and used a towel and they are so thin, old and have stains on them!! Like really?!? It's nasty!!! I don't think they've vacuumed in our room either!!! Horrible horrible hotel!! Use your money elsewhere!! I will never go back! Ever!!! This place definitely needs to be renovated or something, they do not take care of their hotel or their guests either!! Very sad. Anyways please stay somewhere else, maybe off the strip a bit? That's what we will do next time!! And believe me I understand we don't spend a lot of time in our room but come on!! It's gross!! It's makes the bates motel look like a 5 star hotel!! So sketchy, scary to even walk to our room.

5 stars because:
It's a unionized hotel, the rooms are much nicer than what you expect, staff is friendly, conference rooms and catering were decent and its incredibly cheap to stay here. They also offer casinos, a wedding chapel, entertainment like a trapeze artist act, dining and bar options, amusement park which is really fun, shopping and more.

So at 1230 am I went to their front desk complaining that my bed is not comfortable, apparently their clerk was not very helpful - I asked for the supervisor, and told her that I don't even want an upgrade, I just want to be moved to different room. She probably felt my struggle, and offer me a free upgrade in the morning. I accepted that offer, but when she asked if we are here for party, I replied that my husband and I are both in Military, and we are only here for the Military ball - right there she upgraded our room with no charge!! I was so please with the lady, and she even gave me a flower. 

Oh by the way, her name is Carrie.

I stayed in the Manor, Building C, 3rd floor, Thurs night - Sunday morning.  The rooms on either side of me were occupied and I never heard them. From what I found this was the cheapest hotel on the strip. The room didnt have a mini-fridge but there is an ice machine near the elevators so we used little trash cans filled with ice to keep the booze cold.  Room service came every day.  If you compare Circus Circus with a much nicer place (Caesars Palace, Bellagio, etc) then of course it would get 1 or 2 stars but this is a completely different league, for $83\/night I feel I got what I paid for, so four stars.

Casino only: we walked in, and then we walked out. Popcorn kernels and little kids were littered throughout. On our way out, aggressive beggars were stationed right outside the casino doors, on casino property. It's apparent the staff don't take any care of this place, and there's absolutely no pride put in to maintaining this to its potential. 

Second star earned only because all the neon evokes feelings of old Vegas.

We stayed at the Casino Tower. Room was outdated. When we removed the comforter cover to check the sheets, we found some hairs on the fitted sheet and pillows. Bathroom was clean but ridiculous not having an exhaust fan. I have been to different hotels in Vegas but this is the first time that we're not happy with our stay. Btw, security is a big issue in coming to our room. Everybody can just come up. I don't see any security cameras on the hallway. None of the fire extinguishers on the 12th floor has been checked regularly. Hope it works when there's fire.

Had a pleasant stay here. 

We stayed in the newly renovated area and had a pretty nice room. My hang up is on the few dark hairs I found in my shower which is always off-putting for me. The sheets were clean although definitely not the softest I've slept on. I noticed one of our towels had a whole in it, which I assumed was from how many times they probably get bleached. (At least that's what I tell myself!) We had a Keurig but were not given any K-cups. Late check out is an extra $20 which we haven't had to pay for in the past and didn't pay for this time. Slow wifi. 

No noise complaints as many reviewers have mentioned and for the price, I think we had a pretty good visit.

i stayed here last year when i came with my family. the rooms are pretty good and the pool was crowded but we still had fun. while my parents, sister, and her boyfriend went to gamble, my brother and i stayed at the arcade and we made the best of it. we were playing the carnival games and enjoying ourselves. we were stuck playing that jumprope-like game for the rest of the night and won a lot of tickets. haha. it's pretty addicting if you ask me. this time when i went, we were only playing the carnival games. i never noticed but all the games were $1. it was really cheap and when you make change in that lil room, they give you these coupons where you get a free game when you buy a game.
I love going here so much Never stayed here but I love going to the arcade, best time of my life all they use is quarters I don't need to pay to get a card like at Dave & Busters best place ever

All I have to say is that I should have read the reviews before staying here for my birthday weekend in March of 2010. The rooms, hallways, and general public areas were all dirty, and outdated. the room I stayed in reminded me of Motel 6 and I should have just went there. The discounts I had for here were not worth it at all!

Also, the buffet is absolutely disgusting.

The BEST part about staying here was how easy it was for me to walk outside and get those lovely huge pina coladas and get to anywhere BUT circus circus.

Worst hotel the room smelled like meat as soon as you walk in very disgusting  hotel .There was money missing from my room . Had no lack of interest in customers . Very poor staff and very dirty room it seemed like someone slept in the bed and walked away and they didn't even change it .Never stay at that hotel again worst place to go to you rather stay at a better hotel on the strip for more money

you know, circus circus is not as bad as you think. 

yes it's old. yes it smells like smoke.. but what casino doesnt smell like smoke. The new ones, just cuz it's new and probably have better air filters. and yes it's a clustered and yes the color schemes are bright and not so attractive.

but if you're a kid, circus circus is the best, you get the midway-arcade to go play while your parents are downstairs playing their "midway" 
even if you're a young adult now, it's nice to go back to circus circus for the midway games..it's way better than excalibur. Sometimes it's nice for a change.

hotel rooms.. i havent been here since i was a young teen. but from what i remember the manors are crappy. the rooms on the tower is quite old, but i heard they remodeled it. But ever since they built the West Tower, we stayed there all the time when we do book circus. It's newer and cleaner and is not smokey. 

i do recommend this place for families cuz both children and adults can have fun. and the rooms are cheap and it's really not that bad. I find it sad to see adults playing at the casinos of bellgio, venetian, paris, etc and u see kids just standing off to the side or even at the lobby. they cant do anything. 

i do think circus circus deserve 4 stars.. not because it's classy and brand new, or trendy.. but because for entertainment. everyone can have fun there. 

i guess part of me whenever i see circus circus it brings back good memories of the times when i was a little girl and my parents would book a room for thefamily and us kids get to watch free shows, and play the arcade and midway games, while my mom would help us hold our jackets and stuffed animals. 

but now that i'm older, being around the main strip where all the clubs are happening.. sometimes it's nice to walk back down the memory lane to circus circus, enjoy a few midway games and be away from the clubbing scenes.

I finally decided to cash in my comps here tonight and go to Fright Dome; the people at the casino desk informed me that despite being able to use my comps at Adventure Dome and having the cash value of tickets in comps, I couldn't get tickets for Fright Dome. They actually weren't sure at first and said they called to confirm with someone that I couldn't, but couldn't explain why. 

I'm pretty sure they were just blowing me off and the icing on the cake was when the guy said "don't let it ruin your night" in a way that i felt was condescending. Ruin my night? Buddy, I'm at Circus Circus; let's be realistic about expectations. I don't expect clean bathrooms, I don't expect well kept facilities, in fact, I don't expect anything other than to be treated with the relatively little respect entitled to someone that drops in on often enough occasions to even accumulate comps. Clearly my request for tickets to a haunted house in exchange for the comps I've earned was too bourgeois, so I paid cash for them that I might have gambled with afterwards and went home when I was done.

Fright Dome itself was fun though; I don't blame them and felt like it was worth the price of admission (get the extra line pass; it's worth it!). If I'd have gotten my tickets or at least a reasonable explanation instead of a blowoff, Circus Circus would have earned my loyalty. My two cents; go to Fright Dome and gamble someplace else.

this is a hotel mainly for families, a lot of kids running around until 12am. the beds really aren't comfortable and can tell they aren't turned over. only booked because there was a good groupon deal. giving 3 stars is because the customer service is amazing, especially the cleaning ladies. they are so generous and made a huge effort to say hi and ask if we needed anything.

you should only stay here for 3 reasons:

1.) you are a college kid or are on an EXTREMELY tight budget
2.) you are going with a group of your friends and would rather spend money on booze, strippers, etc. etc. than on your hotel room.
3.) you are bringing your kids and they INSIST on staying here (you can stay at excaliber for roughly the same price and get better service)

other than that you can find a nicer hotel for a little bit more money. the 3 cheapest hotels i have found on the main strip in vegas are Circus Circus, Stratosphere, and The Sahara. I dont think this hotel has been cleaned since the late 1970's. when you walk into the room there are clowns everywhere and for some people that could be a traumatic experience. The circus act show they have in the main room and the pink dome with the rides is cool i guess, but is that what you really came to vegas for?

I personally am not a fan of Circus Circus. For one the parking structure it's so dirty and smells terrible I really did not feel comfortable leaving my car there. Secondly the lobby and walking areas in the hotel where so dark to the point that it was straining my eyes. Thirdly, the hotel was a mess as well there was a lot of trash scattered about the floor. As for the rooms they are very basic there were a lot of burns within the carpet from cigarettes as well as there were a lot of updates that need to be done. 
Take away: I personally would stay at the Circus Circus again but only under the condition that is the cheapest hotel in Vegas or that was one of the only hotels that have rooms available. Other than that not impressed at all.

This hotel is really run-down. The hotel needs major renovations but you can still have a good time gambling for a fraction of the price of the Wynn.

Adventuredome is the same-old-same-old, not sure if its the safest place to leave your kids alone. 

Probably won't be going back for a good while...

Circus Circus is where I stay every year during Magic (it's a trade show and doesn't involve actual magic, btw).  This is where my coworkers and I are forced to stay because it's cheap and convenient.  That said, it's actually not that bad.  You're in Vegas, most of your time is spent out of the room and by the time you actually go to bed you are likely to just pass out anyway.  I wouldn't pick it if I were staying in Vegas on my own accord, but it's not that bad if you are forced to stay here like I am.   

The worst thing about Circus Circus is the damn Crispy Cream.  There is no resisting a doughnut when you're sleep deprived, haven't had dinner, and intoxicated.  You have really hit rock bottom when you are eating a Crispy Cream doughnut alone in your room at 3am inside Circus Circus.  

Contrary to what it may seem, I actually have a lot of fun here.  It's next to Slots-A-Fun, which I just love to work into sentences when I'm drunk in Vegas.  You know, everything becomes slots a fun: "I'm having slots a fun playing Blackjack" or "Come on, doing these shots will be slots a fun."  Although, I don't think gambling at Slots-A-Fun is actually slots a fun. I also thought about getting a fake tattoo (located inside Circus Circus) that said: I had slots a fun in Vegas.  I even came close to talking my boss into getting a fake tattoo of her husband's name after she shared how much it would freak him out.  He despises tattoos and I thought it would be hilarious for her to go home with something like:  Property of Mr.(omitted for privacy).  

Obviously, the rooms are not the most luxurious, but I've seen worse.  They have been, how do I describe it, used.  I try not to think about it.   

There is a little breakfast place on the floor with the Adventure Dome that serves decent coffee.  Unfortunately, the people behind the counter can be ridiculously slow.  Some of them have absolutely no sense of urgency no matter how many people are in line.  I think they just really hate their jobs. 

Circus Circus also has free buses to shuttle people to and from the convention center.  

I'm gonna go ahead and give it 3 stars (In the Category of cheap Vegas hotels).  It's not the worst and definitely not the best, but I can't hate on it too much.  It gets the job done and sometimes I find myself appreciating the seedier places because they always seem to inspire more of an adventurous attitude, especially since you won't feel the need to spend too much time inside your room.  Plus, I always think of Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas and hallucinogenic drugs when I stay at the Circus Circus.  It puts me in a good mood... I don't actually do drugs, but the thought of getting all whacked and watching the circus acts brings a smile to my face.

I considered giving 3 stars but based on our checkout they dropped another star. My husband and I checked in with a friend making it a total of two rooms. We booked over the phone and we're told that our rooms were recently renovated and would be in there sky rise tower. So as we check in to this sky rise tower we are shocked at the old rooms, smelling like an ash tray for non-smoking rooms with no a\/c on. I called immediately about our concerns and the front desk kindly moved us to the west tower at no upgrade fee. 

Now, if this is all that would have happened along our stay I could have rated them 4 stars. Now we are settled in and very happy with our new rooms. One night after seeing a show we come back late to find that our friends key isn't working and need to reach front desk to issue a new key. The front desk tells us their machines are down and might take up to 30 minutes to restore but they will call security to let him in. My husband and I are off to bed thinking our friend will have no issues with his room but yet security is unable to open the door and now needs to call a locksmith (by this time it's almost 4:30 am) and we all needed sleep. Locksmith shows up and opens room after almost an hour of waiting and tells my friend that he might not be able to get back in tomorrow and will have to call for another locksmith to replace the lock. The next morning I call front desk and share our concerns and they offer us nothing but an apology. We had to call a locksmith for a lock that wasn't our problem, spend the next hour in a half getting the lock replaced. At this point I am very upset that our friend had to be put through such a hassle caused by Circus Circus and no one even bothered to show their concerns about our stay. 

I had to speak to management at which they offered us a credit for our friends room of the resort fee a whopping $46. The story continues but I choose to let the other minor things slip off, like the total b**ch at the front desk who gave no concern for great customer service and had an attitude with the guest before me and then treated us the same. Ironically she didn't wear a name tag because she probably gets called out all the time for her shitty service. Bottom line, our rooms were nice but will consider the way we have been treated by this hotel for any future visits.

So I booked Circus Circus through Vegas.com. Price was good & Booking was so easy. The day before I get there I called Room Reservations to check if we could get 2 room next to each other as it was my Husband & me & My Mum. I mentioned that she couldn't walk too far & would appreciate a room close to the elevator etc. I had no clue about the layout of the Hotel of Course.
However we get there the next Day Sunday 8th March & try to get a parking space closest to the Elevator & take our Luggage out & drag it across the parking & get to the elevator & to the Registration desk. At the Entrance NATALIE stops us & says we should check in & talk to her as she would like to offer us a FREE BUFFET. Who would say no to a Buffet in Vegas? Not a long wait at the Registration & the Lovely Lady ANITA, cheerful as ever checks us in & then tells us that our Rooms are on another block & takes 6 minutes to walk there, Really? I did mention when I called Room Reservations, that my 82 year old Mother could not walk too far. So we drag our Luggage all over again & stop & Speak to NATALIE, about the Promised Free Buffet. She Then gets us to walk over to another Counter & there the Lady is trying to sell us something. She says we had to pay her $150 at that time & she would return $50 to us & when we stayed at a hotel (A list which she went on rattling off) then we would get a Free stay & get $100 back. But we had to stay 3 nights. We were not interested as we are unable to getaway for 3 nights. When I said that to her, the nice lady she was, turned into a Witch. She was Very Rude & literally shooed us off. I asked her what happened to the Buffet & she Very Rudely said, "No that's not for people like you who just stay 1 night." Waste of our time to even listen to her garbage. First impressions, really put me off.
We then get back in to our car & drive out across the hotel & to another building to find our room which is on Block E the Furthest one. Room was clean & Comfortable & we had good Parking, Everything was fine. However there was no Fridge (We didn't need one) & no Do not Disturb Sign. I thought since it was Vegas, maybe we don't need all this. Coffee Machine was in the Toilet, But I was not Going to make my coffee in the toilet. So I moved it into the Room.
We were out with Friends & got back to the Hotel around 2 in the morning, looking forward to sleeping until it was time to check out. We had to forget about that. 9 a.m. the lady knocks on all the room doors saying she was from Housekeeping & needs to know if we were checking out that morning. I was so very annoyed to be woken up at 9 a.m. when check out was at 11 a.m.
Tried to talk to guest Services about it, after 40 minutes on hold, a lady comes on laying saying she's the Manager Guest Services & I tell her all this, she's so Rude & abruptly connects me somewhere. Another lady comes online & I asked her who she was. She says she is the Manager Housekeeping, more Rude to me & when I tell her what happened she says that's the Hotel Policy & there's nothing they can do about it. She says I should have put on the Do Not Disturb Sign. I told her I didn't have one & it seems like no one on that floor had one as this Cleaning lady was knocking on every single door. There was no point talking to her, as she didn't even bother to apologize.
Called Guest Services again & the Lovely SYLVIA listens to me, Apologizes & feels really bad for me. I told her we had a 6 hour drive back & needed all the sleep we can get to wear off the Alcohol & food from the previous Night. She then Connects me to the Front Office Manager, CHAD who was kind enough to offer us a Buffet to make up for it all. However, we didn't have time as we had to get on the Road, with all the time wasted trying to talk to all these people. I was Promised a Refund on Our Resort Fee. Not received it yet. So Lets see. 
But People here are very Rude. Except if you are Lucky you get the Nice kind people who go out of their way to do their Service Recovery. They need more People Like ANITA at Registration, SYLVIA at Guest Services & CHAD at the Front Desk.
Be careful which tower\/ building you stay in. Some rooms are nice and some are from the 80s. Low ceilings and terrible quality. Of course they charge the same price either way.

If you care about your kids....do not stay here!!!!! The hotel is gross....the rooms have weird mold or something growing; and the wallpaper border as this same mold running down. The doors look like a scary movie (dirty). If you drive, the directions say check in and park; but your hotel room\/building could possible be a mile away. The buildings are not labeled and it's smells like pot. 
There is no security. The bellhop said the hotel was remodeled 2 years ago but it looks like a 80 year old "trailer park" that people on crack live at. You would be safer sleeping in your car than this place!

The rooms here are not clean and the sheets do not get changed. We couldn't even stay the night and had to check out when we found bed bugs and got a skin rash. Stay away, security was also arguing with us saying that nothing was wrong with the room and they wouldn't refund us for the nights we booked. We literally have a video of them yelling, what a ridiculous property.

Dated but still somewhat fun.

This is probably still one of the best places to abandon your kids while you gamble irresponsibly.

Had a chili cheeseburger at one of the cafe\/restaurants. It wasn't bad.
This is a good hotel...meant to allow you to spend your money somewhere besides your hotel reservation. Clean enough, good casino, about what you would expect.

Margarita (with the great hair) at the front desk was amazing and accommodating and started our Vegas weekend off right!! It was my friends birthday and she took the time to talk to us and give us suggestions and really went the extra mile.

I usually do not review the places I've been to, unless my experience is utterly miserable or superbly fantastic. Granted the saying "you get what you paid for". We ended up choosing this hotel because it was the only one we could reasonably afford at the last minute. This was our first family vacation in 17 years since coming to the United States, so granted we were very excited. Upon arrival the room seemed adequate at first glance, but looks can be deceiving. I noticed that the hotel staff failed to clean the room and there was trash in the waste bin. We were forgiving about this and settled in so that we could explore the Hotel and take a tour of Las Vegas. Doing so required using the sink, which we found out was clogged and leaking water from the pipes. We called the front desk to notify them of this problem and needed to wait on hold for 30 minutes before someone answered our call. After explaining the situation they let us know that someone will be there to fix the problem. After storing things in the safe, we decided to explore the hotel rather than waste time waiting for the arrival of the plumber. Upon entering their second floor, we were overwhelmed with a strong tobacco odor. We decided to play the slop machines and lost $40 in approximately 15 minutes because the machines seemed to be biased towards the house (later we went to the MGM and won $20). After returning to our room I prepared to sleep and discovered a sharp metal piece under the sheets near the corner of my chest! The hotel staff failed to ensure safety. Luckily, I was not injured!! The plumber never came to fix the problem and we had to use the clogged sink. The restaurant there is not worth paying for. It has the quality of Home Town Buffet. Lots of food, but lack of taste. Definitely not worth the $15 we paid per person. The best part about the hotel was the check out. After mentioning the situation to a staff member and showing the sharp metal piece in my bed, we were promptly referred to a manager who apologized. However, because we booked our stay through a third party, we couldn't get a refund and were offered free breakfast instead. We had hoped for a better vacation especially since it was our first in many years. My advice, stay at a better hotel. The extra $40 for a room could have made a difference.

There are two compelling reasons to visit Circus Circus:
1. Literary: It is one of the few Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas stomping grounds still left standing. You probably won't be able to buy a chimp, but then again...
2. The Circus Acts: In the midway above the casino action, you can catch some free circus performers. It may not be Cirque quality, but there is definitely something compelling and memorable and, well, Vegas surreal. Last time we went I enjoyed the "Captivating Cat", a lady dressed like a cat that did trapeze tricks. However, the real star of the show was the one-man drummer band who created some superfly spy music. However, it is like art, some people will appreciate it. Others will wonder why they took my advice and went to check it out. They will shake their head as they are walking away. 

Other than that, I can't think of a good reason to visit Circus Circus. Imagine all the loudness, smokiness, and insanity of your average Vegas casino, and then make about 60% of the population children under the age of 16. Does this sound like a pretty picture? I feel like an old person by saying this, but honestly, when I go there, I can't think straight.  

Go check out the circus acts, say a quiet ode to Hunter, and then exit quickly.

I Checked in the Manor Lodge, room was extremely bad, very old, not renovated nor maintained Long time ago. Place is smelly and bathroom wasn't good. The room rate itself was moderated but all other activities and facilities in the hotel are expensive. Food quality is not good in the buffet bur the steak house us good and expensive in t he same time.

Excellent service for s reasonable price.  Has all the new slot machines and awesome stores inside the casino.  West tower room is nice and clean.  They have subway and McDonald's across the street that is open 24hrs.

Oh god, THIS PLACE. 

This place holds so many fond memories for me during my childhood, what has happened to you my beloved Circus Circus?

Pros:
It holds a lot of memories for me, as already stated.
The Carousel Bar.
Besides shopping, the Stratosphere Tower rides, the rollercoasters at New York-New York and Sahara and a small arcade here and there, this is pretty much the ONLY thing left for kids on The Strip. 

Cons:
There never seems to be anything new. Not very exciting at all anymore.
Very low-quality restaurants.
Middle-of-nowhere location(not really their fault though, more the fault of stupid entrepreneurs who must blow up everything in sight instead of being resourceful and using what's already there for their project).
Desperately in need of a remodel.

Circus Circus is one of the few old school places left and one of the only things left for kids. I WOULD love to take my kids here if I ever have any, that is, if it didn't have the potential to make them cry from how rundown it is. Please, you guys need to do SOMETHING. It's not what it used to be at all but it holds too many memories for me to handle it if it were gone forever.

Only stay here if you want to run the risk of getting bit by bed bugs. After filing a claim they came back that they didn't find anything. After reading numerous complaints about this same experience I just wish that I would have read that before staying here.

We were headed to Vegas for a family reunion, and I was not thrilled that my brother chose "The Clown Hotel" for us to stay at, especially since we all left our kids at home. However, I was impressed with the hotel. The room was very nice (we stayed in the West Tower), the beds were super comfy, and all of the employees we encountered were wonderful. 

I stupidly left some personal articles in the room after checkout (including $100 in cash!), and the hotel called to let me know, then graciously mailed them to me. All I had to pay was mailing costs. 

I would have no reservations about staying here in the future. The Midway was fun, the hotel had plenty of activities going on (be sure to check out Vince Neils Tatuado!), and we had a great time. I highly recommend the hotel, since I had an amazing experience.

If your going to Las Vegas with kids I would recommend this place, if just as a couple, I would not.  Every attraction in this place is about the kids,  has a circus type show, then the little dart games popping the balloons for a prize type area,  arcade,  and of course the big pink dome you see from the outside,  which is the thrill theme park with the rides etc.  Its actaully a decent price for an all day pass for kids, its like $16.95 give or take all day, and the lines arent even long at all, even on a saturday.  The rooms itself were less then average,  can hear noise all throughout the hallways,  blow dryer noise from the in room air conditioner.  I went during the Manny Pacquiao fight this month.  For the little price you pay for the hotel,  just go in expecting sub par accommodations.  The buffet in this joint sucks!! But I had gotten comped for 2 free buffets, so me and my woman tried it, but definately wouldnt go in there to pay for it lol.

This place seemed ok until I found a cocaroach in our coffee maker... 

The prices are pretty steep and we didn't even have a refrigerator, microwave or anything special.

My wife and I booked 7nights here and within 3days we had 4 different rooms due to deadbolt not working, electric outlets not working, and a dresser being broken. The manager even tried to put us in the casino wing which I heard had bedbugs and when I told her that she agreed that they had complaints about them. The housekeeping is awful they came in and didn't even make the beds they threw blankets still bagged on the bed. Even at the pools it's awful life guards just sit there and half the time they don't pay attention neither do kids parents. I had to grab a kid who lost her grip on the wall and went under and couldn't swim. I had kids jump on me kick me got hit with balls even in the hot tub kids running and jumping in over and over with parents doing nothing 15ppl sitting in the hot tub doesn't leave enough room for kids to be fooling around. If the airline didn't want such a high fee to switch our flights to a earlier day I would've flown home. This hotel made our vacation stressful, and the enjoyment went away every time we re-entered the hotel. I personally will never stay here again

God! It must be them who gave us bed bugs! After I stayed at this hotel last summer, our apt now have bed bugs! I checked the past reviews and found people posted a pic with a bed bug on the bed. There it is! I finally find out why after my trip we had bed bugs now! Because of this horrible hotel! I stayed there for about 3 nights. The bed bug must have traveled to my apt by hiding in my suit case! I never knew these bugs in my life until now! 
During my whole trip,I stayed in a few hotels but none of them was dirty like this hotel! So after I got bed bug, I first think of this hotel and checked all the reviews. And then I found it--a photo with a bed bug taken by others. 
If I can go back I will tell myself do not stay here! I am so regretting for having stayed here! God what should I do to get rid of the bed bugs! I should even be careful if I want to go back to China! I'm so afraid that I may bring the bugs to my Chinese home now! 
If I can give them a minus, definitely I will!

The West Tower at Circus Circus is a decent, low-cost option for summer vacation with the kids. The Adventure Dome is the closest to an amusement park in Las Vegas. It's worth the stay for a first-time visitor.

All the negative reviews are hilarious. what do you expect for what you paid. It sounds like they want to pay nothing for a room thats comparable to $500\/night. We stayed there this past weekend, and while the casino is out of date, and ugly, and the rooms could be improved, we paid next to nothing so that we can gamble more. Adventuredome was very impressive. New, bright, exciting, great rides, NO lines, and worth the price. I'd rather take my kids here than to Knott's Berry with similar rides, and long lines. This way, we can do adult fun gambling, visit some of the nicer casinos, eat at other places, and come back for the kids and to sleep. The arcade was fun for the kids too, and people were walking around with 2 for 1 coupons, which was great! We also went to the Circus Acts show, and I was VERY impressed. They were all very professional and entertaining for the kids. I highly recommend Circus Circus for Adventuredome and the arcade\/circus acts. Don't go if you're delusional and think you're entitled to something more than the $0 you paid for your room.

I had never been to Circus Circus before because everyone is all, "It's sad and terrible and far away."  However, FREE acrobatic acts?  Carouseling bars and slot machines?  A Midway?  I'm trying it out!
We got the monorail day pass and got off on the "Sahara" stop like the monorail tells you to.  WRONG DECISION.   It is a terrible, lonely, non-shaded, long walk to the Circus Circus.  PLUS, the stop at LVH turns out to be much closer (like, half the walk plus no scary uninhabited casino to walk through).  
So you'd think that since we saw the entrance of the casino as if seeing water for the first time in a vast, dry desert, we'd be happy with WHATEVER was there.  Nope!  It's really sad.  Like, really sad.  The midway is full of crying kids and closed games and several "Star Darts," which is a game where you try to hit post-it notes with stars on them, stapled to a bulletin board.  It's kind of like one of those really sad church harvest festivals.
The acrobatic act we saw was actually pretty cool.  The acrobats were quite talented.  However, it was not worth it to travel that far.
The Adventure Dome was crazy boring and crowded, and we didn't feel like paying theme park prices for a couple rides.
The whole casino was kind of gross allover, so we didn't feel like eating.
We ended up staying for a very short time.
Overall: it's sad and terrible and far away.

I would give this place zero stars if I could. At check in they give you problems about a bedroom containing 2 people. Yes two people that the booking was clearly for. 
Next, our reservation was made for the hotel, and they put us in the "motel" saying if we pay more we could get into the hotel, which is what we already booked!!!
Then, while settling for what they give us we see a group of thugs kick down the door of where we are staying and start saying things like "suck my dick" and "I'm gonna cone to your room and fuck you" because there is no security and doors are not strong enough to keep intruders out. Not to mention there are kids in this hotel being exposed to that. 
On top of all this , I call for a refrigerator, which they do not have in the room and ask me to pay $20 extra considering all the troubles they put us through already! Unbelievable. Do not book here.

A bit of Old Vegas here ~ Its getting real old looking inside and out. Its really nice at night out front. 

We have never stayed here over the years only because we have always heard the rooms were not the best. Plus there is a lot of families with kids because it is geared for families with all the fun things they have with the amusement area in the dome.

We have been here many many times over the years just to gamble and we went to the steakhouse which was really good.
Not thrilled with the parking here..
So I think being for people with kids this is definitely  a place you will want to take them, not too many casinos have things for the kids!

If your ever around for Halloween they have the dome changed over for a haunted attraction.A few years back I went when they had a whole floor of the hotel changed over and you walked into different rooms that were scary, it was pretty cool.
If you have never been to Circus Circus you have to stop by and walk around!
Shabby, depressing, shady characters. However, games were a lot of fun for the kids. Employees manning the games were super sweet. Circus acts were great.

Well, I was here this August, just totally forgot to Review but here I am reviewing.  

As a kid, this place was amazing~ I thought it was the shining beacon among all hotels, because it had a midway for the kids, and a THEMEPARK!!

The rooms are way overpriced for what you get...other than that it's just your average casino...sorry Circus Circus...

Gross. I stayed here one time and totally regret it.  At first they were gonna put us in one of those motel type rooms that weren't even connected to the main hotel.  But the front desk guy was nice enough to tell us to just go out there, say that you don't feel safe, come back to him and he can get us a room at the main tower.  

Place is pretty run down\/old. And it is REALLY cheap. You can walk to the strip from there..but still...I rather fork over more money to stay on the actual strip and get a better room.  Thank goodness I'm not a poor college student anymore!

Drink service deplorable.   Tacky, tacky deco, if you can even call it that.   Its cheap, convenient to the strip.  That's about all I can say.  Hotel rooms dated and some are worn, tho not thread bare.  Average to slightly below average.  Kids EVERYWHERE underfoot.  NOT a fave of mine.  I give it the second star for the occasional decent  free circus acts.
No spinning bar. Enough said. Or if you need more proof, Vince Neil bars, children galore, and no alcohol in the mixed drinks. There, that should be enough said.
Dirty, old, and run down. Only thing I'll give it is the cheap pricing. In a pinch, you need something quick and cheap, go ahead and stay there.

The room stunk it was not very comfortable . the room from across had a couple screaming at each other so the whole Vegas strip could here them. the room next to us were having sex so i wouldn't recommend bringing kids. Very trashy would not come back and the 1 out of 10 I would rate a -1 ruined my vacation the only reason I gave a star is because that's the only option we get

Just got back from Las Vegas, and yes, we stayed at Circus Circus.  I was quite scared after reading all the reviews about this place.

First of all, we did not have to walk through the casino to get to the registration desk.  We entered through the back where most people were being dropped off by a taxi or parked their car rentals.  So, if your taxi dropped you off at the front, it must be a taxi driver that doesn't know the hotel!!!!

We had to wait maybe ten minutes to register and we did get a guy that was not friendly at all!  His name was Richard - he looked fairly young, so may have been new.  BUT still no smile, no welcome to the hotel, nothing!!!  If you don't like what you are doing, leave!  Don't make people feel so unwelcome to the hotel!!!

When we got to our room on the 22nd floor, the door was WIDE open.  I didn't feel comfortable staying in it so we went back down to change rooms.  They gave us a room on the 35th floor!  Gorgeous view of the mountains!  The rooms were clean.  Even the carpet seemed fine as some people did say that it didn't look very clean but ours was.  The beds were comfortable, the linens were clean and the bathroom was clean.  And like other reviewers said, the wall paper was peeling from the walls but not too bad.  That was probably the only complaint.  We opted not to have our roomed clean the whole time we stayed there so don't know what housekeeping is like.  

There were tons of places to eat.  At at the Westpoint Deli and was very good.  Rock n Rita's was ok . . . very slow with breakfast but expected it from other reviews.  My cousin picked up a dozen donuts from Krispy Kreme and we left them sitting in the hot van when we were at Hoover Dam.  After we got back, we looked in the box expecting a big pool of sugar but nope, nothing melted!!!!!!!!  Kinda gross!!!!!

It was a very busy hotel.  Our room was great, quiet and spacious for the three of us.  Even the elevator wait wasn't too bad.  We didn't have to deal with many of the staff but the ones that we did, they were nice.  

The kids went to the pool once.  But it closed at 8PM!!  I don't know why it was so early but the kids seemed to have had fun.

Parking was a nightmare sometimes, but we always found a spot.  

If we ever head back to Vegas, I would be happy to stay on this hotel, just make sure it's the West Tower.
One word... "ghetto" checked in and checked right back out... dirty, stink, old. coffee machine with no coffee pot, no extra rolls of toilet paper!  Broken drawers. Nasty.

Oh gawd! I made the most and worst common mistake when coming here...and that was coming on a saturday night. I took my 4 year old to meet up with some friends and their kids who were visiting from out of town.  I should've passed. Geez, this place was super packed and is it just me or does the place smell like its in need of a renovation? It kind of reeks of old, layered cigarette smoke covered with nose burning odors, masked by cheap febreeze. I don't know it was just blah. The acts were ok and kept my little entertained and from wanting to spend more than my take home pay. Games are pretty expensive and for a little one who likes to play and get one of those cute dolls, mines was really upset and sad. So I may pass on this place and just opt for Chucky E. Cheese since it's let crowded and she's more likely to enjoy her time there.

$30 - you get what you pay for.

If not for Circus Circus, folks from California ghettos would never get to vacation.

What a cesspool.

Opt for Excalibur. ~ the same price, but it's much nicer and in a perfect location.

You get half of what you pay for here. Check-in took an hour in the half, because they lost my reservation, but was quick to take my money. We walk up expecting to relax a little before we go out.... WRONG!!!! The room wasn't ready, dirty as hell, stains of I don't want to know on the floor, garbage fill with rotting food, the bed (don't get me started). The maid comes to CLEAN UP, but instead did the basics, and flipped the sheets-- not change, but flip the sheets.... THAT IS GROSS!!! We call the desk, get a new room, but surprise we have to wait fucking two hours to get our new keys... The security guy is outside talking and getting the number of some women, why would it take two hours to get our key. When he comes up he is rudely on the phone taking his sweet time getting to the door to let us in. Then this room was dirty, no cover on the bed, the carpet made oil look like sunlight. It actually made the out of touch security guard say "that's nasty," "YOU THINK!!!!"

They gave us an upgrade, and these room look like they actually took the time to clean... Here is the kicker they tried to charge my card the difference. I be dammed.... Getting my money back was like pulling the teeth of a four year old.

I mean yea it's an old casino.  I respect Circus Circus as an old casino.  Because back in my day in the 90's, this place was bumpin.  Arcade games galore, the circus acts by the clowns and stunt men and women.  But now, who plays arcades when we have the latest and greatest computer gadgets and cell devices at home?  Who needs circus acts, when we now have 80" screen HDTV or Plasma?  So it's like modern vs throwback.

I agree that this is an older property but they try very hard to make things wonderful.  I get VIP treatment at CC since the 1980's so I am a loyal visitor.  And they know this and make every opportunity to make my stay great.  Yes they do and there is a VIP line for check in that I use every time.  Perfect examples of customer service at every check-in station.  I am not shy about asking for upgrades where ever I go, stay and eat and generally get them.  Does not hurt to ask.  My room always has a refrigerator which is nice.  I prefer Casino Tower due to the size of the rooms and I have favorite rooms too.  I will post for other properties I stay at but this was always a hit particularly if you have kids.  OMG, kids everywhere!  I hope they do something about the smell of smoke but remember, it is an older property.  Value.  Value.  Value.  If you are on a budget and\/or on a budget with family, stay here.  The staff is amazing and I have gotten to know some of them for they are long time employees and that says something about management.  Do check out the Steak House!  Melt in your mouth steak.  And this is coming from a guy who rarely eats red meat.  Choose your steak as it is in the viewing freezer.  Thanks for the goodies CC.  Now don't freak out but I don't know about the phone and computer chargers because when I'm on a vacation I don't take my phone or computer.  It's a vacation.

There was a strange odor when you walked in from one entrance . The hotel is fine for a quick little stay and always very busy . The staff was friendly but if you have the money try to stay closer on the strip . The pool was a tad bit boring and its very a family orientated hotel . So if you with your girl then you may not enjoy the pool . There really wasn't much to the stay but a decent hotel bed . It all depends what you are looking for when you stay .

Stayed in the West Tower 26th floor facing the strip. The view was nice and the room was clean. Stayed 3\/31 - 4\/3. 

The free circus acts in the Midway are cool and shows run every 45 min. until 12am! The arcade is fun, but really crowded as to be expected. Most of the games are $1, or some are just $.25, which is a plus. 

Aside from the strong smell of cigarette smoke on the 1st and 2nd floors, my family and I had a great time!

The room was modern and it started off being clean nice bed and everything else but from there it went to hell.  I chose stay at Circus Circus because I have my two small children and my mother with me We were in town for a wedding.  The kids enjoyed the adventure dome.  But we had major issues with housekeeping I asked them to come around 1 o'clock because I knew I was good to be in the room most of the morning they never came.  I called the front desk to complain about this at around 830 9 o'clock that evening and actually said sent someone from housekeeping in an attempt at 10 o'clock at night try to clean my room.  Needless to say my children were  bed as it was not a good experience.  I went to check out at around 430 in the morning I flew out at a different time from  the rest of my family I needed to print boarding passes for them  and attempted to use my free coupon for the business center.  They notified me that they were unable to help me with the coupon until everything opens at 7 AM I was under the impression it was a place was open 24 hours a day and that i would get good customer service don't go there if that's what you think.  I was told that there was nothing they could do to help me but there is no way I could print my boarding passes without having to pay exorbitant fees even though they were going to provide me with free service after 7 AM and top of it when I complained about the housekeeping debacle they told me I should have remembered to put my do not disturb sign on my door. I've decided to try to use the self-service Internet kiosk and print my boarding tickets from there and pay for the kiosk is down so I was left with no way to leave my mother and children their boarding passes. In the end I would never go back there again I may take my children there to ride rides but to be honest there are many other cool things in Las Vegas to see then a rundown stinky hotel.
