If you use the machine and break a hundred dollar bill, you get a buy one get one free voucher. So pretty much every game that the 5 of us played played, we used 3 bucks for 6 games.

Oh, and this is the only place I played blackjack for about 10 minutes. I came up $16. Yeahhh bitches, how bout them apples??

Cliff Notes: I'm a fan of their carnival games floor for winning prizes.

Attending the Circus Circus wasn't bad at all. Even though being there for only a few days, there is plenty to keep yourself occupied throughout. 
The buffet they offer has a wide variety of satisfying foods, from main entrees, to sides and deserts. If you don't wanna leave the hotel, I recommend stuffing your face at the buffet. (Specially the ice cream!)
The rooms were neatly organized and cleaned all around. The air was breathable and there was no horrific smell. the bathrooms were kept stocked on the recommendables. The shower, toilet and sink were up to span. The bed sheets were changed daily and the beds were nicely made. With plenty of tv channels and free WiFi, you'll be plenty busy for those who decide on takin a lazy day.
The casino was also a plus of course. Not overcrowded with people as this hotel is also kid friendly, so the gambling area is sectioned off. There were plenty of machines to choose from to get that gambling fix. One floor up is a wide selection of shops to take a peek at that are not to hard on your wallets. Even though it is Vegas. 
A couple flaws I found. It was nearly impossible to find parking for me, as I had to drive in the very back. Also with construction being done on a main road entering the hotel, traffic can pile up, as I almost witnessed an accident. 
I would consider the Circus Circus the backyard of the other hotels and casinos that are on the strip but an excellent hotel nonetheless. (Easy on the pocket book.) I highly recommend to anyone traveling across Las Vegas.

Before last week I had last been here in about 1979 or so and the place hasnt changed one bit.  For kids (I have a 4 year old) it's a great place - rides, games, chances to win prizes, etc.  For adults, if you're into that campy\/ironic\/going to dives thing, then this is your place (even Bill's Casino doesn't have the gaming area in the basement with seven foot ceilings).  Just don't stay there, and don't eat anything.
Average on a budget type hotel.  Place is getting a bit rundown and needs some money invested to spruce up the place.  Great for kids and okay for adults.

I don't know where to start with the Circus Circus.  My wife, nine year old daughter and I stopped here on a road trip from LA to Yellowstone National Park in Wyoming.  

I knew that this was not going to be a good experience when I arrived in the lobby.  There was a line of people waiting to check in that snaked out to the front door.  Now it is Independence Day weekend, and I understand that the hotel would be busy.  I would expect to see every check-in station staffed and the management would be doing their best to handle the rush of people as quickly as possible.  My expectations were not met.  1\/2 of the stations were staffed and we stood in the line 30 minutes before we were helped.  After checking in, I visited the men's room in the lobby where I saw gang tag on the stall walls.  Yikes.

We had a Manor room, which is located in three story out buildings located in  the back of the property.  The room was large, clean and reasonably well appointed.  The room appears to have been renovated lately.  I understand why hotels secure the television to the furniture, but I'm not sure why the Circus Circus secured the $20 alarm clock to the night stand.  I went to move the lamp on the night stand and learned that the lamp is secured to the furniture.  In fact the only bit of electronics that was not attached to the furniture (the TV remote control) was missing.

Finally, the level of people here was positively agoraphobic.  The crowds in the Adventure Dome and the Midway sections were so large, the midways were impassable for several minutes.  I understand that the Circus Circus is trying to accommodate whole families including children, but given the number of guests they have in the hotel, i'd think the fire marshal would want them to widen the halls.

Will I be back?  Not anytime soon.

Seriously,  the people that bring their children here should not be parents.  The place smells like cigarettes and urine,  everything is dingy, shady people all over...  Need I say more? 
I walked around just to see if this place lived up to the reputation it has,  and honestly a place with an on-site trailer park and stores shilling 99 cent jewelry in glass display cases as high end merchandise really doesn't strike me as kid friendly.

What an absolute sh*t hole. 
I'm not one to go over the top on places but this was by far the worst hotel\/motel experience I've EVER had. I was offered a comp'd 3 day vacation when I checked out and declined. I will NEVER go back to this place. If you are reading this because you found it a cheap deal and wanted to check before you book...spend the money and stay somewhere else.  

It took almost 2hours to check in on a Monday night.

First off, I stayed in the 'Manor." This is a no-tell motel that they probably bought and now call it Circus-Circus. Seriously, it's the most disgusting place I've ever stayed. I tried to change rooms but they claimed all the tower rooms were booked. The carpet was that weird greasy sticky, it stunk, there was mold on the ceiling, holes in the ceiling, wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off the walls, tiles stained some putrid yellow, all the clocks and 3 of the 6 lamps were broken, no pictures on the wall, all the furniture was broken (drawers half hanging out and smashed) and this disgusting stink that permeated through the entire building that was basically similiar to mildew. Seriously, it was that disgusting. I'm glad it was the last day when I found the underwear and bra an elephant could have worn jammed between the mattress and wall. I am thoroughly disgusted that I stayed there.

The casino is old and tired. Rock'n Ritas was a sh*t hole with really crappy bartenders and the buffet review will be saved for it's own page. I did walk away with a couple hundred bucks from $1 roulette so I'm not that angry at the casino but it really is a dump and should be torn down.

If you've skipped all the above I urge you to read it. I wish I could give it no stars and will never step foot in that place again.

I had a great time at circus circus, the rooms are priced accordingly. The downfall is it says on the "strip" but it's pretty far from other casinos but overall a good experience I'm 23 and rode the roller coasters inside and had so much fun!!!

So I've mentioned on my first review how I've been going to this hotel and casino since I was a little girl and how I loved it here. Now, I'm sorry to say that I no longer feel the same about this place. 

I stayed here with my family during the new year weekend. January 1st was my check out date. Everything went well the whole weekend except when I realized that I left my Phillips sonicare toothbrush there. I tried to call the lost and found later that day but it was already closed.

I was still in town as I was staying with my sister for a few days. I decided to call again when they opened. I was talking to a man and told him what had happened. He "supposedly" checked to see if someone turned it in but nothing. I have asked him if the housekeeping are sectioned out and he told me he couldn't tell me any of that info. I got upset because he acted like the housekeeping didn't steal anything.

I even asked for his manager and he tells me that there's no manager available. That's some BS! Regardless, there's always a manager on board. He told me I can file a complaint. I told him that their staff is dishonest and that whoever cleaned up that room should be fired for stealing. 

Yes I know it was my fault for not double checking before leaving but when you have two younger kids with you and you're pregnant, you tend to have "pregger head". But still, UNACCEPTABLE for taking someone's belongings. This is what I get for being a LOYAL CUSTOMER FOR DECADES.

We did not stay here-- because, well, we had heard not to stay here. We went over because of the history and the fact that we wanted to have a drink at the famous Carousel Bar ala Fear and Loathing. Nope. It's a frickin' gelato stand. Everything there is nothing short of depressing. I mean really, really depressing. That said, I got a Circus Circus keychain as I figure this place will be demolished within a short time and I wanted to keep a little piece of history (as I think that it used to be cool before it was overrun with rednecks, small children running around by themselves, old people that look like they are going to have a heart attack in the next five minutes, and people who look like they want to kick your ass just for being in their personal space).

My husband and I came to stay at Circus Circus for 2 nights, after a 4 night stay at Ballys. We approach the front desk @ 9:30am and told them we would like to check in early. The lady at the front counter told us that it was gonna be extra to do so, and we were fine with that. Then after a few minutes she says "you'll have to come back after 10am"...ok, fine. So we come back after 10am and a nice young lady named Briana informed us that they don't have any rooms clean that we requested and asked if we wouldn't mind coming back after 2pm, we said that'd be fine. Fast forward to 2am when we are startled awake by VERY LOUD screaming and yelling in the room next door. There were 2 men swearing and threatening eachother. We called security and they came up and asked them to be quiet. An hour and a half passes and they are even LOUDER than they were before. We called security once again and requested they come up AGAIN because the situation was getting out of hand. They FINALLY quieted down. The next day we requested a different room after finding out that they were going to be in that room another night. Oh, and btw....don't plan on visiting the Garden Grille...they are now closed, even though their are NO SIGNS informing guests. And promotion signs are still up for the restaurant. The Pizzeria was supposed to be open until 11 pm but was closed when we called at 10:30.

Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. We wish we would have just paid the extra little bit of money and stayed at Ballys. We will NEVER stay here again.

Worst hotel in Vegas hands down, Toilet didn't work, nobody came to fix after promised.  If they try to stick u in the "manor" its a dump.  Very seedy area, high possibility u will get mugged.  Paper thin walls , here people screaming bloody murder at 4 am.  This hotel totally killed our Vegas trip.  Super Dump.

Worst hotel ever ! Without noticing ! We got a downgrade!  When i call front desk, they told us, its all booked, n we made reservation earlier online. N called before come in , non of them mention anything about it !  Front desks are so rude! Worst experience ever !

Little disappointed with the reservations with so much credit card fraud out there I don't understand why hotel don't find another way to protect their customers. Reserving a room requires all my 16 digit#, expiration, security code in the back and not to mention the name. Now how does this protect me?

Honestly, Circus Circus isn't as bad as a lot of other reviewers say it is. Sure, there are a lot of ratchet looking folks in and around the hotel. Also, being so far away from the main strip can be a bit of an inconvenience. But for what it is, a place you need to sleep, it does its job. I was expecting it to be super janky but that wasn't the case at all. Does it show it's age? Sure it does. 

In spite of its inconvenience by being so far from everything, it's only a 15 minute walk to Encore or the Wynn and stuff in that area. And if you don't want to walk, there is a bus stop just a few steps in front of the hotel. You can do the 24 hour pass for $24 or 2 hours for $6. You can ride that unlimited times within the time frame you purchase. 

Would I stay here again? Maybe. Depends on how my wallet is treating me when planning for the next trip out here.
We enjoyed our stay we go there every, year kids love it free room for 3 night Guest relations is wonderful! Our room was great. There's also amazing arcade games  and circus acts every day.

Please allow ZERO stars! We had reservations, which we made months before because of spring break. Arrived and was told our room would be across the street at the MOTEL part of the casino, not the HOTEL. Well, we walked down the sidewalk and across the street to a set of motel buildings that were pretty scary looking, circa early '70s. This was about midnight; we were tired. Our room: mold in the bathroom, hair on the bathroom floor, blood on the shower curtain, holes in all the sheets, holes in the drapes, toilet ran all night. Customer service the next morning was extremely nice, friendly, and apologetic. She refunded all our money, even the resort fee. I should have told her to quick, get a job at a different hotel. Circus circus MUST be going out of business...or should be.

Circus Circus home to Midway is truly a good memory for me when I was younger. Its more of a family casino hotel in the sense it is more kid friendly than other hotel casinos on the strip. I've been to Circus Circus countless amounts of time and it is a pleasant experience each time though if you're looking for shopping euphoria and gambling then search elsewhere. But otherwise I would reccomend it since it is cheaper than other hotels and offers about same amenities and serves the same function. You can always walk elsewhere to have fun and gamble and later walk back to sleep so its your call but good place and I always had fun. Midway can get addicting even for us adults so be careful about that! But otherwise have fun and go win yourself a teddy bear instead of just losing all your cash on the tables ;) It's Vegas! Have fun! Stay Safe too!

im confused by this place... 

First off its suppose to be for kids. I go up to the midway and more than half of the video games are broken. Including ALL of the pinball machines so there wasn't anything to even entertain me.

Second, the security is limited and very slow. After spending 20 mins in the casino I saw a woman passed out in the middle of the floor and a huge fight break out with children crying. 

Third, the place is very dirty and ghetto. There are holes in the walls and everything is either sticky or gross.

Forth, the food sucks. The buffet smells like plastic burning and the steakhouse that is expensive and for a long time highly touted as one of the best steakhouses in LV falls short. The meat was good quality, but needed seasoning. Service was excellent though. The sides were also crap. Overall not a good meal for the price. 

Whoever is running this this casino (obviously) has the money to control these problems but fails to do so. Ive seen better casinos downtown... and if you have been downtown, you know that is crazy talk.

Rooms are incredibly dark, shower drain was clogged and had to shower in standing water, no room service available. We couldn't find our tv remote and asked housekeeping to bring us one - hours later it arrived. Rooms are way outdate. I would NOT recommend this hotel. Oh, and did I mention the $24\/day resort fee charged upon checking in? The front desk attendant couldn't even tell us what that fee pays for... nice.

Good:
-Clean rooms, attentive house keeping. We called multiple times for towels and they were there instantly
-Great for kids and family
-Cheap rooms
-Ample parking
-Good Gaming. 

Could use work 
-check-in slow
-parking, although ample, is a pain to get around.
-place needs some touch up paint, very faded in areas. 
-signage is confusing

Bottom line, clean cheap room on the strip. Good deal.

Few years ago during the "starving college student" stage--I booked a room at circus circus to save a lil dough.  Well the rooms at the towers are ok but they gave us the ones near the back by the RV parking...OMG---maybe it was just my room but I swear my bf (now husband) was itchy ALL night...we swore there were bed bugs...it ended up to be such a bad weekend cuz both of us couldnt sleep well and had bug bites all over...gross..
We love circus circus...we have 3 kids and my boys love the dome....and the midway the rooms were nice ...for 50.00 and the rooms were great.....

Hmmm.....where to begin. If you're looking for a budget hotel to take the kids and nothing else, you've found it. That's all it's good for. The convenience to entertain the kids at the Midway Arcade or the Adventuredome is all it's good for. The customer service, maid service, rooms, decor.....really really bad! 

Check this out: you know those little hanging things you put outside your room door? Y'know the ones, , "do not disturb\/maid service" . Well, usually my family and I don't want to be disturbed, but occasionally we want maid service: clean towels, empty waste baskets, etc. We put the sign out for "maid service" one day before 11am. We got back to our hotel that evening just before midnight. Our room wasn't done. Seriously? We went down to talk to Guest Services. Spoke to "Richard" and he told me the maids are usually busy and the maids usually ignore those signs and if we wanted towels or maid service, we have to call and make the request. Wait, what?' It's been my experience  that if you put a "maid service" sign on your door, you get maid service. Did I miss something? Apparently, I'm not hip enough on all the new changes. What the F are we paying resort fees for? Well, Richard said he'll take care of it within a half hour. An hour later...nothing. Send in the wife. She spoke to some other person (forgot name), and he apologized and took care of it. He did take care of it and credited one day resort fee. We appreciate that. The overall ambiance of the employee's:  Some smile, most do not. Not very personal and most  have a "I don't want to be here" attitude. 

Our room was bad!! Had to slam door to close it. The door frame was coming apart. The loudest toilet I've ever heard, beds have seen better days, thin walls, musty smell and overall the room is in need of a serious makeover. It's an old hotel, I get it, but damn!! Fix some s**t and put some money into some renovation. 

The elevators are questionable and I'll leave it at that. 

Not a whole lot of places to choose from to eat. I'm sure it's plenty for some, but the choices....meh! They have an expensive and tasteless buffet, a Starbucks and McDonald's (big surprise there), Vince Neil's Tatuado ( haven't tried it, but could be promising), a taco place by the Adventuredome, a Krispy Kreme, a place to get slushies, and a deli (looks ok).

Beware of the sales people who hound ya.

If you have kids, sure why not. You're not spending too much time in your room anyways. Just don't expect a whole lot here. You get what you pay for. We probably won't be back ourselves.
Checked into a room that was still being cleaned. Had to wait 20 minutes outside room for completion of cleaning only to find hair all over the bathroom. Very poor service and  service recovery.

I only came here to gamble so I cannot comment on the rooms and such. However, that being said, the Circus Circus is one of the most depressing casinos I have ever been in. I don't understand what happened to it but this place needs help desperately. This goes without saying but we all know that casinos are very smoky, however, upon walking in the entrance I said, "My god, the smell." It smelled as though 20 years had gone by with no cleaning, filtration, or fresh air, and the smell of extremely stale smoke made it hard to breathe. Against my better judgement, I still proceeded to the casino and was amazed at how sad and run down everything looked. I cannot not recommend this hotel\/casino to anyone to stay, let alone gamble.

My friend was staying here for EDC and her room was robbed. Someone that somehow had a key to access the room came in in the middle of the night and stole all of her stuff. BE CAREFUL IF YOURE STAYING HERE

Though low end, Circus Circus isn't as bad as other people make it seem. True, it is one of the hotels on the farthest end of the strip and catered to younger people, but their establishment isn't so bad. Rooms are quite spacious with an actual air conditioning system, and bathrooms are nice and clean. Unfortunately, they aren't so good with changing out burnt out lightbulbs, and besides news channels, the TV is pay per view. The one thing that really bothers me though, is the carpeted floor everywhere. Everything that you touch there, after walking on the carpet, gives you a nice, static electrical shock. Thankfully, internet is free, and there is a lifeguard at the perpetually crowded pool (there are three). There are four restaurants and a buffet, so you don't have to travel too far in the Las Vegas heat to find food. Shopping in there is minimal; there are a few small gift shops, and none of the fancy clothing stores that other hotels have. Of course, their main attraction is the circus show and their theme park, which is actually quite pleasant. Though targeted to the young crowd, anyone can have a good (okay, decent) time here.

The wife and I stayed here for 5 nights during our short Vegas vacation. The hotel was just A-OK. There were a few positives such as free parking and being able to check out via TV (without having to navigate the maze of walkways and casino aisles), but that's about it. The negatives are:

* AC blasting inside. Yes, even with 98 degrees outside, 65 inside is inappropriate.
* AC\/Heater inside the room was old and noisy. We had to turn it off and open the window instead.
* Old flat screen CRT (tube-style) tv. Totally unacceptable for 2013.
* Slow WiFi connection. 11 megabits per second is unacceptable 2013.
* Not enough signs indicating where things are.
* Resort fee is closer to $11 than $9.95 as per Hotels.com (notified them about it and waiting for response)
* Average buffet for the price
* Barely enough power outlets in the room for charging all the electronics one might travel with these days.
* Glass surface on the desk and the bed side table is unacceptable and bad for health.
* No beverage chiller in the room.
* No coffee maker in the room.
* Vendors peddling their wares right in your face in the hallways.
All I could say im very disgusted, disappointed and frustrating. Took pics of blood stain, yellow and hair all over  the sheet.

Not too sure why everybody seems to complain about this hotel. In all honesty it wasn't bad at all except for the foul smell of cigarette and wet dog in the casino.

We stayed for 4 days and arrived at 6 in the morning. Although the earliest check-in is allowed at 8am, the bell desk was able to store our luggage until a room opened up for us. So while we waited we decided to hang out in the casino. Of course its an older hotel and the carpet is stained with the smells of cigarettes but towards the exit\/entrance to slots-of-fun the room smelt like a foul fart that pickled and didn't air out.

Anyways, 8am came so we decided to check in, although there was a $10 early check in fee we didn't care that fee was dirt cheap to get into our room 7 hours earlier than normal check in time, we got a nice non-smoking room in the tower above the lobby which was nice. A King-Sized bed and the bathroom toiletries were stocked and fresh.

The only downside of the room was that we could hear our neighbors flush the toilet. 

There is a great cheap breakfast buffet downstairs and the boyfriend enjoined the Krispy Kreme stand. We did get lost somewhere between the adventure dome and the midway but it was totally fun and worth it to play something else besides slots and enjoy a few free performances from circus acts.

This Hotel was totally convenient and worth the price. Plus being in Vegas you aren't supposed to spend you whole day in your hotel room, you are supposed to gallivant and explore the strip and what not so it was perfect for us.

Easily the poorest service I've experienced in all of Vegas. If I could give negative stars I absolutely would. Ordered pizza at the pizzeria. Called about 45 minutes into the order, the clerk said delivery was on its way. WAITING FOR AN HOUR AND 50 minutes now. For one pizza. Called the pizzeria, refused to answer. Called Circus Circus, Tammy at the front desk transferred us the Andre. Andre didn't give two $hit$ about managing the customers expectations and did nothing to rectify the situation. Yelled at the delivery guy while I was on the phone to deliver the pizza. I'm paying $40 for a pizza and a side salad to be delivered 16 floors and haven't gotten it for TWO HOURS. Was promised it at 45 minutes and forced to wait an additional hour and 15 min when we were promised it was on the way. Wtf. We've missed our VIP entry for two clubs and spent unheard of money for the worst service I've experienced in my life. AT LEAST DO NOT PROMISE WITHOUT DELIVERING. Jesus. So frustrated.

5 Stars for Midway Area
- Still the best and biggest place for carnival games, arcade games, and those ticket to toy games.
- McDonalds in here is actually better sometimes (due to the menu sometimes containing non-standard McD's food) than the outside 

2.5 Stars for the Quality of the Hotel and Food
3 Stars for the Price of the Hotel and Food
Honestly I read a lot if bad reviews about this place but if you have kids this hotel is perfect for a fun family environment!!

Will never stay at circus circus again Manor has cockroaches (yes this was confirmed by both the maids and the front desk they know they have them yet still rent the rooms out) was moved to the skyrise tower and had no hot water in our room for 2 days. Front desk people were rude. Only good thing was the maids were very friendly. Only reason im giving 1 star is cause i cant give a zero

BED BUGS! We have traveled to circus circus on a vacation and were bitten by bugs, we returned home and now a month later have infestation. WHAT THE FRANK@!@ This is the most costly trip I've EVER been on.  Do you know how expensive it is to get rid of these things! I feel so gross.  Always itchy, welts on my body.  We have a one year old son.  I am FURIOUS@! 

They greet you with somebody checking you in, but then it's a timeshare. Liars.  Where is the front desk..  Please somebody get control of these people setting up shop.  It took us a half hour to arrive at the line to check-in. 

The safe was broken, so we couldn't lock anything. 

Elevators took forever bc they closed one of he two down for 'remodeling'. 

It reeked of McDonnalds and pine sol.

Circus Circus should adopt Chuck E Cheese's slogan, because staying here, made me feel like a kid again (which is a great thing)!

I ended up booking 2 nights at Circus Circus through smartvegas.com (highly advise you check out this website) I got amazing room rates! (Circus Circus also offers AAA discounts and military as well, just a heads up) :)

When I arrived at Circus Circus, I was immediately greeted by a lovely smile, and a "hello, welcome to Circus Circus", which was very pleasant, and resulted in putting a smile on my face!

I stood in line for about eight minutes, which was a surprise, considering the amount of people that were in front of me (about 15-20 people). I thought I was going to be standing for quite some time, but, Circus Circus proved me wrong.

When I arrived in my room, I noticed the spacious layout, and the beautiful view of the strip. The bed was ok in regards to comfort, and the positioning of the bed was slightly off, considering it wasn't in the center, and the T.V was to the far left. This made watching T.V uncomfortable. The pillows were fluffy and big, but ended up not being as comfy as I thought, this resulted in neck cramps.

The staff at Circus Circus was very helpful, everyone seemed to have a smile on their faces, and seemed to be eager to answer the questions you had. 

I come to Vegas a lot, and Circus Circus exceeded my expectations. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. 

They have a great adventuredome. This is why this made me feel like a kid again. I got to enjoy Vegas, like I usually do, then also enjoy the kid aspect as well, (riding rides, playing arcade games etc). 

The drinks are very affordable, and they have great tasting food as well.

They also offer free Wifi (which is pretty fast) and provide their guests with coupons to restaurants, shows etc as soon as you check in! 
This is something I haven't experienced in my other stays at other Casinos, but be careful because some coupons work, and others don't, its all trial and error. 

Circus Circus is a great place to enjoy a fun filled day with the family, or just a great casino to stay in. This is by far the best smelling hotel on the strip, just an FYI haha

I would stay here again, and will be looking into booking Circus Circus for my future stays, (perhaps soon, since I will be back in Vegas in a couple of weeks).

This used to be the place to go when we were younger.  Enjoy fun games while the parents went ahead and gambled.  This place definitely fell off the train.  It looks completely run down on the outside, and the inside isn't all that better either.  Only good thing is that you can buy a wristband for the kids and they can spend hours in the Adventuredome.

Circus .......Circus.
A place for all age groups. Wait time is approx. 20 mins, they don't repeat the same again n again.. The perform different kinds of entertainment everytime.

We did not stay at the hotel but we came over for the cheap buffet and the Midway with circus acts. The Midway was a lot of fun! The kids had a blast playing some games and the prices aren't bad. We won a few stuffed animals and had a good time. I enjoyed watching the circus performers! ZUMA ZUMA, who we loved on America's Got Talent, were absolutely amazing at Circus Circus! They were lively, fresh, and very talented. LOVE these guys! The clown was pretty good for the children. They seemed to like him. Thanks for the afternoon of fun! We may come back again! Only drawback I saw was for the people checking in. It looked like a war zone! There were LOTS of people in line. Of course..it was just yesterday which was a Friday. That could explain why :-). I am glad I didn't have to wait in that line.

Beware of vaccuming going on in the room next door at 2 in the morning.  Then to top it off the desk manager, Evan Rose - asked us "what the problem with that was?"  Oh come on - it woke us up!  Why would you treat a guest like that?

Loud, dirty, unfriendly staff.

So sad because this kitschy hotel chain could really be something fun if they would get out of their own way.
Outstanding haunted house "hex" is my favorite.   There was a lot of security and I was glad to see them. Rides and a couple shows were included in admission.

where to start?.....to begin I'd rather stay at a motel 6 and have a better experience than this.  the room we received was NOT anywhere near or connected to the hotel itself.....of course this was the room i booked and was unaware of this new building.  they have a separate lot of motel style rooms ACROSS the street of the hotel where u sleep.  once u book the room u have to walk back to ur car and drive or walk to the room....travelers\/vacationers beware! the king size bed was so sunken that we layed a bottle of water on the bed and it rolled down to the middle. floors were wet, probably from cleaning, but wet nonetheless, a\/c didn't work, and the bathrooms are worst than bathrooms in the housing projects!  as for the casino and game place I didn't dare explore the once childhood fun hotel I use to visit.

I got conned into staying here once by my friend Tierney.  She lost all of her money gambling drunk and couldn't pay for her suite at the Cosmo.  I stayed here for one night and it was awful.  I felt like I was sleeping in an early 1920's tenement apartment in the Lower East Side of New York City.  The steaks were cheap and the kids were obnoxious.  Never again.

This review is for the business traveler who needs to be mindful of budget and when all else is sold out.  For me, this was just a place to sleep at night.  The rooms were clean, no frills but when you are here  for a trade show, how much time do you spend in your room anyways?  The bed was comfortable.  There is coffee in the room so no need to do the walk of shame downstairs in your pajamas or pay $20 for room service coffee if you need your caffeine boost right when you wake up. The entire staff is super nice and gracious.  

The clientele is definitely budget traveler and no one is hanging out at the bar to network with so if you want some sense of anonymity and can get past the crowd on the journey to your room, this place is not bad.  At $38\/night plus a $15\/day resort fee, my entire stay cost less than one night at a mainstream or chain off strip hotel.  The cab fare to the Sands\/Venetian\/Palazzo is about $10, which includes tip essentially increasing the cost of your stay by $20 per night...still cheaper than the other strip hotels.  It is about a mile walk, so if you want exercise bring your comfortable shoes.  I didn't check out any of the amenities so  I can't comment on that.  There is a clean and spacious next door which is convenient if you want a coffee or a quick meal.

My bestie and I went to Vegas for a weekend and stayed here.

If you're looking for luxury, this is not your hotel.

If your requirements are more along the lines of cheap, on the Strip, and has beds and a locking door, Circus Circus is for you.

We paid ~$30 a night-- you can't beat those prices! No complaints about the room whatsoever. We were worried beforehand that it would be too loud, but it wasn't at all.

The staff was great. Our room was far from the hotel check-in, but we parked our car by the front, so they delivered our luggage to the room for us! We forgot to hang up the "Do Not Disturb" sign, so housekeeping came by one day (around 11) when we were still in bed (super hungover) and we told them to come back later-- which they did, surprisingly.

Had a great time, totally served the needs of a couple of broke college students!
Good experience is good casino for kids.i travel to Las Vegas with my kids and they always want to stay there.

Circus Circus will always hold a special place in my heart because my family and I used to go a lot when I was young. My sisters and I would spend hours playing the midway games while our parents gambled. It was so much fun going home with bags full of stuffed animals.

The hotel could use a little remodeling though. These days it does seem out of place with all the new flashier hotels on the strip.

The motel we booked ended up being shitty. My Uber driver, who was an older Christian Vietnamese lady, did not feel comfortable leaving me there alone. I'm also pretty sure a prostitute was staying next door to us. So when the room did not look remotely similar to the pictures online, I insisted we bail. 

We booked a last minute hotel room at Circus circus manor, which was better but still a little dirty,and it was clear that housekeeping did a cursory job. After a wonderful dinner, we came home and hung out for a bit. My friends fell asleep at 2 am. I went to take a shower, and when I stepped out, the word HELP was written on the mirror. It was written clearly in capital letters: HELP. Not HELD. Not YELP. HELP. This is distressing for two reasons: 1) housekeeping did not really clean at all, and 2) HELP?! Help from what? Dirty bathrooms? Screaming children? Kidnappings? I went outside and said something along the lines of, "WHICH ONE OF YOU DICKHEADS WROTE HELP IN THE MIRROR?" One of my friends reminded me that I was the only one who used the shower,  commented, "That's creepy," and went back to sleep. 

I went over the possibilities: it could be a prank from the previous occupant, or because I was addled with wine and terror-obviously, ghosts. I had the following options. I could: 1) get dressed and stay out all night. But I didn't want to leave my friends, even though they abandoned me for slumberland. 2) We could move rooms, but it was way too late, and they were asleep. I also had no guarantee the other rooms would be cleaner or less creepy.  So I did the next logical thing anyone would do, which was to stay there, go online, and peruse Yelp reviews of Circus Circus for complaints about the paranormal.  

While I didn't find any complaints about ghosts, I did find reviews about cockroach and bedbug infestations, and because I wasn't having enough of a hard time, some of the reviews came with photos. I couldn't relax enough to sleep with these two competing nightmare scenarios in my head. Finally, at 5 am, I fell asleep with all the lights on. 

Out of morbid curiosity, when I was safely out of that hotel, I went online to see if anyone had complained about our room. Our room number was not specifically mentioned, but one of the websites reported this: ""Help Me" will occasionally materialize on bathroom mirrors as if drawn by unseen hands." While it may possibly be just a juvenile prank, one night was enough, and I have learned never to be a cheap ass with hotel stays in Las Vegas.

TL; DR
Do not stay at Circus Circus Manor. Possibly haunted, definitely dirty.

I just wanted to update this review to my most recent stay.Each time i book i always go for the Casino tower rooms as they are very nice, and I'd even go as far as to say nicer than any other rooms on property. I checked in & there was a small issue with the first room they gave me so I switched rooms- no problem....but they gave me an upgrade for my inconvenience to a mini suite! I thought that was very nice of them to do. The Mini suite was very spacious and I really liked the layout. The Air conditioning worked very well (I like sleeping in a cold room) and I once again have no complaints about the stay.
One of the reasons I like staying at Circus Circus because its a very comfortable, affordable option without giving up any regular Large strip hotel amenities......I would advise you to not book the Manor rooms if you can help it....I never booked those rooms and my stays have all been wonderful

First off let me start by saying do not stay here or eat here beware.
Upon arrival we went to check into our rooms and there was a slightly long line after waiting in line I approached the counter showed the desk clerk our confirmation number and she replied by saying she couldn't find it in until I had the right number I needed to go back into line so I went back got mine after sitting in line again for another 30 minutes I got a new desk clerk who said that confirmation number wasn't wrong and he wasn't sure what the problem was.
Once we got to our room our room smells if it hadn't been used in over numerous years there are pieces of trim missing in the bathroom and the room the hotel beds were as old as time itself when you laid on them you felt as if your feet were a foot higher than your head they were so worn out we asked to switch rooms and were told there were no of other rooms available.
 the
The following day we went to the Adventuredome with their children we paid for the passes they got their wristbands who were put on by employees of the Adventuredome the very first ride my children went to ride they were told and sent away by the employee running that ride they were told that they obviously had gotten the wristbands off of someone else and we're trying to use them which I approach the employee and said here's our receipts that my children did not get these from someone else and she told me if I was going to argue she was going to call security and have me removed from the premises. We went back to the the ticket booth and explain what had happened and they told us there was nothing that they could do. Some of the worst customer service as Circus Circus I've ever seen we have been here a few times before and had similar experiences but Las Vegas is turned from a family place to an adult's playground not much choice for children.

I love this hotel....  Rooms are big and clean, friendly staff , and a very affordable prices ... The neighborhood not so good but o well, public transportation outside of the casino. Overall a nice place to stay while u in vegas.

we stayed here this past weekend. the room was $30.... not bad but when you have to wait 15-20 min for an elevator, i'd rather pay triple. it was like this the entire weekend. nobody seemed to care. the casino wasn't the greatest around either. if you wanna be party time, go buy drinks from the bar. we learned this after sitting at the tables for 1 hour!! we flagged down waitresses and nobody knew who was in that section. it was ridiculous. there are plenty of other hotels around so try one of them!!

Good location if you have a car since it is at the end of the strip and don't have to deal with the traffic on the strip. Walking to the main attractions from circus circus is however quite far. The hotel room itself was quite old and our shower was leaking water 24\/7. Pool has free towels but only one of the 2 pools was opened and in the shades and lots of kids.

Let's just say save your money.  The rooms are dirty, it's over priced and the rooms aren't secured.  I've never stayed at a hotel that didn't have a room door with a latch lock for extra security.  The sink was stopped up,  the room smelled like smoke, they were humid and stuffy. I couldn't breath unless the air conditioner was on.  It made noise the entire time and needs to be upgraded.  The rooms look like an old Hotel 8 and needs plenty  of TLC.

We stayed here in 2012, unfortunately we had to go back home a day early but still had a lot of fun. We are going back this April, with our 2 boys. 
Can anyone tell me if you can actually walk to Tacos el gordo from here? Is it to far? Thx we didn't get to check that out last time!!

Only thing I have to say that's bad is that the kids games are expensive. You can play 20 bucks and almost come out empty handed. Other than that, the place was friendly and exciting.free shows here too

Came down to Vegas to meet up with my sons and just try to find a nice place to sleep.  This place is OK. But i will say the rooms at the manor part is ghetto to say the least.  Walls are pretty much paper thin.  Next room over were so loud that we heard all the profanity mixed with the animal sounds of drunkards in a bar it seemed to the point where my kids couldn't sleep til 7 in the morning!  I just don't get it.  Vegas is so dirty now.  With this experience at this hotel i think I'm not coming back ever.  The hotel has been a Wake up call for anyone who is looking for a good time without the hooliganism of a raunchy classless city...

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. It is far from the fun of the Las Vegas trip, is old looking and just an all-around bad hotel. 

My family and I stayed in the Casino towers which is in the main building and I was very unimpressed. The room was not fully cleaned when we first got there; there were little bits of trash in the bathroom\/closet area, as well as hairs in the sink. The beds were also not very soft and the sheets were kind of stiff. There were few electrical sockets to plug in our phone and other electronic charges-- we had to unplug the alarm clock and lamps in order to charge our things. The toilet in the bathroom is scary... when you flush it, it makes this majorly loud vacuum sucking sound and is pretty startling. 

I understand that this hotel is more of a kid-friendly option, but goodness there are a LOT of kids running around, bumping into you, unaccompanied. It was very annoying trying to get from one point of the hotel to the other with all the kids running around, and even adults who didn't seem to know how to walk and would just stop in the middle of the walkway. 

One thing that really stunk about this hotel is that it is so far away from all of the major tourist attractions on the strip. You pretty much have to take a taxi everywhere or buy a bus pass for the strip. It is at the very, very end of the strip and walking to any of the other hotels is pretty much out of the question, unless you are good with walking longer distances to places. 

We did not stay in the manor, so I can't really discuss that but one of the taxi drivers we used one day told us that the manor is definitely a place to avoid because of the criminal\/sketchy activity that goes on around there. We also did not eat in any of the restaurants, so can't really discuss that either.

The midway area was pretty cool, VERY crowded but neat. I didn't catch the circus acts, which was a bummer. The pool there that I saw seemed REALLY tiny. Not nearly big enough for all the people staying at the hotel. Plus, I was a little weary about how sanitary the pool\/pool area was considering the inside of the hotel was not great.

I recently went to Vegas for a week on a business trip and it did it's job, which was to provide a bed and shelter for the night. It was dirt cheap (although I did not choose the hotel in particular). 

The hotel room itself was not pretty, and honestly I would have probably preferred a place with a more decent room off the strip, but I can say that a huge bonus was that I got a fridge (upon request).

As for the hotel in itself, it was filled with children everywhere. The pool, all the restaurants, the hallways, etc. You could you hear babies crying at 5 in the morning (which does not bode well if you have to get up at 7, or if you're coming home drunk from partying all night). 

Another bonus was that I stayed at the Manor, which is actually across the street from the casino and the rest of the rooms, so it was easy to get to the car without the hassle of crawling through the entire child filled casino to do so. 

Great for the price.

No longer a bargain.  Annoying.  Internet ( not free since they allocate $5.00 per day in the "resort surcharge" of $15\/day) is so slow as worth a place in the museum of antiquities.   Food is mediocre and as expensive as in most other casinos.  Restaurant service was lousy.  You can find better bargains in Vegas.  Don't get fooled by their promos.  The best thing about it: The Riviera is just across the street.

I remember coming here as a child (early 90's) I use to have a BLAST! Now visiting over 25 years later as an adult, I'm glad this place is still open. I mean it isn't the BEST but for kids it's amazing! I was going to give it only 3 stars but I added 1 more star because they are still open and the only place for kids. 

Whenever anyone ask me "I'm visiting Las Vegas, where do I take my kids" I always answer Circus Circus. The midway upstairs is always fun for kids. I always enjoy spending time with my God kids trying to win prizes. Here's a secret tip (Next to the Mcdonlads is a office, bring your hundred dollar bills their and change it for smaller bills from the machine and they will give you a couple of buy one get one coupons) Trust me, you'll need anything to save money lol 

They also have the adventure dome wish is pretty cool. It's a good size amusement park. The BEST part of it as an adult is..... It's indoors! You don't have to deal with the weather. Kids love it. I recommend you buying the unlimited wristband for untimed rides. Your kids will LOVE YOU for it :)

They do have a couple good places to eat in here but they could use more. 

I stayed here a couple of times and that's why I didn't give them 5 stars. The rooms are very old, they need to be upgraded. Bed sheets are old and smell very yucky.

I have never stayed here but I like coming to bring my nieces and nephews!  -1 star because it needs major renovations! This is the only kid friendly hotel (aside from Excalibur) & smoking should be band!!!! It smells so bad in here. . . . Anyway, I love adventuredome & the arcade. You can spend a few dollars per stuff animal but its worth it to see the kids happy. They have a free show every 45min so make sure you look at the times so that you can sit 30 min before the show to get good seats!. . . Feel like a kid again in here ;) . . .

I used to like this hotel before, because of the kids. We used to have no problem and everything was ok until our last stay. When I got to the room a soon as I open the door the first thing I saw was the beds were not made the bathroom was a mess towels all over the place trash everywhere. The room was not clean ready for new guests. I grabbed the phone and I called guest services and I told them the situation, they said they would send someone up to clean right away. 10 min passed and no one showed up. So I called again they said the same thing. I waited 20 minutes this time my brother came to the room and he called again and they told him there was no record of someone calling to request the room cleaning, so they told my brother the same thing they would send someone up right away. I was starting to get upset because we had the kids and they were tired and hungry. We waited almost an hour so they come up we grabbed all our stuff an put them in the other room and we left. When we came back the room was clean but they didn't change the bedding no clean sheets. I really like this hotel because of the kids but I'm sorry to say that we are not going to be staying there anymore.. We had an awful experience. Thats why I'm giving it on star.

Stayed here with my family for 3 nights.  We mostly stayed here for the kids, to be close to the games and Adventuredome.  Location isn't bad, not too far from the more popular areas of the Strip.

Check-in was quick, staff is friendly, especially the housekeeping staff.  Staff at the Midway were also very friendly and patient.  Room and bathroom were clean, no coffee maker.  We had a leak in our ceiling which was addressed and fixed by engineering quickly.   Only other issue was the bathtub drains slowly.

Parking lot can be very busy, especially during the weekend.  Resort fee does not justify the price.  If you're looking for a low-cost option this place will do.

Who doesn't love a circus?
Me, that's who.
Tons of kids EVERYWHERE. 
Clowns scare me. 
No enough booze to make up for these 2 factors.
The room I saw was decent. Not super run down like others have said. It was in the newer tower so that may be why. The location is at the very north end of the strip, not very convenient to anything. 
The bus stops out front if that's your mode of transportation.

The check-in rep was very friendly,  the room was ez access to the elevators and lobby, I like the variety of things to do in the hotel. Perfect place for kids. Now 2 things I didn't like that is the cause of not having 5 stars.... Circus Circus need some serious maintenance work done, update the paint. Those colors are old, plain, and dead. Bright up the place, make it look more exciting, and the other issue is the smell where the casino, arcade, and circus performers are located, it smell like someone left the bathroom door open and all the funk is coming out, NASTY SMELL... But other than that the hotel is very nice.

Finally stepped into the world (in)famous Circus Circus. For years, my husband and I have been so curious about this place. After grabbing some grub up the street in downtown Vegas, we decided to venture here. Whew! Where to begin? The parking deck is so gross! I mean seriously. They can invest some extra time cleaning it up. Elevator is too tiny. Better off taking the stairs. Interior can use some upgrading. If it wasn't for Adventuredome, this place would be a complete dump. That's the best part of this mediocre hotel.

After deciding to stay an extra day Vegas we looked for the cheapest hotel deal and Circus Circus is always our go to. Check in was quick and easy and the front desk guy even gave me 3 carnation flowers for my anniversary which was nice. We stayed in the remodeled section and it was nice to not have to wait 15 minutes for the elevator. Our room was on the 5th floor and very clean and nice. Lots of restaurants, bars and shopping to choose from on the casino floor. Staff was very nice and helped us when we needed. Only complaint I had was the fact that the shower took about ten minutes to finally heat up and I kept hearing weird noises throughout the night. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Ugh, this place.  So ugly and so prominent.  

Even in this town of overly-aggressive timeshare salespeople, this place is really obnoxious.  We actually exited through the employee's entrance and got lost in the trailer park behind this place and STILL agreed that it was better than leaving through the main doors.  Peeps, if we already own a timeshare, we ain't buying one of yours.  And your shows are lame, mmkay?

The dining upstairs is sort-of okay.  But that's a different review because I'm determined to give this place its default star.  Effing clowns.

Oh, if you're one of those folks who's hanging on to nostalgia for this joint, hurry up and get it out of layaway.  According to that one lady selling me tickets to KA, this place is closing for good in a year.

You have to slice the desperation in the Circus Circus casino with a knife. The atmosphere is so depressing, as other Yelpers have pointed out. We tried livening up the mood by watching an acrobatics show on the Midway stage, playing a game of DDR in the Midway arcade, and even trading $2 for three stuffed chickens to launch into pots on a rotating surface. But Circus Circus is still a run down version of its former glory-day self.

They were friendly enough when checking us in: gave us a map of the hotel and told us where the RTC vending machine is (in front of Slots of Fun and only takes exact change). What they didn't tell us was that no matter what, we would be charged a "mandatory" fee for unlimited local calling service each night we stayed there. They only bothered to tell us when we were checking out and stunned us with surprise credit card charge. I'm not sure if all Vegas hotels do that, but in principle, it just doesn't seem right even though it's only a dollar a night.

The walls seemed pretty thin: on two of the four nights, we were woken up by loud neighbors or just rowdy people in the hall. Housekeeping service oddly came in the mid- to late-afternoon AFTER people could start checking in. On the third day, our "do not disturb" sign went missing, so it was annoying when housekeeping keep coming by when we were taking an afternoon nap.

The primary reason why we stayed here was because we were in Vegas for a friend's wedding, and she was staying at the Wynn and holding her ceremony there. So we were close by, but that was pretty much the only benefit to staying at Circus Circus.

The verdict: It's cheap, but this is definitely an example of "you get what you pay for." Maybe even less.

This is truly family friendly casino. If you are wanting a pampered, elegant, classy experience...DON'T go here even though it's one of the cheapest as far as room rates...you want a truly relaxing and grown-up experience, go to the Venetian. Don't get me wrong...my 35yr old butt hung right on in there with my 14 yr old daughter riding the rides and playing the carnival style games and had fun doing it. You have circus performances going on from 11 am to midnight that you can actually watch while playing the slot machines. The restaurants are ok...I haven't had a meal yet that had my eyes rolling back in my head yet, and I never found a good cup of coffee...(there's a Starbucks but I don't like their coffee) I would advise you to skip the breakfast buffet unless you get there early...eveything is dry and lifeless after the first hour. The rooms are nice clean and not smelly I just wish they had a heavier blanket on the bed. Our bath was clean but the shower head sucked, good pressure but not so good water stream. Another couple we spoke to in the elevator leaving did not have a good experience and said their bathroom was filthy. They said they would never return and recommended the SLS
#RoadtripUSA

This is by far the worst hotel I've ever come across. The company I work for booked it due to the good deal and I took a chance. This place is short staffed (three people checking in an entire line) extremely unorganized (the elevators were a mess and employees arguing infront of me due to their confusion with the lines) place smelled like old cigarettes and cheap air freshener. The carpet was absolutely filthy. The biggest BIGGEST issue was the amount of staff vs the people checking in. It's 11pm at night on a weekday, I forgot my hotel key at a clients house and I have been waiting in line for 45min. 3 people are helping the line at an average speed of one client per 10min. This is ridiculous, unprofessional and by far the worst hotel on the strip. I should have stayed at a motel 6 at this point.

Every time I visit Las Vegas, I stay at Circus, Circus! The rooms are cheap and clean, the circus acts are free and it's on the strip. I love the buffet and the old court jester decor, the Adventure Dome is a lot of fun, even as an adult. I haven't gone back in a few years but maybe this year I'll visit for Halloween, when they unleash "Fright Dome".

This place used to be one of the most top hotels in Las Vegas , now it's at same level of motel 6 , first this has become one of the hotels where only thing u see is Latino people with average 5-6 kids families all lost bumping into each other  ( not racist just pointing what I saw ) so to accommodate this people they have lower the standards , at first I though I was going to stay at the main building , I was wrong , they send me to some weird buildings call the manor located near the service entrance , area is dirty ... Then as I enter the building u can get that stink of weird smell , carpets dirty ... Then in room u give the ok but tv is from the 80s bulk ones , carpet not that clean , then try to turn ac and thing doesn't work , they sent technician but fix it half way as air will be one for 3 min then turn of for 20 min ..... And the most weird thing is they put the coffe maker inside the bathroom , I can't picture myself making coffe while taking a crap .....so disappointed hope this helps others to stay away from this place

We recently went to Circus Circus, and it was HORRIBLE. 

First of all, the room we got was in the Manors, and they smell heavily of chemicals. So we get to our to, right? The bathroom is small, and let me mention it's inside the closet. The floors were very stained, the wall looked about ready to be torn down. TV sucked completely. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention WE FOUND DIRTY UNDERWEAR BEHIND THE DOOR. It was truly vile.

Second thing was that the casino smelled of stale smoke from the cigarettes; I honestly thought I was going to get lung cancer the day we stayed here.

Third off was the circus acts. When we used to stay here, there was a compete show, not just 5 damn minutes of it! It wasn't worth the trouble of trying to find a spot to watch.

The only reason I gave this 2 stars was because Dawn, our receptionist, and Maria, the waitress in the buffet, were very nice and accommodating. Otherwise, this would have gotten one star. Never coming back here again.

I got a wonderful deal booking my hotel and flight with Orbitz! When booking my flight with Orbitz I received $50 " Orbucks " for free to put towards my room \/ car. I used them to book room at Circus Circus and ending up paying $42 for 2 nights! Great deal - can't get much better than that. The room was nicer than expected. Good hotel to go if you are looking to stay on the strip for cheap!!

Stayed here for a week while on vacation in Vegas. Room is behind the strip. But is walking distant. The hotels clearly makes a nice penny they have no reason why they rooms shouldn't be updated. Our bathroom toilet was stoped up twice during our stay and wasn't fixed until the 4th day we were there. We called the front desk to complain they said they were short staff so it would be a while but promised it'll get done. I guess it was much important improvements on the list. They're a cheap hotel so I guess you get what you pay for.

My retinas are still burning from the time I drove to Vegas with a co-worker for a conference, arrived at 6 a.m. and went in to the coffee shop
at Circus Circus for a bite. This place had apparently been decorated by
a graduate of the "3 Stooges School of Interior Decoration. "
It's SHOCKING PINK!! and BRIGHT RED!! color scheme was like a poke
in the eyes, while it's nauseating merry-go-round theme was like a 
double slap in the face, Nyuck, nyuck,nyuck. Larry, Moe and Curly would
be proud.
When we eventually checked into our room, you guessed it, freakin' clowns everywhere. It also reeked of cigarette smoke,even though it was supposed to be a smoke-free room. Great... 
That was the last time I ever let someone else make travel arrangements
for me and the last time I ever stayed at this dump. It gets one star
for being super-cheap ( our hotel bill was $ 12.50 a night per person)
but that is pretty much it's only redeeming quality.

We went to Vegas to visit family, and decided Circus Circus would be a good choice for young children. Wow, was I wrong! When we first arrived, we found that the TV wasn't working. It took two calls over the course of an hour to get someone to finally come up. She brought 3 spare remotes and none of them worked, so she said she'd put in for an "engineer" to come check it out. That never happened, and we never had TV during our 2-day stay. The attached Adventuredome was also horrible, but that's another story. Although I did not fault the hotel for the noisy kids next door screaming until 11pm and starting up again at 6am, I'm mentioning it here so Yelpers take it into consideration as well when choosing where to stay.

It was a decent hotel. Made with families in mind. We stayed in the Manor area of the hotel which needs updating. Beds were comfortable and not a bed bug in sight. Midway was by far fun and adventuredome was equally fun. Nice location at the end of the strip. BEWARE their buffet made myself and my party sick.
Disappointed by their 10 minute circus show. It took 5 minutes and it left us with a nasty cigarette smell on our clothes. It was the worst! Other places is not so strong.

It's an OK place..
The buffet wasn't all that great
The steak place across from the buffet is delicious.
Our room had a two inch space under the entrance door where we could hear all the noise in the hallway.

Good:
1: Huge! You can spend hours exploring!
2: Most fun casino on the strip for kids!
3: Lots of games!
4: Fast valet.

Bad:
1: Long distances between various parts of the casino.
2: Many restaurants are closed during weekdays apparently.
3: Part of MGM but not part of Mlife.

The first casino that I entered when I was a kid. I remember the parking lot challenge where cars play musical chairs. I remember the water coaster as I went down and my balls started to hurt. I remember my dad getting prizes. I remember looking at all the slot machines and being pushed out of them by the security guards. I remember the go-karts as I smashed it against all the people. I remember seeing the circus show which was 4 minutes long. Yes all these things made me check in the hotel with my girlfriend in our first road trip escapades. At $24 after New Years in a comfy room, this place gets all the marbles. Oh and did I mention its a casino for everyone except all the snotty people?

This experience has been horrible! Do not stay here. First of all it is very far from the nice casinos, at the end of the strip, the place is crowded and very dirty, disturbing! The room was not nice at all, the receptionist claimed she was giving me the nicest room, on the casino tower. I checked in and the lady told me the hotel was sold out, she said my room I requested was not available, so she upgrade me to a nicest room. I don't understand how my room was not available if i paid for it online... Anyway, i had no idea this was a very bad hotel, i paid 140 and it seems to be there is better hotels out there for the same prices. DO NOT STAY HERE you will regret it! One more thing, i uploaded pics so you can see how dirty it is, dirty floors and very lots of rude people, the security guy went off on me because i did a wrong turn, i was shocked!

OK...I PROMISE YOU, THIS REVIEW WILL NOT LET YOU DOWN. I consider myself to be an EXPERT when it comes to staying and playing at Circus Circus. Why so? My parents first drug me there in 1994 when I was in the 4th grade and the strip looked WAY different than it does now. I am now 28 and have gone to Vegas probably over 20 times and every time we stay a few days at Circus Circus. I consider this place THE BEST deal and experience on the strip, no matter your age. LET ME BREAK IT DOWN:


STAYING: CC has different room options to fit your budget. When we first started going there we would stay at the "motel-like" manor rooms, located OUTSIDE of the main building. The rooms are the least expensive and were clean and cozy. It has been many years since I have stayed in the manor rooms though. From my understanding they have not been remodeled like the newer rooms and towers. We have also stayed in the Skyrise Tower. These rooms are also very clean and nice, but I do not have believe they have been update yet. When we stay there, we always stay in either the West tower or Casino\/Main tower. These two towers have very nice, updated rooms. This past time we stayed in the Main tower. The AC was freezing cold, rooms smelled fresh, clean carpets, PERFECT and COZY. No complaints. 

PLAYING: I was just at Circus Circus over Labor Day weekend. We were there for 4 days. My mom won $5,000....ON SLOT MACHINES while there...that should say something. Not only are the slots loose, but the table games usually have $5 minimums. The cocktail waitresses come by frequently because the hotel is smaller than mega resorts, and the dealers have been working there for much longer and usually have very interesting stories to share. This is one of the only places I know of that has a small section of slot machines that still uses COINS!! It is so cool to hear the clank of the dollar coins when you win :) GREAT PLAYING EXPERIENCE EVERY TIME WE VISIT!

CHILDREN\/ARCADE\/ADVENTURE DOME: WARNING...WARNING...WARNING...During the day you will see children...sometimes LOTS of children. It can get annoying, not going to lie. HOWEVER, this shouldn't bother you too much for the following two reasons:
1. If you have a family, then this is the place to BRING your children. You should be THANKFUL to CC as it is a very kid-friendly place. The adventure dome has thrill rides and lots of games. The arcade has video games, arcade games, and carnival games, and LOTS of cool prizes to be won. 2. If you DO NOT HAVE KIDS OR ARE NOT TRAVELING WITH KIDS, then you should be LIVING IT UP and partying and playing at night (while the kids are no longer walking around) and sleeping in during the day (when the kids are roaming around down stairs in the hotel. Therefore, you will likely avoid the mobs of kids that walk around during the day. NOTE: the summer months are particularly bad (lots of families with kids) any other time, it's actually pretty cleared out.

DINING: CC has several yummy eateries. Though I have never been to their steakhouse, my parents have, and they say it is DELICIOUS. I do know that it has won "best in Vegas" for like a crazy number of years in a row. There is also lots of casual dining like McDonalds, Pizza, Krispy Kreme (aka donut heaven), and Rock n Ritas. My personal favorite place to eat the West Side Deli. This place is 24 hours and has AMAZING sandwiches (the hot pastrami is my favorite) as well as YUMMY chicken noodle soup and a strawberry shortcake that cannot be beat. 

LOCATION: Yes, CC is located in an area that is now a little more desolate than it once was. However, the Riviera and Slots of Fun are both a walk away AND both locations offer inexpensive table games :) ALSO, you can get to other hotels quickly. The Duece bus pick up is RIGHT OUT FRONT of Slots of Fun. You can take that bus anywhere you want to go up and down the strip and downtown. Other hotels, you usually have to do some far walking to catch the bus stop. 

POOL: Circus Circus has three pools. It has been a while since I have been, but here is what I can tell you. It is certainly going to be crowded during the summer months...but that's ANY pool in Vegas. Here is a secret...TRY TO GET INTO THE POOL FOR THE CAMPING GUESTS. Circus Circus is one of the only, IF NOT THE ONLY, property on the strip that lets you park your RV at the Las Vegas KOA location at Circus Circus. There is a pool for the camping guests, but it is very close to the main pool. The pool there is LARGER and LESS CROWDED. 

OTHER\/GENERAL STUFF\/TIPS: There are TWO valet areas. One up front, one in the back. If one is full, check the other. Circus Circus has improved with time. Some people think that it is old\/outdated, but NO, I do not believe it is at all. In fact, I can say that I am impressed with their attempts to stay fresh and modern. I do wish they had wider walk ways, but that would be my only suggestion. Make sure to join the players club to earn awesome food\/room comps while there. ENJOY!

I would never stay here even if it's the cheapest around. I like coming in here for the games only. If you're good, you win cute plush dolls and other prizes. My siblings and I took my parents here and they had a blast! Great for all ages!

We stayed across the street on the 2nd floor, since I don't like elevators that was ok for me.
It was a little small for the price. The check in was about a 10 min wait. We went to a show at Excalibur but there was plenty of parking out side of the room.

I give 4 stars bc I paid $37 total. The room was clean and my check out didn't take long. I wouldn't stay here if I was in Vegas for vacation with friends but for spending one night for an early flight it was suitable

By far the shittiest hotel I've ever stayed in clearly I didn't read these reviews honestly wish I would have considering I've stayed in Vegas 4x before I wanted to make this time fun & exciting so for not researching this property or its crappy location I am forever regretting it. 

1st we got an amazing deal (not really hindsight) $135 for 2 nights at "motor lodge" which is pretty much a Travelodge \/  best western style motel hiding under the "circus circus" name very disappointing. 

2nd one of these informative reviews had it down packed you check in then have to walk across the street to your damn there trailer-park \/ RV  lot smells horrible looks run down & the rooms are beyond out dated I wouldn't recommend this motel to my worse enemy 

3rd like someone mentioned NO ONE HELPS you to your room you walk across that side street into your motel room past a half way decent swimming pool and pass 2-3 buildings we were in building C on the 3rd floor 

4th the place is just point blank run down the fitness center (not saying anyone works out on vacation in Vegas) looks like something out of a bad 80s movie.

Save your time & money & stay at the west gate or maybe even something off the strip considering this is 3 miles away from the strip

Circus Circus is a shit hole. I stayed here 10 years ago and said "Never Again". The memory faded over a decade and while I was told a client would comp me a room elsewhere, at the last minute this was the only one available. 

I figured, fine, I just need a place to sleep and shower between the show and evening meetings and events, but the amenities here leave too much to be desired. 

The neighborhood at night is a cross between The Warriors and The Walking Dead. I travel well-armed and aware but I am putting that out there for those that might not

Maybe I am prejudiced because my credit card was fleeced here years ago but the staff, employees and businesses here come across as seedy and scummy like they are out to rip you off at any chance

The $29 a night rate may tempt you but you will spend more cabbing it to and from the real casinos if you make the mistake I did

It might be a fun place for the kiddies but the ripoff carney vibe permeates every inch of the suck here

Avoid it like the plague it is

You've been warned
Margaritas at the sports bar for happy hour are 2 for 1 from 11am to 7pm. Good drinks and great bartenders

Our stay was ok this time around, our ice machine wasn't working for 2 nights (It's supposed to be one of the amenities), called it in to complain about it, never got a follow up on the problem being fixed, the front desk was useless, custom service is terrible here, but they will damn sure hit you with $22.40 per day in RESORT FEE!

My son graduated from elementary school on 8\/3\/2010. As a gift for his graduation, I booked a two night stay at Circus Circus. Let's just say that the price was just right considering we barely stayed in the room. For starters, the two night stay cost me $58.50 from Hotels.com. And I got charged for the hotel fees when we checked in of $14.99. Shortly after, we were told that we would be staying in the Manor Bldgs across the street where the pools were. That was fine because we walked across the street, dropped our stuff off, then went to the pool so that my son could go swimming. He had a blast. He was swimming and having a good time with the kids in the pool. Shortly after that, our cousin and his girl showed up and we went to dinner. We attempted to go the buffet to eat.... YEAH Right... It was over crowded. So we ate at the Mexitalia X-Press since one of the cooks recommended it and led us in the direction where he worked. HE even said that the buffet was not that good. After we ate, the we went to the Adventure Dome and had a blast.

I was charged a $112  "Resort fee" for what?
A business center that I didn't use?
I was in town for a convention so never used any amenities other than my hotel bed.

I called to dispute and they will not refund.

AVOID this hotel!
Came here as a kid over 20 years ago in 1996. I am only writing my experience from back then but it seemed like an awesome hotel! Great prices too!

I loved my stay at this casino, it was very kid friendly with the adventuredome and we loved the new water slide and water park area. The rooms were clean and we had no complaints there. I wish the buffet would be up to par with the hotel. But we did enjoy our stay there.

Ehhhh idk why ppl complain about this hotel. Duhhh its so cheap!!! What do u expect??? I booked a room here on the skyrise tower or whatever idk its near the adventure area where their rides for kids. It was decent i didnt expect it to be mgm style or whatever. Got the room for 50$ so ya 

Anyways this place didnt let u check in until 2 pm or so but we got here at 8am and they asked us to pay $20 to check in at 9am then we agreed but there wasnt any room.  So they waive the fee and got us a room at 11am.

This hotel is great for kids, usually i stay at mgm or treasure island, or planet hollywood however i took my bro so it was good for him. & this is where i stays when i was a kid myself! ^^

And for some reason they force me to buy a coupon book for $10 !!! R u serious? Arent coupon free? Lol they say bc it was required to buy so whatever

I stayed here on a Saturday night with my 5 year old son. This is the second worst hotel I have stayed in, it was down right dirty. The entire hotel stank horrible. I regret staying at the first place I came to.

The pool was decent but super packed.

The line to check in, even though I made a reservation over the phone, was 30 minutes long.

Checking out even had a line at 8:30am...

I'll read reviews before I stay next time!

My first time booking a hotel in Vegas and it was a great experience. The staff was nice and hotel was clean.  Our room was as spacious and clean too. The only minus was the public restroom was a little dirty but other than that I would go back.

It wasn't great but not completely terrible. We stayed in the Tower which was a bit of a walk to the main hotel\/casino\/front desk but right next to parking which was fine. Room was clean. Bathroom had black mold growing in the caulking in the tub which was gross. The bed consisted of a mattress pad, flat sheet tucked under the mattress, another flat sheet, blanket, and yet another flat sheet. Feather pillows. We were in a room that had not been remodeled yet so it had a big tube tv. Wi-Fi is a joke. It takes about 5 minutes to load one page so even being free it was faster to use the internet on my phone.  AC and heater unit in the room worked nicely though the heater had a bit of a stench when we turned it on like it had not been run in a while.  We did not have houskeeping come in (stayed saturday and sunday night) so I can't comment on that aspect. Adventuredome is crowded and noisy. The circus tent has various acts (trapeze is the one we saw) and all the games you would expect to see at a carnival that charge you and you never win. You get what you pay for, it is a low cost alternative to stay on the strip but if you have more money to spend I would probably stay elsewhere next time.

Ok, it gets three stars. Last year, two. What's changed? The smell of smoke is getting further and further away.

We stayed in the West Tower. Avoid Manor court unless you're budget bound. In January, the pool is closed. Fuggetaboutit.

There are small improvements. Food is just a bit better, like coffee. The shops aren't mindless tchotchke stores, although they get there.

Then there are the time-share buzzards that troll the lobby, dressed like they were hotel staff. They chat you up like a Turkish rug salesperson, offering free tickets, but it's all about selling time-shares. These trolls seemed to be sanctioned by the hotel, which dropped the entire rating from a four to a three-star. 

Add in the Resort Fee, which ought to be illegal, and the price of Circus Circus gets less and less attractive. Maybe I should go back to a two-star. Nah. The rest of the staff was pretty helpful.
Casino was ok, but the hotel portion wasn't up to par. The sink wasnt draining properly nor was the tub. I won't be back

Nice and clean room with comfy king bed in casino tower. Family and low income crowd. Buffet restaurant is worth the price for the brunch (18.99 plus tax and tips). Lots of choices and gluten free options. Pool was too crowded with families, I decided not to go. Beware the resort fees that often more than double the nightly rate (this is not specific to this hotel, though). A 20 Minutes walk from the actual hot strip area (mirage, bellagio, etc.)

So, we booked this hotel because I was able to get a few comps through my mlife membership. We chose CC since we were dragging along our 4yo with us this trip and wanted to have some convenient things for her and us to do together. After reading a lot of the reviews I felt that I made probably one of the worst decisions of my adult life and that our daughter would suffer some psychological damage later in life, but....low and behold.....things we're alright. Yes it's older and rundown in comparison to the strip hotels, obviously. You can tell they are upgrading things slowly but surely and I was actually put at ease upon entering. I hate cigarette smoke, but know it's unavoidable in Vegas but the ventilation throughout the hotel seemed good. Check in was the worst experience for us.
