Took about an hour on a Friday night\/Saturday morning about 12:30am, would have thunk so many people stay here and check in that late. 
I can't remember the tower we stood in but apparently it was the remodeled tower and we were definitely surprised about that comfort and quality of the room. The beds were super comfy and the room was pretty dang spacious. I was expecting the worst and was very pleased. Take it, we usually stay at the Vdara so this was definitely a "culture shock" of sorts expectation wise but at the same time, we're not picky people. The restroom was nice and roomy and good mirror space and lighting. The AC worked like a charm and every stinkin' hotel employee we had contact with was very nice and helpful, and not in that...I work at a 4\/5 star hotel so I have to treat you nice, way. It was genuinely nice, especially the house keepers. 
We had booked 2 nights and I had actually booked them separately since we weren't sure how long of a trip it was going to be so they were going to swap us rooms for the second night, I called the front desk and asked them if there was any way we could stay in the current room so we wouldn't have to pack up and unpack again and after about 10 minutes they made it happen without a fuss. Customer service was definitely on point. 
As for the weird "gift shops" and time share people, we never encountered any of them and the shop people done fuss either.

On family vacation with the family and we brought our 7 year daughter to the adventure dome for a night of fun.  It took her a moment to get warmed up to the rides, but once she hot used to it she was all over the place and had a ball, her word's "this is the best night if my life".

Review is for one person staying one weekend in West side tower.
Hygiene: room was clean with clean bed, fresh towels, and no surprises. Housekeeping was decent and responsive if needed.
The elevators and the lobby and check in smell musty, like old shoes. Not a pleasant smell.
Construction: building is old and taps leak, faucets are loose. Parking lot is not patrolled but parking is free. Beds and furniture not latest but decent.
Buffet: only visited the buffet and very expensive, no point in paying that much. But all around the strip buffets are jacked up.

Overall: decent for one person, stay in west tower and check up on your car. Very noisy below in casino and VERY crowded. Central location.

We came here because I couldn't afford much else. Unless you are dialed in, in Vegas you get what you pay for. The place smelled from the get go - but at least the hotel crew were nice. The room was clean but oldish. Not my favorite experience. 

My wife lost here cel charger in the ice dispenser. DONT DO THAT! Apparently it happens more than you'd think. It took nearly an hour to get someone to open it up and get it out. Time wasted waiting for help.

WiFI included but spotty.

We ate breakfast at the Vince Neil restaurant. The food was ok, portions were small. Go eat at Ellis Island Brewery it's great and cheap. The food vouchers they give you are pretty much useless. They take overpriced food and make it less expensive. We didn't end up using them.

I really wish Circus Curcus could get their crap together. The whole place is overpriced for what it is and they won't be able to rely on $3 ring toss games to restore their image.

This review covers Blackjack at Circus Circus.

This is one of the only casinos in Las Vegas to offer $3 blackjack. And with $3 are decent rules (by today's standards anyway). It's 6 decks, double after split, dealer hits soft 17, no late surrender, and split aces receive one card. They have a $5 double deck game as well pitch (so cards are dealt face down). They also have a "party pit" which has lights and loud music. The way the party pit works is if you get a blackjack while the lights are on, you get 2-1, instead of the 3-2 payout for blackjack. The thing is, you must be betting $10 a hand. 

The $3 tables are often full, but it won't take long to find a seat. There has only been 1 table on my visits, but plenty of $5 tables for blackjack. 

One word of advice is to sign up for the promotional chips offer. You give them $30, and they will give you $45 promotional chips for table games (blackjack, roulette). You play the promotional chips until you loose them. It's basically an extra $15 of the casino's money to play with. They also give you win cards with the chips which advise you on how to play the game (for example, in blackjack, if i have a 16 and the dealer is showing a 5, what do i do?). One thing to note is that some of my table mates were a bit offed that you "have" to loose the chips. It's gambling for a reason. No one ever wins every single hand. If you win, you get real chips, and you stack those up. Play the promotional chips until you are out. You can repeat this offer every 6 months. 

The nostalgia of Circus Circus is awesome. Not only was it a place for my childhood, but now, my blackjack needs as well.

This is only for the Midway Arcade area.  I think this is the only place that has games for kids therefore it gets very crowded.  But many of the games give out bigger better prizes if there are more players.  (so it's a good thing that it's busy)  You know when a show is going to start soon because multiple player games would be nearly empty.  

They've increased the price of some of the games from $1 to $2.  I just wish they have a better ventilation system because of smokers.

2 stars at most. No free Wi-Fi.  Although I was told there's a free in room WiFi but the signal is so weak and not connect able. The swimming pool is closed due to the cold season when the weather is 80 and sunny.  The swimming pool in all other hotels are open. Buffet in the hotel provides only breakfast during the lunch time. Literally no show in the hotel. Rooms are dirty and old.

I stayed at Circus Circus about two-three summers ago with my family. The rooms were clean, and housekeeping was efficient. The most important thing is...the beds did not feel STD infested, were comfy, and the bathrooms had showers with constant pressure and temperature. So Circus Circus already trumps Tropicana in that regards. Circus Circus is also dirt cheap for a strip Casino to stay at. However, what Circus Circus does lack is a good strip location. It is a pain in the ass to get anywhere central strip from Circus Circus.
   the only thing close by to Circus Circus is Slots of Fun and Peppermill. Peppermill Sucks, and Slots of Fun..well its okay..but honestly i don't come to Vegas to gamble at cheap shit places...if that's the case I might as well gamble at the casinos where I live and save the airfare. The buffet at Circus Circus is so, so...and the little kiddie place..well it's okay, I miss the arcade games they used to have...but i think that's when i was a kid.
  What kicks ass at Circus Circus is the steakhouse there... http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/bSY97kgQpJ5BrpgW40V1qg#hrid:Mec4tf5edLjEn_uClhQzYg\/query:circus%20circus%20steakhouse  Unless you've been there, you don't know how awesome it is...and I'm talking PRIME steak up there with all other topnotch Prime steak joints (Ruth's Chris, Smith & Wollensky's etc.).  The gaming at Circus Circus is cheap(er), and honestly...the kid situation and them running everywhere isn't as bad as people say it is. I had an okay time at Circus Circus. I think it's a great deal, but I'd rather pay the extra $$ for the night for a nicer casino a little more central strip, but that's just me. It's a perfectly good option for those who want to save money and\/or have families.
   Get off your high horse...Circus Circus isn't going anywhere.
~G

This hotel was disgusting.  They put us in the "motel" next to the casino and it was my worst experience in a hotel ever.  The shower went cold, there were bugs in the room, there were holes in the sheets, and it smelled. Bad.  Of course, complaining didn't help.  We even filed a claim for the bugs and they had their own housekeeping department inspect and determine that there were "no bugs" even though I pointed out spiders to the security officer.  Hmm, could their housekeeping department be biased?  Just a disgusting waste of money for poor quality and even worse customer service.  Stay somewhere else.  Anywhere else.

I just got back from my very first trip to Vegas and I am very disappointed in this hotel. I will start off with the very few things about the hotel which were tolerable. 

1) Our room was spacious and clean. We stayed in the Skyrise Tower. The beds were relatively comfortable. The bedding was clean and the bathrooms were huge.

The Barista cafe on the second floor has delicious breakfast sandwiches and Iced coffee. Too bad they close at 3pm?????? 

Oh and there is a 24-hour Crispy Creme.

Now the bad, and there was a lot of bad. 

While checking in with a attendant named "Lulu" we were told that if we wanted a late check out it would cost $20 to check out as late as 6pm, but we would have to wait until the day we were checking out to tell them that we wanted a late check out. So Sunday when we called to get a late check out all of a sudden it is now $40 for a late check out. With no explanation about the difference or honoring the word of "Lulu" at the front desk. So we had bell service hold our bags for us for just a tip. 

Getting to the hotel rooms in the Skyrise tower is a nightmare! After walking all the way through the casino you have to take two separate elevators and walk through the waves of screaming children at the adventure dome to wait in line for 10 minutes for an elevator to get to your room. The ceilings in the hallways and the rooms are barely 7ft. My husband is 6'10" and had to duck around the light fixtures and fire sprinklers. Getting to your room is at least a 15 minute ordeal that will make you want to never have children!


Food:
Rockin Ritas, the "hip" place to eat in the Circus Circus has the worst customer service I have ever experienced. The waitress acted upset to even have to wait us, she took two out of four of our drink orders and left to help another table. My husband and I shared a plate of nachos and the chicken smelled bad and was almost  a powdery consistency, and the cheese on top was not even melted. So we decided not to eat them and the waitress was very rude to us when we told her what was wrong with them.  
The  Blue Iguana refused to give my husband a cup for water without buying a $3.49 soda. He ordered a taco salad for $7.99 that the bowl was so oily is was soggy and the lettuce was so warm it tasted like it just came out of the microwave. 

The Children:
This hotel would be a hay-day for child protective services. I understand that it is Circus Circus and is one of the only child friendly hotels on the strip but while walking around the casino at 2am hoping that you would get a break from all of the children running around and actually try to enjoy the casino. You walk by groups of children sleeping in the cafes and on hard plastic chairs close to the slots while their parents are gambling. It makes it hard to enjoy yourself when you feel so bad for the little kids. 
During the day you cannot walk through the walk ways without tripping over little kids that are not being watched, or huge double strollers that parents are barreling down the walk ways with. You have to have a lot of patience to deal with the amount of children here.

Gift Shops:
The shops here either feel like second hand gift stores or cheesy flea market stores. They sell old souvenirs from other casinos in their Viva Las Vegas stores. You can get an Flamingo 2007 lapel pin for 2 for $.99 there! As well as shirts with mis spellings or crooked printing for 3 for $10. Other than that you can get a light up tattooed naked Marilyn Monroe shirt or a pair of jeggings that have "Las Vegas" spelled out in rhinestones on the butt. Pretty Classy.

"Resort" fee:
I am not sure why Circus Circus is considered a resort, when there are zero amenities.  While we were there all of their pools were closed with no explanation. Their fitness center was closed and their wifi did not work. But no way would they refund the resort fee.  

Overall:
I know this is very long winded but I hope that people will really take this into consideration when staying here. If you have children with you, this place is okay. Do not stay here if you do not have children with you, it just is not worth it. I just cannot tolerate places that change their prices after they have already told you one thing, and places that have terrible customer service.

Circus Circus is alright but I wouldn't go here often. I wanted to try the buffet because it was cheap but it wasn't even good. The food was bland and it just didn't satisfy me one bit. I would not go here again for the buffet because there are way better buffets out there than this one.

The place is old and dingy but we made the most out of our short stay. Thank goodness I used my comps from MyVegas for a room. I just had to pay the $13 resort fee. I thought it was weird that the coffee machine was in the bathroom. When you're downstairs, it's like walking through a Vietnamese flea market. Good place to grab some cheap souvenirs. Upstairs had the circus acts and games. The people running the games aren't annoying like the ones at the fair always hollering at you to play. It was also easy for the kids to win little prizes.

Interesting place to go
They have an indoor theme park, free random shows (juggling and such)
Decent for people with kids
Craps are $5.  Right now they have a deal that if you sign up for a new player club member you get $45 in chips if you pay $30 for Craps and Roulette.

Extremely dirty dirty dirty arcade...

Enough said...

I've never seen such filth inside a place as this.. Gum on controllers of machines, spilled food and drink all over machines, water and spills on floors causing people to trip....

I couldn't get out of here fast enough.

Yuck.

I have seen worse, which I don't know whether says more about my travels or this place.  Two words: West tower.  It appears to be the way to go.  Two more: dine elsewhere.  The 7-11 across the street may be a better bet.

We would like to give a shout out to Sylvia at the front desk for being so helpful after we arrived to discover that the groupon we had bought had been booked for the wrong date. She went the extra mile and talked to her manager for us so that we were still able to check in and get a room. This is the kind of customer service that weary travelers like us really appreciate. Overall Circus Circus is a great deal. It's one of the cheapest casino hotels on the strip, but it is still well-furnished, clean and comfortable.  Best of all, there is no smoking so it isn't toxic like a lot of the other hotels on the strip.  There's good shopping and the indoor carnival and outdoor splash park are great fun.  If you don't mind the 1970's style of the exterior this is a great place to stay.

This place is a dump. Since there is an amusement park in the casino they let everyone bring their 5-6 kids with them to the casino. The place badly needs refurbishment. Little kids get in the way as they stand with their parents while they are gambling. That being said, my 22 year old daughter was carded when she was next to her friend at a slot machine. Parking logistics is a nightmare.  You can tell that the gamblers here are not high rollers. Best advice. ...........STAY AWAY FROM CIRCUS CIRCUS! !!!!

My thoughts on Circus Circus are pretty cut and dry. 
1. The hotel is old and is for families. This means there are a lot of children running around to create noise and messes. Based on the name and theme you should know there will be children everywhere. So, if you can't handle that do not stay here.

2. You are going to get what you pay for in Las Vegas. We were there NYE so all the room prices were jacked up. In order to save money on rooming we chose to stay here. The rooms weren't horrible but after seeing ny ny where my friends were staying we realized its all in the price you are willing to pay. This is a low budget place for people with kids so if you want glitz and glam go further down the strip.

3. This hotel is not best suited for young adults without kids. There are only a couple of bars and really no other night clubs. We found ourselves often leaving the hotel for most activities. 

So overall it ranks average to me because it fit the bill for a place to stay and a surprisingly comfortable bed to sleep in. That being said it did fall short for adult entertainment and fun things to do. The biggest downfall though was definitely all of the children who were not being supervised by their parents and always in the way. Next time i'm going to planet hollywood.

I'll start by saying I randomly came across their groupon for 30 a night, I went for it but upgraded to the 2 queens & 2 buffet passes for 45 a night- still a good deal. We were bringing our two boys 3 & 6. We check in & have to pay 56$ more for resort fees. Still cheaper then most places. The room wasn't bad but they don't come w refrigerators or coffee makers, every hotel I've ever been to had both. No free breakfasts- I expected that bc it's a casino. There was 1 mini shampoo\/conditioner bottle. The roof has a hole in it above the beds. The dome area has 1 motion ride for the smallest kid to ride & the 6yrld whose 46in could only ride the swinging pirate ship & bumper cars, both were 6$ each so 12 w an adult. I knew it would be overpriced as most things are but its very limited. All games were 2$+

We had a great stay in the highest floor with the greatest view over the strip as you can imagine. Of cause the room had some minor finishing problems - but for a 3 star hotel it is one of the best you can book. Everything has been clean, really nothing to complain about. I can recommend this hotel to everyone who's looking for a hotel next to the strip.

I don't like this place but I don't hate it.  Riding the escalator we heard music that sounded like something that would be playing upon entering hell.  We played a few Midway games and won a stuffed animal that we through out because we felt it would give our child a disease.

We checked in on Saturday the 29th of August, 2015. We had a bit of both; good and bad. The room was o.k, I mean it was clean. The only bad thing was the shower. It drained very slow!!!! By the end of the shower there was at least half a foot of water.  What really got to us was the following: We traveled with our 2 kids ages 12 and 14. One of my kids lost $55 and pair of sunglasses as they rode the El Loco rollercoaster. As they got off the ride they were able to see where the money and glasses were. They took several pictures of the items lost and showed us. We then headed to security to see if there was anyway of getting those items back. We were sure that the answer would be "no" and we were fine with that. After all they do warn you about your valuables. We were greeted by a very friendly security office T. Murray, the other office at the booth told us that if they were able to get an engineer down there they would be able to get the items. Well both the security and the engineer went to see if they could retrieve the items. They came back with only the sunglasses! This all happened within 20 min. Which is sad, one of them kept then money! The area where the items were was totally un accessible to the public therefore no one else had access. How sad that they did this. Really?? You found the glasses but not them money?? Clearly either the security guard or the engineer took the money!! We then proceeded to make a formal complaint since we had the pictures to prove the money was also there. Our report was taken by the Security Supervisor Mr. Porter. The only reason I gave this hotel at 3 star is because of the help and kindness of the 2 people that made us feel good. Otherwise I would have given it a 1 or 2. The first was Ms. T Murray she was absolutely fabulous! Second Mr. Porter, took our formal complaint. I hope that the person who took the money gets disciplined. In the meantime we are still waiting to hear from Circus Circus.

We stayed here in July and it was much better than I thought. It would be. The room was nice and comfortable. The rooms had been upgraded and this was definitely a plus. The whole family enjoyed the circus entertainment and we had a great time. We would definitely stay here again, just bring lots of extra money for the rides.

KOA should not sponsor this RV park, it is horrible. I can't believe it is a KOA! It is a PARKING LOT! sure its on the strip, but wow, when its 114 in the shade this is not where you want to be in your trailer. sizzle sizzle sizzle .....pass out.

Stayed here for 2 days in the west tower. The room had been remodeled and was clean. We brought our toddler and took him to the adventuredome, which was fun. Not too expensive. 

The casino is old and smoky. Not classy and shiny like the other, newer ones we visited. 

We will stay somewhere else next time, for variety's sake, not because this place was terrible. Also, it's about a mile from the other hotels. Get ready for a trek.

Price was cheap to start with. However they played some tricks to leave you no choice but upgrade to the  main building to avoid long walk. This place is very kids friendly. My children had a wonderful time.
Smoke filled dump. Pass. Also the employees were the least friendly on the strip. Impossible to reccomend .

We checked in yesterday at 3:45 at skyrise tower. Out of 6 elevators 3 were out of service. Very long line for Ppl to wait in line to get into the elevators.. It took more than half hour for us to get into the elevator... the hotel room is very old.. The same as check out day.. the elevators were still out of service and can't get down stairs.  Every elevator came down were packed with checked out ppl. After 1\/2 hr waiting, we decided to take up elevator to the top floor to came back down.. or we don't know how long we would stuck in the 25th fl.  I will never ever stay at Circus Circus anymore.

Not as bad as people say it is.

I stay here all the time (get free rooms every year because pop's got the player's game card). They're remodeling the place so rooms are getting nicer (even though they are decent) and I honestly have to say, I have NEVER gotten any bedbugs problem or anything related to bugs at any of my stays (even as a kid). I'm not really into anything fancy & pricey like the Wynn Hotel etc so I'm fine with Circus Circus. Heck I rather spend all the money paying for food than booking an expensive room. 

If you're going to stay here, definitely go to Midway, especially if you have kids. Never disappoints me. BUT if you hate kids, run for your life. This ain't the place for you. Almost all their games are $1. YUP, only $1. I never leave Vegas w\/o winning a stuff animal here. Shoot, did I say animal? I mean animalS. I bring home bags of them toys home. I guess I'm just a kid at heart. Since your at it, don't forget to check out the Adventuredome (indoor theme-park) either. Are you cheap? Not to worry, you don't even have to pay if you want to go on the rides; your "fun-book" (when you receive at check-in) gives you a coupon for riding TWO rides for free. The book also has other  coupons for free stuff too so people, don't just leave that "fun-book" hangin' and check it out.  

Last but not least, do not I repeat, DO NOT eat at their buffet. Not worth it, even if it's 15.99 for adults.

I'm rating this 5 stars because it is the best family hotel for kids in Vegas. It is older, dated, smellier, and just simply tacky. But decades ago the property added a indoor amusement park and it simply is a big attractor. You can get some very cheap rooms here and the kids will have fun, but it will change your vacation dynamic because it's on the far north end basically near nothing.  There is a shuttle to Caesars, and you can walk across the street to Wynn and Encore or a bit further down to Treasure Island and Mirage.  I've stayed here and seen Vegas better than staying in key locations on the strip center.  There's something about it that just makes you want to explore out.  

This hotel is particularly great if you have one parent who actually wants to gamble and doesn't care where they gamble.  So the other parent can eat, and play and go to the corny free circus and amusement park for $30 all you can ride all day.  

Also because this is a 3 star hotel it's best to book here directly, but you don't have to worry about a low bid price stealing your 4 star bid.  I like that for it's honesty.

Some negatives-- 
This hotel feels old and dirty. As you walk through the parking garage the soot or smog is so bad, that people have taken off their shoes and slapped the dirt onto the ceilings, so it looks likes 1000s of people ran on the walls and ceiling.  Their is a smell of smoke in some places. And nothing, nothing is updated.  

Positives--
Great for kids when one parent gambles and the other just wants to stay nearby and keep the kids happy.
Most MGM resort properties have a lot of issues with upselling, and making you feel lost or insignificant. That just doesn't happen at this hotel.  I think that one difference in ethos and character is what makes this place a fun 3 star hotel for $50\/60 bucks a night. Simply put this hotel knows it's one step up above a motel 6, and is proud of it and you will have a great time with the right attitude here.

No we didn't stay here, but hubby thought it would be fun to bring lil guy to the amusement park area so he could play. I'm not the amusement park type so I opted to do slots while I waited -- yeah tough job.

The only reason I gave this place a 2 star was because I won $40. Otherwise, it's a seriously dismal place. I didn't stay too long after winning the $40. I sauntered over to Slots A Fun where I promptly gave some of the winnings back.

You know it's bad when a 6 yr old tells daddy that he wanted to go to Legoland while being in the Circus Circus amusement area because "it wasn't fun". He had no clue that Legoland was another 5-6 hrs drive. Poor thing.

Review for casino only:

I was at Circus Circus last night to go to their Steak House restaurant.  I had forgotten how large the place is, but coming from the garage in the back, I didn't have to go to the main casino.  I did anyway just to see one of the circus acts.  Roller skating duos must be the rage in Las Vegas with a couple spinning there last night.

The place was cleaner than I remembered from years ago.  It's not a place I'd go except for the restaurant, but it is OK.

Circus Circus is a nice hotel and it has a lot of things to do such as the Adventuredome, the free circus performances, the arcade, etc. It is the most kid friendly hotel in Vegas no doubt about that. The hotel towers seem nice.

So bad it is beyond your imagination!

I would like to give 0 star if there is such option. Too many dramas I didn't expect from a big hotel.

After we got into our room, there's no chair! It took them 20 minutes to send us a chair. Then 2 hours later around 11pm, after i put "no disturb" sign, they sent us a second chair.

Towels in the bathroom are not clean. Took them anlong time to send new towels. It was so long i had to call them again. I was told it took 30-45 minutes to get replacement towels!

Next morning, no hot water. Called the front desk again. Was told they already knew the issue. Asked how long it took to fix, the answer was "we don't know".

A chair, clean towel, hot water...are these the minimum  for a hotel?

This was the single worst hotel experience of my life. The lobby and casino areas were filthy, including human feces on the bathroom floor in the lobby. Hallways to the rooms all smelled of stale cigarette smoke. Ice machine on our floor didn't work. Extremely bare bones amenities in the rooms.
To top it all off, our car was broken into while parked in the hotel garage, along with at least 3 other vehicles. Smashed windows and glass everywhere. When we approached hotel staff for assistance, such as a security report, or contacting local authorities, no one could be bothered helping us. We even had to sweep up the glass ourselves so no other people would get hurt or suffer damage to their car. We had many items taken, which was a total drag, but the lack of empathy or customer service made the experience significantly worse. Not only would I never come to this dump again, I may never visit Las Vegas again, as this experience was so awful. Wanted to post with zero stars but had to give at least 1 to post.

This place is a s$&t show!!! Stayed in the Sky rise Tower.... We waited 15-20 minutes just to get in a elevator even then one elevator actually worked!!! The pool is a joke it's tiny and just to try to get in there is like going through customs.... the rooms inside are decent but damn this place is literally a circus.... I wouldn't recommend it unless you're tight on a budget.... Staff was 50\/50 they hated their lives or they made the best of it...only good thing about this place is adventureDome.... Consider yourself warned....

I come here for one reason only - to play whack a chicken.  I love it, and unlike the slot machines, I always have something to show for my money!

I know it's a rip off, but we always have fun playing some of the midway games.
Stayed in a three bedroom suite everything was amazing got everything I expected for the price. The pool provides life jackets for kids its a great hotel for children.

I got a great deal on Expedia for two nights in a hotel on the strip, which I obviously booked right away! I only paid 28 dollars a night which was the cheapest rate anywhere for the two nights!

I arrived at the circus circus quite late due to a delayed flight, and was shocked to see a queue at the check in.. A queue at nearly 1am? Are you kidding me... Only two people manned the check in counter(there were others standing about, but not working) and it took me around 20 minutes until I reached the counter (after 25 hours flight and transit, yay!) 
The first guy couldn't even find my booking, but he called for help and he was replaced by a really friendly, helpful guy whose name I sadly didn't get (sleep deprivation will do that to you). He put me in the casino tower and gave me a upgrade to a larger room for no reason at all! Epic friendliness.

The room itself was large, roomy and clean, a large TV and free in room WiFi. It had a slightly outdated feel but for under 30 bucks? Who cares! However, NO fridge! Not even a tiny minibar, which really sucks.. I do like my water cold.

As far as restaurants go, I only tried the buffet and the deli. The buffet costs 14,99 which is quite pricey, the food was fresh but the selection was quite limited. The coffee tasted rather bland and watery, the orange juice was fresh and "real" so that was ok.. They only really have one highlight: the omelette dude! This guy makes you omelettes on demand with your  ingredients of choice for no extra charge. And they're Delicious!
The deli was good, they have decent coffee and snacks, again pretty pricey.

All in all I'd say it's a decent place to stay of you get the rooms cheap. I don't think I'd stay here if the rooms were to cost more.

I have stayed at Circus Circus  before over the years for work conventions etc.
 this last time was a joke it was like a ghetto casino from  arriving, waiting for ever in a line 
I had online Mlife reservations with a $92 deposit on a $75 a night room. I thought ok reasonable,  after the long driving around parking structure to find a parking spot within a black of front desk.  line &  having the bell hop take us up to our room to find a half naked man in a robe on the bed   then we had to fight through the crowds with our luggage all over again to get to the front desk. got a slight I am sorry and another room lug all the way back up through casino past towers to the room.  Called front Desk what time is the pool open till?
 they said 9Pm    then the fun part locating the pool... it is not even on the property but across the street at a KOA camp ground. we asked 2 staff members where it was  The first girl said " I don't know this place be\very well just from the parking lot to my area, second a maintenance guy who said we had to go down stairs walk across the 4 lanes of traffic and it was there .
 we found it walked in and it was a mess of wet towels people passed out, low end looking ghetto crowd baby diapers under lawn chairs ...Used  spilled\/ vomited  red looking stuff all over a lamp post  and pool deck. it was like wow  what a shit hole! 
Then the life guard blows the whistle after we finally just got our drink and was told the pool was closed ...I said the front desk said 9 pm?
 he said no 8pm so now the dreaded walk back through the run down hallways and maze of stairs , escalators and elevators  and shoulder shrugging unhelpful staff .
we left  on checking out I received a bill on my credit card  for an additional $161.00 on top of the $92  a total of $253.25 
 when I was quoted on line at $75 a night 
 beware  DO NOT HAVE THE SAME HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE .
 I think this hotel is just waiting to be demolished and is a MGM tax write off as a slum.

Stayed there for a week with my 3 kids and I can honestly say it's well worth it. Was kind of skeptical because of it being at the end of the strip but was surprised how nice it really was. The rooms in the Casino Tower were super clean and smelled nice. Tons of things for the kids to do like the water park and the adventuredome. Casino smelled of smoke but what casino doesn't. Also staff was very helpful with getting around being that this place is huge! Would definitely go back again!

Upon reading the reviews, we were very hesitant on staying here. We said we would give it a shot, and could book somewhere else for the second night, if we was a cockroach or bed bugs. Upon walking in, the lobby had a old, strange smell. Very bad cigarette odor as well. We checked in, and I immediately searched the room. No bed bugs and no cockroaches. Very out dated furniture. I went to shower and ran the water for a while. There was no hot water and the tub didn't even drain. 

We ended up staying, as we weren't in the room much. But!!! Upon gathering out suitcases and getting in the elevator to check out, I saw something moving on the floor and it was a cockroach!!! Omg!! Good thing we were checking out. I would not recommend for anyone to stay here.

Just as you can't compare apples to oranges, you can't compare Circus Circus to the luxury casinos. You choose Circus Circus for different reasons than the fancy casinos.

My lovely wife and I take the kids to Vegas so they can spend all day at the Adventure dome. Sometimes we get a room at Circus Circus for the convenience of having the Adventure dome just down the elevator and a coupon for the all day rides pass. My kids don't care about a fancy room and they wouldn't want to spend all day in a hotel room anyway. Circus Circus offers good value and the best entertainment for kids in Vegas.

I quit doing drugs years ago, but if I was ever going to go on one last bender, I'd want to do it at Circus Circus. This place is the only Casino on the strip that still has the Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas vibe. The desperation is palpable.

The big top may be part of it. It seems antiquated and corny compared to the other free shows on the strip, like the water show at the Bellagio or the big boat in front of Treasure Island. But you know what? I love it anyway. It makes me feel like I'm in Las Vegas. Let's face it, this is a trashy town. Why dress it up?

And you know what else? I hate gambling in those huge ultra luxury resorts. You know how they built those? By whacking gamblers. It is what it is. I like gambling at Circus Circus. You can see that they haven't done a damn thing to spruce it up since 1981, so they can afford to have looser slots. Or so goes my logic, anyway.

Love it or hate it, any trip to the strip is incomplete until you have some big fun at the big top.

Seriously regret staying here. Location isn't good, old nasty, smelly, dirty! Our first room was disgusting, hair in the beds and all over the floor, bathroom was unclean, toilet was worse then a truck stop bathroom. We did get moved to a different room and that was at least clean. This hotel was crowded, full of screaming children, food was bad, pool was green and run down, just pay the extra money and stay someplace else. There are lots of kids activities but it's no better then an expensive carnival.

Carrie from graveyard is the best! Your voice recognition we were so pleased by her professionalism and sincere hospitality. We have been visiting and staying at the Circus Circus for years and will continue to come back because of the wonderful professionalism and courteousness that is demonstrated by all employees especially Carrie!!! A big kudos to the Circus Circus staff
Very bad hotel.  There is no ventilation in the rooms, everything is really old.  Also, it's in a bad part of Vegas. The whole experience has been terrible

I've been told by many people that the circus circus has shitty rooms. But I stayed in it this weekend and it was probably much better than the westgate! The rooms here were spacious and very comfy. I will be staying here more often rather than dealing with bed bugs at westgate.

I booked my hotel for this last weekend on Hotwire. First time using Hotwire and the last time I will also ever use Hotwire. I was shown pictures of a hotel that were nowhere compared to what I got. I got building E in the Manor of Circus Circus, literally scary. I now have a weird infection on the bottom of BOTH of my eyes that started the first night we stayed in this dump. Carpets, walls, everything is falling apart and in disgusting shape. Obviously the beds were not clean and the soaps they left were open and used. There were hairs stuck in the shower from a previous stay. Unfortunately we weren't able to upgrade because the hotel was too busy the first 2 nights but the third night I did upgrade and still freaken paid for it!!! The Manor of Circus Circus is Disgusting and you're better off staying at a Motel where at least you know what you're getting. SOOO disappointed as this was my first time staying at Circus Circus and my experience sucked..

Stayed here last year (2014) it's horrible, there's kids  all over the place screaming and running in to you.  They gave us a room with very loud neighbors. We asked to be moved to another room but they only had a two queen room, which wasn't what we had reserved.   No point in asking for a "strip view" since the tower is towards the back you can't really see anything but the roof. The buffet was horrible, the chocolate ice cream and the coffee were the only good things. Only good thing about this place is the cheap tables...one of the only casinos on the strip with $5 tables.

im one for deals and saving money. have fell in love with this hotel!! will be back for a 4th time this coming december. its vegas...how much time are you going to spend in your room really? i dont have kids and have not been  bothered by the family atmosphere. had very strong margaritas and they are two for 1! the duece bus stops right outside. they recently upgraded their pools added waterslides!! too bad pools are closed in december:( id love to experience those soon. had a manor room for a night but it is seperate from the hotel and a very long walk so we will stay in the hotel rooms connected to casino from now on. paid 20$ to upgrade to a closer room for the last 2 nights. absolutely love the adventure dome and free circus acts. can not get any better than that. i could stay there all day in that hotel and be a happy camper!!  hoping to move to vegas soon and getting a job there thatd make me so happy
and slots of fun is right next door. great drink deals as well as the 5$ bowling which me and my boyfriend love !

NASTY! HORRIBLE! A NIGHTMARE!
The parking lot is creepy. 
The lobby looks old, sad, you want to get deppresed? Come here.
The hotel has a terrible odor. Gives you a headache.
The moment you step in to this =hotel= you feel Vegas (glamour, happiness, light) are gone, or far far away.
And the worst part: a maid named Hermelinda, or Herlinda (my memory doesn't want to recall her name accurately to preserve my menthal health , seriously)  will deliberately throw away your moms denture into the trash when =cleaning up= your room. Yes she will, even if the denture is in a clear cup, and doesn't look like trash at all, she will.
Later on she will deny it. And the front desk manager, the security person ( a guy who rides a bike), and somebody who can be reached only by phone (800 number) all of them, will support her stupity. Also they will let you know that they are not responsible for replacing the 500 dollars denture.
My mom is almost 80 years old, diabetic and traveled from Mxico to visit Las Vegas and find out that an idiot maid, throws away her denture into the trash. How sweet that is.
Nobody cared that it was around 3 o clock and my mom was with empty stomach, low sugar blood levels and still she was not mad because she is a very sweet and kind person.
But I WAS.
I was mad, sad, I felt totally... I have no words to describe my feeling. 
Luckily,  Mr Juan and supervisor Lorenza showed up to help. They took me into the trash container And we found my mom's denture. Yes in the trash.
We were supposed to spent two nights in this hole but we obviously  left right away, and knowing that we will never be back to this place, I didn't look back, I just want to pretend that this horrible experience never happened.
Stay away from this piece of sh.... if you want to enjoy your Vegas visit!!! I will  rate this pseudo hotel super expensive even if is apparently cheap because if I am told to stay here and I will get paid a million dollars, I'd choose not to.
I rather pay some place else than getting a night here for free.

I should not say Las Vegas is not what it use to be. I have only my experience at the circus circus to fall back on. I will say this. I love to splurge, but this place has turned my splurge button off. From the rude dealer and pit bosses that don't make a remark when they are in the wrong, to the restaurant owners (pizzeria) who practice reverse discrimination. The Casino smells old. The rooms are not up to pare for a Casino in Las Vegas. For this I would rather stay in California at the Indian Casino. I have expressed my thoughts and complaints to upper management and felt like I spend the better half of an hour talking to a wall. I am very disappointed for the amount of money I spent not only to stay at this property but the amount I donated to the one arm bandits and tables. Over all my experience here has been less than enjoyable.

Was generally happy with the hotel.  Upon check-in, the desk clerk asked if we wanted a later check-out on our last day there, for only $10 extra. This was great, just so we had a little extra time to pack and get ready to leave.  

The room was clean and comfortable, we got to watch a few old Star Wars movies on TV, and it was pretty quiet for the most part. The only exception is the maid who was vacuuming the room next door at midnight (!).  

The hotel is located a short walk to the major hotels on the Strip (about 10-15 minutes), which was convenient. Definitely would stay here again. 

When we were walking into the hotel looking for the front desk, we were approached by a woman who (it turned out) was trying to get people to go to a timeshare presentation.  All we wanted to do is find the front desk, and were quite annoyed by her sales tactics.  I ended up going by myself (my companion went off to find a brewery), and it turned out okay, but just be warned: if someone approaches you for a vacation plan, or program, or anything that sounds similar, just say no (following Nancy Reagan's advice).

Let me start by saying the staff is friendly. Everyone greets you with a genuine smile followed by a hello. The check in process was quick and easy. 
The rooms are inexpensive so you can expect a 5 star room with marble floors. But it would have been nice to at least have light in my room. The lamp was missing a bulb-yikes!  The sleeping quarters may have been missing a bulb but the bathroom was fine. I could see perfectly at night, I was even able to name some dust friend I made in the bathroom. 

Overall, the staff was the most positive out of the experience.

This is our go-to mini getaway for my husband and I. When we come we are always treated amazingly. VIP hosts are always accommodating. 

On our last visit (Jan 13-15) we came for my birthday. Check-in rep was amazing! She even knew it was my birthday soon and gave me flowers and rang a bell and gave me a "whoohooo". Made my night! Was slightly disappointed in our room though. We usually get the room with the wet bar and fridge and were promised that but when we checked into our room it was not the same. 

New games are always popping up. Still love watching the circus acts even though our kids are bigger and do not come with us anymore. 

Buffet could be a bit better. Bacon was really greasy and some were almost under-cooked. Some of the eggs were runny but omelette station was good. 

Overall we will continue to come back because we love it and love the service and attention we always get!

cheap rooms, crappy food, cheap drinks, lots of gaming , great for kids, circus midway with free shows & super-cheap theme park @ adventuredome. RIGHT next door is the slots-of-fun for even cheaper drink & gaming. Its pretty obvious you are in the shit here but at least theres a bus stop out front & a short cab line.

So my parents asked me if I wanted to go to Vegas with them and the kids. I said fuck it- yes. So I wake up from the 9 hour car ride and I'm like how much longer til the Sahara.. they go oh yeah about that were staying at circus circus. Suddenly my mind is spinning, creepy clowns, small children, rollercoasters. GET ME OUT OF HERE. but then I realized it's also a casino and theres bars.. saving grace. So we roll in, wait 30 minutes to check in, get our rooms, not too bad, but the sink didn't work.(but a repair man was up there within 20 min) But honestly for how cheap it was (like 100 a night on CES weekend) it was a good deal. I think I only got like one bedbug bite. And im not kidding.

The restaurants there were ok- it's vegas so it's super over priced and very tacky if it doesn't have a celeb chef. BEST DEAL EVER though: $2 bloody marys or margaritas, and $ 2 shrimp cocktail or chips n salsa 2am-2pm, how can you go wrong? and $6.50 for don julio shots, all at the "Garden Grill". Now another great deal, the buffet.. so for like $25-30 you can eat all you can eat bfast, lunch n dinner, just beware of what time it's closed at. I missed a meal being hungover and lazy. The foods ok, it's just a really good deal in vegas.  I seriously ate there like 5 times. and if i needed a soda, or anything i'd just go right in. It's a hook up when you want to have $$ for shopping or gambling, $30 a day on food is a good idea. Now when you gain 10 pounds, don't blame me.

So we had kids with us, a 12 year old and 2 year old. Lots to do for them at this place. Honeslty unless you have kids or have been coming to vegas since it was becoming popular you wouldn't want to stay at circus. no clubs. closest night life party happenings would be like the rivieara (pass) encore and wynn (unless I win big i can't even fathom entering those doors for more than a cocktail and a ooooh ahh), and then you have to walk to TI.(which smells like a christian audieger brotherl). it's just kinda weak. 

But anyways in the hallways leading from the casino to the towers.. theres those kiosk things. and those people who attack you as you walk by. Now i say attack and not approach because I maybe walked the hallways 5 times a day for 4 days and i was harassed "where you from" "oh your skin, try this" "want a massage" and it was the same shit everytime. so finally this one bitch (*for the third time that day, and honestly they could tell me apart from the other clientel, they had seen me all day, leave me alone), shes all "where you from" and i couldn't help but ever so maturly respond "uranus". After that they fucked off.

the floor has great slots. When it comes to slot play im all about the ghetto casinos. and they have my favorite top dollar machines. they rock. I wouldn't be caught dead playing a table at circus, but that's just me. 

Adventuredome: kinda lame, but as far as people under 21 are concerned, it's kinda where it's at in vegas for them.

midway: rip off, but super fun for kids. Don't be suprised when after 30 minutes you've gone through $60 on games and you have defective looking stuffed animals in your hands.


would i stay here again, hopefully not.

I booked my room through Hotels.com as I do with most of my hotel reservations, and I just realized that every time I do this for any of my Las Vegas stay, I get the room without a view, located in the lower levels, where I can still smell the cigarette prominently. I realized this because I booked my Circus Circus stay through Hotels.com yet again and as I was checking in, the front desk clerk was extra nice and noticed that it was my birthday so she said she would give me an upgrade. When we got to our room in the West Tower, it looked exactly like what I expected and booked through hotels.com except, I was hoping for more since the front desk clerk said she would give us an upgrade. Ahhh, at last I got to the window and noticed an actual view (now there's upgrade). For the first time that I've ever booked through Hotels.com, finally I can see something other than the parking structure. 

Unfortunately, the nonsmoking room still reeked of cigarettes. I went out to purchase a bottle of Fabreze to alleviate the smell for my young asthmatic children, but ended up being unable to sleep at all that night. Happy Birthday to me. I called guest services first thing in the morning and spoke to a very kind man named Chad, who graciously moved my family to the same type of room, located at a floor on the higher level. The smell of cigarettes was gone, we had a better view and of the actual strip too (WOW), PLUS we slept much better that night. Actually we slept in all Friday, and then all through the night, missing activities outside our room.

Don't get me wrong, I understand most of Las Vegas can smell like cigarettes. But noway to where I sleep and bathe. I could have gone to any other hotel or vacation destination for that matter if my only intention was to stay in my hotel room and sleep. But because of the horrible experience we had the first night, and for a birthday getaway, we are disappointed.

Pointers would be: 
- make sure you book in the West Tower of Circus Circus if you prefer the newer and more contemporary room. 
- if you mind the smell of smoke, report it to guest services right away, rather than suffer through the night and flush your payment for that night down the toilet. 

The three stars indicating it is A-OK, is dedicated to the willingness of the guest services supervisor to work with our family. I approached the situation in a well-mannered tone, without needing to complain, and they took care of the problem courteously. I would have loved to stay an extra night because the room we were moved to provided us the rest we needed from the nightmare we experienced the evening before. Circus Circus in general is a great hotel for families. My kids enjoyed the hotel amusement and adventure activities such as Adventure Dome, the Circus games, and free Circus shows which they were only able to try out very briefly after we checking out, before going home. However, our potential third night fell on a Saturday where the rates went to a price we just couldn't risk to pay after our first night experience.

If you have kids Circus Circus is a decent idea otherwise do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else. This place is run down and old and smells like mildew. 

I normally stay at The Quad so my expectations are not that high but circus circus still didn't meet them. We stayed at circus circus manor which is actually more of a cheap motel than a casino hotel. This place smells like mildew, the walls and ceiling are super thin, it is similar to a cheap apartment I used to live in. I can loudly hear the people up stairs walking across their room. I can hear conversations and tv from the people in the room next to me. 

Lastly the location is not great. It's a long walk to anything to the point where you are either taking a cab or walking 2 miles to get to anywhere interesting. If you have to drive or cab everywhere you might as well stay off the strip in somewhere nicer that is just as inexpensive. It's cheap for a reason.

Are things really so bad that you want to end it all by eating here?

Here was our experience of dining at Circus Circus's Buffet:

We entered from the strip....expecting...oh...I don't know....maybe a Circus? There were several very nervous and unhappy looking "performers" trying (bless their hearts...) to accomplish circus acts. Unfortunately, while we were there, the Circus acts were an embarrassment for the performers (many of whom seemed untrained and somewhat desperate).

We made our way through the rather dingy and ill kept casino.....trying to find breathable amounts of uncontaminated air to breathe. The circulation system wasn't great....the cigarette stench was overpowering.

We tried some slot play....I don't think we came across any tighter slots in Nevada.

Finally....we made it over to the buffet. Well....more accurately, to the massive line for the buffet. Here we had the pleasure of standing shoulder to butt with the thronging masses...as we all crept foreword at a worm's pace...while being forced to watch television monitors which admonished us all to "Take all of the food you want...but be sure to eat ALL of the food on your plate!"....again...and again...and again....in English and then again in Spanish...until you just wanna plunge a fork into your own heart..to kill the pain!

The food was of limited selection....basically mostly deep-fried and of questionable freshness. The service was on auto-pilot...headed for a mountain.

Bleak.

Save yourself. Go somewhere else!

More to come!
Fast check-in. Checked in early around 10 for only $20. Room smells great and staff very friendly. Casino Room is where we stayed

Circus circus when I was little it seemed like the area was a lot better then. The adventure dome was fun for my family we stayed in one of their rooms and everything was fine except the dirty bath tub in our room it looked like their plumbing was not working and they had water come up the tub we called house keeping and didn't get cleaned until the next day. Other than that Staff was friendly  and helpful And house keeping did the best they could as far as cleaning our bathroom. Their buffet was good. So bc of the tub I am giving them a three star bc this shouldn't have happened. It wasn't expensive like other hotels but it was still money that we spent to stay here.

Entire facility showed extreme signs of neglect and lack of repair. Filthy carpets, poor check-in experience, and exorbitant resort fees for no real benefit.
Part of the reason we decided to book here was the Adventure Dome Amusement area. Nothing was ever told to us in advance about it not being open, even though we called the hotel directly about the Adventure Dome.
Complained about issues with bad A\/C and leaky shower faucet, nothing was ever fixed. This was after out first room that we were assigned had to majorly wet carpet leading from the bathroom into the main area (squished when walked upon.)
"Resort Fees" were more expensive than the actual hotel room, and we got no benefit for the outrageous fees. (Almost $31\/night).
Clearly this is an OLD property that the ownership company no longer cares about. This property was once a Las Vegas Icon, and now it is looking like the unwanted and neglected stepchild.
Worst Las Vegas Experience EVER. We will NOT be returning to this property unless upper management gets off their backside and fixes this property.
No shuttle service, no shuttle for the Strip, no transportation services of any kind. Yes, they have free parking, but that is useless unless you drive to the property, which people flying in are not likely to be doing.
Left messages for management about problems and poor experience, had to leave several messages before finally getting a response two full weeks after our stay.
Absolutely disgusted with how bad this property has been let go. Bad maintenance, and entire first floor reeks of smokers. As two people who are allergic to cigarette smoke, our allergies and all were constantly acting up while in the building. Front desk staff and management were indifferent at best.

Stay somewhere else if you can. 

The problems with the room included,
1. An ant plague in the bathroom around the sink,
2. a previous occupant had ripped the door of the fridge and it looked like it had been that way for a long time,
3. door keys that didn't work,
4. a tap in the bathroom that you couldn't turn off and ran day and night,
5. Homeless person begging food off our plates in the restaurant while we were eating. I have compassion for homeless people but I like to eat in peace.
6. Water pouring from the roof in the corridor outside. They cut a hole in the roof to fix the leaking plumbing but left it unfinished for a week.
7. Buffet had limited choice of cold, overcooked and unhealthy food.Hotel was full of unhealthy overweight people, walking heart attacks.
8. No thought about their internal sign system. Impossible to find anything using the signs.
9. Some rude, nasty and lazy staff.
10. A 45 minute wait to check in.  We needed to do this three times due to Expedia being uncontactable. Expedia have not published my review like probably many others from ripped-off guests for this hotel.
11. The hotel faces two huge bankrupted boarded up casinos, blighting the landscape, The Fontainbleu? project, a 2.5 billion dollar project now rusting and abandoned and the Sahara Casino. It looks like downtown Detroit rather than a holiday destination.
12. Slow wi-fi that continually dropped out. Only works for email.
13. Dangerous parking garage. Poor thought about pedestrian flow for a kid oriented hotel. Something that they should fix before there is a fatality
14. Poor sound dampening in the rooms. You don't want your kid hearing what you can hear.
15. The whole place needs a massive refurbishment
16. Unhappy desperate staff.

There were lots of problems with this hotel and I can't see them staying in business. The management need to be replaced. We left early but lost our payment for the room due to what appeared to be dishonest behavior by Expedia. We called them several times to cancel our booking within the required time frame but they didn't answer the phone. I guess cancellations must happen often with this hotel and they thought they could make some money from me.Consequently I wasted a lot of time waiting on the phone and a lot of money on a hotel room that was not used. Expedia are exposing themselves to a class action related to their methods of doing business. Expedia need to replace their CEO with someone who understands how to retain customers. Someone who is not a short-term quick buck thinker. My advice is never to book through Expedia.

One of the front desk staff said to me that he receives daily ongoing complaints about Expedia and another said that he would like to see Expedia closed down so I am not alone.

Expedia have lost my business and others from the 250,000 business people in a social network that I established and manage who just heard about my problems with Expedia.

Third time in Vegas, and has to be the worse hotel I've ever stayed, including everywhere else I've been to.  Comparing this to a Days Inn could be considered a complement.  Maybe on the booking page they could've warned me that I was going to have to walk 15 miles (exaggeration) to my room in the "Manor" buildings.  The rooms here are what I consider to be a degrade to a Days Inn or any other cheap hotel for that matter.  AC filter looks like it hasn't been cleaned in 2 years, TV is from at least 15 years ago, wallpaper on the walls peeling off.  Just a horrible experience.

Raoul Duke: "Bazooko's Circus is what the whole world would be doing Saturday nights if the Nazis had won the war. This was the Sixth Reich."

As your attorney, I advise you to take Mr. Duke's advice.

And take a hit out of that small jar in my shaving kit.

I've always made fun of Circus Circus, generally because I imagined the inside of the casino to feature a bear on a bicycle riding around a slot machine. However, I actually stayed there a few months ago when Hurricane Sandy prevented me from returning to DC, and I needed a cheap place to sleep for a couple of nights (read: I had no money left after getting the "prison treatment" from the blackjack switch tables at Bellagio).

Well, let me tell you, there is not a bear riding a bicycle under the "big top," but I would rather let a similar and much larger Kodiak bear maul me publicly than to spend another night at Circus Circus.

Because it was near Halloween, the hotel was apparently running a haunted house just outside my room. So just imagine the joy it brought me to hear someone RUNNING A CHAINSAW every 30 seconds until 2:00AM. Hey, don't worry me trying to sleep, guys. Just make sure you send LEATHERFACE up to my room when he's done carving up the kids downstairs and\/or meticulously pruning the shrubs outside.

When I did venture outside of my room, I was confounded by a layout that was surely masterminded by a sadistic meerkat. Admittedly, I am not great with direction, but I also know that "Hey Jimmy, put something together with your Legos" would be a better design strategy than whatever was used as a blueprint for the building.

After meandering around for much longer than necessary and finally finding a place to eat, I noticed that the Mexican food restaurant in which I was standing had a faucet leaking sludge just beneath the fountain drink machine. If Erin Brockovich had been in line with me, I'm sure she would have discovered that PG&E was knowingly leaking chromium into my chimichanga.

The only upside to Circus Circus is that instead of a "late checkout," you can actually pay $5-10 and stay late into the afternoon, which I suppose is preferable only to being waterboarded or watching an episode of "Whitney."

I was so miserable, I actually choose a red-eye flight to Charlotte followed by a seven hour drive in a rental car to DC instead of staying an extra night. It was expensive. I was exhausted. And spending a full day on the road while trying to navigate the remnants of Hurricane Sandy was not very safe.

It was still better than Circus Circus.

I have been to Vegas twice in the last 20 days for trade show. The first one the Magic show and the second one Super Zoo. Each time I stayed in a different hotel. 

I read up on Circus Circus, and as I was on a  budget I thought heck I can do it for 8 hours ( was actually in the room for only 8.5 hours total) The price seemed right... so I thought...

Now Vegas is experiencing over 14% unemployment, at a tax rate of 10.5% which for some reason politicians never understand KILLS BUSINESS. TAXES KILL BUSINESS politicians please read and write this on the chalk board 5 thousand times!

Not only is the tax rate just insane for this place, but the fees hotels sneak in is crazy and have to be driving business away. I know it making this girl think twice before I go again. Heck I might just camp next time that's how bad it is there, I think. 

So back to CC, the actually charge you a fee for having a phone in your room... yes you read that right!! $1 gets you a phone! YIPPEE 
READ BELOW

The following mandatory hotel-imposed fees are charged and collected by the hotel either at check-in or check-out: Telephone fee: $1 per room\/night. The above list may not be comprehensive. Mandatory hotel-imposed fees may not include tax and are subject to change.

The total came to $32.34
TAX $4.39!!! Just what are you dirt bag politicians doing with our money? Paying to get spanked? Oh that's right lobbyists pay you for them to get spanked and your vote... you just buy the drugs and put it under misc. from you slush funds

Back to CC... sorry get side tracked... The beds if that is what you call them in CC. I really thought they were training me to be in the Circus to lay on a bed of nails or glass. THE SPRINGS in the MATTRESS could be felt, I think there was an 1\/8th of fabric between me and the mattress... and I have some padding on my own bones...  again I would like to point out that I am a camper, so use to sleeping on the ground. This was sleeping on harsh springy metal! OUCH ALL NIGHT. I tried to sleep on my pillows even!

The room was pretty decent in being clean and not feeling like I was going to walk away with some skin rash or worse.  I think it is a few steps up from being a total loss and that is why they are not remodeling yet.

I do have something positive to say tho. Their staff and security is great. Nice and personable folks. I had to change rooms due to a partying neighbor and they had no problem moving me and having security meet me to show me to my new room and someone bring me the new key card. My car was safe and I felt safe walking around outside.

Of course the security guard looked like he most definitely worked out and was packing a 9mm Smith and Wesson! SEXY!

If you have to go cheep this is the place I think... if you need a comfortable bed do not go to this place unless you bring you camping mattress as well.

They need to demolition this place pronto!  It is a real piece of crap, the only saving grace is that is located on the Strip.  However, it's so far away from the other cool casinos that it's not worth the money you save to stay there.  It's a $10 cab ride to the Bellagio!  The hotel portion was very shabby, wallpaper peeling off the wall near the elevator, knobs missing on the furniture, a lamp burned out in our room, bed sheets all wrinkly and bunched up, the list goes on.   There was a car convention going on when we were there so that may explain why the rates were so high, over $150 a night for total crap in my opinion.  The shops suck and the restaurants were just mediocre.

Our expectations weren't that this place was going to be a high end stay. But, we did expect it to be clean and functional. Potato chips were left on the chair. The sink drained slow. The shower faucet couldn't be shut off completely without using a lot of force. The shower drain was clogged - in the time it took to shower, the soapy water was ankle high.  Called the desk three times (9:00 AM the first time) requesting repair only to be told that they had lots of maintenance calls and they would send someone as soon as possible. Finally around 7:00PM someone came. 

When I called, the lady said for the inconvenience they would comp two nites. At checkout, they asked for the persons name. We didn't have it. They apologized that all they could do was discount the resort fee - a whopping $26!!!!

Never again!!

Came to buffet and it was actually very very, good!! Was a bit iffy about it cause this is just one of the oldest casinos and it doesn't seem to have changed much. Mom just wanted to come here and it was actually a great choice. They had menudo and mom actually like it. All the food I had was very good!!
This place is a dump. Vegas is not for kids. I ate at pizzeria and service was bad as well as the food. I came here after a long day of drinking and boy it was a mistake.

I'm only a teenager and yet I'm a hardened Vegas veteran because my mother is a slotmachine addict. 

Since there's really nothing for the under 18-21 crowd except arcades and shopping, I decided to visit the hotel of my childhood after nearly a decade. BAD MISTAKE. I'm really a snob at certain aspects. If you want a "Family" hotel, go to New York New York at least! The people aren't as seedy and the environment is way more exciting and cleaner. Don't stay at Circus Circus because you think the rides will appeal to your children! You're wrong! I went on most of them and they were all dirty, painful, and underwhelming.

My god.. parents! Don't allow yourself and your children to wallow in such grime. You're going to return from vacation with a still-throbbing migraine because you never had a good night's rest in that barely vacuumed hotel room and you're going to have deal with that cold your child has because he or she was surrounded by hundreds of screaming greasey little kids.

You're in Vegas - so live a little! 

PS - I consider their 1\/2 lb, footlong hotdog for $3 to be the only highlight of the hotel.

Yuk! This review is for the room. The water was shut off a couple of times. The in-room safe did not work. The TV reception was horrible. Our room was only cleaned once on 4 days and they didn't leave any clean cups.

The only reason I left 2 stars was for the fact that it was not as bad as I thought (the room did not smell like smoke). They had reliable internet access and they did fix the safe after calling the second time.

To the management of Circus Circus, 
I don't care if you don't act on this complain but I will not stop telling your other guests how horrible your hotel has become .  I booked july7-9 and the reservation Kya was wonderful. So even if I saw all the negative comments, I still went ahead to book $167.00 queen tower room for sat-sun. My fri-sat was free as well as my Sunday -Monday. Kya assured me that these are renovated rooms and very clean. She didn't ask for a credit card , maybe because it wasn't my first time. ? I also booked another room under my players card for sat for a friend with the same rate and gave me a reservation number, no credit card asked . We checked in Friday around 11pm, tired and exhausted. I informed the desk that I had another room booked for the next day but apparently she did not  charge that room  with my card!??? After seeing the room on the 4rth floor , I called and requested to change rooms. The carpet was filthy dirty, the pillows  smelled like sewers,  and the curtains were so dusty ! The air conditioning unit was bad and I swear I could hear everything that my next door neighbors were doing! Arghhhhh! So with no sleep , I went to the front desk around 11am the next day and asked if I can pay the other room that I reserved coz we were going out. The front desk who was very strict said they don't have any other rooms coz they were fully booked! I respected that , and went out gambling ang came back around 10pm sat for 3 things. I was in the players lane and was speaking to the front desk (Nory? ) I again requested for a change of rooms knowing that the rooms in front of me were vacant. She said it was impossible coz they were really really booked. Then I asked for the second room that I booked over the weekend. All of a sudden this woman who was around 70yrs old or older , dyed blond hair, rude , with a horrible accent and very disrespectful interrupted. She said **** it is not a guarantee to get a room even if you have a reservation number. (She was sarcastic when she said) there is no payment made so she can turn me away!!! Surely there are other hotels!!! Whaaaaattttt? (Wow, talk about loyalty to your hotel... she would rather lose a client! Than be nice! ) anyway , there was an exchange of words as I was really tired at past 10pm, I was embarrassed to my guest, afraid they wouldn't get a room and this woman , this aged front desk clerk was making a gesture that's so rude . Anyway... it was great that the manager heard us... Mary Grace  was so patient, very fluent in English (Filipina) and efficient in her job. While this was going on.... another guy was screaming at that same aged, rude blond woman because She was really rude! Wow! 
I know the management has a union but please take this woman away from the front desk! After all, they are the first ones to face the client. Pls ask manager Mary grace what her name was! In less than 30 mins... 2 customers were upset with the same lady! I'm afraid one day she'll meet a customer who'll do something more than just get upset! (You know what I mean when provoked?!) Oh Noooooooooooo, warning ! Warning ! 
It didn't help that even when I was moved to another room on the same floor, it had he same issue. Smelly carpets, dirty, no A\/C, stuck up shower....rm456, room 417, and 423. I almost recorded the conversation of my next door neighbor at 1am Sundayit was that clear! 
So yes... what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas , even the bedbugs should stay in your hotel. 
I respectfully ask that you investigate and re train your front desk clerk especially this aged-blond-woman-with an accent  who is very disrespectful. 
Circus circus , i am loyal plus I win in your black jack table that why I stay here. But I won't risk my life getting upset . After all, I'm an M member and total rewards. Everyone wants to be treated like a VIP in Vegas. Isn't that what it's supposed to be?
This place is a joke. If they book you at 'the manor' RUN. It's gross and needs to be demolished.

Fuck circus circus been playing for 3 hours no water no drink had to call bar manager someone finally came and had the nerve to say I just started my shift but I walked over here mind you I been here for 3 hours she lied plus she had a attitude her name was Beth with matte red lipstick she is so rude I will never give them any of my money again about 30 min later Gaudalupe came by an checked on us and she was very pleasant I really appreciated her
I have no nostalgia for this hotel.  I think the interior is ugly.  Its noisy.  The food is okay.  The mattress was forgettable and the rooms are decent.

It's ok if u just need a room on the strip at a reasonable price. HOWEVER. ..LOL , This place does need ALOT of work as far as the rooms go. We had a Sky Tower rm on the 29th floor with a great view , but the sheets on one of thes beds was dirty & we did have to request new ones ... I can say  the bar & staff are cool but the rooms are a bit of a hit & miss though.

review for MIDWAY games!
I only come here for he midway games!!! probably the best games in VEGAS.... when i get pretty broke lose all my money from gambling, i take my last 20-40 bucks and end up there for hours playing those kiddy games.  MY favorite is the horse racing where you roll the ball into a colored diamond looking holes and the HORSES\/CAMELS\/ (watever animals they are..) go as you roll in the specific colored holes... anyways i pay $1 to win a BIG stuffed animal (depending how many players go against you)... but hey nothing feels better then WINNING a big prize with $1!!!!! 
To be honest, this hotel is pretty ghetto... but just go there for the midway game. ANd oh YEAH.. GOOD LUCK on ordering drinks on the table cause they dont have that many variety on drinks.

Every Time we go to vegas
And our kids r with us we come
To circus circus(but ww don't stay in this hotel) we just
Come few hours n my kids play they have so much fun :) i highly recommend this place whoever has kids to bring them here

This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed and I have stayed at the Flamingo. Rude people. Couldnt care less if you are even remotely satisfied. The guest services even went so far as to say if I didn't like it I could leave. Guests have no priority in anything, especially parking. They had Country Music concert and where charging $40 for them too park. They had many spots open for parking, that guest couldn't use. We had to go directly to parking structure  and lug all luggage 1\/4 Mile to check in because they wouldn't let us drop at the curb. I am just about ready to take the loss and go to the Palms. They only change $119 a night and have an incredible room. Compared too $130 for any room here. No parking, No smoking in any room (not informed until check on), No access to any service rep or manager that even remotely gave a shit. The apathetic attitude from all has put this dilapidated shit hole on my "evade at all cost and to inform anyone who will listen, not to even attempt to give this pit any money, even at a discount. YouTube will have this listed under Circus Circus hole. Only one star cause I couldn't put negative 20.

Not anonymous.

Rick Edwards

I am writing an edit to my review. After talking to valet in the morning, Clark, who was so helpful, said to get to valet when I returned to park and he would make sure I was taken care of. I should ask for Shawn, who was also very helpful. I had a place in valet. I told Clark that it was nice this trip to have something done for me and not to me. Props go out to them and all of the hard working valet.  MANY THANKS. For this I am giving 5 stars to valet. My original rating on the hotel itself still stands because of how we were treated. Once again, thanks too valet.

Rick Edwards

Took my girlfriend for her first time in Vegas, booked a room online than got there and was told they overbooked, luckily I wasn't charged the resort fee a night, but got put into a room with ROACHES AND BED BUGS which was the MANOR. You'd think that the price you pay and it'd be close to the strip that you wouldn't run into 1star hotel issues. But after complaining to the manager on shift, we were up routed to the west tower, where the towels were hard as a rock, the water pressure sucked. Worse experience for a hotel by far.

Super busy at check in. The elevators get crowded and its hard to get in one with the crowds. Theyre are children everywhere so if you have to keep things PG. The hallways in the hotel room towers for stuffy and hot. The rooms look like they were upgraded which is nice. I love the convenient lamps with the outlets on them. The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. The gym was perfect and the biggest from the five other hotels I stayed at during this last vacation. This hotel is a good place if you wanna bring your kids but walking to the best part of the strip is about 1 mile and crowded.
We stayed here for one night. It was a pleasant stay. There is a lot to do and much of it is kid friendly. Our room was nice. I can't say much else, since we spent most of our time elsewhere.

$30\/nite RESORT fee, but there is no coffee\/tea maker in the room.  There is not even a mini-fridge to cool the hundred degree bottled water that we got from the strip.
I have stayed at hotels that charged less, and every one had a coffee maker.  The expensive hotels all do...

In spite of casino's low rating I really enjoyed this casino. Food was pretty good and the free entertainment was better than I thought. It was in the back bar somewhere. Although I think it had 2 drink minimum for free entertainment. It was a comedy magic show. I thought he was great.

Well, Vegas can be disappointing! some years back they started promoting it as a place to bring the kids, however they didn't say that after Labor Day the rules change and everything but the casino oh and the restaurants close early....what am I talking about?? Well here's my list: effective today!!?!! Adventuredome (which is why we come here)  is open 11am-6pm \/ the pool here closes at 7 pm and the circus that their known for last performance at 4 pm -- weekends are a little later, but I'm here today!
