So much for family fun!? If u come to circus circus you have a curfew no matter what your age. Minus all of the stars possible for that!!! You should see all the disappointed families and their children :(

And yes another kid friendly place!! We played games she won a big owl we got our drink on too.... i suggest you play with your kids in these kid friendly hotels in vegas! Its just amazing to play like a kid with your kids

I guess my biggest complaint is that there's no valet in the front anymore. My truck is raised 3" so I can't park in the structure. So taking it around back, there's a valet. It charges $10 and up.  So when they say that they don't charge for parking.. theres really a fine print. They do, if it's not a smart car. Besides that.. hotel is super old. Everything being old is to be expected. People complain that it's a gross casino, well it isn't for everyone. You gotta be in the mood for this place. Or have a need to be here. I did the Vegas Strong Walk from here. I appreciate them allowing us to start here. There's fright dome. Looks good and creepy. There's Vince Neil's restaurant. There's no other on the strip. Also I hear this is where you go to get the best steaks in Vegas. Just skip the buffet and it's not a place to take a romantic date. Go somewhere more upscale. For kids and teens it's perfect.

I was stoked about paying $67 a night and being not TOO far from other hotels, so I booked last weekend.

Biggest mistake of my life.

The room wasn't TOO bad except the ripped up pillow on the couch and the fact that it smelled like skunk\/weed as soon as you walked into the room. (Non-smoking too, btw). I loved that the bathroom was kind of separated from the room, but other than that, nothing was all that special.

One night we asked for 4 towels, and I don't know WHAT happened, but 40 minutes later, we had to call again to see what was going on because still we had no towels.

When we called again, they said OK, and we got a call a few minutes later. Someone asked, "Did you ask for a fridge?" Uh, NO? We asked for towels.

So a few minutes later, someone knocks, and guess who\/what is at our door. Maintenance... With a mini fridge, being dragged by the cord.

???????!?!?!?

I don't even know.

We told him we asked for TOWELS, not a FRIDGE, which sounds NOTHING alike, and he came back with THREE towels, and 2 washcloths.

Whatever...

We also checked out the pool with were filled with a bunch of kids splashing about and I got bit by spiders :( Drinks were nice at the cabana, only $5.99 for the slushy-type drink and you can fill it with whatever you want.

Definitely going to stay at a different hotel next time though.

I have stayed here 3 times in the last 4 years and I always enjoy my stay. My most recent visit was in the Casino Tower. The room was very big, super clean, and I slept very well on the comfortable bed. 

The breakfast buffet is awesome. I love the omelettes that are made to order. The fresh fruit bar is excellent. There are lots of beverage choices, juices, milk, soda, coffee and tea. 

My only complaint is, watch out for the guys trying to sell you a time share resort. They are very tricky. You think you are getting some free stuff but not so. Just walk away when they approach you. I was able to walk away before they went to far.

I have always avoided this place when in vegas and now I know why!! This is the first time in vegas with a child and whoa is this ever the place for kids! If you have kids, yes, go here! There is plenty of entertainment for children and even for adults who like roller coasters, etc. It was so busy and packed with people that it was challenging to walk through the area..kids running wild, people not paying much attention to one another, etc.  However, if you have kids, this is the place to let them be kids!
I am really glad we decided NOT to stay at this hotel after being in the public areas and seeing how outdated things were.

Pro's
Super Cheap
Rooms were actually spacey and the beds were pretty comfortable - hard to believe I know

Con's
Terrible location (you're going to have to taxi all over the place to get to civilization)
Club? no
Casino - not very fun... :(
Food - ick

The only reason I am not giving 1 star is because my kids loved it here.  The upper level arcade was pretty fun and the steak house was a nice hidden gem. 

We checked in and were given the total of the stay.  I confirmed twice that the price listed included the rollaway crib and was told it did.  I was sure to confirm because I didn't want a surprise addition on my bill at checkout.  well, sure enough, on checkout there was an additional $60 on my bill for the crib.  When I spoke to a manager I was told that I would be billed regardless of who I talked to and that it was their policy.  So that left a bad taste in my mouth after the stay.  For the stay itself.....

The rooms are ratty at best.  The linen was clean (thank god) but the carpet was thread bare.  You could feel the nails of the carpet runners with your toes.  In our room vacuuming must not have been a priority because both toe nail clippings and staples were found in abundance on the carpet.  

If you have a couple bucks, stay anywhere else.
The show in the Midway was great. Loved the.clown and loved Oksana the ballerina who hung from the ropes

WHAT I GOT:
- Leaky faucet
- Placed in the furthermost manor even though the closer manors are not fully occupied

WHAT I DIDN'T GET: 
- Coffee maker 
- Noise proof walls...The night is extremely loud with one side occupied by a playful couple and the other with children
- Consistent room service. Over the course of five nights, the bed failed to be made for two nights.

I used to come to Circus Circus every year as a kid. Now being here as an adult is kind of weird in a way... Nonetheless we were in the Casino tower and our rooms were clean which I appreciate. We weren't far from the buffet which wasn't bad and also spent time checking out the shops in Circus Circus. IDK what people expected, but I knew what I was getting into and it exceeded my expectations.

Wow, I dont even know where to start on this review.

Almost everything about the circus circus experience was horrible.

From check-in to check-out.  

Our room was so old and outdated, the tv must have only been 18 inches (non flat screen), and there was dust all over it!!!  The plug jacks were falling out of the walls, we had a non-smoking room that was obviously never really a non smoking room.  And I hate to sound crude, but the shower curtain had poop on it, like someone used it after they ran out of toilet paper (and no it wasn't us)The customer service at this hotel was the worst I have ever ever experienced in my life.  Rude, not helpful, mean ugh I could go on.  And it was every employee i encountered was this way....maybe thats how they train them??? 

There is NO ventilation in this hotel....Normally its expected but in such a kid friendly environment I would think it would be better.....the kids arcade was just of old stale smoke!!!  My son couldn't breath and ended up very sick !!! I, myself am a smoker and my lungs hurt from all the smoke and no ventilation. 

Room service got our order wrong, the Mexican restaurant got our order wrong.  The billions of sales people stalking you all over the whole hotel was out of control.

I could go on and on for days about certain situations while here but i would never have enough time......I will never ever go back to this hotel again and if I were anyone thinking of going I would re think it.....especially if you have young kids or kids with asthma or respiratory issues.  

Circus circus you should be ashamend

To hectic for me even with free rooms , buffet long waits , 4 dollar water at the deli , FYI run some straight water thru your coffee maker , gross , you won't want coffee there , be sure you remember where your car is . Looks like lots to do for kids . I coffee pots being that nasty really got me , I will be checking with water first before I ever make coffee again to be sure they are clean

This hotel needs to be tore down. It's filthy, dated and not a wise use of strip real estate. The room was much like motel 6. Aside from the bed bugs to deal with, it was really dated and tired looking. I would never stay there again.

I stayed here this past weekend because it was one of the cheaper hotels due to the fact that it was EDC weekend. The outside looks pretty crappy, mainly because it's old. It's at the end of the strip so it's kind of far from the main hotels. The inside doesn't look too bad though. The casino is okay. We stayed on the second floor (nonsmoking) and the room was surprisingly nice. I heard that there are pictures of clowns in some of the rooms so I was very glad our room had none. The beds were comfortable but the pillow I was laying on felt very weird. I was able to sleep on it but when I felt it, it felt as if they got chunks of cotton and threw them in there. The other pillows felt normal though. There are no fans in the bathroom so you can hear whatever business is being done inside. The water took a while to drain too so the sink flooded once because I wasn't paying attention. The bathtub takes a while to drain too but not when the shower head is on. There aren't enough outlets either. We had to unplug 3 different lamps in order to charge our phones. There's no fridge either so I had to throw away my OJ and it was just a hassle to keep getting ice to keep our drinks cold. Check-in is at 3pm and if you want to check-in earlier, you have to pay an additional $35. That sucks because we got there early and since we were tired, we had no choice but to. My friends told me they never paid an early check-in fee before at other hotels. Check-out is at 11am and when we asked for a later check-out, they said it'd be a $10 charge + tax so we left. I never had to pay for a late check-out if it was only an hour later. I don't know if I would ever stay here again. We'll just have to see.

Make sure to bring an extension cord and some Febreeze or something. 

It's entertaining for kids though as they have a trapeze artists performing at a certain time. They also have an arcade too. 

The McDonald's here.. EHHHHH. The FIRST thing I ordered was a small OJ. It was like $1.99. I ordered a hash brown and a sausage and egg biscuit after. I pay the girl, go to pick up my order, and there's no OJ. I tell the person who gave me my food and after going to the girl who took my order, she comes back and says, "it'll be $2.50." Uh. WTF? I ask if it wasn't put in and they both say no with this unfriendly look and tone. I told her I don't want it and left. Augh.

We came here because we have 4 children and thought we'd stay at a place that had lots of entertainment for them like the midway and Adventuredome. The room rates were affordable, but you get what you pay for... We stayed in the West Tower. Our nonsmoking rooms smelled like smoke and the rooms themselves were just OK- clean but not well maintained. Be prepared to spend a bunch if you take your kids to the midway or on the Adventuredome rides. The West Deli Cafe was also awful. If you're hungry, go elsewhere. I'm pretty sure we won't come back here again.

Stayed here one night, I'll probably never do it again.  I paid 24 bucks I think, so I wasn't expecting much.  The beds weren't very comfy, but the rooms seemed clean.  I didn't find any dust or mold anywhere.  Wasn't too smoky either.  The casino was ok.  I think I won 200 bucks on roulette, so in the end, they paid me to stay there.
Not very many perks but they have some good machines. I won a couple hundred bucks on a game called kitty glitter.

Road Trip
Summer 2016

5 days, 4 nights 

LIKES:
Located on the Strip
Clean room
Renovated
Roomy for 1 adult and 1 toddler 
Comfy beds and pillows
Great customer service (front desk, bellhops, 
housekeeping)
Express check-out
Family friendly
Cheaper than most hotels
Discount at Adventuredome, Circus Circus restaurants, etc

DISLIKES:
No microwave\/fridge in room
Swimming pool outside (needs more shade,
 sucks when it's 110 degrees)

To set the scene: It was about noon on a Saturday and I was trying to find a room in Vegas for that night. Didn't think we'd be able to get anything even remotely close to the Strip, but Circus Circus was miraculously not full yet. It definitely cost more than I would pay for an average last-minute weekend hotel stay, but for a night-of reservation in Vegas AND the fact that it was within walking distance to the Strip? I'd say it was definitely worth it. 

We were put in little buildings across a small street from the actual resort, kind of an over-flow situation, I think. All things considered, it was fine. The room was not immaculate, but it was definitely clean enough. I wasn't grossed out or anything like that, it was just obviously a little old and dated. It was not super nice, but it was definitely nice enough. We were comfortable sleeping there and it was just what we needed it to be for our little night-in-Vegas stop during a cross-country road trip. 

If you are trying to do Vegas cheap, but realistically, this is a fine place to stay. It's not the nicest place around, but it's probably the cheapest place for being that close to all the action.

This review is for the buffet - we stayed at a different hotel, came here for dinner with the kids.  It was outrageously expensive (80+ for 2 adults, 1 teen, & 1 child).  The food was absolutely horrible.  I mean, barely edible.  And cold.  We are a pretty easy family to please, we aren't picky, so if we say it's that bad, it really IS that bad.  Also, both of my children are vegetarians, and there was hardly anything at all they could eat.  The few things they could eat weren't good.

First it was quite hard to find my hotel room: this is a real labyrinth. But I guess this is more or less the same for all Las Vegas hotels.

What was a real pain is that Wifi never worked properly. I know it was during CES show, so, many many people trying to us it, but then, common, don't put a stupid paper in the room saying "you get free ultra fast internet". It was sometimes super slow, and sometimes not working at all.

It is a bit far (by foot) from the main hotels and attractions of the Strip, but the hotel by itself it ok, free (crappy) wifi, free garage.  Deli's had a not bad "sunwich" breakfast.

OK, that's one of the less expensive decent hotels so 3 stars looks fair.

This place is crap.  I know it's only $70.00 a night but this place is a dump.  We picked a non smoker room.  And the room smells like cigarette smoke.  The bathroom was the worst.  Pubic hair everywhere and sink was dirty.  The bed sheets was so dirty I don't even want to know what kind of stain was on it.  The pillow case stinks also.  The a\/c unit was blowing stinky air so we can't use it.  We have to open the window.  People was drinking in the hallways and the lobby.  This place is ghetto stay away I warned you.

Buyer beware: the budget pricing cannot make up for the downtrodden ambiance, decor and general air of this place 

Have mercy on yourself; and if you can't afford a better place on the strip, stay in motel 6 instead.
Differently a place for people on a budget that are not to worried about a questionable clean room.

For an old hotel it actually was a nice surprise that it wasn't as run down as I thought. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was nice, clean and well taken care of. There was a lot to do for the whole family. Yes it may not be the most luxurious hotel but that isn't really the point. We took a chance on it and it was a nice stay. I would come back. Yes it's a distance from the strip and doesn't have the best views but it's a good sturdy place
To stay. There are some things they could update like the carpets but everything else seemed pretty new or newish.

Total bait and switch!! I booked a room with a king bed, that supposedly had robes in the rooms. I got a room with 2 queen beds with no robes, no amenities, and the wallpaper peeling off the walls. 

The first room had soaking wet carpet and the smell of cleaner was so strong it was stifling. They moved us to another room with dry carpet, but the buildings main door had a broken lock so anyone could just walk in. 

That, coupled with the fact that we saw a pair of hobos leave the parking garage with stolen stereo equipment, didn't make us feel very secure.

The room was dingy and smelled weird. The wallpaper was literally peeling off the walls and there was mildew all over the bathroom. It was like a joke, it was so depressingly bad. The walls were paper thin, and there was also a bunch of construction going on outside.

I can't believe this is an MGM hotel. We would have been better off at a motel or travelodge, this hotel is foul!! No room service, no vending machines, absolutely nothing to make you feel like you're staying in a nice hotrl. 

Im so incredibly disappointed, and it felt like a complete rip-off. I thought I'd be better off booking directly though the hotel, but apparently they sell all the decent rooms to 3rd party booking companies, and all the rooms they book directly are in the off-site "RV Manor." Talk about adding insult to injury - they basically call it a trailer park!!

If I could give no stars I would. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!! Do not waste your time at this place. We drove 5 hours arrived at around 2AM  they asked us if we wanted to upgrade our room we did when we got our room it wasn't an upgrade at all. We called the front desk they said it would take 20 mins or more before they could help us! By the time we got to our new room it was 4AM. The next morning we went to the pool they wouldn't let my kids and I go in all at once I have 3 kids you can only have a party of 4 at the pool. That was the final straw for us we  left and went to a different hotel we will never return to this hotel ever worst experience. Never stay at This hotel

I booked this hotel with an EDC Travel package. This was only my second time in Vegas, I'd never heard of this hotel, and didn't know what to expect. 

Absolutely the worst place to book when you're planning on leaving in rave outfits to EDC everyday. I've never had so many dirty looks. 

It's a strange kids\/adults hotel. The Casino in Circus Circus is disgusting, all the slots were grimy, the waitresses that offer you alcohol were in their 50's but wearing a push up bra (so gross). The Black Jack and Poker tables are just as bad, super rude dealers that actually snapped at me for not having my id out when I went over to one. 

All the places to eat either sounded disgusting or were disgusting. The Steak House is suppose to be good but it was never open so I didn't have a chance. 

The Buffet, disgusting over cooked food, everything tastes bland or greasy. 
The Deli where the casino is, old fruit platters that are rotten, sandwiches made sloppy and taste worse than Subway. 

I was in the main tower and the rooms are so cramped. It's what I'd expect to see at a Motel 6 in the fact it's like they shoved a bed in a hallway. No mini fridge, no extra blankets, no extra towels, limited cable tv channels, no paper and pen pad, and they have a the bathroom basically in the closet so it gives this awkward wall right when you walk out of the bathroom, I almost ran into it five times during my stay. 

I saw a review state, "This place is so gnarly... and creepy.. like a Pedo Convention." This is exactly what this place is. 

I will NEVER stay here again or come near this place.

This place stinks...literally. It's one of the oldest "resorts" on the strip still standing (it opened in 1968) and it's WAY overdue for the wrecking ball. Granted, when you go to Vegas you usually dont spend much time in the hotel, but it is nice to have a room that doesn't smell like hookers and barf. It's cheap and you definately get what you pay for.

Family Oriented hotel. Excellent service everywhere my family and I went. Excellent room service . Beautiful rooms. Can not complain of the view very beautiful the room we got. Very great experience of Vegas\/Thanksgiving combo

It's a decent stay! 

I'm here for the weekend. But if I didn't have a car or tour bus or taxi cash - I honestly wouldn't enjoy this place. It's pretty far from everything, compared to the dozens of other hotels there are here in Vegas. But for it's price, it's a nice stay.

As for rooms, they're spacious and comfortable. Only thing I would complain about is it's lack of bathroom items. Only a small squeeze tube of shampoo for a room for two and a squeeze tube of lotion. Oh, and a Lego looking soap bar that doesn't smell that great. I haven't stayed in many hotels in LV, so this may be average.

It's a nice place to stay when you just want to sleep and shower. The showers are nice! As are the beds. 

Overall, it's a sufficient place with pizza on speed dial and a shiny restroom.

I would give this hotel a minus one, or a minus five, if I could. Or a minus sixteen, as my son says. I went with my kids and my sister, and her kids, and we all had the worst experience ever. The "upgraded" room was moldy and disgustingly filthy (really, you wouldn't believe the pictures we took), plus it was right next to the A\/C chimneys on the roof of the casino, so it was the loudest place to sleep in, even with the flimsy windows closed. But we needed to open them because the place raked like tobacco and cheap cigarettes, the walls, the carpets, the sheets, the pillows. My kids had nightmares. Yes, we had asked for non-smoking, but no, they said they didn't have any. The wing we were in was all smoking rooms, and it was all full of families with children. It should be a crime to put children (and even adults) in these rooms. The food in the restaurant was horrible. Not even the hot chocolate won the approval of my children. We ran off in the morning. We felt like we needed to be disinfected when we left. This is the WORST hotel I've ever stayed in! Don't come here!

I just got back from staying here over the weekend & I have to admit I'm very pleased with the remodeling done here compared to before how the rooms looked. I stayed in the casino tower we had 2 rooms one with a king bed & the other with 2 queens. Both the rooms were amazing the beds are so comfortable I felt like I was sleeping on a big soft pillow! I slept like a baby! The mattresses are of pillow top! The room was big & comes with a personal safe for free! And the free kering coffee is wonderful also!
I would really recommend this hotel & I won't be ashamed to do it now! High five Circus Circus for making this hotel more nicer looking & welcoming!

Used to come (and stay) here all the time as a child with family and our family friends. One of the few kid friendly areas around. Still is, though age has definitely taken it's toll on the place. 

The draw was the Midway (and Adventuredome, though I don't like their hours of operation). Better and larger than the midway at Excalibur Casino (where half the game booths are often abandoned). This is still a place I stop by as an adult, from time to time, especially when I'm losing a bunch of money gambling and I feel a need to win something tangible in return. [My carnival game of choice: the basket toss.]

There's so much history of this place for me, and for that, there will always be a place in my heart. I just wished there was a facelift to the place.

If I could give 0 stars I would. If you're planing to enjoy Vegas please don't stay here. Check in guy was lovely and energetic, tried to give us the best directions he could to the room. We were in some shady building across the road from the main check in, literally look us maybe 35 minutes to find the room. It did not feel safe to be walking around the building let alone stay in it. We arrived just after midnight, the window to the room was open leaving the carpet damp as it was raining, old slippers left behind I guess from the previous guests, trash under the AC unit and beds, only the bathroom light worked. We called the desk and they sent up housekeeping up right away, she was nice and did the best she could but knew it was disgusting. The water in the shower was cold and I mean freezing cold. We ended up moving to a different hotel which was 1000x nicer for the same price. Maybe the rooms in the actual hotel building are nicer but if you get put in the ones we did then good luck. Walking across puddles of vomit is not my idea of a vacation, kudos to the staff for sticking with the hotel.

If you like dealing with the mess at Chuck E. Cheese, then you will love this place...if you are like me and can't stand that atmosphere, then stay away from this place.  The casino and hotel are ok but the kids area is a hectic, scary mess...plus, it is so expensive!  Won't be going back here again.  We didn't get to see any clowns either...

I dislike this hotel, do not recommend it... i stayed there for one night yesterday sat. 12 and i find it very expensive. I payed $225 for a room in the manor. I am very un happy because it looks like a motel 6, i didn't expect circus circus to be expensive and low quality. First time i stayed there and certainly my last.

Came here while I was casino hopping with my girlfriend. It is very kid\/ family friendly with the midway games upstairs so I guess that's a plus, but was very crowded and a lot of children perpetually crying.The casino itself was very dirty and smokey with poor ventilation. The buttons on all the machines were dirty and sticky. Not impressed. The bartender was nice, but the alcohol selection seemed limited and if you are playing one of the games at the bar, they will only comp beer and rail\/house drinks.

Les suites y sont spacieuses et calmes. le buffet est garni rien n'y manque, au rez de chausse bien sr le casino, un cirque au premier, euh en fait au 2eme le rez de chausse compte aux tats unis comme le premier tage avec plusieurs magasins.

Why is the average rating 2 stars?  I mean, do these people who are rating 2 stars know what to expect from Circus Circus?  If you're expecting a Ritz Carlton, it's not going to happen.  I've never stayed here, but GET OVER IT.  Circus Circus is the best :)

I actually just visited last night (Sunday) and it was perfect 'cause it wasn't as crowded as it usually is on Fridays and Saturdays.  On Saturday, we had purchased tickets for Le Reve (a Cirque Du Soleil show at Wynn) here for 20% off.  The Midway was fun as usual and I won myself a soft, squishy, stuffed, pink piggy.  It's so cute, haha.

Only problem is that I dressed too nicely to be at Circus Circus, which was my bad since I forgot to change clothes.  If you're visiting Circus Circus, you seriously don't have to be wearing anything nice.  No name brand or anything, or all the people there will stare at you and make you feel unsafe - as though they're plotting of ways to rob you.

I honestly wouldn't recommend you stay here unless you really want to save money.  But to visit and have fun in Adventuredome and the Midway is totally worth it!

Awesome when vacationing with kids. We spent two whole days entertaining the kids. Room was huge must have been after the renovation because lots of previous reviews complained it was small. Good price for booking the day before and we stay for the weekend. Room service was very friendly. Only negative is the walk from room to main bldg in the heat was terrible.

Not impressed with this place. After making my reservation online and getting a good rate a month prior I showed up today and they had some secret new rates they said cause we had our reservation so long rates had went up so they had to charge us more. This hotel is old and needs updating BIG TIME. The room I paid extra for was upgraded thank god so that was nice.

This has to be the worst casino in Vegas. We wandered in here because it was somewhat close to our hotel and decided to play a few rounds of black jack. We quickly left. The clientele is awful- there were people hitting on 18s like they had never played black jack before. Additionally, the casino was extremely dirty. 

I will never be coming back here. There are too many well kept casinos in Vegas that I would rather hang out at.

Casino rooms were remodeled and beds are now comfy.  Definitely a nice upgrade to Circus Circus.  Although, I did enjoy the fact that we had to enter 3 different elevators to go from the casino floor to our room and back, mad struggle..

if whenever we're in vegas, we will not come back here to stay, dated hotel, other motels are better than this. its very dated still has the popcorn ceiling, wallpaper is peeling in the bathroom. hallways and room there is a smell to it, its "old and dusty", a bit dusty in the room, above the headboard, carpeting needs to be upgraded to a brand new cleaner one. we reserve a king bed but we got a queen bed, all the lamp shades (lighting) in the room were not plug in the electrical outlet. the ice machine and vending machine on each floor (has 3 floors) motor manor type were not plug in. if you're going to play in their casino good luck on your walking to the main building.

Went for 4th of July weekend, the check in was nice.  The room stank though! And the room was pretty far from the actual casino. Elevators were out of service! it was a nightmare at this hotel! Aside from all this a Chinese security lady practically kicked us out of the casino, she was being sarcastic with me telling me "that if u knew if i was at a casino" that I had to move. " I told her that i was waiting for a relative to come by, they had went to get a pretZel. And she did not care. I told her that she could be nicer to guests there, we had just spent alot of money upstairs at the arcades, if it weren't for guest she would have a job, she was very rude! Won't ever come back here! "It's not about what she said, it's how she said it!

Made reservation requested for non smoking. Customer service said she will put us on the SKY RISE tower which is the newest and closer to the pool. When we arrived front desk said we do not have any reservation on the SKY RISE instead he put us on the CASINO TOWER which according to him newly renovated. When we got into our room its dirty and smell like cigarette. We stayed there from Thursday until Saturday Sunday my wife had rashes probably bed sheets are not that clean. So will not recommend to stay there if you are looking for a nice place to stay and relax

As Circus Circus hotel is on the strip, I took accomodation in the West Tower, 29th floor, room 29816, for 11 days during the New Year Holiday Season through LasVegas.com. The entire back of my Mom's legs were scratchy, she put it down to some allergy that she might have contacted during one of the tours we took. I also had scratchy bumps on my face. Since there are no mosquitoes in US, I started searching the bed for any insect and just 3 days before my return, I discovered a bed bug in the morning, smashed it on the floor rug, and when my Mom tried to lift it from the rug, there was some fresh blood on her hands. 
We informed the house-keeping and the Main Desk. They sent up 2 Ladies from the Staff for the survey and they asked us to move to another room. Since, we couldn't take the time off for a shift, we asked the nice lady, Felix, to spring clean our room while we are on the Strip. Felix did a wonderful job, replaced all sheets, cleaned the room, did the bed, the bath very sincerely. But, bed bugs usually dig themselves into the bed frame and mattress and even in the carpets, so that was just a temporary thing. 
During checkout, when we requested compensation for the unsanitary condition of the room, we were directed to their risk management cell, which we have contacted after returning as I did not want to miss my flight then. The bite marks, especially on the backside of my mother's both legs are severe and scratchy and she is taking medical treatment. They told me that a formal report needs to be filed by their Security Division and was surprised that while we were staying in the Hotel no one told us to do the same. 
Point is, if the rooms have bedbugs, its way too much to pay $100 per day to just use it for sleeping at night and that too suffering from insect bites. Not to mention, if some of them manage to find their way into our luggage, we might end up building a colony of them right in our home. Instead of expediting such a serious issue, the Circus Circus management is busy pushing the buck to other departments.
I have stayed in so many 3-5 star Hotels in Maryland and never faced a BedBug problem. The Hotel needs to burn their mattresses and have their beds and carpets go through an extermination drill in order to make the stay of Guests comfortable at Nights. Whats more, I have little hope of getting any refund for the ordeal I and my Mom had faced during my stay at Circus Circus. If there is any development, I will come up to edit my review.

Well was so excited to take kids to the pool and slides. Slides were great but pools were nasty. If you are going to redo the park then redo the pools. I will not go back, they were green and gross. Ruined our trip we thought we would hang out in pool while kids were at slides...NOT!!! People sneaking in from the outside with beers and we couldn't even bring in water. It was ghetto and not worth it at all. Wish we went to Golden Nugget with the slide and sharks like we did last year.

Creepy, dingy, dark, and smelly, are a few words to describe Circus Circus. A bit of "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas" was shot here and unfortunately, I can see why, I can totally see having a nightmarish LSD trip here. The drink servers are older women dressed in rather skimpy outfits, which was somehow creepy. The roulette table did treat me well, and Circus Circus has some shows that would entertain your child if you choose to bring them, but that's all this place really has going for it.

We went here strictly so our young grand daughter could see the circus acts and play some of the kids games in the arcade. We did not stay here so I can't comment on the room quality. An old run down hotel that has a lot of wear and tear. The people who stay here kind of remind me of the folks you see at your local Walmart. The circus acts were only a few minutes long but ok especially for children.

I cant believe! I came here with my friends.someone took a lot of our money. Around 1000$.I asked a security what wrong with a door,its locked last night and opened in the morning.he said he didnt know, he had to check everything and let we know if he know  something.oh my god.they dont have camera and we cant check .i never come back again.

We chose to go to this hotel since it was dirt cheap and somewhat close to the heart of the strip. We booked at jail like manor rooms with the hope to get an upgrade. My pretty lady slipped the receptionist a $20 and we got upgraded to the new west tower room which was an awesome deal for 3 nights. The room was great, obviously very new with plasma tv nice comfy bed, clean and big bathroom. plus it had a nice view of the strip, I was expecting little kids screaming everywhere I looked but it actually wasn't too bad at all. We went in October so maybe its worse in the summer? The casino was ok, and sports book was tiny but not crowded. The buffet was like a old country buffet so average at best. The carnival games were very fun and we spent many hours wasting dollar after dollar trying to win a 50cent stuffed animal. It was a blast. Say what you will about this place, you get what you pay for. Great place to stay your first time in vegas as I learned. We we will likely go to a hotel closer to the heart of the strip next time, like ti mirage or new york new york. The deuce bus system is a great value but waiting 7-8 minutes between each stop , in front of every freakin hotel gets really annoying  and time consuming fast and better to just walk sometimes.

It was my first time in Vegas and I booked a deal through southwest to fly there and stay in the Circus Circus, I had a fast check in, and it was a early check in and unlike other hotels I researched I paid a very minimal fee compared to others. we got to our room which was a standard room, but I wasn't planning on being in the room much only when it was time to sleep. 
they gave us a food credit which we used for $20 pitcher of margaritas that were strong and perfect! 
The walk to main drag of the strip was fine, not too long plus we could wander into all the hotels. 
The adventurdome was pretty neat and the acrobat show was free and interesting. 
I would stay here again.

So people I would just like to through it out there... it's not the hotel's fault that you have loud neighbors. Or that there are kids there. Or anything related to other guests. So you shouldn't base your review off other people. 

That being said, I had a great time staying here. I did take the advice of yelp, and avoided the manor rooms like the plague. I booked through their website and reserved a Casino Tower room with a king bed. I arrived sometime around 3, and after a short line I was checked in. They charged me $190 for three nights and told me that the deposit I had paid was separate than the total cost and that it was actually $240 for the three nights. Meh. Okay whatever. Not too happy about it but I was tired and just wanted to get checked in. They gave me a coupon book, and a map with instructions to get to my room. 

When I got to my room I was expecting a kinda shabby but hopefully clean place. I didn't get that. I got a nice room with a couple chairs, a table, a nice TV, a safe, and a huge bed that was pretty comfy. Inspecting the room I did't see any bugs or signs of dirtiness. Inside of the bathroom was the coffee maker, a tub and shower, a toilet, a sink with a mirror and a hair dryer as well as clean towels, soap and shampoo. Having walked around all day and traveled overnight the first thing I wanted to do was take a shower. The shower does take a little bit to warm up...but after a minute or two, I had a nice hot shower ready with good water pressure.  The next day when I came back from being out my room was very nicely done... they even folded up the blanket I had for when I was traveling and put my stuffed bear in the middle of the bed by the pillows. There was clean towels. Definitely not any complaints about housekeeping. 
However, I did get woken up a bit early one of my three nights because of construction going on.... not sure if that is the hotel's fault or not though. 

I prefer to checkout at the checkout counter, and when I did they were confused on why I was charged $50 too much and refunded it to me. The checkout took maybe 5 minutes at most. 

So overall I'd probably stay here again if I came back. The minus one star is because if I hadn't done the checkout at the counter I would've been charged $50 too much which is pretty much enough for another night.

As I read all the lame reviews of this place, I have to wonder, what in the world are these people expecting for the price they pay to stay on the Las Vegas Strip?  Staying on the Strip on the weekend has prices that rival Manhattan!  If it's Sun-thurs, then you can afford to go to the bling bling hotels because the prices are usually 1\/3 or 1\/4 of fri\/sat night prices.  However, if you want to stay on the strip, be prepared to pay up for something nice.

If you came far enough to fly into Vegas (AKA not close enough to drive in) then dish out some more money to stay at a nicer place. This place is perfect for those of us who are either broke, have kids, or would rather stay somewhere cheap so they can spend the money eating out at Bellagio or watching shows like O. Or those of us close enought to drive out here 3-4 times a year and don't want to spend $1000's on hotel a year because we're not ballers who can get comp rooms at the nice places.  Seriously.  Anyways, who sleeps in Vegas anyways? If you sleep, then dish out the money and stay somewhere nicer.  Remember, those nice hotels have 100's of millions of dollars worth of debt in building them. No wonder it's $200-$500 a night to stay there on a weekend. If you want a good deal, don't come on a weekend or holiday.  (Yes, you can stay at places like Monte Carlo for $60 a night... but ONLY S-Thurs on promotion!!!)

Yes, this is a 2-3 star hotel, but I'm giving it a 4 because there are too many one star rating from dreamers who think they can stay somewhere nice on the strip for under $100 on the weekend. Dream on. Also, the extra star if for the great midway for those of us who don't gamble.  And an extra star for finding out I can get a room for friday and saturday night for a grand total of $215 four days before I leave for vegas.  Do I want to spend $550 to stay at Bellagio? I think not.....

Remember, location location location.  And be ready to pay accordingly.

for the price it was a very good and decent hotel to stay at. Adventuredome was right there in the hotel and gave us something to do at night. Hotel was clean and beds were comfy. Overall hotel wise, great stay.

Checking was horrible as check in man didn't know any info on our questions. We booked for our daughters birthday and only on arrival did they say the dome was closed down.  Then we asked to speak to someone else and they stated it was not closed down. Then he oplogized and said he didn't know.   Finally arrive in room and bathroom is so small you can't shit with the door open and or stand to take a piss. View was of construction. Carpet left our feet so dirty we walked around in socks but only to have those ruined as well. Carpets are filthy. They promote HDTV but only price standard channels. So no HDTV. Also the block you from changing source and preventing my daughter to play PS3 they so block buttons on TV. Luckily the PS3 turns the source automatically when turned on. As I called desk lady she said we block all those features. Lol well to bad Circus Circus I still was able to change to HDMI source you money greedy hotel. Took my daughter to the dome and she showed no interest. She was more into Vegas lights.  Lmao After 2days we left to another hotel. We checked in on a Wednesday and was going to stay until Tuesday 6days but left and never stayed for her birthday..  Sad in stated this to them and they didn't care. Just want to talk about money...

I just got home today from a three night stay at Circus Circus. We have stayed here for 25 years and always had an enjoyable time. This time however was marred by a few things that were caused by MGM's greed. We always have used valet and a bellman. As we pulled up to Valet.. there is a very large sign on the Valet booth... parking is now $15.00 per day.  As the Valet came to the car. I asked him if that included paid hotel guests.. Yes indeedy it does!...Shame on you MGM!..Not only is that a greedy act.. but you are also screwing the Valets out of tips! Which I know it is considered a tipping position and they are nailed on it on their taxes. but yet dont even now get near what the State thinks they do due to your charges on parking. so not only do you screw over a long time patron.. but your employees too.  Of course I tipped .. both arriving and leaving.  But I know alot of people do not do so now due to the charges for Hotel Guests as well.. Our room in the Casino tower was clean when we arrived but during the stay.. although we did get maid service (whom we tipped daily also) You could tell all they did was wipe up water on the shower walls and sinks.  Made the beds hastily.. no vacuuming... only one trash can emptied..We asked for two extra pillows and one blanket... waited four hours to receive it. after two phone calls to housekeeping of "we have been waiting..."  and assurances of "it will be right up!" and if you are a stayover you wont be serviced till well into the afternoon. One recommendation... Dont eat the Dinner Buffet.. Ick...But the brunch buffet was actually better than I anticipated. Unless things change here I wont be returning. Not that Im a cheapskate. but some of the Perks that drew me to this place are gone...even to the booklets offering discount coupons. Shame on you MGM

From the moment we entered the building and had to wait over an hour to check in after flying all night, it went down hill from there. If you like noise, and smell of smoke everywhere, bugs in your room, waiting for an elevator for 10-15 minutes. and crowds of people, this place is for you. The swimming pool, had well over 500 people beyond legal occupancy. The fitness center is a joke, broken down equipment from the 60's. A can of soda is $4. LOL.....trust me, this is the last place you want to consider. The wife won't allow me to book anymore trips on my own after this disaster.
Despite the view outside of my window, this place is pretty clean and it has free wifi. My room came with two queen size beds which was pretty comfortable to sleep in. I would come back here.

I don't understand all the complaints.  For the price and location Circus Circus is great.  If you are looking for luxury there are so many more options.  This is just a straight-up old-school Vegas hotel.  Good enough for me.  I stayed in the Manor and will come back.  I appreciated the circus performances inside the casino.  I also like how I can easily get to Downtown from Circus Circus.  Getting to the meat of the Strip and getting Downtown is like equidistant in opposite directions, so I prefer Circus Circus and the Stratosphere when I come to Vegas.  But if I were looking for Luxury I would probably stay somewhere like the Cosmopolitan, etc.  But Circus Circus allows a person like me who doesn't make a lot of money to come to Vegas regularly and enjoyably.  So for that, I salute Circus Circus.  Good job!  And I like this part of the Strip too because it is a little more authentic than the rest of the Strip.  Less Touristy.  A little more like I imagine Vegas used to be like.  Go explore the Downtown area by continuing North from Circus Circus on Las Vegas Boulevard.  Go ahead and walk.   It may get a little dodgy at points, but its not that bad.  I did it myself and I was fine.  Just don't look like a mark.  It's worth it.  The buffet is great at Circus Circus too!  I felt like I got good value for the price at the buffet.  I hear the steakhouse is great too from people I've talked to.  I'll try that when I come back.

Stayed here for 3 nights and it was fine. Not magnificent, but in line with expectations of a 2 star hotel.

I booked the hotel based on price never being in las vegas before. After reading the yelp reviews after booking, I was terrified. Horrified images came to mind like bed bugs and musky smells.

It turned out fine. A simple double bedroom with no frills. No couch, no kettle, no coffee maker, no fridge. I was in the highrise tower with complimentary parking conveniently located next to the tower.

There was an additional resort fee of 7.95 per night in addition to my vacation package. I knew beforehand so I was fine with the fee. It included internet which was a must for me, and worked with no hitches.

Circus Circus. It's what nightmares are made of...

It was the first time I have ever been inside the place. The last time I will ever go in the place. 

First of all...this place does not exist! Why in the world would you take out the Carousel Bar?!?!?!?!?? Out of all the things to do to a casino is to take out something that it's famous for?!?!?!!?

Forget it. I will never go back to Circus Circus! It's downright a nightmare. A dirty nightmare at that!
Worst casino on the strip in my opinion, worst buffet as well. Only come here if you must so you can entertain your children.

A friend and I stayed in Circus Circus after seeing the phenomenal rates online  Well, we certainly got what we paid for and then some.

To call Circus Circus a dump is an insult to all the other establishments who have worked hard to earn their rank as a dump.  From the lobby and the hallways, to your room, dirt and stains from Origins Unknown is the motif.  Rooms have peeling paint, loose and dirty caulking in the bathrooms and stains top to bottom.  Beds are flimsy, and the linens filthy.  And as an added perk, you can hear people using their bathrooms when you walk down the hallway.

Most of the clientle  (who come in all shapes, sizes and colors) look like they are on work release.  The smoking that these demons do with their children in tow (in a "family friendly" casino) makes the Bhopal Union Carbide Gas Leak Massacre look like a guppy fart.  Definitely a place for kids if you feel like putting the fear of G-d and cancer into the rugrats.

Most of the gift shops push imitation "bling".  We're talking pasty diamonds in the shape of a Mercedes Benz logo medallion strung on a chain and Yankee caps with multi color rocks sewn in the logo.  One can Over Gold (electroplate of course) quite easily.  Very plastic slip-cover clientele, serious fucking Ghetto.

The in-house restaurants are horrid.  Not one reaches mediocre.  A humorous antic-dotal of serving Mrs. Beasley's cat for an entree would apply, but I have a feeling other restaurants who do sneak in fried cat and other vermin on the plate, prepare it much better.

This doesn't mean Circus Circus is like Riker's Island.  Riker's has cleaner rooms, cleaner sheets and better food.   I advise you not to drop the soap when you shower.  Not because you'll be gang raped (although who knows who will break in)  but because your soap has hit the tub floor and must therefore be destroyed so as not to spread infectious disease.  Stand under the spillways of Hoover Dam instead.

This was a pretty fun place to take my 2 year old daughter and 8 year old niece. We went to the AdventureDome and my 2 year old got to ride the DC Bus, carousel and a hot air balloon ride.. Forgot what that one was called. They both had a great time and enjoyed playing some games and claw machines. We also enjoyed the other area of Circus Circus where there's even more games and the circus act. Overall had a good time and will be back
Haha this place needs to be sold and demo'ed. The rooms r horrible the food suck but u can win a stuffed bear

Not my favorite hotel on the strip, but inexpensive. Housekeeping is lacking. We had towel service the first  day.. no bed made. (Not saying I want new sheets but at least throw it together). The next day we didn't get serviced at all. Then at 845am on checkout day (not till 11am btw) the cleaning lady just walks into the room. Whaaaaaaat? The place has a funny smell.. lol. We started calling it "home" everytime we would come back from other hotels... based on that smell alone. The Internet sucks here. But the gambling is okay :) players club gives you a free 5$ play... and you collect points and money as you play. Just don't forget to collect those comp  $s  efore you leave.

Circus Circus is a good value if you want to do Vegas for cheap. They're remodeling a lot of rooms right now and they're not half bad. There's plenty of stuff to do in the hotel and access to other attractions nearby. The pool here is too small though and it 's also lackluster. I like staying in the motor lodge section of the hotel for easy access to parking and the rooms. Not bad if you want a little bang for your buck in Vegas. There're definitely worse places to stay.

Ok this isn't for circus circus as much as it it for the restaurant inside the hotel called "rockin ritas" I went there to order my gf her first liquor drink for her 21st bday and already upon walking in the place wasn't "rockin" besides that we sat down to order drinks she orders hers, I order a frozen margarita colored blue as shown in the drink menu and the server "Trinidad" chuckles at me I said "is there a problem with making that drink" he replies with "no it's just gonna be really inconvenient" I followed up with "really don't see what's so hard about making a blue margarita" He says fine and takes off,comes back with the drink 15 mins later we drink the drinks and I ask for the check I had to chase him down after being ignored for 10 mins while he sat and watched tv. promptly within 20 mins or so after leaving the restaurant I came down with a terrible stomach ache and nausea I'm not gonna say anything was done to my drink to cause that but it was strange that it happened only after drinking the drink in closing I will never go there again and it was a terrible introduction to my gfs experience into her 21st bday. :(

For $21 a night, you can't have high expectations when it comes to lodging. This was the case with our latest trip to Vegas, but Circus Circus certainly exceeded mine.

The good:

- Fast check-in, free room upgrade (for us).
- Plenty of extras ($20 food\/beverage, $10 slots) and amenities.
- Clean, above-average rooms.
- Lots of restaurants, shops and games.
- Few kids (in the middle of January).
- More open gambling tables than you'll likely find at other casinos.
- Cost.

The bad:

- A\/C will keep the room cold, but the fan won't stay on and is kind of loud when it does.
- Adventuredome was closed for repairs during our entire stay.
- Parking is very confusing\/inconvenient.
- Buffet is mediocre and overpriced.
- Distance from the heart of the strip.

The ugly:

- The people who immediately try to scam you with timeshare presentations when you walk in.
- That creepy 70s neon clown sign.

Overall, I'd stay there again if I were on a tight budget.

Besides the fact that you can gamble and drink while the kids go play with the "bigger" kids....they had two really great Henna Tattoo Stand (some kind of henna type tattoo, more ink, but nice that it stays black and doesn't fade to brown and supposedly lasts 3-4 weeks)!

Only charged me $35 for a pretty detailed one! The guy did it fast and when I accidentally ruined someone else's henna, they cleaned it up and retouched it for free!!
Nothing good or bad, nothing fancy,  just you average hotel,  the room was clean,  staff was fine,  wouldn't mind staying here again

Bigger than the one in Reno. The rooms are also nice and there are plenty of restaurants. Shanti was the receptionist that helped me and she is the reason I am writing this review. She went above and beyond to make sure our room was .

When I checked in the lady, Margarita, was nice, kind and very helpful. When we got to our room we had a nice view on the twenty-sixth floor. We were satisfied with the room since we weren't going to spend much time in the hotel. In the second night of our stay we discovered we were fooled by the cleanliness, we found chicken nuggets next to our bed. We moved one of the chairs that was in our way and we found a toddlers sandal.At night we ordered blankets and it took room service to bring it to my room a hour and twenty minutes. We were very disappointed. In the arcade we won a stuffed animal and the staff member was rude about my siblings joy of winning her animal on her own. The circus show they had in the arcade was impressing, my younger sibling was filled with joy and the stunt people were very friendly. To wrap up my stay, I wish I would have picked a different hotel near the Strip area. It's a nice hotel to pass and see but I don't recommend staying here.

3\/9\/16
We went into Circus Circus to get some food after doing a few hours at the mall. Once you walk up to this Casino\/Resort you really do feel like you're heading to the Circus. Inside there's a wide variety of shops, restaurants and of course gambling. Also, there are tons of rides and attractions around the casino.

If I could give this hotel NEGATIVE 100 stars I would.  I am absolutely ENRAGED!!!!!!!!  My friends and I stayed here this past weekend (rented out 2 rooms), already sketched out about how run down everything was.  On Saturday January 16, we left our room (FLOOR 24) to go out at 10:30pm.  By the time we came back around 4am, the door in our room was OPEN and most of our items were STOLEN.  First off, someone who worked there who had a key could have came in; secondly, the door we had was BROKEN.  That is the hotel's fault, they should have a secure door for their guests, right?!!  The THIEF stole a HANDFUL of our items including expensive and SENTIMENTAL jewelry, all my favorite makeup palettes, hair curlers\/straighteners, TWO MICHAEL KORS wallets, COACH PURSE, backpacks, SUITCASE, lotion, boots.  We immediately reported it to security and filed a case, but what really is going to happen.. is that it is going to sit in the file with all the other cases!!  We spoke to Officer Jim Harris and I asked if there were any security cameras we could check, can you believe they have NONE.  What if there was a serious legal issue that they needed to look back on the camera, yet they have 0. WOW.  WE FEEL ABSOLUTELY HELPLESS.  The security was not helpful at all, I called the lost and found desk and there was nothing there either.  NO COMPENSATION OR HOSPITALITY WAS OFFERED.  IS THIS HOW YOU TREAT YOUR GUESTS?!  I am writing this review to WARN others that this hotel is as SKETCHY and UNSAFE as people say it to be.  My friends and I are EXTREMELY SAD AND ANGRY, we feel very violated and now have a ton of missing belongings, due to an UNSAFE environment.  We made this long trek to Vegas from CA in hopes to enjoy our time with our friends, yet we left feeling disheartened.  I hope MANAGEMENT reads this review and contacts me, because we deserve some kind of COMPENSATION for all of our lost belongings.  As of now, we will NEVER return to this Casino ever again and share with all our friends and family about this TERRIBLE experience.

Time to pile on!
When I was a kid in the 60s this place was the place to go. I want you to think about that. 40 years of smoke and dirt and grime. That's what the casino is like.
I finally stayed at a room about ten years ago. Well, let's just say painted cinder block and a painting of a clown was the decor then. If you like the color orange you're going to like it here.
The plates at the buffet are plastic with little containerized sections-just like you got at the cafeteria when you were 12 years old! Which tells you something about the food.
A zombie survivor of old Las Vegas. Someone put it out of our misery.

This hotel offers numerous amenities that we didn't even have time to check out since we only stayed in Vegas for one night! Offer ample parking and is a very convenient hotel if you plan to take advantage of the hop on hop off tour bus! I would stay here again!
No complaints. Good price. Casino sucked. Stayed on the 13th floor. The lobby is very commercialized and lots of outlet stores. Would be a good place for kids.

Stayed here for Memorial Day weekend in the West Tower. Decided on this hotel due to the price. Check in went smooth and we were able to check in 2 hours early with no additional fee. Once we got to the room we were NOT disappointed. Room was clean and we had a nice mountain view. Restroom was clean. This isn't the fanciest hotel but its also not your Motel 6 either! We stayed on the 33rd floor and the elevators were pretty fast each time. The lobby was quite crowded over the weekend with people sleeping sitting down surrounded by their luggage. I don't know what that was about but it was no bother. Self parking SUCKS but its not too bad. You just have to walk a little bit depending on where you park. We did not utilize valet parking. The casino was clean and the staff were all very friendly. There are several spots to eat here in the hotel. We had buffet one morning and were not impressed. The deli has really good food and is always open. We plan on staying here again with the kids in the near future for Adventuredome. Overall we enjoyed our stay at Circus Circus!

SKIP IT.
We stayed here because my Mom wanted to relive her childhood visits. 
As soon as we walked in I wanted to leave, once we entered our room, we strongly considered leaving. It was OLD and gross. It is unfortunate since this Hotel could be very pretty and fun. It just needs a re-vamp. BADLY.

Although, this is a kid friendly hotel. I warn you to be prepared for a kid invasion. This is the hotel that parents drop their kids off at to go to the casino and walk the strip. They run rampant and loudly.

I stayed here about 10 years ago when I went to vegas with my family, and when my boyfriend and I were looking for an inexpensive vacation spot, I figured why not. Circus Circus recently renovated most of the hotel, so the creepy clown pictures on the walls and clown commercials when you turn on the TV are gone, yay! The rooms was nice and clean (we were in the Skyrise tower) and the house keeping staff were very nice. We enjoyed walking around the hotel and adventuredome and using all the coupons in the book they gave us at check-in. The only downside is that there are tons of kids and the people attracted to the hotel tend to be rude and oblivious to people moving around them, so after the 20th time some lady pushing a Cadillac sized stroller stops for no reason directly in front of you, you get a little irritated. All in all we enjoyed our staff and recommend the Blue Iguana for a quick and affordable bite inside the hotel.

I am so upset ! I am a local here in Vegas and I took my kids to this casino , both over the age of 21 with ID ! My son was cashing out his ticket , when a very mean pushy security guard came up swearing down his neck, my son doesn't drink doesn't cause problems , MR RIPPLE (security) asked for everyone's ID , we weren't gambling or drinking , he was pushy mean and swearing at my kids ! I asked for supervisor he refused, I tried to talk to information, no one would help us , I am never going to send anyone to this casino, I am so upset by the way we were treated ! Really sad they allow such a person any form of power , he laughed in my face , said I need to learn how to dress in Vegas , maybe wear some heels! Are you kidding me this is so disrespectful , I'm ashamed I ever spent a dime here ,

We brought the kids to circus circus because it's family friendly and has attractions for children and toddlers. We booked three weeks in advance and asked for a west tower room.  
The look from outside has not changed much in 20 years. The interior has a different look since my last visit in 94. The room we got was 35838 almost at the very end of the Hall on the top floor. Upon entering the 35th floor lobby you will be greeted by fresh air. not one iota of cig stench at all. The room was clean and free of any uncomfortable situations, no funky smells, no bugs, no loud neighbors. no smoke smells, there were a few stains on the chairs resembling blood, we covered it with something then sat comfortably. At the end of the hall is the stairs you can use in case of emergency. I used it to smoke\/medicate  because there was not a no smoking sign. Housekeeping smiled and cleaned the room great. we stayed three days. be sure to tip them ! 1-2$ Goes along way. 
                                  This is a family friendly casino with alot to do for the little kids. The adventuredome is cool my ten year old had a blast so did my 4,3,1-3\/4  year old. They have rides like happy feet, my Ten year old 5th grade straight A student liked the best. There are two huge coasters for those who like to feel queasy and Nauseous. They also have kids coasters, for the little ones to wild out on. One coaster takes a picture's of the little one's up close and, the shot you want no matter how long it takes. we went on sunday around 3pm-7pm. The kids games mostly pays out tickets to redeem for a prize. When you enter from the second floor there is a small store with candy and beer. beer was almost the same price as a liquor store. not over priced. A medical condition required my daughter to use a hover board to get around on. We were asked very politely By every security guard to not use it. When i explained her slipped capital femoral epiphysis They were understanding and allowed her to use it as a medical device. Use the photo booth it takes pictures in HD you get six pictures for 3$ very good Quality paper and a clear photo.
                                    we all ate at the buffet it was great. The food was fresh the service was friendly, be sure to mention the kids age. The menu had breakfast, lunch and dinner.No matter where your stomach was, it was safe. Two adults and four children ate for 65$ I thought that was reasonable. I ate one of almost everything and scooped a spoonful of as much diffrent things as I could try. Everything tasted fantastic. mussels\/clams are a must try!
                     We ate at the pizzeria twice the food is prepared by real people working hard and it shows, pizza tasted fresh. The tables were quickly cleaned for us to sit. I Took a second to thank the chef for cooking and working hard for my family. 
                      The sport book has no frills at all!!!down to the waitress. The craps were fun as hell. The evening pit boss was super cool at the craps table. Drinks flow like water on saturday night. The slots were tight as could possibly be.
                            In all my kids smiled and had a great time.Thanks Circus Circus,

DO NOT COME HERE. Despite the "deal" you think you're getting, I can reassure you it is not worth it. 

Summary: Un-cleaned rooms. Keys that don't work. Incompetent front desk staff. Riff raff guests. 

Long version: We should have suspected it was going to be an unpleasant stay as soon as the check in process began. There was a long wait and only a few staff actively working the front desk. Once we finally were able to check in, we were told that we could not add an extra cot\/bed to the room even though our request for one had been confirmed. We were told that it is illegal to put an extra bed in any of the rooms with two queens\/kings. Obviously, we did not want the hotel to break any laws, but they should ensure that the websites their customers use to book their rooms through do not allow guests to pick an option to add an extra bed if it is in fact illegal. Mishap #1.

We then arrive at our rooms. We had requested two adjacent\/attached rooms, which we were given. While the keys worked for one room, the second set of keys did not work for the other. Mishap #2. Fortunately (or so we thought) the inner door between our adjoining rooms was open. Once we went into the second room however, were we met with the 3rd mishap. It was disgusting. Beds not made, wet towels on the floor, toothpaste\/makeup caked in the sink, diapers in the trash, wrappers and soda cans everywhere. 

We called down to the front desk. We spoke to Francisco. Instead of letting us finish explaining what was the matter, he would talk over us, making incorrect\/incomplete assumptions about our complaint. When he finally shut up and let us speak, we had to repeat ourselves several times because he was not fully comprehending. We just needed 1- new working keys for the adjoining room 2- someone to come clean the adjoining room (that simple....). Because we were not communicating well with Francisco, we asked to speak to someone else. He said he would transfer us to a supervisor. For 5 minutes no one picked up the transfer call. We hung up and then re-called the front desk. Francisco answered again. Great. We explained no one picked up the transfer call. His response was "oh I'm not sure if any supervisor is there." Why would you transfer us to a supervisor.... If you didn't know if anyone was there to pickup???? Mishap #4. 

Since apparently Francisco was who we had to deal with, seeing as no supervisor seemed to be available, we once again re-explained the situation. He said he could try to call housekeeping and see if they could come clean it. We asked for an estimate for how long that would take because we wanted to go to bed relatively soon as we had an early wake up the next morning. He said he could not give us a time estimate. Since he was not sure if any housekeeping was on staff and what their availability was, we requested instead to just switch rooms. Of course, no more adjoining rooms were available. So we asked if we could just keep the clean room we had and switch the dirty adjoining room to a different one that was at least on the same floor (we have children, older but still would like to have them relatively close for both safety and convenience). Francisco said there was one more with 2 queens left on our floor. Fine we'll take it. It was literally the last room all the way at the opposite end of the building, but we were both too exhausted and frustrated to continue this phone bantering. We asked them to bring up 3 keys for the new room. 

The keys were brought up by Mike. We asked him to come with us to the new room, which he grumbled about because "I'm just the bell hop and I don't control if you can switch rooms if you don't like this one." My reply was that we didn't only want to check to make sure this room was clean, but also if our keys worked so that if they didn't he could bring them back down to get us new ones without us having to call the front desk and waste another 15 minutes. 2 keys worked, 1 did not. Mishap #5. We were pissed and our energy was spent at that point to even wait for Mike to get us a working 3rd key. We would deal. The room smelled musty and damp, but we were tired and it at least looked like it had been cleaned after its last guests. 

Tips about rooms themselves: As previous comments have mentioned it seems the Manor buildings house the worst of the hotel's accommodations. They are across the street from the casino\/front desk. There are only 2 open outlets in each room. Bathroom has a pretty poor venting system. Wifi is available but only in the rooms. 

When we thought we could finally lay down, we were met with the sounds of screaming and arguing outside in the hallways. Finally through babies crying next door, we got to sleep. When we woke up in the morning, eager to leave, in our building's main entrance was a drunk man making obscene noises and crawling (literally crawling) up and down the stairs. Guess we will take the elevator. 

Never have been so glad to leave a place.

I'm really surprised at all of the negative reviews. I guess some people don't mind, or can afford to drop a couple hundred per night on a room. This place might not be as modern as some of the other places on the strip, but I found it to be very nice and affordable on any budget. I just don't see paying a lot on a room when you're only there to shower and sleep. At $31.00 a night, you can't beat that, especially being so close to everything else on the strip. I'd rather spend $31 a night on a room and have more money to have a good time. 
  My room was very clean and quite large. It was the same as Holiday Inn's, Hampton Inn's, Comfort Inn's and various other chain hotels I've stayed at all over the Country.

I wish I didn't have to leave any stars. I give this hotel, guest services, and housekeeping no stars at all! Our bathroom was filthy. We let housekeeping and front desk know about the conditions of our room. I have stayed in many hotels on and off the Strip. They should be embarrassed of their rooms and their service. Guest services did nothing to resolve our issue or make us happy. So be warned before you dare stay here. The toilets were by far the worst that I have ever seen. I will be posting a few of the photos. Yazman the supervisor in housekeeping was the only pleasant part of our experience. Other than making sure our room was cleaned her hands were tied. Cindy at the front did NOT care about customer service or making a customer happy. Good thing there's Yelp because now you all know who to avoid and not give your business to.
You get what you pay for. It's cheap for a reason. Great place to stay when you know you won't ever be in your room and just need a place to shower and take a nap.

i almost feel bad giving this place 2-stars...i mean its a given that its only worth 2 stars and any and everyone who books here should know not to expect much...that being said.. i'm still giving it two stars haha. definitely brought back a lot of memories of random trips to vegas with my family when i was a little kid, but its definitely aged and not as fun and exciting as i remember it. haha. 

while i have indeed experienced much better, comparing this hotel to the other low budget hotels in vegas, it wasnt too bad at all. its definitely really crowded, but the front desk agents move pretty quickly and check in was smooth and quick.  we did have a little trouble finding our rooms because we thought we were in the manor rooms (which are separate from the hotel and have its own parking lot), but we were actually in the tower, so we did quite a bit of walking back and forth. haha but that was our fault.

the room itself is pretty ghetto, but i mean for $20 a night, it definitely served its purpose for our one night spontaneous trip to vegas with my friends and it was fairly clean. im glad i can now say that ive stayed at some of the best.. and some of the not so great.. hotels. really makes you appreciate putting in that extra $30 to stay somewhere nicer.  but it IS really close to the wynn\/encore, which is where i find myself partying all the time, so cab fare is cheap!

I have never been a fan of Circus Circus.  I thought it was dirty, old and the nagging smoke was offensive.  I just took my  kids to Vegas for NYE and we were told to try the Adventuredome.  I have to say that my babies had a ball at Adventuredome (we spent and entire day there and had purchased tickets to come back but did not get the chance).  The games upstairs were great as well, as they were decent with the number of tickets you received for each winning game.  We had a ball!

Robbed!!

While traveling for a work event, my coworker and I decided to stay at Circus Circus. We came back to our room around 11:45pm and while sleeping, our room was broken into and our wallets and my coworkers phone was stolen. They went through our personal belongings, luckily neither of us brought our computers. 

We were robbed- inside of our room- while we were in it!


I was sleeping in my underwear since the building is hot and was totally exposed while this was happening in a space that is suppose to be secure.

When the security came he took our statements and gave us information to contact a third party of Circus Circus and that maybe they'll be able to help us more. I requested the hotel manager to come speak with us and the security manager came instead with no more information than the first man. 

There are no cameras in the hallways and no other manager has been up to make accommodations so we can fly home. We both had to cancel all of our credit cards, all our cash was taken and have no identification to rent a vehicle or even pay for a cab.

This place was AWESOME aside from all the families\/kids and weird smell they pump through the casino floor.

Sharon at the registration desk was super cool. Got us a 30th floor corner room in the west tower and it was CLEAN! From reading the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to stay here but hey, why give up free comps? Glad we did not let that deter us from checking it out. 

Not much food options at this spot as well. Thy bf and I ended up walking out of here for food. 

Gambling is meh. I lost but the bf made up my losses so why not?

Will only come back if they give more free comps, otherwise I'd only come back should it be a last minute thing.

Of course, this will not come as a surprise to anyone, as this is very old news, but this "hotel" is a disaster. Vile, filthy, disgusting. Literally, there was a foul odor the entire 3 days I unfortunately had to stay. I couldn't guess when the last time this place was actually cleaned. 
I called ahead of time to ask whether the pool would be open during my stay, and I was told yes. Of course, that was a lie, as the pool was closed. And the manager rudely refused to refund my resort fee. 
The TV in my room didn't work. The phone in my room didn't work. There was no hot water. Two elevators were broken. There obviously was a major leak, as when we arrived,the carpet near the reservation desk was soaking wet, and smelled of mildew, and there were large trash cans strewn about to catch the water coming down from the ceiling. There was a blackout every day we were there. Literally pitch black. Still, no refund. 
The sheet on my bed had a gigantic rip in it. Complained, but it was never changed. 
Not one person was helpful. In fact, they all seemed to go out of their way to be rude. I can only imagine that they were all tired of hearing complaint after complaint from all their guests.
Truly a rotten experience, and I look forward to the day when this dungeon is imploded.

I have to add a star, it doesn't even deserve one.. This is the worst hotel I've ever been in.. They just wanted my money and get me going, they don't even wanna give room service.. This really sucks.. Yes..

My husband and I went to Circus Circus 6\/14-6\/21 for our 16th annivesary\/vow renewal. After reading all the reviews about the hotel, steakhouse, and all things negitive. I still booked at Circus Circus because of the package at the Chapel of the Fountain. 

1. The chapel was beautiful and the renewal was done with every option I asked for. Maria was a great help and made sure everything went well.

2. The steakhouse was the best....I have been trying to recreate the steak I ate to no success....It was cooked to pefection. The free bottle of wine was a great complement to the meal. The garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. They also gave me free chocolate cake on account of my vow renewal..It was just okay, but how do you complain over something that was free.

3. My room was the best...we stayed in the whirlpool suite which had a fridge which was great because I was able to buy a case of pop instead of spending 3.50 for one. It was also cleaned    everytime I requested. 

4.The Adventuredome Roller Coasters were better than Cedar Point which I go to every year. I think this is because your inside of a building so they were scary. I loved it..

There was a few things that I didn't like so that is why I only gave 4 stars.

1. The people that hound you about a timeshare. After staying a week I was done with the harrasment. 

2. The children in the gaming areas were a surprising shock.

3. It was a far walk to everything besides CVS and McDonalds.

4.There was also an electronics festival going on and it was half naked young men\/women everywhere. 

These are the only things that bothered me. I had a wonderful time and would go back without a thought because I have seen Circus Circus with my own eyes and I know its a great deal. The negitive reviews will make you think twice, but I went with 0 children and was able to be a kid at heart once again.....

I haven't been here since I was 9 years old and decided to take a little vacation. Chose to stay here because my family did in the past...

I stayed here for 2 nights. Made last minute reservations with no problem too. The room I got was huge, had couches, big flat screen tv, and very clean.. Stayed in the "Casino Tower" and I'd definitely come back. Out of about 5 hotels\/casino, this place was the cheapest out of all of them. And they have the lowest "resort fee" too. Free self-parking in the garage..

I don't know why so many people complained about this hotel. It was clean, cheap, and the rooms were very comfortable to stay in. Huge bathroom.
