Our rooms were cleaned everyday by the very kind maids. Tons of room to put clothes. 2 safes. Great view of Vegas and so much to keep you entertained right inside the hotel itself. They have a huge carnival place for everyone of all ages to go enjoy themselves. Tons of gift shops and a very huge casino if you love to gamble. They have arcade games for the little kids and big kids. Bars are located right near the casino. Friendly helpful staff. I would go back. Only complaint I honestly can come up with is there is no refrigerator or microwave. Those were the only downfalls I can think of and that's not enough for me to not go back. Definitely give it a try folks.

I never thought I'd say this, but it's true: Circus Circus really is A-OK.

To be fair, I stayed in one of the (most) recently remodeled rooms in the West Tower. This gave me easy access to the hotel lobby and the cab line, although it put me pretty far back from the Strip. However, if you're staying here, you're probably going to be taking cabs a lot, as it's easily a 30-minute walk to anything that's not the Riviera.

I only stayed at CC for about 36 hours, but I wouldn't have minded staying longer, especially with a big group. There's plenty to do here - penny slots, cheap blackjack, bars and restaurants. If you want to use the Deuce bus that runs up and down the Strip and to Downtown, there's a stop with easy access.

Bottom line, if you're coming to Vegas on a busy weekend and can't find anything at a reasonable rate, give Circus Circus a try. Just be sure to bring a lot of cab money.

Basic hotel, basic amenities. Not bad for a nights sleep. Bed was comfy. But... I was looking for a wall charger spot for my phone and looked behind the bed where I found some dirty socks looked to be covered in a little dust laying under the head board. They should do a more thorough clean and check all angles of the room and under the entirety of the beds.

I now know how batman feels after fighting the joker.  This is the place of nightmares for anyone. Its sick, creepy, disgusting and gross. 

Just look down on the carpet and you need to be an CSI crime investigator to determine what the heck you are walking on. I would not be surprised if there are unidentified diseases all over this place. 

You know how they are trying to figure out what to do with those terrorist from Gittmo? I say, clear out this hotel and put them in this hotel as torture prison. lol. 

No one would cry if terrorist decided to attack this dump. Seriously, this place need to be locked down by the center of disease control. This place is so disgusting, you need a pathologist to explain it to you. GROSS.    

Walk around circus circus then go to the wynn and its like going from Hell to heaven. I feel like I have to throw up just thinking about this hotel.
Never go back. Went to do yoga and floor was soaked in our room- hate to think why. Outdated and Adventure dome more for young kids

Booked a room here online for really cheap. Clue 1 ignored... 
Walk in, its very outdated. Clue 2 ignored...
Go to check in and its a long line with the people from wal-mart... clue 3 ignored
All this aside, the staff was very curtious and friendly.
The room is ok, still unclear why theres a lamp right up in the curtains next to the window. 
I go to plug in my phone charger and not an outlet to be found. I had to move the end table and unplug the crappy alarm clock just to get an outlet next to the bed. 
Finally, morning. Go to take a shower and theres no hot water... wtf. How can you charge a resort fee for this kind of Motel8 experience !?? 
If you want the motel eperience with a hotel price. This is the place for you.
My advice....pay a little more and get a real hotel.

I stayed at Circus Circus this past weekend. Our stay was perfectly fine aside from the issues we experienced with the door to our room. Evidently the door didn't always lock whenever the door shut (the security later made this sound like a common problem) so when we were gone, the door was basically open to anyone to come in. 
We came back after clubbing on Saturday night to discover that we didn't even need to use the key to get inside and that many of our items had been stolen (Coach bag, Michael Kors wallet, cologne, clothing, curling&straightening irons, make up, boots, jewelry, credit cards, and my backpack with all my notes for school -_-) 
We contacted the security who basically offered us nothing other than an incident report. They wouldn't check their security cameras or confirm if they even had any, while the hotel didn't offer any sort of compensation. Only the maintenance came to repair the door in the morning and told us "at least this won't happen again" uhmm, cool thanks? We were leaving and all our stuff was already gone.
My friends and I all tried contacting the hotel on repeated occasions. I was never able to speak to a manager, and like my friends, was instead directed to "risk management" who wouldn't claim responsibility for the fact that the reason we had been robbed was because THEIR door was broken. 
Even worse, when speaking with the security, they described how frequently "door pushers" come through the hotel and push on the doors of the rooms to see if they will open since they oftentimes don't lock as they should. 

TLDR; The room wasn't bad at all, beds were comfy, buuuut that doesn't make up for the fact that hotel is not a safe environment and your room will be vulnerable to intruders. Also, in the event that something does happen, the hotel will do next to nothing to assist and take fault when they should.

Talk about DUMPY.  OMG, this place is a dump from head to toe.  Seriously, you couldn't pay me $1000 a night to stay here.  Our first time in Vegas, we stayed...'cause we didn't know better.  But we would never make that same mistake again.  Complete DUMP.  You feel like you're in a creeped-out\/acid-laced version of Alice in Wonderful.  Seriously -- don't stay here.  And even if you like clowns -- these clowns will FREAK YOU THE FUDGE OUT.  OMG.  This place.

Janet Edwards is a rude manager that needs class from her employees and customer service etiquette! I give her the 1 star because I cannot rate her lower than that!! I get it is 4th of July and there's a lot of people. I booked my stay at the Cosmopolitan and expected my father to do the same for my brothers and him as he is celebrating his 50th birthday. She mocked my Father and became extremely unprofessional when he told them he wanted to cancel and was fine with forfeiting the charge for his room stay and taxes. The email reservation clearly states that if he canceled within 72 hours of arrival, he would forfeit night stay and taxes. There is no fine print that states that if you have already checked in that doesn't apply. The front desk clerk was extremely professional and explained everything step by step as her manager yelled at her and said to collect every key and not upgrade anything! He never asked for anything more from her and just wanted her to honor what the email states. She wouldn't read it and said she didn't care and had smart remarks and her attitude was overall nasty! He booked directly from the site and not a third party. I'm glad It's never crossed my mind to stay here, I'm a combat veteran with a service dog. Would she have thrown me out and my service dog ?! This manager needs to be demoted or FIRED immediately ! It's absurd she is the highest ranking person on the premises and you can't complain to anybody else until tomorrow. I did cuss at her because I never thought a manager would act like an employee who got court order to work here. A fight even broke out in the middle of the lobby and she did nothing to stop it! The fight went on for 20 minutes before bystanders intervene. How is she even a manager ??!!!! I asked her for her name before walking out and she said, "You don't scare me! I'll never get fired or reprimand!

BED BUGS !!!!!  Checked in went to bed woke up with bites all over my body. I asked to move rooms and have that night refunded  they refused said they had to have a exterminator come in and prove there was BED BUGS.  Right - like their ever going to admit there was bed bugs in the room. I have pictures to prove my bites. Came here only because we thought it would be fun for the kids - never again - We'll be lucky if we  get out out of here and not have a head full of lice also

If I wasn't required to post a star, I wouldn't... First off, this turned in to be a girls trip that was intended to be "cheap" and "affordable" for everyone, so it's all my fault. Unless I wanted to fork up full payment myself or to drive 5 1\/2 hours to vegas solo, I agreed to stay here. Why not. The bellman , surprisingly, showed up quickly with our luggage (now apparent to me, because Everyone else is at 3+ star hotel) and the first words out of his mouth were, "why are you guys staying here". Hmmmmmm, this seemed like a great time for a shot, with the bellman! Kidding. The bathroom was very outdated, the shower filled up past my ankles before I could finish squeezing soap into my washcloth. There was what seemed to resemble a blood stain on the wallpaper directly outside of the bathroom. The windows wouldn't open, we were on the Third floor and they were sealed shut from the outside. Ironically, because after spending 5 minutes in that room we all needed some fresh h20. Easily spent 400$ in slots in circus circus casino the first night and didnt win diddly squat. I managed to come by 2 beers on the house, which in the end costed me $200 a piece. Ha!

Going here as a kid, I really liked this place. I didn't notice anything about cigarette smells, dirty rooms, old furniture, whatever. The place has an awesome adventure dome, awesome restaurants (from my perspective, the mozzarella sticks at Pink Pony were fab) and it's huge. And it's in Vegas. If you have kids, I recommend Circus Circus, because trust me, they will not care about the aforementioned flaws. They will care about the awesome things. 

Best part: one of the ticket machines broke down in the adventure dome, so we went and got a staff member to help out. As he was fixing it, a whole bunch of tickets came pouring out (a malfunction of the best degree) and the guy gave them to me to keep! I didn't even have to play games to win them. Just got them for keeps, just like that. So off I went and cashed them in for an oversized stuffed animal (a dog, just for those who are interested), and it still sits in my room, I can see it as I type this.

And this is why Circus Circus rocks.

It's fun...
This place has live shows and lots of little shops to spoil yourself with. I got ice cream and and burger. And I sat and watched a few acts for free that they offer. Its like being at the circus and all the employees are extra nice. Hmmm I got popcorn and they gave me a huge free water with ice! I liked that they have a lot of nickel machines to play slots. This is a nice place to hang out I will be back ASAP. This place is cool it does not break ya bank and most of all you will have a nice time if your with family its super kid friendly and family focused.

When I get to hell, it will be exactly like Circus-Circus. Satan will be operating the Ferris wheel. The legion of demons will clean the substandard rooms. Beelzebub will be the concierge. Since it's hell, you'll never be able to leave; so why not watch the trapeeze show? Play the midway games? Get trampled by ill-behaved children? Why not?You're trapped in hell...you should get your money's worth.

Circus Circus: Hades for overfed America.

Even Though alittle outdated and not real fancy like the rest it's all in all a nice place as well as cheap to stay. This trip was my second  to Las Vegas and I stayed at this hotel both times because it was affordable not to far from everything and still okay to stay in. Upon arriving as expected it was alittle crowded even arriving at midnight local time. But quickly the line went we were checked in and shown our room. Beds were soft it was your basic room with the exception of no icebox which was fine considered when your in Vegas you don't spend much time in the room. The hotel features:
Pool
Shopping 
Gambling 
4 restaurants 
Nail salons
It's on theme park equipped with roller coasters,
Shows for kids an much more. 
 It's also located kinda in the middle of the strip not to far from all the action either way you walk. An trust me you will be doing a lot of that. Its also located right where a 24\/7 bus stop is just incase you don't really feel like hurting your feet from walking constantly day and night. I think if I do go back to Vegas again I would stay here.

I was waiting for something momentous for my 200th review, and leave it to Las Vagueness to make that happen.

When the Las Vegas strip was still the Las Vegas strip (let's say pre-1990); when it was a flagging, sagging, ultimate kitsch and unmatched destination for anyone from the downtrodden, to the rat-pack high rollers, mafiosos and Winnebago set, I came here with my parents to blow through for a night, enjoy the scene, take in some hotels and see what the place was all about. My parents and I had just come from a drive-through of Death Valley (a whole other story, for sure), and we checked into none other than The Flamingo, aka, the original hotel of William Wilkerson and Bugsy Siegel, and first outpost in this dry, middle-of-nowhere desert experiment and nascent empire.  The hotel was definitely updated from the original, but probably not by much. I believe it was owned by Sheraton at the time. Props to Bugsy, who met his untimely demise in a hail of bullets, largely because of his dealings at The Flamingo. 

After checking in, we made our way down the strip by car, and as you looked way down the boulevard, all you could see was a collage of neon with brands familiar to those at the time, Sands, Sahara, Caesar's, Dunes and others. One sign dripped into another, making it hard to distinguish which sign was nearer or further, but creating this magical electric landscape that is unmatched by anything up to then or since. Along our route, we stopped into Circus Circus, where my parents doled out $5 in quarters for me to crank into the pinball machines on the second level of the tent (no longer in use), while they pumped their own respective $5 each into the nickel slots. Yes, my teetotaler parents were also high rollers.

Them days were magic. That neon collage is burned into my mind, but alas, that place called Las Vegas is no more.  Now, the city is the home to conglomerates, with one gi-normous multi-thousand room hotel connecting to another, and a competition as to who will have the latest, the most glamorous and the most outrageous concept, the best restaurant, the most Gucci\/Ferrgamo\/LV stores packed into their weird indoor\/outdoor mall that's supposedly meant to transport you to Paris\/Greece\/New York\/wherever. It's a little much. That's Vegas for ya, right?

Few places in Vegas retain even the slightest vestige of those years gone by, but Circus Circus is one of them. The unabashed cheez-whiz veneer envelopes an interior that bursts with Velveeta-y goodness. I'm sure the rooms are seedy; I'm more than sure that staying here might not be the best idea if you want luxury, but Circus Circus delivers on so many levels, it's hard to even describe. To me it's de rigeuer on your Las Vegas hotel tour. Don't expect the Bellagio fountain show here, though. This is a horse of a different color, but absolutely positively brilliant in its own way.

To wit the following:

* Mutant bartender at the bar all the way in the back, dressed in cheez-tastic bartender outfit that hearkens back somewhere in the range of fifty years.
* $1 Jello shots in your choice of flavors: red, orange, yellow, purple.
* Same said $1 Jello shots pulled from the refrigerator and served to you in, yes, believe it or not, plastic Solo cups replete with cover for portability.
* Very obvious hooker sitting at the bar waiting for customers. The convergence of heroin un-chic, bad tattoos and massive cleavage were something to behold -- and ultimately make you want to spray yourself with Lysol and Febreeze.
* Harlequins-on-acid mural at the top of the escalators in the back that are hard to even imagine painting, let alone commissioning and approving.
* $4 bedazzled light blue (and white as an alternative) t-shirts that have Circus Circus emblazoned across the front in the old school style.

This is barely scratching the surface of this gem. Folks, if you walked into this place without irony, you got what you deserved. You don't get it, and I feel dramatically sorry for you.

For the rest of you who have some nostalgia for what Las Vegas really should be, what it used to be, and what it no longer is, this is where you can find it.  A must-see. FIVE FREAKIN' STARS, BITCHES.

THEIVES! THEIVES! The staff wasn't that welcoming, they seem like they didn't even want to answer any questions. Then we're gone most of the day 2\/27\/17....We get back around 8pm. Start going thru our stuff and her $200 dollar bracelet is gone. She isn't materialistic. However that is one of few things she loves! It's gone! We filed a report and tried to see if they would comp the room! They wouldn't! That have terrible service and maids! We decided to take the hit on the nights we stayed and still going to leave! Wow!......

WHAT A DUMP!!!!

Mold in the bathroom, tub facet will not turn off, cracks in the walls, stain in the room's carpet, broken outlets, booth the phone and the clock are broken, AC works the front plate keeps falling off, TV works but its circa 1990's tube style.


It almost funny how bad this room is...  Stay anywhere but here...

FYI.  WiFi is 5Mb free then you pay.

Circus Circus is best approached with a healthy dose of irony irony.  If this is your lodging of choice in Vegas, you'll appreciate it far more if you use the ducats you save on room and board to fund a complete and total 24\/7 bender.  You won't care nearly as much about how dingy the place is, and you may find unintended humor in the following:

1) there is actually an RV campsite associated with the hotel.  Right on the strip. This contributes to the unusual and entertaining mix of people from all different walks of life at the casino.

2) the official mascot is a clown named Lucky, whose ugly mug is plastered throughout the hotel.

3) there's a 24 hour long "circus" act performance right in the middle of the casino.  Too bad they don't have live bears and lions - hilarity would ensue if one escaped and ate 30 senior citizens at the slots.

4) the steakhouse, which seems to have taken its decor cues from a '70's porn movie, is rumored to be the best in Vegas.  

5) there's an amusement park right in the hotel, complete with a roller coaster and carnival games.

If I managed this joint, I would turn things around by requiring all employees to dress in full clown regalia (including casino dealers) and install a strip club where the performers were also required to wear clown attire (at least at first).  If business didn't pick up immediately, you'd at least then have an excuse to follow some of the suggestions in the other reviews about tearing the place down and building a new hotel (or parking lot).

This place is a dump. The rooms are barely adequate, mold in showers and smells like smoke in non smoking rooms. 
The maids woke me up every day out of a 5 day stay which sucks after being up late in the casino. The staff offered nothing for this inconvenience.
Guess you get what you pay for as it is cheap here but I'll definitely new staying at a nicer hotel next time as I like sleep.
All the food is overpriced and complete tasteless crap.
Cold french fries, dry sandwiches,  tasteless salads and weak drinks. 
Not a fun experience to say the least. 
Not sure how they stay in business. 
Good luck if you decide to stay here..
You won't see me again.

Okay..   my family and I have been staying with this hotel for almost 10 years. At least 1 time each year and occasionally 2 x a year. This visit we had company. My brother in law and his wife. They are in their 60's and I was trying to help save them money ao I suggested Circus Circus.  BOY was I DISAPPOINTED!!!!!! 
Check in was great,  1st in line at the VIP area, lady behind counter had awesome personality and she was quick.  That was the best of the week.
I booked reservation 8 weeks in advance. Prepaid for everything ( 2 rooms). I requested Casino tower, a high up floor and close to elevator and single bed. 
We did get Casino tower,  not too high up, 10th floor, and the kast room furthest away from elevator  x 2 rooms. Okay. I can deal with it.. 
Upon entering room, we inspected it and found mold in the bathroom and hair wirh black specks in tub. This is unacceptable!! So we changed rooms. Okay on we go. We were hete in March 2017, now they gave removed all the mini fridges and coffee pots. You have to request and pay extra for fridge , WHAT!!
The coffee pots have been removed due to an accident in a room that could have resulted in a lawsuit. Okay.. now I am frustrated. 
Still, we deal with it..  Guest services did comp us 2 x fridges since we had to change a room. 
Now, last full  day there, we left early for our function. Forgot our tickets and had to go back. Hubby says, run up to room and get them. A long sprint I assure you.  I sprint up to room only to find out my card key does not work. SH#$%%^T!! However, housekeeping in in the hall and I ask if she can let me in.. No is her response. Okay I get it. Soo she calls security to help. I wait 10 min and they arrive. Leisurely chattering. We walk all the way down to room, as they say, may we see your ID..I dont have it, its in the car, which my hubby is driving around the block in. Sorry ma'am we cant help you. Soo at this point, must go downstairs to guest services for help. I get to elevator,  push the buttons and hear all sorts of banging noises and the doors wont open. I wait 6 min then finally 1 if the 3 elevator doors open with maintenance inside. He says, this car is not working but I can go ahead and take it down for you. I am hoping this was a kind gesture not sarcasm. Now, 30 min later I am bCk downstairs at guest services. They will not let me in either.. No ID on me. Soooo, I ask for a manager. She pulls up room info, verifies my personal info and still hesitant. Soo my saving grace was that I memorized my reservation #. NOW  I get a rekeyed card!!! Yes!! I trek all the way back to room, get my tickets and head back down to hubby who has now been driving around for 40 min. That was last straw. We will not ( after 10 yrs) be coming back here. This hotel has other issues and they are spiraling down quickly. Stay elsewhere and get your moneys worth!!!!

One of the oldest Casino's on the strip. You'll know, it all comes down to what your own personal needs are as far as entertainment and enjoyment. Now if your have kids under the age of 21,this would be one of your choices for you and your family to stay at. With all the different games, its like being at a carnival. Great for kids.

The rooms where nice and upgraded.They also came with a microwave and a little refrigerator and no additional charge.
But they get you on a resort charge now. Must of the Casino's now do charge you for a resort fee. This casino does not charge you for parking, Yet.

Not to well know eateries here in this Casino like you would get at the others. Needs a make over and maybe a little of painting.
Smoke is real strong in here.Not a good ventilation system in here to extract the smoke.
026\/100 Yelp Challenge.(2017)

Circus circus should be a great place for families because of their arcade and entertainment. However they don't deliver in the room accommodations. The carpet was horribly filthy. You can see it's mostly stained and has not been changed for 50 years. Seriously! The drainage in the shower was slow and the faucets were leaking. The bed cover\/ comforter was so dirty...you could see the dust come out when you tap the bed. They had a coffee maker in the room which was the only plus, but that didn't work either. The pictures in their website looked good but man, it looks just like the opposite. I will never stay in circus circus anymore, even though they have the best entertainment for kids. We should just book somewhere else and bring them there one day.

I really don't see the allure of this place.  The place is run down and teeming with children.   The rooms are horrendous.  Please don't stay in the manor if you can avoid it.  Just trust me on this.

This end of the strip has really fallen off.  With Stardust and Sahara gone, Circus Circus and Riviera are truly the only things left.  The rest is just empty abandoned space.

If you are looking for a cheap room that is technically on the strip, Circus Circus will suffice.  However, I would guess that the rooms are easily as cheap as the Riviera across the street.  

You can also abandon your kids while you gamble at the adventuredome or the midway. I could see where that might be helpful.

For the prices of the rooms and easy check in, I give this place a thumbs up..
As for the rooms themselves.. It's pretty so-so.. 
For the casino.. Also a so-so..

I barely write reviews for anything but Circus Circus has been unfairly reviewed so I'm here to speak the truth. My boyfriend and I just left after a 3 night stay. We have previously stayed at Aria, Palms Place, and Paris. In no way is Circus Circus any of the aforementioned. However, in no way is Circus Circus dirty, stinky, or no fun. 

Not only did we win over $500 from $80, but we had a great time doing it. The dealers were friendly, the cocktails were strong and the atmosphere was exciting. 

The food was tasty and affordable. We both ate for about $15 each meal. (Hint: Try the Chicken Noodle Soup at Westside Deli) 

All in all, Circus Circus was a great bang for our buck. We would definitely stay there again and would recommend it to anyone.

A soft three stars, and only the staff on the gaming floor got it up to three.

Now it's one of the older casinos\/hotels on the strip so take that into account. Location next to a paused casino development doesn't help the cause either as this only makes it feel further away from the other big name casinos than it really is.

The check in staff were OK, flat out dealing with what looked to be a bus load of recent arrivals so fair play. The staff at the box office for shows were shocking, not in the mood for answering questions about the shows like when and where they were on and prices for different ones, times and days only interested in selling you a ticket

Now whilst I did get one of the cheaper room deals but was at least hoping for a bar fridge as it was April and quite warm which would have been nice to have a cool place to keep water
The air con system whilst working very very efficiently was noise so could really watch TV and relax. Also the walls were thin. Thin enough that I could tell what the next room was watching on their TV - solution flick thru until you find what they have on and mute it.

The casino still allows smoking inside which I think most do but being Australian and currently living in the UK with long existing smoking bans for indoor public places this was difficult to acclimatise too as I was needing to wash the smell out of my clothes before it spread thru by whole bag

The staff I talked to on the gaming floor where incredible helpful and polite and given I was a newbie to all this more than happy to talk me thru the rules of the game and how the gambling worked and didn't have any issue if I just watched for a few hands\/rounds

I'd certainly go back to Vegas to explore some of the shows and outdoor activities

This place is a dump...back when I was a kid i liked coming here (mainly To go to the midway arcade & chase girls with my friends) but even back then the hotel itself was (and still is) a shithole...i was told way back then to NEVER eat at ANY of their restaurants ESPECIALLY their buffet...back then my brother-in-law was a fire paramedic for the local county and worked at the station close to Circus Circus & i remember him telling me that not a day goes by that they don't get a call that somebody got food poisoning..yuck..thank God I took heed to what he said...i recently took my daughter to the midway arcade & the adventure dome because I never been in the adventure dome part...it sucked...too expensive for what you got..staff was rude & crappy...never again will I come back..oh well I had a good run.....

Food: 3\/5
Service: 3\/5
Cleanliness: 3\/5
Decor & Setup: 3\/5

I like this place because it is cheap. But its an average place.  For kids, its great because of the circus acts and the buffet.  Don't mind coming here when my wallet is low.

Think twice before you decide to go this hotel. It might not worth it, no matter how cheap it might be.

I checked in on Jan 2 around 11:00 pm, and after I was about to go to sleep, I found my pillow case dirty (some brown spot on it), I called the room service and a nice lady said she will have someone give me a new one. probably half an hour later someone showed up, just delivered the new pillow case to me, without even asking me if I need help switching it. I know it was late at night, but hey, I still think they should ask if they can help.

Then next morning when I washed up, I found lip stick stain on the first towel, and brown spots on the second and third towels ,which was really not what I expected.  I ended up threw them on the floor and went to the manager to complain.

One thing I need to clarify is, I booked it through Priceline, and they put me in the motel style Manor building so I cannot speak for people who live in the Towers. 

Anyway, I went to front desk to ask the manager if this was pretty normal for a three starts hotel. The manager was really nice, said sorry,waived my resort fee, and switched me to another room in Manor (He is the reason that I give a two star instead of one). However, when I stepped into the second room, I saw BIG STAIN on both of the beds. I had no choice but turned back to the front desk again. Another manager talked to me this time, and I felt like I was treated as a second second class citizen. I showed her the pictures I took on my bed, asking her if there is anything she can do for me, maybe a upgrade or switch to the Tower (which is the same\/similar price base on their website) and I am willing to pay. She was very impatient, and told me there is nothing she can do for me, and I am not getting an upgrade. I know there is a big event going on, and probably all the rooms are overbooked, but come on, at least tell me that you are sorry before you told me that I am not going to get an upgrade?  By looking at her face, and listening to her tone, I feel like I should be the one who apologizes because I brought her some trouble. But you know it is not really my fault that both of the rooms I checked in are in unacceptable situation. I asked for an upgrade the second time but not the first time is because I was trying to be nice and thought the first room was just an isolation issue. After checking out two rooms, I got the idea about this Manor building and asked for an update. I think this is really reasonable but I got a big NO NO without the manager feeling sorry for this situation. 

Anyway, I got switched into ANOTHER room because the second manager told me that asking house keeping to change my bed sheet will take a long time. I will suck it up with the third room since I am leaving tomorrow anyways so I guess I can live. But this is really not my expectation from a 3 star hotel on Strip, nor to match any hoteling experience I had in Las Vegas before.

We stay at this hotel once to twice a year, we are hooked mainly because we keep getting offers for a free room (you still have to pay a resort fee which is $20-something dollars now... way too much for really no benefits), so it's the cheapest option we can get on the strip (it is a bit of a hike to get to the center of the strip though from out here!!!) The rooms in the West Tower are decent since they have been renovated in the last couple years. The hotel is still technically on The Strip, but it is a bit of a walk to the center of The Strip. I'm pretty active so it wasn't an issue, but it can be for those who are not able to walk long distances, especially with how hot it can get out there.

Every time we check in the staff seems so annoyed. It's probably because of the overload of people vs staff, but still not excusable for someone trying to enjoy their vacation. Plus, the very last time we stayed there (about a month ago), our room wasn't even done being cleaned (the cleaning lady didn't put the covers back on the beds and there was a large garbage bag laying in the middle of the room). We went back downstairs and got an apology and a new room, but then after the new room was assigned we were told how we could have gotten a deluxe room upgrade. Then she hastily said we can use it next time... Why not offer it to us now especially since we just had to come back down to switch rooms anyway??? 

The lobby is always a disaster zone. I have walked through many hotels on the Strip and it never seems as chaotic in other places as it does at Circus Circus (lots of kids running around). I think they need to hire more staff to get the lines going more quickly for check-ins\/out. Walking through the lobby towards the back where the casino is just gets worse. The hallway is too narrow for the amount of people that are trying to get themselves and their suitcases to the elevators and the rest of the crowd trying to get to the restaurants and casino. Again, I don't experience this at any other hotels on the Strip. However, I would say that this is a good option for families with younger kids as they do have an arcade game area upstairs as well as multiple circus shows a day. I have never been to the Adventuredome but that seems like another good advantage for families with kids.

As far as the restaurants go, the Pizzeria is a decent option. The pizzas are big and pretty tasty. The Westside Deli has average cafeteria level food if you're looking for a snack. Vince Niel's restaurant (it has changed names multiple times now over the years) is just ok. The food is average but the service is below average. We went a couple times in the last few years and decided not to return. I'm not sure if the menu has changed with the recent name change or not. And the last place I will mention is the buffet... DO NOT DO IT!!! We had comp dollars to use for dining and decided to give it a whirl. Bad mistake. The food is horrible. The setup is like a highschool cafeteria. We went up a couple times to fill new plates and noticed that there was a plate of pie randomly laying around by the buffet and each time we went up there someone kept taking bites of it and continued to leave it there (our guess was an employee... but how weird???)

I do recommend getting the player's card here because you can get points and decent rewards pretty quickly as compared to other hotels in Vegas. 

We have decided that we won't be staying at this hotel any more and will start giving other hotels a chance to see if we like it better. It will be worth the few extra dollars to not have a free room, but hopefully have better dining, customer service, and be closer to the heart of The Strip.

I don't think I would stay here next time , my room key stopped working I had to go to the front desk and then call a security guard my self so he can come open my door also when I took a shower in the morning the water was cold and the fan wasn't working the only thing I was pleasant was the housekeeper really do the job they keep my room nice and clean 3 days,

This is now my third time staying in Las Vegas. I would say the Circus Circus was sub-standard at best. The room we were staying in was old and was in seriously need some renovations as well as modernization.  The a\/c unit looked like it was never cleaned. The inside of the unit had huge dust bunnies.  The washroom walls had cracks and chipped paint and the sink was always plugged.  The bed sheets looked like it was never wash as I can see black marks on the pillow and the coffee maker didn't even work. The room location had no easy access to the strip. It took over 10 minutes, a maze and 2 elevators just to get on to the strip.  The air circulation inside the casino was very poor especially for those who have breathing problems.  The only light I can see are the staff there. The are pretty helpful if you need assistance.  I would not choose this hotel again and do my best to avoid it at all cost.

The hotel is an older one very smokey. However has a lot of fun things to do like the Adventure Dome and also the video games and slots.

My only complaint is that the workers in the adventure dome all look upset and none are happy. I don't know if they are treated bad or just bored..

This is one of those places where a negative review won't even matter, but my conscious has me writing it anyway.  

I have stayed all over Las Vegas over my years, but had never thought to venture to the Circus Circus, and decided to give it a try.  (No poker room) 

We had a horrible experience, from check in to the staff at the pool who yelled at my kids, to the hours long wait times at the elevator, to the I could go on all day.  

I wouldn't stay here again if the rooms were FREE!!

Horrible
That is how I describe this place. Check-in SUCKS . 30 Guest standing in Line but 3 employees working. Employees no smile on there face as if are forced to work. I only stay at this place just because my 2 small kids.
Nothing good about this place. No microwave and refrigerator. Wifi free but very SLOW.

Came here with my kids to enjoy the evening...the staff is super nice...however we walked out in 30 minutes...due to the fact that it reeked of cigarette smoke...I understand people are entitled to smoke...but I think that an hotel\/casino that is family oriented and cater to kids should ban smoking...there is no reason why my kids or other innocent babies be exposed to second hand smoke...someone has to start a change...it should be a heavyweight like Cicus Circus...I would even book a stay here...if smoking was banned...FYI...I WALKED OUT WITH A BAD HEADACHE!

A very old casino. It's not worth it to visit at all. 
We walked in and then walked out right the way. 
It smells and it's old.

A Vegas parent in the summer always frantically searches for family friendly things to do. In between major trips, I like to squeeze in a few cheap-o staycations. Typical destinations are Mesquite, Laughlin, numerous rural destinations in Nevada and of course, you have your pick of hotels in the city. 
 I've never stayed at Circus Circus and it was not on my radar at all until I caught a glimpse of their ad promoting the newly installed slide at the pool. Wha???... I had to look no further. 
 Booked a room on a Monday, coming out of EDC weekend. Rate was $21 plus $31 resort fee, lol. Check in booklet included a $5 off coupon for Adventuredome- how can you go wrong?
 I was really bracing myself, but was VERY pleasantly surprised. 
 I got a room on 25th floor of Sky Tower, close to pool and Adventuredome entrance. Got a very nice view and room was much nicer than I expected. Was able to check in 2 hours early with zero questions asked. 
 All staff I encountered were super friendly and polite, cheerful and upbeat. 
 Again, so impressed! 
 Only downside is I wasn't too excited about affordable dining options, so we drove 1.5 miles to Palace Station and ate at their buffet, twice, so that worked out really well. 
 Pool check in is kind of a cluster, but two beers on tap, Bud light (bleh) and IPA (oh well), at affordable prices, make it up.
 Kids, who have stayed everywhere up and down the strip and are spoiled as can be, cruising and traveling around country throughout the year, having stayed at an eclectic mix of everything from motels to boutique hotels, both said "we hope we get to come back!". I can see why- between Adventuredome, pool and buffet, I think we hit all their faves in one trip.

The only people that are giving this hotel a rating of more than 2 stars are the individuals that have not stayed anywhere nicer on the strip. And by nicer, I mean even the gutter-tier Riviera and Sahara hotels would suffice as better options.

It is easily the most awful hotel experience I've ever had in Vegas --- and that's said as both a kid and a young adult.

There is absolutely no such thing as guest service here. The place is overrun with little kids, dressed in nightmarish pink 1970's-style decor, their pool area is a kidney-shaped pool that's no bigger than 15' x 10' and built along the edge of the parking area and only closed off by a tarped chain-link fence (yes, it's that ghetto).

I am embarrassed to admit that I've stayed here a few times in the past...mostly when I was a kid on a family Vegas outing.  A stay in their regular rooms is a 0 star (note the 1 star rating I gave this place is because Yelp doesn't allow 0 stars). A stay in their RV Park room. OMG. A very solid -10 stars. It's reminiscent of one of those horror film motel rooms, BUT with clown decor.  Like, this is where Stephen King's terrifying "IT" clown would stay if he came out for a few nights of Vegas debauchery.

When I stepped in, I literally was transported back into what I was confident to be 1973 (ballpark year), suddenly possessed by a very rationalized fear of possibly contracting some kind of disease just by LOOKING at the inside of the room. Either that, or accidentally discovering a dead body concealed under the bed frame as I bend over to tie my shoe laces. This is one of very FEW things that can scare a fully grown adult male in the real outside world. I'd rather be camping and crashing out in a sleeping bag and tent in the wilderness. The only real fear involved there would be running out of TP to wipe my ass after a sh*t in the woods.

The buffet. Wow. *Gags*. Really not much more to say.

It's true...the saying "You get what you pay for." There's a really good reason why rates here are so cheap.

Basically, it's the worst and last place you could and should stay at on the Strip if you've come looking to "get away" and have a great time. Their clientele consists 100% of large families with kids, more kids, old people, rednecks, more kids and trash. If that's your kind of scene, then you're in luck. But most people leave distraught, horrified, mortified, and tarnished.

The only notable and cool factor feature of this place is the indoor theme park by the name of Adventuredome, which features a large roller coaster and some thrill rides.

I had nothing but amazing experiences with circus circus I'm honestly surprised by all these reviews, the cleaners are sweet And yes the place on the outside is outdated but inside it looks good. Our rooms are always clean and although the elevator usually is packed with people we had nothing but positive experiences. I Personally believe it's a place for only families and the rooms are varied on what you can afford the cheapier you get your room the least amount of enjoyment you'll get in your stay spend a little more and you'll get a better stay. Been at circus circus for 5 years every time for spring break. Never a bad a experience

this hotel was disgusting!!!!!! never in my life will i stay here!! its infested with bed begs!!! i checked in. took a nap with my quest. i had to find something crawling on me. it's disgusting complained moved to another room. pulled down the sheets and covers to double check!! and this one had it to...i stayed in the main tower on the 5th floor....i will never stay here again!!! never recommend it to someone else! it ruined my vegas trip!!! i missed my shows i purchased due to a inconvenience of switching hotels!. do not stay here!!!!!!!!!

Went there for a week for business and to see my wife compete in a dance competition.  The room in skyrise was nice and good for the price and was well kept.  I loved the midway and arcade which had fun for the whole family plus shows all the time.  

It's also close to the strip if you want to check it out but dosn't have all the congestion and traffic of the strip.

We were having fun, doing overpriced mini golf and rides, then we went to the batman laser maze. We stood in front of the cashier for 10 minutes, getting ignored. In the meantime, a party of 10 people walked up, and got served immediately.  When I complained, the person who was ignoring me barely apologized and went about helping the huge party. I was son angry, but my son wanted to do the ride so badly, o paid anyway.

Used to love this place.  Got a room thru hotels.com the other night on my 1st wedding anniversary.   Got in late. Woke to check out to find a nasty ass blood stain.   Management is ducking hotels.coms inquiry.  So i have yet to get a complete refund.. so disgusting.

Don't. Seriously, just don't.

There are probably 5 kids to every adult here. The rooms are disgusting. Worse than any motel I've ever stayed at. The king beds seems like they are composed of only springs and a think layer on top. The only good thing is that they have low betting tables like $5 BlackJack. It was was my first experience and I double my money! But you've been warned, do not stay here. You're in Vegas, live it up!

Let me start by stating: I am not a complainer!  Okay my arrival, only 1 of the elevators in the parking lot worked out of 3 ( leaving a large crowd of people waiting for the elevator through several runs). Then at registration the line was outrageous and it took us about an hour to get to the desk. When we got to the room there was a king size bed, although I had requested 2 queen beds (for the kids), with a little heckling and them letting me know that my request was simply that a REQUEST they moved us to a room with 2 queen beds. When my son's went to take a shower the water was cold, you can imagine a 7 and 10 year old trying to take a cold shower. The rooms and the grounds were generally unclean. We stayed here because we thought it would be fun for the kids, but we will not return.  To end on a positive, the bagel place located on the promenade was delicious.

I have stayed in hundreds of hotels in multiple countries. This place is worse than any dive I have ever stayed in. Rooms smell like porta potty mixed with regret. We could not breathe the air freshener was so strong. Half the rides at the kids area were not working. Customer service sucks. Pool area is dirty.
Stay anywhere but here...
I would not stay here if it was free. I left after paying $350    And paid to stay somewhere else...
We asked for non smoking room but we ended up on smoking room service is bad and room looks dirty and smells really bad

Ok let me start by saying is not horrible but there's much improvement needed.on our 5 day stay in Vegas we stayed at the Linq for the first night due to a promotion we had and the rest we stayed at Circus Circus the rest of our stay. When you come from a nice and clean hotel  and get to the circus circus is hard not to notice the differences. The lobby, main floor carpets, hallways and elevators need a lot of TLC. It seems like they haven't done anything since they builded it. From outside the hotel does not show a happy circus with its full white and faded red colors. Parking lots and hallways leading to the hotel are super dirty. The pool has stains all over and the towels provided serve as exfoliators of how rough and old they were.  I'm guessing the towels were blue at some point, now the are a really bad faded blue. It's hard to get to the pool, you need to take different elevator and hallways and is not well marked. Is not like it says"pool 3 floor" and then the pool faces a parking lot were there are workers looking at you sunbathed.. very uncomfortable. The room itself was clean. I checked the sheets and the towels weren't as rough as the pool ones. We were offered an upgrade to have a better view of the strip.... is not worth it. You are so far of the strip you only see the parking lot. Don't buy it. Not what upsets me the most is that we picked a non smoking room and upon arrival we were informed that if that rule is violated we will be charged $300 that's a lot. But we were fine cus we were all non smokers. In our floor there's signs saying is a non smoking FLOOR. yet the floor smelled faintly of old smoke. On our second night when we open the door to go get iced a terrible smell of weed hit us. When we called reception they kept saying they will send someone to investigate which it never happened. I made it very clear I didn't want to be charged extra from someone smoking and then me getting blamed. Which it didn't happens thankfully but the stayed w as very uncomfortable because the weed smell kept coming in every time you opened the door. We didn't let this damper our stay cus once the doors were closed the room was OK. I will definitely choose another hotel next time because to be charged $34 "Resort Fees" for something you can't use because is dirty... is not worth it. I would have liked to use the pool and explore more things in the hotel.

My boyfriend took me to Vegas for the first time and took me to the salon in the circus circus hotel and CLAUDIA cut and styled my hair and she is so professional and amazing! Next trip ill be stoppin in to see her(: thank you Claudia
Wish there is an zero star rating! If you don't want to sleep at all then stay there, because the loud AC sound like industry fan will constantly wake you up!

Housekeeper STOLE a few of my medication pills for my torn acl.

Also at check in my cousin informed the front desk that we had someone with crutches and my grandma who can't walk too much.. And our room was the LAST room down the hall. For a Tuesday check in at a hotel with more than one building.. I'm sure not all the vacant rooms left were at the end of the hall.. Something closer to he elevator I'm sure was available.

The security who took the report was nice as well as the hotel room itself. Some positives are that there is free parking, the buffet is okay (not great but not terrible) and the rates were decent.

I asked my cousin if she had anything to add and she said that the room smells and then reminded me that we were momentarily stuck in an elevator downstairs yesterday.

I did NOT stay here. We only stopped in to get to the Adventuredome because it was our day to see the north end of the stip. 

One word: Disgusting. Ok, Two words: Disgusting and creepy. 

Just the parking lot was scary. It was nearly empty and the clown sign is as creepy as it gets. ::shudder:: 

The table gaming area was named the Money Pit. Seriously? Yeah, that makes me want to drop some money here. 

We walked past the buffet on our way to the AdventureDome and we were greeted with the most horrendous smell I have ever smelled. I gagged and had to hold my breath. The most shocking part was that there was a LINE of people waiting to get into the rank buffet. Had they lost all sense of smell? 

Well, we made our way upstairs, past the creepy clown paintings with protuding genitals and found that the Adventuredome was closed Mon-Thursday. Really? Just fantastic. 

I don't think there's any reason that I would ever stay here. There's a reason why you can get a room here for $13 night via Expedia. What that reason is, I don't want to find out.
I mean this is my first time here everything is good except the WiFi it sucks I can't do anything. FIX THE WIFI, PLEASE.

Make sure you get an updated room. Our room wasn't perfect but we spent so little time there it didn't matter. We stayed on the 19th floor and rode the elevator closest to the main lobby. It's not as bad as people make it out to be. The main thing they lack is keeping the elevators inside the hotel and in the parking garage clean. The pools aren't spectacular, but they made sure the water was cold especially for the days being so hot in the summer. My husband won some $$$ and he only played the blackjack table for 15-20 minutes. The adventuredome was perfect for the kids and so close to our room. The kids, aged 6 & 8 loved it! It's best to buy an unlimited ride bracelet. We were able to spend most of the day there and leave and then come back and spend another hour before it shut down for the night. We spent Thursday in there and the lines were short! We are at Vince Niel's restaurant for breakfast and were pleasantly surprised by how tasty it was. We'd eat there again. Service was quick and we were able to use a few coupons. 

This hotel is great for a short stay with kids, esp for the price. We plan on bringing the kids back to Vegas, but we want to visit more hotels, so we may not make it back. Don't expect all the glamour here, but also don't be so pretentious about it either and you'll enjoy your stay.

NEVER STAY HERE!!!! I wish I could leave no stars at all! This place only employs thieves! Me and my sister staid here and when we left our room to walk the strip, my sister had left her BRAND NEW EXPENSIVE prescription glasses behind on the bedside nightstand because she didn't want to lose them while we went to enjoy our time on town. When we returned they were NO WHERE to be found but the room was cleaned by the room service maid. When she went to ask about her glasses all they did was take a report with no reassurance that they would take care of the situation. Upon check out she again asked about her glasses (mind you, we checked the room very thoroughly before even bringing it to their attention) and they said that the ones to handle the situation were only there on weekdays and not weekends (how convenient for them at times like this). And that they would have the needed department contact her regarding the situation. We asked if there were some type of ANYTHING they could do to rectify the situation or anything and they said no, wait for the call. My sister told them that she NEEDS these glasses especially to drive because her sight is pretty bad and they basically said its not their issue. When she was finally contacted back they basically told her that the maid that cleaned her room denied ever taking anything (of course bc what employee would admit to stealing while on the job to be at risk of losing the job) and that it was MY SISTERS FAULT that they were even missing for not putting them in the vault. We are staying and paying to stay here obviously we are entrusting in leaving our stuff behind. We shouldn't have to put EVERY "valuable" thing in the safe because their employees are not to be trusted. Circus circus is not taking ANY responsibility in the matter and are basically saying go screw yourself because now not only is my sister unable to drive safely because of THEIR employee but she is now out $300 for the new glasses she got. These people make that off ONE weekend stay there per room and they can not compensate her for their employee taking things out of the room!!! WORSE PLACE AND CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED. And I have staid MANY places in Vegas and almost every time at the MGM because me and my family are apart of the MLife which is associated to Circus Circus. So disappointed in the manner that this has been handled. Will never refer anyone to stay at ANY MGM associated hotel again!! I have as well cancelled my weekend I had reserved for my birthday at the MGM since having to deal with this and will stay else where. They make millions and can't even take care of this is the appropriate way. WORSE CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER! TAKE YOUR BELONGINGS ELSE WHERE OR ELSE YOU RISK YOUR ITEMS BEING STOLEN BY THEIR EMPLOYEES!!!

The hotel overall is mediocre but the worst part of it is that the cleaning ladies are THIEVES. Stupid me, I thought leaving my Swiss Army Knife that I personally bought in Switzerland on the counter was safe but no. Next thing I know, it suddenly dissapeared. Never coming back here again and don't know the next time I'm going to Switzerland.

Great place to waste your money. I only came here for the arcade. It's very easy to waste your money here quickly. I spent around $40 dollars and felt pretty satisfied. I don't really play for tickets, but I did spend some time in the ring toss and most of the time in the actual arcade to play video games. It was fun and they had the typical games and some of the newer ones. I just wish they expanded their selection and offered more machines for the various titles they offered to replace the old machines that no one plays anymore. That way there isn't a line of people waiting for 1 machine. The wait times are still bearable though. We didn't have to wait too long to find and play the games we wanted to play. Although we did distract ourselves by playing other games while waiting for a certain machine to free up.

Last minute Vegas trip and this Hotel was the only one with rooms available. I read so many bad reviews that I was scared to stay here. I was really surprised when we arrived to our room.. it was nice & clean that's the only reason why I give it 2 stars.. We stayed in the Casino Tower which I read has been recently renovated. Now on to the bad part..... this casino needs a lot of upgrading. It has this NASTY smell of vomit throughout the whole casino. It has POOR ventilation, we felt suffocated at all times with all the smell of cigarettes. I seriously don't know how could parents expose their kids to this type of ambiance. We've stayed in other hotels on the strip and have never encountered this lack of air.  We were in the casino area for about 20min and that was about it for us. Only time we returned was to sleep. Bottom line : You get what you pay for. Next time we go to Vegas I will plan out our trip and stay in a decent Hotel where the oxygen is not limited.

We stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest one available at the time. We must have come in a weekend where there are a lot of conventions because all the room rates were crazy high....

Anywho we stayed at the sky rise tower. The parking garage is hard to find but trust me when I tell you that you want to find this garage... If you park at the main garage then you will be walking around the casino for ten minutes to even get to the tower.

It's clean, the staff friendly and it's right by the back road so even though it was busy my husband and I didn't have a hard time getting around. Keep in mind we had a car. If not I wouldn't come here since it's quite a walk to the main part of the strip. My google map said a 40 minute walk from circus circus to Caesars!!

OMG... this place is so smoky and so busy.  I really really did not enjoy the couple of hours we were here.  Way too many people and kids... I think it's definitely my last time ever coming here.  And the time before this was over 10 years ago!

I can't lie. Somebody would have to pay me to set foot into Circus Circus again. Ewwweeee it's nasty and old and depressing and kinda gross. The whole place for one night probably added several years to my body age. Here is what I liked: the west tower room was better than expected (but dirty, yes) and the kids enjoyed the free circus acts in Midway. Here's what I didn't like: gross carpet, smells, unhappy staff, pedophile looking guests all over the place, and well, everything. I am gagging just thinking about Circus Circus. In the words of my 4 year old it was "kinda creepy.

Found cockroaches in the room. Awful awful maintenance and cleanliness. Didn't know how bad condition of the hotel was- just thought they had a cheap deal for the day. We just checked right back out and got our money back.

Probably the best hotel in Vegas if you have kids with the live circus show and the giant arcade right next to it or the amusement park. I had my best experiences at circus circus as kid and I plan on having more. So if yo have kids or even a family function I suggest staying at circus circus.

So the room was decent & cleaner than expected.  We stayed in the West Tower & the room had been remodeled.  The bathroom had the tiniest counter I had ever seen and the bathtub\/shower was plastic & leaking.  You had to step up to get into the shower & my husband's (who is 6 ft. 3) head almost hit the ceiling.  The other review are correct that you can hear everything going on in the rooms near you.....even when the water was being used.  The casino was....well it stunk like bad breath, farts & of course cigarette smoke.  I hated walking through the casino. The bartenders were not too interested in serving unless you gambled (which I don't). The selections for drinks were not great...but was not expecting much.  Lastly (and I realize this is just Vegas) it was crazy to see parents with strollers pushing babies & toddlers around at 12:00 or 1:00 am in the morning.  There are children everywhere; babies, toddlers, children, teenagers.
This place was awesome when I was a kid but not its trash.  They really need to renovate.  This is the hotel that all us broke people stay at when we go to Vegas.

Our family visited here every day of our vacation. Next time will probably stay here. We went to Nathan's hotdogs for French fries. But they didn't have any. LOUIS on the other hand was helpful, courteous & sold us everything else on the menu. He also went out of his way to help us with bus family rates\/info. Super guy! We also rode many rides in adventure park\/area YAHOO!

Wanted to give it a shot because I've been going to Vegas for years and have never really stated at any of the spots that kind of started it all.  I'm very disappointed.  This place should not be in business.  I understand cheap but this is just outright despicable.  This place is being neglected from the smell of the room to the mold in the shower and around the curtain rings.  Time to reinvest in your business guys. Shame on you.

I didn't stay here...only played games here.
I remember I sucked at the ring game and I had to pay my brother to win me a freaking doll.

I remember I had a 5 finger discount on another gigantic doll and that's about it.

We stayed here and went to my cousins wedding we stayed for 5 days and enjoyed the amusement park, pizza parlor, sushi, mcdonalds, buffet and my son had a blast in the kids arcade area or carnival area.

We ordered room service. The steak was delicious and so was the omlets 

Our room was very nice. We had a 2 rooms suite and really enjoyed our stay here.

So there are a million hotels in Vegas obviously, but this one is what we chose. We made reservations in the west tower for a king bed. Well when we arrived, all king bed rooms were taken. So instead of giving us some BS, dude instantly suggested he would upgrade us to a deluxe room for free... Uhhhj, YEA! 
We had a lot of luggage so we used bell service. Dude made small talk with us, and asked where we are from. We said Okinawa. He goes oh cool, I was stationed at Camp Schwab (a tiny marine base that you'd only know if you'd actually been there so he wasn't lying). I was like wow no way what a small world. 
It's only the first night but so far everything is working out great! Dude being at Schwab, free room upgrade, decent restaurant etc... Worth a 4 star... For us anyways. Of course if you're willing to $$$$$, vegas has better places but call it luck, we are getting great service and a great deal! Dude even thanked me for my service. And after hitting my 15th year in the army this year, I gotta say I never get tired of genuine Americans genuinely thanking me. Means a lot. Circus circus will definitely get my business again.

I did NOT stay in this hotel. However, walking around it was enough to know it deserves one star or less. It has a terrible smell, very dirty, and very dark. The smoke smell seemed stronger here than anywhere else. Maybe this is because it's so old and doesn't have as good of a ventilation system as some of the other hotels? We came to see the middway\/shows but we couldn't stay long as the smell was making my mother sick. I actually think the Circus Circus in Reno is nicer.

The room was filthy. Stale candy was found by the bed, popcorn kernals were imbedded in the rug, the bathroom had mold.and the mattresses were so thin we could feel the springs.  To be fair, they did upgrade us when I complained, but I noticed that they did not vacuum any of the rooms except on request. Would not stay here again.

Good place for kids.  The food isn't the best.  Luckily I had a car to drive around.  The room was weak.  There was no fridge or even coffee maker.  I was given a fridge after I told the desk that I had baby formula that needed to be refrigerated.  A working fridge came after two attempts.  The iron kept on leaking water when I was using it.  My view was of the Circus circus building, and a big light shining outside.  There was no free wi-fi.  After contacting support, I was told the first four floors of the main casino hotel do not have wi-fi. Make sure you find out where you're staying.  You get what you pay for.

This post is related to the Adventure dome only, I have not stayed as a guest.

Our kids had a blast at the Adventure Dome! We paid $30 per kid for an all day arm band. They provided us with back up tickets showing that we purchased the arm band just incase we left and something happened to the arm band. My husband road El Loco with our two daughters. My 7 year old was afraid to ride any of the other big rides, because she felt like the seat belts weren't sufficient for her size. She said she felt like she was slipping out of the seat belt on El Loco. I do think some of the rides should be evaluated for age appropriateness. I saw several children nearly flipping out of the small train Rollercoaster. The staff are not very friendly. There are a lot of young people working there, and their attitudes are very lackluster. They are unwilling to answer any questions, and did not help the children unbuckle from rides. The rides were bombarded with parents after each ride, because the ride attendee would just walk to the exit and hold the gate. They do not do as other theme parks and make sure everyone is off the ride. I even notice they didn't check seat belts or make sure the children were secure before starting the rides. Everything should be fine if parents personally check for safety and age appreciateeness.

Been coming here since I was a kid. Stayed in the Skyrise Tower before and it was great no complaints. This time we got the chance to stay at the Circus Circus Manor Motor Lodge. Its was the chepest rates. So we said what the hell let's try it out. Arriving I thought, damn its gonna be real ghetto with all kinds of weird looking people. Wasn't to sure about it. Upon arriving we check in went to room and it kinda looks like appt complex. Seemed really quiet and sane normal looking people. When we went in room I checked everything from bathroom, to cabinets, to safe, to bed and under bed. Looking for any nasty s*** we didn't like or looked dirty. But hey it was actually pretty clean, no roaches and no bed bugs! The bed was very comfortable, better then I expected! The only down side is that its a walk to casino and the strip. But not too far. So wear some comfy shoes. I wouldn't mind staying here again if Skyrise Tower is all booked. So people try it out, its not as bad as some people make it seem. Cheapest rates, hey more money to gamble and drink...

Shortly after I posted my review on Yelp (Which is below), I receive a message in my comment from Lori P. of Circus Circus Las Vegas Hotel and Casino Business Manager. I think to myself, oh this is what I am talking about, some customer services! Some one is going to acknowledge the situation.  I emailed this person Lori almost a year ago and never received a response.

This was the worse  buffet I ever been too..  They have the nerve to give vouchers for 2 free buffets..  Which amount to $40.. And my buddy and I chose not to go back..  Worst food ever.. Terrible rooms service, clammy inside..  Worst hotel in Vegas..  Has to be.

I haven't been to Circus Circus since I was a kid so I decided to be nostalgic and stay here again. It has great parking! & *always park on the third floor since you can walk into the casino without use of the elevator*! It's a great place for kids. The arcade is HUGE ! The staff is so nice & helpful!! They are so friendly and really care. They should upgrade eventually but regardless they'll get customers. They also need better room service so you can order food up from the restaurants! My overall experience has been very good

This was my favorite hotel when I was growing up, so we've stayed here several times. The rooms are quite comfortable and a decent size. The quality of the hotel has gone down over the years and it's not as great as before. It also gets really full over the holidays with families. If you are looking for a relaxing vacation, I would recommend staying somewhere else. It is a great hotel for families since there are a lot of fun things to do inside of the hotel such as the Adventuredome.

I've been to the Reno circus circus before and enjoyed it but I feel like it was actually better than the Vegas one. They have people who attack you at every entrance to get a time share at some hotel thing and my parents went to the meeting for it because you get free tickets for stuff but it was supposed to be 2 hours and instead it was like 7. We upgraded to the west tour for an extra $5 a night but it was still outdated and ugly. Maid is pretty nice. Elevator is fast. Nice that it has free parking but it's kinda far from the rest of the strip. The midway is okay but more fun in Reno. The McDonald's is more expensive. Overall, I would come back probably.

I caught the free acrobatic act and was amazed at the agility, skill and ample camel toe that all came free of charge! Then I tried to beat little kids at arcade games and spilled my beer on a machine :( poor kids. Or poor me, I never even stood a chance. 

After that I vaguely remember playing beer pong with some frat boys ($10 a pitcher). The bartender was great. Old dude who had some cool stories to tell.

This place is a classic! Just as trashy and ghetto as legend portrays it.

Stayed here on two different occasions. The first was in the West Tower. Clean & remodeled. The second was in the Casino Tower. One word: COCKROACH. It also smelled strongly of detergent and the carpet was worn and badly stained.

I did like that there were shops and many places to dine at. Also, another plus was the large variety of slot machines.

If you want to avoid all the children, go while school is in session. We last stayed here in early November and it was really mellow.
it is really grossnever want to come back it is too dirtydry blood on your bed

For $36 dollars a night it's a awesome deal. I stayed here from 5\/10\/2014 checked out 5\/13\/2014 we booked 2 rooms. A room with 2 queen beds on the west towers 26th floor and it had a horrible vomit smell, we were able to change rooms but that room had roaches, disappointed. The other room was a king size in west towers 21st floor. This room wasn't bad, sink was dirty but overall not bad. The location was more south than I realized. This was my 2nd trip to Vegas. My first was at Cesar's Palace and we didnt had children with us but this time we did so opted for a more family oriented location. I would recommend  if you have children but wouldn't if your with your S.O or friends 21+. You'll have more fun else where on the north side of the strip.

When you're hunting for a hotel in Vegas you're looking for it to be two things: 1)Solely a place to sleep 2)Cheap

There's no sense in paying ridiculous prices for a Vegas hotel when you'll be out and about from 12pm-4am (walking the strip, meals, day clubs, night clubs). So why not pick the most cost effective hotel? 

Well I'll start with...The saying rings true that you get what you pay for. And so when I arrived at Circus Circus I was sure to leave my high horse at home. My friends and I stayed in Building C of the manor, and for the price we paid, it was good! The building was a little run down, but our room was decent: two king-sized beds, parking literally right outside of our room, not a lot of noise or foot-traffic (sounds like my kind of place!) 

The only drawback we encountered was the ice machine didn't have ice. Other than that, it's a solid hotel for good price!

Oh, Circus Circus. When I told my dad we were staying here, he said that it was the cheapest place on the strip when he used to visit back in the 70s. Looks like it's still the cheapest and the carpet is definitely still the same! 

Given, the reviews, I was fully expecting this place to be gross. Lucky for us, it was not. Our room was clean if not updated. 

If you're looking for a place just to sleep (or not sleep) during your stay in Vegas and don't want to spend a lot. Circus Circus is still a viable option. 

Pool is pretty meh. Food is gross. Casino has seen better days. It's dark and has the signature stale cigarette smell (come on NV it's time to ban indoor smoking).

My only run in with the staff was with an overly aggressive bellman who got in my personal space while I was looking for my check ticket. Seriously, dude. There is no one behind me in line, lay off! He then proceeded to take over ten minutes to find my bag and wouldn't take no as an answer when I said I didn't need help to the room. I get that you work for tips, but the fastest way to lose your tip is telling a female customer that she's not strong enough to lift her own luggage. I overheard another bell demanding a tip from a foreign tourist (who had no idea about tipping). Guess I shouldn't expect the staff at a tacky hotel to have any tact. 

PS: They are also extremely pushy about check out. Check out is earlier than most hotels and the maids are waiting at your door well BEFORE check out. Be prepared to leave in a hurry otherwise you will be charged.

This is one of those 70s era Vegas spots that are still alive. I never, ever stayed at their hotels but I've been to their arcade. I remember wasting a good amount of money on the arcade for fun lol but I brought home a good number of domo stuff toys :D

It reminds me of a depression future of Vegas, they have some small tvs scattered around their old-school glass dome arcade evoking 90s terribly nightmarish bad humor-clowns, it still haunts me.

The shops are meant for low-key and stingy tourists and the casino is just average looking.

They have circus presentations, though I'm not a fan. If been to their Reno rendtion and they're pretty much the same.

Overall, Vegas and Circus Circus' management should improve this blackhole of failing attraction.

I was really weary about staying here after reading the reviews, and they are correct when they say it is run down and needs more investing in its rooms (especially the manor part). However, on a holiday weekend we got a good price and made it work. They gave us lots of coupons which we used! We were able to get to the strip by walking (took a long time) but it's doable. I would personally rather plan a trip sooner and get a hotel on the strip next time. The part where circus circus is gets very dark at night and can get sketchy.

Stayed here my birthday weekend July 16-18th, 2015. Had the best time. Booked a room in the Skyrise tower in order to be closer to the Adventuredome. Parking was a bit crazy. Didn't exactly know where to go, so I parked in garage 1. Parking spaces are very tight, so I found a spot on the end of one of the rows. It was right around standard check-in time, so it was very busy with cars, and people. Check-in line was long, but went very quickly. Gloria was fantastic, friendly, gave me two flowers and even sang happy birthday to me :) 
     My room was quite a trek from the lobby and I learned there was a closer, and less crowded parking garage near the Skyrise tower, which made things a lot easier. The room was great! Clean, comfortable beds, even a view of the strip. I was quite happy.
     My boys and I had a blast at the Adventuredome, and the midway. Rides were fun, no long lines, no worries about the weather outside, since its all enclosed. The circus acts were fun to watch, and my boys won so many stuffed animals at the Midway! 
     I would definitely stay here again. Thank you to all the friendly staff for an amazing weekend!
Stained walls room smells there's holes in the curtains. Place looks more like a 5$ A night fleebag than a Las Vegas casino. UPDATE: there is actually cockroaches in the rooms.

OMG this please is not even worth it The room smelled like smoke so bad and just think we paid in advance for 5 day's and i was pissed then once we checked in they informed us we had to pay a another fee of $10 a day surcharge I was so done with this hotel and was ready to check out as soon as i saw the room Do Not go in the pool it was so dirty you could see it from the side walk   GOOD LUCK

This was absolutely the worst hotel experience in Las Vegas! The overall condition of the hotel is old and crapy, even for a hotel on budget. The hotel staffs were not helpful. The house keeping is absolutely a nightmare! We found a pair of old socks left by the previous customers on the day we checked in! The AC unit was as loud as a chainsaw. The bathtub tap never stops stripping, and was impossible to be completely shut off. It took literally more than a half an hour for the security to come to open doors, when both of our key cards were deactivated for no reason! If you want a nightmare experience in Las Vegas, the hotel would be a great option! 

Even if you are looking for a hotel on budget, do not consider this one. There are plenty on the ends of strip which is at or below the price level here.
We got a great room in the casino hotel. My kids loved it and the adventuredome. Recommend it for all kids.

What a joke!! don't even waist your time trying to get any help from the reply they give you, asking you to contact guest relations. I contacted them twice and the second time I asked for a read receipt . They will just tell you they never received your email. However I have a confirmation that they did receive it, but they just could not bother to do anything about it or reply to you.

If you can avoid staying here for any length of time I recommend it.  The food was fairly good but the service in every part of the hotel was horrific.  I stayed with my wife and sister-in-law and on three occasions my wife and I ordered our food second but received it before my sister-in-law.  No one at the hotel seemed happy at all except the cleaning crew and the employees at the bell desk.  The only reason we stayed there was because of the price.  We will never go back. Even the employees at Adventure Dome seemed unhappy to be around guests. The rooms had next to no ameneties, no microwave or even a coffee pot. If you want to save money try anywhere else but here.  Next year we're staying in Fremont Street. Much more fun.  The free wi-fi was horrible as well.
We always stay at this hotel so it always feels like home. But we usually go out to other casinos to play.

This place is terrible. Hard to find parking, valet is always full. You got people outside fighting and no one around to monitor it. Old broken down elevators. Rude obnoxious guests....all bad...they don't have the hotdogs anymore...I think that casino should be shut down....
