Sadder than even the downtown casinos.  This was the first hotel\/casino I ever stayed at. My working,  single mom splurged on a trip here when I turned 21. I remember it as being fun;  energetic;  great staff,  good food.  But that was 32 years ago.  In all my subsequent trips to Vegas I stayed and gambled elsewhere.  My 21 year old daughter thought it would be fun to see where I had first gone,  on her first visit to Vegas. So we decided to walk from Caesar's; have lunch and gamble a little at Circus Circus.  It was a nice walk.   We were hungry and tired by the time we arrived at around 1PM..  Looked at the map inside;  decide on the Blue Iguana.  Asked a cashier how to get to it. She gestured to her right, "Just take the escalator right around the corner and it's right at the top". After wandering unsuccessfully in the direction she indicated;  we asked at a security desk. He pointed vaguely further on and said pretty much the same thing about it being upstairs.  We finally found the far distant escalator.. and had to walk quite awhile through a VERY LOW END, very sad "mall" of junk shops.  Finally foundy the Blue Iguana.  It was CLOSED. Maybe one off those two employees could have mentioned that? ? Okay. . So then let's go to the other restaurant up here.  The Garden Grill I think was the name I had seen on the sign.  It was boarded up. Really? ? 
 Downstairs,  the casino was swelteringly hot.  Upstairs was uncomfortably warm.  The temperature, smell, and that irritatingly long, poorly directed trek prompted us to decide to leave.  We asked another security guy the fastest, simplest way to the Las Vegas Blvd entrance.  He sent us downstairs and out an emergency exit door to a side street that we had to walk about a block down to get to the entrance to find a cab.  Truly the most unpleasant Vegas experience I've ever had.

The Stake House at Circus Circus
        My husband and I have been coming here for 9 years to celebrate our anniversary. The food is still very good, but the last 2 years our waiter has hardly stoken 2 words to us. Thank goodness for the busers having a personality and checking in with us. They used to be so friendly. Plus, you have to pay $10 to valet on top of a tip, and it 10 minutes to get our car. This will probably be our last year coming here. Time to start a new tradition.

Meh. Pros and cons 
Pros: cheap and friendly staff. 
Cons: Dirty, Old casino, outdated machines,  poor lighting,  sub part rooms. Bugs in rooms.

I did not  go to any part of the resort.  Just my room and casino.

I've never been to a place with such a depressing and uncomfortably creepy vibe. The parking garage is cramped, outdated, and unorganized. The lobby looked like 1987 Miami vice drug bust movie. The adventure dome is a maze of broken hopes, original playstation arcades, and sketchy neighborhood fair rides. 
The rooms were the saving grace. Enough to bump up this place from a scooby doo murder mystery to just a horrible place to be. The shower barely got hot enough to be considered warm. The beds were alright enough to sleep on but the carpets felt like 35 years of dust, dirt, and human shedding compacted enough to tickle passing toes. The best part of this place is knowing you don't have to call this place home.
Overall i would rate this 0.6 \/ 5.

DO NOT STAY HERE. The price is so cheap for a reason. The first night of checking in, we were on our way to our room when we noticed large black beetles running through the hallway. Disgusted, but thankful they weren't in our room (YET) we continued on. 

Once we got into our room, we discovered a black beetle running across the floor. I am not talking a small bug. These beetles were at least 2-3 inches. There was also one running across the bed. 
We discovered a few more the next day, but the real problem was when we opened our curtains. It was hot, so we kept them completely shut the first day. The day after, we got back from long night on the strip and I decided to look out the window. I opened the curtain to look out to a rooftop where at least 50 of the disgusting black beetles were running around. In herds. SO DISGUSTING. They were less than 5 feet away from my bed and I could not stop thinking about how they were there partying right next to my bed the night before and I had no knowledge of it. We had to switch rooms at 1 AM. After a long hot day out, this was not at all what we expected to come back too. On the way to our new rooms, we discovered a few more black beetles roaming the hallways. Disgusting. Do not stay here, ever.
Gross! The rooms were so old and smelled like smoke! There are definitely better places to stay, but this was nice and cheap!

(This could possibly go in the Midway, but I am firm believer that the free acts in Vegas (as they dwindle further and further) need to have their own reviews.)

A little rinky dinky.

I will admit. Not the best thing I have ever seen. A couple of factors play into this of course. 

1. We were there for the first act of the day.. and we were early for that.

2. We only stuck around to see the one act.

So I won't hold it against them too much.. but the morning's act was a chair juggler. A little bit ho' hum I guess... lacked some of the pizzaz of a trapeeze artist or something of that nature. 

It's a bit of a tired area and the seating is just metal bleachers (if you choose to sit, but there is plenty of vantage points around the midway if not).

The reason it's a 4 star review, is it's FREE!.. and as I mentioned before, in a world like Vegas that gets more expensive by the day it seems, it's really refreshing to see a hotel still embrace the sentiment of getting you in or at it's front door with a free attraction.

Where should i start, um, lets talk the good, very affordable rooms, a lot of foot traffic for shops and adventure dome... now the bad, shower has leaky faucet, um hello Califonia is in a drought and this breaks my heart. The ugly, $ 18+for a mediocre buffet MEDIOCRE! !!! While we were eating our delicious yet very expensive pizza at the desk i decided to look at the inside the desk drawer and at first noticed some receipts, well i grabbed those and they were from 9\/11\/14. Great if only we could turn back time. We got here on 9\/20, thats not the scary part. I found a bundle of used toilet paper that left me grossed out thinking about ebola the rest of the night. But what in the world! They need to pay more or something because obviously their housekeepers arnt giving a crap if the rooms are throughly cleaned. Later went to find a pair of old stinky flats that was pretty funny. Well to cut this short, not impressed, food over priced like every where else on the strip, out of two rooms we had one room was spotless upon arrival the other just looked the part. Try a little harder circus circus. Give your employees a little more $ so they can look happy doing their job and maybe theyll actually do what theyre suppose to. Please.

Horrible!!!!!!!!!! The rooms are so sketchy and dirty!!! We were about to go to another hotel even though we wouldn't get a refund back that's how bad they are!!!! I would not recommend getting a room here it's not worth it!!!!!! Worst hotel I've been to

Besides dealing with crappy service at the Starbucks and the hallways filled with smoke smell, our one night stay wasn't too bad....until 3 weeks later when I received a bill for a "balance" of $300. When I inquired about it, I was told that housekeeping reported a strong smoke smell in the room...well, guess what, only my daughter and I were in the room and neither of us smoke! It probably was the hallway smell seeping in. I was told they would waive it this "one time"  and note the account, but if I ever stayed there again, they wouldn't waive it again. We will fix that...I will NEVER stay at an "MGM Resort" hotel again, and Circus Circus is the top of that "Do Not Stay" list!

Never will I book to stay at this hotel with my family again. The pictures online do not compare to the condition of the hotel is. The entire casino is NOT smoke free and the smoke just stays in place. No filtering system in place.

Restaurants inside were okay, but most of the staff were not very customer friendly. If you are having an off day do not step into this hotel.

This place is a true horror show-don't let the "festive" carnivalesque atmosphere sway you any differently. As others have suggested, it should be burned to the ground. 

I am writing a book about Las Vegas and therefore interested in the seedier side of the city, however, this place is a true shithole with no redeeming qualities, even from a literary perspective.

The one thing that will hit you in the face like a hard slap from a prostitute is the overwhelming smell of mold and decay the moment you step through the doors. That and a carpet stained so many times by so many different bodily fluids it is currently a putrefied shell of its formerly colorful and cheerful self. 

Unfortunately for me, I encountered a double whammy visiting this place: holiday weekend and what seemed like the end of some performance. Swarms of people swept me into their human wave and I could not escape before taking a lap around the bend-I have never seen this place so crowded, mostly people with their packs of obese children (really is there no better place to take your kids?). I took a brief detour to the casino floor and that's when things really got ugly. There were beer bottles and garbage  strewn everywhere, while one listless employee halfheartedly swept a few straw wrappers into his dust pan. At 3 pm there was a man so drunk he could barely walk straight or focus his eyes lurching in my direction, blind to his surroundings. 

Fearing that I would either be bitten by any number of vermin or mugged in full view of everyone in the middle of the afternoon, I made my way to the door and RAN away.

I'd rather take my child (or myself) to a prison yard (which is basically what this was) then EVER come  here again. Unless you're a glutton for punishment, you'd be better off staying home.

Oh and the best part is that Circus Circus is located smack dab in the middle of a tweaker-deranged homeless person hangout. In one day, I spotted a disabled woman tying up her arm in the street in broad daylight, a very deranged man running down the street, full-speed in 110 degree heat with his eyes simultaneously bugging out of his head, and what I assume was a homeless man wearing shoes 5 sizes too big while attempting a zombified walk\/stagger which culminated in his swaying in place in the middle of the street for an undetermined amount of time.

We stayed in Circus Circus from 20th-22nd of Feb 2011. I must tell that this is one of the worst hotels in Las Vegas. It is old & worn out. The room cleaning service people came inside the room without even knocking. The bath towels smelled awful. There was a water leakage in the bathtub. But the rest of the bathroom was clean and looked new. I will not come back to this hotel.

Since my wife loves Las Vegas and my teenage daughter had never been there, I thought that this would be a good place to go for our vacation.

I spent quite a bit of time looking for a place that was kid friendly, and had a great Casino.  Circus Circus Las Vegas Hotel and Casino was the one that stood out.

We booked for a week after school let out in June of 2017.  I knew the Hotel was 30+ years old, but with a waterpark, an adventure dome, a Midway, free circus acts and a large casino all in one place, I thought it was a great choice.

Unfortunately, the waterpark was mainly for kids under 7 years old, the adventuredome had only 25 rides, and half of them were for smaller children.  The air conditioning was so bad, that the smell of cirgarettes reeked through everywhere we went.  

The room had part of the popcorn ceiling falling off it, furniture was missing (no place to sit other than the bed), the carpet was worn and stained and the wall paper was peeling off in the bathroom.  There were holes in our sheets, no blankets, and I was bit several dozen times by either fleas for bed bugs (not really sure which).

Considering this is an MGM owned and operated hotel, it surprised the daylights out of me that it was in this poor shape.

I would not reccommened this as a destination for a family at all. 

We left after only staying three days.

1\/2 cuz the room had a fridge...

lol..we check in, they give us directions to our room, its not in the same building, they send us back to our car, then we had to drive to the "Manor" rooms, theyre these shitty rooms that are NOT connected to the casino, 5 minute walk.... in 3 story buildings that look like motel 6's, but MORE ghetto

5 stars for kids tho!!! , most amazing arcade ive ever seen, if i were still a kid, i would have gone nuts!! however..im not a kid anymore : \/

stayed with family on this last trip, wow, never do that again, i would much rather pay double,triple, or quad for any other 3, 4 star hotel in vegas

People, stop booking the manor rooms and then complaining about them.  The west tower and casino tower rooms are fine - large and clean.  The hallways have a pleasant scent.  The casino was clean.  The Adventuredome was clean.  Sure there were kids walking with their parents (not in the gaming area) but none were unruly.  I saw worse kids at the grocery store yesterday.  There is security all over.  The bus stops immediately next door at Slots-A-Fun to head south or directly in front of Riviera across the street to go downtown.  Bus passes are $8.00 for 24 hours and we got four rides each out of them.  We have absolutely no complaints about our stay.

Took a taxi to Circus Circus with my wife and child last weekend so my little one could ride the rides. All I can say I'm glad we weren't staying there, it was very dirty inside and smelled like smoke. There seemed to be a lot of families staying there with out of control kids. The arcade and rides were just ok, not worth the money for the taxi but it killed some time and kept my little girl busy a while.

Wandered around this cony island kind of hotel, to where the roller coaster was, the air hockey and the fun stuff.  It's kind of a blah hotel- and kind of dirty- but overall the place can be fun if your looking for rides and arcade stuff to do.

Where do I begin..

I stayed here 8\/28 - 8-30.. What a mistake that was.

1.) I requested smoking room with two queens in the casino tower and was guaranteed them by two different people since I called twice to verify. Upon arrival, i was told that there were no smoking rooms in circus circus anymore. They stopped smoking rooms the week I booked. I believe that they should have notified all those people who requested smoking rooms, if not what's the point? May as well have stayed elsewhere.

2.) Once we got to the room, the tub looked old and yellow, the sheets were stained, and the curtains smelled very badly. 

3.) The alarms went off at 5:30AM for about ten minutes non-stop to notify everyone of an emergency. So of course everyone was peeking their heads in the hallway and saw nothing. Finally it stopped, five minutes of quiet when BOOM!! AGAAAAAIN the alarms went off to notify the emergency had been taken care of and that went on for ten minutes. TERRIBLE. I don't see why every single person should know of an emergency unless it is risking our lives as well which I'm sure it was no big.. Probably just some drunk fight by the slots.

The only up side was getting on the rides in adventure dome. Other than that, I will never be staying in circus circus again. 

I'd definitely recommend elsewhere.

Decided to check the place out on our Vegas trip. What an awful idea! We should have turned around as soon as we saw the amount of trash in the elevator. As soon as we arrived on the main floor we were greeted with yelling screaming children, sketchy old dudes, and just general chaves around. TRASHY! but we came to see the free circus show. I definitely wanted to see some ariel work ad the net they had looked pretty cool. Instead we got a really bad clown and a juggler who kept dropping his pins. We also considered playing a little blackjack because they had some cheap tables. But at this point I felt like I needed a shower. SKIP THIS PLACE!

Booked a cheap room in the Manor section.  No check in there so had to go to main hotel to check in.  On a fall Thursday, there were 20 people in line.  Nice check in experience once we got to the counter. Supposed to be a king bed, but it was actually two doubles once we got to the room. Room was clean, and it was a long walk back, so just stayed. Safe was closed so we could not use it - annoying.

If I could give it zero stars I would. This place is disgusting. As bad as you can think it is, it's worse. Dirty clothes on the floor in elevators, tagging everywhere, stained and ripped carpets, pool is nasty, the crowd that place draws isn't great either. Awful!!

Price is awesome. Dont expect fridge microwave coffee maker or toothpaste in the room.
This is the second time we are staying here.

At first our experience started off really bad, to the point where my vacation was almost ruined. Thankfully Marco (I think he was in bell desk or maintenance, not sure) came to our rescue, his customer service was phenomenal along with the help of Lydia at check-in, it brought our experience from a 5 to a 10.
I had also lost my phone in the parking lot and amazingly one of the workers found it and turned it in, which I was extremely thankful for, being that I thought my phone was gone for good. The girls at lost and found were also amazing, making sure I got my phone back. 

Overall my experience went from bad to good all because of a few good employees who obviously love their job!

My wife and I stayed at Circus Circus for our honeymoon because my brother paid for our trip and was being price conscious.. not that there's anything bad about that and we definitely appreciate him hooking us up with a Vegas trip.  We had alot of fun while we were there and was definitely worth it, but this is a review about Circus Circus so lets begin.

The place is definitely old and shows it.  We got to the hotel and the minute we walked in the front door someone started trying to hook us up with complimentary shows and passes, but required a major credit card (if its complimentary, why do you need my credit card?)   We get to the check in area and there was nobody there.  We waited about 20 minutes and finally someone showed up.  Circus Circus charges a mandatory resort fee for each day you stay, and apparently from what I've read on other Hotel Reviews, pretty much all of them do... So we weren't surprised nor did we care to pay it.   After we got our room cards we proceeded to head to our rooms.  We showed up on a Tuesday so there was hardly anyone around and that's understandable.  We had to walk an ungodly distance to get to the tower our room was in.. The place really looked run down, everything was expensive and there were lots of kiosks everywhere selling useless junk at ridiculous prices. (i.e. Fake jewlery, hats and crap).  Anyways, we got to our hotel room, and it was decent... about the equivalent of what you can expect from a Motel 6 or Super 8 as far as decor was concerned.  Our view was overlooking the north end of the strip where you can see the Stratosphere and in the distance, downtown.  The view was pretty nice if you ask me.  The bed was extremely comfortable.  The window to our room was partly open in the corner and was nailed in that way so we couldn't close it.

The food there was bland at best and I would recommend eating at other places.  We enjoyed the free circus acts, its surprisingly entertaining.  Come the weekend and all hell breaks loose... There are children EVERYWHERE bumping into you, screaming, acting like.. well... Children and we dare not try to go to the pool.

There were no attractions for 20-30 something adults, like clubs or anything like that.  We would have to venture into the strip or downtown for that.  The casino sections are amazingly boring and poorly lit.

Overall, Im sure this place is great if you want to bring your kids to Las Vegas (why?... its Las Vegas.. should be adults only), but for grown ups, I recommend staying else where.   Other than that, it was an ok stay and we don't have anything else bad to say about this place.

I remember the second time I came here with my parents when my brother and I were still kids. This was the best casino for us, kids who were underage to hang out. They are very strict with underage kids, who cannot pass a certain area and line. Securities here watches you like a hawk watches their prey. Just becareful and not to leave your kids unattended. 

Second floor, there are games and kids shows. The type of games they have are carnival games and arcade games. There should be a food place up stairs but not so good,but good enough for your kids to snack when they are hungry.

hotel- cheap hotel, even cheaper on the weekdays.
Comfortiness- Not very comfy.
Close ness to the strip - not very close, not very sure if there is shuttle but a bit far to drive onto the strip

Gambling-cheap games. At least cheaper than most of the casinos on the strip.

Honestly,  do not waste your money here! Horrible customer service and apparently when they say room service, they mean pizza only. When you call the front desk or to order pizza you can't get in contact with anyone. Just unprofessional and over priced for what you get. The perks are the amount of slots and the floor level of arcade\/circus games for kids. Definitely not worth the time sadly. They have gone downhill =\/

Well First Off we stayed in the Manor... and it was horrible all we could smell was marijuana. the room was sanitary but so old and dingy. the area is very questionable. this was my first time in vegas we had to Walk 3 miles to get to a decent part of the strip. I would have rather stayed off the strip then sleep in the conditions this room ruined part of our trip to Vegas

I honestly would NOT stay here during my vegas trip. I only come here for the Adventure Dome. It is so fun. I love roller coasters. I don't think it's worth it to buy a wristband for an all day thing because they don't have that many rides to keep you there that long unless you're planning on going on the same rides over and over. Great place for the kids. They have 3D spongebob\/Dora shows for the little ones. Height check is required. My little 3 year old daughter was able to see the Dora one. 

The Bathroom in the ADVENTURE DOME smells like straight up dirty diapers. I couldn't even breathe while going to the restroom. HORRIBLE.

I should have known when I told my friends I was staying here and their faces looked like they had drunk spoiled milk that we had made a bad selection. 

First of all, it's a tough hotel to navigate. You might be staying on the 4th floor, but only on some poorly labeled tower. The elevators don't clearly indicate where they go, so I had the experience of going to the 4th floor and seeing that my room was on a different 4th floor. Cool. The elevator to get to my room was tucked behind the meeting rooms. Cooler.

The valet put the wrong number ticket on our car, so it took them 20 minutes to get it. Coolest.

My favorite part of the stay was when I used my key to get into my room, then went to the vending machine to get water and came back to find my key stopped working. First of all, what? Second of all, when I went downstairs (which is quite a walk from the room) to get this straightened out, they informed me I couldn't get back into my room without my ID. When I explained my ID was in the room, they basically told me I was out of luck. Eventually, the person who had the room under their name had to come and yell at them so I could get back in.

Their buffet is terrible. Everything tastes the same. They have very strict security (lots of chains) to get into the buffet, which is weird because no one would want to sneak in after tasting the food. We got the buffet for free because of the aforementioned key snafu and it was still awful. They should have paid us to eat there. They probably give out comps to it all the time because no one would pay to eat there. And they serve Pepsi. Eugh.

The shower worked, though.

For our family vacation in vegas we decided that Circus Circus would be a fun place to stay for Sunday night for my daughter.  

On arrival this place was a madhouse. I expected that but what I didn't expect was that it would be so dated and dirty feeling.

When we entered the room, my wife and I first thought there was no way we could stay here. It smelled like cleaning agents, but felt dirty. We had to do a check of the beds to make sure there weren't any bedbugs. 

The tv is like 10 years old and the channels leave something to be desired.

The beds are old and uncomfortable. I write this as I lay in bed because I can't sleep. Even if the beds weren't uncomfortable, the old ac unit is loud and never seems to turn off for more than 5 minutes.

Our room with a view has a great view... of a parking lot and another building.

Had I not already paid for the room or if our stay was going to be longer I would have gone somewhere else.

The location of the toilet paper in the bathroom requires that you have the arms of an orangutan.

We won't be back.

Circus Circus is the first hotel I ever stayed at on the strip (multiple occasions) and is one of the oldest left standing.  The Hotel itself is comprised completely of clowns and other circus type paintings, colors and is even designed to resemble that of a Circus tent.

Although the Hotel is old it does feature a great amusement park inside complete with a roller coaster and various other rides as well as one of the best video arcades on the strip.  The slots are decently priced and pay out fine and the buffet is a great bargain.  What they place lacks in the charm and elegance of some of the new larger Hotels such as The Venetian, The Bellagio, The Wynn or Hard Rock it makes up for in charm and its inviting family like feel.  

Circus Circus regularly will hold shows in the middle of the floor of the casino throughout the day to entertain the guests.  The rooms are nice enough and a lot more affordable than the aforementioned new Hotels on the strip and most people in Vegas typically spend minimal time in their rooms anyway.  Is the place outdated?  Absolutely but it is also a fixture on the strip and one of the few remaining places with old school Vegas written all over it.  Some minor remodeling wouldn't kill them but they do not want to kill the charm that has remained throughout the years.  If you are looking for a great place for the kids while you gamble this may be the best place for you.

Poor customer service; paper thin walls. For the same price you can pick any other MGM owned hotel.

Before I made reservations here, I called to verify that it would be ok to use my credit card that still had my maiden name on it. I just got married and have been dealing with changing my last name on my ID, Bank, Etc. they said it would be fine and suggested I bring my old ID (with maiden name, even though it's technically no longer valid, for extra verification). 

When we got there, naturally, they refused to take my card. I mentioned that I called and verified that it would be fine, the woman at the counter said she'd go check with who supervisor who denied my card also. (The Mirage though, after we inevitably left Circus Circus, let me use my maiden name Credit Card).

Because we were tired we decided to charge the room to my husband's card (they didn't honor the original price either), and we went to our room in the Circus Circus manor... it was gross. The carpet was stained, the room smelled, and the walls are paper thin. I really mean super super thin walls, we could hear every conversation and tv channel in all the neighboring rooms. 

Needless to say, we left, got a refund (which we were told wouldn't be placed back in the account until after the weekend which meant we were also short on funds for the trip).

We like to stay at this hotel due to price and convenience. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Our recent stay 02\/02\/14-02\/07\/14, we 'upgraded' to a larger 'suite' like room in the Casino Tower. The room was great. However, it was on the second floor, end of the hall. Outside, below our window, was the pick up door for food disposal and other pick up services. Trucks honking and backing up alarms sounded throughout the night. Drivers repeatedly honking,shouting and pounding on doors. I am certain that this can be done at other times through out the day. I will most likely book this location for my next trip in March 2014. I will not stay in the much more favorable West Tower.
Also, a refrigerator in the rooms would be a nice addition. :)

Overall, no complaints. Stayed here 12\/9 for 3 nights. The room was always clean, mattress comfortable, noise level acceptable, wifi strong, and casino amenities convenient.

**And by the way, the front desk is awesome. Seriously, great staff. Kind, organized, knowledgeable, professional and down to Earth. Check in was a breeze.

One night the water went out for the entire West Tower (I think that's what it is called) but no big whoop, as we only stopped off to rest for a bit before heading back out.

What almost caused us to call and complain was when housekeeping decided to vacuum the room directly above us at 11:51PM!!! But it didn't last long. Thankfully.

If I had a major complaint it would be this - the heavy and obnoxious sell from the time share rep. All we did was ask an employee of the casino where the front desk was and she led us to this older dark haired lady who proceeded to drill us on our relationship status, our annual income, while prodding us for our credit cards and $20 each. This vulture was selling time shares.

You know what? Shame on you for this. Totally out of line. Your employee led us to this obnoxious sales rep who was invasive and manipulative. At least I know what to look for now when approached by such con artists. I refused to participate. This lady gave me very negative vibes.

Otherwise, I liked its location and the room was comfortable. I'd return and steer clear of people selling time shares.
One of the reasons I go to Vegas is to meet new people. Unfortunately this place was like a desert... almost nothing around. If you are looking for a cheap spot, this place is perfect tho.

I enjoyed our stay here more than I thought I would.  Located a bit off the strip, this would be the most ideal place to stay if you are bringing children.  This is one of the "original" hotels, so some would probably call it out dated.  It isn't new and shiny like the Linq or Aria, but it has a neat feel and is super family friendly.

Our room was great, the service was exceptional, and if we ever did bring children (though I doubt it) this would be a fun place for them.  They have an actual circus that runs throughout the day, for free, as well as amusement park rides & games located upstairs and in the Adventure Dome.

We didn't spend much time here, other than to sleep, but we did enjoy our time.  We didn't eat at The Steakhouse, but several people mentioned how good it was whenever we were asked where we were staying.

My only word of caution:  If you are trying to save money, do not stay here.  Because of the distance away from the strip and most of the sites you'll probably want to see, you'll spend a small fortune in taxi rides.  The weather was brutal, so we took several rides, and we spent quiet a bit of money on them.  If you are looking to walk the strip and be close to everything, I wouldn't recommend this location.

Family went to the Circus Circus Buffet.  Card was charged twice.  It has been 11 days and still no refund.  Being in the food service industry in the past I know the majority of restaurants would not only have money refunded right away, but would comp the meal as well.  Not at Circus Circus.   We will never go back!

Didn't stay here for our hotel (we stayed at the Tropicana and enjoyed it there) but did bring our daughter here for the SUPER cheap souvenirs all in one place, and the game mezzanine. I do wish we would have found out when the performers would have been on the trapeze, as I think she really would have liked it. It skeeved my husband out since there was no natural light anywhere and an older horror-movie feel to the worn look of everything, but all in all we enjoyed it. The game area was a little dingy and un-loved, but the girl behind the counter was really sweet, and even gave my 3-year-old a few free pieces of candy when what she wanted was exactly the number of tickets she had. If you're looking for a place to let your kid run a little free with a few bucks, this is a good option.

The pluses - Rooms are pretty clean, beds were comfy, not a bad place if you're on a budget. Parking in the Manor buildings was convenient.

The minuses - Dated dated dated. Standard def, CRT television in the room (who  still does this - doesn't it cost you more in electricity?!?), awkward to get in and out of when we visited (music festival had everything jammed up around the place), and they hit us up as soon as we walked in to tour their new hotel. Not what you want when you're just arriving from a long journey.

I was drawn in with their $29\/night rate, however that only tells half the story because they add a $16(ish?) resort fee per night to cover things like wifi, etc. Keep this in mind when shopping, because I don't believe every place does this.

I won't go so far as to tell others to stay away from the place - it was far from the worst place I've stayed in (a certain Red Roof in NJ holds that title), but we probably will try a different place on any return visits. We were LV newbies, and this fit the bill. 

I suspect there are better 'budget' options out there.
Worst hotel in the area... Never stay here... Worst service.... Bathroom tap lickeage... No toothpaste... No shampoo.... I paid $580 for 2 days... Worst worst hotel

Typical Vegas hotel & casino. Definitely has an interesting dynamic of hotel guests and employees for that matter. The West Deli had good food for a reasonable price. Parking was a bit of a mission but I got lucky with a close parking spot. The neighborhood is sketchy so I wouldn't go out at night & it's not located on the main part of the strip.

Total fucking nightmare. 

I don't even know where to start. We stayed in the manor. Upon arrival we noticed that the rooms were incredibly barren and had few amenities. There is no mini fridge, coffee maker, microwave, etc. The televisions are straight out of 1980. But this is just the beginning.

On the first night, my girlfriend and I heard a baby screaming right outside the door. We opened our door to find a shirtless, shoeless baby wandering the halls in distress. An Asian family was watching him and doing absolutely nothing about it. We had to take it into our hands to call the police who contacted security who took at least 40 minutes to show up. But we wouldn't know if they ever did show up, since the baby's cousin finally came to claim her child. What the fuck. 

This is the icing on the cake. At a certain point, on the last night of our trip, our cards all got deactivated. No big deal, it happens, right? So I ran back to the front desk to get a new set. The man behind the desk promised that they would work. I got back to the room, cards don't work. Okay. I ran back. This time, the lady said they'd work for sure. Uh huh. I drove this time. Came back to my room, and... nope. Card still doesn't work. So we called security to let us into our room. He took his sweet ass time but eventually showed up. At this point we just wanted to get into our god damn rooms. When we get in, we call the desk to bring us new cards. A bellman comes by, leaves the cards with my girlfriend and runs the hell out of there. Not his problem anymore, eh? Well guess what? These fucking cards don't work either! So I ran out to tell him what's up. He tells me to call the front desk? Really dude? Call the front desk? You call the front desk! 

And that's where I'm at now. This all happened within the last hour. I'm sitting here trapped in my shitty circus circus room waiting to see what the fuck these incompetent morons are going to do about this situation. 

Don't stay here. You'd be better off at a motel 6. Just steer clear. If you have kids, definitely enjoy the adventuredome. If you like steak, eat at the phenomenal steakhouse. But do not, I repeat, DO NOT stay here. 

Wow.

An update:

We waited and waited but help never came. I called the service desk again. They told us that we could have a new room assigned to us. Well we didn't want a new room. We wanted them to fix our door and not make us move our stuff, since we were leaving the following day. I was really pissed off so I made my way back to the front desk. Michael, the biggest asshole in the hotel industry, told me a whole lot of nothing. He showed no remorse for this nightmare of a situation and eventually told me to speak to the manager. I went to speak to her, but was met with a whole lot more of nothing. At this point, they should have comped our entire stay. Who treats customers this way? Anyway, the lady told us security would come to the room and to go back and wait. Ha! I've heard that one before. So a fairly long wait later, security came by and told us that our door had been "pinned" and that's why we couldn't get in. He said we have to go back to the desk to deal with the situation and get new cards. Long story short, these cards finally worked but it was too late to go out at this point so this was how I spent my final night in Vegas.

I would've given this place 3 stars, had it not been for the awfully springy and outdated mattress........we stayed in the casino tower, that unlike the lodge area, was not smoky & fairly quiet for the week that we were there.  It's a budget hotel, no matter which area you stay in......but I would suggest, if you stay here just spend the little extra and stay in either the West Tower or Casino Tower.  I will say, I liked that it was off the strip which kept it a bit more quiet.  It was also just steps away from a corner store for purchasing water & beer and there was also a CVS about 1\/4 mile away for snacks, wine, liquor and random things.  Our room was clean & served it's purpose.....but again, the bed was very uncomfortable.  Next time I visit, I will more than likely stay somewhere else..........somewhere without the ridiculous "resort" fee.

i always visit circus circus JUST for the carnival games and arcades at the carnival midway. it's this indoor carnival-themed place that goes in a circle with a small magic show playing in the middle.
most games are $1, and if you got kids or you're a kid at heart, how are $1 games not fun!? i won 5 stuffed toys easy and it was just something. my favorites were the balloon popping dart game, the horse race game, chicken in the pot game, and the pounding game.
if you don't have much to do during the day, this is the place to go have fun!

Me and my husband stay on the hotel for one night and at the moment of check in there was a person sending whoever was next in line to a front desk agent and she was greeting everyone in line but I notice she skipped me and my husband which it make me think that it was racist everyone in line besides me were white and she completely ignored me. But the time we were send to the next available desk agent she was rude and not friendly and I've work in hospitality before and I know that when it's busy at least greet the guest but she just ask for my ID and credit card not even a smile. The room was nice and clean but the tub faucet was leaking and it was a little annoying have to listen all nite.

Worst experience I ever had. I had this getto black bitch go all crazy on me at the front desk for asking her some simple questions. Luckily the room price was deducted but I was still not satisfied.  She needs to be fired. In my 31 years of life I'd never been treated as badly. Ruined my trip...

Only reason why I give it a 2 is because of price or else it would be 1. Not sure we're to begin there are quite a few things wrong with this place. Ceiling walls are sagging and joists show, AC vent has some kind of Dust Balls clogging it really it's so clogged nothing comes through. The level of dust in the room was not great either. Hotel lobby were most of the traffic is well it's super narrow since most foot traffic goes through there. Parking elevators seem like they need to be adjusted since door will close on you hard even when you touch the sides to trigger the stop. Filthy elevators as well tons of trash. Lots of the employees would cuss as well normally I'm OK with that but we have a child with us. At the end of the day it's just a really old Hotel that needed a overhaul many years ago. I can't even begin to tell you how many people hit the wall, fire extinguisher boxes as they try to park since parking is cramped. It takes a while to get to the top and once you start going to other hotels you start to really grasp how late in the game this place is.

No idea when we booked there would be so many things to do. We do not have kids but if you do and want to come to Vegas stay at this resort. Arcade, gambling, pizza shops, old timey photo shop, shopping, the adventure done with roller coasters! So many things and very affordable. Price for rooms were great. Beds were comfy. We will be staying here next time!!!

I guess you get what you pay for.  I just needed a place to crash and wanted it to be cheap, and that's what I got.  My "non-smoking" room smelled like a two-pack a day shut in had lived there, there was trash under the bed (nothing scandalous, an empty water bottle and a potato chip bag), the safe had been closed by another guest and the ice machine didn't work.  None of these things is huge for me, but things add up.

The check in experience was a zoo, with people everywhere, long lines and a strange amount of time to check in once I got to the front of the line.  The front desk clerk was very nice and seemed professional, but spent endless minutes inexplicably hitting the enter key, the arrow key, or clicking on something.  i thought I might unknowingly be in a comedy skit of some kind.

I can't comment on the gaming experience or any other the other things Circus Circus has to offer, but after a 10 year absence from Las Vegas, this experience does not make me inclined to return, and if I do it will be to another hotel.

The only positive aspect of my stay was a very low price and a resort fee that is lower and therefore a little less stupid than most other properties in Las Vegas.

This place was HORRIBLE!!!!! Not to mention extremely unprofessional !!!!! When I arrived to checkin the receptionist told me that we didn't have reservations for the weekend. After showing her my confirmation email she gave me the run around for about two hours! She finally gave me what she calls an upgrade room.... But I bag to differ! My keys to the room didn't work we had to wait another 45 mins in front of my hotel room door for two different house keepers to contact someone to open the door. When I booked my room it was advertised as a smoking room with a refrigerator. I noticed there was a no smoking sign so I called down to asked if this was a smoking room like it was advertised and the receptionist told me that this was a Smoke free hotel! ! That was not what was advertised when I booked this room! Needless to say this was a horrible start to my morning after a 4 hour drive from LA. Then there wasn't a working ice machine or vending machine on my floor when I called for an ice bucket they gave me a garbage pail with no ice? Walk up stairs to get ice from different floor which was covered with roaches at 11pm like a trap house . Holes in the sheets and blankets I recommend no one stay here ever !!!! #dontgohere

It was a last minute booking. We needed to stay close to the Wynn but didn't want to pay Wynn money. The stay was cheap. Do not stay anywhere other than one of the Towers. The Manors (or whatever they are called) are just motel styled meth labs. Not worth it. Cough up the extra 10$ and stay in a more decent room.
This place just sucks.. Avoid at all cost.. Do your self a great favor, dont come here, i told you so..

Casino review: Old, seen better days but still fun.  Lots of kids here, but also lots of stuff for kids to do.  Service was good to very good, Video Poker run down but playable.  The 2nd level "midway" is a real throwback.  Circus twice is definitely in it's twilight years, but is still a kinda fun piece of Vegas history.  Enjoy it while you can, because when the SLS is completed and *IF* Fountainblu is ever finished, the North Strip should start coming back and I'm sure MGM will plough Circus Circus for a modern, high end property.

Easy check in, stayed during weekdays not many crowds. 7 year old and 4 year old loved it. Spent the days in adventure dome a little over priced but kids had fun. Not many rides for them but also had no line wait time. Toddler loved the kids splash area and 7 year old loved the water slides. They do close those early 5:45. Pool was crowded i wouldn't take a dip. 
Stayed in skyrise tower the room was a good size for 2 adults 2 children, it was cleaned everyday and towels were replaced. No coffeepot or microwave.
Elevators are so slow and overcrowded. 
Smoke from cigarettes is pretty bad. It's everywhere could smell it in our room.
The free shows were fun, the midway and fairway offer games and big arcade areas. Very friendly hotel guest had no issues.
 The Adult drinks are pricey and were not good. 
The kids had a blast i stayed within budget! You get coupons with your stay to use around casino. I would come back for another stay.

Ok, here goes...

We stayed at Circus Circus with our kids on the way to Disneyland between Denver and Anaheim.  We considered driving straight through, and in hindsight should have.  Instead we stopped at Circus Circus.  Our room was dirty when we checked in.  there were used dirty rags in the room.  The walls are paper thin.  You can hear your neighbor even having regular conversations clear as day.  We also had to call security as our neighbors were smoking, and having a party... At least 20 different people in that room.  Nothing was done.   My son has asthma.. I guess I made the wrong choice stopping in Vegas but there really is no other town half way to stop. Management did not care or address any concerns.  I will NEVER stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

You get what you pay for I jus came back to cali stayed sun an mon night at monte carlo an 3rd night at circus circus since we had the kids for last night. Walls are so thin you hear crazy kids in room next to you. The place is a zoo it is so packed!! Theyput 2 lil tiny pillows on each bed we had to ask for more they were so little. Also when I checked in I waited in line for about 45min.  I probably wont stay there again. You can def tell its a older hotel.

Let me start off by saying that we did not stay in the hotel for Circus Circus. We only came to Circus Circus to bring my son to play some games at the midway and to check out their adventuredome. We were in Las Vegas for spring break vacation. 

First annoying thing is that people were smoking in non-gambling areas. I understand that it's allowed to smoke indoors in casinos but for a casino\/resort that caters to the family environment and kids, you would think they would restrict smoking in non-gambling areas. Just walking to the adventuredome, we had at least 3 people walking in front of us smoking. My wife and I can deal with that, but my kid shouldn't have to. Also, if you are going to allow smoking in areas near where kids will be, at least upgrade your ventilation in those areas. The smoke smell was so stagnant and irritating to your eyes and mouth. 

The pricing for the adventuredome is obviously geared to force you to get a all day pass. For my son to ride one ride, based on the type of ride it was, he spent $9. LMAO, that's for one ride. My son isn't tall enough yet to ride a majority of the rides and so it wasn't worth it to get an all day pass. The midway was the only decent area for my son to enjoy. 

Honestly don't see us coming back here unless they make some major changes. And based on some of the other reviews here on yelp, we definitely wouldn't stay here unless they did a complete renovation.
Great time.. Great service .. Great water park. Will be back again and avoid the trash service at the golden nugget from bj i mean jp from check in services.

The price is really pretty decent though my friend stayed at Royal Resort for the same cost and that place looks really nice. Circus Circus as a hotel is like an 80s casino. For the rate I got, I was in the motels on the side of the hotel but the bonus is there is parking right in front of the building rather than having to park in a garage and walk far to get to your room. The motel has key card doors that don't work so you can just walk in. There are bike security guys who ride around to keep the place secure but there is no parking or security attendant in the attendant box at the front of the parking lot. From what I saw of the whole hotel, you stay here for the price and some of the kid friendly amenities. 
The room in the motel was large and it was pretty clean. The matresses are not that firm. The bathroom is clean. TheTV is a flat front but not flat screen. I had to ask for a fridge. There are no coffee makers. There are no ice machines on each floor - only one on the main floor. You can hear the neighbors through the walls, can hear their tv and their talking. But the room is pretty clean and about 30% larger than a standard motel room.
they have free wifi.The hotel is sprawling and its a bit challenging finding your way around. I would not stay here with kids with the hopes of relaxing at the hotel - it would only be a place to get a good nights sleep, a hot shower, and then out the door to do activities.

This is probably the most entertaining hotel I've ever been to in my whole life! The staff were friendly and welcoming, they told us we're all attractions were located and what times the circus shows started. We asked for a good view of Las Vegas and the lady at the desk gave us a pile of construction to look at. I really didn't care cause what am I supposed to do about it? The second we walked in that hotel room, it was a decent nice hotel room. The tv was kinda small the first night we stayed. Regulations to the attractions outside of our hotel room abut inside the building was nice and cool for the kids! The kids totally had something to do when they were bored! The adventuredome had a lot of cool rides for the kids to go on. Even 24 hour passes!!! Above the circus stage there was games for the kids to win prizes and stuff like that. Regulating to the pool, very dirty and the hot tub too I would recommend not to go to the pool here. Crowded all I can say. The second stay was way more thrilling then the other one! We asked for a view again and we finally got it!!! We got a bigger Tv this time too! We were more satisfied with the second stay then the first. I would totally recommended coming here for a little fun! I totally forgot about the food court and the buffet! The buffet was very nice and served good food! A little pricey so I recommend to go eat something outside the hotel Instead of eating in the buffet. The food court is by the pool, They serve really good cheese fries . There were also a lot of gift shops in the hotel very expressive. I'd totally come to this hotel if you are ever to come to Las Vegas

This place is okay if you are taking children with you. IF YOU DON'T HAVE CHILDREN...DON'T STAY HERE. Lots of kids and families running around. The rooms are reasonable priced and clean. Not sure about the Casino I don't gamble. However, It's pretty big with lots of slot machines.  But no partying or clubbing going on in Circus Circus.

I hate to have to write this review but can't belive my experience  yesterday. We've been taking our kids here for 3 years now and were excited to have them experience the new adventure dome. We have a five and a 7 yr old . I looked around to figure out what rides they could each do based on height restrictions  (33"-58") based  on the ride. Our 5yo was 44" and the 7yo was 47.5" just under the 48" requirement for big rides. I thought good they won't  be fighting over who goes on each ride and they can go on all the same. I was shocked  an thought I was part of a hidden camera joke to find the ticket attendent requiring  me to purchase a 48" ticket for the 7yo. I said he's under the line and placed him under the measuring stand. The attendee insisted no he would have  to purchase the 48" ticket I was in total disbelief and said your joaking. The attendee snidly replied 'i wish I was'. I felt sick, embarrassed, angry and disgusted. I couldn't  belive what I was hearing.  The attendent  would endanger kids safety to sell a higher price big ride ticket. I said loudly enough for anyone near to hear 'THAT IS UNSAFE!". Sad we won't  be returning  here after our many fun times  in the past but this is beyond unacceptable  for a place that should know how to treat it's  patrons better.
Stayed here in august. The room was like staying in a motel 8. The indoor theme park was ok. the casino seamed very old and rundown.

Ok hotel for value especially if you want to be on the strip and traveling with a family. The adventure dome was fun for the kids although one of the rides was stuck twice . Our bathtub faucet would not stop dripping after attempts to tightly turn off. Didn't bother on calling anyone as it seems like thousands of people staying there and from what we could see the staff was very busy from any position.

This place was dirty, found some pizza crusts behind a cabinet and a used kurieg cups in the coffee maker still.
Also went to Vince Neils Tatuado and ordered the breakfast special, the waitress came out with our breakfasts and I asked about where's the toast? she replied back to me we only bring that if the guest requests it? I was in shock! Clearly stated eggs, pancakes, sausage or bacon and toast. 

My suggestion is spend your money elsewhere, and pretty much just avoid this place, I know I will be in the future. 

proof of nasty pizza behind the tv console
http:\/\/i286.photobucket.com\/albums\/ll95\/jubjubrsx\/IMAG0692_zps6613c869.jpg

Some of the housekeeping staffs are disappointing. 1st day was done marvelously, the best I've seen! But next day, took the tip but didn't finish the room. Pillows were on the couch, throw cover was on the floor. Trash bin was in the walkway, didn't bother removing the tissue on the bathroom countertop... Just too many things to complain. So I called the housekeeping asking them why it isn't done even though it's almost 5pm. She was supposed to be one of the supervisors but didn't even apologized then just said with an attitude, "we'll send someone and technically they are working till 6 their day isn't over yet

Truly the MOST fun I had in Vegas! We won a ton of money at Circus Circus and we are already making plans to go back this summer!! The buffet was good. A bit overpriced but it was good. Extremely pleased with Circus Circus!!

Exceeded my expectations! Friendly staff. They deliver your bags to your room. I thought and read negative thing about this casino but its not true. I recommend it and would stay here again. They are upgrading the pool. The rooms and casino are way better than i imagi ed. I rate it so high due to the value of what i paid for. Most casinos have doubled their prices. It will cost at least $200\/night to stay at other casinos on the strip. It does smell like marijuana all over this casino. I'm told its spring break week.

Sorry, Circus Circus, your arcade and circus acts are the bomb, the pools looked great but please invest in getting new sheets, blankets and towels. They were stained and ripped when I first got there, I requested new ones... wait wait.. no luck, walked out and found a maid and she gave me 15 pillow cases(English much?), slowly explained sheets blankets pillows and towels, got them.. took them to room.. none of them fit the bed.. King bed is not a king bed, but two twins pushed together... grrrrrreat. Nothing special for birthday kids, even though its supposed to be a casino for kids. Buffet wasn't great either.

I spent a few nights here last month.  It's definitely not up to par compared to the other casinos on this side of the strip. The room was clean at least but most things were outdated besides the decor. Cell service is pretty crappy since the hotel was built before everyone started using WiFi and data and cell phones themselves. ha.

One good thing about the place, the staff was friendly.  The casino was ok...it's pretty small for a Vegas casino though. 

I wouldn't recommend staying here if you want to see the luxurious side of Vegas but if you'd like a cheap room on the strip, go for it! 

One more thing, it was under construction, so traffic in and out was a MESS and the traffic guide was no help just sitting there letting everyone figure out which way to go themselves. tsk. tsk.

Circus circus isn't a horrible place. I can't trash them. They give you a lot to do on the resort so that you don't have to go off. However, I wouldn't stay for more than one night. You pay for what you get here! Carpets are stained, which doesn't mean that they aren't necessarily clean. No hot water. Moderately warm water came in and out, which is unpleasant. 
The food at Vince Neil's actual restaurant was bad. The bar had chicken fingers which was the best thing we had to eat there for two days. We also went to the famous steak house, which no one told us to make a reservation yet they knew we would have to use our coupon before we left the next day. So we had to eat at the bar and the manager did choose to honor it but We were only able to get appetizers. They wouldn't put chicken on my Caesar salad. My mom had the caprese and we were less than overwhelmed. Parking is plenty and everything is convenient. ATM fees were wild! Something like $4.99, keep dreaming. 
However, there is lots to keep you entertained and works for a budget. Again, it's a one night type of thing in my opinion and other opinions I've read.

Circus Circus was SO cool when I used to be a kid. All I remember was going to the midway above the casino where they have all the arcade machines and waste so much time there.

Fast forward to the present when I went there a couple times since I had some friends stay at the hotel. As far as the casino goes, there definitely needs to be some renovations done. The hotel rooms also need some improvements done as well. I suppose given the price it's a good deal but I would at least try and look elsewhere before I book a room there.

The location of Circus Circus has a lot to be left desired since it's pretty far from the center of the strip where most of the action is. If you have a car then it should be no problem.

Cheap Hotel and Casino. But There's nothing special about this place. I like how they have an amusement park in the hotel and an medium-size midway (games) for the kids. But definitely one of the lower- rated hotels in Vegas. 

The rooms were good. They were clean and maids clean the rooms pretty well everyday and they change our towels when needed. One thing I didn't like was that the walls were pretty thin. I could hear the neighbor's conversation. 

Also, I wished these rooms had more security or at least the rules are enforced better. We requested non-smoking, so the receptionist put us on the non-smoking floors. But our neighbors were smokers! and we could smell the smoke seeping through our doors. We called the front desk to complain and they told us that they were send security up right away. But nothing happened... we still smelled smoke and no matter how many times we complaint, we never heard or saw security take care of the matter. 

Also another thing that I disliked was how anal and rude most of the workers are. I thought that the staff at the midway were suppose to be kid-friendly, but no they scare away the kids. They barely speak to you and they give you this stare that makes you want to give them a 10-foot radius. 

Overall: It's cheap, but i think that you can stay at the better hotel for about the same prices if you look online for deals.

This hotel is great for staying with teens! It has a huge arcade and astrodome with rides.  They can "party" all day and night! What's not great is the old outdated rooms- especially if you are not in the main tower.  The back buildings are so run down and dirty- they actually gave us a free upgrade because there was poop on the sheets in our room there.  And the entire building smelled like marijuana (we don't really mind this- but is was super strong and permeated the stale air- not cool for a kids oriented hotel). Also our bathroom filter that says "change every 3 months" looked like it was NEVER changed.  Finally on the negative- there is no good place to eat here.  There is an excellent foot massage place! And if you stay in the main tower- a great place to bring kids and teens. Something for everyone!!

Wow, this place is definitely interesting...a ton of people everywhere and if you were wondering where all the children visiting Vegas stay or end-up, it's here.

Out of all the casinos\/hotels on the strip this was by far the busiest.  They have a huge section for games...it's like having an indoor carnival and arcade.  

If you have children, this is probably a good option because there's so much they can do.  If you are a child at heart, this may work well for you, as long as you don't mind the sensory assault.  If you are an adult who doesn't really care for children, you probably won't like this spot very much.

Worse hotel ever. so dirty and we where expecting to stay in the real hotel but they send us to building b witch its so dirty never stay in this place do your self a favor. Its not worth a single penny.

I just want to give major props to the plumber on staff who saved me from a mental disaster.
I stayed here for a short vacation last summer.
I was in the bathroom washing my face or brushing my teeth or whatever, and being incredibly clumsy accidentally dropped the pendant part of a very expensive necklace down the sink drain. This was a very expensive gift from a relative so I was freaking out, not even gonna say how much.
I didn't dare run the faucet.. I could see a bit the necklace the top of the sink. After mentally freaking out a bit I called the front desk and an hour later they sent their plumber on staff up.

After I explained the situation he got some tools, opened up the pipes below the bathroom sink and retrieved my necklace for me. That was a HUGE relief for me.
I think this is why I don't wear super nice stuff when I go out.

I'll write more about the hotel itself later, but this always stands out in my memory.
Worst hotel ever maid stole our keys had to drive back an 4 hours back to California and 8 totally hours in a rental car

The first day of walking through the casino at Circus Circus, I legit felt nauseous - like I really needed to vomit due to the stuff they sprayed to make the casino "smell good" . I did not find the smell pleasant at all, and no I am not one those people who are sensitive to certain smells. But this is the only casino that has  such a weird and nauseating smell compared to any of the hotels off and on the strip. Thank god the room didn't smell like the casino though. The smell was so strong that it sticks to the plastic bags of your food takeout as well from the Westside Deli that is located around the casino area.

I made reservations for a king room in the West Tower, but when I was ready to check-in they gave me a double queen instead, since they ran out of the room I initially booked for. The room looked clean when waking in, but upon further inspection I found old blood stains on the sheets and black stains on the towels. Also, they really need to clean the windows. In addition, the towel rack was broken ( it fell off when I tried to take one the new towels off the rack) and surprised to see no one has attempted to fix it.

Pros are that its a good space for families and kids because of the onsite arcade and Adventure dome, plenty of slots available, and the waitresses often come by and quickly you your drinks.

Overall, cannot stand the smell and hotel room should provide more clean and working amenities. Will not stay again in the future.

I'm sorry circus circus but I have to give you a one star until you tear that manor down . It is unsanitary, I can't believe you allow human beings to sleep in that place .... We booked a two queen sized  hotel room for $105 a night .. Booked for 3 nights . They charge a $25 resort fee per day . We arrived to the hotel close to midnight. Staff was accommodating and very nice . They put us out in the manor tower #c . The hall ways smelt of cigarette smoke , weed , body Oder , molding carpet , feces , and urine . We get to our room two little beds that looked like they were there from when they first opened in 69 . We pull back our sheet , they were so dirty and stained I felt like there were things crawling on me all night . The room was so heavy with smoke I couldn't sleep  .. And this was supposed to be a non smoking room ... The next day we asked for a refund or to be moved to a nicer location... The manager that helped us was so sweet her name was Roula I believe. She took care of our needs got us out of the manor and moved us to the actual hotel ... No smoke smell , very clean and a lot nicer .. Make sure when you book a room at circus circus to tell them you absolutely don't want to be in the manor you want to be in the main hotel . I'll give this place a 4 star once they get rid of that damn manor .

I SERIOUSLY FOUND A BLOODY DIRTY TISSUE AND ROACHES IN MY ROOM!!!!! There was pee in the toilet when i got there.  A sispicious unidentified stain on the bed. And a roach crawled across my foot. This place filthy and the staff is beyond rude.  Don't waste your money here.  Had great memories here as a kid but this place needs to be torn down.  Seriously the Bates Motel is safer, cleaner, and less outdated.

On your way, I hope you stop to see the light show. There's a fun sort of effect they have upstairs. There's clouds and fake lightning. It fun for kids and grown ups. This place may not be everyone's idea of family fun, but then again why bring the family to Las Vegas? The rooms are very reasonably priced, the personnel are friendly and the rooms are comfy :)

This hotel was okay. I went here around December of 2012. We stayed here for one night because we came a day earlier.

When we came there we was looking for parking so we can check in. Lucky we got help right away instead of standing in that long line and it was 12 am when we got there. We got confused where we a post to go to look for the room we rented for one night.

In the morning we wanted McDonald breakfast so my wife and I went to the parking garage where we parked and look for one by the strip, luckily a security told us there's one in the hotel itself. We got lost looking for it. We saw people with McDonald's breakfast and ask them, they said its by the casino, but it was by the circus circus arcade upstair. We ask a lot of people and finally found it. The McDonald's in California where we live is cheaper.

The cool thing about this hotel was the theme park in door. I like roll coaster, but this one was tall and it have loops. It made me really scared. My wife went one it 3 times before we went home.

Pros:
Cheap
Big parking garage.

Cons:
A lot of people.
Got lost looking for our hotel room.

We were really excited to take our three children to Circus Circus for the first time but we weren't impressed. We found our room to be overpriced for what we received. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the bathtub was falling apart and the room lacked the amenities one would expect when shelling out close to $200 a night for a room! While we had fun playing at the Adventure Dome, if we were to come again we would stay at a nicer resort and take the kids to the Adventure Dome for a day.

Not sure where all the hate is coming from, but I surely had a blast staying at this hotel. Sure, you're going to run into poker tables and slot machines but this place is great to let your "inner kid" out.

Checking is was as easy as counting my 1,2,3's. Our room was great. Clean sheets, clean restroom, fresh towels, a fridge, and a fluffy bed. That's all I needed and I'd like to keep it simple.

The circus acts were very entertaining. I love the sarcasm of the magician and the twirly whirly acrobat. The games were fun and I was really happy carrying all the stuffed animals around. 

The pool is located across the street; near the Manor. My S\/O and I had a good dip without too many people waddling and swimming around. There was room enough to get tossed around lol. 

I docked off one star because of the whiff of smoke that slammed into my face upon entering. Other than that, this place was cheap, satisfying, and my room clean!

1. Non-smoking room smelled like smoke (each time after coming back from our daily outings)
2. Room's smoke detector had tissue paper stuffed into the vent
3. Pillowcase had gross splotches on it
4. There was a cricket in the room
5. Floors were wet after housekeeping cleaned
6. Soap smells like play-doh


Gross gross gross.
Never staying here again.

My best friend and I booked our 1st ever Vegas trip using Expedia. We were pretty clueless as to which hotels were good, so we saw the very low price and booked. I am writing this review as a 20 something year old professional who enjoys having fun on her vacations and has an about average budget to spend on vacations. 

Clientele\/Guests: 
For me personally, I expected to be around people who resembled the cast of The Hangover. I noticed that there were a large number of families, children, and interesting looking people who stay at this resort. The people did not make me feel unsafe or sketched out in anyway, but they were not the glamorous Vegas party crowd I had heard so much about. These are the people who sit in the casino ALL day and still think that mullets are a cool hairstyle. The people seemed to be of lower taste, I'll just say that. There were a lot of kids around which almost made me feel ashamed to be carrying my giant drink all over the hotel. Nearly every morning, there were screaming children and parents in the hallway which woke me up and was annoying. If I would have the decency not to come back to the hotel at 4AM drunk and being loud, as an adult and parent, kindly remind your children that not everyone is awake at 6AM and screaming loudly by everyone's door is a bit rude. From Tuesday to Thursday, no pretty looking people or young adults engaging in drunken shenanigans here. On Friday and Saturday, the scene got much better. There were much more couples and young people hanging out in the casino, the bars, and enjoying the drinks and louder music being played that was absent during the week. On Saturday night, the casino actually seemed like a pretty poppin' place to be. 

The Room:
We stayed in the West Tower, and after reading some reviews, I was dreading it. However, I was not the least bit disgusted or skeeved out by our room. Everything was really clean and organized, I never once felt grossed out by our room. Even the bathroom did not seem unclean in anyway. The beds were pretty comfortable, but I found it strange that we were never given a comforter until Thursday. This was not an issue because it was too hot for a comforter anyway. When we were finally given a comforter on Thursday however, I was so happy to see that it was delivered in a sealed plastic bag, never opened, almost brand new! Awesome! Usually I get disgusted by comforters and throw them in the corner of the room. Be prepared that the room can get FREEZING cold upon arrival or after the maids leave, but is easily fixed with the control panel in the room. The shower was OK, but not the best. It was very clean, but quite annoying to operate. The water has three temperatures: freezing cold, room temperature, and scold your body\/third degree burn hot. Also, once you turn off the water it never actually turns off, it drips perpetually. Overall, the room was great to stay in, very comfortable and clean. I would recommend staying in the west tower to anyone on a budget. 

Amenities:
Circus performances, oxygen bar, indoor amusement park, frozen yogurt cafe, several restaurants and two bars. 
 
Overall, I found my stay at Circus Circus to be just fine. There was nothing outstanding about the hotel, but it was not bad either. At the end of the day, we really went there just to sleep, shower and change, play some slots, and grab food when we didn't feel like eating anywhere else, that's all a hotel really is. The entertainment was on the strip, so we didn't spend much time in the resort. People will say that Circus Circus is "off the strip" which is NOT TRUE. Circus Circus is at the very end of the strip and seems far away from the other hotels to some people. My friend and I are both decently active, so walking from the hotel to the other hotels on the strip was not much of a physical challenge for us. The only challenging part was timing, if we had a reservation somewhere and wanted to walk we tried to leave very early. There is the Deuce bus which is right outside of the resort and across the street which goes up and down the strip, we took this many times when we couldn't walk. Would I stay here again? If I had to, I would. The hotel is inexpensive, clean, and comfortable. I think I'd prefer to stay somewhere more geared towards my age :)
We got exactly what we needed. A clean (newly renovated), cheap ($25 a night) room on the Strip.

Listen, it's not the Four Seasons people, it's Circus Circus, you get what you pay for. This is a great hotel for families and an affordable price. Do what we did... Spring for an extra ajoining room for the kids. The midway is a lot of fun, and the free shows up there are entertaining. The gaming tables have lower minimums then some of the bigger casinos. The pool is basic, nothing "splashy" :) My only real issue is they need a basic diner type restaurant. Breakfast choices, besides the buffet, were very limited.

I stayed in the hotel about a year ago during spring break.  Having never been to Las Vegas before, I was oblivious to the poor decision I was making.  The place is crawling with small children, the rooms are pretty dumpy, and although the hotel may claim it's on the strip, it's about 1.5 - 2 miles from where any of the real action is.  If you're looking for a cheap room, stay at the Imperial Palace.  Rates there are similar to those at Circus Circus but you're right in the heart of the strip.

I should point out that the casino does have fairly low minimums - $2, $3, and $5 blackjack tables can be found.  The "Slots O Fun" building seems to have most of the cheaper tables.  So if you're a low roller, this place might be a decent spot to hit for some gambling ... just avoid staying in the hotel.

My girlfriend booked 2 rooms for our trip to Vegas for the Jamz competition for two nights. She was hesitant due to the low reviews but we were traveling with out kids and grandparents so we booked it anyways. 

I must say we were very satisfied with our stay and fleas we did choose this hotel for this trip. At check in the receptionist was very nice and helpful. She was able to upgrade my parents room and have our rooms be across from each other which made it convenient l. 

We valet our vehicle and the bellmen were awesome! The rooms were nice. No issues. I requested additional blankets and towels and the lady brought them up fast and was very accommodating. 

The adventure some was exciting for the kids and pretty cool. There was also an arcade upstairs which is just what the kids love. 

We are at blue iguana Mexican food & our order was ready fast & the enchiladas were good. 

We ever up extending our stay until Monday. Definitely coming back with the kids. Thank you circus circus staff for all you do

In my travels, staying in Provence or at luxurious Parador is not my norm. Neither is coming to Las Vegas of which I have little interest except for an interesting show or if I happen to be passing through. That later was the case the last time I came to Circus Circus. My stepdaughter and I arrived after starting the in Moab Utah and all I was interested in was making sure that she was comfortable, safe and entertained. 

For what I wanted (including price), our experience at Circus Circus was OK, and we were on the road soon enough the next day towards Death Valley and the Eastern Sierra. At the same time, this place really is past it's time and in hindsight I could have chosen better here in Las Vegas, even in the eyes of my child.
Check out our awesome experience by clicking on the link https:\/\/youtu.be\/ZY8CN9vTuTA

Looked a lot different from when i was a kid. 
Does this hotel always look dirty, run-down and dark?

I'm giving it a 3 because I won big from gambling and their games are never disappointing.
PLUS, their dealers are hilarious!
I would visit the hotel if I was in vegas but wouldn't choose to stay here.

We walked in at 11pm and we saw a prostitute on our way to our room at the hallway. And when we walked to our room there was a sharp sperm smell especially in the bathroom area. My kids were asking non stop what is that smell and we couldn't say what it is. We had to handle the smell because we were so tired and kids were exhausted. They won't give us another room because they cannot clean this room tonight to sell someone else. Management is bad because they will let us stay at this room instead of finding a way to give us a better one. We now know why they don't get more than two star :( Bad really bad

I haven't been to Circus Circus since I was a kid. I recently went back after many many years, now as an adult, with my mom and my sister's family. This is one of the few places in Las Vegas where you can bring kids and family. This review is for the carnival games area, not the hotel or casino.

-- LAYOUT --
The carnival games area is on the second floor and shaped like a circle. This makes it easy to know where you started.

-- CIRCUS CIRCUS --
I remember the fun I had as a kid. Games were really cheap, and there were gigantic plush animals as prizes. I secretly wanted one as a kid but didn't really have time, or talent, to win the games. Now as an adult, I had the money and time to try them all, and if you take inflation into consideration, all the games are quite reasonably-priced.

I first went on the Jurassic Park shooter video game. I tried the triceratops level, and while I couldn't beat it after several tries, that was the funnest $2 I spent there, and I highly recommend it. Who doesn't want to play against dinosaurs?

I then gravitated towards the carnival games with giant stuffed animals. The first was a game where you had to knock over three square wooden cubes stacked one on top of another with an oddly shaped ball. I spent $10 for six balls.
