Each and every time, I would hit two of them off the table, but there would always be one left. Apparently, the trick is to hit it exactly between the bottom two cubes. I tried that but to no avail. I've worked at carnivals as a kid, so I know you basically had to get some of these shots just right. Sadly, I couldn't win a large plush for my niece at this one.

There are a bunch of old and new types of carnival games where you can win prizes. It's incredibly cheap (proportional to the prices from ten years ago). Most games cost $1-3. 

There are lots of claw crane machines available which range from 50 cents to $2 depending on the size of the prize. Only play these if you see a loose doll at the top; that's the trick.

There was some acrobatics show at some point, and you had to get there at least thirty minutes early to get a seat, otherwise you can watch from the sides.

-- ATMOSPHERE --
The took off a star because of the look of the place. Circus Circus feels a bit dated, and a nice fresh coat of paint along with some decor upgrades would immensely help it from looking like it still lives in the 90s.

-- SUMMARY --
There are games for kids, games for adults. And don't forget to check out Adventuredome if your kids prefer rides instead of games; it's in the same building. Together, Adventuredome and Circus Circus is a great place for a family to go in Las Vegas.

For the money I guess it's worth it but all the other things that could be improved on are not a short list. The hotel is at the end of the strip. The bedding was a bit stained and had some holes was not very soft. Pillows are not comfyat all.  Pool was freezing. The blow dryer burnt my hair and it fell off. The room is very loud as walls are super thin. The staff on a whole was ok but we did encounter a rude man checking us in. I would prob not stay here again.
The fam & I stayed here from june 25 to 27th. We simply loved it. Room was huge and we had great service. This was my first trip to Vegas but I'm already planning my next. Thank u Circus Circus

We just checked out from Circus Circus. This is our second time here. The first time was much better. We stayed a total of 3 nights. The 2nd night we were here our air conditioner broke down at 2 am. The engineer named Frank came very quickly and fixed it. That same night our hotel hallway was filled with marijuana smoke. Not cool! The 3rd day after coming back from the strip, we arrived back at our hotel to find the maid did NOT do her job. One of our beds were made, one was not. There was towels and wash cloths just thrown on top of the bathroom counter, a tissue box just thrown there and no plastic cups were thrown out. We told a front desk person and she didn't even acknowledge our complaints. All in all it wasn't a good experience this time except with Frank the engineer!

Wow what an amazing time in Vegas celebrating my 23rd birthday! The Circus Circus was truly a great place. Love that they have so much parking garages available! Check in was a breeze and the gentlemen who checked me in was very friendly and professional :) I got a room on the sky rise tower on the 27th floor and it was amazing and had an amazing view. The beds were so comfortable! Love that they had a resort book filled with great coupons that I definitely took advantage of. Booked my room through Expedia for an amazing deal. $28 rate and just pay the resort fee at the hotel (WHICH IF YOU TAKE THE TIME TO READ DESCRIPTIONS ALL WEBSITES DO INFORM YOU OF THE RESORT FEE). Definitely coming back again!!!
Deserves NO stars. We had a lousy stay. Room was filthy. Had to Clorox the shower myself and clean all the glass and mirrors. The pool\/water park was closed both days we were there.
You can block my yelp review , but you can't block my facebook review! This place place sucks. I like a clean room

I had made reservations for 7\/23-7\/26. I called a week in advance to change it for the weekend of 7\/28. I was told that it has changed and that we were good to. I wasn't given a second confirmation and I thought nothing of it. When we showed up to check in we were told that the reservations was cancelled. We were pissed because we drove nearly 300 miles just for them to tell us that. We ended up booking a room at the Hilton lake Las Vegas in Henderson and paying nearly $600. I was contacted once from some company that they used for surveys only for them to apologize and they hope that I will continue staying with them in the future. Not once did they compensate me for the trouble and headache that they put me thru. NEVER WILL I STAY THERE AGAIN OR SPEND MY HARD EARNED MONEY THERE. I've stayed at other hotels that were a million times better.

We're locals and have been to Midway way too many times.  But being good hosts, we return whenever friends or family visit Vegas.  

We visited on Tuesday, June 25th and treated all the kids to play carnival games and watch some free circus acts in the crazy, chaotic atmosphere of Circus Circus Midway.

We went early to avoid the crowds and our group was enjoying our visit.  Service was overall great.  My little niece lost one of her small "consolation" prizes virtually minutes after walking away from the booth, and after unsuccessfully searching for it, the lady just gave her another one.  That was very nice.  

The kids played in the one where you hammer a launcher that flings a chicken into pots and the little kids really struggled with it.  The nice lady there gave them 2nd chances without us asking or the kids even complaining. That was very nice.

Then we came across Ms. Hoan, who was working the Buoy Game.  There are a bunch of little bowls on water and you toss ping pong balls into them.  Most are clear but there are a few red and blue ones.  I believe the blue ones are for the big stuffed animals.

So get this...

Our 9-year old tosses about 10 balls without winning a prize until he finally lands one in the blue bowl.  We erupt with cheers.  

Ms. Hoan is on the other side, however, and another family tosses a ball in the same blue bowl which shoots our ball out.  They erupt with cheers and the two families look at each other uncomfortably.  Ms. Hoan comes over and we both explain to her what happened.  Ms. Hoan looks at my 9-year old and says "Nope...I only see their ball in their.  You get nothing.'

WOW!!!  The other family apologizes and looks horrified as they walk away with their huge giraffe.  My son, to his credit, shrugs it off and we move on to the next game.  

As a few minutes pass, I become infuriated and I go to the Customer Service office.  A supervisor by the name of Brian apologizes and gives my son a big stuffed animal.

Circus Circus - I recommend that you review video of this incident.  Ms. Hoan is a disgrace to your brand.  The incident occurred at approx 3pm on 6\/25 at your Buoy game.

This is a good place to stay if you have a family. It is at the end of the strip so you don't have to be in the middle of the crowds and there is also plenty of things to do all at this casino. It doesn't look too big but the mall and the passages seem endless the gaming floor is catered to the average player that enjoy playing penny, nickel and dollar slots. They also have a small circus act, a midway, and the theme park for kids. All of which is indoors which is a major plus for summer time. The rooms are fairly priced from what I hear. We stayed in the RV park (The only one on the strip) and it was nice. There was plenty of pools and they also had a nice dog park (No Grass) and a dog wash. The pools close at 730 pm also so that is a major hit that gives them the 2 stars. If the pools stayed open then I would say 4 stars.

My fiance and I were looking for a hotel near the Convention Center that we were going to. I was told to go to this one since it was the one that was close to it.  

About our stay: 

Although prices were cheap, ya know what they say... you get what you pay for. Honestly, I was expecting at least a coffee maker & a mini fridge inside the rooms. Some customers do take meds that require them to be stored in the fridge, not an ice bucket, an actual refrigerator or a mini fridge. Not my case but just thinking ahead, here... for other customers. Anyway, other than that, the rooms were not that bad. Beds were clean and everything was neat & organized. They replenished the towels..which is good. 

What I absolutely hated, though, was being woken up at 4am by either maintenance workers or housekeepers. They talk so loud that it woke both of us up, two nights in a row! 

Overall, it was an ok stay. One of the ladies at the front desk snapped at me on our first night, when we were in line to check in. Other than these minor things, it was ok. However I will not be staying at this particular hotel again.

I'm only giving it two stars due to the fact that I have so many childhood memories here...So when i decided to stay here again just to remember the good times...MAN WAS I A STUPID KID?! so nasty...do not eat at the buffet here! just go to mcdonalds!!

Why does everyone hate Circus Circus so much?  I think it's one of the greatest places in Vegas and here's why.

1.  It's great value.  It's one of the few places on the strip where you can get weekend rates of less than $100 a night.  Sure Wynn rooms are nicer, but are they really 4 times nicer? (at 4 times the price ).  Also when Echelon Place next door opens (if it ever opens), are you really going to pay top $$ to stay at the Mondrian and the Delano.  I'm just going to walk over from CC to check out the new hot place in town.    

2.  It's old school Vegas.  CC and Caesars were the first themed casinos in Vegas, both started by visionary Jay Sarno.  Caesars has been remodeled beyond recognition since its 1966 opening, only the original Palace casino remains.  CC, on the other hand, has retained the same low-roller circus theme which has been successful for over 40 years.  

3.  It's iconic.  No other Vegas casino has had the same pop culture exposure.  Please refer to "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas" (the book) or "Diamonds are Forever" (the movie).  Hey the place was good enough for Dr. Gonzo and James Bond. 

4.  It's surreal.  The circus is supposed to be seedy and dirty with lots of screaming kids running around, right?  A lot of people don't like all the unsupervised kids but I think they just contribute to the overall theme.  At the same time, their parents are gambling away their college educations.  That's kind of cool.

5.  The food is good.  Yeah, I know you're laughing but the steakhouse is considered one of the best (if not best value) places in town.

6.  It's fun.  I've seen a lot of posters here refer to CC as "ghetto".  I'm not sure if that's code for something but everyone playing at CC knows how to have a good time.  Case in point, I held the dice for over 30 minutes at the craps table at the Wynn.  People there were so stoic that I had to sarcastically ask if "anyone was having a good time".  All I got was blank stares.  The "homies" at CC, on the other hand, were hooting and hollering, trading good natured barbs with the dice crew over $5 bets.  It was a good time.

7.  You'll miss it when it's gone.  You know you will.  So go now.

So it was 480 for 3 people for two nights when i called I was so despret to get something that I got a room in this hotel. Im beyonddddd dissapointed rightnow for the fact it looks so old and like a motel inside things are not well kept for the price i payed. Ive honestly stayed in other hotels that offer well kept rooms and for a less price or the same. Im never coming here again.

Circus Circus is closer to three stars than it is to two, but I can't give it a full 3 because there were a few things that needed to be improved in my most humble opinion. First, the good. The room we stayed in was pretty and clean and didn't smell like smoke at all. We stayed in the Casino Tower on the 8th floor in a non-smoking room, and even though we were in a non-smoking section (we always stay in non-smoking no matter where we stay in Vegas) we were glad that it didn't smell like smoke like other places "Non-Smoking" towers.

Now the bad: 

Casino Main Entrance valet- there was like only two dudes. Took  about 15 minutes to get the car because these two poor guys were taking turns parking cars and bringing cars back. One or two more guys would go a long way. The entrance where the hotel registration was didn't have this problem.

Ice Machine- It wasn't hot this past weekend. Ice machine on my floor was out of ice TWICE. No ice coming out and the thing said "Making Ice". We had to go down a floor to get ice. Not cool.

The Room- Although the room was pretty, one major design flaw. The sink and mirror are on the INSIDE OF THE RESTROOM, NOT THE OUTSIDE, like other hotels, so if someone is dropping a deuce or taking a shower, you are assed out and have to wait to do things like paint your face, brush your teeth, shave or any other kinds of things you'd do while someone else is showering, which could be awkward if the person you are in the room with isn't your significant other. 

The Bed- It folded like a taco when I lied down in it which means it was worn, even though the white linen was nice and crisp and the duvet was neatly pressed and damn near new.

Overall, it wasn't a BAD experience, but it was not a GREAT experience. I'd probably give it at least one more shot.

I was worried after sifting through all the horrible reviews.  We ended up staying in the West Tower and had a fabulous time.  The rooms were clean and the beds were brand new.  We actually walked along the north perimeter of the property and saw staff unloading brand new Serta Pillowtop Mattresses.  There are no fridges or in room coffee.  We went to Walgreens and spent 30 bucks on a small coffee maker, foam cooler and 2 pounds of premium coffee.  SCORE!  

Spend an extra 10 bucks and upgrade your room to the West or Casino Tower.  We loved the West Tower because the elevator is super close to the downstairs valet exit providing easy access for GrubHUB pickups.  

We also went to The Steakhouse inside CC with three kids, ages : 6, 3 and 2...  BOMB.  Sure, there are better steak joints but holy wow the steaks were melt in your mouth amazing and the service was outta this world.  

Does this property compare to the Wynn?  NO.  Do you have kids and wanna go to Vegas?  Book it!  There is no better deal on the strip.  Did I mention we spent a whole day at the pool with chairside service at the splashpad with the kids?

What a joke. Book a room in the west tower and get here to find that they OVERBOOKED so they stick my ass in the manor lodge that is less expensive, without refunding the difference. I WAS a frequent guest at this hotel, staying here every couple of months but after this stunt, that will not be happening again. This is how you treat loyal guests? You just lost one.

Have you ever been catfished by a hotel? I was....Been a long time coming for this one....but the place is a dump!! It has a lot of amusement and excitement for the kids, but not a clean environment for anyone. Service at the front desk is unacceptable. Came here on a timeshare promotion so I expected to be impressed. This place made us itch once we made it to our room. Very outdated. We were told we were getting a discount for doing the tour and that our "suite" was in the new luxury tower....LIES LIES LIES ALL LIES. Filthy carpet...stains matched the curtains. Then there are the $200 holds on your card they require for incidentals....ridiculous! And resort fees of $24  plus per day ADDITIONAL....oh the fine print....lots of promotional prices for this place because it's located in the hood! Don't ruin your vacation staying here. And definitely don't bring your sweetheart here IF you ever expect to get some loving ever again.....this place could ruin your relationship. Although it made ours better, because we snuggled real close at night hoping no roaches would crawl on us.

The hotel room was dingy which made it appear dirty. I had no idea my room would NOT be in the actual hotel, but in their RV\/Hotel Manor which was about a good 4min walk. I was by myself, and female and every time I walked back to my room, I was being hit on and talked to by unsavory men. I did NOT feel safe in this hotel at all! This is definitely not an upscale hotel where you will find many classy people. The staff was also rude, and their buffet was akin to high school cafeteria food. They were an hr late opening up their Italian, and mexican lunch bar. They seemed to have no accountability. This hotel was very dark and outdated, I felt like I stepped into 1972 when I walked in. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again!!!!!!!

Stayed here over the past weekend to run the Las Vegas Rock n Roll Marathon.  Had a few problems with our room not getting cleaned but was very impressed with one of the front desk managers who helped us out.  His name is Anthony Zanini.  His assistance and accommodation made it to where we are willing to go back to stay there again.  Is it the Ritz?  Heck no, but the people who work there really made it a decent stay.  Also, rather than close the pools and jacuzzi due to the cold, the life guards weathered the cold in parkas so we could enjoy a relaxing soak after the run.

I wish i could rate this place with less than one star.  I just checked in today and already it is the most horrible stay in a hotel i have ever had and that is no joke.  Here's why:

1. Walking in, I didn't even know where to check in. Normally the desk is in front of you, but that was a ticket counter for something else. Turns out the checkin desk was to the left and there were no signs indicating this.
2. The line was so long I was standing there for literally 20 minutes just to get up to the counter.
3. The directions they gave me to my room were incorrect and I got so lost in this maze they call a hotel.
4. Once I finally got to my room 4747 in the sky tower... it was in total disarray. Lamps on the ground, used towels strewn about, no bedding on the mattresses but on the floor instead, leftover food on the desk, oh yeah... and cocaine and razor blades on the night stand. I even had to search the room for the phone which was under the bed and off the hook.
5. When I asked for a better room the lady practically scoffed at me and said there weren't any better rooms. I told her I had pictures of the room if she didn't believe me and she said "no need"... then miraculously a new room opened up.  Hmm.  Isn't that something?!  I should have called the police seriously.

Totally skeeved out by this place and will NEVER ever come here or recommend it to anyone!

Circus Circus Las Vegas boasts of being the most kid friendly hotel in Las Vegas. With its big top attitude and its indoor amusement park it very well may be. The beauty of this particular hotel doesn't lie so much in its size or even the circus like atmosphere. The charm lies in the fact that it was something new and relatively untried along the Vegas strip. Rather than build to suit the gamblers they were hoping to attract, this particular hotel was wise enough to offer something new and untried by appealing to families with children rather than solely to gamblers.

The gamble seems to be paying off in a city that is known for both its hits and its misses. Other hotels and casinos are also working to cultivate the family friendly image that Circus Circus has basically proven. Not only did this hotel build The Adventuredome Theme Park they also decided to make accommodations even more family friendly by accommodating RVs at the Circusland RV Park. This offers a great place for families to stay that might not otherwise grace the theme park, hotel, or the casino.

Don't forget that there is a casino involved and that is the primary purpose of this gigantic hotel, resort, and theme park. The casino makes the expense of building it all very much worthwhile and brings in big business of its own each and every day. In grand Vegas style there is also the requisite onsite shopping and of course full service of wedding options in addition to a wedding chapel and banquet facilities in which to hold the reception of your dreams. The shopping at Circus Circus offers everything from ultra exclusive boutique shops and salons to stores such as Under $10 and the trading Post, which offers fad jewelry and other kid friendly gifts.

This hotel has a somewhat unique concept that sets it apart from the many others along Vegas' strip. If you are traveling to Vegas with the family I very much recommend at least checking them out and comparing prices and packages with the other hotels and resorts in the area. Keep in mind that comps are like money in the bank particularly when they involve food or activities that you were planning to do even without the comps. So you may be able to negotiate a much better deal even if you're paying a couple more dollars a night by having free parking, complimentary meals, or tickets to events, shows, or attractions.

Now we're on to my favorite part of the discussion. Dining options. Circus Circus does not disappoint when it comes to offering variety to its guests. In addition to The Steakhouse, there is The Garden Grill, Mexitallia, Pink Pony, Circus Buffet, Pizzeria, Westside Deli, and Barista Caf. The food offerings accommodate varying budgets and familial needs by offering some kid friendly dining choices to visitors and guests as well. The good news however is that if these restaurants aren't appealing to you there is another hotel, casino, or restaurant next door that has different fare to offer.

If you are looking for a great place to stay in Las Vegas along with the family there are very few hotels that will offer the overall environment of fun and wonder that you will find at Circus Circus. In addition to the wonderful rooms, the great food, the casino, and The Adventuredome Theme Park you will find that the shows here are as kid friendly and entertaining for the entire family as the atmosphere in general. This is a great vacation destination anywhere. Considering the fact that it is in Las Vegas and it is very nearly the perfect vacation retreat for those with children.

For the prices we paid to stay here two nights, (over $200 total) I expected a nice room with a fair view. When I ordered the tower king rooms, I did NOT expect to only be on the fifth floor and only get to see the very top of the below building. Nor did I expect them to place us in an area undergoing construction! We should have at least gotten a discount for putting up with that!

Plus, when we checked in, there was a HUGE line that took forever to get through. 

Our room amenities were limited to a very small bottle of lotion, a miniscule amount of shampoo+conditioner in one, and one lego-sized cube of soap. The alarm on the clock didn't work, and there were chips of paint missing all over the toilet seat. Plus, the bath drain would get clogged and fill up during a shower. 

The hotel itself had tons of entertainment opportunities, such as the adventuredome, casino, arcade, carnival-area, and pool. 
But the staff in the carnival area were rude, and one even told us we weren't allowed to sit in the lounge chairs. Like, wtf?!? Then what are the effing chairs for?!?
Furthermore, the pool is only open from 9 AM to 5 PM, so you can't use the hot tub at night. We were tempted to sneak into another hotel's pool area because we missed the cutoff - but we didn't.
Also, you have to pay for internet here, which is the pits. I can deal with 2 or even 5 dollars a day, but it's $11-something here! That's ridiculous! I brought my laptop, but we didn't end up using it at all because of that insane price.

The hotel will advertise that it's on a prime part of the strip, but actually it's on the very South edge. Non-in-shape people, like myself, will probably have to pay for other modes of transportation to get to the REAL prime points farther down the strip.

On the good side, our bathroom was pretty large, and the hair dryer actually worked. 
Also, the buffet here is rockin', in my opinion. And I love love love the crazy decorations and lights surrounding the outside.
There's also a free, but very minimal, circus show that starts at 11 AM everyday. However, from what I could tell, it was only a few acrobat routines and that was it.
On the morning we checked out, there was this really funny clown paid to pretend to be really sleepy in the lobby. I posted a couple pictures - I thought that was a riot. Definitely a great comedic addition.

Anyway, I could have paid a quarter of the price at that gross Travel Suites neighboring Circus Circus, and not have gotten even half the hassles we had to deal with here. I also heard Luxor had been doing a $70 dollars a night deal, which I should have gone for considering they're so much more elegant of a hotel.

Well, I lived and learned. Circus Circus is not worth it. Though I know it could have been a lot worse.

I did not stay at this hotel while I was in Vegas and so my comments are only related to the casino it's self.
So, we enter the casino, as while in Vegas, once thing you do is check out all the other casino's and this was the only reason we visited this casino. 
First thing I notice was the over powering stench of cigarette's. If I wanted that much nicotine in my system, I would have brought my own cigarettes but not being a smoker I settled for the free nicotine in the air. The cigarette smoke hung around like smog on a bad summer afternoon in anyone one of a number major cites that I could name.
The carpeting was about as worn as mine at home but I suspect that Circus Circus budget is a lot more than mine and they can well afford to replace that aging carpet that was full of suspicious stains that I decided I would be better of not knowing their source.
This casino is marketed towards those on a tighter budget and it shows, with the bulk of their slot machines catering toward the nickle and dime crowd.
I am not a tall person by any stretch of the imagination but the low ceiling gave me the impression I was a giant and a little claustrophobia.
The whole casino seems like it is stuck in another time period and does not look like it has moved on from the 60's, which would make more sense, if this was their intention but I doubt it.
We did not stay long, as none of us wished to contract lung cancer from the ever present nicotine that was taking residence inside of us!

Sigh...  Where to begin why did I go with cheap hotel.  Extremely disappointed this place is trash I've had better stay at the motel 6. From the horrible location to shitty service . Everything is old and trash looking . Complete filth of a place
Thought I was going to have a wonderful room. I walk into my room and my room is filthy. It looks like no one has swept. Vacuumed the room or washed the bathroom. Not my favorite choice

I have never stayed at this hotel but know people that have. However, I have ate and gamble at this casino. The overall place smells horrible. The best way to explain it is that it feels like people have been throwing up on the carpet and the hotel has done nothing to clean it. I also tried charging my plugin hybrid there and it was a waste of time. The first time I tried charging it, the station wasn't even set up. I told the people at the information desk. I came back two days later and it was set up but doesn't work. The connectors won't come off even though my card was authorized.

We had an excellent stay at the Circus Circus. Our room was clean, we were given fresh towels daily, and had a lot of fun playing $5 blackjack at the table and $1 blackjack at the nearby Slots-o-Fun. Food at the Westside Deli was also tasty and affordable. I would highly recommend staying here!

Warning- Long but honest review for my family's recent stay at Circus Circus Las Vegas. My husband, 2 year old son, and I booked a West Tower room for 4 nights (July 14-18). We were visiting family and our son was with us, we thought the family friendly Circus Circus would be perfect, but we ended up leaving early after a serious incident. 

Check in: Arrived at 3PM, to find a huge line that looked like it would take hours; no surprise considering the time. Kudos to the front desk staff for their quick service - only took 35 minutes.

Room:  Although our room was updated it was already showing a lot of wear and tear. The furniture had stains and many scratches. TV was crooked. Leaky tub faucet and the light in the bathroom was out. Left a lot to be desired, but considering it is a budget resort, we weren't expecting much. Had clean beds, no complaints. Bell desk was quick getting our bags up to the room, but wasn't very friendly and did not help bring them in. 

Grounds: The resort is a zoo with a constant flowing sea of children. Not an issue for us, but could be a major con others. Grounds are reasonably maintained, if a little dated. There is an issue with casino and Midway location. Children are to stay out of the gaming area, but the location of the Midway is above the casino and the only access is in the middle of the gaming floor. Not only is this inconsiderate to players, it is confusing to kids. That aside, the circus acts were amusing, games were reasonably priced ($1 or so), and the operators were fun. Location not an issue with the Adventuredome as it is located at the back of the property. Lots of rides for a reasonable price if you buy a day pass. Perfect for those with kids. 

Casino: Visited when Grandma asked to babysit our son... We always enjoy the casino at here. The dealers are super friendly and they have $5 blackjack. Slots seem pretty loose. Cocktail waitresses are outgoing and fast. It should be noted that they don't use brand liquors, but drinks are still free to players. You can usually get your standard beer selection. 

Food: Restaurant variety that is able to accommodate most tastes. The buffet was your standard buffet at a decent price, but pretty limited for those diners with dietary restrictions (I'm gluten free). However, they did whip up some custom dishes for me and made sure to take special care. Our bus person was also very helpful and attentive. Despite the mediocre selection, our buffet experience was quite exceptional due to the hard working staff. 

We were having a pretty great time at Circus Circus. However, on the 3rd day of our stay that all changed...

On Wednesday, July 16th, we decided to spend the day on the Strip. Before we left, we neatened up the room, made sure our bags were closed and out of the way, all to make it easier for the housekeeper. When we got back, our room had been cleaned and seemed in order. That is, until my husband opened his bag. He had a money clip in the bottom of his bag with $600 exact. We use this as our gambling money and only remove cash in $100 increments (we're VERY meticulous). While out he realized he forgot to lock it in the safe after the previous night, but didn't think it would be an issue since it was in the very bottom of his closed, packed bag. When he checked after we got back, his money clip now only had $440 and his clothes looked as they had been moved. Nothing else in the room was disturbed. If someone broke into our room, other things would have been gone. Someone was trying to hide it as it appeared they attempted to put everything back in place. In our minds, the only person who could have done this is the housekeeper.

We immediately called security. They said someone would be right up (took 45 minutes). The security woman apologized for the delay but was very thorough and attentive. She explained the investigation process and told us to contact risk management in the morning. We contacted them the next morning and were told there was "nothing we can do" and "this is why we provide a safe". We know we should have used the safe (honest mistake), but we should be able to trust the staff not the go through our bags and steal from us. They told us the investigation would take a minimum 10 days. We understand the process takes time but we asked if they'd do anything to help in the mean time. We still had 1 night left and this really soured our trip. No offer to make it right, no refunds, not even a real apology (just "sorry, you should have used the safe"). Victim blaming is not an apology!

We went to the front desk to see if they would be willing to do anything. The manager there too said there was nothing they "could" do and offered the same "apology". 

We immediately checked out, went to Harrah's, and were very happy. It's a shame we couldn't even get a real apology from Circus Circus. Their loss. We go to Vegas at least twice year and have a growing family, their key demographic. Obviously, we won't be back.

i loved here the only bad thing was the weekend i was there  it was not a  lot of people in the place. time 11pm-3am!! the pictures below are not up to date.  i love the tables but i know this is "circus circus" is for kids but hell i left mine at home for a reason. but, i guess that is what i get for going to a kids place. not their fault. The room is wonderful for the price to stay at  this place

Bathroom locks don't work. I walked in on a friend while she was on the toilet. Not a pleasant feeling knowing the bathroom locks don't work. Asked for a change of room or reimbursement and was denied. Never staying here again!!!

I've stayed at expensive hotels and cheap hotels in Vegas, for as many hotels as Vegas has you would think they would try to be as competitive as possible with their customer service (in my experience most aren't). 
It was inexpensive to stay here, I'll give them that. But the room was awful. The toilet paper on the roll was wet. There weren't enough pillows or towels for three ppl in Casino Tower 2 Queen room. The hair dryer was broken. The TV was broken, when we called to have it fixed we had to call two times and wait over an hour only to be told we would need to wait for an engineer to look at it... we just gave up. Our neighbors had a bunch of kids screaming from 6am-11pm and seemed to be sauting food in their room. We were temporarily trapped in an elevator that wouldn't open on the first floor and instead took us on a tour of other floors.
I have ALWAYS avoided Circus Circus, I'm reminded of why.

Creepiest, yuckiest and trippiest (and not in a good way) place i have ever been to.  Note to self: If I ever decide to do any hallucinogens in Vegas, I will not step foot into this bad acid-trip nightmare.  

The whole hotel is dated; including the rooms, casino, adventure dome and dining options.  The dining options were convenient but not appetizing or appealing in anyway.  The only reason I ate in two of their dining options was because it was there and I was ravenous hungry.  

If ever given the choice, I will probably never stay here ever again.  So why did I stay here?  Dirt cheap prices if you are booking a room last minute....which I needed when I booked my Vegas trip within 2 weeks on a budget.  Next time, I'll plan ahead and save a few pennies to avoid this creepy circus.

Circus Circus is my favorite Casino in Las Vegas. I love the family friendly atmosphere with the midway & carnival games, circus acts, & Adventure Dome. The lunch buffet is good but the dinner buffet is not the best. You're better off eating in one of the restaurants upstairs near the Adventure Dome. The drinks are great. You can purchase novelty glasses for the most reasonable prices in Vegas that offer very inexpensive refills. I highly recommend getting the giant margarita glass full of frozen margarita.

Amazing place for kids and adults!
room service is AMAZING
love to go to the adventure dome and eat in mcdonalds and play the games.
its right next to ross, sometimes i like going shopping.
overall its an amazing place good for kids and adults.
LOVE IT!

Hands down THE NASTIEST, DIRTIEST, MOST FOUL place I have EVER stayed!!! I was lured in by the seemingly cheap prices online, only to find that hey rip you off at check on and charge you an extra $17.50 per day in "resort fees." For what resort??? The entire interior of the casino smells like rotting food and urine, the food served in their restaurants can't even be described as "slop" (that would be giving it too much credit, and the rooms are filthy. One night while I was there I had to listen to some sort of crazy orgie going on in the room next to me. On another night I'm fairly certain someone was trying to break into my room. Do yourself a favor and go ANYWHERE else in Vegas.

I needed a place to stay for one night at the last minute and Circus Circus had a great price! Checking in was great....I was upgraded to a room inside of the casino instead of half a block down the street. As I'm walking towards the elevator to my room I notice a weird smell. I get to my room and it was dark and looked like a motel....& to make things worse I saw a roach beside the television....GROSS! I did not want any of my belongings on the floor and I slept with a lamp on! It's a fun place to hang out and play games with your children but I would not spend the night. When it comes time to check out, I tell the lady at the check-in counter about my stay and all she had to say was...."oh no, that's too bad....you are really pretty" LOL I will not be staying here again.

I love the buffet here, the cook who makes the omelets and pasta is amazing, love the fried shrimp, corn, mashed potatoes
I go there once every two months or so
I don't know what people are expecting but the buffet is perfectly good and not expensive, beats eating in.  Makes a perfectly great meal

We are currently in our room. It is ridiculously hot because the AC isn't working. The toilet won't stop running. We spent 2 hours on the casino floor and didn't get offered a drink once by a waitress, not even water. The service has been horrible and rude. If I could give negative stars I would. Will not be back here ever.

They also don't give free play, not even $5. I lived in Reno for five years and even the Circus Circus there gave you $5 in free play your first time there.

We stayed at Circus Circus on a Friday night. We got a room for about $80 including the $20 resort fee. We stayed in the "manor" section which is not attached to the actual Hotel and Casino. It's an old outdated three-story building with hotel\/motel like rooms. They did move us to the second floor upon request. I did not want to be on the first floor. 
 
We would've liked an extra towel or two -- they only gave us two bath towels total. We could hear folks in the hallway and in adjoining rooms on and off throughout the night. But then again this is Vegas so that's to be expected. 

There were no privacy drapes only room darkening drapes which made for either a really dark room or a bright room with no privacy. 

There is plenty of parking right near the building so no need to use the valet or self park. 

The bathrooms are small and outdated. There is plenty of hot water though and decent water pressure.

There are a lot of haters hating on this hotel, probably for good reason, but I am rating the arcade portion, because inside I am a child. 

It's dirty and a money hole, but I always have a good time there. 

The best game in the arcade was Deal or No Deal. I had the most frickin fun playing that game. I'm also a fan of the quarter pushing games, namely the Pharaoh one, but I'm probably the only fan of quarter games ever. 

Prizes are god-awful. I got a pretty decent bear and headphones.

Wow, this hotel was just amazingly low quality considering the price we paid for a room.  The floors were stained and the water from the shower stayed hot for approximately 5 minutes before it became almost completely freezing.  The shower head was clogged, too.  I had to rush through showers.

It's no surprise that the rooms are tucked away from the casino itself.  Perhaps the whole place good use a good, deep carpet cleaning.

The most redeeming feature of this hotel was the parking lot, which had plenty of spaces.

I wish I could give this two and a half stars...because....well....  it's just below A-OK....

I've stayed at the circus circus before and it is definitely not my first pick for a vegas hotel but it was the most reasonably priced option for a holiday weekend (St. Patty's day). Plus it had been long enough since my last visit to forget the bad and remember the good. The bad stuff first. Check-in, check-in is mayhem...total mayhem...., plus you get to hang with every drunk partier who can't afford anything other than the motor lodge super saver rate-just think bad frat party. It took about half an hour+ to get through the village of the damned check in line. It's here we should fast forward to the OTHER bad thing about Circus Circus....Check OUT....which is impossible. I mean....getting out of the building is impossible. On Sunday-you should get up regardless of your hangover and try to leave as early as possible. The elevators can not handle the volume of guests that the hotel books, after waiting nearly 45 minutes for a downward elevator with enough room we decided to walk down....yeah...on the stairs... from the 32nd floor. It was grueling-but not so much as having to ascend five flights after finding out that the exit stairs kinda go to nowhere-so up to the fifth or sixth floor to try to catch another elevator-but that took another 20 minutes so we ferreted out the other staircase which took us down to the third floor where we could then find an empty single hidden elevator to the lobby. The parking garage was equally hellish. 

So the good....the West tower rooms are kinda ok, during the week when they're dirt cheap I'd say they're stellar, on the weekend the rooms soar up to the $100 a night mark, it's supply and demand but honestly-vegas is rad any day of the week, maybe even moreso when there's fewer tourists so the review should be taken with that grain of salt....if the tower room I had was $40 or $50 like it is during the week-I'd be way more stoked.... . 

The bed was comfy and although they already show their age after the recent renovation... the rooms were pretty nice. I do have to say it was super awesome that the concierge upgraded us to a jacuzzi room on check in-that was amazing. It is on the strip (more or less) so that was convenient, and I did win enough at the casino on their super loose slots that the room ended up being reasonable on price. Weird crowd though-lots of unusual characters-kinda what you'd expect to find at the cheapest rooms during a busy weekend in vegas. There were a lot of kids milling about-I noticed this in other's reviews and it's true. 

Would I stay here again...maybe...but only on another weekend where I couldn't get one of my standby hotels like The Cabanas at El Cortez, or The Artisan.... if you want the total tourist experience then yeah-this is a good choice... 

Oh and yes....the Motor Lodge annex is really a no-go zone....

This place is TERRIBLE. We waited 45 minutes to be checked in. After checking in we had two beds we asked for a king. We also had to wait about 10 min before a valet guy could get our keys. I don't recommend this place to anyone. I was there Feb 12-13

My friend and I arrived Saturday  (November 5th) and stayed until the 8th. This is not our first stay with the hotel, we usually like this hotel because of the cost is within our budgets. We haven't had any issues in the past with the rooms. However,  this time around were placed in room 1117. Within 30 minutes of getting settled in, there was a large amount of noise, we initially thought it could of been the elevators since we were around the corner, but after a while of listening the noise was coming from right above us. My friend called down to front desk (about 8:30p or 9p) to request a room change due to the noise. The lady said they were booked for the night and to call back around 10am the next day (Sunday). My friend called the next day and whomever she talked to said they will send a email out to the manager and will receive a call to our room. We got the call, and were informed that around 1p there should a room available.  We waited, we never received a call. And the later we wait, that time we are losing on our mini vacay. At this point the the hotel dropped the ball. I have to say this was the worst stay
EVER. Being woken up at 5 or 6am to banging and rolling carts, and the sounds of machines above us is ridiculous. I gave 1 star because I give that one to the housekeeper who I met at the door and I requested lots of coffee and she was very kind and did just that. Otherwise,  this hotel would get nothing. Whatever you do don't stay in room 1117.

The hotel is great for $24 a night specials and have kids. The Buffet is a total different story. If you do eat at the buffet......... I hope your room is stocked up on a year supply of toilet paper.  Hopefully now the the Circus Circus front desk has complimentary hemorrhoid cream for their guests. Heck they should  have  the hemorrhoid cream in a basket  at the exit of the buffet! Trust me....I kid you not!!!!!! That buffet  caused me serious issues with my digestion and I suffered hemorrhoids from it!

This same goes for the Circus Circus in Reno.....Their food  is either just bad or they use laxatives as a ingredient! 

I wish I learned my lesson when I was at Circus Circus in Reno years ago! Their buffet painfully Rotor Rooter'ed my insides!

I initially booked my room through AAA travel. After reading reviews on Yelp about circus circus I noticed how horrible everyone described the Manor. I made sure when I booked to not click on the Manor room and booked a king size bed. Once I checked in on Friday I was told of my balance on my room and how to get to my room. I noticed that our room was not in the intial hotel but across the street near the pool and water slides. At first glance it looked like a rundown motel but it was associated with circus circus. The decor was outdated and smelled of smoke and alcohol. Once we got to the third floor I saw that our room was near the elevator. I thought it wouldn't be so bad but boy was I wrong. At first glance the room seemed okay. Yes it remind me of a motel 6 or a travel Lodge and not the resort I remember as a kid. There were water stains on the ceiling, stains on the bed,floor and dresser. TV was old and didn't have a clear picture. Missing artwork on the walls and a heater\/ac that barely kept the room warm. I will never stay at circus circus again. Especially for what I paid for that room I feel I was robbed. I would have gotten the same experience staying at a motel 6 but I would've saved a lot more money.

I've come to Vegas a lot in the past when single and down to do anything if it consisted with drinking, partying, and of course, gambling; but since having my son, this was the first visit to Vegas and the first reason I should set foot in Circus Circus (1.14.15).

I had a completely different idea about what Circus Circus would be like and thought that my 19 month old son would have time of this life here.  I YELP everything prior to visiting an establishment and I didn't once thing to check the reviews on this place, which I total regret. 

Here is a short rendition of what I imagined: entering and being greeted by carnival characters  (i.e. A guy on stilts, a happy clown, or a juggling guy on a unicycle); carnival music, non smoking? (Okay I must have been dreaming), just all around fun, clean, and inviting.

Here's what I observed: a dirty casino with the top floor being reserved for boardwalk games tempting kids with their cheap stuffed animals. The place was smokey (more second had smoke for my little son) and so filthy! If you think Vegas is all about money and about attracting the customer beautiful decor, high-end gifts, and clean floors, not Circus Circus.

The only decent thing there was possibly the little flying trapeze act.

This is where kids' carnival dreams go to die!!

I think I've seen the last of Circus Circus unless it has a serious makeover; More kid-centered: better games, prizes, non-smoking, happy faces, CLEAN.

My girlfriend and I booked this hotel a month before we came to celebrate my birthday (Jan. 31st) stayed here for 5 days. First we got here a little before our schedule time to check in which was 3:00 so we went to go check in at 2:00. We checked in got our room and keys walked up to the room and the room was dirty, bottles everywhere but housekeeping wasn't finished cleaning rooms on the floor. We booked a room with two beds in the skyrise tower by the way so we went back to check in to tell them that our room wasn't cleaned and some nice lady gave us an upgraded mini suite in the casino tower so we gladly took it. The mini suite was great roomy, clean, bed was comfortable, nice view on quiet floor and service was great to us. We loved our stay here and to get a mini suite as an free upgrade for their mistake was great for us so we couldn't complain. The casino is like every other casino in Vegas.

Circus Circus what a disappointment went to it 20 years ago it was fun now it's just an old dirty dingy antique that needs to be imploded before the Riviera. Make reservations six weeks before we arrived in Vegas for the RV lot. What a disappointment nothing but a big windy dirty dusty parking lot. Small problem when we arrive to could not find our reservations shame on me we came a day early. First night we tried the buffet what a joke I've had better food at the school cafeteria bland no flavor waste of money 36 bucks. Every morning we were awakened by the lovely sounds of all let's build some crap right next door with beat beep beep beep backing up equipment ten o'clock Wednesday morning water for the whole RV park shut off without notice. Called RV front desk no help called hotel front desk put on hold and transferred four different times.. 27 minutes later I walked over to front desk to find the manager still on hold. Went to VIP desk and ask for a manager was told sorry we did not know about the water shut off oh let me buy you a pizza package deal. told manager way past pissed off for just a pizza. Manager manage to comp 1 day .next day notes on doors about water shut off. Right hand does not know what left hand is doing. Price per night during the week was $48 way too expensive. Weekend rates you'll love this $76.00 dollars a night for a freaking parking lot. I've had better luck staying at a Walmart. You can bet your sweet ass I will never spend money there again. One of the best things about the whole deal was getting to walk past the garbage and recycling Center for the hotel to get to the main strip. Just love that smell

Booking a room at Circus Circus was completely nerve wrecking; I knew what I was getting into, but still took the risk for the sake of cost. Following the advice of fellow yelpers, and expedia-ers, I avoided booking at The Manor room, and spent a little more (not that much more) on the West Tower King. 

I forgot to pack my CSI Spy-Kids Kit, but I was still able to conduct an in-depth inspection of my room. Room was clean, there were no signs of bed bugs, or human remains and the linens appeared fresh. It was safe to say, I was rest assured. 

People have claimed that the linens here are not routinely washed after use. If you happen to get a room, and the blankets smell like bananas..... then yes, the sheets have not been washed, and my bag smashed a bunch of bananas onto the blankets. Sorry. I came here just to run the Rock n Roll Half Marathon, and half marathons makes me eat a lot of bananas. lol.

Some side notes:
- Check-in was a long and tortuous wait. 
- Finding my room was a joke. For some reason, the numbering was off and I was completely lost. I wish the check-in people informed me of this prior.
- No fridge, but Keurig... in the bathroom.
- Walk, walk, walk, walk, walk.
- You are at the dead-end of The Strip.
- Use the monorail to go to hotspots of The Strip. However, getting to the monorail requires more walking. Closest one from the hotel was a street down at The Westgate Hotel.
- If you purchase monorail tickets online, there was a discount for Rock n Roll marathon runners. The ticket booths will charge you full price if purchased in person.
- I hardly stayed in my hotel, so I cannot really comment on it's amenities like the Adventuredome, circus acts or restaurants. Sorry, I have better places to see.... like The M&M Store. Lol.

OK. If you have kids this is a great place for them to run around and have a good "kid" time. It's such a throw back to a time when people took their kids to Vegas and didn't map out an entire day of activity for them. Not exactly a soccer mom's dream environment for children but what the heck. If your a fan of "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas" you can see the revolving bar that his attorney had so much trouble stepping off of. Also, there is this great craps table that is just below where they stage the Circus show. It gives you this 180 degree sightline of the "midway" so you can throw some dice, have a drink and keep your eyes on the kids all at the same time. See, you still might win that Parent of the Year award.

The only reason this place gets 2 stars is because one should really know better than to book a hotel room for like 17 bucks and expect anything other than a dump.

I arrived here after a long day of work, and waited in line for 45 minutes to check in.  I was relieved until I realized I had to walk like half a mile through souvenir shops, closed restaurants, and casinos before I got to my room.

The room itself was also pretty bad.  I don't expect much from hotels, but two limp pillows and a mattress that felt like a crappy cot didn't make for a restful evening.  I think I would've felt better sleeping on the floor - like, if you aren't even going to try to give me a mattress that makes my back say "hey, this is ok," then don't even bother.  

Maybe there's an appeal if you have kids?  But if you have kids, what are you doing taking them to the strip?  Why not just take them to a real amusement park and not a playground for adults?  Quit being cheap and selfish.  Go to Disneyland or something.

On 1Aug16 around 2150hrs, I got my pocket picked at Circus Circus in the Casino area. I had $100 in my pocket in 20s and they managed to take $80. $100 fom a winning I just cashed. I called the security and explained the situation. He started acusing me of lying. I told him to look it up on their Camera which was right above where I played and he said he had no access to it. So who does, and who has access. Poor freaken excuse. Hell even my Privates in the Army could've done a better job. My stay that night was ruined and was ready to check out. Been in Vegas since 97 and this is the first time ever...So So SAD..
Master Sergeant (Retired)..

Please don't stay at this Casino. This place smell so bad you won't able to stand it.
I don't care if the room is free it's still not worth it. The people that go there also smell just like that casino. Do yourself a favor and don't go there. The only things that is good about this place is the Valet parking I  would give them 5 stars for that.

I'm giving 5 for customer service... at the Buffet Maria was so sweet and her staff wishing me happy 50th birthday. The entire restaurant sang to me ... the cashier was also very sweet and helpful. The staff in the entire hotel was very nice. We aren't staying there we're just visiting to eat and the have fun at the Adventure Dome. Thank you very much
I loved the adventure dome :) I took my whole family there I am a local but if you have kids this is definitely the place to go!!

Ok, maybe I was a little uninformed, but I was disappointed from the moment I arrived. Checkin was a mess, getting to the room was a mess, parking was terrible, room is well tired. Restaurant was ok I guess, but that's all I can say.

HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! 

First off if you're going to a convention they will tell you one price over the phone then charge you a HIGHER price when you arrive. Second if you are trying to use a corporate credit card account, etc. forget it: you can reserve the room using anyones credit card and they will gladly take your first nights fee at that time but if you don't have that card when you show up they will not allow you to check in. Best part: The first night is non-refundable! The staff was very rude and the manager was hostile, almost threatening. He told a person in my group, getting right in his face,  "If you don't like it here, leave" 

Gaudy, tacky interior, dirty rooms, windows so covered in grime they look blurry when you try to see out of them and yes, it's very noisy all night long. Ridiculous hotel.

Let me start with this:  I am NOT high maintenance.  I have stayed at Motel 6's on road trips and was totally okay with it.  But in Vegas, I expect a little bit better.  Circus Circus was a BIG mistake, absolutely disgusting.   We got stuck in a room a block away from the hotel\/casino itself, next to an RV Park, where we had to carry\/drag our luggage after a long day of flying\/travelling.  It was so old and ghetto and seedy that I immediately felt concern for our safety, then sure enough two beefy security guards come storming down the hallway and bang on a room a few doors down from us and yell "Security!"  Yikes.  I was pretty mad at my husband then for booking this place.   I was afraid to take my shoes off inside the room but I guess it was clean enough.  The only highlight was the Keurig machine I saw in the bathroom but after the first day, I didn't get anymore coffee and had to wait over an hour after calling room service for more.  The view from my window?  The ass end of a car in the parking lot.   I felt like I was at a crappy motel.  Oops I forgot to mention the roller coaster El Loco in the kids section.  Awesome but lasts only a second.  And Vince Neil's Tapuado has a kick ass shrimp taco that's to die for.  But don't stay the night here.  That's a big fat NOOOOOO.

Check in was great....and then...
The Manor is a set of motel 6 like buildings next to the casino, across the street.  This is not circus circus.  
The rooms were nice once you get inside except for the tv that is from 1985.
When they cleaned the room they left my door unlocked. Thanks. I'm glad all my stuff was still there. 
The casino itself is small with only a few tables. 
I couldn't sleep all night because of the dog barking in the room next door. You heard that right. The walls are thin..and who let them have a dog in the room?

I initially started out with 2 stars until I called the front desk and was greeted with an attitude by Patty. 

We rented two rooms for one night. One room had a broken bathtub faucet which leaked all night and a broken tv that requires you to switch channels quickly when you turn it on otherwise it would turn off. The other room had rusted towels smh. The toilets flush like airplane toilets (beware of the recoil). Mind you I paid $55 a night for each room but when you include their resort fee it came out to almost $200!!! I could've stood in the Marriott an extra night for the same price. 

Rooms look outdated. You truly feel like you're slumming it. I've stayed in the Excalibur for a lower nightly rate before and their rooms are waaaay better (so are their amenities). Save yourself the money and go to Excalibur instead.

We only came here because of the girls....I mean they needed to blow off some steam so we let them run wild to play games, ride roller coasters, and other rides. I would not stay here at this hotel for a night, but that was never our intention anyways!

Circus Circus was the first place I ever stayed in Vegas.  It's changed somewhat since then, but it's a lot of the same.  There are always a lot of kids around, but what we love about Circus is that it's one of the older places, old school Vegas, and we like that.  A dying breed.  Even though we don't have kids, we still love to visit the Midway, and see the musicians who play for the free circus acts - they are all very good.  I always win a prize too!  A stuff animal!  We've visited the Adventure Dome but it's really loud and cramped....and I don't think I'd go on any of the rides.  In the main casino area, they also do have a Krispy Kreme which is good, we usually stop there.  This is one of the few casinos we still visit on the strip.  The others seem too touristy.

With all the Arcades and rides inside Circus Circus it definitely stands out a little bit and brings in a little diversion to the Strip.

I'm sure the Hotel itself is not the best, but the more fun you will have here, not only for gamble but for games, Arcades and for many kids.

We won a lot of stuffed animals and it was fun.

Circus circus is kids friendly. 

Arcade, prizes, food, entertainment. Both parent and kids love it. 


Pros: 
1. Entertainment for kids 
2. Roller coaster rides 
3. Show time (they have different performance every 30 mins 
4. McDonald 


Cons: 
1. Super crowded 
2. Parking lot looks nasty 
3. Hotel pretty old looking 
4. Line for prize are always long


Overall, I spend way toooo much.

I will say we came here because it was cheaper.  They sucked. Their bedding had stains,  there was rust in the bathrooms,  it was a maze to get out of there,  tv are old style.  There is more that i can say but i will not.  I will not be coming back any time soon.

Stay here if you plan on losing alot of money and having a cheap hotel will help...this is a horrible hotel!! when I went to the "adventure dome"...most of the rides were closed...people inside the hotel keeps asking you to buy things or join things every time I walk near the lobby...its crazy..the rooms aren't that bad but they won't change ur sheets unless you put a sign there...oh n this hotel is far from the strip..do not try to walk..take the DEUCE or drive. One of the worst hotels on the strip!

Let me just start off by saying that I'm really not one to complain. I can tolerate a shitty hotel from time to time and just live on the strip for the vacation. With that said, run away from circus circus. I grew up in the ghetto so I can say this. This casino is straight hood. It's like the bad, east side motel casino of the strip. I booked through hotels.com and decided I'd treat us to a nice place and assumed that fir $250 one night, we'd be setup nice. Nope! We were told that our room was off site from the manor and that we had to walk about 1\/4 mile to the run down parking lot where our hotel was. As soon as the door popped open to our room I could smell that this was a bad room. Wallpaper was peaking off the walls, large amounts of brown blobby glue running down the walls, horrible quality mattresses, and stains all over the carpet. I honestly would expect to pay $35 per night to be in there. We were upgrade to "the best room they had" for free and had to deal with changing it which took an hour and a half. Burned up a good chunk of my time at vegas dealing with it. The "best room" upgrade was a little better but still most definitely nowhere close to $250 per night. Stay away!!

Within the first 5 hours of going through the casino and pool, a 10 year old asked me for money, and an 80 year old made a racist comment about my 2 year old child. I know this isn't exactly the hotels fault, but this is what to expect when your paying minimal rates to stay in Vegas I guess. Everything else was just ok. Really, it's just a place to lay your head to sleep. In and out is your best bet. 

My wife and kids left after our initial 2 day stay and went to Luxor....head and shoulders above Circus Circus, at just a little bit higher price.

Just left yesterday and joined Yelp to warn others. The room was not updated recently as they claim, still had old box tv and 2 double beds NOT queen like it says. They claim they have k cup coffee, another lie. The phone didn't work due to exposed wires, the sheets were clean but had stains, had to use cell to request the roon to be cleaned since we returned at 5pm and it still wasn't done. The pool had insufficient life jacket for kids and there buffet charges full price for kids to eat. I wouldn't return if the room was free! I'm supposed to get an email survey since the person I spoke to didn't seem to care about my complaints.

There's a reason this hotel is super cheap! We stayed for 3 nights on level 12 in the casino tower July 5-8. First off, the middle elevator was not working correctly. It would keep opening and closing its doors when going in before taking you to the floor selected. And on our last night there the 12th floor button was not working! The vending machine on our floor was sold out the entire visit. There was mold in our shower and, of course, it's pretty far from everything. We went with children for the rides and midway, I suggest getting a different hotel and ONLY visiting for the adventuredome if you have kids since they offer free parking anyways. Their pool is also on the small side compared to other hotels in Las Vegas. Fun to visit with children but I highly recommend staying elsewhere!

The rooms were very dusty. The blankets were dust covered and we had to remove them only to find that the head boards were even more dusty!! We complained to the maintenance team that the room needed to be cleaned which they said they did, but however every day morning I woke up sneezing. We had asked for a single bed, but we were given only 2 separate beds. The walls of this hotel are so thin that you can hear every little word spoken in the next room. Only the sound of the AC drowned out their voices whenever the AC did not automatically turn itself off. Being Vegas, most people turned in only by 2 - 3 in the morning and that kept us awake at nights. The AC too was not very efficient since at times during the night the room got too hot and at times we were shivering coz of the cold.

Not worth it unless you have children or are coming on a family vacation . You need to LOVE to be around children for this to be a tolerable place. There's children everywhere , for me it's not at all pleasant. Regardless , the rooms are not that great , super old fashioned and not comfortable

It is very cheap to stay here, especially during the week! The room prices can double\/triple for the weekend. I didn't know what to expect paying $40 a night...

I first have to say the customer service was great & if you are coming to Vegas with kids, this is the place! The gal who checked us in took her time & gave us a a good room on the 17th floor in the Skyrise Tower, quiet hallway.   The room was ok, just a standard hotel room. Our bathtub & sink clogged everyday, so I finally went to the front desk on our last day & talked to a manager, Mary Grace. She was so friendly & switched us to a room on the 19th floor in the West Tower. The rooms were more modern\/updated & in my opinion, nicer & a bit bigger. She also gave us a pass to the buffet for our family. 

Ok so strictly reviewing the hotel, the physical building: it is old, kind of dirty & needs a better ventilation system. I could definitely tell the difference in ventilation when we went in other hotels along the strip. Circus Circus has a strong smoke odor, especially by the casino area. Overall, it is kind of dingy & dirty. The building needs a complete overhaul.

The rooms: we started out in a deluxe two bed room in the Skyrise Tower. The room was somewhat clean (there were pieces of old candy between nightstand & bed) & the bathroom was a good size. The beds were comfortable. These rooms have been updated at some point as the carpet & furnishings seemed to be newer. When we moved to the West Tower the room was a bit bigger, the carpet was stained & air conditioner was not as cold. This room seemed to be newly updated, except the bathroom. 

Adventuredome: Two of my kids got wristbands for all day & my 12 year old was really excited to do laser tag. He went in a few times & said it was just a big open room with a few spots to hide...boring. I played mini-golf with my son who did not get a wristband. It was a crappy, very old mini-golf. He liked it, so I guess that's what counts. Overall, a waste of money for us. If your kids will ride the rides...a good deal.

Buffet: there are five of us, so no matter where we go to eat it is always close too $100, if not over. Buffett was good & two of my kids LOVED the clams! We ate dinner at the buffet twice & breakfast once. The food was good & I recommend the buffet!

Midway & Circus Acts: this was our favorite spot as a family! The circus acts are really good! The shows are about 10-15 minutes & the performances are great! The midway games are so fun. Our favorites were the water gun clown face (pop a balloon) & the toss a chicken in the pot games. There are also arcade type games that dispense tickets. We played air hockey & ms. PAC man. The kids really liked the midway!

Pool & Water Slides: on our first day we got there & checked in. Kids wanted to go to pool & water slides. We found out water slides close at 6 pm & pool at 8 pm. Seems early for water slides, but whatever. We get out to the pool & it is SMALL & CROWDED! Just gave me the hebegebees looking at all the people, you could not have paid me to get in! My kids were even saying "gross so many people "! They played is splash pad for a bit. We got up the next morning & headed right to water slides...the kids got down twice when a lifeguard said she thought they should close the slides because a kid with scrapped up knees went down & she thought his knee might have been bleeding. WTF! So, the pool "engineer" closed all the slides about 40 min after they opened. 
The other thing about the pool...I had a bottle of water I had bought upstairs at the little snack mart by the casino & the security guard told me I couldn't take it out to the pool because I didn't buy it at the shop right there. I told him I bought it upstairs & he said yeah but it's a rule. So I said you are telling me I can't take water outside in the hot weather. He then told me there were drinking fountains outside or I could buy water from the store right here. What a JOKE! I told the security guard that I needed the water for medical reasons & he could call hotel management if he had a problem with me taking the water to the pool. He didn't say another word. 
If you stay at Circus Circus do not expect to go in the pool unless being packed in like a sardine does not bother you. 

I will not stay here again solely because the building needs to be updated badly! I really appreciated the great customer service & the rooms were ok. The rest of the hotel is in need of major updating. I guess I should expect that for how cheap the rates are.

I've never stayed here before (thank god), but I usually come here with my family for the attractions they offer here. The hotel is pretty big but is poorly lit and is not clean mostly. The Midway (Arcade area) is huge, but doesn't have a lot of new games.The Adventure Dome is pretty cool and has some nice rides. Circus Circus is caters to families, which is the reason why I don't really like this hotel. I heard that the rooms are dirty and disgusting. After seeing the renovations done at its sister property, (Circus Circus Reno) owned by a private company, I'd have to say that this hotel lags behind its counterpart in terms of cleanliness and appeal.

So I was a little scared to stay here due to all of the bad reviews and because it was so cheap.  I'm guessing most of the bad reviews are for the super "cheap" rooms in the manor.  I booked a room in the casino tower on a non smoking floor.  I opted for the king suite room which was HUGE and unlike other reviewers said it did not smell like smoke at all and i'm very sensitive to that.  It was very clean and looked updated. The TV had a lot of channels more then most hotels do. Only downside I had was there was no fridge, but it was so cheap and nice that wasn't an issue.  This place is awesome for kids so much to do!  All of the staff I encountered were very nice and helpful, check in was easy and express check out was nice as well.  So do yourself a favor stop griping and try staying in one of the tower rooms its not much more then the super cheap $20 rooms.  I paid $42 for a king suite which had a huge bathroom and lots of room for the little one to run around.  Parking was also easy and felt safe.  Don't stay here and then complain about kids...that's what this hotel is for so get over it and stay somewhere else if you don't like it lol Will definitely be returning soon :)

This hotel brings back memories when my parents use to bring use as kids now is my turn to bring my son


I stayed at the main tower casino king mini suite it was incredible  it was very big bed was very comfortable it had a minifridge overall the whole room was perfect the only thing was our view was not the best :\/ price was perfect


This is for the buffet price here is pretty decent i see alot of bad reviews for the buffet but what do you expect for $16 overall you get what you paid for customer service is pretty good too

I would say this is the best place to take your little ones while your visiting.  There's no other fun places for kids to really go in Las Vegas,  the adventure dome is cool with a bunch of rides for all ages,  and the mid way has tons of games for all of your an adult and you like games then visit the midway.

Every time I Come To Vegas This Is My Go To Hotel. I Always Book The Skyrise Tower Which Is The Tower To The Right Of The Hotel...It Has Easy Access To The Pool And Has Its own Little Casino. The Rooms Have Been Renovated So They Are Clean and New...The Bathrooms Are Very Spacious As Well. The Only Downfall To This Hotel Is That Its Towards The End Of The Strip But I Dont Have A Problem Taking A Taxi Or Walking. The Prices Per Night Are Very Good Anytime Of The Year. I love That there Is No Deposit So I Dont Have To worry about There Being A Hold On My Card And The Resort Fee Isn't Ridiculous. They Have Great Customer Service As Well...And Of Course I Love Their Breakfast Buffet...Everything Is So Fresh!!  Ive Been Coming Here Since I Was A kid And Would Hang Out In The Adventure Dome Im An Adult Now And Still Like to Frequent Some Of The Rides! All In all Circus Circus Will Always Have My Business!

Worst customer service ever. I cannot believe the way we were treated at this hotel. I stayed one night at this hotel on the 31st and checked out on the 1st on new years with my boyfriend. The hotel had signs all over the building notifying us to call in for a late check out so the next morning around 10, I called in asking for a late check out and they told me unless we paid $55, they would not give us a late check out. 

So my boyfriend and I totally understood and thought "Oh because its new years, I bet everyone is trying to check out late so thats why they are probably doing this. Lets just hurry up and check out by 11" 
I decided to go take a quick shower but the hot water was not working. I left it on for 10 mins but still no hot water. I asked my boyfriend to call the desk and ask them to check it out for us. The lady at the desk merely accused us of lying and that noone else complained and we were just saying this to get a late check out. We complained and told her that we were NOT lying and to send us maintenance at least to the room if she did not believe us. She responded "no other room has complained, how come your room is the only room with no hot water" she proceeded to tell us that she was going to charge us 55 more dollars if we were not out of the room by 11. 

We were extremely irritated by her tone of voice and her attitude. I got in the shower HOPING it would turn hot during the middle of my shower but NO HOT WATER. I showered in the cold, checked out at 10:30 and walked over to The Riviera Hotel right across where our other friends were staying and dried my hair there and got ready. 

I cannot believe the attitude the lady at the desk was giving us. We spent 300 dollars on the room for ONE night at the very least we expect HOT WATER. and if not, she should have sent maintenance us right away. We even asked to speak to the supervisor, and she told us that there was no point because she would tell me the same thing and AFTER we checked out my boyfriend called AGAIN to speak to the supervisor and FINALLY they connected us with the manager. We told her the story and she apologized and told us that that should not have happened the way it did and she would email us for a complimentary stay at the hotel. 

Instead, we got an email about a survey about our stay. It was really a horrific way to start the new year with the attitude from the customer service there and having to shower in the cold, and having to walk across to the other hotel in the cold. 

Props to Cheryl the manager who emailed us back with the complimentary room. Other than that worst customer service ever for Las Vegas hotel.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017     12\/100

I've been coming to circus since I can remember as a little kid to now as a grown adult with kids of my own. I come here and stay here for a weekend when I'm here with family with kids. I rate them and give them some stars because they are the only casino I think in Las Vegas that's kid friendly. No other casinos are kid friendly besides circus circus!!! In vegas...

They have plenty of games and circus shows and rides and arcades to keep the kids going for a least that weekend you stay. So this casino hotel gets the stars for helping us adults out with the kids..

Now as for a grown up and adult.. I give this casino 1 stars.. I've learned to notice how ghetto and small this casino really is. First of all.. all there machines don't win? Well for my luck.. and also I had a incident with losing my phone and I went straight to security and they are no help whatsoever!!! I asked if they can check there cameras real quick pls to see where I dropped my iphone they said they can't talk about or look at the cameras!! BS.. some type of security surveillance. 

Overall stay.. I lost $1000 in just gambling and plus a $800 iphone for two days in circus circus!!
Not a good stay.. lol

rolando the circus circus hotel manager is simply amazing!! professional, courteous, and polite! i am totally impressed by 5 star customer service i've received!! flawless management!!!! i can't wait to come backthanks for making my birthday amazing!!!!

Remembered liking this place when I was younger.  Here I go, thinking about staying here as an adult.  I book a room, but was able to find something cheaper and convenient in location to our expo\/trade show.  I noticed the Circus Circus charges had not yet posted to my account, and canceled my reservation a couple days later.  Low and behold...two days after I cancel it... the charge posts.  Since I used a debit card it makes it very inconvenient for them to take the funds out even though I already canceled.  Mind you, I had checked my bank account 10 mins prior to canceling and there were no charges yet.  I was even given a confirmation number of cancellation.  A lot of good that did me.  Ugh.  So inconvenient.  Make sure if you book here, you are really staying here.  They'll charge you no matter if you cancel.  I'm currently disputing the transaction with my bank.

Spent last Friday-Sun at the hotel with my hubby and 5 and 10 yr old kiddos. We booked our double bed room through Expedia for $107\/night that included a $20 food\/bev credit.
