Our casino tower room was pretty decent. The only negative to speak of was that the sink and bath tub drained very slow. My little ones had a blast at the Midway Arcade and the Adventuredome. The free circus acts at the Midway are very entertaining and free! We enjoyed dinner at The Pizzeria, good pizza, good salad, pass on the lasagna, not good, very dry for our taste anyway. The breakfast buffet was pretty good for the price.  We did not visit the pool so can not comment on that.. Overall great stay for the price, lots to do with the kiddies here. Perfect for a family Vegas trip! Don't forget to ask for your coupon book at check-in. FYI, the hotel offers late check out, $10 plus tax for 1pm, $15 for 3pm and $20 for 6pm.

We stayed here a month ago with some relatives. It was great experience especially when you have kids with you.
The hotel is really big, near to a lot of places to check. One of the most important thing about Circus Circus is the employees 
They were so hospitable and helpful.
I would like to thank to a security personel especially the name was or maybe last name AYAZ.He guided us where exactly we were looking to head.I have never seen that kind of service , normally the personel points you or tell you the directory
So we definitely enjoyed our staying with circus circus and would love to come back soon 
Good job circus circus and employes

This was my first time playing a slot machine in a casino. This casino has circus performances which include acrobats and a magic show. Also this place has an adventure dome which you can go on amusement rides. They also have krispy kreme donuts if you want to have breakfast or a snack.

If you want a discounted hotel on the strip, you get what you pay for. The smell is very bad throughout the entire hotel and casino. Went here so the kids would have fun in the adventuredome. If I did it again, I would find a nicer hotel and just uber to circus circus for a few hours.

Worst casino ever! but when you think of  "circus circus" you have to think  "families" and i have to say that dome area was pretty cool. the bartender wasn't allowed to give change so he got no tip, he was rude anyway. the "greeters" were so rude, we went up to one to ask where the dome was and he put his finger up and said "i'll be with you in a minute" and walked like 4 feet away to this man that just came out of the elevator (doors didnt even open yet) and said he pointed to something to the man and we just walked away because i had truly never had been so insulted ..if i didnt want to see the dome so bad i would have told him what i thought of a finger in my face..grrrrr.
Horrible experience. Rooms smell weird. I could hear the people in the room beside us as if there was no wall. Very very crowded. Smells like cigarettes everywhere

Absolutely disgusting!  If I could give it zero stars, I would.  The smell is awful.  The main  lobby smells like mildew and the lobby to the room smelled like bubble gum and smoke.  Woke up to a cock roach on the wall.    Never again!  If I ever find myself stuck in Vegas with limited room options again, I'll sleep in my car rather than stay at Circus Circus.

My room was refurbished, quite big, new art, flat screen TV, fake granite all over the place but the sheets and covers were shoddy. Still great value for $45 a night. It is a tatty old place with a lack of standard services - like room service, but it is clean enough and $45 a night. The casino was more Reno than Vegas, but who gives a shit? If you are stupid\/unfortunate enough to come to Las Vegas with kids, this is probably a good bet . Also the old-school fairground attractions in the tent mean you can get wasted and throw things or try and beat your equally drunken friends at Frogger.

As long as you get a room in the remodeled wing of this hotel, you'll be satisfied. It's a looooonnngg walk to the strip. If you have children this is the place to stay. The small food\/shopping area outside the dome is great but the buffet is not. Oh and it smells rather nasty in some areas...

We have always believed you get what you pay for, after staying at Circus~Circus I believe that even more! We have always stayed at nice reputable places, but this time we were very tight with money and thought we could save some money by staying at Circus~Circus, we were wrong all the way around. First RED FLAG, it had a 46% savings by booking now, we got the room for $56 the pictures online looked great, it's Circus~Circus for god sakes been around forever it's got to be well kept right, WRONG! When checking in the young lady was awesome, she was very informative,  sweet and just all around perfect as a front desk person. Second RED FLAG and continues, charged an additional $24 for what ever reason, we were stuck and couldn't get our money back, so we had to stay. After driving over 8 hrs straight we we're totally exhausted and late for our daughters graduation,  so we run to our room to change our clothes, the hallways stunk so bad the carpets were so filthy,  looked like they hadn't been cleaned in years, when we opened the door to our room the carpet in the room was even worse and the smell in the room was unbelievable! We had to wear our socks constantly which they turned black from the carpet not being cleaned, the bed had stains on it, the sheets reeked of bleach that we had to remove them from the bed, the bathroom was dirty, the room was in need of being dusting bad, we could go on and on but I think you get what we are saying. Say...NO TO CIRCUS~CIRCUS! Its worth putting out that extra money to stay at a nice Hotel, Circus~Circus lost us as a potential customer forever

I stayed here for 3 nights in the casino tower hotel with my husband and teenage son. The room prices are fantastic, and you get large rooms. The casino is very smokey, but all casinos in Vegas are, so I can't knock them down for that. They have a very nice pool, and the Midway is great for kids of all ages. The employees we encountered were friendly and helpful. I would go back to Circus Circus.

Worst hotel I have ever stayed! I have been in Vegas 3 times and love to try different hotels. Employees do not give importance what you need or request, they do not care about your satisfaction. If you are looking for a cheap and good place hotel in Vegas, i totally suggest you to go for Riviera instead of Circus Circus. Rooms are smelling disgusting and they are really dirty. Wifi sucks, I couldn't even get connected. I paid and booked the room online but when i got there, they requested me more money than i paid. I will never go and stay there again!

I traveled over to Circus Circus to meet up with a friend and checkout the casino.  When I say traveled I mean traveled.  We stayed at the Tropicana and even though we got on the  tram train thing we still had to walk, walk and walk some more before arriving at the Big Top. It looks pretty cool enough on the outside, I mean you have the shiny lights and the Vegas fixings.  
When you walk through the doors things change up a bit.  I felt like I had walked into an indoor fair grounds. There were kids everywhere. I guess they are the product of what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas.  
We watched one on the Circus acts.  The act had a bunch of very bendable men pouncing around in leopard  print costumes.  The act was really good.  That was really about all I liked about the Big Top.  
A visit to Circus Circus was enough for me.  I don't think I would want to actually stay.  It's so far from all the fun things in Las Vegas. When you leave Circus Circus  you feel dirty and you didn't even get to have fun getting dirty.

ATTENTION demolition experts!  Blow this place up!

What can I say?  

Unlike some of the old "this is Vegas past" hotels and casinos found downtown (Binions, El Cortez), this place needs to be leveled.  In it's hey day this is where my friends and I would shack up for a cheap weekend on the loose.  We would get one of those motel rooms out back and squeeze six of us into two full sized beds.  But back then it was clean and doable.  Today I wouldn't go anywhere near one of those rooms as the place has really decayed without maintenance since the 1970's.

As soon as you enter this denizen of filth you notice the unmistakable smell which seems to be a concoction of cigs, booze, filth, unclean patrons, and vomit.  Then comes the reality that there are hundreds of loud, out of control children running around loose with twenty bucks in their pockets as they try to win straw stuffed animals and characters from the pseudo midway games.  

The casino looks and feels like it has not been wiped down for decades.  Sticky everywhere you don't want to touch anything unless you are packing a roll of Brawny and a spray bottle of bleach.

So, unless you are one who likes such an environment, I highly suggest going downtown if you want that "old Vegas" experience.

You get what you pay for"

- duty room (before we arrive) 
- no fridge in the room
- too much noisy (even in late time)
- room still duty (3th day)
- smell awful, even in non-smoking apartment
- I really dont trust in their cleaning service, its disgusting to be here
- It has being a awful experience   

good:
- free parking
- free wifii

Gross, Gross GROSS.

Will never step foot in this place again if I can help it.  The last time i was there, my feet were literally sticking to the floor...didn't want to stick around to think about what it was...

EW

Lasciate ogni speranza, voi ch'entrate.

This phrase kept running in my head during my one day at Circus, Circus. 

Why only one day, you ask?

Well, my heart couldn't take it.

It wasn't the meth heads or the white, cracked-out trailer park kings or the families of twenty or more with their ginormous asses blocking the walkways, or the creepy gaze of tattooed men staring hard eyes at my 10-yr-old daughter, or the smoky, dark hallways dotted with unwatched and unwashed children, or the hospice-like feel of the midway and its sad, dated video games on life support, or the oversized skating rink feel of the Adventuredome and the Frankenstein-like vibe of its rides like they were all built in a meth-lab-turned-factory with the severed limbs of former discontinued state fair attractions, or the ridiculous prices charged to ride them.

No. It was the hopelessness that the collective images filled me with. The feeling that this is where we're all headed-man and casino alike. That when the glitz and glamour of the casinos of the south side of the Vegas strip began to tire, this is what they'll become. An unkept sarcophagus storing the broken pieces of ourselves that no one wants but the desperate and sick and derelict. 

And that's the problem with Circus Circus. Because Vegas is not supposed to pin you down to the darkest threads of reality. It's supposed to take you away from all of that. The grocery store in your town you can no longer visit at night. The homeless guy you pass by on your way to work every morning. The grungy kid from high school that never stopped being the grungy kid from high school. The Jerry Springer episodes that flash on your television while you're scrolling to CNN. Inner city graffiti, discarded tall boys, young men in trucker hats and baggy jeans gripping the skeletal arms of their young mom girlfriends. Vegas shouldn't remind you of this.

But Circus Circus does. 

"It's where lung cancer goes to get lung cancer," I told my boyfriend.

He agreed.

"I hate to feel like an elitist..." he began, and I nodded.

We couldn't call a taxi quick enough.

Room was clean but that's as positive as I can be.  Very little water pressure in the shower.  Tiny soap bars. Only 2 towels.  No tv channels to speak of.  The casino and midway smelled horrible.  Very out dated will definitely go back to our regular spots on Fremont Street!

D.U.M.P.  I've found the hotel homeless people go to when given $10 on the street.  Ewe.... Thought we would try it out just fer shits n giggles.  Heard it had a fun playful circul amusement park mentality...  Disgusting in every way.  And the staff!  Gross!  I think living in a trailer and eating cigarettes for breakfast are a Pre requisite for job application.  How can EVERYTHING taste like cream of wheat and bacon grease?  I felt the need to stop in at a roadside gas station restroom to get the stank off.  That's satin somethin

The only thing that I will say positive about this hotel is that the room is acceptable. I am surprised how much they charge for every day food and drinks like coffee and water which was $3.00 and $20.00 for a basic breakfast buffet. I thought I was putting up with the dated Decore to save some money. Next time I'll literally spend a few dollars more and get the Vegas experience at a much nicer hotel.
As a child, I loved it back in the (19)80s with my parents. They had tons of games and circus acts which were rad(ical).

I originally booked a room online at the manor lodge and wow.  Horrible room. It smelled like cheap cleaning soap,  there was a dead roach on the floor,  stains on the floor and on the toilet!  Disgusting. After seeing this,  we tried calling the front desk and they transferred us to like 9 people before we actually got some help. It was frustrating and they were so rude. Fortunately, a nice lady named Roula gave us a free upgrade and we moved to the skyrise tower. Same room but much much better. It was definitely newer and cleaner. However, they kept charging weird fees on my card. Overall,  I really don't recommend this hotel.

Never again will my family Or friends stay at Circus circus again. Unfortunately while sharing adjacent rooms for three nights with my family we were Robbed (so far looks like employee) while we were aseep! Pants with wallet. money. credit cards and keys were taken. We made a report with security and metro police after finding out a female used stolen credit cards (we have pictures in a store of her) tried getting help from so called Risk Management David Garner who won't reply! after showing pictures of female using credit cards and other employees know who she is... Hmmmmm sounds like a cover up since no reply and I was told of my many calls for a week that I'm Harassing them! Really??? You can be robbed and Not safe in the hotel? But if you dare complain or reach out for help Don't bother they cover up for themselves! They truly don't care about their guests only the casino floor where their money is!!! We want the female caught and aressted!!! Thank goodness for REAL detectives (LVMetro) helping us. Now let's wait for a customer service to reply... Hmmmm let's see them say how sorry and concerned that an unfortunate incident happened while our stay. Whatever! how about we will be contacting you to resolve this with an aresst of the girl in the picture and help pay for your loss. Would be nice to say the least.

**EXCUSE MY LANGUAGE, I AM VERY ANGRY**

-Is it just me, or is EVERYONE who works here Chinese\/Philippino? I'm not trying to sound racist, but really... what the hell? 

-When walking in the promenade "mall" I guess it was the same day Criss Angel was there, so I was crowded between smelly, sweaty teenagers and if I stopped for not even two seconds a security guard would approach me and tell me to keep walking. This place seriously needs to work on organizing their lines.

-The pool was a lovely shade of brownish green, and if it was a crayon color it would be named Diarrhea Delight. They need to do some serious cleaning in there because not even my little brother wanted to swim. 

-It took me fifteen minutes just to walk to the elevator from the lobby, and I nearly got lost every time. This place is huge. Walking around past the casino and around the whole hotel really isn't fun. Especially when it's 2 in the morning and I just want to go to fucking sleep.

-Everywhere I walked it smelled horrible. Walking around the casino in Circus Circus is like rolling around in an ash tray, naked. Oh, and I just love the drunk ass ghetto guys running around. More entertaining than the circus acts.

-The buffet was GROSS, and for being so expensive you'd expect it to be DECENT at the least. The mashed potatoes were boxed, all the soda tasted like Listerine, and the meat was disgusting. Salad was okay though. Every restaurant in there was so expensive, and definitely not worth it.

-I won't lie, our room was nice, but what the hell was up with the bottom drawer of the cabinet under the TV being fake? I had to cram all the stuff I brought with the other people I stayed with in two drawers. 

Overall, this place is a roach motel for clowns. But if you have kids, they'd probably enjoy it.

One of the worst experience I had in a casino. I wasn't loosing money but in general the dealers were so rude that even after doubling my money I couldn't be happy. Almost all of them are Chinese I don't know that is the reason. Moreover they were changing dealers so rapidly(roulette) to make people loose money so quickly. I have never seen that before and went mad because we weren't winning money even in hundreds. Don't ever think of going there thinking you will have fun at least.
I love this place that I wanna live here near by they are pretty cool people I met on Vegas but most important they are cool but I am gonna missed it
Total crap shoot. Room reservation receptionist rude and unprofessional.  You get what you pay for.

I give it 1 star because I cannot give it zero, I hate this place... the buffet is the worst thing you can eat (at least in vegas baby)... and there is no sane reason to stay there, if its because of the prices you are better off in a downtown joint, really... it just takes your happy felling of being in vegas down.

I've been to this hotel 3 times since 1995. It's a decent place for the price. family friendly and close to normal shopping. Ross's down the street. So is Peppermill a nice restaurant. A CVS is close by, so is an IHOP and a McDonald's. 
     Oh and those who don't know about Whack-o-Chicken. You basically catapult a vinyl life size plucked chicken onto a rotating grill with several pots attached to the grill, by striking a pad with a rubber mallet that launches said chicken into the air. Object: Try and time the trajectory of the chicken so that it lands in a pot. This game is even more hysterical if you can imitate The "BaGAWK!!!!" sound of the old cartoon show Super Chicken as you strike launch button with the mallet.

One bad note. the lay out of the hotel is confusing. if you're not staying in the Main tower you'll be doing a lot of walking within the hotel.

I am sorry circus circus, you used to be my favorite place. I have nothing against this place, I love the midway arcade BUT, I really dislike the workers behind the carnival game stands. It looked like they were mad at me or something, I didn't even do anything!! I am not joking my brother played basketball a few times and got one in  a hoop and the guys face was expressionless and looked a little mean,and just threw the bear at him. Same with the lady at the water gun shooting game, only me and my brother were playing and I beat my brother and she just gave me a bear, not enthusiastic or anything. Their expressions gives me the creeps. I think if I come back I might just stick to the games with the tickets...
I suggest you not play the claw machines I must have wasted 30 dollars and got nothing, spend your money on getting tickets its much better! 
I think i'm started to like excaliburs fantasy faire more now, even though its smaller than circus circus, at least the workers are friendlier.
The free circus acts were nice to watch.
I saw two acts, one with two guys doing gymnastic stuff, and some guy in the air with strings, he was shirtless..so thats a plus!
fun for children.....but the adults are the ones who make this place happen....Midway should stay open past midnight for the big kids

This hotel is not what I expected. As much money as I spent on a room, I expected for it to be much better toiletries. Moreover, their drainage system in the restroom is clogged, so there is a sink full of water when in use. In addition, I  was woke up out of my sleep at 8am by they next door neighbor's loud conversation about drugs. You would think that their insulation is much better than what it is. Not to mention, I called for a late check-in time and was sent to booking.com and was told that I  could have a late check-in but was booked and charged for a totally different room. The worse experience of my life. My first time in Las Vegas and an 8 hour drive. This hotel is not even worth it. I am so unsatisfied.  I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Ok my wife myself and our 9 year old daughter came here for two days, christmas day and the following day.  Start off by saying, i was reading alot of bad reviews about this place and almost changed hotels at last minute... But boy are we glad we didnt.   We booked a run of the house room on vegas.com and its was $54 plus resort fee $28. 

We got there at about 11am, well before check in. Got in line only 3 people in front of us. By the time we got to the counter the line was down the hall. So perfect timing for us. Got to line and asked about early check in and the lady went to go see if the manager would allow it, and they did. And let me say didnt even charge an up fee of sny kind for it. Bumped up to 28th floor of the skytower. And i gotta say as long as we have the kid with us we'll be staying here. 

I read alot about dirty, ghetto old rooms. And ours was anything but that. I work all around and live out of hotels year round, and this room was bad ass. Soft matress clean room plenty for the kiddo to do all around since we werent in the room long  It was my first time here so getting around at first is a little confusing, got lost more than once trying to get back to the car, but once we found the proper parking garage we were golden. Place is huge lots of walking, my thing said i did like 22,000 steps the first day. 

Now we been here once and know our way around a little bit watch out. My little girl already saying "next time we go to circus circus" lol

Only complaint $4 bottles of water everywhere throughout the hotel. My wife is diabetic i did not expect that price. Just gotta remember bring a cooler next time. Everybody was friendly. Fun time. Thanks for having us

I was in town to cover the first Democratic debate that took place October 13. My company gave me the option to stay at circus circus or treasure islands. I picked circus circus it was closer to the debate venue. I usually make horrible choices when I pick hotels. But this time I made an excellent one. I arrived on Monday the 12, The check in line was a bit long, but it moved extremely fast. When I got to the check-in counter, I told the young lady by the name of "Glory" that I was running late to an event hosted by the Washington Post at the MGM Grand. She said that she would move my room closer to the elevator in the west tower and that she would have a car waiting for me to take me to the MGM grand. I was stunned and amazed by the amazing customer service Glory and this hotel gave me. The room was very modern and nice. The bathroom was full of granite which gave it a luxurious look. The room had a desk, two lamps, a flatscreen TV with many channels, and a safe. I was also very lucky and won in the hotels casino $800.00. They also have an amazing steakhouse, which gave me a free bottle wine on the house. The customer service at Circus Circus is beyond amazing. When I checked out the staff already had a shuttle waiting to take me to the airport. I am coming back in December for the Republican debate. I can guarantee that I will be staying at one of the many MGM Hotels on the strip. I convinced many of my coworkers to do the same.
The reason I give this 3 stars instead of 2 is only because the fried chicken was fabulous. The rest of the food was so-so. Nothing to write home about. But the fried chicken. Mmm
This place was ok. Service was slow and people were rude. This will not be a place of choice for us. We were not pleased with the casino either.

The staff were helpful and pleasant.  The arcade area was dirty and worn. The hotel has the same worn feel. Our stay was three days but after one we left grabbed an Air BnB. Sorry Circus but you should start a remodel
A great place for kids.  The Adventuredome is fun and has a few rides and carnival games.  The rooms are decent for rest.  Can't beat the prices.  It has seen it's better days though.

We stopped for 2 nights in vegas with our boys (6 and 3 yrs old). The hotel reaks and it's not the smoke we smell. Hotel also is dirty and our room was dirty upon arrival, despite that a manager had reviewed the room before we arrived......she was leaving as we approached the door. Tub has mildew, sheets were dirty and the room reaks. Blankets on bed were scratchy...very uncomfortable. 

Hotel is outdated which is fine. 
 Games were very expensive and we didn't expect that....most kiddie games are $1 while the others are $2 each or more. Staff didn't seem to like their jobs. 

We wanted to checkout and go to another hotel so we requested a refund and was told there's nothing they can do.

We definitely won't be coming back.

Great place to stay if you have kids. Adventure dome fun and the circus acts are short but really good.  The down side is when u get off the elevator it smells like a nursing home and the rooms are nice but musty. Stay in the towers. Nice pool. Nice staff. Would stay again with kids.

Pretty gross all around, but always cheap if you're passing through it on a tight budget. It's way down the strip, so its a good 20 minute walk to everything else you'd want to check out, but there's a public bus and it is walkable. The hotel and the buffet are less expensive than most. There's also an amusement park in the complex--not huge, but good for some entertainment.

I'm a firm believer that you get what you pay for. There is a reason this is the cheapest place to stay at LOL!  I will only stay here if it's for my kids.  And no longer than 2 days. And only at their newly remodeled main tower casino. Just stayed here last week.  Nice clean room.  Clean restroom. Visited the adventuredome which i think is a good deal. Had lots of fun with my daughter.  Their dinner buffet was pretty good.  Nothing incredible but good,  maybe like a home town buffet.  But breakfast was horrible.  Same price as dinner (maybe $2 less per person ) and just horrible we had better breakfast the 2nd day at McDonald's  (conveniently inside casino). Their free hourly circus acts are nice except for the fact they have a tiny seating area which fills quickly.  Other than that,  decent place to take the kiddos.

It's not quite as I expected. The shower curtain was dirty like it havent been change in years. I have the worse experience staying at circus circus. The customer service was mediocre as best. At least I know what hotel to avoid next time I'm in Vegas :)

I go for the arcade in the Adventuredome. It's a nice fun place for locals to enjoy. Lots of fun games tickets prizes to be won great place to come with the kids or even just on a little date getaway. I stayed in a hotel recently and the makeover is fabulous the lot better than I expected and it's better than most of the hotels that I've stayed on the strip.

Waited in line for almost an HOUR to check in at 3pm.  We get our keys and then find out we have to EXIT the casino and CROSS the street to get to our room.  Open the door to find a very outdated looking hotel room with sub-standard amenities.  The coffee table wobbled so much I thought it was going to unscrew and come flying off.  Needless to say, I didn't use that coffee table.  The beds are so springy you wake up with a sore back the next day.  

Whats worse than the crappy room is their crappy restaurants.  Since I didn't have a car, I thought I would give their cafe a shot.  Nothing is fresh and everything could be made with a microwave.  

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

My wife and I stayed here a year ago with our kids and grandkids for a couple nights and had a great time.  Totally different experience this year.  The whole property seemed to be understaffed from the front desk to the casino area.  We had no hot water the first morning until about 10 AM.  A lot of the machines weren't working.  Even though all of the rides and games weren't open, the adventure dome was the only bright spot of our stay.  The worst part was the second night when someone broke into our room while we were sleeping there and stole a pair of my jeans with $180 in them, which was in the closet near the door.  Apparently, there have been reductions in security as well.  We won't be staying there again.  We will stay at the South Point Hotel and Casino in the future.  If we want to go to the Adventure Dome, it will be safer to drive there for the day and leave.  I would recommend the free Valet Parking.  The attendants at the Valet Parking and Bell Desk were great.
The price of admission is high for what is offered. Get a coupon if you go here, and go early. The pass is good all day so make use of it. As it gets later safety can be an issue.

This review is for the Casino Tower rooms. It's convenient how the elevators are separated into ones that only go up to certain floors. Really helpful in avoiding crowded elevators. Also very convenient that you just ride up and down and you're already there in the Casino where all the action occurs. We got a room on the 5th floor. The view was absolutely hideous. It included a view of the roof of a smaller building along with many pipes, with the Stratosphere and LVH in the back.  The room itself was clean.. beds were comfortable. The room had a flat screen TV, having stayed in the Manors before with those really old 1990's TV's, this was a really nice upgrade. The room was extremely spacious and it was very nice. The only reason for 1 less star is that the "flush" sound the toilet makes is EXTREMELY loud. You can hear it a few rooms away, not even kidding. Overall, it was pleasant. Highly recommend the casino towers!

I read a ton of negative reviews for this hotels and was actaully dreading our visit.  In actuality, this place is fantaistic.  Rooms are nice and clean. They have non-smoking floors with a note that says if you smoke in the room you'll be charged $250 cleaning fee.  I didn't notice a "trashy or ghetto" feel to it.    It's normal, average family people enjoying themselves.  

We stayed in the Skyrise tower on the 21st floor.  Just past the Adventure Dome area.  

You have to enjoy children. They are everywhere-hey, it's a circus people! What else would you expect?  You should enjoy walking if you don't have a car, because it is towards the end of the strip.  We walked just about everywhere. It's ~15-20 min walk to get down to the main part of the strip.   We did use the Deuce bus pass 1 day which was very nice. 

The price is great.. We arrived ~noon.  Not too many people in line and they had a lot of people working the desk so check in was speedy.

I felt like we were staying in an amusement park\/county fair but even better because it was air conditioned, no bugs or hot sun beating down on you for the day.  It was so much fun.  The rides aren't bad for such a small place. Midway games were cheesy but fun.   Reminded me when I was a kid and was given a roll of quarters to play in the arcade when we visited our local amusement park.

The casinos were ok.  We don't gamble much so a few dollars in the penny slots each day made me happy.   At least this one didn't have the strong smoke smell that many of the other ones on the strip had.  Slots of fun  has a pizza smell instead of a smoke. 


Pay attention to the type of traveler you are.  Do you want a lot of service? People waiting on you hand a foot?  Do you hate children?  Do you want to be right on the strip with lots of dance clubs nearby? Do you want trendy decor? Go someplace else. 

This is a good place for families and people who enjoy the simple pleasures and don't mind walking.  Yes, it really can use a coat of paint on the outside-I really think the tent is supposed to be red and not pink.  But remember it's been around a few years.

Watch out for the "information" booth when you first get into the lobby.   Silly me, I thought it was a real information booth.   It's a sales pitch for some vacation\/time share thing.  They'll want you to go to a presentation before you get your tickets.  Be aware of the nice people in suits wanting to know where you're from.  They just want to rope you into a sales presentation.

We approached Circus Circus with the sole intent of visiting the Horsearound Bar. After getting a footlong at the lovely Slots O' Fun next door, we sauntered over to Circus Circus. The first visual - a woman, bent over the divider wall right out front, hurling chunks, as her friend held her hair. When she was done, she went back inside. Classy. Go OUTSIDE to puke (lure in the patrons) and go back in when you're done. Once inside, it was as expected - full of your average state fair crowd (lowlifes, screaming kids, overweight people with fanny packs and roots.) The ceilings in here are unusually low and there is an overwhelming sense of panic as one makes his or her way through the masses. Built in 1968, I am amazed that it is still standing. Even at the time, it was considered tacky. They used to have real circus animals and one of the games was to throw balls at an elephants' privates to see if he would scream (one would win a prize.) I can't say it has improved much over the years. The facade is scary, the inside is scary...how, in the age of the Wynn, is this place still around? I mean, I love old Vegas and wish that they hadn't torn down the Stardust and the Frontier...but THIS place is beyond grotesque. Thank goodness the Horsearound Bar was open and functional when we got upstairs. That was worth paving our way up the "midway." Highlight - they have a classic "dip and dunk" photobooth upstairs for a mere $3!! I have looked high and low for one of these for years. They have two! If you can handle the torture that is Circus Circus, make you way upstairs for a spin on the Horsearound and a photobooth picture.
Dirty but efficient.  A lot of traffic as far as people go. When we arrived our room was dirty.

Vehicle was broken into while parked in their lot. Punched the lock and when I tried to tell security for a report they looked dumbfounded. Eventually they took one but not happy with situation. Obviously security officers on duty not patrolling. 

Room was clean and non smoking but smelled really bad as if someone smoked in it. Family next door with 5 kids screaming and jumping kept us up all hours of the night. 

Kids loved the games and amenities. Price was good but what I saved on the hotel I am now paying in a vehicle damage deductible :(

I had stayed at circus circus before and had low expectations to begin with. I chose to stay here because it had the lowest prices on the strip. However, this stay, we weren't even in the hotel!! We got rooms in the circus circus manor, which is an even further walk from the strip and about 10 mins walking to the main casino and game place. Absolutely SUCKED! The manors are behind the circus circus building and look like old, run-down motels. Even a walk to the main lobby was quite far and we were even further from the strip!! Not to mention, our faucet wouldn't shut off, it kept dripping our whole stay!! Circus circus usually isn't that bad, but if they place you in the manors, I would suggest going someplace else!

I dont have anything negative to say at all about this hotel... I love it and its great for kids and family. Right when u walk in they greet you and welcome you. Its a very reasonable price. They have everything!! Circus shows, buffet, games, casino, fitness center, pool, small rollercoaster the adventure dome. The prices on food are great we love going to the garden grill for two people to eat is less than $30.... they have a mcdonalds and minigames. The only thing is that its far from the strip but its ok they have shuttle busses and bus. We always bring our car we live inS.D soo its extremely close by..... rooms are nice as well and have many to choose from. This is my second stay here soo we do love it...
love it here...

Big thieves they are...charged my card unnecessary for $90 extra for no reason on this labor day weekend...Priceline charged my card already and at the time of check in hotel charged me twice for the same stay...Check in lady didnt know how to resolve this...and later when I tried calling, everyone is giving different reason for the extra charges...explained this case 1000 times and no one seems to understand about this fraudulent transaction...& they are not ready to give my money back..

Rooms are pathetic with no refrigerator and no Oven...Bed bugs all over the Bed !!!
Dont go unless you want to hate urself later for this choice..

I want to say fist my stay at this hotel ok but one thing just it lacks.   Customer service.  On my arrival, The front desk clerk was very friendly but gave the wrong room number.  The strange thing that happened was another couple had the same room number like I did.  I went back to complain to the clerk but the clerk was not there at all.   I was very frustrating and tired.  They gave me another room.  It took me about 30 mins to get a room

Our stay in this hotel was not too bad. If you want to stay in Las Vegas for cheap, you have kids & don't care about the frills, this might be the place for you.

PROS - Nice & friendly staff - from the bell hop to the valet attendant. The front desk personnel was super friendly, she even gave us adjoining rooms. The valet parking is convenient. Rooms were adequate, clean, but needs a makeover. The ribs from one of the restaurants were actually good.

CONS - Lots of people! Older facilities, our bathroom had a leaky faucet. The restaurant choices are not that great, you have to go to the strip to get some decent food.

We stayed in the west tower last weekend of June i must say i was scared cause i read i the yelp review were bad. But nothing like it at all! The rooms were very nice and clean and
 its an amazing hotel for kids! It was a great stay!!

I was very skeptical about staying here because of some of the bad reviews and decided to try to give it a shot anyway. Bad idea, the room was gross, there was a false eyelash on the floor, a huge wet spot on the carpet of I don't know what and it was missing the chair from the desk. The hallways are so stuffy  and hot and good luck trying to get an elevator at check out.  we were supposed to stay for 5 nights but we checked out after only one.  The hotel was able to refund our resort fee in full but it was a pain in the ass to refund the rest of our stay. The only good thing about this hotel really is the Adventuredome.  My kids had a blast there and there was so much for them to do as far as rides, games, etc.  As far as staying here again, not so much, at least not until some major renovations happen.

My stay at this hotel was a short one. We stayed here for a weekend in the Skyrise tower. The check-in process was very smooth and didn't take too long. After checking in, the lady showed us how to get to our room, which was very helpful. *There is a Skyrise tower parking, which is never full.* Getting to our room was kind of a hassle as we stayed on the 16th floor of the Skyrise tower. There are 8 elevators that go to the Skyrise towers: 4 that go from 1-18 floor and the other 4 that go to the higher floors. The elevators were either always full, slow, or not working. The room itself was neatly made up and was spacious. It comes with a tv, a safe, and very spacious closets. Oh, and FREE UNLIMITED WIFI. The service was also wonderful, from the friendly lady that checked us in to the fast housekeeping service. The hotel offers free Circus shows from 11am-12am and while the entrance to the Adventure Dome is free, the rides are priced. The hotel also has various little shops inside, including a Starbucks, souvenir shops, ice cream shops, etc. There is also a McDonalds, Subway, etc nearby. Overall, this was a nice stay. However, some recommendations would be to update the hotel. Some areas were somewhat outdated, i.e. the carpets. I would recommend this hotel for someone looking for a cheaper option with amenities.

Horrible experience....wow this Kiyana female THE WORST!!! I mean the worst customer service I have ever came encounter with!!!How do you profile, disrespect, laugh, and even get ignorant on the clock and continue to act as though you OWN this darn piece of an amusement park.... Clearly this should be her last day here as an employee, but her Supervisor Martiza is just as a freaking loss cause....it's all good I will never spend my money here again!!! You can keep that 165 plus tax...

Circus Circus gets a bad rep but it's really not as scary or run down as everyone makes it seem. It's definitely not the Aria but for the prices, it's decent. The rooms were clean (except some towels that had suspicious stains on them but easily fixed with an exchange from the maid cart) and the Westside Manor isn't as fancy but you pay for what you get. My friend and I made a last minute trip to Vegas for a concert and this was in our budget, close, and relatively safe.

Will never return. We booked for the weekend to attend the iHeart Music Festival and seemed like a good deal. When we arrive and check in we are sent to a room that upon arrival is still being cleaned up from the previous guests the night before. So we go back down and are sent to another room. Arrive in that room, smells like smoke and there's two pairs of women's thongs on the ground next to the bed. Can't even say "you get what you paid for" because we got a disgusting experience and we are stuck here for another night sadly.

Some people complain about Circus Circus being full of kids. If that's you, go to the Wynn, Vdara or someplace else. But if you have kids, this is the place for you. They can keep busy all day in the Adventuredome or the Midway that surrounds the circus act area. McDonald's is right there too, should they get hungry. 

Now for us big folks, there are a number of restaurants and watering holes to choose from, both at the mezzanine level and on the casino floor. The rooms? Well, the West Tower rooms are fairly nice but please stay away from the Manor. That is just a bunch of old motel rooms that are somewhat removed from the main facility. The only advantage to the Manor is that you can park your car next to your room and you don't have to schlep your luggage very far. But now that most luggage comes with wheels, that shouldn't be much of an issue. The nicer rooms are only a few dollars more, and worth it.

Now here's a secret just for you. Don't tell anyone else, OK? Pull your car into Garage 1 and find a parking place on Level 3 (Green). That way you won't have to take the elevator; just walk right through the doors onto the Promenade level, turn right and take the escalator down to the casino level, another right or two and you'll be at the front desk. The elevators servicing the West Tower are close by, too. Very convenient.  

OK, it's not the swankiest hotel in town. It's not even swanky. But the facility is decent, the prices are great and it's probably the most kid-friendly hotel outside of Disneyland.

Its cheap for a reason...we got a room in the manor portion of the hotel, confused when they told us our room was detached and off to the side of the hotel. They rooms are nasty, ugly, and outdated.

Pay extra for a better hotel... we cancelled our reservation after one night and switched hotels.

My friend and I somehow ended up walking all the way here. I've come here years ago the first time I came to Vegas. I remember playing the carnival games and winning a bunch of stuffed animals. This time my friend and I ended up gambling here and I liked it. It wasn't too busy and not smokey.

Definitely would come back and next time check out the carnival games.

Also, one day I'll make it to the Stratosphere.

I checked it about 2am and there was a line. But it moved very quickly and the clerk was efficient. Booked one of the remodeled rooms and was very pleased. It was comfortable and fully appointed. I only stayed 1 night so I had no experience with housekeeping. I walked the grounds a bit and some area of the hotel shows it's age. I stayed at MGM the next night and regretted not staying with circus for the whole weekend. So my advice is to spend the extra 4  bucks and upgrade.

Circus Circus is significantly chipper than other neighboring hotels on the strip. It offers clean and more than acceptable rooms for this price. 

Customer service is superb. We were assisted by one of their finest front desk associates, Carrie.

Tried to save money by staying here, but it really isn't worth it.

1) Too far from everything and you'll have to bus it or get a taxi almost anywhere.
2) It's filled with small children and families
3) GRIMEY-You go to Bellagio and see Fendi and Prada, but you see fake diamond chains for $10 at Circus Circus
4) Room service is at like 8am every morning!
5) Walking through the casino to get to the elevators is torture

I do have to say that the room was clean but that's about all I can give it. And the $7 shuttle tot he airport...

This place is sorry. Somebody needs to gut the entire hotel and rebuild something else more interesting or more modern. The swimming pool is not even located within the hotel area one has to cross the street and go to the r_v park that's terrible. The gym is laughable. There are maybe 2 or 3 machines from the early eighty's and 3 treadmills. My t_v room at home is bigger than the gym here. There's just no more reason to have circus circus. I call for rebuild a refurbish completely. I'm all for budgeting but there are many hotels in the strip that are brand new for the same price as circus circus. The one thing this hotel has over another hotel on the strip is wifi which luxor still doesn't have.

This review is for the Arcade area.

Stupid employees, stupid employees everywhere.

Old machines, old machines everywhere.

These arcade machines will make you lose money faster than the penny slots downstairs.

I have a better chance of acquiring a tetanus infection from the machine than finding a good and working machine.

I had to babysit.
I was a little scared to stay here after reading all the bad reviews. I stayed here for EDC & the room was nice & clean!! House keeping was great. Check-in\/out was fast & pain free! Great hotel.

My oh my where do I start?!? Well first when I booked my hotel I was told I was getting a suite( my husband and 4 children ) drove 5 hours to Vegas to be told they don't sell suites and that it look like the lady tried to flag the room but couldn't because suites are for the VIP. Oh really? So we were forced to stay in one room with 2 queen beds because they already take your money off your card. Talked to a  "manager" about getting my money back since I was giving misinformation from their staff. She made a rude comment about the suite costing a couple hundred more a night so we probably wouldn't want it anyways as if we looked like we couldn't afford it.  I wanted to take my money and find a place that was comfortable for my family and I and boy was we uncomfortable 6 people small room 2 beds luggages and clothes everywhere you do the math. Was told it was nothing they can do so  me being a good sport for my children who was already restless from the road we just took the room. Guess what we were put on the second floor all you can hear are big trucks driving by honking horns and backing up at 7 in the morning sucks when your up all night gambling. The rooms are not the best we knew that coming in so I will not comment on the appearance of the room. Always loved circus circus for the kids but will never come back!! Rule number one in business accommodate your paying guest .

Eh is about all I can say for Circus Circus.  It was never a fancy hotel\/casino, but it seems to have fallen behind the rest, in my opinion.  Here's why:

1. The casino could use a makeover.  They have newer machines, but everything else is just stale.  It also has the really old smoke smell about it.  Ewww.

2. All of the walkways are now crowded with little kiosks in every opening.  It is just super crowded and cramped.  Not to mention a lot of the people working the kiosks are overly pushy bordering on rude.

3. The Midway is still a fun place to go with kid's because of the circus acts and all of the games.  However they have raised the price of all of the games.  Games that were $.50 are now $2 a pop.  What used to be a fun and affordable day out with your family now costs a mortgage payment!  It was pretty empty as well, maybe its because its to expensive now.

4. The parking is chaotic. It also seems dangerous because no one knows where to go or where to stop.  We were almost hit 4 times just trying to leave and get back out on Industrial\/Dean Martin.

It is still a good deal for hotel stays, but the places really needs a make over or facelift if it wants to contend with the other casinos in the area.

I would have to agree with most of the reviews about circus circus..This place was soooo nice back in the day. 

Now?

No comment, its actually sad to see what its become.

Such horrible service the cocktail waitress appeared upset because they were working not really welcoming or pleasant at all. I spent hundreds of dollars every time I go and never has the service been this horrible. Tremendously dissatisfied. Blackballing Circus Circus

Nasty!!! First impressions parking....horrible! No spots, traffic tie ups, small spaces, narrow isles in the garage.  My advice if you have to stay here use valet. Its free just have to tip.

Line for check in was long but moved pretty fast.  Staff was very nice and friendly. The lobby and hallways are hot. Feels like there's barely any air.

Its an old hotel, really needs updating badly.  We're staying in the Skyrise Towers. Room 28713.

Our rooms....disgusting! There's ripping wallpaper, stains on the walls, marks on the door, hair in the mighty small blow dryer. The room is old and outdated. No coffee maker, no fridge, no nothing. 

Beds are old, pillows are small only 2 on each bed. I haven't toured the rest of the hotel yet but at this time I just want to leave, its disgusting!  The shower was a trickle of water I couldn't even shower properly. Beware also the A\/C is LOUD! Works great but I can't hear the TV over it.

The restaurants and food aren't much better. No Starbucks in the hotel but there is a Krispy Kreme. Bought a milk for my daughters from there along with some donuts to bring back to the room. Donuts were great the milk was bad I just dumped it.

We did go to the buffet. Awful! Don't waste the money I can get better food going to golden corral. The place was clean but not worth the price go elsewhere.

Spend the extra money elsewhere to get something better I wish I did.  Circus Circus is so far away from everything else on the strip you'll have to drive or take a can to get to anything. The monorails don't even go out that far.

Oh...don't expect your cell phones to have much signal either most areas even with Verizon I only had 1x if I was lucky.

The only good thing about this place is adventure dome. Great for the kids lots of rides and games decent price. Mine had a blast. Is come back for the shows and adventure dome but would never stay here again.

We have vacation at Circus Circus twice and couldn't be happier! The atmosphere is very laid back, not too crowded, and has a great vibe. Between the restaurants, theme park, midway, and casino you could spend days at this hotel and never run out of things to do! Since it is at the end of the strip, you don't have to deal with any of the traffic (there is a back road you can take right by Circus Circus to cut through the main strip spots). We'll definitely be back.

The experience was fairly decent, despite the LONG check-in line and no fridge in the room. The kicker however was the power-tripping security guard who would not let me communicate with my Mom or 88 y.o. Grandmother while I was holding my toddler since we were somewhere near a slot machine. Really, someone else can hold the baby?! Awful logic!

I'm a big kid. I don't gamble and I love games, so I love staying at circus circus. Even when I don't stay at circus circus I end up spending time at the midway anyway trying to win that gigantic spongebob or cookie monster (the cookie monster is currently sitting in my apartment). I also got my razor scooter from circus circus, how awesome is that??

I'll take Fascination (it's one of the midway games) over poker tables any day and it only costs a quarter per game!

The drawback is that my fiance loves Street Fighter arcades and he'd be glued to one looking for a challenge from another street fighter geek for an hour or so while I wandered around by myself. This is what I saw every time I came back to check on him.
                                                       __                                                       
  ~O                                                \_\/
     K        ==O                   C         =|
     \/\                                                 \/\
HADOUKEN!                   SONICBOOM!

I have no complaint about the hotel room either because who stays in the hotel room in Vegas?? You're supposed to be out and about anyway. You'll only be in the hotel room to get enough amount of sleep before you go out again. So CC's basic room is enough for me.
I wouldn't go for the buffet at CC though. Go to one of the more expensive ones such as bellagio or MGM.

p.s. Don't you DARE click on that private message link to tell me to grow up!
p.p.s. I KNOW I can't make ascii art worth shit. Shutup. If you play street fighter you'll recognize it.

I wish I could give no stars. I stayed here super Bowl Sunday and a big roach crawled out my pillow then I videotaped it I talk to the manager she was very cool but still that is disgusting I will never stay here again my towels were nasty the toilet was nasty and cigarette butts left in the room there was even a sock in the bed when we move the sheets wow for MGM to make so much money this is horrible.

Oh God....what a dump. Dont even think of staying here unless you have kids afflicted with ADHD and are forbidden to return to the other properties they've previously dismantled.

Lot's to see inside their Casino area. Circus type acts performed by people wearing sequined get ups. 

There's a particularly depressing aura of desperation amongst the gamblers in their seedy Casino. Lifers.

Their substandard buffet isn't worth the few bucks they charge for it. The food is flavorless and looks old. Their waitstaff seems even more clinically depressed than the lifers gambling away their pocket change in their sad Casino.

No fridge in the room, wet carpet. Bathroom smelled good like bleach. Very roomy. I think they track peoples wifi to each room because there's a wifi box in each room so unplug the wifi box to connect to someone elses room. Had a good sleep. The prices to eat in hotel suck especially the steak house. Look it up before going. Also be careful because the maids don't knock!

This place is sketch central. Out room was located in what seemed like a trailer park across the street from the main resort. It was so incredibly sketchy that it even had two signs with red font on the door saying "Make sure the door is locked at all times". The whole place is just dirty and trashy. Add another $50 a night and stay at the Paris for a normal Vegas experience.

Worst hotel stay ever!  Went here just st from r the adventure dome for my kids.  Only to find out it's only one en Thursday thru Sunday. We checked in Sunday night. My kids were so disappointed. We walked upstairs and were bombarded eveytine we walked up there by people trying to sell us a timeshare.  No coffee maker in rooms. Really ones are smelly and dirty. Food at the deli was horrible. Went there first r breakfast and found a thick black hair in my food. They didn't refund me or even apologies for that matter. The ship s close early and in en late!  Worst headache tel stay ever. I will not be back

Never stay here or with any property owned  by this company ever again! After thinking my room was paid for ( which only turned out to be a hold) they charged my account 1 month AFTER my stay. Causing my account to overdraft and leaves me fighting with my bank to forgive the overdraft charges. "An error with their systems " happened. That's nice but now I have a ton of overdrafts fees to fight.

And if took almost 3 days and 5 phone calls to get any answers. As the overdraft fees are piling up.

If you want a vacation that gives you a negative bank account go ahead and stay here. If not spend the extra money and go somewhere else.

Loved this hotel, I came here in January for my little sister cheer competition and we stayed at this hotel, everything was great, the rooms were clean and comfortable, the atmosphere was friendly, I loved the midway and adventure dome and the newly added Starbucks was a plus for me I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a family friendly Vegas experience

I am so embarrassed...I am a member of yelp and I didnt even bother to use yelp for reviews in circus circus before I booked a room. But I will sure use yelp to write a review on circus circus.

GHETTO!!!!! Its the same as it was when they built it. Just really sketchy. I felt very uncomfortable and didnt want tostay there. Room was yucky, bathtub didnt drain, toilet leaked, very outdated and an old box of baking soda outside the window.....hmm...and wierd carvings inside the desk drawer. They also had to use a sharpie pen to write the numbers on the elevators.

Oi....We left a day early and I will never stay there again.

Recently stayed here in summer 2010. Other people are right when they say this place is ghetto and rundown. The main people that live here are family's with children. Be prepared to have a bunch of kids running around when your inside this hotel. The only pro i can think of is this place is dirt cheap, only 20 something a night.

I have never experienced horrible, unacceptable service during any of my visits staying on the strip in Las Vegas. However, recently when me and my significant other booked a 2-night stay at Circus Circus, we were shocked by the way we were treated and antagonized after reporting that bugs were in our room. The day that we checked in was Wednesday, and we pretty much was only able to do dinner and rest for the remainder of the night since we were exhausted from traveling. The next morning my significant other woke up with (2) bumps on her forehead and (2) bites on her left arm-- the size of a penny. We headed down the strip to the LINQ for a arranged brunch at Chayo Mexican Lounge. We ordered and enjoyed the view, until we noticed that the bites started to increase in the sun, spread bigger and inflamed. Her arm and her face started to itch tremendously. We then concluded that it was a bug bite...we went back to the hotel where we gave a statement, they then gave us another room, not to mention the bell boy never came to transport our baggage and we had to do it ourselves. They took a statement and told us our clothes would be laundered.

My significant other was stuck in the room all night, and Circus Circus staff had nothing to offer her for treatment. They told us it's a CVS down the street, we didn't drive out so I had to walk about 3 blocks to Walgreens to pick up medical supplies to treat my significant other. We were stuck in the room all night while she itched and scratched as her bumps began to get more inflamed and bigger. At this point we were outraged at the amount of effort we were not seeing from Circus Circus to accommodate us. In the morning we called their risk management dept. and they first said they couldn't help us until the investigation was over which would probably be 2 days after we had left, which made no sense...they then told us we could get another day in the new room we had only if we paid 91$ , which was about the normal amount for a room according to the sites I checked the day before. They finally offered a 6pm checkout time on Friday, which made no sense, because we didn't know who would be checking in after us at 6pm. We accepted it because we lost out on all the events that were booked on Thursday night. 

We left and came back Friday at 5:20pm, and we are locked out of our room. We headed down to the front desk where we asked about our key cards, they said it had been de-magnetized, but my card and my significant others cards were nowhere near any magnetics at all. They reissued the cards; it's about 5:45 now and we have to rush to the room to pack. We're still waiting on the rest of the laundered clothes at this point, so we call countless people including supervisors, managers, security, everyone who should know something didn't know anything. We waited till about 6:25pm and finally got the bag that never got laundered at all from the manager himself. So we possibly could have taken bed bugs back to our home since they didn't take care of this situation...it's now Monday and we haven't heard anything from them since Friday! 

Better Business Bureau and Risk Management have both been contacted and we still haven't had no follow-up.

We stayed at the Circus Circus for days following the July 4th holkday. I specifically chose this hotel\/casino because our children were with us on vacation & it offered activities for them. 

GOOD - The price was great, even in the newer towers ($29\/night). However there was a "resort fee" added per night...but the cost was still not bad.
The Circus acts were GREAT. My kids really enjoyed seeing the acts. 
The Adventuresome was fun. With the discount coupon you receive on check-in the price is reasonable & the lines were not long at all so all day riding did not become all day waiting in line.
The rooms were really good considering the price. Don't expect the opulence of the bigger swankier hotels more centrally located on the strip.

NOT SO GOOD -
The advertise a "water park" which is actually 3 slides, 2 pools, a kiddie play area & a hot rub! Our local YMCA has a better "water park" than this. Although admission to the "water park" is included in your "resort fee" it was not exclusively for hotel guest. It was VERY crowded & although my sons were able to get in the pool, it was so congested that playing & swimming meant constantly bumping into on having others bump into you. The seats by the pool are "reserved" & cost $40...for a lounge chair!!

BAD - In the land of plentiful buffets & restaurants galore, the Circus Circus buffet was absolutely the WORSE I have experienced in Vegas. The options were limited & the food was not that tasty. The floors near the serve yourself drink station was sticky. Just bad all the way around.

My experience was terrible here! Rolled up in a mustang convertible only to find that where they put us was the motor lodge. Yeah, the motor lodge. This is the behind the trailer park dump. I ironed my bed and was scared to stay there. I was at the rio the night before and that was amazing. Should have stayed there. Let's just say being a delta sky miles member and having 100,000,000 sky miles, this is the only trip I was happy to leave all because of this hotel. The rest of the trip was awesome, don't get me wrong, not trying to be negative but come on! Circus Circus, You need to step up your game.

Aww, everyone is so harsh on Circus Circus!

I kind of like this seedy little place.  The location is great and I like the layout inside.  I highly recommend the Slots of Fun out back - pure gambling bliss at insanely cheap prices.  

The Adventuredome is great for kids, though last time I went I found it pretty lameo.  The carnival games area is the best though - first time I was here as a kid I won SO many stuffed animals that I had to give some away because I wouldn't have been able to get them all home on the plane.  

Anyway, when you go to Vegas you at least have to visit Circus Circus.  It's a Strip institution!

Ok you guys are either overly thinking of this place or not seeing it for what it is. Ive stayed in Circus Circus  twice. First time I was like 10 years old (25 right now) and it was in the manor rooms this was ok. Though i went there a lot every time i go to vegas.

2nd time was in June and the place has changed a bit room wise. I went for free through the MyVegas game on Facebook. Got a West Tower Room. The room was renovated clean with a flat screen. For people saying why pay for the resort fee. most hotels on the strip have them only way to get around them is with player comp which i use for my other times in Vegas.  The check in was fast as i had a comp card that had its own line.

To get back onto the room yes I know I got in for free but I did check the room to see what bargain I was getting. The rooms for the price are great for a Sunday-Thursday at about $30 is a great deal. Yes its far from the strip but just use the bus( quick tip if you buy your day pass from a local bus its only $5 not $7 like the deuce) Yes you can pay more for luxury and so on but come on if your in Vegas the room is only for some certain things, sleep, shower, hold your stuff. Not going to lie when I have comp i get the best room I can get but who doesn't.

The resort is what it is its made for children and people not really into gambling. yes it has its stuff but this place is a budget resort. The pool is for kids no adult partying in this place, but you can get to most hotel's pools now if you pay. The food is alright its not great. I would just make the short trip to Wynn\/Encore for better food. Adventuredome needs new rides it had the same stuff when i was a kid i only went there to not waste the free coupon.  

Conclusion. If you are looking something close to the strip to just walk this place is not really for you but as I said their are ways to get there for cheap. The room is what it is great value for a nice room. You get what you pay for but just remember all you need in Vegas is that room to have fun with. gambling dining clubbing are what your there for anyways. So why not save on the room to get more money for that.  yes there is a $10 a night resort fee but thats cheap the nice hotels charge $15-20. Just remember if you have a chance in vegas get every casinos comp card it will save you headaches they charge the cheapest online and usually wave the fees. 3rd party website are only good for non gambling casinos.

hoped this helps ignore the 1 star reviews they were looking for luxury while paying the price for regular. Of course your going to get that. Thats why the expensive hotels cost that much.

This review is for the adventure dome only.

I never knew Circus Circus had a carnival like area, (but I should have guess from the name of the hotel...) until my bf took me here. I'm not sure how much rides are because everything was closing or closed when we arrived at 5:45 on a weekday. They have a bunch of booths set up just like a carnival! I saw some water shooting games, darts, ball throws, basketball tosses, etc. They have lasertag and I think mini golf as well. If you have small kids I think they would really enjoy the Adventure Dome. 

We walked through the casino and went upstairs to more games and had a lot of fun. Its a good place for a date, kind of reminds me of Dave N Busters or Game Works back in CA. Casino was ok, nothing that stood out to me. We did end up playing some roulette.

G.H.E.T.T.O.

Sadly, this was the 1st place in Vegas that I drank at after I turned 21 when I went on a road trip to Vegas the weekend after my 21st birthday on Labor Day weekend.  Drank at some bar on the 2nd floor while watching a college football game and waiting for my family to be done in the carnival game room.  Got carded and everything.  Hoorah!

Played some games, won some prizes, gave some to my future gf (now ex) when I got back home, and gave the rest to my little sister.

That new mini-amusement park they added here that they charge admission to is HELLA GHETTO!  Makes this Circus Circus more ghetto than the one up in Reno.

This place is really run down and old like some of the older Las Vegas hotels that are still around.

There's no point in coming to this Circus Circus in Vegas unless you have kids and had to bring them with you to Vegas.

This review is solely on just my visit for a small half hour.... I did not stay here
Went here because I thought, hey... Circus Circus .. a place for little kids to have fun? uh NO... no no no

I walked in, eww.... and then I walked the hell out... this is what I saw... 

Bathroom, some lady laying on the floor, in her stall, with her head in the toilet??? WTF

Just a bunch of vendors... some mega dome with carnival rides in it... 
dark, dingy... kinda sad... not what it used to be...

This hotel is ok. Cheap rates are great, but the hotel is FULL of children. Had we know it was a kid friendly hotel we would NOT have stayed. Room was ok. Clean and spacious. The Motor Manor rooms advertised are not on property. Stay on casino property. We asked for the upgrade to stay on site... It was only 20 more. It's worth it!

I and my family stayed here last month during my weekend in Vegas! I like how this one has 2 swimming pools, unlike the one in Reno, which doesn't even have one swimming pool. We had to walk next door to the Silver Legacy to go swimming when we stayed at that one years ago!  The rooms have tons of AC, which helped keep me cool during hot nights. The beds and pillows were comfortable! The only complaint I have is roaches! I was changing in the bathroom when I saw a cockroach crawling up the shower walls. Also my sister claimed that she saw and killed 2 earlier that day! This place should be exterminated!

So when I booked this room, I wasn't really for sure if I made a wise decision.   So we arrived, and got checked in.  We had a room with 2 queen size beds.  The room was bigger than what I thought it was going to be, I didn't feel we were on top of one another.  It was clean.  My kids enjoyed the Adventure dome, the Midway and the pool.  My only complaint is about the pool.  I understand that they dont' want you to bring in your own food and drink to a degree.  But it's over a 100 degrees out and they won't even let you bring your own bottle watered in.  Uhhh then could you please not charge $4 a bottle.  The slides were good, even though they closed them down at 6.  If you are looking for a quiet romantic place to stay.  This place is not it.  It' is definitely geared towards family!   I would stay here again.  It is also walking distance to some good food places.!

This review is only for the margaritas that we enjoyed both times we were in vegas.
The first time a few years back was before the extensive inside renovation which highly confused us this time.
We had remembered walking straight back to a huge bar with 99 cent oversized margaritas.
Yes that right, sompaired to other that charge upto $30!
Now we wandered through the endless maze of Circus Circus not knowing where we were going, everything was newer, bigger, better!
Finally we found a new margarita bar (by the left side of the entrance) and got the super kitchy yard long margaritas on a sling and mixed tropical mango and strawberry lemonade margaita for a yard long drink for two while we explored the strip.
Only in Vegas baby, only in Vegas........................

Nothing's changed. My parents used to take me and my sisters here when we were younger and we'd spend hours and hours here playing games and trying to win useless prizes.

Came here with my family and brought my nephews here- they enjoyed it. Mostly cus there's no other place in Vegas as kid friendly as this place- that's why I'm giving it 3 stars. It would be 2 if we had more options. The boys enjoyed it- so that's all that mattered. 

If not for the kids- I probably wouldn't be there.

I have not stayed here, this is for the Bar\/Casino. My friends and I wandered over to this end of the strip and pulled an all nighter. I ended up sitting down at one of the bars that is right near the beer pong tables and casino cashier to play some video poker while my husband and 2 other friends wandered around elsewhere in the casino. So anyways I ask the bartender for some change so I can tip him, since I only had a 20 and he told me he couldn't give change, it is a policy but that the cashier was over to my right and I could get change from them. The problem was that I was by myself, had money in the video poker machine, and a drink...I was not about to leave it alone at 2am with the trashed people playing beer pong behind me. What upset me even more about the whole situation was that one of the managers was behind the bar helping out the bar tender because he was new-so when I had asked for change he said let me ask my manager, and then his manager told him the BS policy, and talked about me like I wasn't 2 feet away from him, didn't have the courtesy to acknowledge that I was even there , "She can go to the cashier, its right there" That is just rude! Especially since I was obviously spending my money at that bar, and would have stayed longer had the manager not been such an asshole!
Anyways so I cashed out of the video poker and went to find my friends because I was getting hungry. They were hungry too so we tried to find some food in Circus Circus...the only food they claimed that was open at that time of night (2-3am) was their crappy appetizers from another bar in the casino. We asked if there were any restaurants near by, or any open ones in any of the nearby hotels, they said no. 3 of 4 of us decided to just order some of the appetizers they offered. We got the sliders which were surprisingly tasty and then some sort of artichoke dip that was just meh. Then we headed across the street to the Riviera, where my husband found am Irish type pub with a full menu open 24hours. He had a nice chicken and mushroom pot pie. I was pissed. LOL
So the consensus is that while the casino is fun and there is a few choices of things to do, the people who work their are morons and not very helpful.

Paid a month and a half early through online reservation for sat. Feb 14, 2015. Chose to get a groupon deal for Friday 13, 2015 a week and a half before the actual day to check in because we changed our minds at the last minute. Valet parking wa full Friday all of the way til check out Sunday. Parking lots were full as well. We got contact high from just the driveway unloading our bags. The checkin lady helped combine the two nights so we didn't have to check out Saturday only to check back in--That was nice. She took our resort fees for the weekend, because our room was paid in full online. We left our 12 year old in the room for about 45 minutes, come back and she is asking why our bathroom smells funny? It smells like Pot! We complained and we were told that it was fine cause the neighbors were checking out Saturday anyway. Unbelievable! So Saturday our son comes over with us after the Tae KwonDo tournament, we give him some gifts to take home. the maid service has gone through the gifts and set up a little scene with three items. We didn't get it. Anyway we move on with pathetic story, Saturday evening around 7pm we have a power outage in circus circus for about 30 minutes!. After that our tv doesn't work until checkout the next day! They had plenty of excuses when we called them, but no remedies. I go to checkout, the lady acts like she is 007 and has caught us in a national lie! We had 4 adults in our room, yes you are right I tell her and  That's what I paid for! Back when I paid 220.00! Online for one night at this hell whole! She tells me it's 15.00 per adult per night and they charge 385.00 for the stinky, nasty, room we stayed in. She lied and told me my credit card had been denied when they tried to charge it for the correct fees. And back to the little scene the maids set up. That had to be their little way of letting us know they were watching us. They went through our personal belongings to drop little hints at what they are doing when we are not there. They are counting what they assume are bodies in the room, when we are not in the room. That place is untrustworthy from the front desk to security! What a NIGHTMARE!  If I could give it less than a star I would
Anna

My husband and I wanted to take our daughter to Circus Circus while she was off for winter break. We had an awesome time!!! My expectations were really low because of all the yelp bad reviews but was amazed. A lot of fun games for kids and adults at the midway and we enjoyed 3 circus type shows for free :) Here are some tips but first... is you like glam and wow DO NOT stay here and DO NOT compare Circus Circus to the other casinos ... each casino is different for a reason. I strongly recommend Circus Circus for families visiting Las Vegas. Keep in mind they do have a resort fee but internet is included, $ 9.95 per night. READ READ before you book any room!! This is stated on their website btw. 

Tips:

1. Before you visit casino\/hotel look at the casino\/hotel layout and that way you will know where everything is! ( they have a map\/layout of casino on their website) or you can just google it.

2. STAY AWAY manor building. Its an old motel across the street from the casino..it's a walk! and that's why it's so cheap. Duh!

3. We stayed in the main casino tower and our room was remodeled , nice flat screen tv and our room was BIG and CLEAN. This tower was quiet and we never had to wait for an elevator. Also we were closer to the MIDWAY. Stay here :) the west tower in more crowded so if you want fun and want a quiet room stay at the casino tower.

We arrived here on Monday, 4\/1\/13. Check-in lines were long, but the line shrunk quickly. We're staying in the 3rd building (C). The decor is nice, they have big rooms. Our fridge wasn't working, but we got it fixed. Wish the bathroom was bigger. Beds are comfortable, and big. I'm giving this place 4 stars, not 5, because on our first night. We called at 8, and asked for 3 pillows. It was about 9:15, and we called again. They said they were on their way. At 11, they FINALLY arrive with TWO pillows. Wow. But, the Pizzera is DELICIOUS! I highly reccomend this place.

This review is based on time spent at the Adventure Dome and Midway.

My wife and I love arcades and games, and we had some good fun at Midway and Adventure Dome. I love seeing her happy, so that really made the night for me. There's a good variety of games available and most of them were open. A few were out of tickets, but I think that's pretty common in a high-traffic arcade.

There were a lot of flashing lights, which bothered me as an epileptic. Also, the place felt dingy and smelled a little gross (which seems to be a standard for anything in Vegas that doubles as a casino).

The circus acts were short but pretty neat. It was fun to watch, especially when we felt tired and needed to sit down. There was also this little booth where this woman made word art signs right in front of you. Easily our favorite souvenir of the entire vacation.
