We didn't stay at the hotel but we did visit the casino and game-room. It is a pretty awesome casino\/fun world. They had all the latest slot machines! They had a very diverse selection of slots. We stayed an hour and half but I felt like we barely scratched the surface of what this place has to offer. This place has it all. I will consider staying here on our next vacation.

Whenever you talk to someone who stayed at Circus Circus and you ask them how it was they almost always say "Oh,it wasn't really that bad". I've known three different people who stayed here at one time or another and all three gave me the same answer "Oh,it wasn't really that bad". Then they'd say "Well,the food was not good,and the casino was packed with all kinds of fat disgusting people,and bratty kids running around loose,and the circus acts were no big deal,and the place was filthy,and the food was lousy--did I mention the food? But,overall,it  wasn't really that bad".  If you want a cheap place to stay and you don't mind bad food and fat disgusting people,I guess it's not really that bad.

Could be the worst place in vegas and that's saying something !!! Terrible
Service expensive food and nobody can explain the wifi service. Called tech support and had to leave a message. WTH

A couple of years ago I went to Vegas with my California cousins.  It was my first trip, but like most Californians, my cousins are Vegas experts.  They knew everywhere to go and the best places to see.  I had such a great time that I came back and told my friends all about it.  They made me promise to go to Vegas with them.  I glibly agreed.

When it came time to plan the trip they asked my advice about where to stay.  I told them a few nice places on the strip.  Then when it came time to book the flight my friend saw a flight+hotel deal that she thought was too good to pass up.  The hotel was Circus Circus.  She asked my opinion and I told her that this is the one place that I know to avoid.  She didn't take my advice and we ended up staying at Circus Virus...I mean Circus Circus.

I assume that most people stay here either because they have children or because it is cheap.  If you have children, this is an okay place to stay because it is away from the flashy sin on the strip and they have carnival games and a McDonalds on location.  

However, if you stay here trying to save money, you have made a mistake.  There are plenty of good deals to stay at NICE places on the strip.  Staying at Circus Circus forces you to take cabs to get everywhere.  When you stay on the strip you can walk to everywhere that you want to go.

When you walk into Circus Circus you see the vestiges of the great hotel that it used to be.  I am sure that when it opened it was thought to be fabulous.  However, compared to the other hotels that are on the strip it looks shabby, worn down, and kind of sad.

This place is so gnarly... and creepy.. like a Pedo Convention.

Nothing at all like I remember as a kid.
Also strange: Police convention?  Officers with guns, tasers, batons and..... Trophies.  ?!?!?

The inside smells like a sweaty man's gooch after a 3 day hike in a humid forest.. without a shower.

People were huddled in groups with luggage... inside the lobby for no apparent reason?

No thank you.

Horrible . I was planning a trip to Vegas with my little one and we have never stayed at Circus circus . I read the reviews and was aware of not to expect a spectacular experience . I only decided to stay here because of Adventuredome and the Midway Mania. I felt the rooms couldn't be THAT horrible . I could deal with mediocre . But this was just bad all around .

Room: Upgrades to a Casino Tower Room. They were decent looking as you walked in until you saw the stains on the sheets . There were pieces of trash in the back of the head board . And the toilet wouldn't flush . We had to call maintenance for assistance . Overall, the room was ehhh. 

Price : We paid about $90 per night which is not much but on average this hotel is $25 per night . There was a $70 per night plus a $17 additional charge per night that I requested for an "upgrade "  to the best quality room. ( casino tower ). I was better off staying somewhere kid friendly off the strip . 

Environment : Not as kid friendly as I thought it should be. People looked sketchy here , I didn't feel comfortable . The people hired to work here , you can tell don't really care about making this about the kids . Overall disappointment . You are the only casino to have the opportunity to make this about the kids ! And you fall way short .

Pool: the worst part . My daughter loves the water and enjoys pools. Within 20 minutes , the lifeguards yelled at everyone to exit the pool. It seemed urgent . We really had no idea what was going on, until swimmers began saying there was poop in the water ! GROSS. The worst part is that within 10 minutes they allowed everyone back into the water. No drainage . Nothing. I didn't even see if there was any type of solution. That's when we grabbed our stuff and left immediately .


Overall, Never again. Not worth trying . I simply stayed here for my daughter and it ended up being a nightmare. Better off staying somewhere much nicer and taking a drive to the Adventuredome.

DONT STAY HERE!

Really disappointed with Circus Circus. I have great memories of this place from when I was an out of control kid. And then from my 21st birthday. But when we came here again, I was shocked. It was filthy, crowded, run down and embarassing. The circus shows weren't even close to what they used to be. It needs a rehaul or to be razed.

Regardless of what people say about location, CC is one of the best values on the Strip.  You can get a room for as little as 50 bucks and buffet for 10 bucks.  The pay outs aren't bad and the adventure dome is really FUN!  

FYI - there are 4 new developments going in around CC.  So this part of the Strip will be happening within the next 2 years.

Checked 1:00 am at Circus Circus, I supposed to take a shower and go to bed right away after a long hours drive. However, I surprised to find that the "new" room is actually dirty. It's just seems like someone left his room and a whole housing service. I called the front desk. The front desk transferred me to a supervisor, I waited for a couple of mins, no one respond, I hung up and called the front desk again. Then I finally talked to a fat white woman supervisor. I told her u don't need to apologize, u r just a supervisor, u r not responsible for cleaning the room. It's ur staff's fault who didn't clean the room. But since this is ur hotel's fault. I need refund. She only says she could change me to a clean room, but she said I booked on Expedia.com, I can't get back my money, neither reservation, nor resort fee. I was tired and sleepy and also frustrated cuz it was almost 3 am in the morning and I was given a disgusting room and I walked a long way from self parking to lobby front desk 2 times which cost me 10-15 mins walking each direction. I insist it's hotel's fault, I deserve my money back and 3 days' free stay. The fat white woman just say NO and called the security and forced my friend and I to leave. I never use any single dirty word, nor did I insult her. I was just insisting my rights and hotel's fault. The fat white woman just refused to admit it and refused to refund me anything. Now it's almost 4 am. I walked across street to Rivera Hotel, however all the rooms r full. Now My friend and I have no where to go, we r freaking tired, sleepy and frustrated. I will sue Circus Circus in court for my legal rights! Tips: never ever book any room in Circus Circus, lousy management, bad staff, unreasonable people. I bet Circus Circus is the only bad hotel on strip. Just don't book this hotel no matter how cheap it is. U will feel sorry for ur money spent on Circus Circus even a cent.

We came to this hotel because we were so fixated on the pink dome attached to it.  We had also heard that it had actual free circus acts so we decided to go give it a try.  At first glance the casino seems very dingy.  I do not think they have good ventilation as this casino had the worst smell of smoke that literally brought tears to my eyes.  The circus acts were entertaining but dont expect Barnum and Bailey.  We didnt have time to venture into the adventure park but based on what we experienced, there are better Casinos to visit.

If you're thinking about bringing the family along (I'm talking about kids of all ages), then this would probably be the most "appropriate" hotel to stay in.

Number 1, the hotel doesn't have a night club or anything. It does have a restaurant\/bar called The Garden Grill which is pretty much the only place in the hotel that I recommend. They also serve drinks in the casino. The casino is relatively small compared to other 3-star hotels but like I said, the hotel is child-friendly. The rooms are nice, though, especially for a 3-star. But they only give you 2 very very small bars of soap and 2 very very tiny shampoo bottles.

The staff is nice, I'll give them that. I'm not saying that the hotel sucks but I wouldn't say it's awesome either. So since I didn't go to Vegas with a family of four, I'll give this hotel a 2.

GHETTO. Dingy, dark, and low ceilings with annoying kids running around everywhere. Didn't stay here by choice, and I didn't come to Vegas to listen to screaming and whining kids all day. 

Rooms didn't have shower caps and couldn't get hold of front desk. The fitness rooms has little kids playing on the machines and people walking on the treadmills in socks. Pool? what pool? 

Only pluses is that it was cheap (~$150 for 3 nights over holidays), rooms were big, and close to encore and wynn. But it was still about a 10 min walk to encore. 

Stay somewhere else if you can afford it.

After having wait 45 minutes to check in I finally made it to my room. It was like one of those old run down hotels out in the middle of nowhere! Ice maker was broke, bed was hard and very uncomfortable, buffet was HORRIBLE! I wouldn't stay here again if it was free!

Like most Yelpers, I've also been brought here as a kid, since there were and still are hardly any casinos in Sin City that cater to the young'uns.  Unfortunately, the renovations didn't do any good, because the place still looks and smells really old!  Where should I start?  The old air conditioners didn't make the room cold.  The bathroom sink had a loose faucet knob, while there was some rusted metal sticking out of the walls of the shower.  Even the free toiletries seemed old, because they didn't really lather up when you used them!  Cheap stuff!  I had written a note requesting for an extra pillow and an extra plastic bag for clothes on the back of the house keeping card.  However, the housekeeper didn't do either!  She put the card back on the table and just took the tip we left for her!  Stupid biatch!  The carpeting all over the place looked old, too, and should be replaced!  The parking structure was dirty and could use some serious water blasting!  To think they spent over $100 million in renovations . . . I don't see it!  I'd give this place 1 star, but since it's the only joint that caters to the young'uns, I added another star.  Sin City definitely needs another hotel-casino for kids, so that the added competition can give Circus Circus a serious run for their money!  Word to the wise: Try not to go during Spring Break, Christmas Break, or any other break when the kids are out, because the place is too dang cronowded!

Maybe we just got very lucky, but our stay here was excellent and I have no real complaints. Let me say that I have very high standards when it comes to the cleanliness and safety of hotels, and I still found Circus Circus to be fantastic.

Our room was spotless, and cleaned and maintained brilliantly by the housekeeping staff. The bed was really comfortable, there was lots of storage space, the bathroom was big and came with lots of clean towels, shampoo, soap, etc. A coffee machine, hairdryer and two safes were also provided. The air conditioning worked perfectly (albeit loudly) and with 40degrees heat outside, this was hugely important.

The hotel in general, like most Vegas hotels, was like a city in itself. In addition to the casino, there was a huge variety of restaurants, shops and bars within the hotel, as well as an oxygen bar, a kids theme park and of course the obligatory wedding chapel. We didn't use the pool or gym, but it was nice having those options on hand.

There's a lovely McDonalds (seriously, really clean and the nicest staff ever) and a Subway right outside. 

Yes, the hotel is a bit of a walk from the main strip (30-45 mins based on how fast you can walk in the heat) but really, that's obvious from looking at a map. You can't book a hotel and then complain about the location afterwards.

I had no problem with any of the other guests whatsoever. At the end of the day, you're in Las Vegas, if the sight of drunk young people or old people smoking at casinos bothers you, you've come to the wrong city. (For the record, there was very few of either of these examples in Circus Circus)

Only complaint was that we waited in line 25 minutes after check in just to get into an elevator! I realise that at peak tourist season at check in time there will always be lines, but I've never encountered such a long line in any other hotel just to get an elevator.

It's not the most luxurious hotel in Vegas by any means but unless I become a millionaire between now and my next trip to Vegas, I would happily stay here again.

Great hotel for fun vacation with kids.   Only reason I didn't give five stars is carpet in room was in poor condition and we had to have room keys remade at least six times in two days.   Day one kids had a blast in the midway while we played in casino below.   Day two they spent all day riding rides in the adventure dome.   Spent a lot at the midway, but they all came away with bags of stuffed animals.   Day two was great.  $23 for all day access.   They give you a book of coupons that come in handy.   Food was good.  Highly recommend for families.
Awesome experience...no complaints...ok no refrigerator in the rooms but there are tons of places to eat, drink and be merry in this place! Love it!

To be fair, I don't have kids, and don't like them in big groups.  We stayed here for a short stint during the CineVegas Film Festival.  It's grimy.  It's gross.  I didn't want to touch anything, and I'm not one of those "germ people."

The room we booked ended up being in this weird offset barracks area instead of being attached to the main hotel.  It was a hike just to get to the strip.

I played poker here with a bunch of degenerates and every day gamblers.  I won $35, which was nice.

The one shining star: There's a taco place in the food court, which had cheap and good food.  Nothing amazing, but they actually made their carnitas there.

If you MUST bring your kids to Vegas, this might be a good place to stay--there were tons of kids there.  But Vegas with the kids?  Really?  Are you sure that's a good idea?  How about ANYWHERE ELSE?!  Or leave them at Grandma's.

Circus Circus.  More like 'I Didn't Like-cus it There-cus.'

NEVER EVER go here please!!!!!! I read the yelps and was like it's only a room we got a good deal we really won't even be in the room. I regret ever ever saying that. This was my husbands and I first time in Vegas and unfortunately just because of experience here we never want to come back again!!! We check in go into our room and there's a blood stain on the ceiling, walls, chair it looks like someone was murdered in our room! Then you go into the bathroom there was mold everywhere!!! So we decided to go down to the lobby to complain. We get attacked by the time share people. They tell us to go on the tour we get free stuff so we had nothing to do so they said put $40 down you'll get it back after the tour. They said wait here for the shuttle so we waited shuttle was full they said we are gonna go in a cab we will give you the cash. We are about to go in the cab and they say sorry we don't have cash can you pay for it and we will reimburse you. Hell no! We said no we have no cash and all of a sudden cash appeared. We go on the tour they said no more than two hours...4 hour laters. We still don't have our $40 back and we are pissed. We head back to the hotel and I speak to the manager we get upgraded to another room. This one was a tiny bit better. So now it's about 4pm and we are starving we wanted just burger and wings we found a restaurant we go down to the lobby they aren't open when the Mexican restaurant is open WTF!!! I don't want Mexican!!! So we get an auntie Anne's pretzel for breakfast and lunch. We went to a comedy show NOT HERE! Had a great time headed back to the hotel decided we would gamble a bit and go to bed. My husband was playing black jack I decided to go to the bar and get a drink. I kid you not there was cockroaches all over the floor and bar people were screaming. PLEASE do you self a favor and spent the extra couple of dollars and go to a better hotel!!!  Only giving one star cause I think I had too.

It's an inexpensive yet decent hotel. It's huge! I was pleasantly surprised by it. It's a little outdated but it's still nice. It's one of the original Vegas hotels, so I can appreciate the history there. Our toilet backed up and we had to switch rooms, which was disappointing, but overall, it was a good stay. The buffet was pretty good as well.

*(My Circus Circus Nightmares)* 
Worst place to stay in Vegas! 
They just don't care! 
We made a reservation because my daughter had Cheer Nationals in Vegas and we thought this place maybe a kid friendly environment which it was geared toward kids with the Adventure dome and such. When we arrived first thing out of the car I noticed the awful stench of rotten trash in the over crowded parking structure and figured well that's Vegas baby. Oh no as we waited in line to check in I observed the walks of life this place attracted and the dirt caked on the carpet. In my mind I was thinking this is already not where I wanted to stay, but it was midnight and we needed to get some rest after a 4hr trip turned into 6 hrs. due to a fatal accident on the way in. As our turn came to check in we were greeted by a lady and she looked up our reservation as it was brought up we noticed the charges did not match what we booked. Hotel taxes and room rates were increased only a few dollars but that wasn't the point. The point was it was inaccurate! Well we were tired and just wanted to hit the sack so we paid and were going to deal with the issue at check out. The lady hands us our cards gets a map and write floor 5 and room 099 and directs us on the map how to find the room. So we proceed to follow the instructions. While trying to locate the room carrying bags of luggage and dragging two kids around for a 1\/2 hr. we were unsuccessful locating such a room on the 5th floor of 099. Mad as hell as we walked back to the check in I slipped on a flight of stairs that had a plastic edge wearing flip flops and landed flat on my back. Writhing in pain for about 10 Min's. not one person even security walked over to me and asked if I was OK! And yes they saw! Finally making it to check out tired and in pain we asked to speak to the night manager. We explained out situation to him and asked what can he do for us. This guy was a young little punk with and attitude and should never of been put in a position as a manager. He did nothing but offer a extended check out time from 10 a.m. up to 1 p.m. OH YAY GEE thanks! So he resets our room cards and tells us floor 9 and the room number. After 10 Min's. we arrive finally. The room was a standard 2 queen beds and didn't appear all that bad comparable to a Motel 6. 
Morning arrives and is my daughters big day. We hop in the shower and first thing we notice was black mildew all along tub\/shower line wall OMG REALLY! I have pictures of this gross and unhealthful environment. In horror and getting out of the shower I grab a bath towel again notice a problem not so much for me but my other half. They only provided 4 bath towels, Zero hand towels and Zero wash cloths. Running down a maid service problem was fixed but the point was these things should of been taken care of before hand. The entire day we were at the competition and visiting around town. We ate dinner at The Garden Grill in the Hotel before we went back to our room. Another horrible experience in itself. We were seated in a booth that the backrest of was loose and coming apart with on the other side a larger man was seated and every time he sat back it popped the backrest approx. 6" into my other half's backside violently. So we decided to relocate and mention it to the waitress. After that we heard the words chingada being used as she conversed with another waitress about us. We did not arrive back to the room until midnight and just went to bed. The next morning we packed up and wanted to get out of there. I think with our experiences we were just done with this place and decided to get one last shower before check out. The hell continues as my lady steps out of the shower I hear Oh MY GOD EWWWWWEEEE! I was thinking holy crude what now!!! Yes ladies and gentlemen when you thought this couldn't get worse well it did! She almost stepped on a cockroach getting out of the shower!!! Unbelievable!!! I scooped it up in a cup and wrapped it in the plastic trash bag to take to the check out lady. We finished and went to check out. I calmly handed the lady the plastic bag with the cockroach in it and asked in a very loud voice "Would you be willing to pay for a room that had these in it" She responded by setting the bag in the trash by her desk and said no in a hushed voice. We proceeded to tell her about our problems in detail and show her our photos. We asked what are you willing to do for us? She replied the best we can do for you is credit 1\/2 a days stay and all the hotel taxes. Again we were unhappy and were tempted to dispute charges. 
We promised the kids we would take them to the Adventure Dome for some fun. This is how they get 1 Star! Now this part was geared for kids and have to admit I even had a bit of fun on the rides. We bought a unlimited day pass which was reasonably priced. And have to mention the had some very talented artist where you can get a cartoon, life like portrait hand drawn or a miniature clay face scul
This hotel needs major renovations. There aren't great places to eat here. It's only good for kids but I'd never stay here again. My room smelled of weed.

Very typical Vegas--I got a deal on Hotels.com for $119 for 1 night in one of the "Motor" buildings. It was a little trashy (some peeling paint and a worn out comforter), but it was totally what I expected. When booking a room, definitely find a deal and don't pay full price! Beware that there are multiple buildings with rooms, some farther from the casino than others.

This is the worst hotel ever. You think it's cheap the second that u book this hotel, you made a mistake. I stay only 1 night (thanks god) building C. All the kids are running through the hallway until midnight. Now is 1:30am in the morning. Everybody take the chair out and sit in front of the room chitchat. The wall is like a paper. I can hear things from the room left and right and children running above me. I cant sleep. Im not going to come back. Not in this life but if u dont want to sleep all day and night I would recommend this hotel.

Not bad. Not bad. 

I stayed here the past weekend with a group of friends for $89\/night.  The room is pretty similar to a motel room but it was pretty clean and decently spacious. The staff is friendly and the housekeeping has quick service. 

We stayed in the manor buildings which are just across the street from the main hotel and casino.  We didn't really mind since the rooms are cheaper and it's just a 2 minute walk.  Also, there is a separate pool just for all the manor buildings too.  I enjoyed staying at the manor rooms because it seemed a lot less crowded even though I know all the rooms are booked as well. 

Make sure you make use of you coupon book!  There's lot's of good coupons like free rides at the Adventure dome and free drinks at the bar! And free wi-fi!  :)

The hotel and the room itself are clean and the staff is friendly. Parking in the old garages is a nightmare, especially if you drive a larger vehicle. Also, if you stay in the Skyrise Tower make sure your room doesn't face the Adventure Dome or you will have a lot of noise until late at night.

This is the worst casino under MGM Resorts Int'l name. It's time for the executive board come to terms of reality and sell this property. It's ghetto and trashy. Walking in looks like a flea market from North Las Vegas. Slots of fun looks like no fun. My experience today never improved from the last time I have this property a bad review. Message to MGM best way to improve this property is to sell, sell, sell!

Bottom line:  Older, dirty Casino.  Also, don't expect any of the gaming to pay.  The machines have been programmed so tight they do not even give back any money to continue play.  I saw people shaking their heads the entire night....
The price for the hotel for a night was good.  The staff was very friendly and the room wasn't too bad.

Highly recommend a room above the casino.  They are recently remodeled and much better than i ever anticipated! We normally stay at Paris or TI but the rates for this particular week were outrageous. It was a little farther down the strip but grab the bus ($20\/3 days) or walk. LOVED our stay!

I've slept in this hotel 3 times.  My first time as a child.  I had great memories of coming here with my family, watching the free shows, playing at the midway, at riding the rides at the adventuredome.

 The second time, I decided to stay here again when I was the legal gambling age and drinking age.  I barely slept  in our room.  I managed to stay awake with minimal naps, redbull, candy, Krispy Kreme and coffee.  We stayed above the casino and the room was remodeled.  The beds were comfy.  We had a nice view of the strip.  Great pressure in the shower and the hot water maintained.  I don't smoke, neither my husband, so when we were in the casino the ventilation wasn't that good.  But they didn't pass the law in Hawaii yet (no smoking in restaurant, indoors, smoking has to be 20 ft. from any building etc.) so it was bearable.  

For my most recent stay, I traveled with my family and my parents. We stayed here for six days. My oldest child is 8 and my youngest is 17 months.  We stayed in the manor lodge.  It's the farthest away from the casino, about half a block.  There is an indoor bridge that helps you get there in a few minutes.   Parking is located in front or in back of the building. 

There is no smoking allowed in the manor lodge that we stayed at.  The room was a decent size.  We got two queen size beds, which were nice and comfy. There is NO refrigerator, but a cooler instead.  There is No microwave.  We were on the ground floor and it was pretty quite through our whole stay.  The wall paper was peeling a bit, but that didn't bother my family.  We had a bathtub, good shower pressure, and it stayed hot through out my shower.  However, when I turned it up to a certain degree you could hear the pipes banging each other.  This also happened to the other room near us.  But I could only hear it when I was in the bathroom.  

The room had a decent flat screen  tv that showed about 20 channels.  Two of it had children shows.  It had a safe but you had to pay to use it each time.  The housekeeper came around at 9:30 am.  

I didn't realize on my last two stays but they have 2 outdoor pools.  Its underneath the bridge and closest to manor lodge.  Everyday it was filled with families.  We didn't use it because the heat was just to unbearable for me.  My oldest son asked a few times, but I offered to go to the midway instead.

The Casino:  
The ventilation has improved, but at certain times you can smell the smoke. Servers would come periodically any time of the day and offered drinks.  Security is pretty on it in ensuring your kids are just passing through and not watching you gamble.  

Midway:
Circus Circus has the world's largest permanent indoor Circus.  There's a good assorment of games that you would find at the carnival.  About 200 according to our hotel pamphlet.  They also have a good amount of arcade games.  There are a few games where your child will win no matter what, as long as there under 12.  Thre are also FREE cirucus acts almost every hour.  We watched about 5 acts and there were all worth your time. C'mon, it's FREE.  At Midway they have a McDonald's in the area and a spinning carousel type of snack area that sells hot dogs, gelato and other carnival type of snacks.   

The Adventuresome Theme Park:  
If you have kids 12 and under make sure to stop at the Adventure Dome.  Check out my review for this place:
http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz\/adventuredome-theme-park-las-vegas-3#hrid:F3kRusbgHZLXHz3KDUO5tg

I know I go against the grain of the other Yelp reviews.  You get what you pay for and for the price.  I believe it met my expectations.

I was trying to plan a vacation, and stay here. I called asked for a nice room, was told since I don't have a players card with them I was only allowed to have a standard room. I remember coming here for over 30 years, I never have thought, I would be told I can't stay at a hotel. Thank You Rhonda! Your service on the phone made it clear I can't stay here. What Great Customer Service! Zero star if I could.

We stayed in the manor motor lodge. It is really far away from the actual circus circus building and you are not on the strip at all. Try to stay in the casino tower for sure. The motor lodge smells terrible in the hallways. And its a really long walk to any of the food places inside circus circus. i definitely would not recommend staying in the manor. It does get two star though because the room is actually quite nice.

We don't need the Bellagio, CC is just fine.

    The buffet, unfortunately,   is underwhelming.

    Because the crowds are sparse, idiots are using hardened nails or something to scratch mirrors and stainless steel elevator doors.

    The room was pretty good, decent TV, it sat in a monstrous wood thing.  Room seemed fairly recently remodelled, no worn carpet or anything, no complaints.  It was stuffy when we first got to the room because of the "green" ac\/ heater \/ air circulator that won't go on until it senses motion ( unless overridden ).  That is stupid  IMHO.  First impressions count.

    The trapeze act I saw was impressive.  I was playing slots on on the floor, and the way they have it arranged, there were bleacher seats above me for the families, but I could see the show from a level below.  They were very talented, but had sort of a "mail it in" feel, because the crowds were sparse.  They were also easy on the eyes.

    Payout percentages on slots seemed OK.  I was up but of course started betting more with "house money" and gave it back.

    Number of drink hostesses was OK, especially " Marilyn", on duty Friday early, she was a gem.  Full bottles of beer, real sized bar drinks.

Housekeeping staff very polite and helpful as we're front desk and information counter. Info counter Google nearest b of a ATM and gave me a map highlighting the route. Many bike security guards throughout property. Had a beautiful suite room with flat screen, microwave and refrig. I had a beautiful view from my corner suite of stratophere all lit up and other pretty Vegas lights. It was a really nice stay, super comfortable bed and puffy fluffy pillows. I was in Casino Tower.

One of the most surrealistic experiences I've ever had was in this property. Walking through the casino, we came upon a large, formally-dressed wedding party - complete with white gown, bridesmaid dresses, and tuxedos - patiently waiting in line, with young couples in T-shirts, shorts, and flip-flops, for their turn to be wed in the hotel chapel. To this day I wonder why, if they had gone to such expense, had the bride-and-groom-to-be opted for a ceremony as tacky as this? Were they going to watch the full-fledged circus acts afterwards? Would their reception be in the restaurant serving an all-you-can-eat buffet? Did they live happily ever after?
dirty with paper-thin walls.

This is for my black jack dealer - we stumbled in - don't ask me how - this has got to be the last stop b4 dealer hell. 
Imagine cheap, drunk rude people - no it wasn't that bad but at 12 am I bet it is pretty awful. Let's face it - this is not the "Wynn". The people are barely a step up from homeless. 
But our dealer was so Sweet - cheerful - singing - joking - great entertainment - we had an absolute BLAST!  I have played at the nice casino's and the dealers are Boring. Can't get them to even smile. 
Sadly -- I lost - but - totally worth the experience. Next time I want to whine about things I will remember that poor lady dealing with not nice people - rocking out to 70's tunes - having a terrific day!
That is a woman who has a rich life and knows what is important!

Yeah.... Such a shame that my favorite chicken in the pot game is here. So fun. And the quarters over the edge game.

The employees look shabby and unhappy. Saw a father holding his toddler's hand and smoking a cigarette.

1 star is too much. 

We went here because the thought of a circus theme hotel was a great idea, the plan was to have our sister meet us up here with our daughter a day later. 

I am so happy that we decided to come ahead just in case we didn't think the scene was suitable for our little one.

We went for the upgraded rooms and it felt worse than staying at a Motel 6. 

The whole casino is horrible beginning from the NON EXISTENT POKER ROOM That they advertise online. To he horrible stink! Let alone THE HORRIBLE SERVICE!!! 

We checked IN RIGHT PAST MIDNIGHT We checked out 3 HOURS AFTER CHECK IN. Nobody in the front desk seemed bothered by the disgust look in our faces. 

When we explained about the moldy wallpaper and rusty bathtub\/ sink. They proceeded to tell us that we were actually in the "newly Renovated" tower therefore there was nothing else they could accommodate us with.

Needless to say, We decided against bringing our daughter and siblings with us. We left to the RIO hotel and casino.BEST DECISION OF MY LIFE!!!!! 

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST
DO NOT STAY HERE!!! It was so dirty I felt like I was going to get bed bugs from staying there. It was so disgusting. I will never stay there again. The days inn is way better

This place should be condemned and blown up.  Make way for a new Hotel and Resort. Heck, even a new parking lot would be better than this dump.

It was great for kids.... in the 80s. The buffet was top notch.. in the 80s. People swamp to this place as one of the first location... in the 80s.  You know where I'm going with this. 

It decayed it into a rundown motel status with a Harrah like cheap buffet food. New carpeting should be needed.  Rooms are a joke and you can get the same hotel price in the newer hotels like Luxor.

If there's any redeeming value, it's the fact that besides Treasure Island and Sahara, this is place where you dump the kids and give them $20 to spend on ridiculous carnival games. Some of those games reminded me that they are preparing kids to life of gambling.  Some of those games have risk involve where they can gamble their prize for a bigger prize if they can repeat the win. Yikes!

Quality: *
Decor: **
Service:**
Amenity: ***
Ambiance: **

Run of the mill place that is on the end of its run.

BE CAREFUL NOT TO BOOK "MANOR" ROOMS. They are like a motel in back of the main property, not connected to the main hotel. It's a far and lonely walk from strip back to your room. You get that warm safe feeling that you get in the Wynn. 

If the accountants and execs at MGM are wondering why their company is hemorrhaging cash Circus Circus is the place to look. The property is in tear down condition and no one is in the Casino. There is an entire floor of games but I still wouldn't bring kids here. The Luxor is a much better place to take your family, please don't take them here. Two stars only because the price is right.

MGM executives, board members, and shareholders. I am now talking directly to you. Circus Circus is breathing it's last breaths. The selling of gaudy Mercedes and Playboy branded rapper\/thug necklaces tells me this. No educated person(people with money) would wear these. Casino\/hotel competition is pretty stiff. If you do decide redevelop I would go heavy in the shopping store theme. There is a paradigm shift in the Vegas business model toward shopping from gaming. Your second and I think best option would be to prep the property for sale.

Family friendly hotel with lots of attractions for children, pool and slides, free circus shows on the hour (10 minutes each), and a theme park within. 

I give it four stars because it's the only family friendly hotel on the strip. Quality wise the hotel is old, smelly and crowded. The worse thing about it is you have ever to walk through the gaming areas to get anywhere, which means you have to inhale a lot of second hand smoke. 

If you could put up with these down sides, it's pretty decent considering the family stuff,big rooms and great price. Lots of couples and singles stay here because of the price and being in the strip.

Though it's on the strip, it's a distance away from the "main" strop. A good twenty minutes walk to Bellagio, that's like an hour in 100 plus heat! However, the good news is gets a bus stop right in front and you dun have to stand in the sun to wait for it too. Buy a day or three day bus pass and you'll be right with this hotel. Day pass is $8 and $20 for 3 days. Absolutely worthwhile, as you'll be tires from waking between casinos and shows and malls and buffets. Save ur energy by bussing around.

The only thing this place has going for it self is thr cheap price. Do your self a favor and stay away as far as possible from this place and specially the manors. We stayed here because my parents swore by it. I have never heard anything good abut this place and it was last minute but I thought "how bad could it be"? Bad couldn't prepare me for what I was going to experience. The rooms are out dated and poorly maintained. I would rather sleep in my car that stay a night at circus circus and one of its manor rooms. The first thing we noticed was the odd smell in the room. Almost as if it hadn't been aired for weeks. We wanted to give it a chance but things just got worst. We noticed a stain on our sheets and couldn't take a shower because of how dirty the bathtub was. We left to shower at a family members room and called maintenance and house keeping to address the issue. We came back hours later to find that the sheets had Ben changed but the pillow cases were turned and fluffed. There was even blood stains on one of the pillowcases. Spoke to a manager who moved us room to another down the hall and when I told them I wanted to get out, she replied with "well I'm booked, I can't give you a room I don't have. I can how ever give you tickets to our buffet for 2". Reluctantly we moved 4 doors down to a very similar room, where there was stains on the head board and the paper wall was pealing from what looked like moisture. There was no coffee maker, no extra towels not even a water. The room walls are so thin we could hear our neighbors T.V playing all night. It was incredibly hard to sleep. Check out was at 11 and even after all that we had been through a lady from room service tried to open out door at 10:40am to try and clean. They did a poor job at handling us as a guest. They did deliver on the 2 buffet tickets, but after seeing how they maintained the property and how they handled guest, I ran for the hills. Don't ever stay in this place specially the manor. To whom ever Lori from the MGM Grant is, i know it must get old to respond to so many angry guest. There is no need to reply, just please do something so that the next guest doesn't go through what we did. I know it's has to be getting old writing these many apology responses. Good luck, hope this review will save someone's trip.

Boyfriend and I drove in and arrived around 5AM and they would not check us in! They said they were fully booked. This was Tuesday morning. Really, CC? Fully booked?? I found it very, very hard to believe that they are somehow the only hotel on the strip that was fully booked. This forced me to a)sleep in the car and deal with everything wrong with that situation, or b) cough up money we planned for other things for a room at another hotel. Forced us to pay for another night at another hotel. Left a bad taste in my mouth, especially after the girl at the desk gave a longer diatribe about how "she's not hiding rooms from us and she leaves when she leaves so she doesn't care and there's nothing I can do deal with it." It was 5AM and we just drove all night. There's a time and a place where that's acceptable, funny even, but that wasn't it.
Stayed on the 29th floor of the West Tower this time. I liked it! In my opinion, it is the nicest tower. My family got "upgraded" to the Casino Tower but it's very dated and out of the way in terms of location. The room was spacious, water precious was awesome and it honestly I've gotten a lot less for a lot more in Vegas. They let us stay until 3PM for $20 instead of $70 on Friday due to noisy neighbors and that was really nice of them.  My only qualm is parking... I suppose I got spoiled by the Skyrise Tower last time as it has its own separate garage. Parking for all other towers is horrible. No supervision (but free!), people hitting and scraping cars, ridiculous. But then again, that's not CC's fault. A bigger covered garage would be nice though. If you really don't want\/have a budget to spend $$ somewhere else, this is probably your best option.

So fun!!! My nieces all had a blast in the Adventure Dome! They would stay in that place forever if they could! We got the all day wrist bands, totally worth it. They rode that Frog ride at least 10 times! One suggestion would be that they make wristbands good for everything. We were disappointed to learn that you had to pay separately to try the Batman Laser Tag. The casino was also a blast. Machines paid well. I played in the casino right below the escalators that lead up to the Adventure Dome. In a time span of gambling on & off for about 6 hours I believe I made about $500 total off of 4-5 different slot machines. A bunch of my family was also able to try the deli they have inside of the casino for a late lunch. Soups were delicious but the highlight was my French Dip Sandwich. My husband got the same & loved it as well. It was so nice to have something hearty & fresh. Would definitely go back & replay the whole day again the next time we're in Vegas!

Circus Circus has proven to have its rightful place among the titans of the Las Vegas Strip! Once you spawn your clones into the world your ganna need some entertainment to keep them busy while you tear up the tables! And Circus Circus provides just the right recipe to keep your kids busy with excitement, lights, sounds, , Circus Acts, carni-foods, games, carnival attractions, carnival rides and rollercoasters, midway games, video games, and more games!! 
     Amusement grade entertainment for the whole family! while downstairs is all you traditional slots and tables surrounded by bars and grills! Tables are a plus because the min buy ins are bit lower so you don't have to break the bank to gamble compared to the rest of the casinos in the heart of the strip. In addition to the many bars here there is a main bar in the building adjacent to the main casino that caters to beer pong!!! (as well as the rest of the traditional games of course)  
     And lastly but certainly not the least... If your feeling lucky go to "THE STEAKHOUSE". Its been rated one of Vegas top steakhouses for over 20 years! It's an absolute MUST! DO NOT MISS IT! 
     Long story made short, if your coming out to Las Vegas with the kids in tow... do the family a favor and stay at Circus Circus so they too can have their uninhibited fun!

This is my second time staying here and was there for 4 nights this time i was not satisfied. My room had a lot of ants and house keeping would not bring enough towels for showering two times a day and had to wait 2 hours before they delivered them to my room. Its very reasonable for the price per night. Im thinking about trying another hotel next time.

Yes!! The room was CLEAN,the bed is soft and the pillows are perfect! After a drive from Los Angels it was a plesent surprise to have such comfort. The water pressure was great too. My kids, husband and I scored big in the midway only spending $30 between us. Don't miss the Circus Acts they do not disappoint!! We got the room on Vegas.com for $50 a night!!! The buffet could be better,but your in Vegas baby! There are great restaurants all over. Oh and get to the pools early,they fill up fast.Thank you Circus Circus!!!

Worst experience,the room smelled like cigarettes and it was non- smoking actually the whole building stinked,the TV was old not flat screen,no coffee maker a motel 6 beats this hotel never will I come back here waste of my money

I have been to Vegas over 30 times and never have stepped foot in here. I asked my girlfriend to take me and several times she asked "are you sure?".....

I didn't understand why until I walked into this filthy carnival that resembles a casino.  I wouldn't have minded this place as much if it were clean  - Nice one MGM!

We didn't partake in any of the "win a prize" games and did a speed walk through this place hoping not to stick to the floor or touch a wall.  The people in here seemed happy so maybe I'll chalk it up as a not for me place but I was in the place for a total of 10 minutes.  Yuck!

Guest relations is wonderful! They did everything they could to try to make my stay better. BUT last night....We came back to our room where we found that housekeeping was aweful. They left dirty, used tissue on the counter that was not there when I left, dirty ice buckets, used towels and wash cloths in and around the shower and didn not wash the tub. I know this because of the bubble bath I used the night before. It had bath beads in it that were still lining the tub. THEN when I called to ask for an extra blanket.......it took an hour and a half to get and the lady that delivered it banged on the door like a cop screaming "housekeeping" repeatedly so loud even the neighboring guests were looking to see what was going on at 2am and she almost knocked me over as she shoved the blanket into me before she walked away like a diva!!! I woke up to a bruise from that one!!! And if that wasn't enough.......I got bent over without lube at check out too!!! Yesterday. Tried to pay for the additional night at the adjusted rate and was told repeatedly that it was "paid in full" and when I went to check out.....I was told that I suddenly had a balance!!! Seriously!!! 

If that wasn't bad enough......I got calls from people that booked their stay here for my wedding and to my horror learned that my cousin didn't even have an air conditioner in their room....only a wall fan ...... In Las Vegas in June?!?!?! My mother had peeling wallpaper in her room and a filthy a\/c filter that kept the room hot. My friend got turned away and harassed for her service dog that was clearly marked as a service dog!! And so, so much more!!!! I remember this hotel from childhood. I was excited to finally stay here and have a kid friendly environment for my wedding guests. But WOW!!!!! I never dreamed this place would be this heartbreaking!  

In short........Save your money!!!! Book elsewhere!! I can personally vouch for the sad state of this place and promise that if you book here.....you WILL regret it!!!! I can say that I personally will NEVER stay there again!!!!!

I and my family have been staying here for almost 20 years . We have always loved it but this time they had removed a lot of the things we loved or it would have got a 5 . All the table games in Slots of Fun were gone along with the three real nickel machines .The Skyrise casino was all but gone . No clown tv which we love . The prices inside the property were outrages .This is not the Casinos fault but are resort fees were more than the cost of the room . This is why  I will not be coming back to Vegas anytime soon.

Booked a Monday night but unexpectedly arrived 2 am on Monday. Luckily the very nice lady at the front desk got me a reservation. I was very grateful. Not grateful for the 40$ sandwiches at the deli, bring your own food if you are on a budget; but no microwaves in the room. We brought the kids and they loved the circus acts. The circus acts are very good and entertaining. The whole midway is exciting and fun. The only thing I HATED was the night before we were to leave (and we had to wake up at 3 am) was that we had a 'do not disturb' sign on the door and housekeeping knocked, not once, but TWICE. Did we need towels? No, we have a sign on the door. Not 30 minutes later a man knocked on the door asking about the toilet. I do not know what was going on. Why give us signs if they are going to ignore them? Very annoying. I've been here twice and this is the first time I've been to the pool. Only one side of the pool was open, and it was crowded. Too many kids in the hot pool and no shade. This was weird. 
 Other than the knocking on the door with the sign out, it was wonderful; wish it was longer. Will stay again.

Old memories bliss
Shocking let down with a frown
Dirty, smelly, germs


for what its worth, my kids still loved the games.  my 8 year old did ask me why the restroom smelled so bad...

If you got kids this is the place to go. Parking lot is very tight and it gets packed like crazy. It's best to go early in the morning rather then the middle of the day. Games are fun, everyone enjoys it, and that's what really matters.

Room are better than the used to be.  The staff is ok.   But the main hotel is a little dirty and the pool is so so.  I would not recommend going for the pool.  Nothing to get excited about.   But the price is right for what you get.

I have stayed at Circus Circus several times over the years. It is a decent hotel with the basic amenities, in a slightly more kid friendly environment than the other hotels. The pool is not the scene that it can be at times with the other hotels though.

I would suggest using priceline.com or hotels.com etc to get a hotel, I have done that and ended up here for all but one of my Circus Circus stays. It is an older hotel with a different ambience than many of the other casinos. 

There is a shuttle that will take you from one end of the strip to the other cheaply that leaves from here multiple times a day as well as cabs cruising up and down the strip. If you like to get in a workout, its a nice walk to work out those sore muscles after a car or plane ride to some of the other hotels.

The pool is bare bones basic. The casino is reasonable but nothing that I play too much at. The midway shows are fun for all and no other hotel has the free circus\/midway acts that they do here. They also have the kid allowed gaming area which is a fun place even for adults to enjoy.

Definitely an acceptable place to stay when you get a deal on a room of $50 or less a night (usually on the weekends too).

Took my cousin to Vegas had a great stay and decided to stay an extra night.  Our hotel was sold out so I booked the best deal I could find on the strip which ended up being The Circus Circus.  We ended up in their manor house which is literally a motel in the back.  I felt so unsafe, the room was dirty and smelly.  We couldn't breath at night because of how musty and old the rooms are we didn't sleep at all! Also their pool was closed!! The weather was perfect at least they could have their hot tub going! This is a family hotel\/casino so you would think they would keep the pool open to keep the kids out of the casino floors the dome is a dump too.  I was very disappointed with my stay I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.  I had to wash all of my clothes because they stunk so bad (even the clothes I didn't wear and some of the brand new ones I had bought) we were in a non smoking room, well I couldn't tell that we were.  You could also hear everything going on outside our door even whispered conversations!  They should knock down those roach motel buildings outback and build a brand new tower.  You could tell also that they do not change their sheets or wash the covers often. They had a coffee pot but inside the tiny bathroom!!!  So unsanitary.  Their 150 dollar rate was a waste of my money. I went to bed at around 4 am and I was packed and checked out by 7 am that morning.  That is how bad of a stay we had.

I did not stay, just visited and played blackjack.  I was expecting a circus, but there was none. Lots of midway games for the kids and some tiny free acts to watch.  No circus :(
Found a $3 blackjack table and enjoyed ourselves for a long time.  Nice dealers and atmosphere.

I stayed here about a month ago and really enjoyed my time.... until I got kicked out.

So I decide to do a quick vacation.  Eight days. Fly out and arrive early.  Got upgraded, and checked-in early, etc.  Awesome!  Everything is going fine.  Found one dirty towel and threw it by the door.  No big deal.  I was anxious to hit the casino floor and check out the huge amusement park-type hotel.

It was my first time in Vegas and I'm stoked!!!

Never got to experience any of the restaurants, but there's a McDonald's upstairs in the circus game area.  They give you a receipt coupon thing for a freebie for next day if you do a quick survey.

So I played a ton of slots and got lucky.  Did the free $15 coupon in chips for $10.  Mind you they're only for play and can't be cashed in.

Checked out the kiosk for an emerald necklace for mom.  Rachel is right.  They are pushy.  What went from $55 went down to $40.  "I'll be back I promise, I'm here for another week."  "$35"  "Deal.  Tomorrow though!"

Went swimming.  It was hot out!!!!!

And sooooo..... I guess after I ventured across the street and got drugged I misbehaved and knocked a few things over in the gift shop.

Ended up in the hospital, etc.  (embarrassing)

After I got out had to get new key to my room, couldn't get in, had to get housekeeping call security and they came.  Big guy question me, then cute security lady with short hair and gun said I was being evicted because.....

Whatever.

She commented that I was one of the most polite evictees she's come across in a while.  Probably why she needs the gun (HA!)

So they allow me to gather my things and cash out my chips in the safe.  I payed via a booking site so I had to go back through them about finding a new place.

The booking company actually refunded me and was in the process of trying to help me find a new place.  Almost an hour phone call and being on hold and yadi yada yada they tell me Circus said you can come back, but we have to rebook you since we just refunded you.

Instant bust!  Money is limbo now.  Plus I was still confused\/mad\/embarrassed. I dunno.

Cute hotel.  Dirt cheap.  Super small drinks (compared to Wynn).

My takeaway is that it's cheap and affordable and not a bad place.  Some things like need improvement like more employees during busy times at front desk and maybe bigger glasses for cocktails.  Also I couldn't figure out the buffet.  It was always roped off.  The frozen drinks are amazing.  You can get a plastic sippie and get it refilled.  Not just frozen, you can do bloodys too.

Also Concierge needs an attitude check.  Prior to my departure I needed a new keycard.  I was now a Players Plus member so I didn't need to stand in the ridiculously long line. Someone had jumped in front of me and was paying cash and so I went to the concierge desk to ask can someone else help me with getting a key card replacement; can you get a manager to help me, etc.  I had to go to the bathroom...grrr!  They point to the line where the dude jumped in front of me and says that guy at the desk is the mgr.  Oh also there wasn't anyone at that desk for a hot minute.  Nonetheless, they could have told the Mail & Information Desk also does key re-issues.  Complete fail.

(Most of the staff was polite, even while I was getting the boot.)

Anyway...even though I got kicked out I enjoyed the place.  Really missed out on the amusement portion though.  Bummer!

Hopefully I can check out the rides when I'm back in December!

(Hey, honest review...right?!?!)

I got what I paid for I guess. 
We went for the cheapest casino we could find to supplement our hiking in the area vacation. We do this once a winter. 

The bad:
We were put in the back 40. 
This hotel had cheap apartment style housing a descent walk AWAY from the action. See pictures for rundown details. 
Want a quick drink and stagger to your room. 
NOT POSSIBLE!
Want to safely carry money to the casino. 
NOT POSSIBLE!
Want to safely get back to your room with your winnings, 
NOT POSSIBLE!
Rooms have nonexistent insulation. 
The meal door frames can be heard from one end of the building to the next. 

The good? 
Cheapest room I could find. 

The last time we were in las,  we stayed at a competitors hotel. It was an Internet deal also yet they put us in the towers associated with the casino. 
They got us to spend money on alcohol. 
Gambling. And great bar seafood ( wasn't cheap) 

Perhaps we got the trailer park quality because the hotel knew we used a travel site to book?

Advise.  
Don't stay here or bring your kids unless you can confirm you are in a tower with elevators that dump you into the main casino. 

I paid 100.00 for two nights during the week. 

I guess I got what I paid for. 
A days inn would have felt more upscale. 

I feel gypped.
-----------------
More.

5 pm. One bar closed " till 6pm. Wtf" in the main casino. 
The other one had a blonde that wouldn't acknowledge us.   Left.  Went elsewhere to drink. 
-------------------
Tried slots. ( not a gambler)
12 min to loose 20$
That's 80+ an hour to entertain myself. 
Again. Wtf.
Can't you entertain me while I willfully loose money , say. Gimme an hour to loose it?
---------------------
If you have any bit of skepticism on staying at this place, you are correct. It is s an outdated dump.

2 stars for the cheap tables and slot machines that were kinda loose when we went.  the circus games also look like they could be good fun for kids.

minus 2 stars for the HORRIBLE room we stayed in one night-from bed, i could actually hear every single word of the family guy episode the people in the room next to me were watching.  Had the bed been at least somewhat soft, maybe i could have slept, but that thing was hard as a rock.  the shower also had zero water pressure.  the buffet was DISGUSTING.  seriously, gross.  everything i tried was tried out or tasteless or tough to eat, so i went with something safe, fruit, and even that was unripe and difficult to eat.  i actually kinda feel bad for this place, because i feel like people keep giving it chances and it keeps disappointing.

This is one of the first hotels that I have stayed at prior to the Venetian. It is a hotel for kids. The rooms are not as fancy as the Venetian. There is a coupon book given for guests. Typically, I use the buy 1 get 1 game coupon or I get the free donut from Krispy Kreme. In certain rooms, you can smell smoke. People smoke in the casino, so you will smell it when walking to the adventuresome or the main gaming area.

Nostalgic..

Low hanging ceilings, more than comfortable beds. Flashy and cheesy, but that's the whole point of staying here.

Confusing parking garage layout. People heckling, tons of kids running around and into you.

The carnival games are still pretty fun. I have finally conquered the chicken pot game that as eluded me my entire life.

They need more than a McDonald's in the play section.

West bar  -$6 combo for tequila shot and beer. Funny bartender with a less than funny story of how he is where he is. Ah, the consequences of life and excess.

This hotel is still pretty cool, in a random hodgepodge of a little-bit-of-everything-that-makes-it-all-random-but-adds-its-own-character kind of way.

Kind of like an actual circus.

Though everything about the appearance of Circus Circus from the outside (the hotel and buildings themselves, the signage, etc.) makes this place look old, dated and tired, the interior and rooms in the west tower are surprisingly new and modern looking (actually they were nicer and better outfitted than the rooms at the Excalibur). 

If you have kids\/a family, this resort\/casino is definitely geared towards them with the midway, the on site indoor theme park (The Adventuredome) and the shows & events they offer. 

I can only give it 2 stars due to the fact that it looks so dated from the outside and the lobby and some public spaces are not in great condition and are pretty filthy in places. Also, while this place is amazingly cheap to stay at (especially for Vegas and considering it's only a stones' throw from the strip. Rooms on Sun. - Thurs. nights were going for $26\/night on Expedia and I'm sure you can probably find them cheaper if you search around.) those cheap rates are both a blessing and a curse; Because it's so cheap to stay here, it appears that a lot of dirty asses end up at this hotel. During my 1 afternoon here I saw several groups that were missing teeth, appeared to be unbathed and were pushing a stroller with one hand while drinking a can of Natty Light with the other. 

One special treat to look forward to is when you're in the taxi line to leave this place. Rather than simply have taxis que up near the entrance, they're held just around the corner and out of sight from the hotel lobby. They have an attendant who asks where you're going and then she blows this deafeningly loud whistle (seriously, the whistles that NFL referees use have nothing on this woman!) to signal the next taxi to come and pick you up. God help you if you're the 10th person deep in line or if you're suffering a hangover, as you'll hear this whistle over and over, splitting your ear drums each time until you're placed in a cab and put out of your misery.

I wish I had read the reviews before booking a room here. The guy who checked me in was great, he was friendly, personable, and even though it was busy with people checking in, he didn't make me feel rushed or hurried. Upon telling him this was my first time in Vegas he gave me some great tips and suggestions to make my trip even better. It was all downhill after that.

The Manor was horrible, upon entering the building the smell of industrial strength cleaner was in the air, plus the corridors were not air conditioned or vented. I got to my room and the a\/c was set on 66 degrees but it was not cooling the room. The room was big with a 2 queen size beds, the one closest to the a\/c had a blood stain on the sheet. The carpets were worn and stained, the wall paper was bubbling and the tv was an old tube style that had a humming noise, making tv watching impossible to enjoy. There was little to no sound proofing and I was awoken at midnight by the tv of the room next door. The room never got cool enough to be comfortable.

I stayed 1 night and then went to The D, it was well worth the extra money.

There should be a minus star for this place. They don't deserve one star!! This place is so bad to the point that I don't know from where I start. Unfriendly front desk staff, the room smells awful like an old ashtray, though they claim it was a non-smoking room, filthy bed sheets, noisy hallways, and on and on!!! Could not wait for my stay to end and run out of this old, dirty, boring place with no coming back ever never.

We stopped in here over the weekend while in town and let me tell you 
If your wanting to be around a ton of screaming kids. This is your place 
I remember from years ago this place being kid friendly but this was just insane !!
Kids running all over screaming. Yelling even in the casino 

Needless to say we didn't stay long 

I'll scratch this casino off my list next visit !

After a few days in Vegas, I looked for a way to justifiy extending the trip and settled on it by moving from our current the "four star" Monte Carlo to the two star Circus Circus, enticed by their deal for $25\/night remodeled room.  However, I unconsciously gravitated towards this strange destination for two additional reasons:

-Generational reasons:  my father passed-through here in the 1960s, back when James Bond graced the place with his motion picture presence  
- Confirming "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas" Mental Images - I had to see the rotating bar,  morphing carpet and the 2013 experience of the American Dream

With eyes wide open as to see how much luxury downshifting I was going have to endure, I walked into the lobby, unfortunately without a head full of acid, confronting a check-in line that took about 20% longer than normal.  Although there were no moving carpet designs, the lobby did have cool clown art you can get lost in.  While heading to the elevators, I confirmed my stereotypes: an endless number of overweight blue collar folks, marching along with their three foot margarita plastic cups, using this ancient amalgamation of anachronistic building structures as the ground of their Vegas experience, venturing-out for mercurial walks up-and-down the strip to go see the Stratosphere observation deck, the M&M store, Bellagio fountain, "TI" pirate show, Mirage Volcano, maybe grabbing a drink at the Rum Jungle.  With one stale smoky whiff of the place, you know that you are among those that consider the Downtown Freemont Street experience a Vegas must-see destination.  There I was, among them, with good reason:  I now have a family.
It wasn't always like this you know.  For me, Vegas used to be all VIP tables, bottle service, and exclusive parties to hang-out in.  To give one example, one time, as part of a big-time poker player's entourage, I attended a debaucherous private party in the Palms, in a room so sick that it had its own full-court basketball court with a 24 hour bartender,hobnobbing with the Hollywood A-List.  Now, with disposable income squeezed and family in tow, the previous dynamics of reality being have been pulled from under me.  All those things I once valued, like choosing between the Venetian or the Bellagio because of the danceclub; now, the vacation attributes that come front-center are things like the amusement parks, cheap hotel rooms, lazy pools, and hotels that didn't treat kids like kryptonite.  I could try and fight it, blowing $400 or more bucks on a room only to be reminded that your kids can't dip in this or that pool, but there are better things to throw your money at.  So bring-on the Orleans with its kidsclub, arcade and 14 movie theaters... bring on Excalibur and the Tournament of Kings.    
So why four stars?  Because it delivers that family experience that your kids will love, on the cheap.  in other words, you can squeeze the most out of Circus Circus with the understanding that the Bellagio cabanas and the Wynn suits can wait.  Whereas every casino in Vegas had done an about-face when it comes to the family, Circus Circus has accepted us with open arms.  And their new remodeled rooms are of the same quality as you get in the 3 or 4 star establishments:  clean sheets, new and updated furniture and a view of the Adventure Dome for the kids.  All this for $25 bucks a night and coupons for discounts in their unhealthy restaurants below?!?!  I'll take it and so should you.  And best of all, you too can get that anachronistic nostalgic experience that I had been asking for:   With the right lens, you can witness Tony "The Ant" Spilotro family gift stand still there (the mob enforcer from the movie Casino that got buried alive in the cornfields);  with the right imagination, you can go to the Midway arcade to watch Sean Connery filming of Diamonds are forever;  and with the right philosophy, you can even peer outside your room at the same mountain watermark left by the ephemeral wave of flower power that inspired Hunter S. Thompson write his most memorable monolog in 'Fear and Loathing'.  Yes, with the right outlook, you too can appreciate the mutating warping of the third class blue collar American Dream, while still having a blast with your family, reminding you perhaps that life has a way of equalizing.  Even if you lead a charmed life, you lose everything, and death will be the ultimate equalizer.  The only thing you can do is make the most of what is given and your given life situation.  Once I did that, stopped judging, I noticed how everyone was nice and it was a blast to see all the colorful people milling about.  Best of all, after all these years, I got to explore and see Vegas finally DURING THE DAYTIME, and not just using the daylight hours to nurse yourself out of that wicked hangover so you can party and drop $2Gs again the next night.  Thank God that stage is over!

Umm...I have not been here since 2001. All I can say is that this place is total run down ghetto dump. Was as packed as Disney land on a Saturday and I felt like I was going to get robbed every second. Take your family elsewhere...

WOW.... how different it is from one end of the strip to the other. This was the hotel my friend and I picked because it was cheapest without being one of those skanky scary ones off the strip. But what we didnt realize that after the amount we spent on cabs to get to the hotel to the "good" part of the strip... we should've just stayed at Caesars or Aladdin or anything closer. The hotel itself is alright... great for families with kids because there's actually tons of non gambling stuff to do. The rooms are clean, and pretty modern but what kills this place is their HORRIBLE restaurants. We arrived pretty late, and it was still scorching hot... and I didnt feel like eating anything too heavy, so I ordered a fruit salad. They brought me a GI-NORMOUS plate filled with huge chunks of fruit (literally 1\/4 or a pineapple was laying on my plate, with just slices running through), grapes were not washed (yes there were still cobwebs in there)... it looked like they had it leftover from that morning's breakfast buffet and they had just thrown it on the plate. As for the crowd... definitely not the posh hard rock or bellagio or palms people. BUT, because they are not really a high end casino, the dealers are more lax... My first time playing blackjack and the dealer was teaching me how to play, and i actually won $40 :-D

Okay, this is the first hotel I ever stayed at in Vegas and guess what... I was a kid at the time. So I am writing the review from a kid's perspective (and also a little bit from my parent's perspective).

A lot of reviewers have given this hotel a low star rating and not without reason. The hotel & casino is not the BEST hotel\/casino in Vegas and may actually be one of the worst for adults who want to party and gamble a lot, but if you are traveling with children and want everyone to enjoy their time this is by far the best hotel.

When my family stayed here (back in the 90's) my siblings and I practically lived in the amusement park. We got a 2-3 day pass and spent most of our waking moments there. We rode all of the rides, watching the "street" performers, ate the junk food, played the games and had a grand old time... while my parents enjoyed a cocktail\/beer and some light gambling (they aren't big drinkers or gamblers so they were satisfied) and some ALONE time. They didn't have to keep an eye on us because the four of us were in a fairly secure environment and were able to look after each other so they actually got a little break during their vacation (we were traveling around the country via RV for 3 weeks prior to Vegas). They were even able to enjoy a dinner together, as a couple. It may not have been the flashy, fancy Vegas but it was special to them nonetheless.

Plus, the circus that takes place in the neighboring tent provided my youngest sister a special outing with just her and my parents while us older kids laid around watching TV (something we WANTED to do).

The pool on the rooftop was pretty disappointing because it was small, cramped and HOT. Sure it was the middle of the desert in the middle of the summer, but the boring concrete hole did not please us at all. We stayed for a total of 5 minutes at the pool and called it quits.

The hotel is situated at the end of the strip (well almost. Not as bad as the Stratosphere) so it does limit your mobility if you choose to venture from the Circus Circus grounds. We decided to hop in the minivan and make the journey down the strip to Excalibur (clear at the other end) to watch Tournament of Kings, but traffic was a nightmare. Needless to say, we would have been better off walking the 4 miles. LOL

The rooms weren't fantastic and there were problems even back then. So I can understand why people would be complaining about the rooms now.

So maybe things have drastically changed for the worst in the past 13 years, but for a family spending just a few nights in Vegas it was the ideal location.

Stayed in a room in the Skyrise Tower. Crisp linens, clean bathroom, and spacious closet\/armoire to hang your clothes. What more do you want in a room? If your looking for an overstuffed side chair to throw your clothes on, an in-room coffeemaker, or one of those little memo pads with the hotel's name on it, look elsewhere and pay a premium. Plus, the front desk is staffed with very helpful and friendly people. I've stayed in nearly 10 different hotels on the strip and this was by far the best bang for my buck.

Stayed at Circus Circus for the first time ever. Much to my surprise I received superior service from Belinda in VIP.  Her personality is\/was inspiring. I interacted with Belinda multiple times while being a guest at this establishment, she consistently exceeded my expectations throughout my stay. Although I am late posting feedback, it is a pleasure to share my thoughts with potential guests because professionals like Belinda are rare Gems in the world of hospitality these days. I look forward to patronizing Circus Circus in the future. Cheers and perpetual blessings!

Decent hotel for the cheap price. There was a lot of activities and stores around circus circus. The live circus show was entertaining. The casino is pretty huge. This hotel is huge; takes about 15 minutes to get from our sky rise room to the front entrance facing the strip. I really likes the option to check out through phone that way we don't have to wait in line.

This place has 2 good things free ice and security walking the halls. Then again why is security walking the halls. Original reservation Saturday to Wednesday, called on Sunday afternoon from my room to get Tuesday check out, they said I receive no refund. No customer service skills, won't even work with us. RESORT FEE, that's a joke.....Pool was closed, vallet parking charges $13.00, no hand towels in skyrise towers. Maid said hand towels are not for this tower. Midway and adventure dome, bring lots of $$$$$$. Everything cost!

I want to like this hotel, but the downsides are too much.

PROs:
- It's great for kids.  The AdventureDome has 5 acres worth of rides and carnival games.  Very fun.
- It's cheap.  Including the resort fee, I stayed here for $50\/night.
- A decent selection of shops and restaurants

CONs
- The location is bad.  It's a 20-minute walk to the Strip.  And a 50-minute walk to Fremont Street.  It's basically in the middle of nowhere.
- The decor is plain and drab.  It opened in 1968 so that explains it.
- A lot of noise can be heard from the adjacent room.  The reason is because the separating door (in the room) has a lot of clearance at the bottom.  I could hear every conversation from the adjacent room.

For lack of a better word, all I have to say about this place is "yucky."

Parking is horrendous. Spaces are tight and the parking structure is filthy. Upon entering the hotel, you get the familiar stench of cigarette smoke. No ventilation like the newer hotels. While walking through the casino, some spots are super cold and some are warm. I remember staying here when we would go on family vacations, but I would definitely stay away from here now. 

Let's get to the arcade area since that's where we spent the majority of our time. Let's just say that I've never been more grossed out in a while. SO. MANY. PEOPLE.
Gross!!! I didn't want to touch anything. Lots of spoiled little brats running around unsupervised. And why are kids these days so fat??? Oh I know, cuz their parents are fat too and don't care about being healthy. I get that kids want to have fun too, but this place is disgusting.

If you want a cheap place to crash after a night a partying then CC isnt bad. It's ideal for kids. My dad used to give me a roll of quarters and just ditch me for hours....cant do that nowadays though. 

DO NOT PLAY BLACKJACK HERE. These old casinos are training grounds for BJ noobs. They hit on 19s....hit when the dealer is showing 4-6. seriously....I can't believe anyone winning here. I was sitting next to a couple of guys who had no clue. If they're staring at their cards too long and it's obvious what to do......you better walk.

When I Come to Vegas I love staying at circus circus due to the fact that prices there for the room is cheap.. I stayed in every tower \/building...so this time we stayed at the skyrise tower and I didn't like there room I was very shocked in how they looked not nice the beds when you sit on them they go down and make noise...wow..very stuffy...

Stay away! I received a late notice to work NAB convention, and had to book a room for 4 nights last minute. Circus Circus was the only hotel in the area with availability. Had a bad feeling about it then and there, not to mention horrible reviews, but had no choice. Boy did I regret this, and I'll never come back here again! 

I reserved a King Bed room in West Tower, I received upon check-in a double queen in Casino tower, facing a wall, and no, the front desk didn't seem to feel apologetic at all. I dropped the luggage and left. I was back around 1am and went to bed right away, but couldn't fall asleep because of the motor like sound traveling through my walls. I called the front desk twice, requesting somebody to come check my room and take care of the noise. Security showed up, stepped in and then joyfully declared :"Oh, thaaaat? That's just an elevator!" Oh, thanks, now it makes it ok, let me put myself to sleep now that I know that there is no way to block that noise!!! Third call to front desk with a request to be moved anywhere but next to the elevator, but to no avail. They offered to move me the next day with "an upgrade" to a slightly larger room with a king bed, well thank you very much, how kind of you to keep me up till 4am (I guess that's when the elevator traffic died down and I finally passed out) when I have to be at work at 8 the next day, and then generously move me to a king bed room that I actually booked online to begin with and paid a bit extra for!!!
