The room turned out to be second to the elevator and next to a vending machine that just couldn't stop buzzing,  and the window could not be opened. I gave up.

3 stars for the revolving carousel bar.  

"Bazooko's Circus is what the whole hep world would be doing Saturday nights if the Nazis had won the war. This was the Sixth Reich.

I have seen homeless shelters cleaner than this hotel. And fair warning, there are different towers NOT connected to the hotel, so if you use valet ($15 per day) you might have to walk a country mile just to get to your building. I wished that they told us that early in the registration process. The Manor buildings smell like urine mixed with a deodorizer. The carpet has those worn down, grimy foot paths, and we had a questionable hair in our bathtub. The Vince Neil's bar is filthy and when we sat down, the bartender walked out of the bar area ignoring us completely. (He wasn't busy either.) When we moved to another spot, the bartender was doing so many bottle tricks that it took another 10 minutes for him to take our order. I will not stay again and anyone that may be interested in staying here, don't.

Stayed in the Circus Circus Manor C witch is not part of the main hotel towers. From the check in counter it is a short walk (5 minutes) to the Circus Circus manors. There is parking next to the manors if you prefer to drive and park over there. 

Upon walking into the Manor (C) I could see the place was showing its age. I can tell the interior has been maintained, but that is it. Every time I walked the halls there was the smell of some kind of cleaning agent. The rooms were clean and accommodating for someone that would need rest, and would need to get cleaned up the following day. 
However, when neighbors moved into the room next to mine I got to hear things I would rather not have heard. 
~In one of the rooms next to us I could hear a couple getting it on...or a porn shoot was going...all I know is that room would need to be sterilized (wallpaper, mattresses, toilet paper...all of it.). I hope that the room I had stayed in was not the scene of a crime...shoot. 
~The other room next to me was a family of four and the kids were loud. Thankfully it was not as disturbing as the sounds that came from the other room, but on the night before checkout there was a moment where the kids and dad was yelling at each other. It was a bit uneasy to listen to as it reminded me of a domestic disturbance argument I heard in the past. This one was simply just a father disciplining his kids in an argument exchange. There was no crying or load bangs\/noises.

~There is your basic hotel movie channels
~Bathroom had included towels for a 2-night stay (3 towels total)
~bathroom included generic soaps if those staying forget to bring some
~room included large closets which were included in the TV entertainment center, for travelers that need to hang suits or other clothes that cannot be folded
~room included a hair dryer
~room included a safe
~NO REFRIGERATOR
~AC and heater had worked

There was phone check out, and since I had a long drive back home, I was able to call checkout at around 4:00 AM.

This hotel has seen better days. While we didn't stay here, we dined and gambled here. I was very disappointed that their dealers are very rude, quiet, don't smile, and don't converse with you at all. Most of them are very old and many of them are of Asian decent. I enjoy dealers that at least put on some makeup and try to make themselves look nice. Most dealers are very aware of their hands and have their nails done. Not here. I know it's shallow but they were just horribly unattractive and I think it was mostly because none of them ever smiled. The first table I sat down at the dealer kept coughing all over the cards. They don't have electronic card shufflers which seemed odd. The next table we went to the dealer was just very rude and barely spoke English. When I was getting ready to leave the table she insisted that I color up and when my husband started separating my chips, she very rudely grabbed them from him. I think her name was Yong. The last table we sat at was with an elderly but American woman dealer and she honestly looked like she was ready to commit suicide. She never smiled, never really acknowledged anyone at the table. It was very depressing.

If your looking for a place to sleep only, this is your spot. Cheapest room I could find at $21 a night. If your looking to bring your kids to Vegas for the first time, look elsewhere. I was really excited to bring my kids to Vegas as this was their first time. We walked into the Hotel and the kids were like "Uhhhh dad, this place is ghetto" and it is. Not much different for when I stayed here 17 years ago. A lot of trashy guests inside. "because of the cheap price" the people in the room next to me were arguing all night and a call to the front desk was no help. The shopping area is pretty nice and the kid area with the games is GREAT! The free shows are pretty impressive also. Best advise, stay somewhere else but bring your kids over later in the day. Buffet was decent and our view from our room SUCKED.. Hahaha. You TRULLY do get what you pay for here.

WHERE TO START....
The first thing that bugged me was the $15 Valet. Entering the hotel It was crowded. Check in was smoothe. The person helping us was very nice and helpful. We upgraded our room. THANK GOD otherwise we would of had a room in a outside building. Looks like a old Motel 6.  The elevator to our room was hot and stuffy. Once we got in our room. We noticed it looked old. The carpet,wallpaper ect looked dated. Before bed we noticed blood spots on the sheets. The beds are pretty comfortable. The vending machine on our floor did not work. The only reason we stayed here was because of all the fun activities for children. Its so crowded and things arent organized. Doing anything is impossible. House keeping made the bed didnt change the sheets. So of course we saw the blood stained sheet we had taken off back on the bed..The staff was impeccable. Really sweet and attentive. Christina in valet was really helpful. We lost our Valet ticket.She made the process of paying and finding my car smooth Now waiting for them to bring my car was a 16 minute process. Me being disabled made it very difficult to wait in the heat. Once I got in the car. I had to show my registration and ID to get my car which was fine. Overall I would never recommend this hell hole to anyone. The handicap parking is a far distance from people with disabilities to get to. I cant forget the pool area. They offer a really nice water slide and a little splash area. The pools were all murky. Crowded definetly not enough pool space for the size of the hotel. I will never stay here again

Horrible place, stayed in 1980s built room for 100.00\/night very disappointed. 
Floors where uneven TV was so old it was boarder line antiuq (not that we were there to watch tv but would like the choice) 
Wallpaper was stained and disgusting.
Kids screaming all day kids everywhere forget about adult playgrounds sexy vegas style staying here. Didn't gamble there nor go to shows just slept in the out dated hotel. Never again will I go to circus circus.

This hotel is slimy and toxic, literally. It stinks severely, especially of fresh and old cigarette smoke and mold , the beds are extremely uncomfortable, the worse I've ever slept on.. And watch out, they overcharged my credit card and left me no proof that I overpaid because I never signed anything. What you get from this ultra cheap hotel is exactly what you pay for... and then you get ripped off. Avoid staying here if you  can.

I have only stayed here once, and probably the last time I will stay a night here.
The rooms are alright. They are rather on the small side, and they don't have really any views. 
During Christmas time it was hell trying to check in. Fortunately they helped my Dad immediately because he is handicapped! I give them their stars for that.
 
It is super easy to get lost here! I couldn't even find the McDonald's!!!! Also it's more expensive than a California McDonald's. 

The coolest thing here is the indoor theme park! I will come back for the indoor theme park  ^^
20 min waits for elevators, completely outdated, $30 per night resort fee & no coffee microwave or fridge?!?! This place is not worth it.

Seems alright to me.  I stayed in the "manor" which is the motel in back of the main casino\/hotel and i paid under $50\/night for four nights that spanned a weekend.  It's not the top notch service, shopping, dining that some of the other casinos offer, but since I wasn't planning to patronize any of those anyway and didn't want to pay for them, the "manor" at Circus Circus was fine for me.

Nonsmoking is available.  Not on their website or numerous other outlets.  You have to phone them and ask in order to book one.
Perfect place comfy cozy priced perfectly clean & nice beds are soft will stay here again for sure

My fianc and I came to Las Vegas for my birthday week. We weren't expecting much because of all the negative reviews but as soon as we arrived we were pleasantly surprised. The staff working at the registration desk were super friendly and helpful and even got us a room on the 30th floor with a beautiful view.The casino was big but smelled of stale cigarette smoke. Some waitresses were nice and friendly while others were rude and ignored us. The rooms were nice, clean, and spacious. There's a lot to do downstairs like midway and the free circus acts with a variety of restaurants. We loved it so much we decided to come back with my fianc's mom for Mothers Day. We all had a blast!

I have been coming here since I was a kid. I still see some of the workers here that were here when I was little. The place hasn't changed very much over the years. It's one of the more affordable casinos on the strip so you can't expect it to be perfect. It is kinda run down and I noticed the prices have gone up a lot lately. They must be struggling so they are getting desperate. Either way I am attached to this place and I'll always come here even if it's just for a night. I have too many memories here not to come by and visit.

Last minute booking during the huge NAB convention and I opted for the nearby Circus. It is also one of the least expensive, for very good reasons. It is old, run down, and feels like they are getting ready to bring it down. I stayed at their "Manor" across from the main tower. When my friend dropped me off and took a look, he renamed it "Murder Manor" as it looks like the scene of many crimes. The non smoking room reeked of smoke and there was not a glass in the bathroom. Hangers were at a premium and so was tv, as this one should have been in a standard def antique showing. Wifi worked ok. Sheets clean, Bed ok. Mostly quiet. But to add insult to injury, I stupidly left a good pari of jeans in a drawer (because of the lack of hangers) and when I called the day after checking out they did not have them and seemed to care less. Vegas needs a redo starting here.

Absolutely the worst place you can stay in Vegas. My family decided to stay at Circus Circus so it would be convenient for my 12 year old brother to go play the games there. The check in process was delayed because the incompetent staff was having trouble issuing our keycards so we had to wait for 20 min. After checking in we go drop off our bags and hit the buffet. The buffet was overpriced and disappointing with very little variety and extremely poor quality. During my stay I had some of my stuff stolen out of my room.
I am positive it was an employee who spotted me in the lobby carrying an incase bag. They probably waited until we left the room after dropping off our luggage to steal some of my stuff. My family left the room for about an hour to go eat dinner and after coming back i notice my laptop bag was gone containing a macbook pro, 2 ipods, and an electric razor.

Honestly if you're vacationing to Vegas, live a little and book a nice hotel. This place is old, cheap, overpriced, and far from the excitement of Las Vegas.

DO NOT STAY in the MANOR rooms!!! They wreak of overpowering carpet fresh floral scent. My clothes smelled like it after just two days in those rooms. When we arrived even though I had paid for four days on a King bed room they didn't have a room available and so gave us 2650 Manor D which literally was a 15 minute walk across dark parking lots and busy streets just to get to the casino. It was filled with drunken loud people and children racing up and down the halls screaming until 4am. We then had requested a bell hop to help us move to our real room first thing in the morning but it was not going to be ready until the afternoon so a bell hop was supposed to come and take them to the bell desk and when i called to double check I was rudely told they were very busy and so we hoofed them 15 minutes to the bell desk ourselves. When we got our new room 1615 Manor A the security door was broken and that horrible scent was there as well and we woke up to no hot water. So we moved again with the same exact lack of help from the bell desk and we were put in 28841 West Tower which was much better but we were not treated well and Circus Circus isn't close to anything to do. The Manor buildings need to be bulldozed they are nasty!

I went with my family of 5 for our first experience in Las Vegs. The hotel seemed very good for kids, because I had two sisters below the age of 18. Yet, I usually find it disturbing how the casino below has omnious amounts of second hand smoke covering the arcade and circus attractions above. 

The rooms where very nice, but lacked some clean facilities. Obviously the room cleaning was not up to par due to the cheap prices we acquired. I would only recommend the West Tower as the lobby, casino, and arcade is below the tower, not the Circus Circus manor. As Las Vegas is an adult fantasy city, if you don't care about the kids to catch secondhand smoke poisoning, I would only recommend families with low income budgets to go to Circus Circus. 

Also, the buffet is semi-decent, but I would recommend going to somewhere else to get a true buffet experience.

Worst fucking place ever. Do not play craps here. They have no clue how to play. They put my bets on the wrong zones and lost my money when I would have won had they put it in the zone I asked. Then when I won on several rolls they tried to pay my winnings to others at the table. Only do to one gentleman's kindness did he admit that wasn't his winnings and said it was mine. Complete waste of money and time. Also took one hour for a medium rare steak. Never going there again.

i dont even want to give any positive reviews for this hotelmost terrible hotel !! it doesnt have hot shower water its really really fucking ridiculous i have called them for help for at least 3 times! No one come to figure it out!!!   One guy said he would send a technic person to figure it out!but no !!! And I have been waiting for at least 1 hr! Still no hot shower water!!

Circus Circus is a great place for children. There's so much for them to do. I recommend this place to anyone looking to stay within' your budget and for your children to do. I wouldnt reommend this place to couples who  want a romantic scenery.

Round and round the various paths leading up and down, across and under, to reveal a plethora of games, the ubiquitous slot-machines, and attractions performed by multi-talented clowns, acrobats, and prestidigitators who contain one surprise after another.

At the request of a young cousin, we dined at The Pink Pony. Excellent service, courteous and attentive. Faerie-tale environment. Repaste receives a 4\/5.

Entertainment recommendation: Circus Acts {4\/5}, Adventure Dome {for the Halloween season, this is featuring the "Fright Dome" spook attraction, which is quite amusing; 4\/5}, The Midway {evocative carnival games including the ring toss, watergun targets, ball throws, and an animatronic fortune teller; 4\/5}.

We went here to watch the free show, getting there half an hour early for an 11:00am show.  The show started 1\/2 an hour late so we waited an hour total for about a 12 minute show.  We got our choice of seats - it really filled up to overflowing by showtime!  The seats were not comfortable for sitting there over an hour - our backs hurt for awhile. There was a fairly funny old man clown, and also 4 young acrobat guys from Moracco that did a good performance.

If I were a half drunk college student on a severely limited budget I might consider roughing Vegas Circus Circus style.  However, I am not.  And since I don't have a mullet or a Nascar tattoo then I can see no reason to spend more than 10 minutes in this place.  

There is a smell upon entering the hotel that is more like the smell of a Chicago bus terminal.  There is a decent flair style bar somewhere in the maze that is the casino floor.  Honestly, other than history that little bar might be the only redeeming factor here.
We received 7 phone calls at 4 in the morning and the supervisor theresa at the front desk could not have been more rude when I asked why I couldn't get my calls to the room blocked.

We got a great rate!  We had no remote for the tv and then we weren't able to get any hot water for the shower.  I know we got the room for cheap, but these are basic things.  Our check in was quick and the person gave great customer service.  We stayed in the casino tower.
Really Mediocre establishment for the price.. and the resort fee just adds to the frustration.

I had always heard of this place as a dump so I was a bit weary on staying here. But, we came on a family trip and this was the family (kids) place. Stayed in the skytower room and the check in desk was kind enough to set us up in a room near the elevator since my mom had problems with her knee. Pleasantly surprised by the room. It was clean and semi-updated. Towels were new since they were still leaving the linty stuff behind. Great view of the pool that we never got to use. The midway and adventuredome is where we spent most of our time. Got good use of our coupon book and my son had the best weekend ever! This place is overly crowded with families, kids and a few strange ones out there. Its a popular place for large groups on convention, competitions and school trips. Because this place is loaded with kids and teenagers...expect the debauchery of kids being kids running around all hours of the night and being loud and obnoxious. Didnt bother me none...these are kids enjoying time away from home! Beware of the typical check in and check out times as it is nearly impossible to get an elevator. Bell Desk was great and helped my mom out with a motorized scooter to get around more comfortably. Dont expect this place to be up to par with the nicer or average casino hotels on the rest of the strip.And it is kind of a distance to walk towards the center of the strip as the casinos on this end of the strip are a bit more spaced out. So, wanna visit vegas on the cheap and with kids? This is a good place. Don't be a cheapo with the valet or bellhop. The service comes in handy. The bellman was nice enough to take all our bags to our car in the skyrise parking tower and loaded them all in for us. Oh and they offer free wifi...but i was never really able to get good use out of it and my reception wasn't that great in the casino. And if you dont want to be woken up by housekeeping early in the morning, place your do not disturb sign on the door before bed. They woke us up both mornings pretty early to clean our rooms.
Midway games and circus acts still similar to how it was when I was a kid. Not very much has changed.  Very nostalgic

I usually stay here when in Vegas as the rates are pretty good if booked through Hotels.com or another site such as that. I stayed at the Manor this time and it wasn't bad...but wasn't great either. The beds are comfortable for the most part, but the linens are old. The Manor is ready for an update already! The shower had very little pressure and the bathroom was very small. Stay in the towers, they are worth the extra $8.

Seemed pretty run down and dirty.  We did not stay here, but simply hung out one evening here.  I probably wouldnt return here though.  Super crowded and screaming kids everywhere = migraine.  The a\/c was good though!

I am sitting in my Circus Circus room, afraid to sit on anything. I was eager to take a nap after a long flight and the bedding on both beds in my room is nasty, dirty and encrusted in food and I don't even want to think what else. I checked under the sheets, big mistake, more gross yellow stains. I am so grossed out.

The hotel is overrun with a million kids, it's loud, completely overwhelming, outdated, designed by a guy who got his architecture degree from the back of a magazine and hucksters peddling things approached me twice on my way to the elevators. 

The rooms are bare-bones, no coffee maker, fridge or any amenities you'd find at even the cheapest Holiday Inn.

I will never stay here again and might be leaving tonight. Disgusting.

I came here to try the buffet. I heard it was kid friendly, but honestly the Hotel is a little scary.. This is a depressing environment as all you see is ghetto everywhere. The elevators all smell and have graffiti on them. I would NOT stay here..

Stayed here on a whim with a girlfriend.... not close to the strip and in a seedy area of town. The rooms were not nice and the bathroom soap was not appealing! The windows opened up all the way leaving a  great bottle opener for our beers along the ledge. I am not sure I would want to take my children there for fun..... but I am sure if your on a tighter budget and just want to have a carnival ride and game weekend, its great.

I wanted to be close to the Convention Center (easy walk), and booked a Southwest Air package which included two nights at Circus Circus.  Jaw-dropping low price. After reading all the negative reviews, I was prepared for the worst.  No need!
Circus Circus is just fine, particularly given the very low price point for a strip property.  Admittedly, the lobby is a bit of a labyrinth (aren't all the strip hotel lobbies?); the solution seems to be requesting a room in the "West Tower," as those elevators immediately adjoin the hotel check-in area.  My large-sized clean room on the 20th floor had two comfy queen beds, and a nice LG flat screen.  Wifi ("included" with $8.95\/day resort fee) was serviceable.   No toiletries to speak of, so keep the expectations low there, but the towels were fluffy and plentiful.  Maybe other "Towers" are tired, but not so for the West Tower.  I didn't eat at the hotel (except for Krispy Kreme pick-up), and the circus "midway" is actually pretty fun.  You know what?  I'll stay here again.

i stayed here for the weekend cause it was a heck oif a deal.  please know that your away from any of the real Strip action.  this is remote area with a poorer class crowd of people.  some really ghetto trash outside of slotland, which is next to circus circus.

Plus=dirt cheap room rates, nice circus acts, some liberal slot action

Neg=noise, more smoking than usual, ghetto crowd, lotsa kid noise,
           food=so so

the room was good enough, clean, big.

it is a lonely walk in any direction, ill advised for the good looking ladies...if your driving it's good....walking=trouble

We stayed at the Circus Circus Manor for 4 nights. I am going to write a very honest review. Overall, this place was better than the expected for the price we paid.  I think that people need to keep in mind the price being paid here and the expectation for quality.  The room was grungy but clean on the surface.  The bed linens and towels were clean and new.  The TV was old, not a flat screen but it worked.  The internet was free and it worked.  The staff were friendly in every encounter.  The bed was a little soft but it was not too bad.  The room was noisy. If you are going to stay here make sure you bring good ear plugs, you are going to need them.  The noise didn't bother me, we just said , hey people come to Vegas to have fun and some of the people in rooms around us were definately having fun.  Overall this was not a bad place to stay.  I would not spend too much time in the casino because there are many many kids!  I mean a ton of kids.  
One more thing about the room, there is a kurig coffee maker! bonus and plenty of hot water for showers.  If you want to stay on the strip for not much money this is the place to stay.  
During check in they wanted to upgrade us to the tower, we had booked the Manor.  We wanted to stay in the Manor so that we would have easy access to our car since we were driving to the Grand Canyon.   I will probably not stay here again but over all not as bad as I expected.

This place certainly isn't new and fancy like many of the other locations on the strip, but it is an okay place to get a good night's rest. There were a lot of children running around and things were a bit dingy and run down, but the price is pretty awesome. Do beware of the additional resort fees, which do get you a coupon book with some decent stuff like a free premium ride at the adventure dome and 2 midway games, plus some deals on drinking and gambling. Resort fee also covered free wifi. There is a gym which was much nicer than I expected, but very difficult to find. Many people asked seem to not know where it was hidden and there are no helpful signs. I would suggest it be kept open 24 hours a day since this is the city that never sleeps, but the hours started early and ended semi late. The pool didn't appear to be anything worth checking out unless you are super hot, especially if you have used any of the other pools on the strip. We did have a problem with an alarm clock next door going off in the middle of the night, but staff did get it taken care of eventually. I also had a problem with my safe, which may have been forgetting my own code, and was impressed when security arrived prior to the maintenance man to verify my identification. Do beware the food at the buffet is not really edible. Overall I would stay here again, but mostly if I was with children or had a strange love for the free circus acts.

We have stayed here a couple times but I haven't been compelled to write a review until now. The hotel is inexpensive and great to bring my 7 year old because of the adventuredome theme park. The rooms are decent. What really made my stay incredible was Margie from front desk. She was so helpful and kind. This was an example of the best costumer service I've seen in a while and I work for Hyatt hotels. I am truly impressed and will be staying here again and looking forward to seeing Margie.

RUDE PEOPLE HERE !!!I'm staying at Circus Circus and I had a TERRIBLE experience since the beginning . I couldn't get in the entrance. I called to see which way I can enter the receptionist transferred me to security . The gentlemen that answered was rude and not very descriptive on how to get to back entrance . Parking was TERRIBLE !!  People were rude while we were trying to park no to mention there were hardly any parking because there was Country fest. I'm here for a soccer tournament and we all wanted to be together . No we weren't this WAS. The reason why we stayed here ! I called the front desk and spoke to someone he told me that I didn't like it I could leave the jolted since there were 45k people staying !! That's REAL NICE. Talking to a customer that is her first time staying here . WILL NEVER STAY HERE!! Or recommend it to others !!

Circus Circus, where should I start? Room and hallway carpets are disgusting, I paid $70 dollars for Resort Fees which include WiFi which I think it should be free. No hot water, in conclusion the worst hotel to stay in Vegas, Next time I rather stay in a Motel than Circus Circus. I know that saying of you get what you paid for, but this is ridiculous.

Cheap, satisfying and clean. What more can you ask for? Beds are comfortable! A few dark spots on the walls, water faucets need to be tightened but whatever, no big deal. If the sheets are dirty (which we didn't have) ask for new ones. Geeez. So many people are complainers. You aren't in Las Vegas to hang out at the hotel all day, you're only here to sleep :) soooooo I give 5 stars because room + beds are comfortable and clean. Staff is friendly, CHILDREN friendly. Has amusement park within hotel. Casino games for days!! Walking distance from the strip. Woooo Vegas :)
Everything was very clean,  staff was awesome.  A little crowded,  but room was immaculate.  Will definitely go back.
I checked in to Circus Circus at 1am this morning and was assigned to room 11746. I was awakened due to itching and it felt as if something biting me.

DETAILS: 
- we stayed on the 24th floor of the Skytower
- checked in last Friday and stayed until Sunday
- ate at the buffet, gambled, had fun at the Adventuredome, and used the pool

I will admit, you get what you pay for but in our case, it was well worth the inexpensive stay with our ten and five year old. Every single staff member there were incredibly nice and helpful, the room was pretty awesome (my husband let out the loudest sigh of relief because he remembers how it was when he was a kid), it was very VERY clean, everything worked, we had a great view, and wifi was fast and always worked. We obviously spent time at Adventuredome and the pool, both of which were clean and great for kids. Even the high schoolers working the games were nice! The pool, although a little outdated, was very clean, and had plenty of clean towels and life jackets for the kids. The snack bar line could use more help because I ended up waiting almost 30 minutes for a snow cone and the showers in the women's restroom were broken. This casino is not the best to gamble at since it has only a dozen or so machines but they paid out handsomely:) All in all, for the price, it's worth it, it's not filled with ghetto people the rooms were great, and service was impeccable.

Do not come here if you are looking for a luxurious place to stay! This is NOT the place for you if you wanted something luxurious. I got a room at the Skyrise tower, the only word I can use to describe the room is it SUCKED! First of all the hallway smelled like weed, the room smells bad, and  it is dusty. This is first and last time, you'll see me there.

The hotel itself was alright (we stayed in the Skyrise Tower) for the cost, but I was dismayed when I booked room online and discovered that in addition to the $27.90 per night there was an additional "daily resort fee" of $23.52 per night. As far as I'm concerned this is a sneaky, hidden charge. Nevertheless, I went ahead and paid it. We were traveling with my brother and his family, who were staying in the RV park. Turns out this is nothing more than a giant paved parking lot with few amenities, not even tables or shade of any type. The only real consolation is it has its own swimming pool. The thing that killed this trip though was, just as we were leaving, we discovered my daughter's bike had been stolen. So much for security. My brother and I decided we won't be coming back here again. I'd encourage anyone else to steer clear of this place too.

It took over 30 minutes to get through check in on a Sunday around 4pm. It was so loud in there and the check in clerk did not speak very loudly. He gave me very poor directions to our room. We did not know we had to go to level 2 to access another wing to another elevator. We were lost for 15 min because there were no signs directing us to level 2. Poor signage in a lot of ways. We were happy with our room and liked the Keurig coffee.There were severely high winds and we were on floor 23. The wind howling through was extremely loud. Then it got to the point of sounding like an air horn and it was sucking our door in. I had to stuff towels around the door, brace it with our chair, and shove tooth paste tubes in the door to stiffen it. While I realize the wind was extreme, i would not have expected this. I would not recommend staying up high while there is wind.

New tower room was updated.Great price for a cheap vegas trip.Pizza was excellent. Tanisha in Vip took care of me and was extremely professional. The place is older but gives you the old vegas feel. Pit boss at the crap table very professional and made the loss easier to bare..... For a cheap stay over.. This is your place if you in can deal with kids.

I arrived at 1:40 AM and ended up waiting almost a half hour to get checked in. There was at least one guest service agent who was working on something else besides checking people in despite the long line. They provided extremely slow check in service for the guests.

The property is extremely scattered. The signs are terrible when navigating through the hotel\/casino making it easy to get lost.

as some people may have said, i think it has been remodeled and the rooms were PERFECT. for paying 50 bucks a night, it was almost as if we were staying in a hilton honestly. 

the pool is alright.. i wouldn't swim there because there are much nicer pool parties else where so who cares. and the casino is aight and they have lots of arcades and food places upstairs. 

if ur young and going out at night, just beware that there are sometimes people sitting outside near the outside of the hotel building rooms but usually there are multiple entrances so you can avoid them. and just be smart about partying if thats what you're there to do.

I did read many negative reviews but for the price I really didn't care. I think some people book last minute get a hike in price for doing so and then complain because it's "ghetto". That's probably because it's cheap, affordable and attractive to families with children . This is the first time I have stayed at the hotel with my 3 children and for the 70 dollars I paid for a Saturday was great and couldn't be beat. I can't lie..the decor needs an upgrade, especially the bathroom but we weren't planning on staying all day staring at mismatched colors. There are casinos, restaurants, circus shows, Adventure Dome, shops and a pretty spacious pool. I did hear that if you book last minute the chances of being sent to the motorlodge was high and from the remarks, I'm guessing it's pretty scrappy over there. I stayed in the skytower with the kids and they loved every minute. If you don't want to be around a bunch of teens, children or obnoxious people....and want "luxury", then I suggest to drive a bit more south to other hotels. You'll find ghetto and sketchy people all up and down the strip regardless. From my point of view and in my opinion, the price was right, children had a blast and didn't cost me an arm or a leg.

Update--08\/17\/2014
My original review was placed on our first night. I felt like I need to update this place after my first night stay. This might be funny to some and perhaps serious to others, but I think my room was haunted. I took a shower and put the kids down, organized a few things before I slipped into the bed. I turned off the lights and closed my eyes. I was woken up by what seemed like something jumping on the bed, so I jumped up and turn on the lights but there was nothing there. I thought maybe it was part of a dream that had wake me up, so I just went back to sleep. I had the most creepy feeling ever and as a mother of three sleeping children..my nerves were on edge. Again, I heard something in the corner of the room so I just turned on the lights and left it on. I called down to the front desk and didn't want to seem like a crazy person, so I asked if there were any other rooms available. I was told they were completely booked and they apologized. It was about 1:45am when I went to sleep (again) and was woken up by a huge bang  at 3:17am (mind you the light in the bathroom was left on) and when I stood up..everything on the table was now on the floor!! MY Purse, bag, ipad, papers from check in and a cup of juice. All of it on the floor, almost as if the table tipped over -_-. Needless to say, I ended up just staying up turning on another light and opening the blinds. I ended up dozing off at 7am and the sun was coming up so I felt a bit at ease. At exactly 8:15am, I hear someone trying to open the door. I went to look through the peep hole and it was one of three housekeepers in the hall way. She apologized and said she had the wrong room!! Are you freaking kidding me??? First the angry ghost and then the early bird housekeeper. Checkout is at 11am thank you very much. SO.....Sleep at your own risk lol. I am now home and on 3 hrs of sleep. I now have a love ..hate thing with Circus Circus.

worst hotel ever!!!! never stay  here!!! we waited 20 minutes for our elevator every time and people cut in front of us every time!!! when we tried to ride the elevator down,  it would never stop on our floor, we had to ride it up to go down. we left 2 days early even though we paid for it.  we are staying at the trump hotel, what a difference!! circus circus i's like going to wal mart!!! no wonder why trump is such a great businessman and president, he knows what the hell he is doing., unlike the circus circus clowns!!!!

It wasn't bad, it wasn't great.  I liked the whole check in process.  It was very organized and very professional.  The directions they gave us to our room could've been better, and it would have been nice to have a taxi company's name and number listed by the phone in our room, because I could NOT figure out the bus schedules.  I didn't like the fact that when I tried to walk to the Stratosphere I had to walk allllllllllll the way around the building instead of being able to just walk right out to the street.  ** Whatever you do, don't use the shampoo that they give you in your hotel room!  It really screwed up my hair so badly that I had to walk to Sephora down the street and buy some expensive conditioner to get it back to normal.

Circus Circus as far as a review...what is there to say that hasn't already been said?? You either like it or you don't.

Ritzy? Nope.

Fond childhood Vegas memories?? You bet!! Damn, I remember how this was THE spot for a vacation. More arcade games than you'd ever find at any game place or bowling alley. Enough of them to make me dizzily overwhelmed and ready to faint! More quarters to blow on them from your parents than they would EVARRR give you during any other rational recreation time. A bunch of different areas that you could freely wander to and from without any parental helicoptering. Ahhhh those were the days... Even us kids got to irresponsibly indulge in Vegas!!!

But now, a fast forward to the miserable adult reality of today...

Circus Circus is now one of the last surviving original 80's boom hotels on The Strip. Unbeknownst to most people, it has a pretty damn good steakhouse too! I haven't had the chance to visit in forever and a half though, sadly! =( The recently renovated rooms aren't half bad either, especially if you are looking to crash out for a bit and be on your merry way.

There is a walking distance CVS on the next block which is quite convenient. You aren't in the heart of The Strip so you can make an escape to I-15 quick and easy. Heading to downtown is easy as well since you are on the north end of strip hotels.

I've actually found this to be the most convenient spot overall for activities happening at the LVCC, since it's walking distance but just far enough away to avoid the mega-people-and-traffic-jam that happens with big events. No need to deal with parking headaches, taxis, or any of that annoying crapola. This is especially key when an event ends and around 25,000 people pour out of the LVCC at the same time and look for transportation to vacate the area.

Industrial Road in the back is the locals' "secret" back road to avoid all of the hoopla and delays of Las Vegas Blvd. Shhhhh don't tell anyone though!! ;)

Overall I've been pleasantly surprised with this spot after rediscovering it a couple years ago (after not staying here for a LOOOOOOONG time). For quick trips where I need to take care of some business in town and need to avoid delays and headaches, it works and works quite well.

With live circus acrobats still performing overhead, the big smile I get from reminiscing over childhood fun here is also part of the lure too!

3.5 stars, I'll round up to 4 just because!

I would give this hotel a half star if I could.  Dirty...our bathroom smelled like urine when we checked in.  They did come clean it after I complained. Not enough parking actually parking was disastrous, no answer when calling for room service.  I left a $5 tip for the housekeeper on the 2nd day and they only fixed one bed and only left 2 towels for 3 people. No housekeeping showed up on day 4.    The pool is overcrowded and the water is literally dirty with debris on the bottom and floating throughout .  Perfect example of you get what you pay for.

I swear teleportation exists. How do I know this? Because of Circus Circus. Everytime I step inside Circus Circus, I am instantly transported into Tijuana. It is so weird. I can't figure it out. I mean, I don't want to be in Tijuana, but it happens everytime. Soooo weird. 

But I will give Circus Circus a fat high five for their midway games and their theme park. I'm not sure if I'd bring my future kids there in fear they might be kidnapped and sold, but nonetheless I. HAD. SO. MUCH. FUN. THERE as a kid. Man, I remember fucking every other kid up at TIC-TAC-TOE, watergun races, bean bag toss, rock climbing... pretty much everything. I'm not even sure how my parents were able to fit all my prizes in the car. I was like Jeremy Lin before Jeremy Lin was even invented.  COME AT ME BRO!

This is still the best place for kids in vegas.  MGM has a better pool with the lazy river, but for kids to play, you can't beat Circus Circus.  The only reason I give it four stars, is I wish the hotel rooms was more updated and less smoke throughout the hotel.  The adventure dome is smoke free, but while walking throughout the hotel, it's very smokey.  They should have more smoke free environments.

umm, this place is very colorful. and it looks like it is a lot of fun. i stayed in a really nice room. but this place did not feel... safe i guess you could say. I was sitting down and eating with my family and 3 people got arrested like in 10 min increments one, for hitting his wife, one for stealing something and i don't remember the last one. i would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Don't be fooled by the pictures online. This place is so outdated, its unbelievable. The rooms look like funeral home settings. The walls are super thin. The decor looks like its from the medieval times. Very, very trashy place with an odd smell. I checked in and checked out literally 20 minutes later. Avoid this place like the plague.

First thing is they have another building. I went on booking.com for a room and when I got here they said I could upgrade to the circus circus main hotel for just under $12 so I did when I took a shower I was standing in standing water the tub wouldn't dream during the shower the shower head was way to low, was not strong at all it was Dripping everywhere but the right places. This was an upgrade I would not have wanted to see the annex rooms.

You first walk in and there is a massive line to check in(it was like this no matter what time we passed by) when we finally got a rep there was a problem with our reservation the clerk was rude and unhelpful (that should have been our first clue not to stay) we rented two rooms one was in the tower which wasn't bad just outdated but clean the other was across the street in the bungalows we would have had a better room at the super 8 there are a lot more hotels right on the strip for just a little more I won't be back here

At Circus-Circus right now. It's okay, but that's about it. Good for kids with the arcade and the circus show. The "Fitness Center" is pathetic, small, old and limited equipment. Not a fitness center at all. Food is pricey. We came here for the "family friendly" atmosphere and aren't gambling so can't say much about the casino. The Adventure Dome is great for kids, but they should have included it or at least sharply reduced admission price with the hotel cost. WiFi took a while to access, but good 3\/4 bar signal is okay. Wouldn't stay here again. Oh well....

literally worst experience ever!! I was moving to vegas and had to wait a night to move into my new place so I just got a cheap room and woke up with a bug bite on my toe thought probably a spider. NO NO NO it was scabies! should have spent more money on a hotel room cause I have had to spend hundreds of dollars on Dr. bills. By the way scabies  are mites that live under your skin so gross. It is all because they could not wash the sheets. Do not stay here. Don't do it! spend a little extra on a hotel room. The water was also black when I turned on the sink.

I had THE MOST amazing service when calling to book my room and was so impressed that I brought a thank you gift to Grace! My room wasn't awful but almost EVERYONE I encountered upon check in and during our stay was awful! I have a disabled child and was refused assistance to my room with all my bags. Pool closes at 7 p.m. When it's still over 100 degrees!, my neighbors were fighting LOUDY starting at 3 am....just overall a huge disappointment! I will NEVER be back....ever

Had to call security on my neighbors on both sides of us (they were friends of each other) on two different nights and finally had to move to another room to save me from beating 1 of the ladies for cussing me out after her kids were screaming outside my room door and banging hard on our common wall and did nothing to control them. I asked the front desk upon checkout if they were going to do anything for me and they said "No". " We cannot control what other guests do". Oh yes you can and should but coming from a supervisor, I figured they care about occupancy and not the customer experience. I will never stay at Circus Circus again, and If I pay more for peace and quiet, so be it. Buyer beware!! You get what you pay for. Security was the only people who seemed to care hence the 2 stars, no-one at the front desk could give a #@%^.

To be quite honest we will come back but I would love to speak with anyone about my stay particularly this last time. (Oct. 7th\/8th) We have been there several times but this time was disappointing. We were charged way over the standing price for the Manor room we had to get because we came late and didn't reserve which is understandable to have to get the Manor not reserving but over charging was not ok. No blankets on the beds, dirty carpets and peeling wall paper. On top of that we had to pay for vallet. uh since when??? I knew it was coming and is decent rate really. Upon one of our trips we ate at Vince Neils. I highly suggest going to a restaurant such as the peppermill. There was a German cockroach in our food and the manager did nothing to correct it. The staff is friendly. The cocktail waitresses most are super great. Next time will be sure to reserve our room. Don't get a Manor room, if you can, avoid it.

This is one of the older hotels still remaining on the strip. It's known as the most kid friendly, but it could do with an upgrade.
We took the kid with us this time. She is five so it was fine for her. The rooms appeared to be upgraded. At least the one we were in appeared to be. 
However, when we got to our room, one the beds was missing a bed spread. Called the front desk and the Housekeeper guy brought us a bed cover, that goes over the bed before you put the sheets on. We told him that wasn't what we asked for. Had a bit of attitude and said that's what the front desk told him. Apparently sounded like he'd been verbally abused by the guests a lot. Anyhow we got it all sorted out and he came about 10 mins later with two new bedspreads, so that they would match.

Adventure dome was transformed into Frightdome so they closed early at 6pm so they could prepare for 7pm admissions.

Not a bad place to stay, but the staff could be a bit more friendly. I think we'll  opt for Orleans next time.

Marisela the desk receptionist was so helpful in finding an adjacent room for our family. She is so helpful & patient to our inquiries. Your company is so lucky to have her & we do recommend a perfect 10 for her if there is. Keep up the good work Marisela & hope to see you again in the future.

The hotel room I was staying in was so bad that the wall paper was coming off the heater didn't work and it was so cold in the room and I think there was mildew in the restroom and my trip to Vegas was bad because the hotel room was bad I have to cut my trip short all because of the bad the hotel room was and when I went to complain I found out that two worker already told the front desk not to rent that room out and when I left I call the hotel to complain and all they told me was why didn't I complain while I was still there so they're no help there so if I could I would gave this hotel 0 stars

I give them 5 stars because they know how to entertain the kids. I love that they have games for $1,$2,$3 etc.  They also have a free show like every 20mins. I spent $100 on games and my daughter's both won more then twice. 

Also a few of my family members played the slots and won $300 and $250.

Went here a couple of years ago and immediately wasn't too thrilled with the place.  The lobby was stuffed with people waiting to check in and smelled like a ripe locker room, and the line stretched way back to check in, so I got to "enjoy" that smell for longer than I care to remember.

Don't really have anything to say about the staff here;  they looked overworked at the time, so I felt for them there.   We stayed in the Sunrise tower in some generic rooms, and had fun with an elevator that always seemed to want to bypass our floor on the way up, so we'd have to go up a few floors and then ride the elevator back down to reach our floor.  Very weird!   Beds were on the soggy cheap side of things, I prefer a firm supportive bed.  Couldn't hit the buffet to see how that was because it was so packed during operating hours, so I was hitting the food court at the Riveria across the street.

Shopping location was busy but had some decent stuff going on there.  Had my first oxygen bar and water massage experience there....now that was a good time, especially when I was on the bar for who knows how long! ha ha!

One star is misleading and too good for this place.  The only good thing about this place is the very very cheap price. But I guess as with anything, you get what you pay for in Vegas. The hotel rooms are gross, it's like an outdated and unkempt motel 6. I'm positive the antigens in the carpet are contributing to the thick stale air in the rooms, the hallway and the lobby. I feel gross breathing here. It's still early in my stay, but the only warm and willing to be helpful  person at the hotel was the one trying to get the check in line moving, which was crazy long. The check in person looked and acted like she had a big ol'stick up her butt. (I don't think she was born with smile muscles) Although I was impressed that she knew our questions before we were done asking them. She did answer our questions like they were the stupidest questions any one could ask and we're idiots who should've known the answers. She seemed so bothered to help us. I know Circus circus is busy, but hell so are we and we're also in a hurry. Note to circus circus; when someone is kind and warm to you in the middle of your shitty shift, the appropriate response is to thaw, not deflect. Ppl come here with cash for an experience, this city is plastered with phony fantasies, it's easier to fake a warm smile than to fake who you are. 

The money I earn doesn't come with out sacrifice and the money my husband earns doesn't come with out facing death. When we came here to celebrate my 40th I expected an experience that would supersede others, especially the hotel experiences. But instead, my hotel experience has been subpar and just as bad as any mediocre motel experience, this place is like staying in a dingy old motel that'll give you fear of taking back bed bugs. Don't spend your precious-hard earned-long hours-short weekend- overtime money here. You'll wish, the whole time in your room, that you splurged.

Show up and housekeeping hasn't even cleaned the room. And whoever designed this place needs to be fired. There is no easy\/quick way to get to where you need; (take one elevator to one floor, walk across the entire place to get to another elevator to bring you to your floor). The elevators are always super busy yet there is no stair access from the 2nd floor up. Nobody will answer questions or provide any helpful info. Oh and then there are the hundreds of screaming little children.

I came here for my birthday. I reserved some room from the manor not knowing it was not in the casino. When I checked in and went to the room someone walked in on me. It was dirty and not up to dated. I went to complain and told them this isn't how I wanted to spend my birthday. The front desk lady was so awesome she upgraded me to the west tower with a view of the strip. also she gave me a flower. The room was awesome and clean nice bathroom. The casino it self was really nice and clean. I would definitely come back to celebrate again.

This place was built into the 60's and it shows. The whole place smells like Lysol because they've used so much of it over the years. The rooms are really cheap for a reason, they are old and basic. This place attracts low end clientele and families with lots of kids. It's filled to the brim with super cheap souvenir stores and gimmicky shops.  If you are desperate, this place will do in a pinch. But, avoid it if you can. Ironically, they have the best steakhouse in town (seriously).

Ugh.  The casino is ok, if you're all right with an abundance of children running around while you're losing your hard earn coin in slots, but the hotel itself is yucky.  I'm seriously never staying in a two star hotel again after this experience.  I know, I know, what do you expect for a cheap room, but still - I'd like to sleep in a bed where I don't feel every single spring.  I can deal with cheap blankets, and corrosive towels, but feeling the springs in my bed is where I draw the line.

Bad.  I have six years living in aircraft carriers in 200 person berthings and this hotel is worse.  Do you like mold and ants - if so, this hotel will deliver.  The bathroom had mold in the tub, sink, on the ceiling, and around the toilet- not a spot or two of mold, I'm talking about all the grout within 24 inches of the tub was covered with it.  The sheets were not even close to being clean.  I knew when I selected this hotel that it was old and of course there are a lot of children- I thought my kids would have fun, but these issues weren't related to being an older hotel- this is poor cleaning and lack of attention to detail.
Yaaay!! watch out for the droves of stinky sticky children everywhere!! This place is good for cheap family vacations otherwise stay away. Old run down lots of low scale patrons

Only reviewing the breakfast buffet.

$15 per person, best deal on the strip. The food is decent, when you remember what you are paying and where you are paying. The made to order omelet station is outstanding, delicious and fresh, you can also substitute egg whites which I liked. They have EVERYTHING here. Eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, biscuits and gravy, country fried "steak", pancakes, waffles, "special" eggs, rice, beans, french toast...I could go on. It's huge and you won't go hungry. Being a little hungover going in it was the perfect way to satisfy my need to eat a lot of really bad food. They also have an assortment of pastries and fruits if you're interested. 

Side note: this place actually feels like a circus. There were SO many unsupervised children running around it was out of control. They are all crying and screaming and throwing food everywhere. It felt like a trashy Denny's. I don't think I would ever eat here again.

GOT ROBBED WHILE WE WERE SLEEPING IN THE ROOM. 

Stayed at this hotel for Life Is Beautiful Festival  and on our first night while sleeping on the bed, someone came in our room and stole mine and my boyfriends wallets. Reported it to hotel security which is basically useless coz they just took a written report and say that corporate will get in touch with us. Been calling their risk management department and they don't have answers. All they say is that they are "investigating" what happened. The hotel manager (Rolando or something) was very smug and arrogant throughout this whole ordeal and even had THE NERVE to tell us and I quote each word: "We have five thousand rooms we don't have enough security for this place. Things happen". REALLY????? That's what you're going to say to a PAYING GUEST. 

This hotel and its is a shit show. A SHIT. SHOW.

They do run this place like a circus.

Smoke filled, crowded, and run down are the words I would use to describe the place. The property is also far from the mono rail. I couldn't wait to leave. We watched 1 show that lasted 10 minutes while waiting 40 to see the show. It was meh at best. My son said the place is ok. Not good, just okay.

Awful experience. In addition to the $24 daily resort fee (which we expected), they charged us about $60 more with no explanation and when questioned about it the answer was, "this is just what the room costs sir, I don't care what the amount you booked for said."  

We asked for a fridge in the room and were told that it would be up in 20-30 minutes... 3 hours later and still no fridge.  Overall, dirty hotel, incompetent staff and poor service.  Also, room was filthy with an un-flushed toilet when we showed up.

I checked in early into the hotel and my room wasn't ready but the attendant upgraded my room. The room was clean had a great view. Con- I could hear the water pipes from the other rooms, although I was in a non smoking, periodically I could smell that after order of a cig but It wasn't that bad because I was the only on in the room who smelled it.

Overall the hotel was decent for the price.

Unfortunately I can't go lower than one star...

Where to begin..

First off the entire hotel smells like perfume and cigarettes. I understand it's Vegas and people smoke but this place really needs to make a better effort to filter the air or make designated smoking areas like other casinos have. 

Secondly there are stains EVERYWHERE in this place. And by everywhere I mean EVERYWHERE. Pretty sure there was dried blood on the walls of our hotel room. There are crusty looking stains on the shower walls and on the carpet of the room. 

All of the sheets on the beds have some sort of rip or are super scratchy and uncomfortable. 

End of the day, spend a little more money and get away from this dump.

This place reminds me of my childhood vacations in Vegas. This is definitely one of the old parts of Vegas that has a special place in little children's hearts, as it holds one of the most amazing arcades ever.

If I could give zero stars I would. This was they worst experience at a hotel. Check in the line was so long, I upgraded to a deluxe room and upon entering the rooms they both reeked of cigarettes and the floor had dog food all over the floor as if it was never cleaned. There were no seating besides the bed with a big open space near the window, I think a Best Western or Motel Six would have been better. There are better hotels the same price, and DO NOT STAY in the Manors across street.

You basically get what you pay for. But I have to say all the staff was super friendly, especially the one lady at valet. The room was decent for the price. It was safe, there is a lot of construction going on around it that makes it look seedy but there will be new casinos open soon around it. I came with 4 young adults (17-20 in age) and they were fine with it. We left to venture out anyways. I would stay again if on a tight budget.

I love the fact that the kids have a place of there own at the Adventuredome arcade when we stay here. All day pass for $26 dollars and they're gone for the day. Krispy Kreme and the Pizzeria were an added bonus and convenience. But the rooms are completely over priced at $210 per night!!! 

We booked the run of the house room online and was placed on the 25th floor in the west tower which gave us great view and proximity to the adventuredome, but for $210 can I at least get a mini fridge and microwave or a suite. I think its really odd that a family hotel doesn't offer a family suit unless you're VIP.
Good price, room was actually nicer than I had expected. Staff was friendly

We had a great time at Circus Circus! There is a lot of things to do at this hotel but it is a 15 min walk to the strip. The customer service was great and the room was clean and smelled nice, we would stay here again, the price is right and we enjoyed our 3 night stay.

This is one of the oldest hotels on the strip, a lot of people don't like this and find it unfit for their needs. I personally have stayed at this property 4 times now, each time I experience something new and I personally have had good experiences each time (which is why I keep going back).

Some tips: try to avoid the Manor suites, they are far from the central complex (casinos, Adventuredome, circus acts and the arcade). Also the Manor Suites are very basic and very small with bedding that appears to be from the 70's.

The West tower is possibly the most modern and spacious.

My favorite is the Casino Tower rooms due to the location and the amenities of the room.

This is definitely a place to experience, a lot of history on the strip and a very unique place. Family-friendly for sure and also kind on the wallet :)

Visited on a 3 day holiday weekend. Arrived Friday afternoon, quick and easy checkin. Ladies restrooms were a wreck, broken toilets, no toilet paper in the stalls that did work, trash all over the floor. Reported to lobby desk restroom needed service.  Her response: not my job, use the other restroom on the other side.  Stayed in west tower on 7th floor. During peak times over 15 minute wait for elevators. Higher floors (21 and up)didn't seem to have this problem. Floor 7 reeked of marijuana. The rest of the casino smelled of stale air and cigarette smoke. The deli cafe food was good, but one of the ladies taking orders was rude. No smile, no thank you, no apology for getting my order wrong. 
1 star was for the midway games and entertainment for the toddler and 8 year old I had. They loved the midway!  
Found out on the last day Excalibur has a similar section for kids ( no circus acts though) and the atmosphere seemed much better. Kids loved the dinner and show. Trying there next time. Will not be returning to Circus Circus

Check in was better than any other hotel in the strip. That was the high point. 

Even though we were on a non-smoking floor, the room smelled horrible and opening the window didn't help. 

We were on the top floor of the Casino tower which must have been next to their air conditioning system and the elevator control room. LOUD and very hard to sleep. While the air conditioning was a constant hum, the elevators were intermittent.

The final nail in this hotel's coffin for me was a pipe break that left us without hot water on our last day. 

I won't be staying here again.
The kids had a blast on the rides...very smokey in the casino. I would never go their if I didn't have kids

This hotel made my experience in Vegas terrible! A salesperson named HEIDI cancelled my reservation without telling my party and I. The worst part is that after a 6 hour flight we couldn't check in until 4 hours later. The worst customer service ever! Management is rude and tried to say someone named Heidi didn't exist yet Jet Blue was on the phone with her. ALSO, after the 4 hour wait the manager gave us a complimentary dinner but when we went to order we were informed that the manager had no MONEY on her account.

Overall, you get for what you pay for here. Cheap rooms for cheap service. Pay an extra 20 bucks for a better hotel.

you get what you pay for! made the mistake booking a room in this dump, first off finding a parking space in garage was nearly impossible then we get to check in and i have to wait in a huge ass line there system is to yell next customer and you have to keep alert to who's calling you real state of the art oh then the elevators are a joke real small and take forever one stayed on 2nd floor and never came down to lobby i stayed in tower so had to hike to another elevator to reach my dismal room with ripped pillows and sheets ,broken showerhead and alarm clock real classy. I have to say the worst experience was the pool we have a five year old the pool rules are posted no running,diving horseplay well guess the sorry excuses for lifeguard dont care there were little kids ranging in age from 1-6 in the 3 ft section of pool and there were bigger kids running ,diving and doing cannonballs into the pool around them i observed this going on i yelled to punk  kid pretending to be on baywatch and told him to do his job he basically told me off and we had words i loaded up the family and left, great way to treat your guests!, dont go here spend a few extra bucks and enjoy your stay instead.

I rated this two stars because of the folks who work here. Everyone has been great. They are courteous and pleasant... but the "Manors" could use some work. The walls are so thin I had the opportunity to witness a complete argument between next doors inhabitants.  For the love of all things holy... she WANTS the pan cakes!!! And, I don't care who bought what or that you spent your last ten bucks on... STOP yelling, or even... talking at 6 am.  Coming back after lunch, they had their TV on normal volume and I swear I could follow the entire show!

The hot water lasted about 7-10 minutes in the shower, and wouldn't shut off all the way. My wife had to wait 15 minutes for it to build back up... The casino was hard to breath in - circulation sucked. The safe is closed and locked in the hotel room and noone could open it.

Honestly this lil gem could be great. A little leadership and this property could soar!! We won't stay here again... but I suppose it's good for for a bunch of dudes\/girls coming to party and not care about where they sleep... or a with a bunch of kids that will wreck it anyway.

Oh! And the "F--k Me" smeared on the wall behind the door in some unknown black substance wasn't quite the greeting we had expected.  Thank you for handling that so quick and giving us extra coffee, sweet cleaning Lady Maria! She had a smile and was so nice!

UPDATE: (I dropped a star.)  A loud, wierd buzzing goes off at 7:15 am on Dec 15th. My wife goes to check it out because the sounds are unfamiliar. She calls the front desk and is met with a shorr, frazzled and very put off attendant (whom I'm sure has answered several calls about the same thing). She says it's a fire alarm and was a prank. I understand stress... but yikes! Anyway, of course she couldn't know what I do for a living. She couldn't possibly know that I know that the intermittent strange and loud buzzing in the hallway doesn't randomly sound off when a pull station is activated. No, that's a continuous alarm. So, was it a faulty sensor? Did an employee try to reset the control panel? Who knows... but being rude to an abruptly awoken GUEST of your hotel? Bummer folks. Absolute bummer. (Did I mention now the neighbors are awake now too and once again TV and conversation fills my room. So much for sleep.)

Usually I stay at Harrah's or Flamingo to save on money and to be in the heart of the strip but because I waited at the last minute to book reservations, the prices were too high at those places and the cheapest hotel on the strip I could find was at Circus Circus. I read some reviews about the hotel and they sounded scary, mostly about the Manor Lodges which are separated from the main hotel. So I booked a room in the Skyrise Tower (connected to main hotel) which turned out not to be so bad. Pros: friendly hotel clerks, newly-remodeled and clean room as advertised on their website, clean carpet, comfy beds, no stains on the sheets, no roaches, no bedbugs, spacious bathroom, lots of storage space, easy elevator rides and relatively easy walk to main hotel for dining and Midway for circus acts, and nearby parking garage.  Cons: no mini fridge (but I heard they could be rented), walls kinda thin (I could hear a baby crying next door, but fortunately I didn't hear it until the day we left), cigarette smoke smell in the bathroom the last day (probably through the vents which I told hotel clerk Lulu about because I didn't want to be charged for any cigarette smell cleaning since none in my party smokes), smell of pot in the parking garage, sketch characters loitering by the garage (we did, however, see hotel security escorting two of these characters off the premises) and location of hotel is kinda far from the hub of the strip. Overall, I wouldn't mind staying here again if my first hotel preferences weren't available.

I booked our room at the Manor. So when I came to check in the lady asked if I wanted to upgrade to the Skyrise hotel for 10 dollars more on the 27th flr. and  it was okay.  The only thing I can complain about is the elevators. Out of the 6 elevators they had on 1 to 2 were working which caused alot of madness especially around check in and out ..

Difficulty navigating around trying to find our room, and we were out in the manor rooms which aren't even connected to the main tower. We had three women to our group, and walking to our room was uncomfortable. Every single man we passed by had to make some sort of comment to us and they weren't too keen on letting us pass by in the hall. Yeah it is Vegas and it happens a lot but it was just a little more tense since we couldn't get passed them and they even waited in the halls to see what room we were in. 
The room itself was not great, it looked like a motel that you stop at on the side of the road. There was mold in the bathroom and around the room, peeling wallpaper, and still some remnants of the last people who stayed in the room. Our neighbors were so loud we could hear EVERYTHING they were saying. ALL NIGHT. 
We had to walk across a parking lot and a busy street to get back to the main building so we could get a cab. And as a safety factor for three women walking alone, did not feel comfortable once again.
In the morning, we realized we had some bed bug bites. Not really the nice experience we were hoping for.
Would not recommend and will not ever return.

Circus Circus is a great place for families with kids to stay while on vacation. The rooms are nice and there are plenty of activities for both kids and adults. The Midway Acts are incredible and complimentary every day, so it's a perfect show. The performers are very talented and come from all around the world. 

The Adventuredome is Las Vegas' only indoor theme park with more than 25 rides and attractions. They have thrill rides for adults and kiddie rides. I've taken my cousin there many times and her favorite attraction is the 4-D theater showing a SpongeBob Squarepants film.

If you're looking for a place to eat, the Pizzeria is delicious and very well priced. They have incredible buffalo wings. Also, I LOVE Vince Neil's Eat-Drink-Party! I highly recommend the buffalo chicken fingers.

.

First of all this casino is quite dilapidated being the oldest one on the strip. Inside, it has many fun games with rewards as exchange including dolls and other toys. I recommend coming here to play the games and also gamble on the older non-digital, coin-based machines. But other than that, for dining or food, I would definitely go elsewhere. The front entrance of the casino does not even have bellboy to help you get a taxi, so Uber or Lyft is highly recommended to help get around.

Do not book your room at the MANOR. It's literally across the street from the casino and is a much older type room. We booked our rooms here with a group of friends through expedia and thought we got a great deal , but NOPE! We ended up paying extra for the upgrade and stayed at the main tower. It was about $25 more per night. Rooms are smelly and old. I don't think I will get a room here again. The casino however is a great place for entertainment for both adults and kids upstairs !

The room was clean. The AC and Heater work. There was no trace of cigarette smoke in my non smoking room, which is a big plus! The room was quiet.  They have a nice selection of restaurants on the promenade level.  The water pressure for the shower was pretty good, and the water was hot enough. However, as one reviewer noted. There are hobos and there are  not part of the hotel's circus act. They need more security on the outside. The hair dryer that came with my room was 1400 watts, barely enough to dry my long hair. It was so weak, I thought it was broken or on the wrong setting. Also the side table in my room was wobbly and old. One of my light fixtures seem to be broken. The decor looked old and tacky. No free wifi unless you go the Mac Donald's down the street.

Pretty much this place is underrated. We had a great time here with the children. if you aint about family fun in vegas, screaming kids, or saving a little money on a hotel room, save yourself that "im too good" or snobby ass review and book at the wynn or stay elsewhere. This place caters to kids and adults. Arcades, fairgames, blackjack and craps plus circus acts. My kids had a blast and so did the wife and I. 3 good stars from me. Book a west tower hotel, nice.
Not worth the price. Cold shower. Dirty bathroom. Dirty sheets. Avoid staying in the manor.

LOL. Circus Circus. I don't mean to laugh in a bad way, but I love the dirty old charm of this place. It smells of bad carpeting in the game area. The arena is pretty cool for indoor rides and cheap beer.

This place is kinda depressing because of the run down decor.

The good thing is their black jack tables are the lowest in the lv area that I know of. 

Sometimes $3-$4 but then you cant win much anyway.

Not that other reviews unduly influence my own, but the people on this page are utterly entertaining. And in the spirit of not throwing in a statistical outlier, I won't put up a 5-star here. But I had a great time here.

Mind you I did not stay here - I am cheap, but not THAT cheap. My friends and I wandered over here around 11 PM looking for something to do and found the second level with all the carnival games. We had a blast with the horse racing game (where you slide the ball down the ramp and if you drop the ball in the red hole, the horse advances farther), the water race (shoot the clown's mouth), and a wide variety of games I had not played since I was 12. Granted the folks working here looked completely miserable (it was past midnight by the time we got to some of them) and I felt bad for them since there wasn't much business. But I really loved this place as a kid and returning here made me nostalgic for a time of my life that is long gone, save in my mind. 

Don't be so cruel to this place, Yelpers! Just don't stay here and you'll be fine. It's only a 15 minute walk from the Wynn, where I was. Now that's a fine place to sleep. ;-)

I shouldn't have come back here as an adult. Should've kept the fond memories I had of this place as a kid - as a kid.

The idea is great, fun trapeze shows, bright whimsical colors, carnival type games, rides and snacks...but why does it have to be so GHETTO? 

Not only was this place a big dome of dirt, they RIPPED ME OFF!!! I kept trying to change my paper money into coins, and they kept keeping some for themselves!!! 

THIS PLACE RIPS YOU OFF! They would change my dollars and keep a quarter in various machines. Then when I would ask an employee to help me out, they would say, "I'll be right back," only NEVER TO RETURN!

WHAT A JIP!!! 

This place is infested with GRIME and CHANGE MACHINES that TAKE your MONEY! And you're NOT even gambling! 

TERRIBLE ESTABLISHMENT!!! TERRIBLE.

An affordable choice for families but I would not recommend for couples. The rooms are decent but the hotel itself is outdated and weird gross smells everywhere you walk. The restaurant we wanted to go to was closed and so was the adventuredome. The people in entry are beyond annoying trying to sell you a "better" deal every time  you walk in lobby they pester you and you have to walk in lobby when leaving room. We will probably never stay here again:(

I just got back from my trip and decided why not leave a review. My sister and I were looking for a inexpensive stay on the strip for 4 days and circus circus was the spot. But as soon as we checked in and got our room it was on the other side of the parking lot not even attached to the casino. It was where all the poor rejected people go to stay "The manor" I feel bad for people that paid anymore then 33 dollars a night because damn it was kind of nasty. If the show hotel impossible could come look at the location damn he would be pissed. It should just be just taken down and burned. The first night in our room we found a bed bug !! Worse nightmare ever!! It's not like the rooms were kept but it was infested with bugs as well. We demanded another room and they hooked us up with a suite for the rest of our stay. That's why I gave it 3 stars instead zero for that! Next time I'll pay extra for a better place to stay !

Won't stay her again. Room smells like plastic Valet parks my totally SUCKS since they changed over to the new parking policies. They don't even have enough employees to park cars straight ghetto!!! I've always avoided this place and I now know why

Get what you paid for, I arrived with my husband and two kids, it's our very first visit, which I told the lady who checked us in, Maria, she didn't seem to care in the least. Next thing I ask what's the best route from my room to the pool, cuz the kids were dying for the pool, all I got was "follow the signs" unfortunately we got lost and since we were in west tower the pool being in sky tower it was a ridiculous amount of walking. Don't they have a "hotel guest" only way so we don't have to pass the casino with all our pool wear? Another question I had was do you have a hotel shop in case we forget anything, what I wanted was milk and they said No nothing like that here, so I was bummed, next morning I pass by a store on the lobby which did have milk, pretty disappointing in how the employees who work here aren't knowledgable in their own hotel. The ones who never stopped bothering us where the ones who wanted us to visit the timeshare, they where the only decent employees to answer our questions. I'm bummed that our first trip to Vegas wasn't as exciting for the kids, we will have to book elsewhere cuz I want to come again, hopefully better service.
I like the casino with the circus acts above the gambling floor.

I won $320-ish here on a penny slot.I did actually receive drink from one of the waitresses finally, which is more than I can say for most of the casinos I hit up. I did like the floor as it was not too busy but was a lot of fun with all the colorful, but dated, decor and the acrobat shows every so often. I think I might come here agian, but I would hope the rooms are more modern.
