I stayed here all the time when I was little, and loved every minute of it. There was nothing cooler than staying up late in a foreign room and watching Circus Circus "Clown Cops" on TV. Now that I am older, I realize that this place has really gone down the drain. There is duct tape covering holes in the carpet, and the bedding looks like it might get you pregnant if you sleep on it. I never knew there was a "carnival" type floor, my parents probably didn't tell me about it so I wouldn't put their life savings into a video game. Now when I go to Vegas, I stay at The Golden Nugget, which has an amazing yet freezing pool.

It use to be an awesome hotel in the 90s. After coming back to this hotel in 20 years of none visit duration, I finally made a stop to Circus Circus. I didn't spend a night here but I came to play gamble and let my friend's children play the games. When I arrived to this hotel, I saw many places that needed an immediate repair before accidents may occur. 

When I parked inside the garage 2, and walked towards the three elevators, I saw one elevator completely out of service without an out of order signs.  The elevator call buttons didn't have a light to show up and down, and I was curious to know if the maintenance guys were ever to come and fix the issues.

When I walked inside the hotel, it was nice to see the old interior designs but I think its time to renovate some areas because it is getting pretty boring... Overall I was disappointed.

I recently stayed at Circus Circus this past weekend! After reading reviews I almost cancelled my stay and booked another hotel the same week, after noticing a lot of the hotels were sold out I changed my mind and just kept our reservations! I couldn't have been more content with it, the room was clean, no bed bugs no roaches! Room service brought us more blankets as it was a little cold in the room, the shows (my mother in law took my daughter to) I heard were fantastic, the pizza place that delivers to your room was pretty good and worth the $35 we spent on wings and pizza, especially since we were so tired from walking and were super hungry! I did have 2 tiny I purchased a water bottle from the vending machine and it got stuck I called the help desk and they told me to come down for a refund I went down stairs and they told me they don't offer refunds after the man had just told me he would refund me the 9.00 I just payed for some water & my room key (no I didn't have it next to any cards or change) and it would stop working MORE THEN ONCE & BECAUSE RESERVATIONS WERE NOT UNDER MY NAME THEY WOULDN'T ALLOW ME TO RESET IT AND My new born was in the room sleeping since I had walked to get a water right outside my door so I asked security to open it since my baby was there and she was nice enough to ask my husbands name and see what the room was under and gladly opened the door for us!

This is probably the worst hotel you could get,I'm so disgusted on how dirty each room is  and they somtimes will not wash the old guest sheets and just redo them as they were never used this is totally disgusting take a black light with you and flash it over there bedsheets you will see they were never washed how could such a big hotel be so cheap and disgusting for not washing there bedsheets for new guest how could you reuse old sheets wow I'm so shocked,also this room is so out dated needs remodeling,the rooms definitely need better care and a new look and they also need better showers and better sinks and better flooring,other then that my biggest concern is them not washing sheets after each guest but rather just redoing them this totally is wrong and it's really disgusting,I won't return intill I see proof of bed sheets been washed and changed intill then I will never return to this hotel again.

Parking was free and we got directions from a person in the lobby.  Those are the only stars under that big top.

The drink server, an Asian female, was rude and disrespectful.  Perhaps she forgot that her job is not only to deliver beverages.  She is there to provide customer service.

This server left us waiting 20 minutes for a drink.  When we got up to finally go get our own, she was off getting drinks for a group that just came in.

When asked about it, she said that we " better stay in one spot or your drinks get thrown in the dumpster "

Are you F@#$ing kidding me?   Blew 40 bucks to get smart mouth attitude from a server.  

In case no one said it before, that is NEVER the way to do business.

I came here especially because it was the setting of a Bond movie.  Thanks for making bad memories one lousy service person at a time.

I came with such high hopes for the reputation of great service.

I guess that only matters if you have some unknown special status.  

A very canned response.  I bet that's a great copy and paste response.

You lose a star for the lack of effort to remedy.

Sorry doe's NOT make it right.

I was treated like trash by a person whose very existence is to be hospitable.  That is your whole business model.  To be a gracious host while I spend my damn hard earned money.

Get it right or get out of the business.

I don't have much to say other than I felt like I had to delouse myself after leaving. My man and I went to the Steak House for our super sexy date night (a night where we get dressed up and have a nice dinner). We had heard great things about this place . The problem is you have to go through a good portion of the casino to get there. It reminded me of going to Tijuana as a kid....dirty and vendors selling cheap crap everywhere. I will come back to take the monkeys to the Adventuredome to ride the kiddie rides but that's about it.

Just got here reserved 2 rooms and I must say so fast the last hour has been the WORST EXPERIENCE. Number 1 they charge you to park your RV in a parking spot even without hookups. So on top of $330 for 2 nights plus $95 in resort fees I have to pay an additional $44 to park the RV because the parking is NOT included in guest amenities. Number 2 we got here around 9ish and found out NO ROOM SERVICE ???????? R u kidding me They stuck a pizza menu in the door like this is your option. Every year we stay at SOUTH POINT and I must admit I MISS MY HOTEL. The food, the room service, no fees for parking, and the amazing late night specials they had in cafe for late night folks. My husband went downstairs to deli and $9.99 for 3 ckn strips where at South point you could get steak & eggs for only $5.99. I mean even their coupon book is a joke no free buffet for ur stay treat ur guests better. What a disappointment we will never stay at circus circus again I wish we didn't already pay this place so we could head over to south point. Don't get me started on the water line hanging out in hallways and how unsecure the RV parking lot looks hope security stays on their A game. Lesson learned next year we will be back at south point because the only thing circus circus has is their circus shows and adventure dome.thumbs down

We went here Oct 17 night. I was afraid withall the negative reviews - - - bedbugs, dirty rooms, wet carpet. 

Our stay is not bad. We have a 7 yr old
kid with us. Room is fine, it's huge. But -1 star for the smell
of smoke even though it says that west tower is a non-smoking one. 

Yes she's enjoying it. The splash pad, the pool, the adventure dome, the free circus and acrobats shows, the arcade\/game booths.
Hotel check out time is 11 AM, BUT!!!!!!Why the maid knocked my door between 9-10 I just fell asleep like an hour ago.I went out and told her" I'm leaving" ,she said" oh,ok".

Love it here. Food is decent. Arcade for kids and Free Circus Acts. All the service here is great.

Good Place Overall 
Only downside it is away from the nice parts of the Strip

The room itself was not bad. Nothing special however. The main thing that really annoyed me is that the whole weekend they were allowing people from the ACM music festival to park in the hotel parking lot. This caused such a big inconvenience to the hotel guests, as it would take over half an hour just to park. A few times the only parking left was at the veryyyyyy top of the structure. The front entrance off the strip was blocked off so we had to sit in traffic to get to the next right turn so we could go the back way. The hotel itself is very dingy. Not updated at all. The pizza restaurant was ok. Cheese tasted kind of low quality. I would say that it's a good place to stay if you have children but with the rooms so cheap, it seems to attract an undesirable crowd.

The worse hotel services that I ever been..they charge me 300$ for smoking fee and I didn't even smoke in the room and now I don't have nobody to talk with about that!!
I'm very disappointed from you guys it's the last time that I'll come to this hotel bad service bad rooms!
I'm not recommend to visit is this hotel ever.

Best casino on the strip by far. Great food and actual entertainment with the quickest valet we have seen in all of Vegas not just the strip. The rooms are dated but that is why they are the cheapest on the strip. Well worth the money except i do prefer staying at the 4 Queens on Freemont St. seeing they do not charge a resort fee like the casinos on the strip.But if you do not want to spend a lot of money and stay on the strip and want a cheap hiegh quality room and some real fun and great food Circus Circus is the place. Bu if you are not on a budget and want to spend much, much more there are better places to stay but for the money Circus Circus is a 5 star.

Checked into our room and there was a foul smell...called housekeeping and they freshened up the room...after they left, found the source of the smell...a used sock which probably made its round on the Strip...How well does housekeeping "clean" the room?

This place is okay. The problem I have with this place is they have no fridge or microwave! You have to walk like across the street to get to the pools. Parking is a hassle. Valet parking was also full! No one offered to carry our luggage to our rooms. This place offered lots of coupons in the room and you get a $20 coupon for the garden grill, buffet, and steakhouse. You also get a $10 coupon for the casino. This place is really crowded and late at night, it gets empty. My group heard the room next to us with their baby crying and they complained about our loud music. LOL. We also put a DO NOT DISTURB sign outside and someone took it. Plus, the housekeeper went in and cleaned our room even when we put it on. We didn't really see any drunk people in this hotel besides a drunk girl laying outside her room.

In preparation for a Vegas list I am putting together for future reference, I am back tracking on this review from a few years ago when I saw U2 and spent a few days in Vegas.If a deal is too good to be true, especially in Vegas, you know why. The worst hotel experience in Vegas that I have done. Way on the other side of the strip, hotel rooms are like "no tell, motels." Annoying frat boys throughout the night with shitty costumer service was the pits. I went on the strip so often just to avoid hanging out in my room. This was in the scummy part of the strip which added to the experience in a negative way. It's one of those hotels which looks great in pictures...not so much in real life. There were hidden fees when booking compared to other hotels which angered me to no extent.

OMG about Circus Circus. best prices for a GREAT hotel. Spent our honeymoon stay here and was so cheap and soooooooooooo nice. Rooms were clean, food was great. Close to everything diffenently a great place to stay. also good for kids with arcade and shows.

The price and location were ok. But the room's walls are too thin. I didn't get a good night's rest because the people in the next room were so loud. If the walls were thicker I wouldn't be able to hear them. My tip is to bring ear plugs.

Hey man, want to save money while at vegas this isnt a bad place, they have a KICK ASS arcade downstairs that beats any and i mean any of the other hotels, i remeber we used to stay at other places but me and my cousins would always walk to circus circus to have ourselves a good TIME!!!

TFR

We had to stay here during a soccer tournament and this hotel is where our team managers chose for us to stay. Everything is pretty outdated in the room. We stayed on the top floor and every time we walked out of the elevator to our hall there was a HORRIBLE smell. We didn't have hot, or even warm, showers any of the three days we stayed.

Why did I walk back into this place?  I knew it was going to be a disappointment before I went there....but my friends insisted on checking it out for old times sake.  Maybe I though it has improved since I moved away from Vegas a few years ago....or perhaps I was holding on to the past when I remembered this place as a fun joint...silly me.

The place is smoky and the crowd here is rough.  I didn't feel safe walking to\/from the parking lot.

The slot machines were busy and we didn't want to pull out our money on the blackjack tables with the rough looking crowd for fear we'd get jacked in the parking lot.  We wanted to go to the Steakhouse for dinner, but we just couldn't stand being on the property, so we decided to leave and go somewhere else.  

I'm not coming back anytime soon.

Return Factor - 1%
It's a good place to stay in Vegas if you have kids. It has a pool a nice casino and a arcade for kids and a nice show every 30 minutes

Lots of people seem to knock this place but I think that FOR THE PRICE, it was a great place to stay. Sure it is not Mandalay Bay or Wynn but for less than $50 a night and the 5th night FREE, you are not going to beat this place price wise if you want to stay on the strip (Las Vegas Blvd). And if you are bringing the kids along on a family vacation, this place has a circus and amusement park in the hotel.

Mediocre stay. As a kid I always wanted to stay at Circus Circus., simply because of the midway and Adventuredome. Never happened. Now as an adult my husband and I stayed INCASE we couldn't find a babysitter and had to take our son along. Luckily we did have a babysitter but unfortunately we were  stuck with the room... March Madness weekend, everything was mostly booked and overpriced.
Check in was at 3pm but we wanted to check in early since we arrived at 10am. Check in fee was $35., umm no thank you. So we returned around 2pm after a meal and a walk on the strip and were able to get the room by then. There was a charge of $10\/per night for the resort fee. Which includes wi-fi access, fitness room, pool etc.
Stayed in the Manor Lodge which is inconvenient because of the walk., but whatever. The bed was comfortable and the room was pretty big. The wi-fi was horrible! I could only get a "decent" signal standing by the fridge in the corner. As soon as i walked to the bed it would disconnect. WACK! Speaking of the fridge, it was broken. We couldn't chill our drinks smh.
Overall IF you can Avoid staying here, it's best. Especially if you have no children with you. But if there's no other option it's good just for sleeping\/showering etc. Really that's all you need it for anyway, right? :)

Discretionary post.

I could see how easy it is for people to not like this place, but as one recent yelper guest mentioned, you have to acknowledge you are getting what you pay for, which is mediocre at best.  Definitely not the worst place to stay, but many of you would be better off and happier spending the extra money to stay somewhere else closer to the exciting part of the strip.  If you give this place high marks, it is probably based more on the experience than the look.

Good things:

- It's cheap.  It's really not a bad choice if you're on a budget.
- It's a quick walk to the CVS in case you need a few extra things for your stay.  Less than a mile north on Las Vegas Blvd.
- They have Keurig coffee machines in the rooms rather than the ordinary ones that aren't even clean.
- Plenty of closet space for personal belongings.
- The view outside the window is not actually of a neighboring building's roof.
- FREE WIFI!  I know for a fact that there are other hotels along the strip that actually charge you for it.  This is one critical factor that can determine someone's level of happiness.

Bad things:

- It's far from the actual Las Vegas shenanigans.  A cab ride to the other side of the strip can potentially run you up as much as $20 depending on who drives you and when.
- The shops around this place don't tend to open very early.  But then again, not many people tend to wake up early in LAS VEGAS.
- You might have to deal with that turn that goes into either the parking garage that leads to the check-in desk, or into the Manor rooms.  There should be a signal light there, or at least stop signs.  Cars usually plow right through there regardless of pedestrians crossing or not.

Things that aren't necessarily good or bad, but are left up to the person to interpret and decide:

- This hotel has a ton of kids as well as gang members.  The same people who react to this can respond 2 different ways:  "How can you like gang members?" and "How can you dislike kids?"  Not all gang members are bad.  And many kids are.
- They still have CRT TVs.  Of course they work, but it's tough to watch things on those after watching flat-screens for a while.

All in all, choose to stay here if you aren't picky.  But if you're trying to "impress" someone, be ready to get laughed at.  I'll let you imagine the dialogue.

This is a good place to stay if you want really cheap and\/or you have kids. Otherwise, don't bother staying here.
It is far removed from anywhere else on the strip so you'll have to drive or go via taxi to other parts of Vegas.
It is very obnoxious and full of creepy clown stuff - but is one of the cheapest on strip locations to stay and does have lots to offer for kids (rides and circus stunts) and the casino area is okay for adults.

Yes, this IS the ghetto of the Strip.  Smelly, sketchy and very cheap. 

HOWEVER, if you're in Vegas with kids it's a must visit.  The Midway and Arcade are a blast for the little ones.  Total throw back to the shady carnival games of a day gone by (in a good way).  Toss in the free trapeze acts and my 8 & 10 year olds had a ton of fun.

That alone earned 2 stars from me.  Just wash your hands when you leave.  ;)

Omg worst hotel ever!!!!! It was so so bad! I have no words to explain how disappointed we were on circus circus! The smell was so nasty!!! It was extremely uncomfortable staying there!!! 

I don't recommend this to anyone!!!!! 

Stay away from here!!!


Even Luxor is better than this hotel! 

The staff is sure e unfriendly! They are pressuring you to go visit their centers and if uou don't want to they still pressuring you!!! 


I just can't forget that smell of the hotel! 


Discussing!!!!!!! 

And it wasn't that cheap either!! It was a pretty average hotel but the service quality was extremely poor!!!! 


The walls were super old!!! The paint was peeling off!! The tvs weee from like 1970s!!! Super super old!!! 


This hotel has to remodel or something because it's going to keep loosing all their clients!!! For sure!!!' 


Cosmopolitan is way better than his hotel!!!

Okay for the price! If you are looking for a good deal to just have a place to lay your head, I mean who actually goes to Vegas to really stay in the hotel. Well, maybe some but most want to do stuff on the strip and that's why they get a three because of how far away they are from the main part of the strip\/action. If you're not looking for that then that's a win. The rooms are old and dated, I can see my grandma going crazy with the lysol as we speak lol. I hate when places use that nasty bed cover ugh nope goes on the floor, don't ever sleep with that thing! Also finding your way around this one can be a challenge and you may end up waisting time trying to find your room and loosing more money as you're doing that, which can be fun depending on how you look at it. Overall it's not really that bad and I do like the little roller coaster they have, I went with my sister and her school we had fun. I did feel like I needed a drank tho. If you know your way around the strip and have a car it's not that bad and if not better bring some extra Uber money and Siri works just fine too. I would give them a four if they weren't so far away and had a little modern day update idk something needs to give in there feels like your on Fremont street.

Hunter S. Thompson wrote, "The Circus-Circus is what the whole hep world would be doing Saturday night if the Nazis had won the war. This is the sixth Reich." 

Circus Circus WAS a pretty neat place to go ... when I was 6.  

For some reason, it just always struck me as this cheesy place, and I never bothered coming again until fairly recently when I decided to try getting a drink at the merry-go-round bar. 

Sadly the bar is now a gelato stand. 

And this Americana gem I thought I'd re-discover in my adult years (once I was finally old enough to appreciate "Fear and Loathing") was just so uninteresting. I mean, they have free performances on the Midway, but they're so short and the wait is so long. 

Aside from the Midway, which is more and more like Chuck E. Cheese with carnival games, the rest of the place looks like any other casino.

Circus Circus appears in "Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas" as The Clown's Pocket in Las Venturas.

I hadn't been to this place since I was 12... and nothing's really changed since then. All the memories of being forced to hang out at Midway for hours on end while my family gambled came rushing back to me... 

The only thing that made it fun this time around was being around my most favorite people and competing for the most prizes won. I liked playing miniature golf at the Adventuredome (which seemed like a dirty carnival) though. I didn't want to gamble here... slots or tables. Everything just looks so old and not "Vegas-y."

This place might be nice for families with young children. I'm glad to say I will be good on coming back in about... oh, 12 years.

SO dirty, this place needs to be torn down and redone. It's filled with the trashiest people you will ever see, be sure to put your valuables in a safe place and don't let your wallet or purse out of your site BUT it's cheap and the adventure dome is fun :-)

It's so scary! Bleeding eyes!

Not sure when circus themes were ever deemed "okay" but I find Circus Circus blatantly horrific, from the huge menacing clown on their sign to the gaudy[1] interior.

It's a casino, though, and their minimum table bets are reasonable for those who aren't high-rollers. Adventuredome's fun for children, but besides that, it doesn't FEEL like a safe place (read: clowns are menacing) - why would you bring kids there (or even to Vegas)? Don't be a bad parent\/guardian!

If you hate clowns, Circus Circus is not for you! Your mileage may vary.

[1] Even by casino standards.

So where does one start when it comes to giving a review of Circus Circus. Cheap, yes! But what you save on room rates, you'll spend on cabs! Depending on which cab, what direction and what destination, expect to drop $12-20 on cab fare one way. I say this because people pick places like this to save money! Well... spend the extra cash and find a place on the strip! 

It seems that when Vegas tires of your casino you are disrespectfully sent away! Circus Circus is one of those places! You feel all renovations or any possible updates came to an abrupt end somewhere around 1987. There are parts of the hotel and casino that are virtually deserted! All I could think being from Detroit was, "and they always knock us for vacant run down buildings"! 

You just had the feeling that ownership, the city, and the guest just really didn't care about this place anymore. I didn't feel it was completely dirty. It just felt like people didn't care what the place looked and smelled like. 

Again... I recommend that you stay on the strip!

I did really enjoy my stay here ! Check in with mini suite casino room thanks to the upgrade for my birthday.  Differing from other review, it is not smell or smoky at all. Room was clean. I love the midway !
The only problem for me is the security. It would made me feel more safe if there are more security guards in self-parking garage ( i didn't see even one during my stay)

Disgusting. Old (but not in a good way). Crowded. Smelly. Oh, the adjectives could go on for this place.

I stayed here with my boyfriend for a short getaway this summer (from August 10th - August 14th). We paid about $27 a night after booking it on Expedia.com or Hotels.com or whatever.. We should have known, based on price, what we'd be getting. However, when we got there, it was confirmed that we were in fact OVER paying these people.

Checking in was ridiculous. There were people everywhere and several different lines. We eventually found the right line to be in and the lady at the Front Desk was pretty nice. She gave us a map and after 20 minutes we finally found our room on the 19th floor in the main building (thank God we weren't in the "manor," across the street). The room itself was to be expected of what we were paying, but after one night there, the sink in the bathroom clogged up (the tub started to do the same on our last night there). Of course there was no one to come and fix it. 

Also, Housekeeping NOT ONCE cleaned the room. In fact, we were left a little note upon checking in that two of the three nights we were staying there were the "days off" for our maid. Awesome..

The view was okay, but all I happened to notice about it were all the other (aka, "better") hotels we should have looked into. There's a stupid $1 fee to have the phones in the room. Well, why not just unplug the phone and take it to the front desk and keep my daily dollar? Oh, that's frowned upon. Not to mention, because of how I paid with a debit card, they put a $50 hold on my card for this stupid daily phone fee. Outrageous. Several calls to the hotel were answered with, "Well, we don't work in the accounting department. You'll have to speak with them." Eventually the hold disappeared and I figured out it was for the phone. 

Check out was a joke. There was no personality of anyone working that day at the desk. We were about the fifth people in line and it took all of two minutes to process everyone ahead of us. And there was no print out of charges or anything of the sort. They simply asked my room number and name and said "That's all. Next!" Rude, rude, rude.
I felt uneasy as I'd like to have known if there were any charges placed on my room that I hadn't approved (since being here more than ten minutes I learned it's not considered top of the line, I wanted to be sure of everything). 

I ended up leaving a shirt there, one of my favorites I'll add, but no one was ever avaliable in any sort of Lost and Found Department. I was apalled. I worked in a resort in Tucson, Arizona where every little complaint or problem was handled properly and as quickly as possible. Maybe this made me a little biased? 

Either way, skip Circus Circus and spend a little more to stay somewhere decent.

There are a lot of things that exist on this planet that are gross.

Cottage cheese.

Wet cat food.

The president's tweets.


Considering the gravity of some of the aforementioned gross things, it's hard to postulate there's room for anything else gross in the world.

Fortunately, there is. And most of it gets sucked up in a place called Circus Circus.


 I'm not actually sure where to begin.


Is it the old q-tip I found in my room?  The on-site McDonald's? The smell of the entire place that may or may not remind me of burning tires?

No clue. It's a hard call.


Despite my hesitation to partition the yuck of Circus Circus to one specific cause, I can say that it is, well, yuck.


But, my car didn't get stolen and I didn't lose an eye here. Which is an accomplishment for any place on the strip.


Can't say I'll step foot here again, and I suggest you don't, but if you do remember to wash your hands.


Wash them many times.

Let me begin with this caveat: I wasn't expecting luxury. I wasn't even expecting anything special. I got a very good price on our room. All I was expecting a decent room, with a decent bed, in a decent building.

That said, this was a truly dreadful stay. It's not even worth extensive detail.

To begin, the signs for getting visitors around the large hotel property are useless.

Check-in was quick enough, and the clerk was efficient, professional, and amiable. Nice.

Anything nice ended there. We hiked to our room to drop off our bags.

Oh. My. Gosh. Our building (in the Manor area of the property) was filthy on the outside. The carpet and halls were dirty, and the building smelled terrible. We requested a non-smoking room... and we were welcomed by the overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke when we opened our door. The carpet in the room, as in the hall, was extremely dirty. The furniture in the room had huge gouges and strips torn out of it--some as long as a foot or two. Classy. No, not classy.

The television was quite old, but whatever. Not a qualifier for quality for me. Just ended up being another thing to add to the tally of sub-par experiences.

The bed comforter was smelly and dirty. Shiver. I tried not too think about that one too hard.

The bathroom might have been the worst part of the room (ew). There were yellow spatters and splashes and stains all over the walls--seriously, so ridiculous. They were things that would've easily come off with a wet rag. There were filmy splashes and stains on the doors, too. The whole place DESPERATELY needs a wipe-down. Seriously. It would improve it massively. Oh, and you only get shampoo (no conditioner) and two bars of soap, so plan on that. No lotion. No bath gel.

Then, the worst part: Circus Circus walls are only good for keeping out light. I AM NOT JOKING. Our neighbors staying on both sides of us, speaking in regular tones, were clearly audible--many times we could hear everything they were saying. That's not to mention when other guests came home at 12:30 AM and later after having a good time at the bar and speaking rather louder than usual. Anywhere in the hall? You'll hear what they're saying. In their rooms, a couple doors down? You'll hear them there, too. You'll hear everything in the whole building. We even had earplugs that we put in a little after midnight... still noisy. The room air conditioners are like blow-driers. They're that loud.

Last, their "Commitment to the Environment" cards fall pretty flat, when their tub faucets and shower heads pour like rivers. Flow control, anyone?

We love a good hole in the wall, but this was appalling.

I have booked this room through Priceline. Paid a little more to stay in Western Tower in Labor Day weekend. Checked in at 3 pm and got room 28319 on 23th floor. 
Was not informed it's a handicapped room, so with all equipments in the shower, was not able to enjoy the shower. The water pressure was very weak, my garden hose can do better than it! I took a shower first and then my boyfriend next. It went out of water when it's his turn. NO KIDDING! There was no water at all! We waited for an hour for it! Circus Circus was suck! Even Motel 6 is better than it!

This review is only about the restroom; I have not stayed here, nor would I, after the horror I saw.

We decided to take the kids to this circus themed place to play the games, but first, a required trip to the bathroom. 

1. The place smells like one, gigantic cigarette and appears filthy.
2. The people who frequent this place are pretty ratchet, like those who love Walmart.

Okay, now for the horror of all horrors:

I opened the door to the restroom to see dozens of haggard looking moms changing their babies diapers. Ewww, I know it has to be done, but so many at one time...just "ew."

I open the stall (cue Jaws music) and there, on the toilet seat, is SMOLDERING CIGARETTE, pushed into a fresh turd! Let me say this again. A SMOLDERING CIGARETTE, LIT END UP, squashed into a brown, fresh log. 

Obviously, will never set foot in that Hell Hole again!

Thankfully I only stayed one night there and after arriving and waiting in line to check-in for almost 40 minutes, directions to our rooms were given to us. Directions that lead us to no results since we got lost. The layout of the casino and hotel is extremely confusing and is not intuitive at all. 

Finally we made it to our room and noticed a weird smell in the air. Not that of dead prostitute or cold tobacco thankfully, but it was rather funky and we had to crack the window open to freshen things up.

The room was decent but far from great. It was clean at least but the beds were a bit soft. The internet wasn't complimentary either and was something like $8 per device which I thought was rather expensive, especially in this day and age; at least it was fast.

Although I'm sure that Circus Circus, at some point in time, might have been a nice play to stay at, it seems very beaten up and is now just a tacky, worn out and in dire need of rejuvenation kind-of-place. It's pretty bad in there and almost creepy. Looks like it hasn't been touched since the 70s or something and the casino floor is another great display of where I would not want to spend a dime. It smells bad and the croupiers are creepy looking.

There's a Krispy Kreme donut shop and a few shops on the lower floor and they have an entire part of the building that's under a giant, ugly purple down known as the "Adventuredome" where there's some kind of theme park. It was closed when I tried to scout it out, possibly because it was past 10PM. It didn't look all that great.

As far as food options go, there's very little that they offer .There's a buffet but it looked terrible. We settled for Rock & Rita's for our breakfast and it was not all that great. There's a few bars but most of them are lame and past their prime as you'll be able to tell when walking around the place for over an hour around 10:30PM-ish.

In many ways, this place could be used a set for a sequel to Steven King's "IT" movies or something. It's definitely creepy enough. Maybe they should just blow it up and build something else there. It might actually improve the value of the land and Circus Circus seems to be past it's prime... Way past it.

I doub that I'd ever want to stay there again. There's many better options and most have a better location since Circus Circus is at the very beginning of the strip.

Very old school casino..probably a tear down soon..stayed in a room 25 yr ago.. but i will say they have a very, very good steakhouse..one of the best in vegas and you dont have to take out a mortgage. I will go back for the steakhouse and thats all

I've stayed at this hotel with my husband several times. We have always liked it and found really nice stay for us. Yes its not the nicest or cleanest hotel. 
My husband and i stay here more often than not when coming to vegas. We fine that its much more fun and can enjoy our selfs. It is far from the main strip area but just grab a taxi. If you dont like it dont complain because you get what you pay for.

The place is dirty due to the lazy staff.  There were graham crackers scattered all around the bed.  The place seemed like it was just half ass cleaned.  

The clock didn't work, every tv channel was snowy, remote control did not work, and the AC kept shutting off.    All this happened in the sky rise area.  

All the house keepers that worked the 28th floors in the sky rise August 13-14 should be fired.    

Other than that the casino was nice, plenty of slots and entertainment.  

The pool area wasn't bad.  Definitely a lot of kids since its circus circus.  And that means The ool was dirty. Notice that I kept the P out of pool, however I don't think that was the case in that pool.
This place is a scam. The machines took your money but wouldn't print out any tickets to be redeemed we wasted half an hour twiddling our thumbs farting around avoid at all cost. SCAM

Well lets just say if you are getting married in Las Vegas and plan on a group of friends and family stay in the same hotel out of the conveince of having the wedding party together  i would much rather have a little hassle to  go through even on my wedding night then to ever stay there again.Two of our guests  almost missed the wedding due to wrong room booked that was already paid for. One guests had to switch rooms because they booked someone else even though they had been there for a day and had two days paid for. We had to visit the front desk numerous times. The whole thing was a joke they really lived up to their name. CIRCUS CIRCUS

The circus acts are no longer the same and the steps in here make intoxicated walking in the casino a struggle. Very easy to lose yourself in a corner or not be bothered if you prefer. Drinks at machines are served average speed, not the best but not horrendous.

The sports room is good. Easy to place bets and watch a bunch of games.

I got electrocuted by the blow drier in my hotel room. Yes I am serious, not a shock... ELECTROCUTED. I hate this place. We were lured by the cheapness and got what we paid for, a dump. This place needs to be ripped down. They upgraded us after the incident and offered two free nights next time we are in town but I wouldn't wish that upon my worst enemy. 

Upon checking in they give you a coupon book to use in the Casino. There are free drink coupons in there for Slots o Fun, When you go to use them the bartenders in there are huge A Holes. We got a drip of rum with a giant glass of coke. Then after setting it down in front of me he began to harass me about not being 21 (I'm 28) and then called my ID a fake. It wasn't worth standing there, we left the drinks and walked out. 

This is really far down on the strip. If you're a warrior of drunk walking then maybe it wont be that bad for you. 

It smells 

The "amusement park" is like a parking lot fair with far more game vendors harassing you to play their games. I would not let my kids hang out in there. 

When we walked into the buffet my boyfriend said "Wow, I haven't smelled this smell since i was in basic training"...nuff said there... 

We really had fun expectations of staying in old Vegas and getting a little bit of that fun kind of seedy casino. This was more like a nightmare.
Very basic hotel\/casino. Staff is friendly and seems assertive. We had dinner at the West Deli, which was pretty good. Wouldn't want to stay here for the whole weekend, but a night is fine.

I loved this place! 
Pros: the amusement park, slots, and other attractions were great and convenient. The quick walk to McDonald's and the late night convenience store was a major plus. 

Cons:The traffic in the hallways was a little annoying. It reminded me of Black Friday at Walmart! Some of the rooms are ok. I was placed in a double in a older section after being promised a single. The room was very dusty and dingy. However, after complaining to the manager, my room was upgraded to a deluxe single on a higher floor. 

Overall: I was pleased with the upgraded room and all of the conveniences the hotel provided. I enjoyed they there were a mixture of adult and kid activities throughout the hotel. I would definitely still at the hotel again.

Worst place ever!!!

I like their arcade but that"s about it.

It was my first time staying here and the only reason I decided to stay here was because they were offering a nice discounts on the rooms. 

So after hanging out at the pool, my friends and I decide to go inside to play at some tables and the arcade. We were having fun and all, then I was walking around and security comes up to me and says that he has to escort\/kick me out for wearing a bikini in the casino...umm really??? where the fuck is there a sign posted saying no bikinis???

With that said...I will NOT stay at this hotel ever again.

This hotel has seen better days. But it is what it is. Cheap food, cheap rooms, cheap everything. It looks old, smells old feels old. Every surface you touch is sticky.
When I went into the bathroom there was a guy in there alternating between a sink shower and drinking the water.
Bring ur kids here to build up their amune systems. 
The only good thing here is the games area upstairs where ur kids can share germs with other kids and become immune to all known diseases. 
They charge $8 for valet.

I will give one star since we had fun on the rides.. But hotel wise.. Booooooo. Low budget, dusty, old, stale, stinky and faded... The 19 inch tube tv (blank stare in 2010) did not work. No coffee in the room, broken iron.. And the food was terrible.. The buffet was like 10 steps down from hometown buffet.. Garbage. But....the rides were fun.

First time in Vegas with the family and we decided to stay here. Back in 2010, the hotel looked great in some areas, but as if it were still the 80's in another. I found the mini-theme park they have inside to be an interesting concept and could only imagine this would be the ideal option for families with younger children. They had a decent selection of restaurants and the casino was definitely fun. Overall, I'd say if you have a family with kids under the age of 14, this is the place to be. Price was affordable for being on The Strip, so if you don't care about luxury this is a also a good option.

This is the first and last time I or any of my friends will be staying here. Check in was probably the only nice part of this place. Quick and easy. Got to our room in the Manor, room 1954, and the light and fan were on in the bathroom which we thought was odd. Looked inside and the toilet was overflowing with someone's shit. Call it in and 2 hours later someone comes out to fix it. Then they notice that no one cleaned the bathroom, obviously, so there are no towels and no soap, so they say someone will be right out. Sometime past fucking midnight housekeeping showed up to clean the bathroom and woke us all up. We asked them to come back in the morning but no one showed up until we called again and still took them until noon. So had to skip a shower after driving 2 days to get here. Casino was fine but the people at the tables in the pits were jackasses including most the dealers as we tried to find a table to throw money away at. Outside of the 3rd day we basically got ignored by the waitresses serving cocktails. On the second day we noticed the safe doesn't work and we had no TV remote which again took several hours to get. Oh and I almost forgot without warning they barricaded my car in behind caution tape and metal fence barricades? Wtf.

Overall this place sucked. Only stayed cause my friend wanted to see the Circus stuff but for 75 a night I'd rather pay more for an actual nice hotel. Dirty, smelly, shitty service, mold infested bathrooms, etc

Don't stay here

I definitely got what i paid for:  a clean room with two beds.  my 8 year old loved the circus shows.   however, most of the hotel was overly perfumed and left me with a headache.  I had a groupon, but the resort fees and taxes added up...

This is by far worst hotel I have ever stayed . 
No coffee machine , towels were small and limited quantity , staff was rude , bathtub was clogging even if you complained 3  times no one responded.  
I wpuld highly recommend to stay at other hotels even if it bit expensive , otherwise it will spoil your whole mood .

Worst hotel in Las vegas, loud and displeasing, no remodeling full of bugs, full of crackheads, full of peeling walls, old beds, old toilets, old floors,old sinks,old windows, old air conditioning, dirty air in the room, smelly and stinky carpet, the sheets don't get washed here somtimes there trying to save water and give you reused sheets, wow can't believe this hotel is still in business, if the owner is reading this, I urge you to make some changes in the hotel make it nice inside the rooms and you will get triple the revenue, if you want to cheap out then nobody will come. Just a advice take it or leave it your choice.

Is ok but smelling so bad is not so clean but is what u pay for 
The pool is small is not space for so many people

Stayed here 1 night driving across the southwestern US with my five year old. This was the best of 3 hotels we stayed at during our road trip. First and foremost our room was clean. The bed comfy. The ac was loud but I liked it because it covered any noise from outside.  We booked through hotels website and ended up in "the manor" which was fine with me. The only negative was the dripping bathtub faucet not the noise just water wasting.

We took the nephews to the Midway..  and they took us for all we've got! (okay, not really).  There were lots of games and the prices actually are pretty decent (most games for $1-2), a buck or two more if you got the "special".  I do like that a lot of the booths offered prizes to the kids even if they didn't win anything, makes it a lot better than when I was growing up and it was all or nothing!

The kids had a great time, each had a nice bag of loot each, and got to watch the various acts that occurred in the small stage area throughout the day.  Definitely brought back some old nostalgia when the kids (me and my siblings) would play while our parents would gamble downstairs. *dreamy sigh*

Me and my girlfriend stayed here for a night and I have mixed feelings for this one. It wasn't too long to check in. It only took about 5 minutes. Prior to arriving I called to see if the room was still available because I was running a little late. They said yes and I also mentioned if they had a single queen size bed and they said yes. As soon as I got to my room I noticed two queen size beds. I went down to see what was the deal. The woman who checked me in said that was the only available room. So when did a one queen size bed go to two queen size beds in two hours? Despite them not doing anything me and girlfriend just decided to keep the room. Other than that it could see some upgrades. For example the elevators and even the parking lots are filled with graffiti. I thought I was in Las Vegas not a place where you want to be mugged. The positives are the casino and the indoor amusement park.

Wow! What can you say about Circus Circus! Sadly not update since The Ratpack was alive. From the enjoyable urine stench on the garage elevator to the enjoyable urine smell in the casino, I could hardly contain my excitement. I think the neighboring  hotels should take up a collection, buy a s*** ton of tnt , and offer to blow it up. Stinky, outdated and downright nasty. Needless to say The Circus Circus has seen the last of me and my friend. I have been in cleaner truck stop bathrooms. So there!

Honestly for the price I did not expect too much but the rooms are actually pretty good... but we found a bed bug on our bed on my pillow(caught it and put it into a bag)... they didn't take care of the situation at all they didn't change us  to a different room WE had to request them to change our sheets I was terrified to take the bugs back home... and also we had a tour to get ready for at 4:45am i had to shower with cold water... do you know how horrible that s*** is? 20 minutes into my shower I got hot water..
My husband and I got so many bites for the whole body~~I reported already but nobody help!!!it is very terrible!!!
Enjoyed our stay. Average hotel and had overall good experience. Took entire family and kids had a great time for their first time in Vegas.

For the most part it's the same old same old, nothing fancy and a good price. The buffet was good and even better since we got 4 FREE tickets with our room. The plumbing has issues, slow drains and weak water pressure. The arcade and trapeze act was great, the kids loved it. The water park perfect, everyone loved that but not the extra costs for lounge chairs and umbrellas. After walking the strip we came back to the hotel and walked in the front doors of the hotel. We had 4 kids (under 21) and needed to use the bathroom so used the one right inside the big front doors. There was a cleaning lady in there and told the kids that next time they cant use that restroom because they are not 21. ?????? It's the main entrance to the hotel, right where the cabs and ubers drop you off, under the big fancy lights. I guess the entire hotel caters to children except the bathrooms. All in all it was a good stay for the price.

Had to almost walk a mile just to get to our room which was in the Manor Motor Lodge.  HORRIBLE room considering we paid over $100 for the room.  I guess you don't get much for that.  Room was old and UGLY!!  AC wasn't working correctly and they came out right away to fix it and called to make sure it was done after which was kinda nice.  Hotel was GHETTO!  I would never stay here again!!!  Person that checked us in was pretty nice at least.

Checked in to our room and immediately went out to the strip. Came back to our room several hours later and attempted to go to bed. Immediately noticed hair all over our bedding. Contacted house keeping and asked them to replace all bedding. Housekeeping arrived and replaced all our bedding. There was hair on the new bedding. Housekeeping attendant was attempted to brush off hair on new bedding and we complained to the management. This entire ordeal took around 40 min to complete. The entire time we are waiting on this our room door is open and I can't help but feel our privacy is being violated as we are sitting in our room with people walking by and unable to enjoy the rest of our evening. I'm convinced that we would have received more courteous service from a 1 star motel.

Came here with my family once and both my mom and I got food poisoning from eating here.  Not only that but I got it after eating a lasagna at a supposedly "nice" Italian restaurant in the hotel that we had to wait an hour to get into.  Thanks for the worse Vegas trip ever, at least the day I got sick and starting yacking everywhere was the day we left =\/

If you have kids, you gotta stay here!  There are so many things going on from circus acts, the Midway games, and stuff inside the Adventuredome.

The only bad thing is that it's far from the center of the strip where Bellagio, Paris, MGM Grand, etc are.

Stayed here because it was a saturday and this was the cheapest place. I've never seen so many kids in one place anywhere. I don't understand why people would bring their kids here but hey I guess if you are going to then this crazy place is where you would do it. There were a ton of people selling timeshares and tickets which really annoys me. The bar made weak drinks...we ordered a pitcher of margarita and between two of us we didn't feel a thing. I can't complain too much because we just slept here and moved on. Seeing so many kids though was pretty scary but we had a nice view of the Stratosphere.

Definately an older property ,   If you are with children there is a lit to do here.  The rooms are clean and quiet,   There is the ell of cigarette smoke everywhere.    The Casino is dirty and the employees are not held to high standards of uniforms and customer service.

Dude...ok...I will just say this, I'm a local.  It's an 'ok' hotel if you have children, want to have fun at the adventure dome or if you're being super cheap, but other then than N-O-P-E.  I just don't like circus circus period.  I get that it's cheap in all, but just no. Their buffet reallyyyyy blowsssss omg.  Maybe because I was with the wrong people... Idk. But it sucked. Sorry not sorry.

If you need something different to do with your kids, take them for the free circus acts.  It's like a super scaled back cirque du soleil.

Layout here is harder to navigate than most. And the decor is creepy. Go with the circus tents and acrobats for a classier feel and lose the clowns. The outside looks like a giant paedo-trap.

Wow!!! Had. It been here in years and I am talking about over 10 and it is in desperate need of some updates!!! The circus performers area and carnival needs to be remodeled and updated I was afraid to lean on anything because it was too dirty!!! This is a nightmare to Bring your kids!!! I think you need to shut down and remodel and update the arcades and games and most definitely the prizes

Great for kids and the rooms are much nicer than they were when I stayed here about 9 years ago. Staff is hit and miss; some are friendly while others are rude and standoff-ish. But, my kids never knew the difference.

Yuck, worst hotel ever. TONS of kids who should not be up with their drunk parents at 1 am. I feel bad for them and it kind of gives the whole place a sad feeling. If you plan on not spending any time in your room other than to crash, then this place is good. Also, be prepared to take the bus because it is too far to walk to the ACTUAL strip, aka, the place to party. It cost me and my friends $47 each which is insanely cheap. So all in all I dont regret staying here.  If you have a little more to spend, get a better hotel. It is a lil' depressing in this place. Parents, dont take your babies out to Vegas and let me run into you as I stumble out of the club, not appropriate.

This is for the Friday Night Dinner Buffet.....OK I walked in not expecting much & only went for The Experience of doing it and some Peel-n-Eat Shrimp, Fried fish & Fried Shrimp.....The Price of admission $25......Wasnt expecting much BUT what I got was A LOT worse. The Fried Fish was some long thin cut fried breaded mass processed crap that after pealing most of the uniform factory breading off, made me wonder if this really was "Fish" at all (My guess is NOT and its some kind of "white Factory Slime" made of who knows what?!!) The Fried Shrimp were not even worth picking the bread off of as you were left with a very small & miniature sad looking piece of shrimp. I saw more Factory meatballs, Veal Parmesean. corn dogs and This is what you can expect. There was no Peel-n-eat shrimp at all......However, BBQ Beef Ribs and Fried Chicken saved the Day and both were a Thumbs Up especially the ribs...The Show of the kids running around and screaming and laying on the floor was pretty good with the symphony of crying babies in the background.....I suspected as much going in as far as that was concerned......I do these things so you dont have to and can avoid walking into an expensive Employee Dining Room.

Unless you have kids with you, and the question is why do you take kids to Vegas, in my opinion this place should be avoided like a episode of Two and A Half Men. Honestly I don't know why either are as popular as they seem to be. We chose this as one of our places to move around the strip a bit but coming through the door you immediately regret it. 

Kids, kids, and did I mention kids EVERYWHERE. And we're not just talking cute Gerber Baby kids, I'm also talking the stay in my black painted room teens and B-Rad Malibu's Most Wanted wannabe's, yeah you know the type. The place is dark and crowded. While we expected a place called circus circus to be a family type theme\/ clientele it was a bit overwelming.  The ONE saving grace of this place was the AdventureDome which has basically anything your child and your inner child can think of doing such as roller coasters, water slides, rides, and other various things for "junior" to do while daddy spends his college tuition.

Overall, the adventuredome itself gave this place 1 star however there's really nothing else here to save it. The strip in my opinion is full of better alternatives to stay at depending on your lifestyle, age, and budget. Circus Circus just isn't one I will ever go back to since who brings kids to Vegas?!?!

I don't know why this hotel has such bad reviews. I don't know if it's ritzy raised people giving such bad reviews or what buut.... My gf and I recently staid a couple of nights here and everything was clean, the room was large, up to date, beds were comfortable, complimentary coffees etc I mean there was nothing wrong with it? For the price of $30 something a night it was beyond a steal.

The amenities are few but the room was nice, spacious and clean. No mini fridge and no microwave. You can request a mini fridge at $20 a day (the website may not tell you that it isn't gratis). Oh and here's another example of FEES FEES AND MORE FEES, if you want to check in before 2 PM you can pay an extra $20 (and pay resort fees, so total would be $50 just to jump the line). Some hotels in my experience are courteous and let you check in when the room is ready (for instance the MANY Indian casinos throughout CA and OR) but not in Vegas! When I checked in the employee was kind, when I balked at the cost of the fridge (an extended stay so a fridge was kind of necessary) she said she would have one brought up to my room at no charge. Of course that never happened, even when I politely inquired about it two different times. All in all, the cost for a 3 nights stay only amounted to $48 a night including fees. (Of course the rate I signed up for was $24 or so but those DAMN RESORT FEES). Sadly there are now only a few machines on the floor that take coins, four quarter machines, and a lot more that take dollar coins, I guess they did the math on that one. I think next time I spend three days in LV I will get a nice clean off-strip hotel with a fridge, micro and maybe a continental breakfast, the price would be similar and the staff probably more accommodating. Vegas ain't that cheap.

We spent two nights here and we were happy with our room. It was always very clean and the hotel was clean too. The staff were always very nice and friendly. It's a nice, cheap place to stay while in Vegas, but don't expect something as fancy as some of the other places on Strip because it is one of the cheapest.

We read all the reviews and we suggest the following since we've been here since the 18th for my husband's 25th birthday: 
West Tower is the best tower-the bed is actually quite comfortable and the room is very clean; try the brunch buffet because the selection is great (lots of meat choices) and the service\/cleanliness is terrific; (side note: there was a clown eating at the buffet a second ago with a napkin tucked into his bowtie ~ excellent); Slots of Fun is damn fun - beer pong $9 on actual pong tables just do it and laugh at your inability to play the simple game; and most of all, you can sleep during the day since housekeeping works 24\/7 it's not all vacuuming and banging doors at 7 a.m. 
Is it glitzy and glamorous? No. It's in need of upgrades but nothing terrible or seedy. Lots of parking if you have a car, the place is clean, has plenty of activities that you probably won't have enough time to enjoy (although there aren't any nightlife\/karaoke options), and it's a heck of a great value. Only four stars because there's no nightlife..it'd be great if they would capitalize on the circus theme for adults (my husband just said topless trapeze artists- which is probably a million dollar idea).
Hope your experience will be the same!

Upon arrival at the "Manor" parking lot (really felt like Bates Motel) we were greeted by a red-headed woman that offered us sexual services for me and my two friends.  After denying her, we entered our ALREADY OPEN AND UNLOCKED run-down room and pulled out our blacklight (which revealed anything between blood, semen, and urine stains across the room).  The blacklight showed the story of a sexual movie or something, because unholy amounts of semen were spread along the walls.  To our suprise, my friend opened up his bed to two bed bugs crawling across the sheets.  As if this wasn't enough, a crackhead started kicking at our door, offering us anything from sex to drugs.  All in all, this opening sequence at Circus Circus and the "Manor" should be a warning for any future customers to steer clear of the facilities at all costs.  Spend the extra money and go elsewhere, good luck if you decide to risk it all here.

You get what you pay for. Too far away from everything. The rooms are old even in the "updated" section of the hotel. Everything in the hotel closed by 11. The buffet was one of the worst I have ever had.

Stop clowning around.

Ok, in all seriousness, let's talk about this hotel. I usually stay at the Trump Hotel or Treasure Island. However, due to a short notice trip to LV, I was forced to stay at Circus Circus. The parking situation was interesting. LV parking tends to be crazy if you're new to it, but this hotel's parking seemed disorganized. I'd suggest having more signage and have them be more visible and easy to interpret. It be great to know the best parking place for a certain part of the hotel that one is staying in.

Another note, the interior of the hotel can be very confusing for the new visitor. Up and down stairways, making a left and then a right, and another right...wait did I already pass by this area? Again, just like with the parking situation, signage would be great throughout the entire lobby\/adventure area. My suggestion to new travelers? Do the extra walking outside to the parking structure and just walk in the front entrance. Don't test your luck with the elevator near the parking area. Also, the entrance to the parking structure has an entrance to the main lobby for the elevators to your room. Just be sure to read the sign to know which elevator will go to your desired floor number.

If you're like me and are a bit sensitive to cigarette smoke, this is NOT the place for you. Even the non smoking section has the tendency to smell the opposite. If you dare to walk through the casino, you're going to have to hold your breath for 2 mins before heading out the front door.

The rooms... not too bad, I've been in worse. I was actually ok with the rooms, although the decorations could've been updated. The view isn't great, even from the top of the building. Nowhere near the strip, so you're going to have to walk quite a distance to get to the strip, or just use your car or get someone to drive you.

I will say this though, the staff (as far as my experience goes) was the best part of my stay. They're the only reason I'm giving 3 stars. They were so very nice, helpful with directions, flight itinerary printing services and other tasks. I had some very loud people on my floor who were making a lot of noise late past midnight, which forced me to call for security (which I honestly didn't think they would actually send anyone up). But they did! Pretty quickly too, especially since I was on the top floor. They had the hallway cleared out and told the people to be respectful...etc. then they went the extra mile to knock on my door to make sure everything was alright and if there was anything else I needed.

Overall, will I spend the night here again? No. I'll go back to trump hotel or treasure island. But I will definitely visit for the circus shows they have. I'm a fan of circus arts, and you can't beat a free show.

ok, so it's not exactly on the main strip and about a 5 minute walk. The front desk is hidden in the basement in the last building, and this place is just huge.
I did get an amazing deal through hotels.com and got a very clean and very well appointed rooms for that. So value for money was in favor for me giving this 4*. I I had to pay close to $100.- for a night, it would only have received 3, but still... a pretty great place !

Huele muy mal. El aire est viciado.
Lo nico rescatable es el domo de juegos; aunque si los juegos los mantienen cmo los ascensores, y la alfombra, yo no subira.

I am currently (3-28-15) in my hotel room n 
I'm pissed 
First they doubled booked me 
Second they give me a room with only one bed instead of 2 
Third the Ac is broken so it is on but the temperature it releases is outside air of 78 degrees 
So it is hot in my room and bed lamps don't work

I'm so tired of walking downstairs to the lobby 
After 3xs n 2 hours of struggling to get a decent room.
Only reason I'm putting up with it is because it's 9:39pm n I'm soooo tired of going down to the lobby to complaint abt the 3rd wrong thing with my reservation
I will never stay here again

Overall the hotel is OK to stay for a couple of days if you dont care what bed you are sleepin on and what towels you are using. Honestly, NO. Never again! It is better to pay more and be treated like king or queen rather than a sh\/t.....i WILL NOT recommend this facility to anyone.

We originally booked a room in The Manor.  When we checked in, we were told we were being given a "free upgrade" to what they called the Skyrise Tower and were given directions on how to get to our room.  We parked, unloaded our luggage, and walked to the elevators, where we saw a large number of firefighters walking back and forth in full fire gear, carrying different types of equipment.  An employee told us the elevators were currently down and that the firefighters were "inspecting something".  He instructed us to go BACK to the check-in desk and have them change our room to the West Tower.  We trudged back to the car with our luggage and a cranky four-year-old and, while driving back to the check-in parking, we saw a large crowd of hotel employees who had apparently been evacuated from the Skyrise Tower.  When I I went back inside to request the change in rooms, the clerk again claimed we were being given a "free upgrade", this time in the West Tower, even though that is where they had to put EVERYONE who had just been checked in to the Skyrise Tower!  They tried to make it sound as if they were giving us something awesome to make up for the inconvenience, but it was really just them blowing a bunch of smoke up our ***.  I understand that things happen that are beyond their control, but I find it impossible to believe that they didn't know about this apparently major problem in the Skyrise Tower at the time I was originally checking in.  It was obvious the firefighters had been there for quite some time.  I don't understand why they would continue booking guests into those rooms if the entire tower was inaccessible for an indefinite period of time.  Additionally, I feel like they should have offered us something REAL, something tangible, like a 2-for-1 deal at their buffet, to make up for the inconvenience, but they didn't even offer us so much as a complimentary soft drink.  

After we FINALLY got to our room, my 19-year-old daughter and my four-year-old niece got changed into their swimsuits and went down to the pool.  They returned only a few minutes later, stating that the pool had been closed because of wind.  Thank God they have free circus shows, because otherwise the four-year-old would have been completely unmanageable after having to sit in the hot car for a long time while we sorted through the room debacle and then having been told she could go swimming with her brand-new floaties only to find out the swimming pool was closed.  

When we returned to our room for a bit of rest before going to dinner, I attempted to get a drink from the vending machine on our floor (THREE DOLLARS for a small bottle of Gatorade?!?!).  The machine accepted my money and the LCD display stated "Vending 1", but nothing came out.  I called Guest Services and they said we just had to go to the cashier's cage and let them know what had happened and they would give us a refund.  My daughter went down to the cashier's cage, but they refused to assist her because she wasn't 21 years old.  She wasn't asking for a cashout from a gambling machine!  She wanted a refund from a vending machine that ate our money.  I am disabled, so that's why I sent her down to request the refund in the first place.  The person at Guest Services DID NOT tell me that someone over the age of 21 had to request the refund.  

At the end of the evening, when we were all exhausted and wanted to go to sleep, we discovered that the beds appear to be from the same era as the Flintstones, because the mattresses are hard as a rock!  Needless to say, none of us slept well that night and ended up in horrible moods the next day.  My daughter and I are contemplating a 10-day trip to Las Vegas in the summer of 2017 to celebrate her 21st birthday and we most definitely will NOT be staying at Circus Circus.
Contacted the hotel..... worst customer ever. Still being charged after cancellation. Never never book here again!!

A few friends and I stayed at Circus Circus for two nights last week, and as a bunch of 21 year olds, I must say we had a little more fun at the casinos than at Midway and the Adventuredome. The games at Midway are classic games that you play as a kid (like throwing a ping pong ball into a little glass cup or throwing darts at a balloon to try and pop it), and of course they're expensive, but what really bothered me was the crappiness of the stuffed animals that you got after winning once. In order to get the bigger nicer stuffed animals, you would have to win multiple times and then trade your crappy little ugly stuffed animals for the bigger ones. Kinda sucked.

Adventuredome really didnt look like too much fun. I really had no want to ride any of the rides or buy anything. The casinos were much better, although the card dealers weren't very nice. I definitely got yelled at by this one dealer multiple times for nothing. She was a beezy for sure. I sat at her black jack table for a good couple hours, and the next day she also carded me again. Then yelled at me for something again. Really did not like her and it kind of ruined the experience for me. 

And call me mean, but there are way too many bratty little kids there for my liking. Why on earth would you take your child to vegas for a vacation? i have no idea.

I had booked an online deal that got me a very good price. However I found out I was staying at the manor motor lodge. Me and my husband decided we would prefer to stay in the actual Circus Circus. They allowed us to upgrade for only 20$! We stayed in the west tower on the 34th floor. It was super nice. No complaints about the room. It was way fun to wander the whole place. It's huge. However not within walking distance to many of the main attractions. And lots of kids.

Now, I'm not one to really tear into a place with a scathing review (ANYMORE) so I will choose my words carefully for this place.

*Stares at blank review spot... 3 minutes pass*

Well...

*4 minutes pass*

Errr...

*7 minutes*

So, I got nothing.

I will start at the parking garage. We parked at the red 2 section and ended up having to go to orange 4 so we could reach the elevator to the building. Upon leaving we had to go to orange 4 to cut through green3 wind up back at red 2. BTW what is with the hundreds of foot prints across the ceiling of the parking garage? The place looked kind of dingy already and this just made me break out the sanitizing wipes.

The Adventuredome is what I believe to be the main attraction. A huge glass structure with rides and attractions and oh so much fun for the family. If this place was actually clean it would really be great for kids. Lots of fair foods like cotton candy and plenty of cute rides they would all love. I think the older kids and even the parents could have fun too. 


Everything is just SO dirty!

You just don't want to touch anything. Blah...

Circus Circus is pretty cool! I was in Vegas weekend before Halloween a.k.a Kim Kardashians b-day weekend! The dome was the "fright dome" because of the holidays...I recommend going there for halloween! The hotel overall is kinda grimy but I LOVED the midway area of carnival games and all of that cause I felt like a kid again! I'd come back for that alone!

nasty nasty. lame lame. i stayed here for free , 10yrs ago & i was pissed. nasty, run-down, ghetto, nasty food, brats etc.  after midnite, there's dozens of  snoop dogg look-alike patrons acting shady on the casino floor.  i believe this place pioneered the vegas buffet .  it's historic & i guess it makes money. i've popped in a few times over the years & it hasn't changed.  they should tear it down & make it classy & modern w\/the same circus theme. you've been warned dogg.

This is a 2.4 star review.

I'm gonna try something new...

Check in\/Lobby experience:  LONG line of folks coming in for the weekend.  When I walked up @ 9:30am on Thursday, I was 8th in line.  2 clerks checking guests in and out, making the wait really painful.  When it was my turn, 2 more clerks appeared (guess their break was over).  Bonus for the rest of the folks waiting in line, which was now more than 15 deep.  Clerk was cordial, but not overly friendly or informative.    2 stars.

Lobby area:  Really dated, dark, and generally shabby looking.  It could use a coat of paint and new carpet.   1 star

Room:  We lucked out and stayed in the West Tower.  These rooms were newly renovated:  granite countertops, flat screen TV, new carpet and wallpaper.  In general the room was much better appearing than we expected based on the lobby experience.   The beds really comfy, a plus.  The bathroom was clean and had granite upgrades.  I didn't notice any shampoos\/lotions, etc that you see in other hotels.  Oh yeah, there was a bar of soap that the maid changed daily.  The room didn't have any paper or pens.   3 stars

Valet parking service:  LOVED these guys!  They were really friendly and offered directions all over.  If we were coming back for a quick pit stop between shopping trips, they were willing to leave our car on the side for us.  Bonus.  They gave the best customer service of anyone we met on the property.  5 (although if I could give 10 I would) stars

Casino:  Old and dated.  The only casino we went into where we would always leave smelling like smoke.   Ugh!  Maybe the newer hotels have better air filtration systems.  Did enjoy the trapeze show overhead on Saturday night.        1 star.  

We didn't explore the Midway or eat at any of the restaurants.  Had a bad experience in the morning at the bagel place...Juanita was more interested in sharing stories of co-worker angst and drama with her work partner than making us coffee...  Really?  

**Noticed there were not any recycle options anywhere on the property.  I ended up taking our used water bottles with me to put in a recycle bin elsewhere.   

Average stars:  2.4
crap place, terrible staff, and the gaming machines break every other time

I am at the hotel Circus Circus in Las Vegas Nevada and notice in my hotel there's a camera I looked carefully thinking it was the fire and smoke detectors and noticed that is wasn't it was a camera I felt very uncomfortable also  invading my privacy I took pictures and will post them and look more into that because that's not right.

Stayed here for four days and here's all I can say:

PROS
1. The staff is great. 
2. The Circus acts are great. 
3. Vince Neil's has karaoke. 

CONS
1. The whole first floor of the hotel is like walking through a smoke chamber. I'm pretty sure I have second hand-smoke now. It just wreaks and lingers on everything.
2. The kids. If you want an adult vacation, don't come here. I get that it's circus themed but kids are running around everywhere. The crying, screaming...no thank you. 
3. I wanted to get a massage so I looked on the Circus Circus website. Went to the spa after seeing a package online for a facial\/massage package. It turns out they no longer offer this service even though it's advertised throughout the hotel, very disappointed. 
4. The rooms don't have: coffee pots, bathroom fans, comforters, a mini fridge.
5. Hotel workers in the lobby and entrances are constantly trying to sell you 'complimentary' things. 


Overall, if you have kids, this might be an okay place to go for entertainment. In general, come here for the free things, DO NOT stay here.

As bad as it gets.  Crowds, worn out rooms, poor service.  We needed a suite for six of us, so we went for Circus Circus' price and location.  That we got.  But it's risky.  Don't plan on anyone being able to check you in, calculate your bill properly, get your to your room ok, or check you out.

This was my first experience of Vegas as a child.  I remember back then I would have given this place 5 stars! But coming back as an adult.  The only thing I can say positive about this place are the low limit tables.

We have been trying to stay away from booking this hotel but we were on a budget and we wanted a quick weekend getaway.   We had a comp night through the MyVegas slots game so we decided to cash in.   We booked the comp room plus we added one extra night.   

I was really having second thoughts about staying here, I hate going to Vegas and stayingt at Circus Circus since there are a lot of families with small children.  YES I am not a fan of seeing people with strollers walking around a casino.  Ugh .... anywayssss 

The check in clerk was really nice she smiled and didnt take forever to get our room keys.   Our room was nice looks like it had been upgraded, we had a West Tower room and we really loved it.  I was impressed with the bell staff.  Didn't eat at the hotel since we had purchased buffet passes at MGM Grand through the MyVegas which were easy to use.  The Casino can use an upgrade it looked exactly the same as it did 25 years ago during my very first Vegas trip.     I will def stay here again!

I had the worst experience at Circus Circus.  I checked into the hotel and checked out 10 minutes later. We were booked in the Manor, when we walked in the room it smelled terrible, there were stains all over the carpet along with what looked liked cigarette burns, stains on the ceiling and the walls. I called the front desk and they said they would not move me so I decided to just leave. And now they have a $600 hold on my credit card. So please, don't stay at Circus Circus. The hotel workers were even telling me that they would never stay at that, hotel.

I thought at first, the lady behind the counter was joking when she said no to my request for an empty plastic cup, but no, she was completely seriously.  She looked at me like I was crazy and said she has empty cups, but she did not just hand them out.  I honestly do not believe that it is company policy to say no to a guest who had a simple request such as mine.  Perhaps, had she had known I have been visiting Las Vegas and Circus Circus for over 30 years she would have offered me the cup with a smile.  I am guessing it would not have made any difference to her.

I already knew what to expect when staying here, even before reading all of the reviews, due to the last two times I had stayed here as an adult.

My parents were thoughtful enough to stay here every time we were in Vegas, when we were kids.  While they did what they did, they would hand me and my brother lots of cash and leave us to our own devices. We would venture off by ourselves to the upstairs arcade and would circle it for hours, trying to win something from the carnival style games and stop to watch the free circus daredevil acts.  My favorite games were the water gun and some game where you would roll rubber balls up this ramp to get Tic Tac Toe and, of course, the pinball machines. Looking back at everything now, CPS would have certainly cited my parents for child neglect.

Our room was much nicer and cleaner than the last two rooms I've stayed at here.  The tables have one of the lowest minimum bets on the strip for those who don't like to risk much.  The slots aren't as loose as they once were, but still pay out better than some of the other casinos.  Mediocre eats too.  Circus Circus is near the end of the LV strip.  I consider this place average all around.  I'll consider this place again, if I'm low on funds.
