We tried out Circus Circus because they had the cheapest deal for a busy weekend.  On top of that they gave us Free Buffets, too bad we didn't get to experience that due to our busy weekend.  

The Staff were great, hardly any kids where we were at.  I believe there may be two sides to Circus Circus.  Our rooms were on the Skyrise section with a nice window view.  

The room was decent; which i thought was okay due to the fact that we wouldn't be in our room much besides going to bed or getting ready to go out.  They also had a spacious restroom and cable tv. 

Checking in and out was a breeze.  The line moved fairly quickly. 

The only con is the loud AC
Rooms are fair but the adventuresome & Midway are tons of fun for adults and kids alike. Not to mention the wonderful free circus acts the run all day at the midway.
What a shitty experience. If you are decent person and want to be treated OK not even get close to this place. Asian guy at the check in was vey rude. Don't go

Room smells like smoke upon arrival, clogged sink, missing a chair for the room desk, and lots of hidden fees they won't tell you about. Last time we stayed here it wasn't this bad, but we were charged $300 extra for smoking in the room apparently which is funny because neither me nor my boyfriend smoke. If you're on a budget don't stay here. They rape you with fees. They said they'd send maintenance, but no one ever came. Won't stay here ever again.

Forty years ago, when I was six years old, I stayed at Circus Circus with my family. Having just spent this past weekend there for a friend's Vegas wedding, I can promise you this: They haven't made one upgrade in the past 40 years.

Dingy, faded and sad is how I would describe this once festive relic. Everything -- from the ugly hotel signs to the faded lobby carpeting to the smoke-clogged casino -- looks and feels old. Not in a cool, vintage way, either. Just old.

But my real problem with this hotel was what happened when I checked in: First, they gave me a room in what they call "Circus Manor," which is essentially a shitty little annex across the street from the actual hotel. At no time during my booking process was there any indication that I'd be in the Manor; I had paid for a regular room in the hotel. But OK, I figured, how bad could it be?

Pretty bad, it turns out. The first thing I noticed was that the hallway carpet outside my room was soaked. An electric blower had been set up to dry it, but to no avail. Once inside, I immediately relieved myself in the bathroom, only to discover that my toilet wouldn't flush. I called Guest Services, and after a good five minutes on hold, the hotel employee told me to expect an engineer in my room shortly.

He didn't show for over an hour. And when he finally did and began working on the toilet, releasing dirty water all over the bathroom floor, he informed me that it would take him a good while longer to fix it. I was already running late for the rehearsal dinner, so I called Guest Services again and insisted I be moved to another room. 

Well, the room they moved me to was right across the hall in the Manor, and I immediately discovered that the bathroom floor in that room was also soaking wet. The engineer, feeling bad for my predicament, called Guest Services himself to ask that I be upgraded to a room in the hotel tower, away from all this wet misery. They had him on hold for literally 20 minutes.

I could not wait another minute, so without waiting for him to get through to them, I grabbed all my stuff, moved my car to the regular hotel parking lot, and waited (another ten minutes) at the supervisor's desk in the lobby. It was only then that I was finally moved to a clean, dry room on the 23rd floor of the tower, without any real apology or conciliatory gesture. (Like, how about offering me the buffet for free, people?) The rest of my stay was uneventful.

Look: I realize Circus Circus is no luxury resort, and that there are far more upscale (and pricier) places to stay on the Vegas Strip. But this mega-hotel is owned and operated by MGM Resorts, a multi-billion-dollar corporation. Surely they can provide even the most basic upgrades and customer service to this depressing ghost of a hotel. And if they're not willing to make those improvements, they should put the place out of its misery.

The best hotel for families in Vegas! With an indoor amusement park and arcade for kids, this hotel is without a doubt the best place to take your kids\/family when in Vegas.

Rooms are nothing special, all you really need is a place to sleep in, but good standard rooms.

Let me get down and dirty (literally) with my review. Honestly, we were pleasantly surprised with the great customer service and the modern and new room (in West Tower). However, the registration and parking arrangement is so strangely laid out and chaotic and the room was dirty, with hairs everywhere, including "those" hairs in the bathroom. Bleh. The toilet was dirty inside and yellow streaks up and down the outside. The tub faucet leaked and there was a loud rattling noise in the wall(AC, elevator?). The pillows are lumpy, broken up cotton chunks like they stuffed five cotton balls in a case and called it a day. We slept horribly. 

We were impressed with BP the valet who was very helpful and courteous with our baggage check. Valet and baggage assistance is tip-only for cost and very helpful due to drop off and parking arrangements. They securely store your luggage and give you a slip to call when you want your baggage brought up to your room. I had them come up to get and hold our luggage after check out so we could explore. They made it very easy. Just don't lose your slips! 

The midway was wonderful, even for our 2-year-old. Games are cheap and the booklet you get upon check-in gives two free midway games. The aerial\/clown acts on the second floor were really neat and worth seeing, regardless of age.

This is an update to my previous experiences. Between 2000 - 2010 my family and I would  vacation at Las Vegas once every 2-3 weeks for the weekend. At times we stayed every weekend. Circus circus was one of our original choices due to child friendly amenities. Previously when we booked two separate times the 2nd was in fact a second chance  we were even more displeased. Lobby looked amazing but after we arrived to the suites it's was a portal to the land of lost items. Yes euivebt to a dump. Smell of vomit reaked. Garbage everywhere and flies! Sorry hun blow flies don't show up until a couple days where something has become rotten and left. The room was NOT cleaned. Looked like someone had thrown a hotel party. We immediately twice mind you went down and argued to cancel reservation. We went elsewhere. This last time we 8\/11-8\/12 we stayed elsewhere but did a walk through thru the stores changes do happen? Right! The lobby ok and some hallways had garbage to the top.  However the 1 star comes from the experience in the store. Allow me to be more specific. You cross the street coming from the self parking area. Turn a right through two glass doors and take a right it's the first store with options for souvenirs.  We walked in and made our way to the coffee mugs. Upon check out the woman charged us waayyy more and did not say a word. She had scanning it twice and then did some typing on The register. She was not very polite asked for the card. I stopped my spouse because the amount did not match. We only came for 1 item 1 single mug for our niece. Unless it was made out of swavroski crystal the price that it read was definitely incorrect. When I questioned her she said oh . Ok and yelled for her coworker. She came back annoyed  and fixed it. Then we went to pay debit  and they asked for ID. We had to explain what a military ID was. Even if it was for a DEBIT where we input the PIN number. Then we asked for our receipt. Again she had to call the other gal who was just walking around.  We asked a couple times if it was an issue. My spouse apologized because we asked to correct the product amount AND for our receipt.  It's 2017, 7 years after my last visit. This will be the last time I go to Circus Circus. EVER

I have the same results with the hotel.  the service was much better this time but the room was no worth the price (free).  I was able to listen to the people next door yelling at the kids all night and morning long.  I needed a hot tub to go in after sleeping on one of the most uncomfortable beds ever.  This is now my last time even visiting this hotel.  The service at Tatuado restaurant was less than desireable.  Never again will I step foot in this less than desirable hotel.  Stayed a second night at a different hotel and was much more impressed with that hotel.

Do. Not. Come here. 
This has been one of the worst hotel experiences I've had in my life, and I've had some pretty bad experiences. I urge anyone planning to book a couple nights at Circus Circus to read the entirety of my review which, please note, all took place in one night. 

First of all, we were charged an extra $10 per night in a mandatory fee that covers "free" wifi, and...uh...I don't even remember the rest because it was so useless or scammy. When asking the concierge about the hidden fee, he spoke to me and my family in a completely condescending, patronizing tone of voice, like we were dumb people. It infuriated me. He insisted the fee is stated clearly (it's not, I have hawkeyes) and then said "I don't have time to argue with you" when I asked where on the site it was mentioned. 

Next, the elevators are all rickety and one of them was broken. Not to mention numbers and buttons were scratched clean off. What a ****show. 

(BUT. HERE IS THE MEAT OF MY REVIEW. PLEASE READ!)

To top things off, my room had a leak in the ceiling. I tried calling the front desk and got a voicemail the first time, request to "leave a message in the mailbox" the second time, and an unanswered call completely the last time. Then housekeeping insisted it was the air conditioning and sent me to a disconnected line. Last, the room maintenance guy (who I reached after four tries hitting some weird message\/mailbox thing) told me he'd send maintenance crew to the room. Of course, the maintenance guy shows up an hour later, rubs the carpet (what?), holding a flashlight that is constantly flickering like a strobelight and just suggests I move to another room. He gave us a room on the 32nd floor with a lame excuse for a view of the strip and guess what? That concierge from earlier told us no room on that floor was available today. Ha. 

Then in the 32nd floor room, we opened the door to be greeted with a blast of cigarette odor. So we go downstairs and demand another room. We get a sorry from the supervisor, a few buffet coupons, and a new room with a draining problem in the bathroom. 

This "hotel," if it even deserves to be called that, is disgusting. Yes, it's cheap, but for a tiny bit more money, you can get a WORLD of a difference in quality. 

Save yourself. Stay away. Please.

this is such a great hotel! i stay here with my dance group for a competition and we always have a fun time. we were all very happy by the way we were treated by the team members and my parents definitely enjoyed it.

Nasty, disgusting..

Came here for adventure dome . I would never stay here . Couldn't pay me. I'm staying at the Hilton suites next door. Night and day with this place. I taught my kids how to press the elevator buttons with their shoes instead of using their fingers. The elevators were full of trash and smelled like urine.


People-- don't stay here. If money is an issue, stay a little off the strip. Download the "kayak" app and see all the different hotel rates. Don't stay here!

I'm a nurse and from a medical standpoint- this place is a health hazard.
An enormous place that has everything you could possibly want. I give this hotel four stars only because the Adventuredome indoor theme park, the hotels main draw was closed.
Not nearly as bad as I anticipated.  I got a dirt cheap rate for a clean place to sleep on the dodgey end of the strip.  If I ever need to be on that end of the strip again I'd probably stay here.

it's cheap, you get what you pay for, and rooms are relatively quiet.  Yes, it is smoky but guess what, you're in Vegas...

My only gripe, why did I spend 30min in line waiting to check into the hotel? more time in line means less time gambling or going to their amusement park.  you'd think they'd want you to spend more money at their "resort

This place is old, noisy, and run down. It is very kid friendly...but I can't imagine traveling all the way to Vegas with your family just to spend time at Circus Circus. Your kids will be happy, but you will want to die.

Super long check in line. 
Get to our room and they are still cleaning it and the carpet was wet. So we called and they said ok go to this room number and we will send security to open it for you and bring your new keys. We have been standing in this smelly, hot, hallway for 15 mins. 
So much for paying extra for a view...of the hallway!

If you're looking for an uber-cheap place to sleep in Vegas, Circus Circus might do it for you.  Our room was surprisingly spacious and updated - clean, comfortable and gobs of room to unpack and hang out.

However, that's about the end of anything remotely great that happened here.  The rest of the casino \/ hotel felt dirty, old and uncomfortable.  We couldn't wait to get out the second we stepped in.  It felt like walking into a bad part of town Walmart, except instead of the elderly greeters you have massively depressed looking employees and clowns everywhere.  Oh mah gah.

Also, for some reason I had a hard time figuring out where to check in upon arrival.  Maybe I'm distracted by blinking lights to easily, but the front desk was a bit tucked away and caused a luggage lugging excursion around some very drunk gamblers.  

Major bonus points for the Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas flashbacks though.

Boy was it a fabulous relief to check out and head over to the Aria (which was perfection) for the remainder of our Vegas stay.  If we ever return to Vegas with our little daughter, we might (might might might) return for a couple of hours to hit up the Adventuredome - but we will stay far away otherwise.

I booked a 3 star for Vegas which ended up being Circus Circus. I know that hotel to be kinda outdated but the main tower rooms seemed fine, after all, I would be working the whole time. When I arrived, parking was a nightmare. There was a 1.5 hour line to check in, everyone was drunk and it was a total sh@t show. I finally check in and they put me in the motor lodge across the street instead of the main building. The lodge is a 1 star at best and my reservation was for a 3 star, but since they blanket the entire hotel in the 3 star rating, they can scam people into thinking they are getting a 3 star when really they are getting much less. I argued with the front desk for another 20 min, by this time it was 9pm, I was tired and I figured I would just stay one night then transfer or leave. They wouldn't switch me rooms unless I paid for an upgrade. This is where I became so angry because it felt like a total scam. I wasn't paying more for a room I already paid for! They wouldn't budge, and I checked out the next day. Chad was the manager and he was horribly rude and unhelpful. I told priceline everything, but because Circus circus refused to refund me for the nights I wasn't there, priceline refused to help me. They are scam artists, do not book this hotel! They are just trying to get extra money for an upgrade on a room that should already be a 3 star. Shame on them.
It was great that they offered free half an hour circus shows. They also have games at the second floor where kids can stay at.

Maybe I hate this hotel because any time we've ever stayed here, it's been across the street in their motel section, not in the main casino hotel..and it's ghetto over there.  And even if I were to stay in the main hotel, I still don't like this place.  It's junky, clowns - yuck...maybe if you have kids this is the place for you.  I'm all about "Who cares where you stay in Vegas, you only use your room to sleep in" but I draw the line here.  I guess I do care where I stay and that will be anywhere but here.

Its an old hotel and is meant for the kiddies but when your drunk everyone becomes a kid again...lol  Stayed here when one night in one of there newly remodeled roooms...pretty nice, really comfortbale bed and nice size tv and free wifi that actually works was good, would stay here if was here for only a short weekend and if it wasnt summer time casue the walls are kinda then so you will here kids but if u come when kids are in school it is a good option..  Like the photo booth we usually hit that up sober and drunk at least once.  Slots so fun is a nice spot to hang out away from the kids and have good slots.

Yikes. This place was awful, it was back in November that we visited by I forgot to post my review. It's too crowded, kids are running and screaming absolutely everywhere, and the pool\/spa is FILTHY. Not only that, but in November, their spa was kept at cool\/room temperature. Like what?!? And it was outdoors too, so it was freezing. Don't spend your money here.

When Excalibur screwed up my reservation, I had to stay here for a night due to overall lack of options, money, and the patience to look for anything better. 

This experience reminded of going out with the boys, the end of the night is approaching and out of desperation to find anything better your friend just decides to go home with a slightly overweight girl, with a few missing teeth, heavy clownish makeup, really bad hair extensions, humongous hoop earrings, an ill-fitting outfit that helps her resemble a zebra print marshmallow, wearing frayed black leather peep toe shoes that reveal severely chipped toenail polish, and she stinks of sweat, Jennifer Lopez's "Live" perfume, and Marlboro Lights.

Just like the girl your boy ran off for a night full of fun that he will soon want to forget, Circus Circus is used up, run down, and in desperate need of a makeover. The place could use a little paint on the walls (less creepy clown makeup, dentures, and a pedicure), a revamped food menu (a diet and workout plan), and a better air filtration system (the desire to not wear perfume not sold at Wal-Mart and eventually quit smoking Marlboro Lights). 

In the end, the experience could have been better. But that doesn't mean I wouldn't ever go back. Just like if the same situation presented itself, your friend would be somewhat likely to repeat the same mistake again. But the second time around, you just make sure no one knows about it. As long as no one knows, there is nothing to be embarrassed out, right?

Then again, what happens in Vegas - stays in Vegas. Unless, you write a Yelp review about it.

Once when I decided to come to Las Vegas I decided to try out the Circus Circus. Once you get there you realize that you need to walk almost 5 blocks to reach the center of the strip. After you check in you get a small little room and wi-fi that sometimes doesn't work. When you go downstairs they have a nice looking casino but it actually closes at a certain time. If you don't want to gamble you leave the hotel and have to walk 5 blocks to the strip. If you decide to stop partying in the middle of the night you have to walk, probably drunk, 5 blocks through an area filled with hookers and dealers to the hotel. Also, the pool is very small and is closed if there is any wind. So if you want to experience Vegas fully I'd recommend staying at a hotel on the strip.
this hotel is not amazing, but for the price, it is good..
Getting a little bit old and nasty.  Sorry Gang.  Better places to stay in this city.

No scary clowns anywhere but low price rooms good if your with a big family with kids. Stratosphere also next door a good neighboring property to have. Value oriented and fun. If your anti - stuffy snobbery you will love this place.

A solid choice for people on a budget or who have youngsters who like roller coasters and the midway and fun dome. They have been trying to keep things up but compared to all the new mega resorts its hard to keep things as crisp. I remember years ago when they were painting the ceilings on the casino floor. They were going from black to white was it? 

There are many different towers. I like to always pick the tower that is most convenient based on the elevator location but whatever you do stay far away from the Manor Motor Lodge. Clean comfortable sports book with booths, cheap good pizza there nearby.

I once couldn't find my car in the garage. I spent hours looking for it in the hot hot heat to the embarrassment of a bunch of friends. Its so confusing these big places and if I remember correctly I was looking in the wrong garage or the wrong floors or something. After all that I usually just park on the roof.

Good value. I deducted a couple stars mostly just because I'm not a fan of staying so far north on the Strip. I have always disliked that part of Mandalay Bay for the same reason - too far south.

One thing to remember: if you stay at a budget friendly hotel you can compare the price of an upgraded jr suite here to the same price of the Harrahs standard room. Something to think about if you want to try a room with a lot of square footage.

So ya it's cheap.... But you will pay in other ways. I spent little money, but lost some of my soul here. 

First of all, this place is in a terrible location.  At one mile from the Strip, be prepared to take a lot of taxis or walk the desolate distance (which is no fun drunk and no fun sober). There's no coffee, there is no good restaurants save for tacos el Gordo And there are no good bars nearby.

This isn't located on the new nor the old strip..... It's just nowhere.

We stayed here for 2 nights. It was my first time staying at this casino. It was confusing trying to get to our room because they have different wings plus elevators. We could not find anyone that could direct us to our room. The room was clean but no mini fridge, coffee or microwave.  It was cool that the kids were able to go on the water slides and there is a play area and 2 pools. We also got the unlimited bracelets for the rides and them at was worth it. We would come again even though it's cheesy here only for the kids.

Had a great time this year. We were here last year as well. The rooms are clean . Staff was friendly. Bring your own water as they want 3 dollars a bottle. But what do you expect it's Vegas. Adventure Dome was fun as usual. Kids had a great time.

Circus circus is not even 1 star!  A negative 1 star might be over rating this property.  They advertise this place as a good place for family.  IT IS NOT!!!  I will NEVER EVER stay at this S#@t HOLE again!  The adventure dome is the one and only positive, and remember you don't have to be a guest of the hotel to buy a ticket for entrance to the Adventure Dome! I paid for an upgraded newly remodeled room???? To sum up this experience in one word HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!

I have been going to this hotel for the last 20 years and I still remember playing all those games when I was a kid. This hotel has not changed and they still have some of the older games that I played when I was a kid. The adventure dome was my favorite place in the entire hotel because of the rides and games they had in it. This is probably the only hotel I would bring my kids to in Las Vegas because of the circus acts and all the games that they can play and have fun with.

I got a great deal on Expedia. But the room had an odor to it.  The free Wi-Fi isn't free you pay for that in the resort fee of approx. $25.00 due at check in.  You only get 5mb of speed THAT'S IT!! Very thin walls, loud neighbors, and we woke up to a lake in our room.  During the night a pipe broke in the hallway and they didn't wake anyone up or even offer a refund.  I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!!

Ended up here because they had the cheapest rooms on the strip with a pool, $33\/night directly from hotel reservations.  Only booked two night to see how it is.  I got a room in the Manor, low rise buildings connected to the main buildings.  Pool was clean but only open unitl 6PM. But it gets cold when the sun goes down so no point in staying after then.  I wanted to stay three more nights. Hotel could only offer $33\/night.  Went on price line and got it for $26!!  I had to check out and back in and was prepared to wait a few hours until check in at 3.  When i checked out the clerk said i could check right back in then.  I got a room in the tower with a spectacular view. The room is clean everything works and it's actually quiet.  No Complaints The place is full of people and it's massive.  But so is every other hotel here.  Everybody is helpful and nice.  I have stayed in worse places for much more.
Didn't stay in the hotel but the casino and Midway are a blast! The circus acts are incredible and the arcade has fun for all ages!

DON'T DO IT! The cost of the hotel is inviting, but DON'T DO IT!! I stayed there for one week. Besides the additional hidden fees over $200 I needed to play at check-in, the hotel has a number of other faults.

Within three days in our first room I killed 5 cockroaches. I called and complained and they said they would move us to another room. We waited an hour for the bellhop to arrive to escort us to or new room. He didn't even help us with our bags. He walked is to the elevator, held the door  open, and pushed the button to our floor. I combed over the new room and found the lamp was missing a light bulb. I called and asked them to send somebody to fix it. They said they would while I was out to dinner. I came back from dinner and the light bulb was still missing. I complained again about the bellhop and light bulb and they said they were going to upgrade us to a suite. We got to the site and it was worse than our budget room. The only difference was the beds were very far away from each other. Very romantic. I asked to be placed back in no light bulb room. It still didn't have a light bulb by the way. They sent an engineer up another hour later to screw one in. 

DON'T GO TO CIRCUS CIRCUS!

I sure wish I had read these reviews before booking two nights here!  My boyfriend and I were on a short trip mostly centered around seeing our favorite artist perform at Planet Hollywood, and trying to conserve money, we booked at the Circus Circus.  It was so bad that we both wanted to go home a day early by the time we'd been in Vegas about an hour!  We're not quitters, though, and we ended up having a ton of fun in Sin City, we just didn't spend very much time at all in the room.  

The food available was gross.  Kid-friendly my ass - we walked through the lobby at about 2am on our way back to the room and everyone there was - I'm sorry - trashy.  Think mullets and Nascar.  Then came the pack of YOUNG girls coming down the escalator in their underwear (not exaggerating) with a bunch of skeezy looking guys with them.  The walk TO the hotel is flat out scary - this place is like the skid row of the strip.  The sheets were like paper towels and our "fitted" sheet didn't even cover the whole mattress.  The tub was dirty when we got there.  The mattress was more like box spring.  We wanted to check out ONE HOUR late and were going to be charged $20 to do so - are you kidding me?  The hidden $1 charges for things like having a phone in the room are just annoying.  

I'm rambling...but for the love of God, if you go to Vegas don't stay here!  Creepy, depressing, at times scary.  It's worth the extra money to stay elsewhere.

One of the cheapest hotels on the strip... I can see why.

Me, my boyfriend, and 2 brothers stayed in the Manor. We got to Vegas early and decided to book a different reservation. Our first room was not bad. But then we got into our second room... the cigarette smoke was STRONG! It smelled like someone just smoked in the room. I found 2 clean ashtrays in the room... even though the room is suppose to be nonsmoking. Every time we would come back to our room... it reeked. Now that I am home... some of my clothes still smell like the room. Ugh! Even the casinos smelled better.

Booking a room here was a complete disaster. When I arrived I was told I booked a lesser quality room than I did online and was forced to pay an upgrade for the room I initially paid for. 

When I pulled up the confirmation it only included prices, not specifics about what kind of room I book so there was no easy way to prove what I had paid for because I prices change from day to day online and could not match up with what is currently online. Other than that the website is old and hard to use to begin with. The woman that I spoke to at the desk was not helpful and border line rude when I tried to address this and the person on the reservation line, who although was much more friendly, was not any help.

The room that I was placed in is OK. It is something that I would expect at best western, but not on the Las Vegas strip. But for the price normally (weeknight,non-holiday) its not the worst. However, the particular room I was placed in was facing a solid white wall.

The casino itself is more like a casino in Reno than one on the strip. It is at the very least outdated and at the worst kind out dingy and smelly.

I was disappointed by the lack of bars open and the mount of people on the floor. It was kind of dead and the people who WERE out there seemed close to it (not just older BTW). 

The best thing I have to say about this casino is that it is kid friendly. Great if you have kids or want to go wild and be loud without others caring, but not so great if you want to be able to use the pool and sleep without a room full of screaming kids next to you. I think there might actually be a pro wrestling match going on down the hall. I'm 21 in Vegas so whatevs. but other people probably care.

 I would go somewhere else unless you don't have other options. The customer service sucks. The hotel is blah and the rooms are meh.

This place is just all kinds of BAD!  
*Smells terrible!
*Casino is claustrophobic as all hell!
*Endless rows of penny slots frantically being played by people in fanny packs and matching "What Happens In Vegas..." t-shirts.  
*More children running amok than parents to corral them.
*A KOA Kampground out back?!  Are you kidding me?!?
*I can't even imagine what the rooms look \/ smell like!
Could not get out the door fast enough to avoid feeling like I needed an immediate shower.

The only thing that could possibly make it even a tiny bit better is if the valets were dressed like clowns......except the cars would run over their big shoes.

This weekend we had family flying into Vegas and we decided to book a last minute trip to see them.  Since we are loyal MGM property customers we decided to look at Circus Circus because of the reasonable rates and newly remodeled rooms (according to their website).  Upon arrival, we were told that our room was outside of the main building and that it was only a 4 minute walk.  After a 10 minute walk with all of our bags we arrived at a small motel like dwelling that they call the "manor".  When we opened the door to the motel building we were overwhelmed with the smell of urine and dirt black carpet.  There were no elevators so we had to haul our luggage up a flight of stairs to get to our room.  

When we opened the door to our room we were less than enthused about our hotel accommodations.  The room was extremely dated, with old peeling wallpaper, popcorn ceilings, and a TV from the early 90s.  The floor was full of stains from who knows what, forcing us to wear our shoes when we were in the room. 

The bathroom tub faucet was leaking the entire time, the ceilings were covered in black mold spots, and the faucet to the sink had low water pressure.  When we took a shower the water temperature fluctuated between scalding and ice cold.  When my husband went to iron a shirt there was more mold growing in the water reservoir of the iron.  My husband has allergies to mold and my asthma symptoms were exacerbated this weekend and I attribute that to the mold and lack of cleanliness.  

The location of the room was so far from the hotel which deterred us from gambling at the hotel, so instead we took Ubers to other casinos and literally spent the entire day away from the property.  Since we were only in town for two nights and wanted to spend time with family we decided we would wait until check out to speak with a manager about our stay  When we got to the registration desk the line was ridiculously long and at that point we were so exhausted we wanted the experience to be over.  We had someone at the business center check us out, print our receipt and after that we left.

It does not end here.  We arrived at the parking garage and there was a line 35 people deep of people waiting for ONE working elevator.  There was no sign or attendant indicating that the other elevator was out of service.  When we finally got onto the kid filled elevator there was an open condom wrapper on the floor that made us feel uncomfortable given the fact that this hotel is geared towards families. 

Finally our experience was over.  I would not advise anyone to stay at this establishment.  We paid $200 a night for a motel experience that was far from satisfactory.

Why does the manor area even still exist?

I had to make a last minute reservation for one night and found a special on Hotels.com thinking I came up. Oh the regrets.

Firstly, when you make a reservation on their site or a third party, you can clearly see the photos they use aren't of the room you get. So right off the bat it's false advertising. Strike 1

The manor is a piece of shit. I paid nearly $130 for a room that looked like a homeless person lived there. The carpet was gross. The bed had strands of hair. The sheets had holes\/rips. The bathroom door had holes and blue tape holding together broken pieces. They say there's no smoking, yet the entire area smelled like smoke. The walls are so think that you can legit hear your neighbors showering. 

And to add to all that, the location is so meh. If you're staying in building e you end up having to do a lot of walking just to get to the hotel entrance. 

Also during my check-in around 11pm on a Saturday night, the staff were all grumpy. I get that you're working the night shift, but jeez at least fake it. They functioned like robots who didn't know how to sympathize. 

For a few dollars less, you can stay at Super 8 a few blocks away and be at the heart of the strip. 

I used to stay here with my family as a kid. Nostalgia got the best of me. Never again. I'd legit rather sleep in my car than ever set foot in here again.

I was never a yelper before, but this experience inspired me to sign up and write about my experience.

Where to begin...so having gone to Vegas a few times and staying at off-strip hotels, I decided to try for a "cheap" but closer to the strip option. So on my arrival, I called the front desk asking where I should park based on my reservation. They couldn't tell me until they checked me in, so I decided to park in that huge parking garage. I called them again to ask where the Front Desk was (I had not seen it on the way in) and again, they had no idea where I technically was. I could only hope that I was parked within CircusCircus.

After finding my way in, I found out that my reservation for the "Manor, Section E" was on the other side of the hotel, so I had to go back to the parking garage and move my car to the motel-quality rooms. My room was literally at the farthest possible location from the main lobby. This is fine, though, its just part of going to a new hotel so I won't blame them too much for this one detail.

Once inside the room, everything smelled smokey despite it being a smoke-free building. The carpet was tainted with black dirt, not sure what it was, but I wasnt planning on taking off my shoes at any point. I settled in for the night and tried going to bed but the room was quite hot. I tried turning on the A\/C but it would not turn on. There was a lot of noise from nearby rooms, and I'm pretty sure my bed's headboard was sharing the wall with the adjacent room's bed headboard since every time they were getting "busy," the rocking motion would translate to a slam against my head. I can't blame the couple for doing it, but the hotel is poorly set up if my headboard is responding in this manner.

When I woke up the next morning, it was because the pipes were rattling so loudly from someone taking a shower. I took that as sign to just get up and shower too, but first I decided to sit on the john for my morning appointment. Upon flushing, the dirty water completely exploded and splashed into my legs and my right arm (since I was using it to flush the toilet). I flushed it again and it repeated. I concluded that the toilet was designed to splash you back. I took a shower immediately following. Of course there was no hot water. At 6 am, this wasn't the best way to start my day. 

I went to the breakfast buffet shortly after and stood in line as a single cashier slowly processed people in. I guess this is the least terrible part of my stay. After eating my fill, I felt tired again and decided to head back to the room for a nap. Around 11 am, the maid was trying to get into the room. I left the security latch on but damn if that was going to stop her. She kept opening and closing the door until I got up and went over. She asks if I was planning to stay another day because check out time is at 11 am. I told them that I reserved for a 2 night stay and that my checkout was the following day. She looked perplexed and said it was OK. She left and I tried sleeping again. Less than 20 minutes later she comes back and repeats the situation. This time I show her my email confirmation stating that I had the room 2 days. She finally leaves and at this point I just decide to leave the room for the day.

It was then when I realized how far away CircusCircus is from the strip. My god that walk was horrendously long. I arrived at the strip to find out that hotels all have free parking, now I wish I just drove over. I ended up leaving the strip before sunset because I didn't want to walk back to the hotel in the dark. Those streets don't look very safe at night. I went for the dinner buffet and took a walk around the Adventuredome. It was just this horribly overpriced kids carnival. I went to the Casinos in the hotel and really felt the age of the place. With my poor sleep from the previous night and all the walking, I didn't have much more energy to drive back to the strip.

I come back to my room and see that my dirty clothes were put away with my clean clothes. How kind of them. I also found that the dirty towel I left on the floor after the toilet spill had been folded and put on the rack, but at least the maid left a new towel on the counter. I got ready for bed and all I could hear were children screaming from one of the adjacent rooms and more pipe rattling. The room felt hot again but I was already dreaming of better places to be.

Circuscircus was pretty cheap, in cost and in my experience. I'm not sure if I'll go back to Vegas if other hotels are like this. I don't get to travel much because of my low income. It is worth stating that if I had the money, I would try coming back and staying at a better hotel. Maybe the experience would be better.

Poor Circus Circus. It really is everything they say it is although it was nicer than I expected. Problem is, its very claustrophobic inside, and nostalgic, but not in a good way. The clowns on the wall are borderline too freakish for words and the smell of tobacco is overwhelming. I think though that you'll find that its not as run down as one might expect. It's just tacky. But at 25 bucks a night how can you complain? ? You get what you pay for. It's a place to stay and kids might actually enjoy it. Just hope you're not attacked by creepy clowns in the middle of the night and that a midget doesn't try and hump your leg at the poker table. I saw a few bearded ladies too-- not sure which one of them worked there.

This past weekend my sister and I took a weekend trip to celebrate her birthday. She had never been to Las Vegas before and literally booked the entire trip. She booked her hotel off a deal that came with a flights so we ended up staying at Circus Circus. When we got our room we were told it was in the Manor which is not part of the hotel. It's across the street (which was fine) but when got to the manor I was scared for my life . First of all it was about a 10 minute walk from the hotel . The Manor is also a row of building that look like a row of run down crack houses in the ghetto . Mind you it's Vegas you aren't going to be the room for long. As we were getting to our room the smell was so bad. I'm not knocking on anyone who smokes weed but the hallways teamed of it . Our too
 Was non smoking and it smelled like someone died in there . It wasn't clean at all . I felt like I was going to catch something. My face broke out 2 mins of walking into the room and sitting down . My sister went out to smoke and some random guys smoking weed were asking if she was alone for the weekend. 

My sister and I both called the front desk and asked how we can get a new room and or get a refund and we will find another hotel on the strip cause this was just unsafe . They did however move us back into the actually hotel towers but told us that if we bought a package deal the Manor is were they usually out all those ppl. We only had to pay an extra $5 a day so that was not bad to get a upgraded room and it was decent view extra. The toilets were clogging bough on all levels albeit that was the biggest down fall in the new room. Over the hotel isn't that bad . The drinks were strong and free since we spent time in the casino. We also checked out adventure land the roller coaster LOCO is pretty fun. 

Bottom line for this hotel I believe you shouldn't buy a bundled package flight plus hotel or you will be out in the Manor with the rest of crack heads . Lol
I used to go here if I want to play low stakes Blackjack or other table games...

I read so many bad reviews about this place and I almost cancelled and booked somewhere else the last minute. But honestly this place was not bad at all. We upgraded to the west tower for 5$ a night extra. Our room was clean and nice. The hotel casino was so much fun. All the theme park stuff was fun. It's obviously not as nice as all the bigger hotels but if your booking at the circus circus I would assume your not expecting that. It does suck that it's kinda far from every thing so you do pay for transportation. I was worried but overal I was happy with our experience!
If you don't have kids stay away! If you do have kids what are you doing in Las Vegas? I hate all the smoking indoors. Couldn't find any quality food at the hotel.

Worst hotel I have ever stayed at! Even worse than a motel six or low budget hotel! The room I stayed in was filthy! There was brown stains on the shower curtain! Mold under the handle to turn on the water in the shower and to top it all off the where doing construction at 8am in the morning right above our room. We went to sleep at 3am and then was woken up at 8 am every morning! Do not stay here spend the few extra bucks to stay somewhere else!
Fuck circus circus  hotel room is crap  food is crap  the next day I checked out n checked in the palazzo.

If you win - you lost !! They wont pay your win !!! Service is unnessecary because nobody cares and service buttons mostly doesnt work.. staff is unfriendly and the old ladies who serve cocktails are just disgusting!!! Buuh...

If I could give this 0 stars I would.This hotel is creepy, and old. The "AdventureDome" is pretty old and stinks like cigar & it was very expensive, the games are not that fun & the carnival games give out cheap toys which I guess it's okay.The hotel room was not nice we found some teeth under the pillows,saw some stains in the walls and we found hairs on the bathtub.Yes,it's cheap but you get what you pay for. The parking lot is scary,dark and old there's two parking lots,I left my car I saw a lot of cars had dents & scratches.Also I get the theme is about circus but like cool it down on the clowns, they're literally even plastered on the parking walks. Service is too slow.The McDonalds is horrible the cheeseburgers taste like rubber.Bad neighborhood.Only thing by there that's good is Tacos El Gordo. Luxor & Excalibur are much better! Wont never stay here again.

DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!! First of all this hotel looks like it should be a setting for an American Horror Story episode. The place is dirty and is due for a renovation. Parking is horrible. And this is suppose to be a hotel for kids?!
I stayed in 1426 with my family and the first night we stayed all of us we woke up with bug bites, multiple bug bites (most likely fleas). We went down stairs to talked to the manager there was a lady in front of us who's room smelled like cat urine and they gave her money back straight away. However, when it was our turn we talked with a manager Leo who later passed us off to some other manager. They tell us that they need to send security to check the rooms and file a report about the bugs in the room. They didn't offer any compensation or free night nothing! All we could do is twiddle our thumbs standing in the hallway while the check the room. The customer service is horrible! They don't give a sh*t about certain people's plight at their hotel. 

Just uploaded some pics and noticed that other people have posted pictures of bed bugs and other bugs in the hotel

haha, I liked this place when I first came to vegas when I was about 12 or 13 years old, I STAYED here in the hotel with my parents, of course after the long drive from California years back.  I had a great time, all the carnival whatsoever, video games that were not event available here in New York then and stuff. Las Vegas seemed more kid friendly at the time but then the casinos took out their video games, same with Atlantic City actually in the mid to late 90's.
I went back here in 2009 and it really did nothing for me, lol. Not even a bit of nostalgia, like oh I was in this exact spot over 14 years ago.  Now I got to see some of the new rides and stuff they built but yeah it is just a spot really for parents to drop their kids off for a few hours of fun time.  it is really a dinosaur casino compared to alot of others on the strip. Also, it is way out of the way, the very very edge of the strip before you get to the end of it but before the many many wedding chapells that you will pass by going further downtown. You can skip this casino, especially if you have been here in the past . You are not missing anything.

Was looking for something cheap to spend one more night in vegas. 30$ for 1 night. Cannot beat that. My room was better that expected, mostly clean. I was in room 2508 in building C of a section called the circus manor. Feels a little bit like a concentration camp. Biggest negative point: you are at the far end of the strip and have to take a bus or walk 30 minutes to get to the center of the strip.

My husband and I took the kids to Circus Circus for a little getaway... I was very disappointed.  First of all the pool area is surrounded by the parking lot so while you're swimming you will see cars going by, buses, campers etc.  The cleanliness of the room, I would say was below average. The elevators are extremely small and it was an extremely busy weekend so the wait time was very long.  Circus Circus has the air conditioner off in the hallways and no ventilation in the elevators.  The carpet in the hotel  had an unpleasant smell.  I know this hotel has been around for ages but it's time for it to be demolished!!!  And being right next door to the Camp site and Travelodge made matters worst....all the undesirables were right there!  They couldn't give me a room for free to stay here again!!!!

So I get there at 1130 pm I stand in players card line and then they state stand in the regular line next I had been a returning customer for business trips for a while with my fianc. So Michael helps me first and he is so rude the way he spoke to me about standing in the other line I always checked in at the players club line. So I agreed next time I'll check in the regular line Marygrace stated it's fine to heck in this time but next time at the regular check in line. Ok. So Michael was still so rude so I refuse to let him help me check in. So then I switched to Maggie who was also rude she checked me in I upgraded to sky rise tower she had keys ready and room ready and then she decided to go in the back for about 15 minutes comes back with a big Caucasian lady and she says "we're going to cancel your reservation and give you your money back......" at 11:45 pm(I'm 7 months pregnant) haven't slept all night drive 8 hours to be told this after my room was reserved and keys were about to be handed to me. Mary Grace comes over and helps the big Caucasian lady and they both say they don't have to tell me why but that they can't accommodate my needs.. what needs? And then after making me feel so uncomfortable and upset Mary Grace says you can stay if you want but your not welcome after anymore .... with no reason...... I'm not going to stay when you made me feel like this? Horrible people. and I already felt uncomfortable driving for 8 hours and they also said I can't book at any other MGM hotels so they pretty much caused me to drive and stress out no sleep for 24 hour and I'm 7 months pregnant. I have to see my doctor because now I am not sleeping right and this really really affected me mentally and physically I almost got in 2 accidents on the way home. To me : why did they not call me prior to say this? Why did Maggie set up my room only to leave me waiting with keys n front of me and say we're canceling" at 12 at night!!? Hey had no remorse! They let me walk out tired and scared and stressed! Now I have now see my doctor to make sure nothing is wrong! I almost crashed twice on the way home! So horrible and not professional not kind that they would check me in to cancel my reservation! They should be fired. That was very wrong! I will see my doctor and make sure everything is okay and if so will be reaching out to my lawyer. I really feel someone of very higher professional educated power should get back to me on this situation and handle these uneducated horrible employees. I had always recommend this hotel to my friends and family and bigger parties of people with my age (21-25 and 35-40) range why would they choose Circus? Because of me. It is so upsetting because my family went here since I was young as well we were never treated in such a manner. I cannot believe this happened to me. So very unprofessional and wrong in so many ways. It's very sad that these employees are a reflection upon this fun hotel. These employees are not representing MGM hotels in a good way at all. Hire me for a day and I can show them how you should treat guests. MGM is a professional hotel company and only professionals and nice individuals should be able to represent them no matter what. Horrible.

Incident date: May 18 2017 
Arrived est: 11:30 pm

Also prior to this I called around 330 pm spoke to grace I believe and I said is it okay that my father booked my room this time he used his card and I don't have it I want to make sure that room is paid she responded yes that's fine all you have to pay is $30.61 at time of arrival because room is paid already... room wasn't paid I owed $52 and they refused to honor that.

This hotel is not very expensive and all in all it's OK. Nice for kids, pool is OK, we've been treated well, just minus 1 because the non-smoking room still smelled (ex smoking room i suppose). 
Tip: there is a very good mexican reastaurant just around the corner, the El Dorado Cantina

This Casino may be on the strip, but not really.  It's just close enough to the actual strip for you to temp the walk, but beleive me the walk back from the strip (after a bit of alcohol) is not worth it.  

The noise in Hotel is too much to bare and the ones making the noise don't have the excuse of being drunk (they're kids).  So basically you have to deal with brats the whole night.

Next time I'm in Vegas I will not be staying at Circus Circus and the only reason I gave it 2 stars is that it is better than a flea bag motel, but only slightly.

I recently concluded a visit to Las Vegas. Initially, we were to be staying in this hotel. Quite frankly, I'm glad we didn't. The hotel looks old and dirty. The only part of the hotel that I found tolerable to look at was the lobby. This comes at no surprise since in order to check the hotel, one must enter the lobby and that's your first impression of the ENTIRE building. Nice way to trick people. 

Trying to kill some time around the area, we decided to play some games in the arcade. If you're wheelchair bound, it'll be very easy to get lost and you'll probably feel it's impossible to enjoy the "fun" located above the casino. I would consider mapping out your trip of the place before you enter to prevent further frustration.

After having a little bit of fun in the arcade we had to find out where to redeem our tickets earned. There are two areas. One area is only opened up on the weekends. There is no sign indicating this, so you'll probably stand there for a few moments wondering why employees are passing by you without helping you. Only AFTER we stood around for a few minutes and asked, the employee informed us of another prize station on the other side.

The wait there was just as irritating. We waited for about five or ten minutes. I was debating whether or not I should simply hop over and collect the proper prizes myself and leave the tickets on the table. Finally, someone showed up. No apology for the long wait, not even a "hello" or a general acknowledgment of our presence.  More of a look of "What do you want"?

I suppose the upside to the  trip was the employee let us slide with our prizes being 5 tickets short.  But that was really the highlight of my experience with employee contact.

To the employees: Smile. Guests like me are the reason why you're even employed. Be happy about that.

I stay in the Manor it was very clean the beds was nice and comfortable. The pool was nice you have to get a wistband in order to be at the pool security was making people go back to the front desk to get one. The bathroom was small and the room could be updated.

Reading the reviews on here made me hesitant to book through Expedia. But I am glad I did. When we checked in there was no line 1 AM Vegas time and went up to our room. It was the last room of the hallway and took a little time to find we were in the West tower and the elevators are located near the lobby. They gave us a $20 food and beverage credit as part of our Expedia deal. It is at the end of the strip and was conveniently located near all the main resorts and attractions. For the price ($500 for car and hotel for 6 days) it was not bad at all and would come back again. We did not use the swimming poor or spa, the buffet was ok and we used our coupon and got in for $16 for 2 people. The Mcdonalds located outside the front entrance was one of the best McDonalds I have ever seen from the food to the atmosphere do not go to the one on the second floor of inside the hotel. The lobby was a little smelly with a strong perfume, i am not sure what they were trying to hide. There were a lot of kids and plenty of Asian people who do not speak english in the hotel. But we mainly were not in our rooms at all and if you are looking for a cheap place to be on the strip with clean big rooms than this is the place to be.

I actually liked this dinky looking place. The big pink tent above sure catches your eye quickly if you're looking for this place.

Boyfriend & I entered in a little before 9, check in time is 11 so we had almost 2 hours to kill before entering in. ACTUALLY check in time is at 2, you can check in at 11am but you have to pay $10 extra, not bad just to get to our bed earlier and rest a bit more. We walked around the waiting area, we came here for EDC and there were A TON of people here for the same thing, it was nice to see some fellow ravers before EDC even started :)

I liked how there were convenient $10 and under thrift stores to buy presents, a small tiny store that sold Hello Kitty items and a LED clothing shop which is PERFECT for EDC outfit & accessories. There's also a Auntie Anne's & Krispy Kreme right next to each other, yummmyy! There's also this cute pizza spot called Pizzeria , I ordered a delicious Pesto Pizzazz Pizza :]

The hotel room was alright. We got the smoking room, it smelled like stogs in our room but the sucky part about this room was that we didn't even smoke in our room - _ - Since we were spending our time mostly at EDC, we just came back to our hotel; slept, watch a bit of tv, took showers, got ready and other things. 

Also another downer on this place was that it's filled with kids because of course of all the games and what not in this place :((

This review is for the midway only, as I have never stayed here. I enjoyed it here ever since I was a kid. They have tons of crane machines which is good, and the races and other games are always fun. My family members won on that bottle toss game and also twice on the quarter on the plate game last trip! So 3 huge stuffed animals! They got their money's worth!

I wish I would of gone elsewhere for this family trip but instead I'm stuck here in a "newly renovated" casino room that are supposed to be better than the west tower rooms. No frifge, way smaller rooms and bathrooms. Valet never available, horrible parking.

I was there today and I suppose to leave tomorrow but the room smell bad and everything is old when I made the reservation they never tell me that it's was manor tower and that's the worst tower and I ask if they can change my room and they say they can't but today when I said I going to leave early because the room it's awful they try to change my room but it's to late I really uncomfortable in that room.

Good for family with kids.
Watch circus and play games. Fun rides.
Only place you can take kids along in a place like Las Vegas

We found hair everywhere,  on the pillows and on the bed, on the bath towels, in the bathtub, and on the cups. The drainage in the tub is very slow. 

The internet is extremely slow. The TV is fuzzy. The remote control does not work. The most absurd thing is when we checked out there were two movies' charges. Given the horrible condition of the TV set, none of us switched on the TV. The only suspect is my 3-year old, who can barely read English. However, the staff at the front desk claimed because the programs were on for more than five minutes, the charges must be billed. 

The pool hours and Adventuredome hours are too short. 

We will never go to this hotel again.
This place is SUPER OLD! It's basically ancient, but it's the best place for kids to stay at. Their amusement park, arcade, and Midway are by far the best entertainments for 18-

I'm big on customer service and surprisingly Circus Circus in Vegas was lacking. Hundreds of people everywhere and it was hard to find someone to help. Then when we finally did (three young girls) they acted as if they couldn't be bothered. Talking and walking fast with still no answer to our question. The room smelled like an ashtray and I was sick when we left; I'm had Lysol spray to freshen it up. Would I visit again? Possibly. Have I had better? Absolutely!

It's not going to wow you.  It's not the newest hotel on the strip.  But overall, I had a pleasurable experience with no complaints.

One small inconvenience is the lack of microwaves.  It would have been nice if there was a communal microwave in each building.

We stayed in the Sky Tower and the staff were always friendly.  The view wasn't so bad either.

I would be willing to come back and stay again.

I didn't want to give 1 star but this was the only to let others know about how Circus Circus customers service. Really is.  My Mother 82 years old. Love Circus Circus for many years.  Every time we visit Las Vegas, she would play at Circus Circus the whole trip.  No other Casinos.   This time she wanted to stay at Circus Circus
So I made her reservation for 2 rooms.  Joining rooms for her and her grandson.  4 days 3 nights.  First night no heat no hot water both room.  They contacted front deck.  They sent someone up to fix the problems.  No luck there.  So the front deck offered them more blankets.   Omg you would think no heat no hot water.  Change the room.  But no they left them all night to freeze.  The next day. My Mother told me she was cold all night.  Couldn't take a shower because water was too cold.   I called ask for supervisor.   They put Johnny front desk manager on line.  I explain to him about the problems and he told that I know nothing about what is going on here because I am not in the rooms.  He stated that he would change their rooms and credit back 1 night per room.  I said thank you.  Front desk screwed up and changed only 1 room.  I called Johnny back.  he wasn't happy because, I called him back.  So he stated I will put your family out.  He was very loud and rude.  He said front desk will make the changes.  He was very unprofessional.   I guess he think he owns Circus Circus.   My Mother said she never wants to stay at Circus Circus ever again.

I was very skeptical about staying at Circus Circus because I had heard some horror stories in the past. However, I decided to give it a try for old times sake. As a child, we ALWAYS stayed in the manor. Circus Circus was the place to be, so I figured it could not be THAT bad and it will be nice to reminisce. I did know though, that I definitely wanted to stay in the actual hotel this time and to stay far away from the manor. (The manor alone is why this place gets a bad rep in my opinion, and has such few stars.)
Check in was the quickest I have ever had in Vegas. I did check in around 5 on a tues, which may have contributed to it being so quick and painless. (Only one couple ahead of us, and less than 5 minutes when at the counter.) 
I booked the West Tower King Room. The elevator was literally right across from check in, and a short walk from the parking lot. The room was much better than I expected. (I usually stay at Mandalay Bay, but knew not to look forward to a room any where near as nice.) It was relatively modern, with a restroom larger than I expected. The bed was a little soft for my liking, but my boyfriend LOVED it. Though it was soft too me, I slept very well. However, they have THE WORST pillows. (One pillow was too low and sleeping on two was too high.) The air has a high or low option. I enjoy getting to input a number for the temperature, but settled on the high setting. This set the room to a decent temperature, but definitely not as cold as I would like. The restroom had peeling wallpaper and poor circulation. However, I had no problems with water pressure or leaky faucets like others have reported. Also I never heard any noise outside my room, though this may be because we were in the last room at the far end of the hallway. Housekeeping was great. No problems there as the room was always spotless. I was very disappointed that the room had NO keurig coffee maker. Why advertise something and even include it in your "resort fee" if you do not have it? This is the second mgm property advertising keurig coffee makers and not having one.   
As for food, this is where they lose a star. I wanted to try the Blue Iguana restaurant but it closed at 9. It's Vegas, so obviously people will be out late. I got back to the hotel at 9:30 and was bummed it was closed. Also the garden grill is basically only open on weekends, another downside for me. I did end up trying two places. I had breakfast at barista bagels and more. They have a $5 breakfast bagel that includes egg, cheese, and sausage or bacon. I had this in a cheese bagel which was SO good. I also tried the Westside Deli. I HAD to eat here to reminisce. As a child I always ordered the footlong hot dog with nacho cheese. I was thrilled to know they still had these. They are $5.50. I would not shut up to my boyfriend how these used to be $2 and then went up to $2.50 which was heart breaking as a child. (This was over 10 years ago, which he continuously reminded me but it was SO great to reminisce.) 
They are the same hot dogs from that long ago, in the same place. The hotel decor also is the same, which is why so many people are skeptical of CC. However, never judge a book by it's cover. Yes it does appear a bit run down, but the room is FAR from this. Also the staff was THE BEST I have had in Vegas! Every time I passed one, they always said hello with a smile. They were happy to answer any questions people had, and were great with directions. 
This hotel is on the strip, but far from other attractions. One thing to consider if this is important to you. I drove to the other end of the strip and then walked around. If I had walked to the middle of the strip from CC in 100 plus heat, I would of been too exhausted to do anything else, not including the walk back. I would stay here again on a budget trip. It truly is great for the price. The pool is just a pool, which is the only reason why I would not stay here again on a "relaxation trip", but as a great place to crash it does the job.

I've been to this hotel twice. Once in the late 90s as a kid looking to have fun, and once in 2012 as a broke recent college grad looking to save some cash. In two separate decades this hotel has completely disappointed me which is a feat considering I'm under 30. 

A lot of people will say this place is good for kids, as a child I hated it because I couldn't really roam as I wanted (no casino will let your kids run free) and the clown vibe was creepy. Take that and mix it with having so many issues with their indoor amusement park, it was pretty much the worst. 

As an adult those clowns just get even worse. Small pool. Like really small pool. So small when people pass you the water gets warmer...that could be caused by something else, but I won't worry about this because there's enough chlorine in the pool to bleach your skin.

The rooms are old, and a bit musty. The casino is small and not enjoyable. If you want a trip to Vegas away from kids, this is not the place (don't worry we didn't expect to be kid free). If you want to go to a good hotel, this is not the place. 

That being said, the biggest problem with this hotel is LOCATION. If you want to go to any portion of the strip it's going to be a $20 cab ride at least or a 2 mile walk. If you've been to Vegas in the winter you know that means a freezing walk, and in the summer you will be drenched in sweat by the time you reach the boat at TI. 

There are better family friendly spots, and there are better located cheap spots. The only reason to stay here is a free hotel, or the desire to walk more than you've ever walked before.

Ummm. This casino is seriously outdated and kind of dingy. I feel like if there was a massive renovation then this place would be all right! But as of right now, I would never even consider staying here. The hotel usually has cheap rates which is good if you're doing Vegas on a serious budget. Also, parking is free here. What keeps me from giving one star is the circus performances. Those are neat!

Really enjoyed the midway carnival perfect fun for the whole family ... Was really excited about the mc Donald's inside the midway carnival however we were extremely disappointed with the service and the food at the mc Donald's ... Good was cold and order was wrong would not recommend going to the McDonald's inside circus circus 
Next time we will eat before we go or maybe go to the buffet

I'll be honest, you get what you pay for. I wouldn't call this a "bad place" or anything like that. Just kind of ghetto in a way. It's dirtier then most other casinos in Las Vegas and the people running around are pretty low brow. However, with that said it does have some upsides. Not being directly on the strip allows you easy in and out access to major roads and in the end, you get to do more if you choose. The other plus is the friendliness of the staff. So you know, it's give and take with this place. I'll let those reading this review form their own opinion.

Bed bugs!  No joke!  Sorry for the grammar\/spelling I am doing this on my phone.  First we arrive and the GPS took us to the hotel entrance where we used the valet with no issue.  We get in line for the check-in, took about 10 minutes, great!  Pulled the $20 sandwich trick, dude knew what we were doing, awesome.  We go up to our room and there is a manager lady inspecting the room.  She saw a small tear in the lamp shade and said she was going to replace it.  She left the room.  In the meanwhile we pulled back the sheets to find both beds had torn sheets and both had big stains, but they were clean.  We go into the bathroom to find that the ceiling is leaking above the shower head.  It was a huge bubble and was dripping pretty fast into our tub.  I called the front desk and they told me to sit tight engineering will be there in 45 minutes.  I requested a new room and they asked that I stay until engineering gets there.   Engineering shows up and so does the manager lady.  Engineering says yup, you guys may want to get a new room.  Manager lady got a bellhop to bring us keys to our new room after another 30 min wait.  So we move rooms, tired and cranky but they took care of it.  We get to our new room and it looks great.  Until my nephew went to look out the window and found 3 used Q tips laying on the floor where he was standing.  I was grossed out as was my wife and nephew.  I went to the hallway to tell the house keeper who could not understand me or the things I was saying.  I got frustrated and went back to my room to call the manager.  They were sending housekeeping and the housekeeping manager.  In the meantime my wife stepped on a staple and we found 4 more thick gauge staples around the room.  Housekeeping arrives picks up the Q tips and says sorry.  They leave.  Still a little grossed out.  By this time it's been 2 hours since check-in so the wife and nephew went to bed and I went to gamble.  It took me a bit to find the casino floor as the signs were not clear, but I finally found it.  It was way to cramped so I never even sat down and headed to the Rio.  When I came back it was much later and I decided to sit down to enjoy some blackjack.  Table was nice, dealer was nice, rules were the norm and they only had $10 tables.  The other players were pretty unsavory characters.   There was definitely some gang affiliations going on with-in that casino and not just one.  So I retire for the evening to my room and went to sleep.  It was quiet and a decent bed.  I woke up the next morning and went to take a shower.  The tub was filling much faster than the drain could keep up which grosses me and my wife out.  So I finished and told my wife, she didn't want to shower in there.  As I am getting dressed my wife is out of the bed and says eew a bug on our sheet.  She goes to flick it off and I said wait.  And I got down and looked at it and said "do you know what that is?"  She says no, it's not a bed bug is it?   Now I have only heard of these but have never seen one, thanks to the power of Google I Google'd it.  Sure enough it was a dead bed bug!  I was irate!  I called the front desk and demanded to speak with a manager immediately! They connect me to a supervisor who I told I found a bed bug and I wanted to cancel my room for the night and wanted a full refund for both nights!   He offered me a refund for the next night but wouldn't give me one for the previous until there is an investigation of the bed bug which could take 10 days.  He then Sent security to the room to start the investigation with written complaints and pictures of the bed bug.  When we went to check out I found the supervisor and asked him if he had see the pictures, he said yes.  I said is it what I thought it was, he said he was legally not allowed to say and I could find my answer if I Google'd it.  I said I want my money back for last night now.  Again he said he couldn't.  I said what if I stood here in your lobby and started showing people the picture? He said he would have the police escort me off the property.   So I left peacefully and went to the mgm grand for the next night.  This was just a terrible experience and will never go back.  It's been 13 days and still no refund.  I will try to add a photo!

This obviously isn't the fanciest place in Las Vegas, but it's alright. My borfriend and I stayed in LV just for the weekend, so we didn't spend much time at the hotel anyway. It's at the end of the strip, and it's easy to take a bus from the hotel down the street to see the Bellagio fountains or check out other places along the strip. The buses come every few minutes, so you don't have to worry about waiting too long. Also, you can drive your car and park it in some other hotel's parking structure while you walk around, and then drive back. That's what we did and it made everything a lot easier. We had dinner at the Garden Grille...the food wasn't bad (our lunch at the Eiffel Tower Restaurant was the best, though) and the waitress was super nice, she even gave me a free margarita. As for the room, the bed was actually comfortable, but then again I was exhausted from walking around all day and could have fallen asleep anywhere. The room was a pretty good size, no, I couldn't hear people in neighboring rooms through the walls, but people in the hallway were a different story. I didn't go to the adventure-dome, but I did spend about 45 minutes in teh midway. It was crowded. I'm sure all the parents just drop their kids off there when they want to gamble; that's what mine did when I was younger, lol.

Maybe I'm giving this place a good review because I won a giant pillow pet from that game where you toss rings onto bottles. I named him Ceasar.

I used to stay here as a very small child (as an infant, probably).  I don't have too many memories here after the age of 4, though I have gone back to visit the Adventureland dome place and ridden that rollercoaster in there.  The adventureland dome is fun and they also have an extensive arcade and fun center, which is cool, but other than that this place is a little older and I don't think I would want to stay there now.  It's also quite a bit off the strip so this wouldn't be my first choice of hotel to stay at.    
Still, if you're a family traveling to Vegas with kids, I would at least stop by the game center, arcade, and the adventureland dome (a little theme park of sorts).

I love this place.  The atmosphere is right, the rooms smell and look good, great working WiFi and the parking isn't bad and is free.  My favorite part though is that the staff is friendly and very loving.  Thank you so much for making my birthday a special one. Thanks for the flowers lol. Ask for Carrie. She's a angel!

This "motel" deserves no star ratings at all... Stayed here for the Labor Day weekend, thought that I was paying a decent price for a decent hotel near the strip. Turns out this place is an extreme rip off because for the amount they charged this place was completely disgusting. We were placed in Building B,  ghetto looking motel style building. The room itself looked ok at first glance. At some point I noticed the towels had disgusting yellow or black stains on them. Called the front desk and asked to have clean towels brought to our room. The second set of towels were stained also. The beds looked ok, but read a lot of reviews about beds having bed bugs. 
None of the ice machines were properly working. 
The swimming pool was extremely disgusting, way too overcrowded and just gross.

We stayed at the Circus Circus RV Park in back of hotel.  Very nice location.  We used their pool and the laundry machine which is top rate.  Easy to catch a cab from hotel and facilities were all available for us in the RV park.  Would come again.

No,  just no. I literally cannot think of ANY conceivable reason to stay here. Ok, send your mother in law here but do not go yourself. 

I do not care what anyone says,  the entire place smells like an ashtray. Yes,  they claim the rooms (specifically the West Tower) are non smoking. Right. Maybe no one is actively smoking in them at this second but smoke has permeated ever crevice. Our kids and I were sneezing and sniffling the entire 48 hours we were stuck there. 

The elevators are inadequate - either out of order or perpetually unavailable. 

The lobby is ALWAYS jam-packed with people waiting. ..waiting to check in,  waiting to check out,  waiting for their car\/cab,  waiting in general. 

Nothing in the facility has been updated since before I was born (I'm old). 

The pool is ridiculous. ..the capacity exceeds 3000 people but there are not nearly enough chairs to accommodate. There is zero shade unless you care to fork over big bucks to rent an umbrella or cabana. 

You'd think that given the dilapidated,  unpleasant facilities that food and drink would be less expensive compared to the rest of the strip. ...not so. 

We only chose to go here bc of our littles and the potential activities within. Save yourself - stay off the main strip,  save money,  rent a car.

When I walk into any hotel I give it 5 stars, any negative experiences after that always impacts it for me. I think 2.5 would be a fair and accurate rating to give but 2 is my only option here. 
Yelp considers 2 to be "Meh. I've experience better" what a great way to sum this place up.

Our first two negative experiences happened at check in, the receptionist were nice, some of them were hard to understand but I don't think it was any fault of there's, more age related. Anyways we got our key card and proceeded upstairs to our non-smoking room. I swear, i've walked into some rooms that might have a "faint" smell of cigarettes, but this 1st room was as if someone took cartons of cigarettes, put them in the middle of the room and little them all on fire before throwing them out the window just as we walked in. We both were sick with colds so could not stand the stench. We walked downstairs again and politely told the front desk what happened. She apologized and said they were trying to fix this issue (it must happen a lot) but at least they are trying to fix it. Okay fine, second times a charm, we quickly are handed a new set of keys with a different room to test out.
Our second room smells fine, and we quickly get excited, but it was short lived as we try to turn on the lights and soon realize that not a single light switch works, including the bathroom. At this point i'm viewing the hotel as a hike to and from the front desk and consider activating my step counter.
Our 3rd visit to the desk we are polite again and explain what happened in this room, the women now seems amazed (maybe most people give up by the 3rd try?). So she quickly walks away and mumbles something about manager, she is being nice, i honestly cannot understand what she says though.
