I look at my female friend for a translation and she shrugs and mumbles manager in recognition of all i understood. 
Okay so the manager comes out and starts typing a novel on the keyboard and apologizing, he is also very nice and courteous, he helped us with 1 night resort fee which we definitely appreciated and moved us into our 3rd and hopefully final room.
Upon entering our 3rd room everything is in order, smells, electricity, running water... so i'm happy camper, my female friend collapses into the bed in exhaustion from our hike in zion park and now in Circus Circus. 
Day 1 complete at Circus Circus... why is the clown so scary looking?

Day 2
Goes fine, the building doesn't explode but watch out for the toilets, they flush so hard i swear they could suck your arm down with it. Okay not really, but they will surprise you if you're not ready for it.
So it's 10pm, (12\/17) I tell my friend we should watch a movie, she shrugs without thought while staring at an ipad. I think she knows i'm tempting fate at this point.. 
I click the menu and it tells me to call the front desk for movies. Okay...that's a little outdated but sure. I pickup the phone and make the call, front desk doesn't answer, instead it is the operator, who tries to connect me again... no luck, so she tells me they will call me back in a minute. I wait 5 minutes and call back, she tells me they haven't forgotten about me and hangs up again. I wait 30 minutes and call back, reminding her it has now been over 30 minutes, she apologizes and says she will personally go check on why the hotel wont accept my money for a movie (not those exact words, but seriously..) I wait another 30 minutes and start writing this review. I have now been waiting 1 hour and 15 minutes including the writing of this review.. I'm not one to give up but honestly. I give up Circus Circus, if you don't have customer service or accountability, you do not have a hotel.

Sincerely,

Ryan
Prior customer service manager of 3 retail stores and now traveling

Brought my child here to check out the free circus acts and midway during a recent vacation.  Arrived shortly after 10 am. Asked where the midway was.  I was given directions by a helpful hotel\/casino employee - who neglected to tell me that the midway doesn't open until 11. 

Bathrooms were kinda dirty.  Gross to find empty beer bottle sitting on the toilets - at 10 AM. Makes you wonder when the bathrooms were last cleaned.

The free circus acts were definitely top notch.  We saw some great trapeze acts.

this place was terrible!! i stayed in the manor buildings. It looked as if i was staying in the ghetto. the bathroom was smelly, wallpaper coming off, the door didn't appear to be secure, there was a nail in the mattress, blood on sheets, the sheets didn't smell fresh, neither did the ones the maid replaced it with. I will pay extra to stay at another hotel closer in on the strip. so at ALL COST AVOID THE MANORS!! it's not worth it! yelp needs to post pictures of the manors so you can see where you may end up.

Definitely not the fanciest hotel in vegas, but it's fairly cheep. They offer quite a bit for the price,  but are still located on the strip. Good if you want the Vegas experience with breaking your pockets in comparison to other hotel casinos on the strip.

This was the worst hotel experience... 4\/6 elevators were broken in our tower. We had to wait 1 hour to get to our room each time. It was beyond awful we were basically trapped. They didn't allow anyone to use the stairs. No refund was offered for 100 bucks a night a cheap hotel with rude people every where. You definitely get what you pay for. The line for the pool another hour wait.

Well, its not the bellagio but it wasnt bad. My room key didnt work but it was because it got demagnetized when i put it in my pocket next to my phone. Its weird that it was so sensitive but they took care of it and i kept it in my other pocket and it was fine. There was no bad smells of smoke, piss, vomit, or anything else anywhere, just a few smokey areas in the casino near the tables where you would expect it. Everyone was friendly, ran into a broken prize ticket game and they gave me 200 tickets for the inconvenience and when i cashed them in, the lady gave my 1 year old a free toy. Food was good, room was clean, casino was nicer than i expected. I dont know if the experience is different from room to room or tower to tower, but the west tower was ok for me. I was expecting the worst from reading all the bad reviews but its not what i got. Just thought i would give a good review where it deserved.

2.5 stars. Yes, it's inexpensive but if you want the 'Vegas Experience' you probably want to stay elsewhere. 

As many others have mentioned, Circus Circus is pretty outdated and far from the action. The casino and other facilities are unimpressive, old, and are more reminiscent of Reno rather than the famous Las Vegas Strip. 

Shops and eateries are pretty meh 

My room was clean and adequate, however, it felt very much like a motel. Not as bad as others have mentioned, but perhaps this was because I was here for CES and the hotel wanted to have its best face on for the techies. 

I suggest you shell out the $20 more per night and stay somewhere like the Luxor or even Excallibur. Trust me, it will be worth it.

Waren im Oktober 2014 fr eine Woche im Circus Circus. Wir haben uns fr dieses Hotel entschieden, da das Preis\/Leistungsverhltnis & die Lage recht gut ist. Das Hotel ist im typisch amerikanischen Style eingerichtet & seine drei Sterne wert! Wir hatten ein Nichtraucher Zimmer welches fr amerikanische Verhltnisse recht gro sind. Das Badezimmer war sehr gro & es waren alles ntige vorhanden. Das Zimmer wurde tglich gereinigt & Handtcher wurden ausgetauscht. Die Einrichtung ist nicht das neuste aber auch nicht kaputt oder abgenutzt. Es ist alles vorhanden was man bentigt und von den Hotelstandards her kennt. Es gibt gratis WLAN im Zimmer. Fr Las Vegas ist es typisch, dass es in jedem Hotel  Frh\/Mittag und Abendbuffet gibt. Somit gibt es solche Buffets auch im Circus Circus. Wir waren zum Frhstck- und Abendbuffet dort & es war gut. Eine gute & groe Buffetauswahl und man kann sich was frisches kochen lassen. Aber auch im Hotel gibt es Restaurants, wo man auch gut & gnstiger essen kann. Natrlich kann man das Circus Circus Buffet nicht mit anderen 4 oder 5 Sterne Hotels vergleichen. 
Direkt vor dem Hotel gibt es eine Bushaltestelle, von welcher aus Bus den ganzen Tag den Strip auf & ab fahren. An der Bushaltestelle kann man Bustickets fr verschiedene Tage lsen. Gegenber ist das Riviera Hotel mit einer Hertz Autovermieter. Im Circus Circus kann man kostenlos parken. 
Vom Hotel aus, kann man innerhalb von ca. 10 Minuten zur Fashion Show Mall laufen um zu shoppen oder essen. 
Also wenn man nicht viel wert auf Luxus legt & sich mit einem normalen Standardhotel zufrieden gibt, ist man hier genau richtig.
Ich kann das Hotel weiterempfehlen.

Be careful.  Could be fun for your kids during the day but the rooms are awful, especially the rooms in the annex.  VERY loud and uncomfortable.  Felt Like I needed to sleep on the floor (it would have been cleaner).

We decided to stay here since we were having a family vacation and it had the Adventuredome. We checked in at 3:30pm and the line was sooo long it took us about 20 minutes before we got our keys. I called the express check in line at 3pm and was told we wont be able to get the keys until after 4pm since you have to call an hour ahead. Wish they told me that when i made the reservations! After being on the road for 8 hours, the last thing I wanted to do was wait in line to check in. Anyway, we stayed at the West Tower rooms and it was nice; flat screen TV, built-in safe, pillows were fluffy and the granite tabletops made it look classy. The bathrooms were clean and spacious. We got 2 connecting rooms, and the only upset was that the other room smelled like bleach when we first walked in and the carpet  was damp. After a few hours, the smell went away and the carpet dried up, so not much of a complain there. Overall, the room was above my expectations for $37\/night. The Adventuredome was pretty cool too. I recommend getting the all day wristband because each ride costs anywhere from $5-$8. 

Piece of advise, DO NOT GO TO THE BUFFET. IT SUCKS.

We  stayed in the casino tower.  Very nice room.  Everyone was very nice.  The shops had great pirices on gifts.  The splash and pool area was so nice for our 
grandkids.  The lifeguards were very aware  and did a great job. We had a lot of fun here and will be back.

I had an extra day in Las Vegas and took full advantage of it by walking everywhere or something like that. I got to my hotel room and settled in and while the deal I got was plain simply amazing this is Circus circus and that is about all I could handle there was a lot to do and see but my brain had little processing memory in it. I will try the circus circus again in Reno and maybe Las Vegas.

We stayed at Cancun Condos for several days with my son's family. Went to Circus Circus for the carnival rides and games\/prizes my grandson had been dreaming about. It was not upscale and spiffy like Disneyland but maintenance was good and place was pretty clean. Free parking was amazing and great variety of fun rides and games. Few food choices. Best of all was the cheerful, friendly attitude of the folks running the rides and games. All were concerned my grandson was enjoying the games and rides and understood what he needed to do to win. We went home with a bag of stuffed animals, some fun temporary tatoos and smiles on every family members face. Very memorable for my grandson. Thanks Circus, Circus!

Not a good place to stay. Not convenient, hotel service is not good, ice machine was not working in our floor, rooms does not smell fresh and lobby is not accessible. Hotel employees are not professional. Not coming back ever.., sorry!

Terrible. Smelly and shady. This place is a cesspool. Motel 6 rooms are better. The rooms are far away in their compound and no shuttle available so you have to walk for 10 minutes or so. The atmosphere was horrible. I wish i had paid 50 extra for better rooms in other casinos.

Here is A Hotel which I would say if your on a Budget and looking for a Hotel in Las Vegas which is kind of near the other Hotels then this is the one !! First I would say Good Hotel for the Price !! Also it is a good hotel for Families. The Room was Clean and the bed was pretty Comfy !! The thing is just a Bit far that's it . But overall I shall Return and stay here again !! Not Bad for the Price!!! One more thing the Bathroom was ok also !!

Not bad for a circus squared

Overall:

I stayed at the manor which is across the street from the actual hotel and casino. I think it was pretty nice not having to trek through the casino with all your baggage. You can park right outside your room. I would recommend staying here if you need a cheap place to stay read my complaints below to see if it is right for you. 

Arriving: If you are staying in the manor I would not bring your luggage in since you will have to move over to the manor anyway. Self parking was pretty dirty due to all the kids spilling their liquids.

Check in: Check in was very quick and polite.

Compliments:

Air conditioning worked A-okay. 

Room was clean.

No reported bed bugs.

Next to Encore so good for clubbing.

Bed was comfy.

Complaints:

Most noticeable complaint is the windows they have a bit of a gap in them so when the wind blows you will hear it. 

Water pressure is a bit on the low side but nothing too bad. 

Bed had only a thin blanket didn't ask for a thicker one so that is really on me.

They still have those tube televisions.

Safe was not working or broken.

My parents used to come here every single trip to Vegas. It was a perfect place for my parents to gamble downstairs while my sister and I roam freely upstairs.  There are games, circus acts\/shows, video games, and food. So there was plenty to do while the minors play and the parents gamble. I used to love coming here when I was a little girl and loved playing video games.  

Now that I'm much older, I realized that the place has been run down for over 15 years. They haven't done much remodeling and the place just feels small, messy, and so dated.  This hotel is very family oriented and very kid friendly. There are tons of things for kids to do and there are still plenty of gambling for the parents.  I would highly recommend stopping by if you have kids.  Made for kids but not exactly glamorous for adults.

Where do I start....

So we book a room to Circus Circus from one of those discount websites.  It was a great deal, half price and close to everything we wanted to visit.

We get to the hotel and once we find our way to guest registration we are greeted by someone who clearly was at the end very long shift and wasn't at all pleased with the idea of checking anyone else in.  She very unceremoniously informs us that the room we booked wasn't available and we will be placed in another room.  No apology, no compensation.  When we asked if there was another available room that we could perhaps pay to upgrade to she simply said "No".  I also found it a little unsettling that there was a resort fee on top of what we had already paid online.  It was nice to hear that this resort fee did come with access to their wifi.  

I try to not let my experience at guest registration ruin my trip so I head to our room, which mind you is literally as far away from guest registration as you could get and still be considered Circus Circus.  Our room was in the very back of their property in what I'm guessing is one of the original buildings from when Circus Circus was built.  If the decor was any indicator it was some time in the 60s, probably the last time our room saw any real attention.  

We settle into the room and I attempt to connect to the wifi I was told about at the front desk.  The one thing I'm thinking is probably the only thing I'll get of use out of this resort fee I paid.   To my surprise I find that there is no available wifi.  
 
None of this was all that terrible really, it was a cheap price and really how much time do you want to spend in your hotel when you're in Las Vegas?  The real problem came with the paper thin walls.  I could hear people in the adjoining rooms as if they were in my room with me.  Being Las Vegas no one sleeps, ever, so clearly I was a fool to think I should expect any sleep.  

In the end it was all too much for me and my trip was cut short.  After driving for nearly 5 hours and getting almost no sleep I opted to drive home.

I love this place. Took my 2 boys ages 7 and 5 so we were able to enjoy Las Vegas in a whole new way! We had an awesome time here. The all day passes are definitely worth it if you're staying here.. We went for a few hours then came back later at night. We went during the week so there were little to no people in the place ( MY KIND OF THEME PARK!) My boys had so much fun. Make sure you use the coupons they give you when you check in. There are a few coupons in there for free games and $5-$10 off all days passes at the Adventure Dome. Overall we had a great time here!

Its saddening to see the poor reviews for The Circus Circus. I've stayed here almost every time I've visited Las Vegas since I was a child with my parents. Now as an adult I still stay at The Circus Circus.

This past Saturday my husband and I stayed at The Circus Circus, only for one night, as a little pre honeymoon trip. It was absolutely wonderful. 

We arrived at about 11am and we went to eat at the Pizzeria. Amazing food!!

We then decided to see if we could check in early. The front desk staff were incredibly kind. We were asked if we wanted a lower floor or a high floor with a view. We asked for a higher floor and we were given the topmost floor in the Skyrise Tower. The view was INCREDIBLE to say the least.

We ended up spending most of our time at The Circus Circus. We went to the Midway, walked around the Adventuredome, and played the slots. 

Sure at the Midway it can seem to be a rip off but people need to understand that those games are designed to not be easily won, especially the ones with the large prizes. We really enjoyed ourselves even though we had some problems with the arcade games and not giving tickets. But the arcade staff were more than willing to open the machine and give us as many tickets. 

The casino, yes, is smoky, but it wasn't debilitating as I've seen from other comments. That comes with casinos, especially older ones. 

The housekeeping staff were amazing, if we had any questions or needed anything they were more than willing to help us out. There was one girl in particular who stopped to talk to both my husband and I on several occasions. She was so sweet and it was very nice and easy to talk to her.

We enjoyed our stay so much and we do plan on returning in the near future.
Worst hotel I have ever been to. I was sent to a manor building that was like a hooker hotel. PRices ARE OUTRAGOUS AND ROOMS ARE DISGUSTING CIRCUS CIRCUS NEEDS TO BE CONDEMED!!!!!!!!!

They have great room prices, the rooms are comfortable and it's convenient to just go downstairs for all of the activities for my kids.  The circus performances are fun to watch and the restaurants and buffet are either new or newly renovated with good food for better prices than most hotel\/casinos.

Stayed here on a last minute vegas trip last weekend. I don't consider myself to be "snooty" by any means but words can't even begin to describe how disgusting this hotel is. Although rooms were $29 a night, it was NOT worth it for many reasons. Number one, I was sent to the "motel" section, which wasn't even part of the hotel. I legitimately feared for my life. The people who were staying here looked like they walked straight out of a prison gang. I witnessed a large fight right outside of one of the bars in the casino and I swear there was a woman shooting heroin on the stairwell when I was leaving. Secondly, they did not provide any soap or shampoo in the room and the sheets had a huge nasty stain on them. The room was just dirty and smelled like mold and body odor. The beds were hard as a rock and killed my back. Needless to say, I checked out after the first night, got my money back and went to the SLS across the street which was only $25 more a night and many steps above Circus Circus. Never again!!!

Didnt stay here but came here for the free shows. 
The waitresses for the free drinks near the slots are awesome and Good wins lol maybe it was my luck.
 Anywho! Bought the drink mugs for $14 &$16 & refills are $6 throughout the hotel!! We got free drinks and poured them in our cups lol so great.
 I wouldn't recommend staying here seeing that their are a TON of kids (unless you have kids its the BEST CHOICE! !!!!!!!!! ) & everyone has access to come to the room hallways which I would not be comfortable with. 
Overall nice hotel, not close to monorail or las vegas blvd.

Well where to start? I hadn't been to Vegas in about ten yrs, and I hadn't stayed at the circus in about fifteen... Big disappointment...they sent us to the manor eww!! Shoulda listened to you helpers. I had no idea that they were gonna send us there, it's like another walk from the main circus hotel and the rooms looked old and smelled old. Never again will I stay there. If I would have known...
The buffet food tastes like cardboard. Our server and the fresh pasta chef were very nice. Vince Neil bar service is slow and the bartender forgot to bring us our drinks. Not worth it.

This review is based on the entertainment in the Adventuredome, the games floor and the circus acts.  We didn't stay in this hotel.

This hotel is the best place in Vegas to spend fun time with kids.  Ours are 7 and 5 and they had the most fantastic day here, so much so we went back the next day for more.

We spent one day doing the fair rides which were perfect for our boys .  There were plenty of rides for them to go on and best of all there were no queues (W\/e April 8-11 2011) and because they had wristbands they were able to go on each of the rides over and over again. It was dream come true for them and I have never seen them smile so much - they had the BEST time.

Over the course of the two days we were there we also saw some of the free Circus acts which are superb and worth taking the time to watch.  The acrobats particularly were amazing.  Our 5 yo tells us that watching these shows were the best part of our holiday.

We had our cartoons drawn by the cartoonist on the Fairground floor and they are brilliant.  The kids loved this experience and the pictures were great and reasonably priced at $20 per head.

We also had our photographs taken Gangster style upstairs.  This was great fun.  We were all dressed up as 1930's gangsters and then had our photographs taken.  I wans't bowled over by the quality of the photographs.  They clearly can take excellent pictures as they have many great ones on display but I suspect it depends on the photographer and ours lacked in imagination and skill.  Still, we came away with two prints, one as part of our family package at $49 which we felt was very reasonable and one of our boys for an additional $39 which was extortionate but expected.  As with all of these things they make their money through the extra prints you can't resist buying once you've had the shoot done.  Fortunately we only liked one of them!

All in all, if you have children you must take them to Circus Circus, succumb to the child in you and just enjoy,  It's tacky but an awful lot of fun.

All this said, there's not a chance I'd stay here, even with children, it's clearly a dump and although super cheap  just too awful to stay in if you can help it.   It is crawling with children and is seriously unglamorous and tacky.

We loved this place totally! You might complain that this place looks old (it does look a little old as compared to the newer ones) but the hotel was good. We just felt like our childhood was here as we played some insane games here !!

There's a trapeze show (and some others too) every hour in the evening and it was a lot of fun. The room was decent .

Well, I don't know if it is because my family and I ALWAYS come to this Circus Circus Hotel every time we go to Las Vegas and don't really stay else where, but this place is awesome! I have always loved the look and not to mention the rides and games are ALWAYS fun! =) Circus Circus is my childhood to Las Vegas! Can't wait to go back!

Overall, It's a dive, but inexpensive and the kids had fun on the rides and playing games. We had a smoke free room but it still smelled like smoke. Rooms are low end looking. Plumbing was awful. I would probably pay a few extra bucks and stay some place else and if you have kids, swing by for a few hours to hit the rides and games.

This hotel is very affordable. We got a lot more than we thought we would for the price. The room was well stocked, clean, and came with complementary wifi. The air conditioning worked very well which is important in the Las Vegas weather. The service from the front desk was above average. Personally, I don't like having housekeeping in daily so I just put the "do not disturb" sign on my door and I was never interrupted by housekeeping. Whenever I needed anything I asked housekeeping and I would get it. The location could be a bit better. Overall, this hotel is a great deal.
I just stayed here and its a good place. If you have kids thay will have. The money goes more here the In other casinos. Cheap place to eat, sleep, & play.

Got comped a free room from MyVegas, room was pretty nice and cozy (more than I expected for a free comp) however after checking out I realized I had left my credit card and debit card in the safe (long night of drinking and gambling will make you forget some stuff). and when I called lost and found they informed me that my card had been recovered and is waiting for me. Went to go pick it up and it was only my debit card, my credit card was still missing. The security stated that was the only thing in the safe and that I must have lost it while I was out. Kinda unlikely since I only carry cash in Vegas to prevent any drunken shenanigans so after a quick call to Chase to cancel the card all was well. Room was nice, table games were good, drink services was horrible however it is C.C. so you can't expect the top of line, security was shady but definitely will return once my comps are back up just will leave the cards in the bag this time instead of the safe.
Room was clean, dated looking, big shower, pleasant employees. Went to Fremont St - took the "Deuce" bus there. Rough group of people but a cool place to go.

A fair deal at a decent price. The hall carpets were outdated and the room carpets were a color that made you wonder if they would ever need to be cleaned. We picked the location because we had a 2-year-old and a 4-year-old and the front desk assured us the adventure dome would have great things for the little ones. Sadly, one measured 41" and another 31".... So, we had lots of upset moments because they couldn't ride. I recommend waiting until the little ones are at LEAST 42" for a decent experience. Height limits were not brought up by the front desk during the call for booking, or when I checked in...even though I asked about the little guys. Somehow, housekeeping failed to clean our room after our first night. Also, the pools and hot tub closed at 6pm!!! Which meant we didn't get to play the first evening after a long drive. There are no refrigerators or microwaves in the rooms without an extra charge. We got a refrigerator (due to a milk allergy) but it froze everything on the lowest setting.....& it took 3 calls to get...The buffet was boring with many prepackaged ingredients.  this was a low budget version of Vegas to say the least. If we had paid $20 more a night at Excalibur I'm sure it would have been worth it.

Oh woe is me!  What happened to my beloved Circus Circus.  When I was little we always stopped by Circus Circus to play the midway games.  It was so cool back then.  Now, it is looks so run down.  It even smells funny, oh wait that's the buffet...YUCK!

Before heading back home, we had to make one last stop to play our games.  My game is the one on the bowling ball that you push along the rail and if it stays in the dip, you win.  I was crushed when I circled around the midway and could not find my game.  Wah!  My mister decided to try his luck at the Tic-Tac-Toe game.  At one location he got diagonal tic-tac-toe, but he wasn't a winner because you could only do vertical and horizontal.  When did they change that rule?  We found another tic-tac-toe game and you can win diagonally and for $2 you get 4 balls.  My mister finally became a winner and got me a a teddy bear with a Las Vegas hoodie.  He then tried his luck at the milkcan game, he knocked the cans down with one bean bag.  His prize, a small blue gorrilla.  What happened to the prizes at Circus Circus?  They used to be so cool.  Now they are all budget. They had a crane game with South Park dolls.  Of course my sister has to try it since she is the Crane Game master.  She zeroes in on Cartman and after the 2nd try she gets it.  She tries for Kenny, but couldn't get it.  My mister tries and after the 4th time, he wins her the Kenny doll.  We also tried the water shooting game, but the clowns' heads looked like they were about to fall apart.

I totally agree with some of the other reviewers, this place does feel depressing.  They don't have to go balls out like the other strip hotels to renovate, but they can at least freshen it up a bit.  Circus Circus is nostalgic Vegas to me I don't want them to change too much, but something needs to be done.  Their parking lot feels like a jail.  I do appreciate the blackjack tables are only $5 min., but it feels very swapmeet like to me.  

*SIGH* With all the buildings popping up on the strip, we'll see if and how Circus Circus will respond.

STAY AWAY, A MAN TOLD IS HALF SAVED.

So, you want to go to Las Vegas and bring you kid with you because you think Circus Circus is appropriate for your child entertainment, well I got news for you; DON'T!!!!. I had an horrible experience in this hotel, let me start by saying that I have asked for a non smoking room and I received a room that has nicotine stain all over the sealing and walls, I have a 3 years old daughter, and that was unacceptable, we literally couldn't breathe. Along with my daughter, my wife and my mother in law, we brought our little Maltese dog, whom is a service dog and he come with us every where we going. We booked this hotel for 2 nights and at 2:00 PM on our second day, a Security person knocked on our door while my 3 years hold was sleeping and rudely and loudly, demanded us to pack and leave the promises immediately. Because of the little dog, I told him that Rocky was a service dog and that I would talk to them after my daughter woke up, he reply again rudely and loudly, that there was nothing he could do and again demanding us to evacuate immediately. Anyhow, to make a long story short, this place was full of drunk people witch I guess in kind of normal for a casino business, also full of pat smoking individuals, etc...... I just can't believe that they kicked us out like we were some kind of criminals, because of a 5 pounds SERVICE dog, and they can't even wait for my little one to wake up, this is 100% outrageous. As I previously said Stay away from Circus Circus.

No pillows.  Had to call room service.  Pillows took 30 minutes to come.

No remote control for the TV.  Called room service.  Still waiting.

No refrigerator, no coffee machine, no microwave, no shampoo, no conditioner, no toothpaste, no shower cap.  This isn't really a hotel room, it's more like a campsite reservation.

Generally a run down, tawdry place with the low price point being the only redeeming feature.  Stay elsewhere.

It's is absolutely depressing to go to this casino.  The entire establishment has a tired, desperate vibe.  The music is just a little too cheery, a little too loud.  The smoke filled floors (is the air filtration system as ancient as the rest of the casino equipment here?) are littered with shrill children running frantically about while their distracted parents are mindlessly playing their own games.

I don't like children, and I don't think they mix well with gambling.  Certainly not here at this derelict circus.

This review is in regards to the room and the hotel HEAD NIGHT CLERK CARRIE and how SHE  DOES NOT take care of unsatisfied, uncomfortable and disgusted guests. It all started when I had a COCROACH crawling on my arm at the Circus Circus Buffet (LEFT A REVIEW ON THAT TOO) and how she handled my situation. She was not at all sympathetic to what happened and all she kept doing was looking me up and down  judging me, her demeanor was as if I was just trying to get something for free. She didn't even apologize for what happened. It would have been nice to be offered a free meal somewhere else or even a better room. So first the bridge to the hotel had a broken escalator and moving walkway. When we got in the building that the room is located it smelled of mildew and must as if the carpet hasn't been cleaned or dried properly. When we got to our non smoking room first thing I noticed was the smell of cigarettes in the room, I thought maybe it just needed to be aired out so I attempted to turn on the AC unit which did not work for the first 15 minutes, when it finally did turn on it smelled even more. I'm not really one to complain unless i cant stop thinking about it, I  figured maybe you just need to run. That seemed to do the trick luckily the AC started working fine. As far as the TV goes its a tube TV that has a high pitch ringing the entire time it's on. As far as the bathroom it reeks of cigarette smoke, especially the shower curtain. Its all that you can smell as you shower. I've been a traveling salesman for years and I've stayed in many low budget hotels but this by far is the lowest quality I have ever experienced from the room to even some of the staff. Don't ever stay here. 7\/23\/15

To make a very long story short ( as it's now 11:28pm ) i made reservations online with Expedia for a bestie to enjoy the weekend with her sister. Expedia charged my credit card $608 and some change. I even received a two confirmation email. I purchased this fun filled weekend for a girlfriend of mine so I made sure when I spoke to Expedia that she would have no problems checking in without me there. Well well well what do you know.... she gets to the front desk and there are no reservations to be had. But the worst part of all, MAGGIE at the front desk ( short, blond, and tattoos on her fingers ) was the most unprofessional unkind and down right rude person any hotel should have working for them. Instead of trying to fix the problem she became the problem! I cannot believe this hotel ( let alone any hotel ) would employ someone like this. She is to be the "face" that people see when they check into a hotel, a friendly face, a person were one wants to return.  Honestly, she isn't a benefit to the hotel, frankly she down right sucks! The management really needs to think twice about who they place at their front desk. So disappointing - I called and had a conversation with the manager at the time, whom was completely understanding and agreed. Helped out for the night, yet tomorrow I still have to deal with this hotel all over again.

Ps - the reply below from CC is automated and has nothing to do with what I posted! What a joke!!! Nice try CC  ---- UPDATE- they changed their reply.

This appears to be an older hotel that could use some renovations, but not poor quality. It's pretty big and has several attractions including rides and a water park for kids and the younger teens. Parking structure is pretty big.

It took a long while but we finally figured out what was still old-school about Vegas and it's the manner at Circus Circus a three level row of hotel rooms behind Circus Circus without ballet that has self parking and you don't need to use elevators this truly is the right place for my father 83 years old still smoking still Kickin ass and still playing slot machines like there's no tomorrow thank God you're still a piece of Vegas that reminds us of what Vegas used to be

A true vegas institution. Been coming here since 2001 when we lost our friend because he was TOO damn drunk. Lol

The arcade is always on point. The drinks are standard priced for being on the strip. The service is awesome. 

The servers don't take forever like they do in Bellagio. And their crapa machine Is better (sic) and cheaper and LUCKIER than bellagio also. 

Luckier as in I put in $20 and got back alittle over $220 in total. In bellagio every other roll was a freaking 7. And the minimum is $5 not $1 like circus circus.

We didn't stay at the hotel but we did visit because of "adventure dome" we valet parked which was $8 okay great no problem, it took a grand spankin 30minutes for us to get our car when we left even though the valet area was empty. This place is dirty they lack cleanliness everywhere! The tickets and rides are over priced, the employees aren't as enthusiastic about their jobs either. To ride the carousel its $6 my son would of needed an adult since he wasn't tall enough which would be another $6, as we were walking to get tickets for it we noticed a cute little 50cent carousel lol my son had a blast for 1.50!

Ok i read the reviews before I got here and I thought they were lying but they weren't and here are the reasons why to DO NOT go here: 
It smells like smoke and vomit.
There were stains
The  a\/c was loud
The carpet looks like that a dog pissed on it
The bathroom was so small 
The arcade was old and revolting!
NEVER GO TO THIS CRAP! I RATHER SLEEP ON THE STREET

My girlfriend and I have stayed at hotels all around the strip, this was the most underwhelming stay of them all. We booked a two night stay because it was (slightly) cheaper than the others and we've never stayed here. We were placed in the manor located directly by the RV parking. We opened the doors to a dirty room, it was 3am so we kicked off our shoes and went to bed anyways. We woke up to cockroaches running across the ground and decided that would be the last night at that hotel. I spoke to the manager Teresa, who then told me that she could only give me my resort fee ($23) back and she would not refund me my 2nd night despite how unhappy I was with our stay, I just wanted to take my business elsewhere at this point. We have now booked a room at the Flamingo and will let our room at Circus Circus stay paid for but vacant. I will never be returning, one star was generous.

I'm a Vegas regular and my plethora of high end hotels under my belt from the vdara mandarin oriental and the palazzo-Venetian may not allow me to properly judge a lower end hotel, but believe me the moment you walk into this sleezy cesspool of a hotel you will instantly recognize a condemned resort ( if you can call this stink that). The horribly laid out hotel is reminiscent of something out of a cheesy horror movie and the vile gag inducing stench from the buffet really epitomizes EVERYTHING wrong with this god awful excuse for a resort. There are cheaper safer more family friendly locations along the outside of the strip with more amenities friendlier staff and nicer room than this sad excuse of an mgm property. Stay away  not even a motel 6 could compare to this.
Very pungent Caroline smell and old bathrooms and it hasn't been renovated since 1996 but why so much chrolinw smell looks real good there

Ok so we stayed here as we traveled with kids. Circus circus on the outside as well as the lobby is old, out dated. The service makes up for it. And our rooms were fairly updated. We stayed in the casino tower. Plenty to do for the kids. And the buffet in the casino is fairly priced.

It's a nasty hotel i ever stayed ... i booked through hotels.com and in there they mentioned new rooms and i paid $299 per night, but after entering in the room i realized that its a nasty room ever. after paying $299 + Resort fee i got the Nasty room :( 

Beds stinks ..and bathroom sticks..and they are doing some ceiling work, i saw the patch on the ceiling in my room.

Don't stay here ...

I've visited this hotel since I was a young kid. It's only been the last few years that the service has gone down the drain. This trip has been the WORST!!!!! The worst part is as I am writing this review, I still  have a few more nights stuck in this dump. Tonight we had an incident with the hotel housekeeping staff. I spilled grape soda on the bed and it soaked the sheets. I called housekeeping to get the bed changed. They sent the staff right to the room however  the maids were very disrespectful and had major attitude. Once the maids saw the stain, the main maid with attitude (blonde curly haired woman) said we were on drugs...... I don't understand where you get a grape soda stain to be drugs.. but anyways. I get that it was late nigh,t but even though I offered to change the sheets  Emma (Housekeeping staff) told me to let the  maids change the sheets. The maids were bothered by the fact that they had to change the sheets and gave us even more attitude when they found out we needed a new mattress pad and blanket. They sent an additional woman with the proper bedding. They changed the bed and we still ended up tipping them $20 even though they didn't deserve a single penny for their nasty attitude. I thought that was the worst of it, only to fund out that the hotel management was an even bigger drag. So I called  to complain about the service and Emma transferred me to Judy  who is the housekeeping supervisor. She transferred me to the hotel supervisor (kerry) who once I said I wanted to speak to a manager put me on hold for a few minutes. Once I was able to speak to her she, told me she would transfer me to the hotel manager Johnny. After she came back from putting me on hold she basically told me that he didn't want to talk to me and that I should contact the Hotel manager Michael Gatling in the morning after 9am. So now I'm stuck feeling violated and disrespected and even more frustrated that the hotel staff, from housekeeping to upper management has treated me with the utmost disrespect.

I will update later with more detail of what transpires.

The room was big and clean it did not have an old hotel smell. It is an older hotel so there are some area that reflect that for sure. They do not have many eating options in the hotel but the places I did go to were good the best place to grab a quick bite was the deli. Housekeeping was really nice and really helped us out with extra towels and pillows they were quick. 
The biggest disappointment for me were the elevators they took forever. At one point I had to wait about 20 minutes just to get back to my room. I was tired from being out and now having to wait that long was ridiculous. I feel this is something that needs to resolved or figured out asap. We were on floor 16th and there was only a few elevators that can be used versus the other ones that would go to all the floors... That was weird

ZERO STARS. I'm so upset even writing this..STAY AWAY!!... we were booked into the manors I believe. They're the Compton looking buildings behind the actual hotel..I kid you not.. it looks like the projects over here. Old looking buildings..ghetto people hanging outside..smoking and doing drugs.. a lot of shady criminal activities going on over here and it's terrifying. I feel unsafe walking to my hotel room in the dark. That's not even the worst part. The bathtub had gunk all over it. The bedsheets had a brown stain on it.. the pillows had a brown stain on it and what appeared to be drops of blood.. disgusting ..I called guest services and they said they'd have someone clean it. We had to go to my brother in laws hotel elsewhere to take a simple shower.. when we came back around 10pm the bathtub STILL had gunk on it!.. they didn't attempt to even clean it. My sheets seemed changed until I flipped my pillow over and the stains were still there! YOU CANNOT HAVE HUMAN BODILY FLUIDS ON YOUR ROOMS! It's dangerous..hazardous to MY HEALTH!.. I called guest services seriously upset AF.. I spoke with Tony I believe who put me on a ridiculously long hold to come back and not even remember he put me on hold. Because the fact that you have someone else's bodily fluids on a new guests pillow is not urgent enough? I demanded to be switched out of this room..out of these Manors but they're all booked up they said..they switched us down the hall and that someone was going to help us move our stuff. 30 minutes later a security guard comes to drop off keys and that's it. Didn't help us or anything. The new room has a deep red stain on the headboard..I'm praying it's not another blood stain. Given the ghettoness of this place I wouldn't put it pass them. It's so disrespectful, disgusting..UNACCEPTABLE!! My husband called to speak with a manager.. she offered buffet tickets. Like that is going to help this terrible experience. I will not even dare to walk into your buffet. It the rooms and the surrounding areas are this freaking disgusting then I cannot imagine the buffet to be any different. Your hotel should be ashamed of yourselves and the terrible service you offer. Your hotel should be closed and your customer service is the worst. I was a loyal customer.. spent money at your casino and this is how you treat loyal guests?.. never again. To make matters even worse is we are still here. I have to sleep on this disgusting bed. I can't take a shower on your disgusting showers because everywhere else it's booked.

we had a good time with our nephew here who won a few stuffed animals for our baby. sure it's a zoo, or rather a circus, but i think it's just fine for what it is. just bring lots of hand sanitizer and avoid all the kiddie germs.

big extra props to the worker who saw our stroller and puzzled looks and led us thru the back way over to the midway.
Been coming here for many years, always great service, not too expensive and great for kids and adults alike.  Gambling is relaxed and fun, many new upgrades have been done.  Great atmosphere

This hotel has the rudest workers and the rooms are nasty! We wanted a kid friendly hotel so that's why we choice it. My bed had black dirty marks on the sheets and pubic hair on the sheets. I called down to have my sheets changed and the manager on duty was rude asking me if I wanted to check out? I used the shower and the water doesn't turn off, I called the front desk and they said they would be up here and it's been 2 hours with the water running in the bathroom! DO NOT STAY HERE we are checking out and trying Treasure Island.
Straight ass ghetto! A hookers paradise! Good place if you want to save money. Don't book cheap vacation here! You get what you pay for! Splurge for better tower.

Not worth the money I paid.  Motel 6 is cleaner and has better staff.  I was so excited to stay here with my children.  What a horrible mistake.  I had to practically beg the bell boy to assist with the luggage.  They were so irritated that I interrupted their conversation.  Finally get to the room.  45 minutes later the luggage showed up.  The beds sheets were stained!! The painting was half done and the "queen". Were no more than full size.  The room smelled like piss!  I have two in diapers and I could smell it.  The front desk does not care.  Fire alarm at 12:30am and not on employee seemed concerned or cared.  The next day we were checking out thank God!!  The bell boy was aggressive and told guest to get off his elevator.  One man got on anyway, he just glared at him the whole time.  He got off and the bell boy said "it's so hard not to say anything, then I just get pulled I to the office.  "Not sure what his problem was as the guest did nothing wrong.  Then we are loading the car the bell boy puts down our stuff half of it, including my husbands computer down in the middle of the driveway.  Another guest runs it over before I had a chance to grab it.  The two bell boys witnessed the whole thing almost laughing as I try and run the other driver down.  No one helps.  The bell boy just asked for his tip so he could leave!!!  Security gets there with the supervisor told is we were shot out of luck.  Asked us why we didn't run the driver down or why we put our luggage down there.  It was YOUR bell boy.  Unhelpful apologetic anything.  It was so bad!  I was traveling with 2 under 2!!  I will never stay here again and I will write bad reviews everywhere. Fear not the management and the hotel do not give a shit!!!  Plenty of other cheap hotels in Vegas that are not this bad!  And 150 a night is not a cheap hotel!!

I've stayed at this hotel plenty of times and this by far has been the worst. I stayed in the sky tower I called guest services four times and it took 4+ hours for them to get someone to me. The sheets were dirty with stains I had to take them off the shower had hair and dirt all in the tub the floors looked like they haven't been cleaned pretty disappointing. I CLEANED THE TUB OUT MYSELF... As far as check in it went smooth friendly people but just real disappointed with everything else
It's old school vegas dating back to the Mandalay Resort Group's formation. Now it is kind of old and dirty, but still fun to play the midway games.

I've stayed at Circus Circus for 2 out of my 3 visits to Vegas. 1st time I was on a family trip with little cousins, 2nd time we got the room for free. I'll be there again April 1st and I now have a 3 year old, so this is the hotel of choice. I've only stayed in the Casino Main Tower each time because it's attached to everything, is very clean and have never had any problems. This is NOT the hotel you stay at if you do not have children, or going with those who have children. It's not meant to be a luxurious hotel for that very reason. I call it the kid hotel. I can't wait to post again after our trip.

This review is for the amusement park as well as the hotel, just thought I'd start out with that to avoid confusion. 

First of all, the hotel:  Don't stay here.  Period.  The rooms are dingy and don't look they've been cleaned since the days of the rat pack.   And just to get checked in, you have to stand in an amusement park style line, complete with velvet ropes to direct traffic, for up to an hour.  Not really what I was looking forward to after a long flight and multiple delays.  And don't ask the staff for ANY extras (towels, blankets, etc.)....all you'll get is a dirty look.  

Now for the amusement park:  It's OK.....definitely not great, but considering that it's inside a hotel, I guess you shouldn't expect too much.  But the roller coaster is a nice diversion, and the midway games are fun.  It's a bit overpriced for no more than what you get with it, and they close entirely too early, but again.....it's in a hotel in Vegas.  Need I say more?

Crowded and dirty with rude staff.  Was accosted at the door to buy a time share.  Also was forced to pay extra to actually stay in the hotel.  Turns out when you book a room at the hotel it doesn't mean at the hotel it means across the street (unless you pay them extra to move you into the actual hotel.). The entire operation is shady.

This hotel is full of creepy drunks and non drunks and it's suppose to be kid friendly?  I think it's too dark in this hotel.

I just came back from Vegas a few hours ago. I stayed at circus circus as a last minute trip.  The rates are super cheap. 
My room was in one of those manors unfortunately. I don't know why it's not even part of the main hotel.  It's a pretty scary and dangerous place to stay especially walking at night or evening for that matter. 

It's away from everything.  The signs inside and outside of the hotel were unclear. Looking for the registration desk and stuff was annoying cause it was soo dArk! I mean geez.. 

When my friend and i walked to our room, the cleaning crews were still inside cleaning like really? We checked in and hour after check in time and the rooms aren't even ready? 

Pros: $10 slot machine credit upon checking in

Free boarding pass printing

Cheap rates( expect to get what you paid for)

24 hour deli inside main hotel

Free parking!

Cons: scary at night 

Not many places open late around this hotel

Staying at the manor

This place is great for kids.  Vegas and kids, yeh right.  They have arcade and carnival games galore.   There was a free acrobatic show with the jugglers on unicycle and plate twizzlers in a mini circus ring.  

The price is right, next to nothing,  Rooms are comfortable and suprizingly clean.  Easy check in and out.  Only problem is the large amount of kids, which is Good if your with kids and bad if your not.  All around good time had by all.

We didn't stay here but we went to visit for an afternoon. It is an absolute dump. The outside of the hotel is faded, we were told by a local that the place is grimy.. carpets are about 60 years old. The ventilation was terrible in the casino, the smoke really bothered me here. 

I booked a massage at the so-called Spa. The website looked great and it showed that they offered a variety of treatments. When I arrived at the Salon, I looked and and asked if she could tell me where the Spa was. Unfortunately, she said I was there. The Salon was old and dirty. She opened the door to show me the room where I'd be getting my massage and I almost walked out. It was a closet - no joke. The table was pushed up against the wall because the room wasn't big enough to fit in the centre. The towel she had on the table was stained and she gave me a wrap robe to put on that was stained and gross. To give you an idea of the size of the room, I am 5ft2 and when I reached my arms out I could touch either side of the room. There were brown and yellow splatters on the wall and the massage was less than average.

I am not a picky person and I most definitely don't require fancy facilities but this was a joke and was grossly overpriced for the service.

I will never stay here again. Our motor home broke down so we had to get a room while it was being repaired. We were told that because we have a service dog we could not have housekeeping come into our room. After going to the repair shop to check in we returned to find that none of our room keys worked. We had all 3 room keys reprogrammed twice then spent half hour on hold calling the service desk because we still couldn't get into our room. They sent a security guard who said they blocked the lock so we couldn't get in because someone complained that our service dog barked. She only barks if someone tries to enter our room. No one mentioned this while reprogramming the room keys or on the phone. I couldn't access my diabetic supplies and meds or my babies stuff. The hotel staff didn't care. We didn't enjoy the smell of marijuana permeating the halls either.
Not as clean or fun as it use to be...but, for the cost (29.00) per night-----it was well worth it.  I could have paid $300 and stayed at the Mirage---but chose this on a budget and was happy.

OH HOLY HELL! So many screaming children! Too many clowns and cheesy carnival games and circus acts. This place is bordering on the 'bad end' of the strip and even has an indoor amusement park under a pink dome with more clowns and cheap food. This place makes me want to hurl, especially after perhaps the worst buffet I've ever encountered. One cool thing though.....I got to meet Sammy Hagar hanging with his family in the coffee house. "I Can't Drive 55"? You couldn't drive fast enough to avoid this place.......A NIGHTMARE INDUCING HELL!

Being the HST fans we were, Circus Circus was our default hotel of choice for many many years.

Not anymore.

I can understand Vegas hotels and casinos reaching out to families. After all, mom and dad have money to lose. But this is ridiculous. Check in took 45 excruciating minutes, complete with screaming BRATS (note, I say brats, not kids- these were out-of-control BRATS), pushy Midwestern people who thought they owned the place, and drunken attitude-saturated teens who mistook MTV videos as a reflection of actual reality.

The room was generic- which is to be expected of Vegas. After all, they want you out spending your money, not holed-up in your room.

Getting to the casino floors took twenty minutes, navigating through triple-sized mobs of the same people we had to deal with at check-in.

Far too much emphasis is placed on "family entertainment" and not enough on expected entertainment for adults. We will never again stay here.

As much as my kids love this hotel im never coming back here. I had complimentary nights and was told on phone i had to pay resort fee for one day i agreed on. I come and got charged per night.  Also, we leave privacy sign on door as we always do. We go out for a few hours and come back to obviously a maid being in our room. Beds were made, trash cans emptied. My daughter had $20 birthday money on the bed. Idk if they were mixed in the sheets or not but its gone. We rip thr made bed apart and try lookiny in back of it and what not and nothing. I go downstairs to complain to send security upstairs to take pics and stuff. I didnt even get an apology or anything im very upset. A report dont give me daughter back her money. Again no one should of been in the room period. I came here 2 years in a row. Not happening again. Everytime i come i put a lot of money back into the hotel. Kids in theme park, games, food, arcade, and myself gambling a whole lot with slots and roulette. That wont be happening again. Im very upset at this whole situation. So glad we are leaving saturday. Cant come soon enough cause i dont want to put another dime into this hotel. Some people act like they dont like their job. Lady at krispy cremes this morning kept rolling her eyes and had an attirude not just to be but others also. People at vinces restaurant were nice though and when i first checked in.

I'm always surprised this place is still in business. We had some family in town and they stayed here at the KOA. I LOVE how easy this casino is to get to from the freeway. The parking garages are a little confusing.

Shame on me for not doing more of my own homework.

When I go to Vegas my standards for where I stay are typically pretty low.  Usually all that I need are a bed, a toilet, and a shower.  That is pretty much just about all that I got out of staying at Circus Circus.  The crowd isn't bad and I had a good time at the tables, hence the two stars, but beyond that, I was disenchanted.

The Circus Circus prides itself on being a "resort."  If you're into that kind of thing and you plan on staying in one place for a while, then it might work for you.  I was there for a conference, and for some time away from life.  The hotel is a $14 from the convention center and the monorail that takes you up to the strip.  I spent more on cabs than I did on anything.

The walls in the rooms must be paper thin.  I sat and listened to my neighbor's small children playing until about 2am.  Loudly.  It was delightful.

Stay away.  There's better in Vegas.

I don't have a choice I put one star but  0 star 
Lock like hotel but inside totally same as sh.., o my god motel more convertible.
Worst casino in Las Vegas and triable room
No security in area 100% lock like park really I can't say anything about this motel I can't believed very funny iron is broken and not working and hair dryer is not working and I find second hair dryer in my room that one is not working to you can believed I sawed Cockroach in room 3 times and...

-To start off, I understand I stayed during EDC week.
We stayed at the Manor side of the hotel.

My stay was Thursday night through Tuesday morning. The room floor was dirty, cereal inside the ac vent, hall lamp was broken and never fixed during the stay. 
We noticed the next day the window was broken and the armoire had a large split on the side of it. We took photos and went the the hotel lobby to report it. The manager asked us what happened and we explained we went straight to bed and i caught a flight immediately after check in. She said we should have reported it sooner. We expalined we were tired and slept right away and thats why we were there first thing in the morning. 
Saturday morning, i go to uuse the hair dryer; it starts grinding and smoking. I immediately went to the front desk and explained what happened and also added there is a lott of rattling. The desk clerk said its normal for it to make noise. I expalined again it started smoking, she said its normal to smell something like that. I told her there was visual amoke and i wanted it replaced. Sheade note, -Never replaced the whole stay.

I made a call to the room maintenenc to request a role of t.p.. They said they would be up in a few minutes - i ended up waiting 2 hours and having to call back to request 

Unfortunately this review can keep going but i think the idea is clear. This hotel can definitely improve if checks and balances are in place. Personally I would spend the amount elsewhere for an event weekend and be accommodated a bit better.

Love the free nights we received and its great for children they can play games, ride some rides, and there's circus acts, McDonald's, Rockin Rita's (the food is ok but the service is great very friendly), don't care for the Buffett it seems as if all their food is a bit bland the best thing would be The Garden Grill I absolutely love that place the all you can eat prime rib is great very tasty with green beans and garlic mash it's great and the all you can eat BBQ ribs is also good the strawberry shortcake desert is quite yummy and you must get a ice cream shake its old fashion and so delicious...take a visit to the popcorn factory it's odd flavors of popcorn but really good, and Krispy Kreme donuts I don't care to much for it but it makes a fast breakfast for those with kids, also try the Pizzaria it's really good pizza, great ceaser salad fresh and I liked that brand of dressing, and they also deliver to your room so that's a great deal if you feel like staying in a night and if you don't want to find parking go ahead and valet and if you don't want to wait in long check out lines use express check out fill out the paper put the keys in envelope and drop it I. The box on your way out. If you're on a budget or not its a great place to stay!

*** DO NOT STAY HERE!!!***
 My husband and I stayed here this past weekend and had a great time despite one of us coming down with the stomach flu. Lo and behold we wake up Monday morning to see they charged us a $300 smoking fee!! We don't even smoke!! I tried calling to get this resolved and they failed to keep their word on refunding me my money back. I would totally understand if we were smokers but we have never smoked a day in our lives. What could have been a future vacation spot is no go now. Never coming back here again & people beware of their stupid smoking fee even if you don't smoke!

Remember when you read other reviews that many are trying to recreate their childhood.  I have no doubt this was probably once a nice Casino, but please find another place for your family.  We visited this past December.  Luckily for us we were in the RV Park.  Because once we went into the Casino we were appalled at the condition of the casino.  There was a chemical smell permeating the place (we were told they have had insect problems, I do not know about this, but really makes me wonder what that smell was)  and the smell was overwhelming.  
The dinning spots were overpriced, and again we wouldn't have eaten there if you had paid for it.  Now let's talk about customer service.  Customer service?  Well first they have a skeleton staff and service is minimal.  Perhaps there employees were all home sick from the smell?
We frequent a lot of Casinos.  We live near Reno\/Tahoe and have plenty of Indian Casino's where we live.  So we feel like we are somewhat experienced about what makes a good Casino.  One of the high priority's for us is good security.  Well don't look for that here.  Besides the rowdy folks stumbling through the Casino at a high percentage, there is the matter of the security at the tables.  Hah!  Husband was playing 21 and was verbally accosted by a player who was not happy with his play.  The other players rolled their eyes at this individual.  Then the man became very aggressive and told my husband "Fight like a man and let' go outside".  Where was the pit boss?  Security? According to the other players this man had been going on like this for quite a while.  This would never happen in the better casinos!
We met a couple from Europe who were also in the RV Park. I asked them if they were taking their children in for the rides etc.  He said emphatically NO!  He said  he had gone in to check it out and did not feel like it was a safe place for his children.
Again there are so many cleaner safer places in Las Vegas to take your children, pleas do your research.

Hi my review for this place is very good: once we first came in the customer service was good and the man was very nice at the desk and he told us everything , we looked around and then found our room . The room was very very nice two beds , very clean nothing bad about it , the bathroom was clean and the water runs fine and the air is cold and runs well. The buffet is quite expensive but the food is very good ( stay away from the cook veggies), the west side deli is one of my favorite places , very fresh food at a reasonable price , we got the nachos , fries and chicken strips. The arcade was very fun for me and as for my mom the casino was fun. Although it is kinda far from the main places on the strip , you can buy a 24 hour bus pass for only 8 dollars and it's very good to get on get off and walk around. This is all coming from a 15 year old girl so keep that in mind ( I'm not very optimistic and this is my real opinion) overall this place is good ( I feel bad for the people that have gotten bad experiences here )

Las Vegas can be a really interesting place when you are traveling with your kids.  
I have been going to Las Vegas for... ahem... about thirty years now with my family and extended family.  Now that I have a kiddo of my own, she has come with us a couple times and has loved it.  

Circus Circus is not somewhere I would ever go on my own.  It is outdated and really dark inside.

However, for kids, they have the best midway on The Strip.  The games are easier to win, with some games giving every child under 12 a prize just for playing.  That makes it a lot easier when you have children who are unevenly matched in their game skills.  Of course, they will have to learn not everyone can win a prize at some point, but that is another topic.  

The midway does not open until 11 a.m., so plan for a late breakfast before heading to Circus Circus.  Waiting around for it to open is not fun, especially when you can see every game, but you just can't get to it.

Also, if you are a few tickets short of the prize your child wants, the staff is really accommodating.  You usually won't have to go play more games just to get those few tickets.  However, YMMV.  At the Excalibur midway, you cannot even be one ticket short (and the games cost twice as much to play).

Additionally, the midway does have live gymnasts and acrobats who perform several times daily.  That is free fun for the whole family.

The parking situation is not great at Circus Circus, as it can be a little confusing.  Also, there are signs everywhere warning you that your car may get broken into and that the hotel is not responsible for theft or damage.  That is a little bit worrisome, as we did not see signs like that in any other parking lot.  That said, we did not get broken into on either of the last two days we visited and parked there.

Overall, if you have kids, Circus Circus is a must stop.  If you don't, skip it.

Circus Circus was an ok place to crash for one night on our Vegas\/Grand Canyon trip.  It was honestly our choice because of price but wasn't obviously the best hotel around. It was seemingly clean enough and the beds were comfortable.  It did smell a little more than I thought it would (the smoke smell).  My only real complaint would be the elevators. They were ridiculously slow and it seemed that only 1 or 2 worked for all of the floors of the hotel and casino.  I have 3 stars because it is ok and the price is ok but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

They had the worst service ever and it is simply just a disgusting place to be. First we check-in and the room smells like someone took a dump on the bed. We get a different room but they don't give us the keys. It takes them 40 minutes to send the security officer to open the door. We called down to get our keys sent to us, an hour passes by and they still haven't sent them. So we call again and 30 min later they are still not there. So we call one last time and the keys finally came up the 4th time within 30 minutes. Call me spoiled or not, I will never stay in a hotel ever again that is less than 4 stars.... That hotel and that visit to vegas was my worst trip yet!

If your looking for customer service, look else where...some of the worst customer service I have ever experienced, you say hello and the 90% of the employees just ignore you, the rooms are like cut rate motel 6's.  My biggest issue was how rude the staff is
This is the only "family oriented" hotel on the Las Vegas strip. The friendly staff, and multiple family amenities are an outstanding way to bring your whole family to Vegas.

I'm only giving Circus Circus 2 stars for two reasons.

1. It's a historical casino\/hotel (kid friendly)
2. It's cheap

Now let me tell you why they don't deserve the other 3 stars.

Any room in the Manor section of the hotel sucks, majorly. My son and I stayed in Manor A 2nd floor. The walk to the room was properly instructed by the hotel registrar and had us walk through the entire casino, passed the adventuredome, out onto a non working escalator in a hallway adjacent to the building where Manor A was actually located. We later found out on our own that our room was just a few feet away without the detour, smh.

After 30 minutes of sweat and tears wasted by being misled we was tired. So as we're relaxing I noticed that there is NO air ventilation in the bathroom (if someone goes #2 run for your lives!) even if the door is closed, eventually you have to open it and the smell will still be in the bathroom. The sink dials are incorrect. Hot is the the right and cold is to the left when it should be reversed. I found that out after scolding my hand. 

My son wanted to take a nap and noticed the purple "blanket" nicely decorated on the bed is not even a blanket  it's just decoration. I thought he was lying until I tried to open mine thinking it was just folded into fours or something. Nope. It's not a blanket. Not to mention the light on my son's bed side table didn't even work. The outlet where my lamp was plugged into is missing the outlet face. Isn't that a hazard? 

The wallpaper is falling off the walls. The walls are too thin and I was woken up by our neighbors blasting the tv (on cartoons, I get it, this is a kid hotel but damn I shouldn't have to hear them) at 7am. Thanks for waking me up like this isn't Vegas and people aren't up all hours of the night. 

With all the money we pay for hotel\/resort fees one would think this hotel would have upgraded their rooms by now. Just because this is the "kids" hotel doesn't mean it has to be crap. No hotel shuttle or airport shuttle. No gym. No microwave but you can get a fridge for an extra $20 a night. But you won't be able to heat up your food because microwaves aren't an option. 

Overall they should be happy with the 2 stars I gave. They need to upgrade this place or shut it down. I definitely don't see it lasting forever under these conditions.

First I would like to say that all the staff were great. 
The main issue I have is that its time to UP GRADE the facade and surrounding buildings in the circus circus grounds. 
However , this is the place to go if you have children. 
It was very affordable and rooms were well kept (west tower)
Keep in mind that its affordability is what attracts a certain clientele.

Truly the worst experience ever!!!  I'm waiting in line to check in and A kid threw up in the middle of the floor. I notified the 5 Bell hop men who literally sat there looking at me and none  of them moved or made a call for someone to clean it up!!! Can you say hazardous waste! because tha is exactly what it is. I am pissed because I have small children! I don't want my children to get sick & I don't know what the kid has.  We booked the room on Kayak & paid in full at the time of booking and were notified at check in we owed an addition $30 per room per night for a resort fee!!! What! No one ever notified me that there was a resort fee, dirty crooks!  My husband gets on the phone with Kayak and they tell him they've handled it and there would be no resort fee.  We go back to the front desk and they tell us there is still a resort fee. Remember you get what you pay for.  I am giving them an additional star because the manager came & lowered the resort fee to $15 per room per night.  Once again you get what you pay for.  Did I mention my 3 year old & I ended up getting violently ill after our visit

If I could give this hotel no stars I would. A bunch of family members from across the country decided to meet up in Vegas. We each booked different rooms and checked in as separate guests and we each had a different problem. One person was checked into a room that people were still staying in. Another person requested a handicap accessible room and was placed in a regular room. A third person was checked into a room that was a complete mess. 

Once all of that was situated we called to request a mini fridge for the room as they do not come standard. We were on hold with the front desk for 45 minutes before we gave up.  

A few days into our trip the water in the hotel went out for roughly 30 minutes. 

This hotel is a glorified motel 6

My sister and I came here looking to see the casino of our childhood. Remember watching the Circus Circus commercials on TV? Your parents gamble and you play in the most EPIC indoor midway.There are circus performers everywhere in beautiful sparkling costumes. The smell of popcorn and cotton candy fills the air... Well, maybe it was all-that back then, but let me tell ya, this place is definitely past its prime. 

The casinos are dark and dingy. The arcades are just as sad as your local carnival. The midway rides are limited, expensive, and disappointing. You leave and notice you spent a whole bottle of hand sanitizer in a few hours. Not to mention, I'd be afraid to walk anywhere from this hotel. 

Don't waste your time. There are WAY better hotels available, even if you're watching your wallet.

Ehh...Circus Circus is OK. I've stayed in the newly-remodeled West Tower room and it was great. But the casino-don't waste your money. But I LOVE the Adventure Dome. The staff- not so nice. And if you book you're room online let's say in the West Tower? They'll just boot you to the Manor. At least-that's what happened to me. Overall, this isn't what it used to be like when I went there a year ago.

I remember back in the 80's, Circus Circus was the place to gamble and stay before the Mirage opened. Now, it's just a complete dump that had a few renovations over the years with the smell of piss as their hotel fragrance.

This hotel is on the same league as the Excalibur, Luxor, Riviera, and the Quad. Located on the north part of the strip in a bad area, I wouldn't walk outside towards the main part of the strip, (Caesar's Palace, Mirage, Treasure Island, Venetian, the Flamingo Hotel) but if you insist of walking outside at night to gaze in the Vegas lights. Stay with a big group and ladies, carry pepper spray if you're traveling alone. 

The one thing I like about Circus Circus is the price and the cheap eats compared to the strip. Although the casino is not as fancy as the newer hotels, I love playing the clown slots and some of the staff was ok in terms of customer service. The clientele reflects the condition and price of the hotel. Entertainment options like the infamous, Free Circus Acts, the huge arcade, and the Adventure Dome (Formally the Grand Slam Canyon) are what draws me back to Circus Circus.

My first visit to Vegas, I stayed here with the then BF.  Somehow, we managed to get upgraded and had a kick ass room for the same discount rate we had booked.  Thank goodness, that is the only thing that made this work for us.  High enough up not to hear or experience the madness below.

The buffet sucks, the people are cranky, the casino well we ended up at Treasure Island and few other places to gamble.  Too many freaking kids.

It's like a hotel on steriods in mega doses.  We had a car, really didn't need it more trouble then it's worth, now that I know better.  The noise level here is freaking incredible.  It's bad enough with all the kids running around unsupervised.  Well needless to say, unless I'm desperate I won't go back to the C.C.

This hotel is the worst I have ever stayed at. I thought it would be fun for the kids. The room is super small, the beds stated that they were Queens, but I couldn't even fit comfortably with my 10 year old and my baby. The air conditioner unit in the room was so loud when it turned on, it woke everyone up every time through the night, and forget trying to watch TV with it on. The pool? Absolutely disgusting!  We visited it and turned right around and walked out. This was a nightmare of a stay. I will never stay there again!!!!!!!

We stayed three nights at the Circus Circus KOA RV park, in one of the deluxe sites. It was a pretty good place. We had our own grassy knoll with an olive tree providing shade, and a table and chairs. It was a little pricey for an RV park, but it was good for us since Vegas was merely a stop on a bigger road trip and we had an infant and dog with us. 

*pros*
they allow dogs
they have a really nice dog park
nice pool, with shade
nice hot tub
clean
safe
easy to find
clean bathrooms\/showers

*cons*
pricey
takes 25 minutes of walking through casino to get to strip
Best hotel and resort MGM owned and maintained of course, best hotel in Vegas comped me three gorgeous nights in a west tower strip facing suite!

Wow, is there a negative 12 star? Seriously, the only accurate word to describe this place = Ghetto!
My GF booked a room here for her hockey tournament, thinking cheaper is better. This place is a rats nest! Cigarette holes in all the bedding, a putrid vomit tinge in the hallways, and the bathroom? Wow. All the towels were stained, and the shower curtain looks like a Petrie dish mold experiment! A new coat of napalm might help the walls and ceiling in there! If she hadn't paid up front we'd be out of this crap hole. Forgot to mention the drunk, sloth of a woman screaming at her man friend at 4 in the morning. Good times!
Stayed in the smoking rooms..they were dirty...headboard dirty, chair dirty. old TVs. Tub had hair in it..I would NEVER stay in the smoking rooms in Circus Circus again

Never having been to Las Vegas, I figured I was getting a decent deal online with I booked with Circus Circus as a package. However, I was wrong. Next time I think I'll spring for somewhere a little more classy. This place was just OK. I "upgraded" our room to a tower suite, which makes me wonder what the normal rooms looked like. When we got in our room was booked in as 2 queens when I specifically asked for 1 king bed, that was easily fixed though. We got to our room around 11 pm Las Vegas time, but 3 am our time so we just wanted to hit the hay. Lying down to sleep all we heard was the rattling of the broken window. The tiles acting like baseboards in the rooms were crooked and falling off. The halls had a weird chemical but fruity smell I wasn't a fan of and our bathroom on random days had ants. In the end check out was at 11 am and we flew out at 10:45pm so we had to pay an extra $35 to stay for an additonal 3 hrs. I guess in the end this place is good for families, it has it's own little mini theme park inside, a midway full of games and a pool. None of which I really had an interest in. The 2 stars is for the service, all the staff were extremely nice and in the end we still had a good vacation. If your ok with sub-par rooms with good service then this may be a the place for you.

The hotel room was fine. The tub took a while to drain. There was absolutely no view. You could hear everything the person in the next room was saying. If you want to be in the heart of the strip this isn't your hotel it's far from the rest of the strip. Almost as far as the stratesphere. This is a family oriented hotel. Lots and lots and lots of kids so if your coming with your significant other or with a group of girls or guys this isn't your place!!! The breakfast buffet was I think 15.00 per person and it was a great buffet! The whole upstairs was carnival games.

YES CHEAPEST ON STRIP, NO, NOT WORTH IT!
