CHECK IN: I don't know whether circus circus or Alegiant air lied, but I "paid in full" including tax, but had to pay an additional fee when I checked in, $7 a day resort fee! Either don't call int paid in full or include it! Liars!  (Treasure Island treated me like a king).

NOTE!  Every time we went to and prom our room, we had to walk through the entire casino and then though the gift shops to get to the elevators to our room!  I've been to Vegas over 16 times, always a different hotel, and never saw this CRAP.  It's not the walking, it's the walking through crowded passages, dodging vendors and solicitors, and smelling the old-stink.  It takes over 5 minutes to get from our room to the strip.  That was 20 minutes per day for seven days, a total of 140 minutes just getting OUT OF THE PLACE!  (Treasure Island elevators are just on the back side of the width of the casino, 20 paces).

FOOD: Service in the Garden Grill by wait staff was trash. Bartender had some professionalism, but hostess and waitresses simply not professional.  (Everywhere else was better)  

FACILITIES: Rooms were Motel 6 standard, pool was small but clean, casino floor had "old" smell.  Several gift shops with mostly same dollar-store quality crap.  No idea why the have duplicate items in all their shops!  (Treasure Island was clean, fresh, and nice gift shop).

VENDORS: Can't walk through the casino to the hotel elevators without being badgered by vendors.  Literally over 7 different vendors heckle you EVERY time you walk to or from the hotel elevators EVERY time!  And we stayed for a week!  So that was at least 4 x 7 = 28 times!  One of these clowns even said "There you are!  I was looking for you!" GO F YOURSELF!  I hate that BS! (Never experienced this at any other casino)

BUFFET: Get this!  They ARE NOT OPEN from morning opening to evening closing!  THEY ARE CLOSED between meals!  So UNLIKE every other buffet I have been to (ALL the major ones in Vegas), if you show up in between scheduled meals, you can't get it!  STUPID!  So we went elsewhere.  (See the seven buffet reviews I did of this trip alone for alternatives)

ROCK PUB: They have a rock pub there.  Fun, but beer pong events just icky!  Check this out, it is the number one way herpes is spread.  When we walked in, it looked like a frat party of folks well past college age.  THAT is simply sad.  (Go to the Flamingo Piano bar)

Seems to be a magnet for people who don't have boundaries.  

We saved a little per night for staying there.  Won't ever happen again.  We decided that the Travel Lodge next door would have been the same price, and we wouldn't have to deal with all this crap.

Stayed in the Sky Tower the rooms were a bit small but ok.  Buffet was average.  I really don't have anything bad to say.  The Hotel staff were friendly and I really didn't experience any problems with the exception of all the walking back and forth from the Adventure Dome and the Midway where all the circus acts and games were at. (its quite a distance).  Great place for kids.  Just a note though, kids under 16 must be in rooms by 10pm per state law, however this hotel has a few exceptions.

This has been one of the worst experince never will i be staying here again after staying here the past 8 years first this is no where kid friendly when the hallways smell nothing but weed really bad and then our door room dont lock and we get swapped out to a different room that smells like mold and the last thing is we had to go twice down to the lobby to reactivate our room key and one of the times it caused me big money because we made it late to our concert because of the inconvenience so never again will i stay here not acceptable for my family

Unfortunately we chose Circus Circus as it seemed near the Las Vegas Convention Center. it was a nice walk to get there and a relief to leave the crowded, rundown and unpleasant aura.  We ate at the buffet and was very disappointed by the blandness of the food!  Upon our arrival in our room we found garbage left on the table and unswept floor! in fact, here 5 days in to our stay there is a discarded knife still in the hallway where it has remained the entire time!!!  The life guards at the pools do little more than sit and practically fall asleep!  we tried using the spa\/hot tb, but with children jumping and running around in both sides, we finally left in disgust as the lifeguards did nothing to enforce rules such as no jumping, no one under 14 without an adult etc! 
This is one place we will never stay at again or recommend to any one !!!  We advise everyone to find another hotel where the staff treat you well and appreciate your business!!  Unfortunately ad are stuck here two more nights due to a prepaid vacation package!!!!!!!

one star is even too good for this hotel!!!

This hotel is such a great deal for its price. Parking spots were easy to find and the lots did not feel as cramped as those bigger, fancier hotels. My family went I guess during a busy season so check in took super long.  All their staff were super busy manning their registers so I guess nothing else could have been done. The rooms were very average in terms of looks and cleanliness. The place is very child friendly and far enough from the main Vegas strip to maintain some quiet. We stayed for a week and the room was kept very neat. Check out was super quick.

If you're the kind of person who would rather save a few hundred bucks for playing and sightseeing, this is the place to be. Would recommend to all my friends and is the only hotel I would consider staying at for future visits to Las Vegas.

So I decided to stay here because hotels.com had the rooms for a good price. Found out where my dad and I were going to be in what room we went. Stayed in the Manor Rooms and got inside and the bedding was nice along with the tv cabinet. Turned the tv on only had like 6 channels.  Looked up and notice a water stain on the ceiling and the wall paper was awful. Okay so wen to bed at 1:15am. At around 3am someone pulled the firealarm and it was sooooooooooooooo loud my father and I woke up pissed off and it took maintenance like 2 1\/2 hours to fix it. Sunday morning at 5:45 am again the firealarm was pulled yet again. So I was wondering is still a everyday thing. Oh an the people in the next room were talking so loud we couldn't sleep. I will NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN unless it's in the other part of Circus Circus and not the Manor Rooms

I stayed at circus circus this weekend would not stay here again. For $400 I would have expected a mini fridge or a comforter on the bed. We had a bad experience with people blasting music at 9 am in the morning. I would not stay here again bathrooms were falling apart also.

I have never stayed at Circus Circus, though I did take my kid here for the circus acts and to the Adventuredome.
- On the day we went, we got to see the Circus clown and the trapeze artists. They have shows periodically, starting at 11 am. Seating is limited, but there is place to stand on the sidelines.
- Adventuredome has a number of rides for kids. Don't miss the 4D Dora Diego show. Recommended for young kids.
- Play area for kids with rides. Come equipped with a bag of quarters for this one. 

All in all, a decent experience. If planned well, a trip to Circus Circus can be a fun one for kids.

I truly don't understand nor see why this hotel has gotten such bad reviews. 
I just came home from a three night stay at Circus Circus and I had a great experience there. The staff was attentive without crawling up my azz all the time and the room was clean. 
Ok, so people say this place is "ghetto"...well it sure isn't the Venetian or the Wynn but there is nothing wrong with being working class. Or is there? 
I didn't smell ass, vomit or other noxious fumes. There was smoke but its a casino. There were lots of horrid kids but its Circus Circus. 
All hotels are noisy, no matter where one goes. I never even heard my neighbors...it was the staff walking down the hall that I did notice. 
One thing though, the AC was omg loud. Earplugs fixed that. 
Thanks Circus Circus!

I've stayed here many times when I was little, but the place has definitely lost its novelty in my eyes now that I come to Vegas for different, 21+ reasons :P For families, this place is great - there is a whole floor dedicated to carnival-like games and children can have lots of fun (but will probably waste a lot of your money!) playing the games in order to win stuffed animals.

If you're 21+, this is definitely not a good place to stay in Vegas.
It's on the outskirts of The Strip, so it's not easy to get anywhere - the Wynn\/Encore is a couple blocks away but you are still far from everything else. 
The food in the hotel is very mediocre.
The gambling in the hotel also really sucks - the blackjack tables have a $5 minimum, which is lower than most places in Vegas, BUT they only deal 1 deck, so it's almost always in the dealer's favor. You can lose a lot of money that way. People also don't really seem to come here for anything other than slots, because even the poker room only had 1 full table when I came, compared to the Venetian or even Encore, which had hella. 

Good thing my friends and I weren't staying here during our trip!

I stayed here in the summer of 2011 with my husband and his family. We had three rooms in total. When we walked up to the Hotel from the parking lot there was an overwhelming smell of garbage. Inside the lobby we checked in, gotten our rooms keys and we went up. My father in-law however, chose to get us up on the wrong floor and we got a bit lost, not knowing where our rooms were. He decided to get some help and we were helped by a staffmember of the hotel. It was all friendly and professional. 
The Rooms:
Me and my husband went into our rooms and I thought it was going to be a bit of a run down room, but it was not! It was pleasant, good in size and neat. Instantly I felt more relieved, that was until we wanted to put some cash and jewelry in our safebox, which did not work. I alerted my father in law and he contacted front desk. They said that someone might come to our rooms tomorrow between 12:00 AM and 4 PM. Uhm, we're supposed to be in our rooms the whole day? We didn't do that and used the safebox from my father inlaw. But it was a bit frustrating that they could not send someone straight up. 
Even though the rooms we had were fairly modern and pretty, some parts of the hotel it self were a bit run down. When me and my husband walked towards the pool we peeked into some other rooms that were being cleaned and we were shocked (and happy) to see how the quality was in there. 
The Buffet: 
A no go... It was disgusting, and very unsatisfying... Everything I ate there tasted like plastic. That was not even the worst part, when I went to grab food I noticed chicken bones on the carpet, lying between tables, anyone could have spotted it. When I went back to my seat it was still there, and when we left it was still there. We had been sitting there for quite a while and it seemed to me it was ridiculous that none of the waiters had picked it up. So I got a napkin, picked it up and dumped it on a not yet cleaned table.
We did go into the Adventuredome, but we didn't go on any of the rides. It does seem like a fun time for kids, but I got no clue why anyone would take their kids to Vegas to be honest...

Okay... so despite the creepers that gock at you until you start feeling uncomfy (i think because they want your machine...) I really liked this place.  The machines are pretty loose... and the hotel is designed for families... which I didn't bring my kids this trip... but would definitely do that in the future. It's an older casino.. a little smoky ... but fun none the less!

All I have heard about my hotel before I even got there was run down, ghetto, and far off the strip. Upon arrival, I didn't think it was all that bad! The decor was a little tacky and it isn't half as glamorous as some of the big name hotels but it is great for the price if you're not planning to spend most of your time in your hotel room! 

Our room # is 24838, it was CLEAN and tidy, and that was really all we could hope for. The bonus was the view and the helpful staff. Wi-fi was great in the room. The gym was quite small with only approximately 7-10 machines, 4 treadmills, and no free weights over 20 lbs. Couldn't find the pool, not sure if they even have one.

The only downside to this hotel in my experience is the fact that it is indeed a little far from the main part of the strip =( The closest two hotels are Encore and Wynn and they were about a 10-12 minute walk. We ended up cabbing to most of our outings since it was also very cold to go around this time of the year. It was mostly 15-18C and even colder at night (bring lots of sweaters and warm pants)

There's also a tix 4 tonight booth downstairs to the west tower and it's a great spot to get discounted last minute tickets to shows! As for food, there is a Krispy Kreme donuts, Auntie Annie, and McDonald's right inside the hotel. There is also a buffet and steakhouse for those looking for finer fare. The steakhouse was pretty pricey from what I could see in the digital menu outside, approximately $50-$70 for steaks. The buffet at Circus Circus was very disappointing. Good variety of food but quality wasn't up to par. It was only $20 for the dinner buffet but not worth it for what you were getting. They had a pretty good salad bar, only 2 choices of soup (chicken noodle or minestrone), pogo sticks, fried chicken, pasta station, make your own taco\/fajita area, ham, turkey, and roast beef, clams, baked tilapia. These were just some of the things I remember from the buffet. May as well just go to McDonald's and get 20 nuggets for $6.

Overall, I kind of like the tacky circus theme and considering the price we were paying, I am very satisfied with my first Vegas experience at Circus Circus.

This hotel deserves no stars! We planned to stay here during the pigskin youth football tournament for five days. This being my first time in Vegas I didn't know better. However upon entering the lobby I just knew I was in for disappointment.  

After waiting about an hour to check in to my supposedly renovated room I got off the elevator and walked down the hallway past a sopping wet ceiling panel above a garbage can in the middle of the floor surrounded by caution tape. I was shocked to say the least but kept walking to my room anyway.

The room smelled like urinal cakes and the sheets and drapes were stained. I couldn't bare to spend a night there and left immediately. 

The worst thing about this whole experience is that I came to find out that this hotel is owned by MGM resorts international which owns about 12 hotels on the strip including Aria and the Bellagio for crying out loud! People bring their kids to stay here and this is how they are treated. Whether you're a billionaire or just the average joe you ought to be treated with respect and dignity wherever you spend your money and Circus Circus does neither. MGM should be ashamed of this and I feel terrible for all the people who came with their kids and had no other choice of accommodation.

Let's see on the minus side:
1. Only 5 minutes of (free) circus performers every 45 minutes. (Dangerously over crowded at each show)
2. Small overpriced rooms
3. Noisy pipes (?) at night
4. Big pink light (my room faced the pink adventure dome) coming in the window
5. North end of the strip, far from the cool part of LV. 
6. Expensive restaurants (even the cheap buffet was still $20 a person)
7. Far from the monorail
8. $4.00 for a bottle of water
9. No fridge, no microwave in room
10. My kid who was two inches too tall at age 8, for the kid rate, had to pay the adult rate of $29 for an all day pass on the kiddie rides. 
11. Wifi was non-functional
12. "Closet" cubby, (no door) was too low to hang my long coat without dragging it on the floor. 

On the plus:
1. Free parking 
2. Buffet food was good
3. Furniture was fairly new

Conclusion: there are just better places to stay in LV for the same money.

Unfortunately, this hotel really shows its age. The big positive is the kids area with the rides and other attractions. Another positive is the Circus Circus dog although I've heard it's more expensive now than it used to be. I wouldn't recommend staying here, but you should at least stop by if you have kids or if you want a good hot dog.

Sad to say but I was excited to stay at this hotel and once I got there had a very rude woman hold our luggage and then when we came back to check in dealt with a Roula who was worse than any front desk I've dealt with. I work in customer service and take it very seriously as well as understand that we all have bad days ... put on a smile and at least try to be understanding... rant over. Sadly
I won't be taking my kids here again.

The worst hotel on the strip. Got bit by some kind of bug, multiple bites on my shoulder which made the skin swollen and raised for several days. Crowded with kids running wild, no healthy eating options, long lines for elevator and check in\/check out. Do not stay here. Pay a bit more and go elsewhere!

This place is the worst! It's run down and just ghetto! It's supposedly kid friendly, but I would never bring my kids to this shit hole! This was our first trip to Vegas so we had no idea this place was so nasty otherwise we would have never stayed here. It's all the way at the end of the strip AND you have to walk 4 blocks off the strip down a dark, smelly alley to get to your room! Yes, the prices are cheap, but if we ever came back to Vegas, we would pay the extra $20 a night and stay somewhere half decent.

Make sure to find out where they are going to put you cuz if they put you across the street and you put your car in valet they are going to charge you $15 for 10 minutes and when I went to ask the manager above it she was so rude she was like if you want I can shoe you how to walk to your room first and last time here and the dang tv don't work

It was a decent price but the food was awful at every place we ate inside the hotel. If you are going with children, it is a nice place because of the amusement park. However, I was hoping for a break from children running around everywhere so it was not the best.

Let me start off by saying that this hotel needs to be shut down!  I went there to meet up with friends that were staying there, and first off, there were kids everywhere! Too many for that matter.  And it smelled like rotten sewer throughout.  Very run down.  I will never stay or even visit this hotel again.  It's just a horrible place.

For $28, I'm not sure my expectations were ever very high.  This is the kind of place where you can hear your neighbors having late-night sex (wait, that's probably just Vegas), the pillows smell like they haven't been thoroughly washed, and you see high-heeled girls getting into dark pimped-out cars at 6am.  But it's cheap, and the kids love the Midway - we spent an entire afternoon playing the games there, helped out by $5 off each person's ticket that came with our hotel room. The gambling itself is OK, and we didn't try any of the food.  It set us back about $15 each time we cabbed to either the main part of the strip or old town Vegas, so you have to factor that into your overall cost (it's a 3+ mile walk otherwise, in a not so great part of town).  Would I come back?  Well, it depends on what kind of vacation I wanted.  For a total experience, probably a nicer hotel would be my choice, but if I want to optimize for spending my money gambling or shopping, I have no pride about staying in a place like this - why not?  Just turn the pillow over - the other side is probably cleaner.

Circus Circus is okay for those who are looking to save money and for families with kids. Other than that, this probably is not the best place. 

Generally, the casino and the Midway reeks of trash and smoke, which can become unbearable especially when it becomes extremely crowded later in the day. 

The Adventuredome is crowded with kids running around and teens in herds, but it definitely seems like a good time for those interested in theme parks. The free and continuous circus acts are also great entertainment. 

Even though it is located on the strip, it is so far away from all the real excitement and you would have to drive to other parking lots if you want to experience the full strip because walking would take a while. If you're looking for the glitz of Las Vegas, stay at the Bellagio or other similar hotels because what you'll get at Circus Circus are touristy souvenir shops, unclean areas, and outdated rooms.  

Good food options and okay customer service overall. 

Tip: Bring hand sanitizer and\/or hand wipes 

Most likely will not be coming back here in the future. 
And the clown at the entrance sign is extremely creepy.

Circus Circus is a hotel you only want to stay at if you have kids. It is very very old and run down appearing. The free circus acts every 15 minutes are pretty entertaining as well as the games. It really is like going to a carnival. I definitely would not recommend this place for people without children. It's ok, but nothing compared to MGM or the Mirage, ect.

We booked a one night stay at the last minute on a Saturday and it was a good value. When we walked Into the lobby, it was a bit of a junk show with people everywhere and a long line to check in. Once we got to the room it was great. Clean and comfortable despite the horror stories from other reviewers. It's definitely a different scene, but it's Las Vegas. We had fun and were comfortable.

Circus Circus is an aging, dying casino... we all already know that.
However, this past weekend, I got to experience some next level Circus Circus... it's called the "Manors".

What a dump!!

It's a 20 minute walk from the front of the hotel through scorching hot parking lots.

The rooms smell like cigarette and weed, you have to unplug everything to free up a couple outlets for phone and laptop, the non-flat screen TV has 8 channels. There's no food anywhere nearby.

The "Manors" at Circus Circus are absolutely terrible and they charged us almost $160\/night when their normal pricing is $20-$30.

Circus Circus was already low on my list since all it is a playpen for unsupervised children and the fact that it's super FAR from everything that's worthwhile in Vegas. But having stayed at the Manor is a new low in my Vegas experiences.
Will never stay again, no matter how low the pricing is.

Also, the WIFI is garbage.

I stayed at Circus Circus in the year 2012 for EDC Vegas (I was 22 at the time). I booked my hotel on the insomniac website though a package that also included a shuttle. The hotel wasn't expensive at all. I paid about 30ish a night and for what we got it was reasonable. My sister and I weren't looking for anything extravagant since all we needed was a place to sleep when we weren't at the festival. I would definitely book this hotel again.


PROS
-wasn't expensive
-we got to the hotel before our check in time, but this was ok since the hotel had a service that held our bag for us until our check in time arrived
-souvenir shops within the hotel
-right by a walgreens 
-the hotel is surrounded by many food establishments
*getting onto the shuttle for EDC was extremely easy, I never waited more than 15min and getting to the Speedway never took too long since we didn't have to deal with the traffic from the strip (this was a huge plus)


CONS
-very far from the strip, but you can take a bus around here that will take you to it

Nasty, Smelly, Cheap and rude employees

I would not recommend this place at all its Nasty Discus sting, 

To start with parking smells like Drunk piss, Pool ugly and rooms Discuss ting we found moll in our room and then got transferred to a so called better suit that had glass melted into carpet, and the kids circus???? Circus is a joke and the McDonald in the place nasty Dirty staff with attitude. It was the WORST WORST experience ever

Saw a guy touching him self and staring at kids in pool area.  until i confronted him about it. keep your self and kids away from here

Pay the extra Money stay elsewhere

You get what you pay for. We stayed here thinking that the kids would have lots of fun here, however the environment was very ghetto. Too many kids running around with no supervision. The staff was friendly, however you can just tell that they are aware of how low budget this place is. It is far from the strip, and drinks and entrance to the pool is super expensive. So do yourself a favor and book a better hotel! Rooms are run down and the hotel itself is dirty. Looked like if we were staying in the projects.

There are 2 play areas:  One within the hotel itself and one in the pink dome.  The dome has rides that can range from a single ride $5-8.  Or you can get a day pass Jr under 48 inches $16 and Regular over 48 inches $26.  There are also carnival games that are about $1-$2.  Inside the hotel game area has arcade games, carnival games, and a circus show.  I love their set up for the circus show, they have bleachers set up for audience and no matter where you are you can see the show, even if you are downstairs gambling.

This place is a dump the parking structure tells it all. Went inside to be told no running water so the restaurants and bars were closed really this is Vegas. Can't believe this is owned by MGM Resorts Motel 6 is better

I was in the mood to play carnival games and lucky me Circus Circus is in town!

Circus Circus hotel is very outdated and run down...in serious need of a hotel-lift.  Nonetheless, it gets 3 stars because it has exactly what I was looking for.  

Free circus acts on the midway are nice to stop and watch.  Watched 5 guys in cheetah overalls doing the limbo and other acrobatics.  Pretty neat stuff.  I mean, when's the last time you saw a guy doing a hand stand off of 2 other guys' heads?  Yeah, serious stuff here. 

The carnival games are the same since childhood :)  Throw the dart at the star, knock over the milk bottles, throw the wiffle ball in the tilted basket...  A lot of the prizes were Despicable Me themed since the movie came out a while ago.  We didn't play the games with the wack toys, because cammannn, who want's a generic giraffe or elephant?  Games are $1-2 depending.

I wouldn't stay at this hotel.  However, I would stop by on rare occasion for some games and entertainment.

I stayed here a few years ago and we decided that we would stay in Circus Circus. We never stayed here before and it sounded lie a good hotel. We got to our room and the carpets and walls were dirty. There were no pillows on the beds and we called room service for 4 pillows, and she said "Yeah whatever..." rudely. the next day we checked out of the hotel. I do not recommend this place at all! Stay away!

You get what you pay for - heed my warning. Although the room rates are some of the most competitive on the strip and this place caters to kids. the quality has something less to be desired. Our room was one of the more recently 'remodeled' rooms in the west tower - it definitely saw its share of battles. Not sure when they last changed the bed cover as it was stained and had a hole in it. The carpet was in need of a shampoo, too. Even though we weren't in the room too much, it made a little difficult to sleep soundly.

I like circus circus hotel.  It's inexpensive and I think the rooms are nice and the beds are comfy. I got checked in quickly and offered an upgrade for 5 dollars to a skyrise tower room. 25th floor with a nice view. When I come to vegas I don't plan on spending much time in my room so I don't think paying a huge price for something I'm only going to sleep and shower in is worth it. They have an awesome players club. I built up about 50.00 dollars in comp cash good to buy food there. Points can buy prizes or free buffet foe 1000. 1,500 gets you two nights free stay.  I will stay here again.

This is an older hotel & casino. Some parts walking through were on the warm side. Ac didn't seem to work well. Loaded with kids. We saw the free acrobat show-only lasted 6 minutes. We were kinda disappointed but what do you expect for free. Large arcade around circus acts. Check the circus schedule -each show is different & at different times.

Negative -1*
I booked this hotel, looked at the pics, read the reviews and thought that for 34dollars a night...this place doesnt sound tooo bad..so i booked it. 
check in- went to my room...and found out that it has 3 different towers...the less u pay the lower the quality of room they give you...to upgrade its 10-20 dollars a night. (not worth it in that hotel)
back to our room now...as we walked over to our towner....it looked like really really old motel!!!! not a hotel! it was disgusting!!! smelled really old with stains on floor! the whole room smelled like strong windex! the windows didnt open to air it out! right next to the hotel they have a camp ground with RVs. very trashy. people are trashy there that stay in the lower class tower. i know this is a "2 star hotel" but the tower i paid for was no joke, no star motel!
uh! after 1min in the room i couldnt take it no longer....I wouldnt even stay in that place for free...and i am a pretty cheap...but it was pretty unlivable!
l called the site i bought this hotel from, explained that this place is beyond disgusting and luckly i was able to get reimbursed! i then booked a near hotel- stratasphere for 54$ a night...3* hotel...was amazing for the price! vacation ended well cause i was out of circus circus.

please dont even considered this "motel" unless your a stripper or somthing..haha.

worst hotel in vegas

suck ass!!!

Descent stay..Don't expect luxuries here! You get what u pay for! Save and spend else where in Vegas..Just got a $55 Ferrari T-shirt at Encore!

My friends finally showed up!..time to move to Wynn. And watch some shows and n'joy good food..had and saved enough at circus circus! ..geez needed ear plugs to wade off the loud noise from my neighbors..having load s@&..whole night! Where did u get those pills..geeeezzzz..lol
Was not very impressed with what I seen. Dingy and dark place. If you have kids it's a great place. Just no strip vibe here so very hard to get into las Vegas feel here. Will not visit here again.

This is my first time writing a review, and I did it because I had such a bad experience at this hotel.

I got my stay here through another website i think it was hotels.com (not sure though) it was a good deal. 6 nights\/7days king size bed with air conditioning and a fridge. Turned out it was at the manors not even connected to the hotel. I decided to upgrade when checking in. The lady was real nice about it and got us the upgrade real easy. Had to wait around about an hour or two because there card system was down.

From first glance, the hotel looks grimy, old, and wore out.  Same is said of the inside. It's stuffy everywhere and smells of smoke (which isn't to big of an issue for me)

 I went and got my key and went to pick up my luggage because I didn't want to carry it around with me, so I left it at the luggage hold area. No one was at the desk! and their were 4 other people waiting by the time I got there. 20 minutes passed before a lady showed up and started getting people their luggage. smallest quantity at a time. I had 5 so I had to wait until she got through all 4 other people. (she looked super annoyed with her job and looked like she didn't want to be here at all. no care about the customers\/clients\/guests)

Get up to my room on 6th floor. My room is small with a small bathroom and a door to the adjacent room?? (Security risk any?) air conditioning didn't work, fan had mold on it, of course I didn't realize that until I started to get sick a day later from having it run. No fridge in my room like the deal said. Oh did I say I was put in a smoking room on a nonsmoking floor? because it was the only one available for upgrade. Well after a terrible night's rest, and getting sick from the mold they moved me down the hall to a new room.

Looks Identical. only they gave me a fridge and a working air conditioner and no door to the adjacent room. Yet the room is placed in a similar location where my last room was, so whats up with that? the view from both rooms is terrible. You mostly look at a building in front of you and the roof of the main building area below you.

The Buffet Review: 1\/5

Over Priced, terrible selection of foods, and even worse in the taste department.  After waiting in line for about 10 minutes which isn't to bad for lunch time. I got seated and went to look at the foods.  Wide selection of choices they do have.

My first plate consisted of Mashed potatoes w\/ gravy, fried chicken wings, mac & cheese, x2 sausage links, and toast.  The wings, M&C, and potatoes were yucky. tasted like 3 day old KFC, because 2 day old KFC tastes better! The sausage links were cold in the center and under cooked, and the toast was just plain cold.

2nd plate was a salad with olives, cheddar cheese, and ranch. Because the rest of the salad makings either don't belong on a salad or belong to a separate salad group. the dressings were miss labeled ( I don't think rang is supposed to be orange?) or they weren't labeled at all. The lettuce was dry and warm which salads aren't supposed to be warm.  I also grabbed a plate of sliced cherry pie, my thought was how can you screw up pie?...Circus Circus did! it tasted like that fake pie you make when your to lazy to make your own or to cheap to buy the good stuff for an extra 2 bucks. Plus it was cold. If anything positive came out of the buffet it was the water. Because at least that they got right. Cold and wet!

I'm almost done.  Most of the people here are nice. The room keepers if your lucky enough to get English speakers are pretty nice. Unless they don't understand the word go away, or can't read the do not disturb sign. I was interrupted by several room cleaners on several occasions. They just barge right in without saying anything. I don't think they care to read the do not disturb sign clearly placed on the outside door handle. One of them came in while I was undressing ( which I wouldn't mind if she was attractive, which He wasn't) 

The casino area. It clearly states no minors under the age of 21 allowed in or to loiter in the gaming area. I must have seen several kids sitting on the gambling games next to their parents which is illegal.  I even saw a kid sitting at a black jack table, clearly under the age of 15. The waitress\/servers in the casino area are not attractive but instead look like 40 year old ladies in terrible shape who shouldn't be wearing said outfits. Plus their service is terrible, they walk around saying "drinks? Drinks" and they walk so fast you have to yell at them to get there attention. Then you don't see one for at least 20 minutes. cheaper to just sit at the bar. Plus I saw several of these servers just coughing on the drinks they were serving, made me sick knowing they coughed on people's drinks.

Overall a bad stay here. Recommend if your looking for a cheap stay. better staying at a motel or something. Plus some health concerns here!

This place was not the bomb.  It was in fact anti- "the bomb".  Lucky for me I wasn't there for the casino but for an awesome gathering with 50 of my closest friends.  We got a set of suites in the main tower which were in fact THE BOMB.  So hey if you're here and you need a place to hang or a home base then definitely go for it.  Otherwise...damn....the casino is like ghetto plus twelve.  There were kids literally EVERYWHERE and I *LOVE* kids.  I was just appalled that people would want or be encouraged to bring their kids to a place that was SO filled with smoke and ilk just so their parents can get their gamble on.  I heard that ALL THREE pools were closed..that's just trifling.  The games on the midway did not seem to be outrageously priced at all but I was just taken aback by the need for this sort of 'baby sitting' service.  But hey,  I'm the sort that will stay at the diviest place I can find just so I'll have the money to have fun elsewhere.  If you're like me then this is a fine place for you.

I looked forward to staying in Circus Circus For the First Time. It was quite a letdown. To begin with, there are different classes of rooms which they do not delineate emphatically enough (if at all on the site) so that you realize you're staying in a toilet rather than the nice main building.

When we got to the room, the lock was broken so we called the front desk to have someone bring me tools to fix it. Although this is supposed to be a non-smoking room, it definitely has been smoked in. There is no question. We complained about that also. They said they would make a note. Part of the reason for this review is self-defense. I don't trust this place. Therefore, I expect them to charge me for smoking in this room although I quit smoking years ago.

The only place i saw more worn, threadbare bedding was at my grandmother's house. At least you expect the bedding there to be decades old. 

There is hardly any way to get front desk assistance unless you wait on the phone for 10 to 15 minutes that's just what it is. Another little item, I went to check in, but my wife's name was on the reservation. That meant I had to go back out get her so she could get the room. Of course, l had all the personal information on her and the reservation. I've seen less nonrepudiation measures at nuclear plants.

I will not stay here again and let my friends know to avoid this place. Why 2 stars instead of 1? I've stayed in third world countries. This place sux slightly less than that. You get an extra surprise charge for a resort fee, even if you are staying in the subpar rooms. This means you get NO bargain or price break. You're better off staying in a room that locks. 45 minutes later and I am still on door guard.

I expect we will ditch this hole tomorrow. Seeing all the other negative reviews sans remediation, I'd bet nothing is done.
Celebrating my 20th. Anniversary. Love this place. I back to this Casino every time when I go to Vegas.

The concept of this hotel is very puzzling. The hotel name, "Circus Circus" would make you think this place is for children. Well, Las Vegas is no place for those under 21 (assuming your ID is real). 

If this hotel is $9 (including "resort fee"), book it. If rate is over $9, look else where. The rooms are terribly outdated, the carpet smells \/ from the 80's, and the beds are Motel6 look-a-like. 

Although guests should spend less time in the hotel and more sightseeing, I'd imagine you'd like to wake up bed bug free.

I've been here many times but the last time I came here ruined it for us forever. We came on a Saturday night, we had reservations for the top floor penthouse view. When we got there the lady at check in told us we got moved to another area that circus circus owns. It was horrible!  It not connected to the original circus circus, it's like we were isolated!! We dislike everything about it. We then called customer service to be moved and get our money back and they were not able to that. This is our last time at circus circus.

If you're planning on partying on The Strip, clubs, etc, don't stay at this hotel. The prices are fair for a reason. Its location is far from everything else, and our room was of bad quality! The window was unhinged so it let in a cold draft, and it was noisy all night! My girlfriend also got BUG BITES from her bed! Also, accommodations and guest services were little to none quality wise. Definitely investing in a better quality hotel for our next Vegas trip.

Please don't stay at this hotel.  Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money for a clean and safe place to stay in Vegas. 

My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night as we passed through the city on our way to Death Valley.  We reserved our room online several weeks in advance. However, when we checked in, we were told all online reservations were first come first serve and that they weren't able to give us the non-smoking room like we requested weeks earlier.  We were also charged a $25 fee for booking online.  I wish that was communicated to us before we made the reservation.

We were given a room in the Manor Lodge, which was news to us as we booked our room in one of the towers.  We had no clue there was even a Manor Lodge! On our way to the Manor Lodge, which is quite far from the main hotel and casino, we witnessed a drug deal in the parking lot, a family almost get hit by a speeding car, piles of dried puke, countless cigarette butts, and a needle.  The parking lot and garage area is quite a scary place and I don't recommend walking alone there at night.  I wish there was a security presence. 

Upon entering our room, we were hit with an extremely musty smell, like dirty wet laundry.  The edge of the carpets were wet and stained, the walls had stains on them that looked like bodily fluids, none of the outlets worked, the air conditioner was falling out of the window, the sheets had cigarette burns on them, and the shower was riddled with mold.  The room was so dirty that we didn't feel comfortable taking off our shoes.

On the door there is a large sign that urges guests to use the deadbolt, however, our deadbolt didn't work.  We heard awkward sounds from a nearby room that would be extremely inappropriate, and quite scary, for a family with children to hear. 

I've travelled quite a bit cross-county and have stayed at my fair share of bad hotels, but this one has been the dirtiest and scariest place I have stayed at so far.
Wow!!!!! Do not stay here at all!!! You will deal with straight up gangsters from the bloods to the crips!!!! I went out for a cigarette and was approached by gangs. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

The rooms at Circus Circus are, without a question, by a large margin, the most disgusting hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. I don't expect luxury, but I also don't expect the room to smell like spoiled food. I asked for a room change and the second room smelled better but when I checked the mattress for bed bugs, I found Skittles, Goldfish crackers, hairs of various types, and sticky stains.

I've stayed in my fair share of Travelodges and Comfort Inns and this dump is not even up to their standards.

I'm awarding a second star just for the old arcade games, and because the video poker and table games have better odds and lower minimums than most on the strip. The reason for that is it's the only way they can operate without bulldozing this charmless monstrosity.

Play once and expect an offer for a free room to show up in your mailbox. Don't take the bait. You'd be better off sleeping in your car in their parking lot.

****maids are stealing your belongings******, and nobody  won't take a responsibility about it !!!!!

It is s a cheap hotel, but you get what you pay for!

Keep that in mind and enjoy Las Vegas!
 ****maids are stealing your belongings******, and nobody  won't take a responsibility about it !!!!!
