 ****maids are stealing your belongings******, and nobody  won't take a responsibility about it !!!!! ****maids are stealing your belongings******, and nobody  won't take a responsibility about it !!!!!

My 5 star rating is weighted like this: 75% hotel, 25% casino. 

===== THE HOTEL
I have now stayed there twice, and YES, I stayed there again on purpose.  There is one very important thing to note:

********** YOU MUST STAY IN THE WEST TOWER! **********

The west tower was recently upgraded, and it is wonderful.  The rooms still smell like new carpet, which is so much better than the other plethora of smells you can get in a hotel.  The rooms are reminiscent of Signature at MGM, but slightly smaller.  For this very nice room with one king, we paid $43.05 per night.

********** I REPEAT, WE PAID $43.05\/NIGHT FOR 3 NIGHTS! **********

You can't stay that cheap almost anywhere, much less in Vegas, much less in a NICE room.  Granted, we did get a "Buy 2 get 1 Free" deal, though the 3rd night would have only been $29 more...not bad.

On our most recent stay, we were given the room that is built for challenged people, and thus it had a different bathroom.  Normally, this is considered an upgrade, but I would definitely disagree in this case.  The show had height adjustable head, though it wouldn't move.  There was also a platform for a person to sit on while they bathe, but it just took up space.  There was much less counter space than the normal room we had stayed in previously, and the mirror was much smaller as well (my girlfriend didn't care for that).

===== FOOD
Inside the hotel are about 5 different eateries.  Its to their advantage that you go in not expecting very much, as you come away very pleasantly surprised.  The Garden Grill had really great food...the caesar salad was delicious as were the filet minon sliders.  The service was good but maybe a bit slow.  Don't hesitate to go here!

The Casino Cafe had the best eggs benedict I've ever eaten, and that is the only breakfast item I ever order.  I have been craving it since I ate there!  The service here is worse than Garden Grill, but the waiters do mean well.  Our waiter was an older asian gentleman with a strong accent, and stronger sense of humor.  A few times I wasn't sure what he said and he said "sorry sorry, I know I talk funny".  He had a lot of endearing qualities  and we tipped him very well for his good-hearted nature.  

I suppose I should review Krispy Kreme too since I had a doughnut there.  Service is horrible, but its Krispy Kreme within 50 ft. of the roulette tables...nuf' said.  

===== THE CASINO
Honestly, I like the casino.  Maybe its because I generally do very well on their tables.  Without being able to put a finger on it, I like the casino for its table games (specifically, roulette).  It can get crowded sometimes, but otherwise the dealers are cool (Jorge and Rodriguez are a couple funny ones).  For roulette fans, they also have 6 video roulette machines that are hard to find elsewhere. 

===== THE PLAY AREA
If you like to act like a kid and can put up with real kids for awhile, the big top is fun.  Its deceivingly large... there are 2 full-size rollercoasters and a mountain inside.  Theres a ton of games that you don't see every day, and my girlfriend and I enjoy going in there for maybe 30 minutes at a time...then getting the hell out of there.  It smells just like The Log Jammer at Six Flags Magic Mountain inside the dome (in case anyone knows that musty, water and oil smell), and I get nostalgic when I smell it.



===== Location: Its not very close to anything, so -1 here.
===== The Goods:  The room was great, as was the food.  
===== Ambiance:  There are definitely more kids than other hotels, but in the casino you don't see them, so -1 out of 10 for that.
===== Overall:  I won't hesitate to stay there for the 3rd time, but ONLY if we can stay in one of the West Tower rooms.

Great LV hotel for families with children. There is plenty to do for a child of just about any age and there are plenty of other children there to interact with. The only problem I have is the smokey gambling areas--especially since this is a hotel that caters to families with children. The gambling areas can get pretty thick with smelly smoke and there is no way to get around the hotel without going through those areas. If you can deal with that and you want your kids to have a great time, this is the hotel to come to in LV.

When it comes to hotels I think I'm very easy to please. We booked Circus Circus on a last minute trip to Vegas. Because it was last minute and hadn't planned this vacation we were looking for something cheap and cheerful. Circus Circus definitely delivered. 
Our room was clean, and our bed was comfy. The hotel seemed to be primarily families with small children the one day we visited the pool it was very busy with children running around, just a heads up if your looking for more of an adult\/couples getaway.
Only complaint and nothing against the hotel it is a bit far down the strip and we spent a lot of money on taxis to and from the hotel.

Ok let me start by saying if you are comparing this hotel to any of the major casino hotels on the strip move on.  This place is not for you!  We spent a week in Vegas starting with a 3 day stay in a two bedroom suite with friends then moved to the Venetian in a suite which is no comparison. We moved to Circus Circus for only one night do to no availability where we were to save some money!  This place is the equivalency to a low budget $40 a night room for $200!  The halls carpet are dirty. The elevator smelled like piss!  Bed was so worn out we about disappeared when we laid down.  The furniture looked like hand me down. I was told it was the worn out furniture from another big name casino hotel!  It looked like it!  Smoke in the casino was terrible. We come from a no smoking state that we are very used to now and love. Not likely Vegas will change but newer casinos have better ventilation to remove the smoke.  The Cosmo had the best we stayed in. If you stay in low budget hotels then you will be ok with this place.  Otherwise pay up and enjoy your stay at another location.

This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed at! First off we were supposed to stay in the Manor motor lodge with a king size bed. Upon check in they put us in a double queen( and we'tea couple, I hate that). Check in line absolutely too long whenever we called downstairs the the front desk NO ONE ANSWERS! And we were stuck here 5days. Entering the room the carpet was wet like it had just been shampooed literally.We could never get a hold of housekeeping and the tub was dirty. If ur planning an adult trip u definitely don't want to be here too many kids running all over the place. We ate from the Westside deli and I had hair in my corned beef. I really never experienced such poor customer service! My girlfriend say she was bit by a bedbug , didn't physically see any but the sheets did feel itchy. The hotel smells horrible like cigarette smokes embedded in the carpet and walls! The main lobby is at the back of the hotel and Getting to the strip is such a hassle whoever designed this hotel was a horrible architect.The only nice thing I can say is they held our luggage for us on the last day because we had an overnight flight( but what hotel doesnt do that). I'll give one star just because I feel bad for them. I never had to NOT give a star. Never again!

It's not nearly as bad as what other reviewers would suggest.  It's clean and comfortable.  For $25\/night, it was exactly what I paid for and I knew I'd be staying outside the main building when I booked the room.  The only thing is that the walls are thin and I can hear everyone around me.  But, I put in my earplugs and it was fine.

What a dump!
The hotel is overall dirty. The pillowcase looked like someone had walked on it with shoes. We had to get extra sheets also, because the one that was on the bed only covered parts of the matress. 
There was a long line in front of the front desk most of the time and even a long line for the evelator because many of them did not work. 
We had a "do not disturb" on the door, but the maid was still banging on the door at 11am.
The interior is tacky and the unpractical layout forces you to wander around taking mulitple elevators. 
Dont stay here if you want to enjoy your stay in Vegas.

My main grip with Circus Circus involves how it fails to fully inform a customer of the cost of lodging at the point of booking.  Thus, the booking screen presents what turns out to be a base rate, plus local tax that is specified in terms of a percentage.  Separate from these pricing elements, and in small print, is an indicate one's credit card will be charged an unspecified "resort fee" which is not listed in the amounts specified as part of the cost of lodging.  Hence, I conclude that Circus Circus essentially induces the lodger to think the cost of lodging will be only the base rate, plus the local taxes.  Only at check in is the lodger confronted with the additional "resort fee".

I am told that the resort fee is standard on the strip.  Perhaps so.  But if other hotels also essentially hide the amount of this fee at the time of booking as I believe Circus Circus intends to do, multiple wrongs in the form of deceptive booking mechanisms do not justify Circus Circus in use of the same method.  When I purchase a service or product, I wish to know the full cost involved.  I feel deceived by Circus Circus and will think twice before returning.

PLEASE DO NOT STAY HERE "... I and my wife planned a vacation for our kids and this place was horrible the manager's can't even manage the place and they have lot's of water spots inside the rooms plus on top of that we had to take cold showers and did not care to accommodate us at all we had a 4 day 3 night stay there and for 3 days we went without hot water due to them having boiler issue which isn't my problem so i advise any family out there if your traveling to Vegas and want to take your kids make sure you dont book your room there i didn't even get half of what i paid for.

I am SO happy I did not really care to pay attention to many of the negative reviews on Circus Circus! Complain about walking? Really? This is Vegas! You walk, you eat, you gamble, you have fun, and you visit other hotels just wishing you could afford one of those rooms for a couple days!!!!! DUH! I'll just tell you my experience. I went with my 6 year old and my husband from Sunday to Wednesday. This hotel with flight included cost under $400 each. Not only was it affordable (one reason to not compare it to other hotels on the strip DUH #1) but it also gave us spending money to go visit the Adventuredome which was SOOOOO MUCH fun! That costed $25 each and we went and came back later after taking a stroll down the strip. There are a lot of families which equates to LOTS of kids, cousins, grandmas, and uncles around because it is family friendly (another reason to not compare it to other hotels on the strip DUH #2). We also went to eat at THE STEAK HOUSE and OMG, I had the best filet mignon I had ever eaten and I have been to a lot of fancy steak houses. It did cost $52 but it included a delish salad which included beets and orange tomatoes. Along with two sides. We also ate at some of the more affordable places such as the Blue Iguana and the Pizzaria. I just would NOT go to Vince Neil's spot. The margaritas were horrible along with the service and the chicken fingers my husband threw up after 30 minutes of eating them. Either way, I appreciate the affordability and quality of food for the other spots. My husband also gambled at the $3 Blackjack table! He had so much fun because once again...this place is affordable. (DUH #3). I did not give it five stars because the pool is lacking some updating but it was still a decent pool, however remodeling it in the near future may help with the visual aspect of Circus Circus. In the end, ALWAYS wash your hands whether at Circus Circus or the Bellagio and I would definitely come back...only with kids.

I haven't stayed in the hotel itself in a while now so I can't really vouch for how good or bad the rooms are, but I honestly don't remember it being that awful.

As a kid though, Circus Circus was awesome. My parents used to bring me and my brother here all the time to play games and watch circus acts at Midway. There aren't really that many family friendly things to do in Vegas, so it's nice that Circus Circus caters to that.

I decided to stay at Circus Circus this weekend (October 20, 2017) because I was coming for less than 48 hours and figured it couldn't be too bad.  When I arrived, they offered me an upgrade for $15.  I accepted, and they handed me a receipt for an extra $50.  $15 for the upgrade and $35 for extra resort fees and taxes.

I was assured the room was non-smoking, and that all rooms were non-smoking.  The room was hot and smelled of smoke.

There were no convenient outlets, and the ones that were there could not hold plugs.  they simply fell out.

The ode to joy for me however was the lack of hot water in the morning.  If you are foolish enough to stay here and you want to wash off the ambient cigarette odor comfortably, then my advice would be to wake and shower before 8 am.  The hotel is definitely out of hot water by then.

This hotel is definitely run down but it's also the cheapest hotel on the strip & was one of the first ones to be built. There's fun games for the kids on the lower floor. The service was fine. However, I would recommend staying somewhere towards the middle of the strip because this is far from everything else.

3 stars for the childhood memory of stopping here for a night en route home from a four-day road trip with my dad and brother when my innocent virgin eyes saw Vegas for the first time. All the flashy lights, cigarette smoke, alcohol, raucous, and funky smells of the casino can be intimidating for a kid and I remember wishing we'd stayed at Days Inn, where it was quiet, more manageable, and more holy. This was the city my mother warned me about, where alcoholics and hookers ran rampant in the streets and fathers gambled away their mortgages, and I wasn't about to have any part of it. I had stuffed animals back home that needed me. But then I finally loosened up and mustered up the courage to venture out of the hotel room and gamble away my college trust fund while I sipped on a vodka cranberry.

Ok maybe not. 

But I did sip on some apple juice and played skee ball until my ten bucks ran dry. I scored a yellow M&M doll and a blue monkey that night and it was the proudest moment of my life. =) Then I got REALLY brave and snuck into the slot machine area with my bro (who was 18 at the time, before they increased the minimum gambling age to 21) and witnessed him hit the jackpot and return home with a large souvenir cup full of quarters (this is when Vegas slots discharged actual coins instead of vouchers). Wow, what a rush! I thought we were high rollers!! Even though I'd probably never consider booking a room here as an adult, Circus Circus was the perfect child's introduction to the City of Sin and for that I would recommend it to any visitors bringing the little ones along.

What? This place really didn't get five stars from everybody? Have you all gone nuts?

I chose Circus Circus Hotel because I didn't have alot of money and had to be there for a conference for a week. I didn't really care about the children being everywhere because I didn't intend on staying at the hotel except for sleeping. I wasnt really expecting much because the reviews for this place were crap.

When I got there I was like a child again. I felt like I was in heaven. There were so many things to do and a wonderful kids casino that I ran around in for hours. I won more in the Kids casino than I would have won in the regular casinos. :D

Okay, so I stayed in one of the Manor Rooms. Creepy at first site. Kinda dirty and lost looking. But my room was clean, the bathroom was nice, and the room service was reliable. If you want perfection then cough up the money for it but I personally had no complaints for the hotel room or the service especially since I payed nickles and dimes for it. Surprisingly, I didn't really hear any kids while in my room. Sure, they littered the halls of the casino but it didn't bother me.

I really enjoyed Circus Circus, I didn't expect alot but I enjoyed what I got and made the best out of everything.

Oh, How could I forget?
They have Circus shows every few hours. Among all the children and their parents, I, a 21 year old, clapped and screamed like a 7 year old. The performers were too exciting and you cant help feeling like a kid when you are there.

Really, go there. Its cheap, its fun, its Circus Circus.

Kids: This is probably the best spot for fun, kid-related activities (circus, Adventure Dome, fair-grounds, kid shows, arcades, etc.). Of course, it's just a brilliant way to get your kid hooked on gambling and spending money at a young age, but hey! TURN UP kiddie style!

Grown ups who are kids on the inside: Reference above comment.

People on a budget: I mean, if you can't afford this, the Travel Lodge, or off strip, is your only other bet...or maybe you should save up a little more before visiting? The Stratosphere and Downtown hotels are within the same range options.

Location:  Welcome to the North strip! Just know, after the Wynn, it gets a tad shady. Just stay within the hotel's vicinities. This hotel isn't really near anything important. The Riviera use to be across the street but was closed.

Casino: Cheaper prices compared to many casinos on the strip.

Rooms: You kinda get what you paid for, but it's a great place for quick trips. I think they're clean and livable.  If you like luxury, though, this place isn't for you!

Food: McDonalds (which seems to be then landlord of Vegas) and Subway are the cheapest options.

Additional: Pretty good gift shops, but not as cheap\/good as downtown!

This place is gross. The pizzeria is gross, the barista and bagel place are also gross. It smells gross, it looks gross, everything seems to be coated in some sticky sweet bullshit left behind by families of long ago. I'm sure it hasn't had a carpet cleaning in decades. I didn't try any of the other eating spots because the coffee and cinnamon roll I had at Barista were literally the most disgusting things ever. I almost asked for my money back but I didn't even want to talk to them. And NO SOY or almond
Milk!!!! It's really not too much to ask. Get that shit. Figure out your gross hotel.

First time at the circus in Vegas  July 10th\/11th and i was very disappointed.  I booked a room at the west tower, and being a fight night i paid $144.28 for one night.  The price was a bit high but i saved a few bucks compared to other hotels at the strip. I checked in and the lady who helped me out said to just get in any elevator and it will take me to the 22nd floor where my room was.  I got in one elevator and realized it had no 22nd floor, and i had to go all the way down and catch another elevator that would take me up there.  I didn't give it too much thought and figured the lady could have forgot. My lady and i dropped off our bags and headed down to the casino and returned about 1am. One of the lamps on the side of the bed wasn't working and i had to move the furniture as it wasn't plugged in.  Then when my lady and were ready to sleep and got in the bed we found a couple hairs and stains in both the sheets and the blanket.  I called housekeeping and requested my sheets to be changed and i was promised they would take care of it quick. 20 minutes later i called to check up on the sheets and another lady told me she didn't know anything about it and she would send someone right away.  Another 20 minutes later i called again and the lady said she already sent someone but there was only one lady doing housekeeping so it would be a while.  The housekeeper arrived at my room and rudely began throwing the sheets and kicking them out of the room and I'm guessing she assumed i didn't speak  Spanish and began mumbling about my lady and i being too cocky and that it was a hassle to come up and change the sheets.  She was almost done but forgot the blanket and had to go back down to get one meanwhile my lady and i were waiting to be able to rest. She returned and swapped blankets and walked away.  It took close to an hour to get my sheets changed, not the service I was expecting from circus. Next morning i wanted to make myself a cup of coffee and my coffee maker was not plugged in either.  I expected better service from this hotel.  I've been yo the circus in Reno and it is nothing like the one in Vegas.  I will not return and will warn friends and relatives about this place.  At the price i paid I could have gotten excellent service from Paris or Ceasars which i staid at the previous nights.  Will not return,  I'm leaving vegas with a bad image about this place as the one in Reno has never dissapointed. Look around before booking a room here and save yourselves the trouble.

MUST READ FOR YOUR OWN PROTECTION"
I Feel Horrible to have to even want to put a review on here. I have been to Vegas plenty of times and before my last trip i have always loved going to Circus Circus and enjoying the atmosphere that makes me feel like a kid again.. But while visiting this hotel I came upon such a poor security protection experience, especially right after the horrific Las Vegas Tragedy that happened just recently completely discussed me. Upon my recent visit here I was not only stalked by a man but I was also poked by a needle from this man.  After I was stuck with this needle and I went to Circus Circus security to report this the man was still right there.  I stated to security look at the cameras, and was told "We Only Check Cameras For Emergencies".  HMMMM   What is CIRCUS CIRCUS's definition of an "EMERGENCY"  Security asked me if I would like to press charges.  OF COURSE I DO!!!!!    During this time my boyfriend showed up and called the REAL POLICE!!!!!!!!!!!!   Come to find out the security walked the gentlemen out and let him go to do this to HIS next poor victim... Stating I said "I DID NOT WANT TO PRESS CHARGES."  ARE YOU KIDDING!!!!  WHY WOULD I EVEN ATTEMPT TO TELL YOU IF I DON'T WANT TO PRESS CHARGES.  DO I GET POKED WITH A NEEDLE BY A STRANGER EVERYDAY?"  "COMMON SENSE"  OMG.  Police authorized me to seek medical attention.  I went to the hospital but now I have to wait for all the results why I worry about what was this man's sole intention.   Circus Circus should do the right thing.....  Look at the cameras and attempt to save the next poor sole.

Sincerely

Highly Disappointed.  :(

Great place for the price.

Pretty far from everything else on the Strip but very close to the strip clubs haha

Service was decent.

Chose this place for the nostalgia. The place is really outdated and has a funky smell throughout the entire hotel\/casino. The room was clean but the bathrooms are nothing to brag about.  Tub floods when shower is on not to mention the tiny shower\/tub.  The place has a lot of stuff for kids and not to mention the free circus acts but really needs to update the place and make it modern.

Decades ago, i  booked  low priced rooms here over the phone. should i have been surprised  when the room wasn't available when i arrived?  Circus cited some technicality that wasn't followed. (ya right.)

They offered some replacement rooms at some place on the edge of town. didn't take the offer. doubt i spent any monie$ at circus.

wandered all over reno. it was slightly snowing, and  there was black ice on the streets. (taxicab was sliding, i thought the driver was drunk. he blamed black ice).  saw a show, saw the mgm building, got married at a chapel and returned on the return bus to oaktown.

nothing unusual happened on that birthday. 

oh this circus is lv? my bad! meant to post for reno circus circus. (talk about murphy's law, this post illustrates it.)

The hotel is a tad outdated. But still seems to have a high cleanliness standard. Check in seemed to be daunting when I walked in, the line was full with 20+ people. But the front desk was very efficient! I was dreading the wait but with 20+ people I only waited less than 5 minutes!! Lupita checked me in and was very clear and informative, and handled the check in lightning fast. Overall good experience. Really good value. A little disappointed that the fitness center wasn't open but hey. It's Vegas.

I'm pissed at HOTELS.COM for rating this shit-hole 3.4\/5.  I don't believe these are honest reviews...perhaps if someone from HOTELS.COM would stay there, they would understand.

I arrived on Tuesday night for a 3 night stay.  It was late (approx. 11pm) and there was a long line to check in...and only 3 people working the desk.  It went VERY slow...at least 20 minutes until I reached an agent.  The agent happened to be the hotel manager (Johnny) who was very nice and apologetic about the wait.  I requested the highest floor possible and he told me there was only 3 floors.  He said HOTELS.COM booked me in the "Manor" building but he would move me to the highrise the following night.  I paid approx. $270 per night (FYI).  It was late, I was tired and I just wanted to get to the room so I said fine.  He told me it was about a 4 minute walk...huh???  He gave me a map so I was off lugging my three bags out of the building...across the street...until I thought I found it.  After opening the door to what seemed like a dilapidated, I thought...no...this can't be it (and it wasn't).  It was the "A" building and I was in the "E" building.  So I walked around (now it was around 11:30pm) dragging my suitcases until I saw a guy on a bike wearing a security uniform.  He pointed me to the "E" building...all the way at the end.  After several more minutes of walking, I entered the shit-hole.  I can't even begin to describe it.  I thought it was a joke.  Appears to be where prostitutes can take "Johns" by the hour.  It was disgusting...gross.  It smelled...it was dark...the walls were damaged...the doors looked like they were repaired and painted over a hundred times.  I entered my room and was even more grossed out.  It was dirty...the sheets were stained...the wallpaper was pealing...the carpet looked like it was from the 70's...I could hear EVERYTHING...a guy snoring down the hall...kids watching cartoons on one side of me and a few other TV's down the hall.  I didn't unpack...slept in my clothes...and couldn't wait to get out of there the next morning. For this dump I paid $270 a night???  It wasn't worth $20\/night!!!

The next morning, I again had to wait 20+ minutes in the check-in line.  Johnny wasn't there so I told the agent I was supposed to have a room in the high rise.  She typed in my name...said, "Oh yes...however the room isn't ready quite yet".  She said to leave my bags at the bell desk and no matter what time I returned (it was a convention), my room would be waiting.  So that's what I did.

I returned at around 7pm...once again had to wait 20+ minutes in the check-in line.  I told the agent I needed the keys to my new room...she typed in a bunch of stuff into the computer and said, "Sorry...we are completely booked...there's nothing I can do for you."  I was pissed and demanded to see the manager (again Johnny wasn't working).  I told the manager how gross the room was last night...how I wouldn't let my dog stay there...and within 2 minutes he found me a room on the 26th floor.  

My new room was just ok...clean and much quieter...but still not remodeled in many years.  Just seems like the whole property needs to be leveled and rebuilt for today's standards.  The lobby...the casino...it was all tired and sad looking.

The one positive was the deli store near the lobby.  Food was excellent.

I certainly would never...never stay at the Circus Circus again and I do blame HOTELS.COM for not accurately representing this terrible property.

This place will forever have spot in my heart. First time i went with my fianc. Had a blast. Great customer service. Second time we went and got married at the hotel the year after. Could not have asked for more. Ceremony was on point and again customer service was as well. I have a third trip booked for April 2018 and hope to receive the same service as the last two. Only issue is that for someone that has stayed so much here and spent so much money i have yet to receive anything comp. who knows maybe third time is a charm
It's a good budget hotel. Vegas is Vegas and circus circus is fun for the kids or kid at heart.

I'm sorry, Circus Circus, but after 4 days of lodging, I think it's time for a divorce.

LAYOUT: horrible. Who puts the hotel lobby in the back of the building when the main entrance is on the Strip? So basically, you must walk the entire length of the main floor to even get checked in (God forbid you have a lot of luggage). There are no direct elevators to the rooms, so have your walking shoes ready. If you're staying in Manor or Skyrise Tower, you have to get off at the Promenade level and then take another elevator to your room (and the wait is horrible). In general, give yourself 20 minutes early to get down to the lobby if you're meeting someone.

AMBIANCE: this hotel appears severely outdated, sad and depressing. It hasn't been updated since disco was still in vogue. The main floor is a labyrinth of gambling tables and slots, in addition to various sleazy merchants selling sundries and other garbage that nobody wants or needs. The rooms in the Skyrise Tower have been updated, but I still saw peeling wallpaper and there were no coffee machines, fridges or microwaves. So basically, they make you uncomfortable if you want outside food. If you want cold drinks, get ice from the machine in the hallway, fill up the bucket and put your drink on that. Don't bring any food that's quickly perishable because you have nothing to keep it cold with or heat it up anyway!

This is a great kid-friendly hotel, but I don't want to be around kids when I come to Vegas. The staff looks like they want to be anywhere BUT there, and I would, too, if I had to wear an outdated purple jacket as my uniform. Unless this hotel does some MAJOR renovating all over and changes the layout, I don't see them staying in business for the next 20 years. Cheap and basic are no longer good enough for Las Vegas hotels.

Last night someone came into our room and stole a bag full of expensive Sephora makeup and, far worse, my husband's wallet while we were sleeping. The response so far has been very underwhelming and we are beyond upset. Currently at the police station. We'll probably never come back to Las Vegas again let alone Circus Circus.

EDIT: So after pitching a massive fit they gave us $100 worth of vouchers for their bars and restaurants. They also said that after they investigate they can compensate us for our losses. So hopefully next week we'll be getting a check from Circus Circus. So those 2 things did help a good deal.
Super disgusting bed bugs stayed here for 3 nights worst nights ever, never coming back

Ready? Okay let's go! 

So I traveled to Vegas as a tag-a-long. I'm always up for a good time so I adapt and I go with the flow. 

Over the years I would have NEVER picked to stay here.  Even when I took my kid nieces to Vegas for the summer we didn't stay here for the kid appeal. I saw the pictures and frankly it looked like a clown threw up in the room.  Weellllllllll HELLO Circus Circus! The tower I stayed in was lovely!  The decor upgraded and the regular room was large.  Now keep in mind you can normally find me at the high end contemporary hotels so my standards are high but I really felt comfortable here.  

The bathroom was small and a normal bath shower combo with a curtain (I think NO place should use a curtain.  Get a door!) But clean and updated.  

No great amenities in the room and no views.  I'm curious to see the high floor views.  Not much on that end of the strip to look at.  The suite was large however,  size of bathroom did not increase.  

The casino yes it's small and more kids than the other hotel's. The adventurdome is a great place for kids however, it does get pricey.  

The Buffett...by far I've had better in Vegas. 

The Wifi...more like no fi..totally slow. 

The gym, almost non existent.  BUT are you really going to workout on vacay?  (I did that's how I know the gym isn't super great)

So you have to ask yourself,  why did I come to Vegas? 

Do you need a decent, clean room, with good customer service to stay at? Okay here's circus circus.  If you plan to hotel hop use the monorail to take you down the strip or jump in a cab.

last month,  My family stayed  at CirCus CirCus Hotel 
And, We ate dinner buffet at friday night
Price of buffet is $ 21.99 plus tax
staff on CirCus buffet is  not friendly and  kind.
but, Food Quality  is not tasty and fresh
not sure We visit here, again

I actually like staying at circus circus.  This weekend October 3rd was really expensive though so we decided they are the manor Lodge at Circus circus. Unfortunately we did not have a good experience . First off as we enter the hotel room there was a strange smell and second the bathroom was really small and the shower water was low without any pressure . Also the pillows were really uncomfortable although the bed was comfortable. And to top it off we were getting ready on a Saturday night and the power goes out for about 30 minutes. What I enjoyed most about manor lodge was that the parking was right outside the hotel. I would actually stay at the Circus Circus again but definitely not at the Manor Lodge hotel.

Old school. Went here as a kid. Wouldn't stay here as an adult as the rooms are run down and out dates, but a trip to Vegas ( or Reno...) isn't complete without some carnival games at circus circus. They also now have rides but super loud in the dome. I don't have kids but if I did, this would be THE place to go in Vegas. I don't find much use for their rewards club card as you have to but in with $50 to get any points.

I am reviewing this like I paid $40 per night total (which I did - Southwest jackpot deal plus $14 per day "resort fee")

Room - we stayed in the recently remodeled West Tower. It was quiet and clean. Although it is starting to show poor upkeep with cigarette burns in the chair and marks on the wall paper.

Internet - you get free wi-fi with the resort fee. It went down a few times - you have to pay to use the business center ($10 for 20 min but we had a $5 off coupon, printing costs 2 minutes per page)
You can get your boarding passes printed for free at the mail\/information desk but prepare for a line.

Check In\/Out - I wanted to see if the room was ready around 11am and she informed me that their computers had been down since the previous night, yikes, but when I came back at 4pm they were working and it only took a few minutes for check in\/out

Hotel - there are tons of people at night and it is kind of a maze, gaudy feeling but other hotels have that gaudy feeling as well. If you are walking, you have to walk thru the casino to get to the room elevators from Las Vegas Blvd

Food - all food in Vegas is way overpriced. We ate breakfast at the Westside Deli which was fine

Transportation - free parking - the walkway from the garage is on level 3 which is odd. You can get a bus right across from the Riviera to the strip.

Midway - went to use our 2 free games, friend won a stuffed banana by popping a balloon. Many arcade games, McDonald's. Didn't go to the Adventuredome as it seemed overpriced.

Staff - everyone that I met was friendly

Other - check out the Tix4Tonight booth to get discount ticket vouchers (must exchange them at the theater for your actual tickets)

If you are looking for a cheap place just to sleep, then I think Circus Circus is a good place to stay when visiting the Las Vegas Strip.
Please do your self a favor. Read all the other reviews and learn. I didn't and it ruined a big part of my Vegas experience.

Not my ideal hotel by far. But it was cheap and you definitely do get what you pay for. I don't like kids so I wasn't happy about that either. The room decor is perfect for this place. Tacky as hell! But it was a place to lay my head and it wasn't dirty.

One plus though was the margarita stand that opened at 10am. Gotta have my breakfast margaritas!!

Doesn't even deserve a star. $160 for junk. I haven't been here in 13 years and now I know why. I reserved a room with two queens and got two fulls. The room was a step up from a  motel. I booked for Circus Circus and was told to go outside to another building for my stay.  I'm assuming a add on to the hotel which was not my idea. Had to pay extra $20 to stay in the actual casino. Overall never again. Plus the sink got clogged. I thought they renovated?

2 stars only because the kids loved it here (arcades and stuff), if not, I'll give it a blistering 1\/2 star. C'mon! who would've enjoyed staying here if you had no kids or nephews and nieces in tow with it's old tired rooms and hallways. Imagine the scent of cigarette smoke just wafting in the air 24\/7, wherever you go, @#$%*&$!!! 'Nuf said.

   :)--- cheap
   :(--- crappy cheap!

Circus Circus is old and it shows. It is also huge with towers and motel like room beside and behind it. When you make your reservation be very careful of your choice because some are much worse than others. 
For the price staying in the main Tower is fine. It is not that great, but it is cheap (book correctly). If you end up in the motel type rooms which are other buildings altogether you will be disappointed, unless you don't mind being in a room that looks exactly like a Motel 6, only not as clean.
The Tower room are just fine considering the price. They are clean but well used. The other rooms, as far as I am concerned, are terrible and I would sleep in my car first. 
The hotel and property around it is just huge, it has an RV park as well. I know nothing about that so I will not comment.
There are several nice pools and the food is only satisfactory. There are many bars and the casino is nice, but also in need of a refresh.
What is nice about Circus Circus is that it has circus type acts throughout the day for kids and it has an amusement park right on the property with about 18-20 fun rides. It is pricey and the wait is long, but not unbearable. Call and check with the desk to see the closing times of the theme park because they change often.
The service is very nice. 
If you can afford better, do it. If not, Circus Circus is fine as long as you navigate your way to the better rooms.
The Strip is right out front and very nice to walk. Have fun.

i think i'll cry if i have to stay here again. 

my fam stays here for because its like $60 a night, but its that much for a reason - it sucks! its def one of the old casinos now w\/ its fellow senior citizen, the Riviera, across the street. The location of the hotel is very far from the parts of the strip that you actually want to visit. and the food: GOD! why did i eat here?! i settled for their buffet because i had post flight hunger, but if i had known, i would've settled for McDonalds upstairs. And i wouldnt exactly call this place family friendly w\/ all the $$$ theyre robbing from kids at the Midway.

So, if you have a car (to drive to the better parts of LV) and all you want is a room to bunk, this could be a good place for you. But if you like walking\/dining in your own hotel, choose elsewhere. 

i think i'll study harder in school so i don't have to stay here when i grow up.

I arrived here 1am on Friday morning. After driving for 11 hours, rest and quiet was all I wanted.

What did I find at this lit up, over sized circus? 

At hotel registration, the guy helping us had to spend TOO long explaining how to get to the room. They don't ask you if you need help, they just kind of assume you want to drag your bags all the way over to the west tower on your own. But it's Circus Circus, what did I expect? So he had to give us a map and draw lines that led us to the other side of the casino. Then a confusing elevator set up. If it wasn't for this cute old filipino couple, we probably would have been wandering around forever. 

When we get up to the room, the room is nothing wonderful. All I want to do is shower. There are stains all over the curtain on the inside so you feel dirtier coming out than you did going in. Go to lay down, and the beds are awkwardly smelling and the texture feels weird. A very starchy feel. And they are so uncomfortable. Even after sitting in the same position for 11 hours, almost being side swiped by many semi's, that shit was nearly intolerable. We had to sleep so we figured, fuck it? 

Went downstairs in the morning to find out that there is something more aggravating than their rooms and weird set up and confusing maps. The people. Because it's not just the guests, it's the millions of unattended children running around, making you nearly drop everything you're holding. Parents with strollers totally oblivious to the world as their child stands in the middle of the walk way. I have never been more appalled by the lack of parental supervision as I did in Circus Circus. It truly ruined my first two nights in Las Vegas.

So if you don't have children, please consider staying somewhere else. I would have given this place no stars had it not been so cheap. I only went here because weekend rates are ridiculous. 

And if you do have children, why the fuck are you in Vegas??

No offense, but that shit drives me nuts. It's smoky, there's a LOT of drinking, and you have to go through all the casinos just to get to the Midway. What's the fucking point?

So try Disneyland, parents. And watch your fucking kids.
Apparently Circus Circus is working on remodeling their hotel towers. Let's hope the updates and upgrades will improve the mediocrity they currently hold.
